Unlike other dogs Boing did not experience the change of formula & so has not had the unfortunate stomach upsets. Another real plus was getting free shipping which helped with the overall cost. Due to health issues I have to be extremely careful of what he eats & as yet I have not seen any ill effects. Have given him the chicken grain free, this flavor & have 2 more to try. He isn't a finicky eater which helps. More in a month or so - hope this helps anyone looking for a decent alternative to the usual big name dog foods.

My dog has had diarhea problems with all sorts of dog foods in the past.  We switched him to this a couple months ago and he is doing great.  This food was recommended by our pet store and I agree that it is not only healthy, but gentle on my dogs touchy stomach.
My dogs have been on this food for three years and are doing very well.

This brand of dog food was recommended to us for our Black Lab, Sadie, as it is very healthy. She absolutely loves it, and her coat is very shiny. We can tell that this is good food, as she is very satisfied. Will definitely order this and possibly other flavors again.
Ingredient wise.... one of the best dog foods in the market. Of course, a bit on the expensive side. Our 3 dogs love this food.

I looked at.several diets for skin sensitive dogs. Am already feeding a salmon diet and salmon oil bit wanted to mix. The canidae has a good name, top ingredients and at time great price
Went to order another bag 1 mo later and price had changed by $6-$7 per bag. Am now looking again.

glad I got this, searched the web for the best food for a dog with stomach problems, loose stools, what I got at the vets didn't help, after reading many reviews I got this and I love it becaseu I feed less, they poop less, more money up front but less cost in the longer, also I get it delivered, what could be better, couldnt say anough good stuff, love you canidae

Bought this a month ago and it seems to be working very well for my dogs and me.  My dogs can not have any wheat or corn and it is hard to find a dog food at a reasonable price that contains neither.  I'll keep ordering it.  It is handy to have it delivered to my door.

At 40 per cent high quality protein, this is great food for a young, healthy, very active dog. It's hard to find food with that much protein. We've been through the wringer for 3 years with our German Shepherd's food needs. He was diagnosed at 1 year old with IBD (inflammatory bowel disease) and even though he is on medication, we have to be careful because anything less than top quality food will give him terrible diarrhea (no matter how slowly and carefully we transition him from one food to another). Even some top quality foods will do it.Since we put him on Canidae Pure Sea he's had consistently firm stool for the first time in his 3 years of life. His coat has gotten more soft and glossy, his breath is good (for a dog), he's put on and kept on some much-needed weight. We are so happy! He's also a picky eater, but he loves the Canidae and never turns his nose up at it.

A couple of notes for any dog-savvy readers: we ruled out EPI and protein sensitivities early on. He's on Tylan and Immodium for the IBD, and most likely will be for life. The vet said that no matter WHAT we do, he will likely be subject to bouts of diarrea. That's why the Canidae seems so miraculous.

I am feeding her this currently while mixing it with the Innova (which is very expensive and hard to find) that her breeder is feeding her. I love that the price is slightly less than other premium, holistic foods and I can get it shipped to me on Prime 2 day shipping. It's also for all life stages, so I like that if this continues to work for her, I won't need to switch to a different food as she gets older.

The ingredients in the food are great, and I especially like that there are pro-biotics. Because the nutrients are so concentrated, I know that one of these 35 pound bags is going to last me a very long time with one growing puppy. At the same time, I had a difficult time getting her to eat the food (I guess it just didn't smell appealing to her). I have had to mix it with a little pureed pumpkin and a tablespoon of the Canidae canned food of the same variety to make it a bit more appealing. At the same time, this could just have to do with my picky Lhasa-Shih's taste buds and not the food. I know that several people who use the premium food are thrilled at the small amount of stool. Personally, my puppy has still had larger stools at least twice a day (some of this could be from the Innova which she is being weaned off of). Lhasa's are known for having sensitivities to allergens, and I love that this food is so gentle on her stomach.

Mostly, I love that this is carried by Amazon and it can get to my house so quickly and easily. It is hard enough for me to pick up a 35 pound bag of dog food while I'm putting it in a plastic bin (let alone carrying home from the store as I live in a metropolitan area where I take public transit). Great service and good product.
This is really good dog food and at a really good price. Way cheaper than at my local pet store. Can't beat this for good value.

switched over to this because of the new puppy.  all the dogs could eat the same food which was convenient.  just ordered the grain free from amazon as well in an attempt to avoid some skin allergies for my schnauzer.  we'll see.  great item!

Our older dog has developed allergies and it's been hard to find a dog food that works for him. We were using Diamond Naturals, but I suspect they must have changed the formula because suddenly his allergies flared up and he ended up with an ear infection. We switched to this dog food and he LOVES it. Not only does he love it, but his ear infection is now gone and he's itching/scratching/chewing MUCH less.. We're grateful to have found it and hope they do not change the formula!

My three dogs like it a lot, and my problem dogs skin has improved dramatically.
His hair his growing back and his skin is not red and itchy anymore. I'vebtried the "Blue" dogfood and it didn't work at all.

Our 6-year old Vizsla has been eating Canidae for 3 years. A month ago we switched flavors from Bison to Sea Salmon.  We gradually transitioned the change even though it was the same company.  Within four weeks on the new flavor he developed a set of distressing systems including soft, mucus covered stools, horrible gas,low energy, staggering walk, excessive drooling, licking and constant neck extending (difficulty swallowing).  A vet visit confirmed these as diet related.  We put him on a chicken/rice diet and his symptoms stopped after just two days.  Doing research to decide whether to switch back to bison or go with another company, I found a great deal of  information about other pet owners having issues with all flavors of food from Canidae. Consumer Affairs reports a pending class action suit.  We have decided to switch to another company.
The whole process was very smooth. We received the dog food in good condition and it arrived fasted than I would of thought. I'll order again.

My dog is allergic to poultry and it's hard to find products that are poultry free.  My local feed store recommended Canidae Lamb and Rice and it has done wonders for my dog.  Her coat is thicker and shinier.  She no longer itches and scratches/bites herself raw.  Plus she loves the food and it's very reasonably priced compaired to other dog foods that are poultry free.

My two Rhodesian Ridgebacks and one Labrador Retriever are no pushovers.

Even other varieties of highly regarded Canidae food have left them looking up at me over lightly rearranged bowls of food with that 'Why have you turned against us again?' look.

But whenever I bring home the thirty-pound bags of Canidae Chicken Meal and Rice, the dogsters nose hungrily around the car before I can even get the stuff out of the trunk. I've long since settled on Canidae (for its reputation as nutritious and high-quality) and on the Chicken Meal and Rice (for the predictability factor with my threesome).

Things just got better, however, when I realized that my Amazon Prime membership allows me to order a thirty-bound bag for second-day delivery at no cost (in fact, it usually arrives the next day) at a price lower than what I was paying locally.

This has allowed me to move to a just-in-time delivery service, which cuts down on the storage needs and may be attractive for other owners of multiple and/or large dogs.
Since using this product my dogs coat has improved soooooo much.  He loves it.  He does have fish breath, but his health is has improved.

I've been feeding my dog (75 pound Golden mix, about 5 years old) Canidae for 3-4 days now, and she absolutely loves it! She's always been a picky eater, often ignoring food in her bowl, but she laps this up as soon as I put it in.  I've been mixing it with her old food to ease her into the transition.  For the first two days I did 75% old food, 25% Canidae.  Today I've done half and half.  No tummy problems.  If anything she seems to have more energy.  The only thing is that now I have to really police how much food I give her, whereas with her old food I knew she would only eat it if she were hungry. But I'm happy she's happy! I'm also happy to have found a food that seems to be much better quality, and for a price that's within my tight budget.

Great product and quick shipping!
My dog really loves this food! She is allergic to wheat, of which this has none, and is a very picky eater but loves this food!
This product is made from the best ingredients.  My dog was allergic to chicken-based dog foods so my vet suggested salmon.  This is a quality salmon dog food without a strong fishy odor.

My Boxer have tried various dog foods. He started with Nutro as a puppy but after a year, he started not liking his food so we switched to Science Diet. After much research, found that Science Diet did not use the quality products... so we switched to Chicken Soup for the Dog Lover's Soul Adult Dog food. My dog loved the food but realized he had allergies to one of the ingredients. So we changed to Canidae and he loves this and has no allergies.

When My husband and I researched good quality dog food, we found a lot of great quality dog food and most of them were pretty pricy but we found Canidae and Chicken Soup to be the best quality for a good price. I would recommend Canidae Lamb Meal and Brown Rice to any dog owners. My dog has been on it for about 6 months now and its been great!

Our Rhodesian Ridgebacks were on this food some years back and we moved, thus losing access to it at the new location. I am very glad to see Amazon carrying Canidae and that it's available using the Prime Membership! We have fed many, many dogs the Canidae when we we were fostering rescue dogs (an average of 3 new dogs a month for years) and it was the only food NONE of them ever had any trouble eating & digesting. Our own pack has a couple of members with soy allergies, so I'm careful about what we feed. They have been back on the Canidae for a few months now with no drama at all. The switch from their old food back to the Canidae was easy and stress free and all 6 dogs scarf it down like it was prime rib. (or you know...a squirrel) Even my father's Chihuahua likes it and that little diva used to think she could only eat human food! I have been able to cut back by a half cup on the daily ration for our largest dog as he was putting extra weight on with his previous amount from the old food. Everyone's coat is soft and shiny, they all have loads of energy and are generally in excellent overall health - that doesn't happen with the grocery store bargain foods. Again, I am VERY VERY glad to see the big bags of Canidae available from Amazon!!

Our dog loves this brand. We used their Chicken & Rice formula for about a year & decided to switch to the Lamb & rice one after our dogs interest-level started going down. How did we find out? We realized that over time we have been mixing more treats in her food to get her to eat it (This with only 2 meals a day!)

Our dog definitely preferred lamb over the chicken, no more treat mix-in's, only pure dog-food!

We = Canidae fans for life!
My female bulldog has skin allergies and this product really helps her condition.  This is a good price for it with free shipping.
Buying Canidae thru Amazon is truly one of today's best bargains.  Plus, Mr. UPS carries the 30 pound bag up my stairs!

I should've done more research before buying this product. My dog seemed to have very little appetite when she was on this food. She had skin problems. She had loose stools. Unfortunately I didn't want to believe that it had anything to do with the food. I finally decided to look into it after months of trying to get her to eat it more regularly and found that my problems weren't uncommon with this food. I've since switched her to Blue Buffalo food and her skin problems have gotten better, she has become more energetic, her stools are no longer loose and she happily eats.

My dog got horrible diarrhea from it.
We mixed it with her old food for about a week and after that gave her just the Canidea food.
Too bad, it seemed like a good brand though.

It just came in, and to my disappointment, it contains barley...which she is allergic to. That is NOT on the ingredient list, so beware. Fortunately my other dog can eat this.

Amazon, please keep the ingredients up to date!

Canidae has changed the formula of their ALS recipes.  Many, many dogs have become ill after eating the new formula.  The web is full of complaints from dog owners whose dogs are experiencing the same awful symptoms (Diarrhea, vomiting, itching, hot spots and even seizures).  Do your homework before buying this product.  The company changed the formula without notifying the public.  Would give zero stars if possible.
My Weimeraner loves Canidae dry food.  It's healthy for her and leaves her always wanting more.  Highly recommend it and it's worth the cost.

I've heard this is a good food, but was shocked to see after chicken meal so many grains. I did not feed this to my dog. I'd rather pay more money for better quality food. All those fillers are unneeded. I expect such a highly regarded company to have better ingredients. I always look for by products but didn't think to even bother to check the next 4 ingredients. Highly disappointed.

This has given my young dog persistent loose stools. My older dog also had problems with loose stools on the adult formula, which was immediately rectified by a change to Innova. See the large number of serious complaints on the web about the new formulation before buying.

I have a two and a half year old female Boxer that has allergies to most commercial dog foods, so I keep her on a diet free of wheat, soy, and animal by-products.  Canidae seemed to fit the criteria and was available at my local pet store (whereas, the brand I was feeding, Evo, had to be ordered), so I wanted to try it.  I've been feeding my dog three and a half cups of Canidae dry dog food daily (divided between two feedings) for about five weeks, and she has lost a significant amount of weight on this diet.  She is a very active dog that has always been lean, but she is now too skinny. I will be switching back to Evo and would not recommend Canidae.

I purchased Canidae Dry Dog Food, Chicken Meal and Rice Formula for my two Cocker Spaniels (Cavalier King Charles and American breed). After about two weeks, the problems began. Diarrhea, some vomiting and general malaise. Further feeding resulted in more problems. We had fed them Blue Buffalo and Eukanuba in the past but had never experienced these kind of problems. We returned to Eukahuba and both pets have returned to normal. I'm unsure what ingredients caused the problem but I will never use this product again and recommend caution before feeding your dog this food!Canidae Dry Dog Food, Chicken Meal and Rice Formula, 30-Pound Bag

Loved the taste, the smell, everything. Better than what I used to make myself years ago.

And the BEST delivery from a second party shipper that I have ever received. Many thanks !

Buy this applesauce, you will NOT be disappointed.

Some of the best coffee out there, as good if not better than Seattle's Best and Starbuck. Good deal price wise if you order it on subscription which I do.
smooth, rich coffee, I prefer the Breakfast Blend better than this colombia blend and that is what I changed to!
For colombian ground coffee lovers , this is a brand you will really love and you wont be sorry at all for purchasing it
I really love this brand of coffee, I am a coffee nut and enjoy drinking this, it is nice and smooth and great tasting you can not go wrong with this choice.

Community Coffee Colombia Classico is a standard quality, everyday-type Columbia coffee. It is comparable to Eight O'clock Columbia coffee. It has a good aroma when you first open the bag & one tablespoon per cup results in a decent strength coffee in a typical drip coffeemaker. It's not a premium coffee, but becomes a good value at a discount price.

Community coffee is the best brand of coffee made.  Being from Louisiana and driving passed the Community coffee processing plant and smelling the coffee being roasted is an experience one never forgets.  I have drank this brand all of my adult life and there is none to compare with it.  I have drank all of the varieties of this brand and dark roast was my favorite until----i tried the Columbia Classico Blend and now at 62 i have a new favorite.  It has a sweeter taste than the other varieties, not quiet as strong as the dark roast, but strong enough to be "real" coffee.  I love it and so glad i tried it. Thanks Amazon for carring it and especially having it on a subscribe and save plan.

I bought since it seemed like a great deal but when i made a batch it was awful. It had a weak taste and the aroma was as if it was old coffee. Completely disappointing i love trying all coffees and expected more from this. Will never buy again. I thought i would never have to say this but Dunkin Doughnuts is way superior so try that first. Seattle Best is a great coffee as well.

i think that's the best ground coffee in a bag can do. much better than the store brands like Maxwell House or Folgers or Wegmans, etc. when it's on sale they are actually about the same price. would definitely try this brand again!

This flavor is on the strong and bold side, which I like.

Good price for Community Coffee pack of 3.  Received quickly.  Product packages were sealed but not firm bricks like I expected. I will say that the flavor was not compromised by that.  Will probably order these again.
This is very good coffee. I will definitely purchase it again. It is robust and flavorful without any trace of bitterness. Love it!

Weak, dry, tasteless coffee. Doesn't taste even remotely like it was made with Columbian Arabica beans. The grind was also of very poor quality.

How bad was it? This stuff makes Folger's seem like premium, high grade stuff. I have no earthly idea how people give this Community Colombian Classico such a high rating. Perhaps I just got a bad batch of very old stuff from Amazon but I'll not be giving this coffee a second chance! Probably one of the weakest and most tasteless coffee beans I've ever bought.

I don't know if the name "Community Coffee" is intended to convey a coffee for the masses, but that's kinda how I would rate it. It smells good when you open the package, you use a normal amount to brew, it has a good flavor & aroma. No disappointments, but nothing special. I have a hard time distinguishing this from other typical brands of columbian coffee . . . no worse, no better.

In my case, a half of the cans were smashed. I'm not saying that the can was destroyed. Also, it was within the expiration date. However, foods in some of the cans were discolored...must be getting old.

So technically speaking, there are nothing 'wrong' with them... But made me keep wondering if they are safe. So for a peace of mind, I decided not to order this product again.
2 of the six cans were smashed when received - maybe they should pack them better for shipment or not send smashed cans

The Taste of this Chocolate almost made me pack up my Keurig and take it Back to the store! I purchased this Hot Cocoa out of excitement when I brought my Mr. Coffee Keurig on sale for Black Friday.  I am an avid hot cocoa drinker and this by far is the worst tasting chocolate in my opinion. It was watery and had an awful artificial sweetener aftertaste. Granted the first time I did not shake the K-cup as directed so I gave it a second try after shaking. Surprisingly it didn't do a d@mn thing to help the taste! On the bright side if you long for a watered down artificial sweetener as an after taste in a drink then this is the K-cup for you.

Recently tried this milk chocolate k cup from Amazon. The only thing this drink has in common with chocolate is its color.Of the 13 items listed as ingredients  cocoa is number 8.It has a chemical smell and a chemical taste.If you buy this junk don't say you were not warned. It does not deserve ANY stars.

I love this stuff!  We make it at the 8oz setting on our Cuisinart K-cup machine, and then add frothed, steamed milk from the Aerochino frother.  Makes a wonderful hot-chocolate latte.  The chocolate is very good by itself, as well, although we like to add a least a splash of milk (or whipped cream) to thicken up the body a little.

This is excellent hot chocolate, and I will buy this again
and recommend it highly. Very good flavor, very smooth
and actually tastes like chocolate.

Our family loves to have hot chocolate on a cold winter's day and this is not hot chocolate.  I don't know what it is.  You need to find another product for your Keurig if you are looking for hot chocolate.  Please do not waste your money on this product.  There is no quality control on this one.  How Keurig thinks this is good is beyond me.
I prefer dark chocolate, but this has a good taste. I'm happy with it, even though it is milk chocolate.
Absolutely horrible, I have never had such terrible hot cocoa, very artificial taste .  It's going back!,  Waste of $13!

The aftertaste from the artificial sweetener is terrible! Waste of money, as the box makes no mention that it's full of nastiness. Yuck yuck yuck. I can still taste the chemical aftertaste and it's been at least 30 minutes! It tastes like I've sucked on a penny!
You've been warned. I honestly don't understand the 4 & 5 star reviews... It's such a bitter, strong aftertaste!

Cafe Escapes Milk Chocolate Hot Cocoa for the Keurig is for the birds. I am truly sorry about this guys but it was nothing more than chocolate flavored water. This probably is not your fault since it is made with water. However, I can tell you that the very first company that can produce a hot chocolate made with water that actually tastes like a full bodied hot chocolate will be millionaires. Put a little body to the chocolate and you will have a true winner!
I love the product and found mixing it with flavored coffees gave the latte effect for 1/4 of the price
This is the best and I have tried them all.  My least fave is Green Mountain (bitter). 7 oz. Is my perfect blend. I always add about 10 mini freeze-dried marshmallows....yummy!
Came quickly and was just what we expected. Great job having a product that most everyone else on the web was out of.
As others have said, it has the chemical taste of artificial sweetener. When will these companies realize that there are a ton of consumers out there who do NOT like sugar substitutes!

THIS HOT COCOA IS THE BEST AND FOR SOME
REASON IT IS VERY HARD TO FINE .SO I STOCKED UP
IT HAS A CREAMY COCOA TASTE I HAVE TRY OTHERS AND
ALL OF US AT WORK LOVE THIS COCOA.
THANK YOU AMAZON FOR HAVEING IT FOR US.
SHERRY1530

This was the first k-cup I tried out with my Keurig coffee maker, and while good it had a weird metallic aftertaste. At first I thought it was because the coffee maker was new, but i'm still getting that weird taste after many other brews later. If you don't have sensitive taste buds it's great, but if you do.. stick with the Green Mountain Hot Chocolate.
Wonderful hot cocoa! Great flavor, its very important to shake the cup before brewing and to use the right cup setting. Will definitely buy again!

I found the taste way too sweet for me. I tried it with less water, more water, added creamer, still could not shake the taste. Very disappointing. Only used it at the office anyway so I am sticking with Swiss Miss packages for my hot chocolate fix.
Incredibly disappointed with this product. Tastes nothing like hot cocoa, just watered down. The sucralose gives it a chemical aftertaste.

I normally drink coffee in my keurig but I tried these for something different. They tasted almost like the weak hot chocolate you get out at an amusement park from a machine or something. I would not recommend them. I have a machine that lets you pick what size cup you want, small or medium and even on the small the hot chocolate is watery.
I was really excited to try hot cocoa in the Keurig - but these are just awful.  We tried adding creamer but that didn't really help either.  Definitely won't be purchasing again!

I am a hot chocolate freak. I was very anxious to try the varieties of hot chocolate with my new Keurig. This cocoa was my first purchase. It was so terrible I almost brought it back. First, it took half the box to get the plastic taste out of the drink. A Keurig issue. That last half of the box didn't redeem itself. This cocoa tastes like flavored water, flavored with diet sugar. It has the same aftertaste you would get with a diet soda or a sugar-free yogurt. Also, you can't get more than 8 oz per cup. If you do, the taste just gets more watered down. A huge disappointment. I will be trying other brands but my expectations are very low based on this first experience.

I read a few reviews and learned that this product contains sucralose. It is not listed as an ingredient. Explains the diet taste plus I don't trust manufacturers who pull stunts like this. The manufacturer is Green Mountain Coffee - very disappointing.

This is probably one of the worst hot chocolate brands I have ever purchased.  It is one of those things that has a "something is wrong but I'm not exactly sure what" kind of taste.  In some ways the flavor is like chocolate water.  In others it is more like carob. It just tastes fake.  I will not ever purchase this brand again.

I agree with the other one-star reviews. It has a strange flavor unlike chocolate and more like chemicals. It's watery. I will try a different brand of hot chocolate or just use my personal K cup to put in my own hot chocolate mixes.

I'm not an avid coffee drinker, so when I bought my Keurig I really had my eye on the other drink types (teas, cocoas, hot cider.)  These was the first hot chocolate k cup, and I'm sorry to say that I don't like them at all.  The drink is watery, and has a strange after taste.  I hope one of the other hot chocolate k cups are better than this.

Don't waste your money! Garage sales this summer will be full of this crap. This is the worst hot cocoa I have ever tasted in my life. Tried it a second time ,thought I didn't make it right. Couldn't sleep all night & today I'm sick to my stomach. It is full of chemicals, not real food. Why would anyone want to waste there hard earned money on something that could possibly do you in!
Tastes like chocolate water with artificial sweetener.  Really not worth drinking.  The changes in formula necessary to make cocoa mix fit into the little cup really ruin it.

Thankfully this came in a variety pack, so I only had one.  But god, was it nasty.  I'd already been told by a family member not to go with the "large" setting on my Keurig, as it could make cocoa taste watery.  So I dutifully chose "medium," and oh, how I wish watery were the problem.  It had such a horrible bitter taste that I at first thought my water had somehow been contaminated.  After reading other reviews here, I realize that it must be the sucralose.  I consider it not only very misleading advertisting for each cup not to be labeled as "diet" in some way, but sucralose also happens to be my least favorite of the major artificial sweeteners.  I don't know what the calorie count on these things would be, but if it happens to be low then I'd recommend trying this only if you're dieting and really desperate.  For people wanting a normal hot cocoa taste, avoid at all costs.

This product is very bland. I got it because my kids love hot chocolate, and usually they use my keurig just for hot water to mix their own hot chocolate. They were so excited to get this, but they didn't even drink their first cup of it because it has almost no chocolate flavor. I had to mix chocolate syrup in with it to give it any kind of flavor at all.

I got a bunch of these from a friend and wondered about the bad after taste. It wasn't like products completely flavored with Splenda (sucrolose) but it still a slight strange taste (I describe it as slimy) and left that after taste in my mouth. On the k-cup it self, it doesn't say it has artificial sweeteners or is diet, so I came to the internet and it is almost impossible to find the ingredients listed any where. The reviews were the confirmation at first. Too much Splenda makes me sick to my stomach so I know it is not good for me. Too much is more than a few tastes. Oh well, I guess I'll try the Grove Square or Swiss Mix as those are the only others I can find.

I find the taste of this product unappealing and the after taste sickening.
THIS HOT CHOCOLATE IS BETTER THEN THE GREEN MOUTAIN ONE. MY KIDS ENJOY THE EASE OF MAKING THEIR OWN HOT CHOCOLATE. THIS IS THE BEST ONE TO BUY

I made 6 oz cup of this and it tasted awful.  It lacked milk chocolate flavor and was very watered down.  I was very disappointed because hot cocoa was the main beverage I wanted to brew since I do not drink coffee.  This was very bad.

I tried the Cafe Escapes Milk Chocolate Hot Cocoa Keurig K-Cups and the Cafe Escapes Chai Latte. I like sweet things, but both of these are seriously way too sweet. The Chai Latte has a much more pronounced artificial sweetener flavor and aftertaste, but this too has the same artificial sweetener flavor. Not good at all.

We bought this KCUP because we wanted some hot cocoa around. It is completely watered down and lacks a lot of the chocolate flavor each time. If you like rich hot cocoa, this is not the hot cocoa for you.

I bought these for the kids and they love them.  Since it comes out too hot for them we put two ice cubes in the coffee cup and brew the hot chocolate on the 4oz size cup right over the ice.  It comes out at the perfect temperature for kids.

I ordered this hot cocoa on the basis of several good reviews on Amazon, and I'll add my own to that stack. The cocoa is very tasty by itself. I would love to get a foamer as suggested in some of the other reviews and try mixing it with foamed milk, I'll bet that's great!

I also ran a Small cup of bold coffee with a Small cup of this (50/50 mix) and liked it a lot.

With winter approaching I bought this as a trial. I was concerned that it would taste watered down because I feel that many of the Keuring coffees taste that way; I like the extra bold varieties or Starbucks Italian Roast on my own K cup.

I was actually rather pleasantly surprised as to how much like real hot cocoa it tasted. Not watered down and not too sweet. It's not gourmet but this winter, when you want a quick cup of hot cocoa after shoveling snow or playing outside, this will do nicely.
This tastes terrible. Even the powdered hot cocoa mixes where you can pour hot water taste a lot better (and cheaper)!

Honestly, was not was what I was expecting when I ordered - it was bitter and tasted like splenda! Delivery was great, received order on time etc - but the product itself was disgusting - I couldn't even give it away at work! I left it in the break room at work and it went untouched!
This is really good, especially at the 8 oz. setting. The review for muddy water must have been a bad batch or some other brand of k-cup cocoa this is great. The only downfall is the price :(

This is one of the best products for the K-cups system. The hot chocolate is just right, not too sweet, very rich and creamy and full bodied. I like that it does not have a sodium flavor like many instant hot chocolates do. Add a few drops of milk or 1/2 & 1/2 and it is awesome.

Back when I made my first cup (last year), it was indeed watery.  I thought how it would be nice if so much chocolate wasn't left in the k-cup after brewing (yes, I removed the foil, to recycle the cup).  I decided to shake the cup before inserting into the Keurig, and I'll remove it and re-insert after twisting it 180, giving it another hole to brew from, which DOES help.  I prefer the taste of this to Swiss Miss or Nestle for sure.  I also add Vanilla or Irish Creme powdered CoffeeMate creamer which thickens it up a bit, or will add some Bailey's or Amaretto after shovelling show.  I like the Dark Chocolate version as well.
We are pleased with these hot chocolate k cups.  Rich milk chocolate taste, not too strong or too weak, just about right.  A good addition to our k cup collection.

I've tried a couple different Hot Chocolate K-cups and so far I think we like this one the best. We love having it around so we can give the kids hot chocolate, or just curl up as the weather gets cooler and make a cup ourselves. It's chocolatey but if it tastes too watered down like some suggest, then just set your settings to a smaller cup size.

For us, it's just right! Creamy, chocolatey, warm and delicious! Give it a try if you like K-cups and hot chocolate! Why not? There are great k-cups coming up for the winter months, and this one is definitely going to stay stocked throughout the winter. YUM!
This tasted, watery and I used the smallest amount of water you can use with a k cup - 6 oz. The chocolate was flavorless but mostly it was just super weak.  I do not recommend.

Beautiful plants--I ended up not getting one of each kind, but each plant arrived well-wrapped and labeled.  They were healthy and happy after a good soak once they arrived.  They're lovely and I'm so glad to have ordered them.

I am a plant killer! However these beautiful little plants have made it in my house for six months now. Most plants only make it 2 months in my home. They are easy to care for and very hardy. They look great hanging in my frt kitchen window. Thay came wrapped very nice and safe and a few of them are already blooming and changing colors. I cant believe I actually found a LIVE plant I cant kill!!!!
These plants looked dead and were very small.  I watered them as directed and they still look the same.  I've had them for a few weeks and follow the directions every time I water them.

I bought several plants and terrariums. All of my plants arrived in a very short time, in excellent condition & healthy, each were indivduallly wrapped & labeled. The glass terrariums were perfectly wrapped to protect them and individually boxed, but best of all, this is the most Affordable shop I've found for these things.
I recommend this shop to everyone !!! ;-)
Thanks a lot,
Ms Bowers

I received my tillandsia plants today and they are exactly as promised. I ordered them on Friday afternoon and they were in my po box on Monday morning. I'm having a blast trying to decide which container or seashell or candlestick to display them on.
Great plant option for those who want something low maintenence. Look great in glass globes or shells or just sitting in sills. Exactly as pictured!
great purchase, very nicely packaged.  arrival was very fast, maybe 2 days after order was placed.  very clear and concice instructions included.  couldn't be happier!

I have seen these little air plants at Farmer's Markets and Organic/Local stores. They really are cute and the instructions were easy to follow. Since I have other plants I am sure I won't have issues remembering to water them once a week. Packaged so nicely with a nice handwritten note which is always a pleasure to receive when buying a product. Nice personal touch.

I didn't expect these Air Plants to be prettier than the photos but they are! Healthy as can be, no wilting or dead areas. You can put these in a crowded room and they steal the show anyway. These are my first Air Plants. I am impressed. This type of gardening couldn't be easier.  The shipping was fast and inside the package is all the information you'll need. I had some sea shells packed away and now they have a purpose.  Absolutely adorable ! I will order again from The Air Plant Shop.com on Amazon.

These were combine shipped with Spanish moss that I also ordered.

Just got these. I can't tell if they're alive yet.

Will update later...

I love these candies.... However, the entire case was ruined, not one piece was not damaged, obviously they had melted either prior or during shipping. The chocolate was stuck to the top of the paper they are wrapped in. . They were still edible, but didn't quite taste the same, the chocolate was gooey instead of solid, even days later when stored at room temperature. They really disappointed me :( So I am hoping the next case I purchase will be fresh, as I am ordering in October a cooler month, and hoping it was ruined in delivery and not the sellers storage.

After learning this was my boyfriends favorite candy I just knew it would make a perfect anniversary gift. He was absolutely stunned! Not only did he love it but his mom now tries to steal some( after she figures out where he hides it). I will definently be buying this again.

WAS GREAT HOW FAST THE PRODUCT GOT HERE.  I HAVE NEVER HAD A PRODUCT GET HERE THAT FAST.  WAS PLEASED TO HAVE THE CANDY HERE ONLY PROBLEM WAS IT HAD MELTED BUT WE ARE STILL EATING IT.  THANKS AGAIN FOR BRINGING BACK A MEMORY FROM WHEN I WAS OVERSEAS IN THE ARMY.

My friend brought me this candy from Germany once, and ever since I've been hooked.  They are simply delicious and it's hard to just eat one!  The picture on Amazon is outdated though...The candy looks the same, but the packaging has been updated.

I purchased this tea at a retail store. I was terribly, terribly disappointed. It didn't taste bad...it tasted like nothing at all. I wasn't expecting a strong taste but the tea bags don't even smell like anything. Literally...nothing. They are the nice fabric-bag type tea bags. This was my first experience with this brand...maybe their other flavors are better.
This product arrived in about three days.  Never use the entire packet for one recipe unless you like hot seasonings!  It is extremely hot.
This bread works perfect with soup or by itself. Really a wonderful, full flavored bread. I put the mix in my bread maker on the basic setting and then out came another hit from The Prepared Pantry!
Went looking for bread especially for bread machines. Was very glad I ordered this product. Tasted great and the family loved it. Product arrived quickly and was fresh.

We've used Splenda and Kirkland brand sucralose packets. either product is very good for what it is, a no-calorie sweetener for hot or cold drinks, desserts, and breakfast cereal.
For convenience, rather than the best price, I purchased this 2000-packet box of real Splenda-brand from Amazon. After using the product for a few days, i noticed my wife replaced her normal morning ice coffee with diet soda. She couldn't stand the Splenda, it was giving her a dry mouth and bad taste. i had noticed something a little "off" but just dismissed it as my imagination. Later i tried a sample straight from the envelope, it had a very acrid taste and seemed to burn -- it certainly wasn't SWEET. i then did a blind taste test using a new, small box that i bought from a local grocery store. night and day difference. in summary, i think i got either an old/expired box (there's no obvious expiration date on the box), or the product might have soaked up an odor/taste from something during transit.

I and my wife use this product more than 15 years and totally satisfied with it. Before this product i use Sugar Free,Sweet n Law,Equal but the test is not like splenda. There are bitter test in Equal and other product. I am 58 Years Old and with weight and blood Pressure.
I like this feature from Splenda:
They are a great way to sweeten beverages and can be sprinkled on cereal, fresh fruit, and more.

Each packet of Splenda provides the same sweetness as two teaspoons of sugar.
Each packet has less than 1 gram of carbohydrate and less than 5 calories, which meets FDA's standards for no-calorie foods.
24 packets of Splenda provide the same sweetness as one cup of sugar.

Splenda is the way to go and buying it in bulk like this saves a lot of money. The cost really racks up when you get at the grocery store.

I've ordered this a few times and will order it again when I need a refill

If you're going to buy this do NOT purchase it if it's being sold by "segouna." After over charging for shipping, she takes a week to email that it was shipped. But she hasn't actually shipped it [but you don't know this]. So you wait and wait and email and email. She only responds to email sent through Amazon.com, never to email sent through your personal email. Then a few weeks later she claims she can't find any tracking information on the original package. A few days after that she finally sends you your purchase, but only if you threaten to report her to Amazon.
I always end up using a lot of this for a variety of things & this is convient for me to have on hand instead of a large quantity of small boxes.

As I reported to Amazon previously the packaging was terrible. alot of loose sugar inside the box. When I opened the shipping carton My wife and I noticed the original Splenda box was not properly sealed. The Splenda box was literally unsealed and open. It made us leary to think that someone might have tampered with the shipment. As of today no harm has come. The sugar is the same. The quantity is wonderful. The price well I've seen it for less.
On this particular deal one gets the best artificial sweetener at the best price in a large quantity with exceedingly fast shipping, no reason to try another.
Hard to get excited about Splenda but hey it was a good value and arrived at my door quickly. Feel confident ordering here.

I do not live in the United States, and I am used of Splenda, and where I live nowadays, splenda is very expensive and not easy to find, and I found out that if I order it online from Amazon.com, I will get it much cheaper than where I live.

I have used Splenda sweetener for many years.  It doesn't have the aftertaste some other sweeteners have.  It has been difficult to find it in quantities of more than 200 packets.  This box of 2000 is a great value at about half the price per packet I  had been paying.
No fancy box just great price. I had always purchased large amount of Splenda at wholesale club now I can buy it from Amazon at even better price with free shipping and no member fee.

being a type 11 diabetic i have to avoid sugar,
splenda was the reccommended choice at the hospital
and i am now completely sold on this product.
a REALLY great amazon value helps alot also

Splenda is by far the most accurate tasting sugar substitute available.  I bought these packets and have been using them for years.  These are great on cereal too, for example turning ordinary corn flakes into frosted flakes without heaps of sugar and extra calories.
Wal-mart gets about $14.97 for a 400 pack, do the math, every dollar counts when you on a fixed income like me.
Splenda is Splenda.  The quantity for the price was the sole reason for buying this product.  With Splenda packets, I go for the pricing.  I only use Splenda in my coffee.

when i turned 30 i cut sugar out of my diet purely as a health maintenance measure. now in my 40's my blood pressure, BMI, cholesterol and blood sugar continue to be healthy for my age and height, despite being inactive. so something has got to change if you want to stay healthy - lifestyle or diet, but preferable both if you can manage it. i use about 20 Splenda packets per day in my beverages. I have tried all other sweeteners for at least a week each, and while I'd like to support Stevia use - I just could not handle it's leafy taste even in my ice tea, which is already leafy.
i was concerned that may be too much since many web sights warn of aluminum buildup in your liver - so i contacted Cargill and tried to find out what amounts of Splenda did their human trails involve - but they would not tell me - only said there is no consumption limit. that's why I took a star off my review - i wish Splenda's maker would be more forthcoming when a consumer contacts them with a legitimate concern. if you can tolerate sugar, when making a gallon of beverage, add one tablespoon of sugar per 16 grams of Splenda, to soften the metallic taste of this sweetener.

Some will snicker or roll their eyes at the title, but maybe those can relate to say...running out of ketchup. And there were an additional 200 packets in each box of 1000 that I didn't even expect. Would certainly repeat this purchase when the time comes.

Best deal...IF you use a lot. As a insulin dependant person who uses it in ALL my cooking, it saves me about $50 a month over store prices. (I usually get about 2 month's out of a box.) I.E. use about 40 packs a day. (I said I use it in ALL my cooking!)

This was the best deal on Splenda that I've found. It was shipped fast and I have been dipping into it ever since it arrived. I have given up on sugar and this fit's the bill better then the other substitutes.
Seller had item shipped rather quickly. It was as advertised.

I could not use any of the not-to-be-named pre-Splenda sweeteners. I simply could not tolerate their taste AND the after-taste. I've been a Splenda user ever since it became available because... well... the taste is VERY close to sugar's own and, as far as I know, there are NO side effects.

My understanding of the Splenda technology is that the process starts with what is supposed to be a 'sugar' molecule and then ONE atom is replaced with another which makes it impossible to digest so it simply passes through your digestive tract. You get zero calories, good taste and no side effects.

So... what's not to like? The price? That's were the wisdom of buying these large but not too heavy Splenda boxes comes from. Buy in bulk and save :)

I NEVER put anything sweet into my tea or my coffee - a habit I probably developed during those dark, sad, pre-Splenda days - but, when it comes to Cappuccino... it's a different story. I am reaching for the little yellow packets. A box of these lasts me for a long, long time.

I could not use any of the not-to-be-named pre-Splenda sweeteners. I simply could not tolerate their taste AND the after-taste. I've been a Splenda user ever since it became available because... well... the taste is VERY close to sugar's own and, as far as I know, there are NO side effects.

We use a lot of Splenda and this is a great buy.  The product came quickly and in good condition.
Es la segunda vez que compro con este proveedor y el margen de error en las bolsas empacadas es del 2.5% aunque en este último pedido llegó en un mejor estado.
I USE SPLENDA PACKETS EVERY SINGLE DAY. LOVE THIS PRODUCT AS IT IS CALORIE FREE AND EASY TO USE. ALSO DIABETIC FRIENDLY. I WATCH FOR IT TO GO ON SALE A LOT AS WE USE A LOT

Mrs. Butterworth's Waffle Mix / B002J997RC

I love, love, love this waffle mix. Seriously, all other waffle mixes just taste like sand to me, but Mrs. Butterworth's is so sweet and tasty. I've eaten Mrs. Butterworth's since I was a kid, so that may be part of it, but since I've introduced my fiancé to this mix, he can't seem to get enough of it, so it must not just be me. And it's SO easy to make - a touch of vegetable or canola oil, some water, and a waffle iron is all you need. No eggs, no milk, nothing perishable that you might not have on hand at the moment.

What I can't understand is why none of my local stores seem to carry this mix anymore. Pinnacle Foods is apparently still making this mix, but no one seems to carry it in my area. I wonder if that's because of the "contaminated" scare that went around when people first started noticing the brown sugar crystals scattered through the mix and assumed that the evenly distributed, dissolves-in-water, brown crystals were a contaminate of some kind. Honestly, it seems that everything has to be bleached white as a ghost these days, ruining all the flavor and nutrients, and introducing goodness knows what chemicals into your system before people will eat it. And now even Amazon doesn't seem to carry it, which breaks my heart. Fortunately, we were able to find it on Shop Food Ex dot com, and everything arrived with another year-and-several-months to go on the expiration dates, so we're all stocked up for the winter.

Nutrition Information
---------------------
Serving Size: 1/3 cup of mix
Servings per Container: ~19
Calories per Serving: 170
Calories from Fat: 20
Total Fat: 2g
Saturated Fat: 0.5g
Trans Fat: 0g
Cholesterol: 5mg
Sodium: 450mg
Total Carbohydrate: 34g
Dietary Fiber: 1g
Sugars: 6g
Protein: 5g

~ Ana Mardoll
I could not find this product on any store shelf.  Amazon came through.  Makes the best WS's.

Whiskey Sour Mix is excellent.  Much better than in the liquor stores.  Daiquiri mix (almost a duplicate recipe to thw W. S. Mix except with Rum instead of Bourbon, is not so good. With some lime sherbet, it would be Methodist Punch (which is ok, but not what we are looking for).  The Marguarita mix I have not tried, but really.. .  Marguaritas should not involve any kind of mix.
I have been serving these at my parties for a couple weeks now and EVERYBODY loves them. I will re-order soon!!
Didn't think I'd ever find anything as good as my Holland House dry sour mix packets.  This is equally as good.  I'll stock up for our bar now that I've tried it.

I have tried several liquid sour mixes and I'm usually very disappointed. Either they taste too sweet or too fake. This product has no artificial colors and it definitely makes a difference. This mix makes a delicious whiskey sour.  I ordered the small box to try it, but I will be ordering again in a larger quantity to have on hand for parties.
The cost of the mix to the number of drinks you get is much to high.

This grape jam is delicious.  It's smooth and sweet, but not overly sweet.  It spreads wonderfully and the taste is perfect.  For those of you who may get confused, this is jam, there are no seeds, just a smooth version of jelly.  I prefer this over jelly since jelly is kinda lumpy and does not spread as evenly.
I am happy that i bought the set rather than Individual items. Great deal guys. Cant wait for the great specials!!!

Welch's Grape Jam is close to my Granny's homemade jam and brings back SOME fond childhood memories. Picking the grapes from my Great Aunt's arbor was just the beginning of the labor of love, to clean, prepare and cook them for making preserves, jam and jelly. Cleaning and sterilizing the jars wasn't fun either :(

So yummy fond memories in a squeezable bottle makes this jam experience absolutely spreadable and wonderful!

This is a nice jelly that spreads fairly easily and the bottle makes it easy to apply to your sandwich or whatever else you want jelly for. It has a really nice grape-y flavor, so if you really like grape jelly, give this a try.

I was disappointed in this product especially considering how exceptional the Salmon Oil they make is.

This did not pass the 11 rescue dog test! They just turned up their noses. So did the other dogs here. Very tiny tidbits, as well.Buy an extra bottle of the Grizzly Salmon oil instead.

I tried these " Nu Treats" because they were offered at a discount when I purchased some Grizzly Salmon Oil for my dog. When I read the list of ingedients on the package for the treats, I was stoked. These crunchy little morsels are packed with nutrients and small enough to use for training without having to break them.

The only downside is the smell... but they *are smoked salmon treats after all. An added bonus is that they seem to digest well (unlike cheese and some other lamb-based treats I've tried).
Our 8 year old Cairn terrier suffers from food allergies and she can enjoy these with no side effects at all.  They also come in a convenient size for smaller dogs, which I appreciate.

We originally tried these treats when we received as a sample. My dog loved them, and i thought the smell was so fishy, no wonder he did!
The bag will last a long time. Do not feed too many, as it states on the package. It is a good value. Could even be cut in half or smaller to use as training rewards.

My dog can't get enough of these things. He gets so excited anytime he even hears the bag crinkle. We were told at obedience class to bring treats our dogs will do anything for and this was my choice. I'm back ordering more. With two labs, I wish I could order in bulk.

Our GSD loves the treats. They have never upset her stomach at all and she takes them down with no problems whatsoever.

It's quite true that they smell like fish food, but I normally don't carry them around in my pocket on account of them being pretty brittle if you were to have them bounce around in a pocket or treat bag.

The fact that they are loved by our dog and are a healthy snack makes it a win-win for us. I'd definitely purchase these in the future.

These are extremely popular with the canines I've offered them to - a nice small size and, being grain-free, a very healthy treat as well. My only objection is that they're kinda smelly to carry around in your pockets, as I usually do, altho the dogs consider the scent a very tantalizing aroma!

These are excellent treats, my dog really likes them, but from this seller specifically, they arrived almost completely pulverized so it was mostly a bag of salmon dust.  I used them to supplement the dog food, but they were mostly useless as treats.

I've been giving these to my 2 little dogs for over 5 yrs. They love them and I love giving them to my girls.
They are a nutritious salmon protein treat with essential amino acids and calcium. They're low calorie
with no artificial anything.
And... they're made from Alaskan Wild Salmon in the Pacific Northwest -- not salmon from the polluted
waters of the east coast. We use them for training treats, just because treats and in their puzzle toys.
They never lose their interest when rewarded with these treats. I highly recommend.
My dog LOVES these treats! The ingredients are so good for her and they don't cause any allergies or reactions either. Great product!

It's funny that most of the other reviews talk about using it straight, when I've never used it that way or even thought to try using it as shoyu! I use it as a soup base for zaru soba, somen salad, and udon. We mostly use it for hot udon. You basically put different amounts of water for whatever noodle you're eating and it tastes amazing each time. For instance, udon uses 1 part memmi, 12 parts water. It's extremely simple and tastes soooo good. Me and my daughter always drink the soup after and I make extra now so that we can have a lot of soup to drink with each noodle! This is really an amazingly good sauce! I'm hoping they eventually add subscribe and save for it.

I'm a big soy sauce fan but after tasting Memmi Noodle Soup Base, I don't think I can ever go back. It tastes much less salty and has a lot more sweetness (without being overly sweet) than regular soy sauce. I should probably actually try it as a soup base sometime, haha, but it's great over veggies and rice!

My mother-in-law introduced me to this sauce years ago and I have loved it ever since. Me and my kids cant live without it! Try it with a little rice vinegar added and it is a great dipping sauce for egg rolls, california rolls and gyozas. I would have given this 5 starts but find that it is a little on the pricey side here. I can buy a big bottle of this at my local asian market for about $3 a bottle.

We go through 3 bottles of this every 6-7 months. We buy Annie Chun's soba noodles from amazon, cook those and flush with cold water, drain and in a bowl with this sauce, some water, sliced or shredded cucumber, carrot, chili, etc. Get the salad shooter out ;)

Very refreshing on a hot summer stretch, you can actually cook the noodles in advance and store in a ziploc in the fridge with your vegetables, then make this delicious cold dish in a flash. Since the noodles cook in just a few minutes, dinner can be done in 5.

This sauce is somewhat like a teriyaki sauce, and its very popular with my son and his friends. Soy sauce, sugar and seasonings.

Besides our favorite cold noodle dish, you can also make hot and cold soups. With a little prepared dashi (dried bonito flake) broth mixed in, you can bring together a tasty hot or cold soup quickly.

Best of all, you can buy all of this from amazon at the same time. Our supermarkets are spotty with selling soba noodles, none of them carry this memmi sauce, and instant dashi can be challenging to find.

We have a restaurant here in town that has a fusion of Asian cuisines...and they have this absolutely delicious Taiwanese Beef noodle soup...for $10 a bowl. I rarely have it because it's expensive for a soup! Still...I crave that flavor. Hard to describe. So...did a little digging around on the internet and found this. We made it tonight for the first time using about a 6 parts water to one part soup base and adding garlic, crushed chili flakes, Chinese five spice and some mushrooms...then served over linguini in a soup bowl. Soooo good. It's clear, dark, somewhat sweet but yet salty and has that mushroomy-umame taste that just makes you addicted to it!! Next time, we are adding some shrimp or beef and topping with sliced green onions/scallions.

Although it says "Soup Base" on the bottle, my family hardly uses it for that purpose. It works great for everyday cooking and I would describe it as a sweet soy sauce. Try it on any type of meat and cooked vegetables. You can get a 20oz bottle for ~3-4$ at an Asian market.

This is a wonderful addition to soup stocks or packaged ramen in place of the "flavor packet". I use it often and enjoy the unique flavor it adds to chicken stock or water. Well worth experimenting with.

This is a lollipop that has flavor (orange) throughout and quite yummy! It tastes different, less artificial, than other lollipops and that is what made us order more than once!

High school colors are orange and black so used this first for graduation party (having the lollipops fanned out) and then just for special occasion (birthday) or celebrations (sports banquets, etc.).

Loss of one star: Part of the lollipop goes over the top of the stick and that is the easiest part to eat, the rest is swirled around a stick that is a small diameter dowel stick. It was a bit of a drawback that part was swirled around this hard stick and you had to try and lick it off or bite it off--you end up leaving little pieces of it on the stick. Would have loved to have had a softer stick that had a bit of give to it or even had a round lollipop that had the majority of it off of the stick. The stick part probably means that this is not for preschoolers.

But yummy flavor and thinking of ordering more!
This product is a good one and enhance the taste of the food or chicken. It also makes easy preparation with instruction on how to cook or mix all the ingredients.

My lab mix has a very sensitive tummy. He had recurrent bouts of diarrhea, vomiting and constant wretched gas. I had given him pedigree for awhile but realized that was no good for him. Then we tried science diet, but his gas seemed to get worse and his tummy would gurgle all day.

I read about this dog food and its natural ingredients. There's no corn meal or other fillers. He's been on this food for about 2 weeks now and his gas has disappeared! He has not had a single bout of diarrhea or vomiting. I'm impressed. Yes it's pricey and I normally wouldn't buy something so expensive, but it is well worth it for the health of my dog.

*Updated* to say that he has been on this food for a few months now and has continued to be free of tummy troubles and wretched gas. He hasn't vomited at all or had diarrhea. His coat has gotten so much shinier and he seems to be a much happier dog without all the tummy issues!

We finally found this food, just by luck at the pet store. Our dog (boxer/bulldog mix), now 6, had suffered mysterious allergies from the time he was 2 until I found this food. We went to a Veterinary Allergy Specialist for over a year, spent thousands of dollars, went to extremes trying prednisone (which the side-effects are very problematic) & antibiotics, and tried over 6 different prescription pet foods; nothing helped. Our dogs paws/feet would blister up in between his toes, burst, and bleed. We even had our dog run grassed with synthetic/artificial turf in case it was due to grass allergy.

The food is a little pricey, he eats 6 cups of food a day, but I cannot express the relief we have had from finding a food that eliminates his allergy symptoms. I have to admit that the smell of the fish is a little overwhelming. We had had to resort to feeding him outside now, which wouldn't be so bad, except the birds seem to like it too.

I love this food. It actually is the only food I have found that my dog is not allergic to. (except for an extremely expensive prescription diet) I have a boxer on this food. He is allergic to almost everything. However, he is not allergic to salmon or sweet potatoes making this food the perfect choice for him. All food related allergies have disappeared and his coat has improved tremendously. He still deals with outdoor allergies, but this food has shown a big improvement in him. The only issue I have had is that he packed on a few extra pounds, which he has now lost. I cut down his dry food amount and mix canned green beans and carrots in with the dry food so he has enough to eat without the extra weight. He loves it and eats every bite!

I have 2 schanuzers, one has great skin one has serious skin allergies. When we adopted them they were eating kibbles and bits, and the one with bad skin looked horrible. I hate to say it, but I didn't even like petting him.

We went to the vet and spoke to a nutirentest, they gave us some small samples for each dog to try and find out which brand of dog food they liked the best. Turns out they both loved the natures balance.

I chose the fish and sweet potato flavor since most dogs that have alleriges are also allergic to chicken and rice. We have been using this dog food for almost 3 months and I have seen a dramtic change in both of their coats!

The one with great skin, is even softer and shiner. But the one with bad skin has had the most change. He has a beasutiful shiney dark black coat. He has completly stopped itching and all the bumps are gone.

I cannot say enough good things about this food!

Natural Balance Sweet Potatoe and Fish is awesome.  Since eating this my cocker spaniel has not had anymore ear infections!!  He loves the food and it has benefited him greatly.  Would recommend this dog food!!
The only brand that wont give my doggies the itch and allergies! Been loyal to the brand for 4 years now...

My Golden is my heart.  And she has allergies, and with a Golden ear infections are very possible.  Switching to a limited ingredient dog food has been a huge positive.  And, she loves this stuff.  Give the option of a few dog foods, she'll go to this one and bark for it.  Her weight has remained consistent since the switch, btw.  I do recommend it.  For those on a budget, I would add: this flavor (as opposed to their Venison and/or Bison flavors) tends to be about five dollars cheaper; stalking the items price fluctuations tends to save another five.  This size bag is about a six week supply for us, I think.  The plus side to ordering is that you can get the bigger bag, and someone else carries it to your door.  However, if you have a local business in your area that stocks this (I don't, but my Mom does) they will probably load it for you.  And the local Natural Dog Food store actually gives samples.  Anywhoo, wherever you buy, I think this is a product worth trying.

Be cautious about all store dog foods. My dog had been eating Natural Balance Sweet Potato and Fish and developed digestive issues and almost died. I thought it was a number of things. Had lots of tests run and then one of my clients dogs developed the same issues with his dog on the same dog food and has also spent a lot of money trying to correct the gut issue. Can't prove anything as we got rid of the dog food, but since they recalled their Sweet Potato and Chicken this year because of (see below)...Posted: Jun 21, 2010 at 4:00 PM [Jun 21, 2010]

In 2007, a pet food recall was issued after the FDA discovered that vegetable proteins imported from China that were used to produce pet foods were contaminated with melamine. Sadly, some animals were sickened, and even died. After this recall, it's fair to say that many of us had become even more aware of how the pet food industry is regulated and how lapses are corrected, which is a great thing. Knowledge is power, as the saying goes.

The FDA posted a new announcement for a voluntary pet food recall on June 18 - relating to Natural Balance Pet Foods, Inc. More specifically, the company discovered that there was the possibility of salmonella contamination in 5- and 28-pound bags of their Sweet Potato and Chicken Dry Dog Food. Consumers who have purchased that formula need to look for a "best by" date of June 17, 2011.

Flickr photo courtesy of Denise Chan
Salmonella, also referred to as salmonellosis, causes digestive problems, and dogs will typically present with fever, diarrhea, vomiting, and weakness. Other symptoms can occur.
Salmonella is a zoonotic disease, meaning that it can be passed to humans as well, so care needs to be taken. Hand washing is a must - even when handling dry pet food that may be contaminated with the bacteria.

To keep up to date with current recalls and information on pet food safety, visit the FDA's website to view the updated list that includes not only dog and cat foods, but also horse feed.

[...]

Over the summer my girlfriend and I adopted an American Bulldog who, unbeknownst to us had a number of allergies. In the beginning these allergies manifested themselves through excessive scratching and some overwhelming stomach related ailments, which, for the benefit of the reader, I'll only describe as the type of thing which made us wonder if our dog's insides had been possessed or become otherwise engaged in some advanced stage of decay. As cute as he is, he'd come into a room, gun-hot so to speak, and very quickly force us to find another place to sit.

This food changed all of that.

After trying him on two or three other products this food caused him to all but stop scratching and, for all intents and purposes, put an end to that earth-shattering, life-changing, climate-altering flatulence (there, I finally said it) of his. He's now the perfect dog, this food has improved his life, our lives, and the lives of anyone who comes to visit. It's definitely worth it.

I have a Jack Russell Terrier. It has an allergic reaction to chicken and some grains.  This food seems to have solved most if not all of its allergy problems.  The dog had chewed itself raw.  After a couple of weeks of this dog food, hair was growing back with only occasional scratching.  Nothing like it use to be.  I gave it 5 stars because it worked.  Would my dog rather have burger or steak... yes.  But, it does eat this.  I order a bag a week and a half before I run out.  Not as cheap as regular dog food, but saves on the Vet bills.  Fifty dollars a bag for the dog food, versus a minimum, $150 for a visit to the Vet.

My dog has an over abundance of ear wax and the vet suggested I try this food. My dog has been eating this exclusively for 10 days and it has made him sick. He has tons of gas and diarrhea. The only thing positive that I can say is that he liked the taste.

I was very happy with this product at first, as it solved my little dog's skin problems. Now, almost 2 years later, my dog has developed really bad cough allergy. I have solidly confirmed the food is the root cause by stopping & trying it again. I just want to mention that this is a 2nd time we have to discontinue dog food after years of use, due to newly developed allergies.

Great dog food. My 2.5 year old lab is at a healthier weight after a year on this (she was 90 lbs as a 1.5 year old pup, and she's slimmed down to 80. But she's a very large lab, so she wasn't really fat to begin with). Also, I don't wanna get too graphic, but there is evidence on our walks that she's digesting this better than the grocery store food I used to give her.

(I started her on this because we suspected a food allergy, and then I liked the results.)

But why is it going up in price? I've been buying it off Amazon because, with Prime, it's cost effective. But it was $50 in February, $55 in March, and now $60 in April? What gives?? I might have to start buying it at the brick-and-mortar store again. And that's a shame, because having a month's worth of dog food delivered to your door is pretty awesome.

My french bulldog developed SEVERE allergies at around 8 months. Within a few weeks he was covered in bumps from head-to-toe, his hair fell out, he wheezed horribly, had really bad gas, went to the bathroom a lot and had loose stools. I wasn't sure he would live, and the Vet said he had severe allergies, probably to his food, and put him on several months of prednisone and a prescription allergy food. I was upset with the prednisone treatment as I knew it was dangerous and my dog hated the prescription food. Two weeks later there was almost no change and he was still miserable, so I started researching my own solution for allergies, comparing food ingredients, and ideas to try. I found that salmon/fish and sweet potatoes are not ingredients found in many other dog foods so an allergy to them would be more rare...and this food doesn't contain any grains or poultry products. I started him on this and added a heaping spoon of canned pink salmon with it, and he still licks the bowl clean every time. His breathing started clearing up within a week or so and I was able to stop giving him prednisone. The bumps gradually went away after about a month and a half and his hair slowly grew back. It took about 4+ months for 100% of his symptoms to go away, but he has been doing great for over a year now. (For treats he is only allowed raw baby carrots, apple chunks, frozen green beans, or salmon jerky.)

This food is an excellent option for dogs with both grain and poultry allergies as I can't seem to find another quality dog food that doesn't contain a little bit of chicken or rice, eggs, oatmeal, etc. My only issue is that it is a bit low on protein, but since I add canned salmon to his food each day anyway isn't a problem for us. The canned salmon and salmon oil are good for his skin so it works nicely, especially since he will eat the dry dog food just fine, but when I add the canned salmon he goes nuts for it.

If your dog has allergies, try this!! Don't let the vet sell you prescription dog food and put your dog on dangerous doses of prednisone. My vet put my dog on the most common one sold; it was really expensive and I was so upset after I researched it and discovered that it has almost zero nutritional value. (Look at petfoodanalysis. com as it does an amazing job of reviewing all foods and ranking them on quality ingredients, etc.)

My shelter dog, Sarah, is a long-haired shepherd-chow chow mix that is allergic to so many food ingredients and outdoor plants, that I just say "She is allergic to nature!"

She was scratching almost non-stop, which was unpleasant and uncomfortable for her, and frustrating and distracting for me, so I decided to take her to a highly recommended veterinarian to perform allergy tests to see what was causing the problem.

As it turned out, almost every food ingredient and outdoor plant (wild and cultured) was checked off the list as her being allergic to them.

"What to do?" I asked. "She's got to eat something, and she's got to go outdoors."

The veterinarian gave me a bag of this Natural Balance Fish and Sweet Potato dry dog food. What a difference it made! The scratching was reduced 90 percent and both Sarah and I felt much better for it.

Highly recommended for any dog suffering from allergies.

I have been a faithful buyer of Natural Balance for years for my large dog with allergies. Thinking I was getting the best.

My dog developed a yeast infection that my vet told me was allergies. He has constant ear infections, itching and he started to lose weight. His skin was like an elephant and it started to flake off. Turns out the potatoes and sweet potatoes in the Potato and Venison dog foods was feeding the yeast infection and it was killing him. He was losing weight and went from 75 pounds to 57 pounds before we found out the cause. I contacted the food company who were no help at all. They didn't even respond to my reply. I wasn't asking for any miracles, I just wanted some answers and I got a big fat NOTHING.

After switching vets my new vet discovered the yeast infection and we switched the dog food. He started to gain weight but we have a long road ahead of us to keep the yeast at bay.

I am just disappointed in the company's customer service. I spent about $50 on a bag of food every two weeks plus treats. My money will be better spent elsewhere.

My ten month old doxie/mix started having horrible stomach problems.  She would regurgitate her food within minutes after eating it.  After spending $1000 at the vet and having no reason for why she was getting sick, I decided to look into a different kind of food.  She was on Wellness before and the vet switched her to a special canned food.  Then he had me switch her to Science Diet Sensitive Stomach.  She did fine on the canned food, but got sick with the Science Diet.  Once I started this food, she stopped getting sick.  It was a miracle!  Her gas has gone away and she has kept the food down for over two months.  I'm so happy with this food!  I switched her brother onto the food too, and they both love it.

This product is great if you have a dog with allergies. You know how awful it is when your "baby" is miserable. Our pet's skin was so sensitive and itchy that he could barely be touched without trembling all over. His skin became raw with open sores from his constant biting and scratching . At his worst, he began losing large sections of hair. He also suffered from chronic ear infections. We were back and forth to the vet every few weeks for steroids, antibiotics, etc. We finally determined he had many food allergies. (beef, dairy, lamb, liver, chicken, kangaroo(??-they tested for this-not sure why) really all proteins except for fish.) If you have a pet with allergies like this you know how hard it is to find products they are able to eat. Meat/chicken by products seem to find there way into everything. The Natural Balance Limited Ingredient Fish and Sweet Potato dog food is great. Our dog loves the taste and the difference it has made in his skin in amazing. His skin is completely healed, most of his hair has grown back and his ears are doing better as well.
I know this food is more expensive than many brands you find at the grocery store. At first, my accountant husband was not thrilled with the cost. However, when he saw the tremendous improvement in "Kelso's" skin and saw the vet bills going away he realized what a value it really is.
AMAZING PRODUCT-AMAZING RESULTS-HAPPY/HEALTHY DOG!!

Natural Balance dog food is great, but the dog food I purchased from Amazon was not completely satisfactory.  There was about a 4 pound clump of dog food that was so hard and compressed, it would have been unreasonable to break apart or use.  a 5 pound bag of this dog food goes for $13, so  I feel like I lost money on this purchase for the convenience of having it delivered instead of an in-store pickup.  I won't be purchasing dog food from Amazon again.  I don't feel as if they rotate the food out as well as it would if one were to purchase it from Petco or PetSmart.

The breeder we got our Goldendoodle from uses this dog food because it's great for doodles that may have sensitive stomachs, which ours does. He is now a 1year  and we continue to use this dog food, plus you get such a great deal for this bag on Amazon.

We talked to the folks at petco and their dog also had cushings.  They said their dog responded well to the diet change so not having much to do on the vet's end we gave it a try.  Our dog did not like the taste at first, but began to prefer this over her old food (natural choice for sensitive stomachs which she had been on for years).  It is expensive, which hurts the wallet, but it has been worth it to see the improvement and to see her playing and more active again.

This product arrived on time and it was in perfect condition. My dog loves this food, she has a really sensitive tummy and this does not bother her at all.  I would buy this product again and I would order from this seller as well.

I ordered the natural balance salmon dry dog food because I had good luck with the natural balance salmon dry cat food.  Further, I am a pescatarian and was disappointed to see how almost every dry dog and cat food brand at the grocery stores and on the market contain chicken, lamb, or beef bi -products.  I love my dogs, but I cannot see feeding baby lamb to my dog! Even the "only fish" labelled dog and cat foods on the market often contain chicken, etc when you look on the ingredients list.  So I was very pleased to find a cost effective solution to this in natural balance.  The only issue is that my dogs will not touch this food! However, I will say that they all (including the cat) flock to the Natural Balance salmon dry cat food lol so I will continue ordering that for the cat.

I have had problems finding a dog food that my sensitive dog could eat, and my other dog would like also! They both seem to agree that the duck and fish flavor is the best! They  chow it down like there isnt going to be an another meal:) Shipping was really fast:)

My pure bread yellow lab is surprisingly a very picky eater and after going through several other brands this is the only food he will eat.  He doesn't have allergies that we're aware of and hasn't had any bad reactions to other foods, he just won't eat them.  Now I've moved to an area where I can't get this food at a nearby store, so I've come to Amazon.com to start ordering it regularly for delivery.

My english bulldog had severe food allergies. It would make him lick his paws until they were red, paw at his face, itch, and worst of all have very frequent messy poops!
I tried many remedies and foods until I tried Natural Balance. This formula has helped all the problems he had with food allergy. And, he has hardly any smelly gas anymore!

This product made my dog very sick. He is an older 11 year old pug with allergies and this particular mix is supposed to be good with allergies.
