I woke up at 730ish and never felt so refreshed that early (I'm obviously not a morning person).

Unfortunately, the prices here are a bit high, and I don't think I can get these where I live. In my opinion, though, unless you can find them locally for cheaper, the $31 is still very much worth it!

the greatest tea ever. i actually am a distributor of this product the only one in so. cal but not being one sided. better than any prescription drug on the market. and better for you in the long term.

I have to get up at 4AM, and the longer the days get, the more difficult it is to fall asleep at a reasonable hour. Not with these wonderful tasting drinks! I am out cold within an hour. . . tops. I have tried Neuro, Zen Serenity, and now these, and these are the best by far (taste, effectiveness, etc.). I wake up feeling great; not like when you take a sleeping pill. Also, I ordered from Marely's (I assume this was a typo), and their customer service was SUPERB when I had a slight issue. As far as the price, a night's worth of sleep without taking a pharmaceutical drug, is worth every penny to me.

The only problem that I have with this item is that it does not in fact put you in a mellow mood. It knocks you out completely. Within an hour of drinking this, I have a really hard time staying awake. That's why I purchased it though, to relax and eventually help get me to sleep. I have also not noticed any side effects with my sleep, when drinking this multiple nights in a row and then stopping, like most sleep aids.

It is also really tasty. It holds up extremely well against any other fruit beverage. This may be a con though as constantly wanting to drink a beverage that knocks you out can't be good for your social or work life.

I didn't know that this drink did more than just taste good the first time I drank it. I knocked out (fell asleep!) The taste is great, and we prefer the Black Tea over the green tea version. It is hard to find but we have found it at Sprouts Market and also some Shell Gas Stations. Check MMM's website for Store Locators. Walmart also sells it online but my local Sprouts store is cheaper than any online outlet so far. Good drink! Wish they also made the drink without the sleep effects.

Recently found Bob Marley's tea at a few select stores. It is very refreshing and has a nice clean taste to it. It is very relaxing but in no way put  me out. I can drink it any time of the day. I tried both the black tea and the green. The green one is the best and it is sweet but not too sweet. I thought I might be able to get a better deal on Amazon but doesn't come close to the $1.50 or $1.70 that I find them for.
Ordered the product in the middle of june and i have yet to receive the product despite contacting customer service

This is a delicious tea that will help you relax before sleep time. Unfortunately, it is hard to find; I did not find it in major retailers and grocers in my area and it's expensive to purchase on-line.

I bought this from my local grocery store just to see what it was about. Looked cool, and I drank a few sips as the can said it might make you drowsy. I definitely felt a "head change" the first time i drank it, and immediately went for a red bull to balance out the effects. That night I was having trouble sleeping and was laying awake at 1:30am. I remembered I still had a can of this in the fridge and drank the whole thing.. Within 10 minutes I was out.

Just recently I bought this again in case I needed help sleeping (I sometimes have insomnia). I drank half a can and about an hour later (around 2:30pm) I was laying in bed taking a nap. I actually fell asleep on my back, which I NEVER do; always on my side or stomach.

Personally, I dont think it should be a "Bob Marley" product, as Mike Tyson would be more suitable - since it will knock you out cold.

12 Pack of Marley's Mellow Mood - Black Tea Peach Raspberry Passion FruitI bought this on a whim, in a particularly bad walmart visit. I was really surprised that after a few sips I was really not so bothered as i thought. When I got home, I was reading the bottle, saw that it was quite natural ingredients, so since I never sleep for than 3-4 hrs. I bought a case at amazon. Have used it off and on all month especially when I was upset and not sleeping, the calming affect helps me get back to sleep. sandy in Central NY

I got this cuz i like trying new drinks and im glad i read the label before drinking the whole bottle (it being 1pm)
I am so happy i found something that is "natural" that allows me to fall asleep. i suffer from insomnia and i had half a bottle and i just dozed off and slept though the night. such a great feeling. I went to the store the next day and bought a bunch of them.the Green tea isnt that great . but im not a fan of green tea. you should try it if you have trouble falling asleep!!

I've ordered this food before, and it's one of my dog's favorites.
This last shipment, however, contained many dented cans, which does not instill confidence.
I'd say about 20% were dented, though so far all the food has been fine. This is an observation about quality control more than it is a complaint, and I'll likely order again.
This was a terrific bargain.  This is also my dog Jax's favorite dog food and the purchase price was half what I usually spend.

I live in California and have an elderly Aunt in Mississippi. She does not drive and has to depend on others for trips to the grocery store. The prices for things like Oatmeal may not always be competitive with places like Walmart or Costco, but ordering grocery items through amazon.com is a great way for me to help out my Aunt. I just talked to her on the phone while she dictated her shopping list.

Thank you for this service, amazon.com!

This is a good way to start the day and this box will keep you going for almost two months.  Just add hot water and you're set.  It's quick and easy to prepare and very filling.  Plus, the variety pack will keep things interesting.

I purcahsed this oatmeal variety pack assuming I would receive the various flavors listed in the picture such as banana bread and cinnamon roll.

Nope.

I get a box with just 4 flavors including 13 packets of original. Who in God's names wants original quater oatmeal via packet? If you are going to deliver pain like that, then ad and description should state so accordingly.

Will not be making this mistake again.

I needed some more oatmeal for breakfast and this hit the spot. I myself need more than just one packet and will typically use a plain and another flavor to use up the plain oatmeal. I don't know anyone that wants to eat plain oatmeal but that is my solution for the packs rather than throwing them away. Several people complain of the price but not having to deal with going to the store for it and the taxes of it more than makes up for any differences.

What is pictured and what you recieve is not the same!  The picture when I ordered had 6 or 7 different flavors pictured, one being banana, which is the main reason I ordered and I recieved only original flavors.  I will not recommend this seller and will never order from them again!

It's cheap. For about 18 bucks, you get 52 packets of oatmeals.
I usually take three packets of these each morning.

I like the large variety of oatmeal but less that a week after purchasing this on Amazon (with Amazon Prime) for $18.59 on March 20th, I went to Costco and found the same exact product for $9.39. Save your money and buy it somewhere else.

This is a quick breakfast and a great value.
I usually add a banana or other seasonal fruit along with milk or water

Amazing price compared to the grocery store and a great multi-pack mix. I like adding raisins and dried cranberries to mine, makes a great healthy breakfast. No surprises in this one, we all know what Quaker Oats are.

The box I got is same as I can purchase from Costco but more than double the price, it's crazy.  I gave this a try cause I though this is different variety pack, No, it's just like you can get from Costco but more than double the price. save yourself some money.  This product needs detail information on what's inside.

Those little packets are wonderful for a quick low calorie weekday breakfast. My favorites are the cinnamon&spice, raisin&spice, and the apple. They are so easy to make and I usually have them after my exercise. With the exception of the warehouse stores (Sam's, Costco) it is extremely rare to see the 52 packet boxes.

When I ordered this product there were many more flavors listed such as "cinnamon roll" & "banana bread"....so this is why I ordered.  When it came in the mail it only had 4 flavors.  Cinnamon & Spice, Apples/Cinnamon, Maple Brown Sugar, & original.  I won't be purchasing this again on Amazon.

False advertisement here. The variety I received is not what I ordered. If you are out of a particular variety don't send a replacement unless you have contacted the customer for approval. I don't think I would order a bulk variety again. I'll order the individual flavors instead.

The Quaker Instant Oatmeal Variety Pack, 52 Packets offers four different flavors of oatmeal to kick start your day. My box contained 18 packs of Maple & Brown Sugar, 15 packs of Apple Cinnamon, 14 packs of Cinnamon Spice and 5 packs of Original. Overall this is a good selection of a product that I enjoy on almost a daily basis. The flavored oatmeal might be a little sweet for some people, so be careful using this product if you have Diabetes.

Please rate this review if you found it helpful.
This 52 pack of Quaker Assorted Oatmeal was ordered for a church food pantry. The product arrived quickly and in good condition. This is a great value and the church was happy.

Not much to say here - it's Quaker oatmeal, just in a bigger box than you'd get at the grocery store. My only problem is that there's plain in the box, but that's clearly visible, and I knew it when I bought it. I just wish they offered a big box without plain flavor.
Good product, but this price is beyond stupid.  It wouldn't cost this much if you bought 6 boxes of the 10 pack at walmart.
Tasty oatmeal start for the day. Cooked in the microwave while you get ready for work.

I got a 5lb bag of rolled oats from the farmer's market in Detroit.  Little did I know how hard it was to properly flavor blan oatmeal without adding 2lbs of sugar.  This solved my problem and makes my morning breakfast that much faster - boil, add, stir.  But why did they add like 6 packets of the plain stuff?  The cat won't even eat it.

I bought these after recently being diagnosed as type 2 diabetic.  Probably not the right thing I have found out. They are handy for a quick breakfast.  The taste is not all that great although the texture is much improved over the older product.  Have offered them to other people, but they are not really enthused over the prospect of eating what one called 'wallpaper paste'.  I'm going back to coffee and toast.

The stress of a tough year is starting to get to me. I've been puckered up so tight for so long, I'm afraid my puckerer may have frozen that way.

So I've been searching for inner peace -- and outer unpuckering -- in personal relaxation products. But expensive gadgets and doodads would just angry my blood up further, so I'm seeking Samadhi on a shoestring budget.

When my wife goes to a spa to relax, she always gets some kind of oatmeal facial scrub treatment. I don't know much about pampering, but I'm intimately familiar with a wide variety of hot breakfast cereals. If oatmeal on the face is relaxing, then I'd sure give it a try.

I heated several packets of the oatmeal in the microwave, per the cooking instructions, added a little milk and layered it onto my face. I'm not sure what's supposed to happen next in a 'professional' treatment, but in my bathroom, a lot of it just glooped off into the sink. The rest felt... well, like oatmeal on my face. Sticky. Warm. Lumpy, in a way that was less 'relaxing' and more 'get it off my face-y'.

The oatmeal did smell nice, and made me sort of hungry, but I don't think I relieved any stress by putting it on my face instead of IN my face. Maybe next time I'll try wearing it with eggs over easy, or a rasher of bacon. Bacon makes *everything* peaceful.

I bake a lot of bread and cake. This Xanthan Gum is a very fine powder product that emulsifies cakes without changing its color and taste. After using this Xanthan Gum in my bread and sponge cake, the pastries remain moist and fluffy longer.
This is a very good product and the cheapest price for a pound that I've seen.  I will be getting from them every time I need some.

I see this ingredient on product labels everywhere so I thought I'd check it out. I always liked thick shakes growing up so I thought it might be a way to make a sensible shake or smoothie with the body of a more indulgent drink. Guess what  -  it's amazing! It does the job to the nth degree. With the addition of about half a teaspoon you can make a fat free shake that almost refuses to pour out of the blender. I wouldn't reccommend any more than half a teaspoon to start because you can always add more liquid. I did that and wound up with a full blender full of drink and it was still almost too thick to pour. It's also very popular in salad dressings because it adds body and cling. Home made ice cream is another natural. Try it and discover your own uses.

A must for low carb foodies!  I've used it in baking, making low carb ice cream (which gives the ice cream a real "mouth" feel) and thickening sauces without the use of flour or corn starch.  Amazon has the best price on it, too.

I bought this because I was looking for a lower cost alternative to the $12 small bags of Red Mill Xantham gum I had been using to make gluten free bread. I was trying to lower the total cost per loaf, otherwise I might as well buy the loaves in the frozed section which are pretty good. I had already figured out a means to cheaply combine my own flour ingredients so I wouldn't need to purchase the expensive Red Mill gluten free flour. Next, I located on Amazon a great bulk deal on bakers yeast that also added to cost reduction (and was superior in result too.) After buying this Xanthan gum, I further reduced the price per loaf significantly. I have found this product works well and have not noticed any difference in quality of my results with my bread. So, I am very happy to have found this alternative at a more reasonable price. I also like the zip lock bag it comes in which is much more handy for baking and easy handling than the Red Mill bag.

Works like a dream.  This and Guar Gum are the only thickeners I use. This gives my lotions a nice, spreadable quality that makes my lotions feel moist with out being wet or greasy.  Be careful, if you use too much it will clump and leave a slimy feel.  Excellent product.  "Xanthan Gum! WOW!"  Anyone get that reference? :)~

I was a bit apprehensive about straying from the familiar Bob's Red Mill brand of gums, but I'm perfectly happy with this product. There's no discernible difference between this and the much-more-expensive BRM brand, so if you know you'll be using xanthan gum often, this is what you'll want to buy. I use some every day and have barely made a dent in my supply!

I do a lot of gluten free baking and this is such a great deal.  Fresh, effective,and saves us money.  I've purchased this xanthan gum three different times now and the quality and price cannot be beat.
This came well packaged and I found that this gives my yeast breads a longer shelf-life and far moister end product. If you love gooshy white bread, this is THE trick to making it super moist!

This is a great deal for Xanthan gum. I used some of this as a thickening agent during cooking with great results. The re-sealable bag keeps the product good for quite a while (possibly years if you refridgerate it) and I found no observable difference between this brand and other more expensive ones. A little xanthan gum goes a long way and this 1LB bag should last you quite a while.
Just restocked after being out for a long time.  I'd forgotten that you need so much less than cornstarch if you are substituting.  Maybe 1/4 as much?  Clumps less than cornstarch as well.
I use Xanthan Gum for my home made lotions, creams and serums to name a few and it works perfectly! You need just a little and that will go a LONG WAY! This will last me forever!

I grind my own grain and make all of our bread.  I have LITTLE kids and traditional home made bread is pretty coarse and difficult for them to chew, so I tweeked my recipe and added this to my dough to make a lighter textured bread.  This is pretty pricey in the stores here so finding it on Amazon has been a great budget saver.  The quality is great and the packaging convient for storage.

I used this in my Gluten Free baking and it works great!  For St. Patty's day I made my niece Gluten Free Irish Soda Bread using Gluten Free A P Flour, adding 2 teaspoons per cup of flour used and it came out tasting just like the regular bread.  Like I said, it works great, thank you for such a wonderful product, I will be doing a lot more Gluten Free baking.

We have to do a bunch of gluten free baking for my family.  This is the second time I have purchased this exact product.  I was disappointed to see that the cost went up 5$ since last year, but it's still about 7-8$ then purchasing at local retail shops.  This lasted us about 1 year using it for our baked goods.
A little goes a long way. Think baby steps when using, if you aren't using a recipe. I made fruit smoothies, with or without ice.

Ordering through Amazon is the easiest, safest way to order online. I received my order quickly and have never had a problem with an order being shipped incomplete. I order gluten-free products online because the deals are much better than anything found in the local grocery stores. Xanthan gum is costly enough, but you can buy it for less online. The product was fresh, sealed well and performed as expected.
Makes my gluten free breads and desserts the absolute best! My bread seems to be nice and tender--not gummy and gluey. Thanks Essential Depot for a great product.
I looked around for some a decent price on this stuff. This was the best I could find. It arrived quickly and was just as expected.

I was reluctant to purchase Xanthan Gum, thinking it was too expensive, and frankly, it was a foreign ingredient that I had never used before.  To my absolute delight, I found Xanthan Gum to be an indispensible ingredient in gluten free baking!  It is easy to use, and will last a long time in your pantry.  As any Celiac's patient (or person with gluten sensitivity) will tell you, it's wonderful to bake a Gluten free birthday cake from scratch, with the confidence that everyone will want to eat it!
This is a great product at a great price.  It arrived on time and was packaged well.  I will purchase more when I need it.
Since you are looking into purchasing xanthan gum I assume you know what it does. It acts like it should, and the resealable pouch is very nice.
I have just started using Xanthan Gum in my protein smoothies! A little goes a long way, but the texture of my shakes are now so think and creamy.

I bought this along with Sunbeam 2591 350-Watt MixMaster, Black to make some bread and cakes.

I wasn't too impressed with the mixer but this Xanthan Gum is incredible stuff for the price.

It thickens up nicely and gives a great texture.

I will be coming back for more.
I have used this product all year without any problems (For gluten free baking).  Works great and best price I've found.

This product will cause SEVERE GI distress; even when used in very small amounts.  The gas pains and resulting diarrhea is not worth what it adds to the food product.  I bought it to make home made ice cream smoother.....  forget it!  I'd rather eat ice crystals than go through what my husband and I went through with just 1 tsp. in a quart of mix.  I looked it up on line and this is one of the MAIN side effects and says someone "may" tolerate after using for 30 days!  Why would one want to?  Even though the label says it is "food grade", the food service that used this product would soon be out of business.
Love this and I use in a differnt way my husband can't swallow driniks well and this is a good thicken for that and so much cheater

....Use it when you want something a little less tumeric-bright. One stop spicing if you're making a tanjine too. All the moroccan spices I ordered were surprisingly different from each other. So feel free to experiment.

I purchased a chi poo last week and this is what they had him on. The first bag 6 6lb was $9.99
I purchased another bag while he was being groomed 4 days later this store is 13 miles away so I figured it would be a good idea to grab another bag. Granted nothing in this store is priced for the consumer.Imagine my surprise when I checked my receipt to find I was charged $17.99 plus TAX for the same item i purchased 4 days prior at the same pet store for almost $8.00 LESS. There are only three places I can purchase this. At the pet store or online and the costs are outrageous to say the least. I have found other brands of holistic food at Pet Smart about the same Price. You're paying for the name. Same with IAMS and all the rest. Just how much better is this stuff ? I'm not sure. I know this dog evacuates a lot within minutes after eating it !

I shop on Amazon all the time and I was stunned to see this listed at $89.00 for 6 lbs bag marked down to $13 but then they soak ya for shipping which is bringing the total up to $20 for a 6 lb bag. I've seen 25 lb bags for that price. Glad I checked. Think it's time for a food change for this pup !

I first bought this cereal at the HEB grocery store and it's priced between $4 and $5 for 1 box. It taste pretty good. Amazon currently sells it for about $3.95 a box, if you opt for subscribe & save. It's crunchy and takes longer to sog, which is what I like. I don't like Nature's Path Flax Plus Multibran Cereal or Heritage Flakes (not sure which one I tried). It gets soggy too quickly.

And if you're curious about the expiration date, all 6 boxes (arrived 2 days ago) are dated for December 2012.

I never smoked,and have all my taste buds intact. This cereal is less sweet then corn flakes or wheaties by a long shot. They really have a multi grain flavor. One thing to note on these boxes,the serving size is small and there are not very many servings per. I suggest buying the bags if you like to eat ,"A real bowl" not a cup of cereal. It's far more cost effective. I'd give this cereal five stars if all the ingredients came from North America. The cane juice and rice bran flour are from South America.

Nature's Path organic multigrain oatbran flake cereal is a great tasting product and it's very nutritious and friendly to the diet (i.e., very low fat, low sodium, good protein, high fiber content (at least 5 grams by my standard), and low sugar). I've been consuming it for a long time.
Great cereal, always seen in my cupboard. Amazon pricing most fair keeps me coming back.

This used to be my favorite cereal. It had fiber, good taste and texture but in the past year or two they started making it sweeter and sweeter. I don't like sweetened cereal. At least with an unsweetened cereal I can choose to make it sweeter myself. But if it is too sweet out of the box there is no choice to make it less sweet. I contacted the company and told them I didn't like how sweet they had made it now. They denied that they had changed anything. They lost me as a customer after that. I was buying 6 boxes a month for almost 2 years straight. I stopped. I waited a few months and decided to try again to see if they had changed their recipe back the way it used to be. I just opened a new box and it is still sickening sweet for my tastes. Goodbye Nature's Path. If I wanted super sweetened sugar cereal that is what I would have bought! Anybody want free 6 boxes? You can have it!!! Yuck!

Do you like ginger? Are you aware of it's health-giving qualities? Ginger has been shown to settle the digestion, to act as an anti-inflammatory, and may even shrink tumors and inhibit cancer cells. I've seen this specific product recommended in various articles on Naturopathic health. It TASTES healthy. It tastes great, too.

Ginger Beer (as opposed to Ginger Ale) is loaded with ginger. And it's rarely more loaded with ginger than here in REED'S EXTRA GINGER BREW---At 26 grams per bottle, you can practically SEE the ginger in it. It has a lot of ginger "bite."

Unlike the soft drink megacorporations which produce a tasteless and overly fizzy sugar water they label as "Ginger Ale", Reed's microbrews it's soft drinks in a process similar to that used by a beer microbrewery. There is no alcohol in REED'S EXTRA GINGER BREW. 25% of REED's EXTRA is fruit juice, part of which contributes to the sugar content, which is comparable to other sodas. REED'S should be a treat, not a substitute for water.

REED'S GINGER BREW comes in three varieties, ORIGINAL, PREMIUM, and EXTRA. The amount of ginger increases with each variety (It's a little odd that PREMIUM has less ginger than EXTRA). The labels are similar so check carefully to decide which variety you want.

I've had "ginger ale" as a soft drink off and on throughout my life, both the regular and the diet varieties. It was okay. Then I spotted Reed's Extra Ginger Brew (all natural Jamaican Ginger Beer) in my local Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market. What is this, I wondered? Well, looked it over and decided I just had to try it. Oh, my! It was good! Really good! It was so superior to the "ginger ales" I've had that there was just no comparison. And this drink tasted like real ginger and it was good and strong! Boy, this is a fine soft drink. A bottle has just about the same calories as regular soda and I note 37 grams of sugar. I'm going to have to watch it. This stuff goes down so easy!

Gary Peterson

I like this. Sometimes I even love it, like - when it's a furnace outside and the ginger beer is ice cold. But it's not the best I've had. If you want a very gingery beer, try The Ginger People. They infuse their beer with real pieces of ginger - ginger that you can see. Fever-Tree offers a nice, refreshing ginger beer as well.
I fell in love with Reed's Ginger Beer Extra Ginger Brew years nearly 20 years ago. I may not be an expert on ginger beer but I know what I like and it is Reeds!

I Love ginger ANYTHING..  This is a non alcoholic brew that offers two strengths of ginger. I prefer the 26 gram bottle. Snappy and bubbly.  It's my "eye opener" in the morning . Once you get hooked , you'll miss it when it's gone.  So, I buy 2 cases (48) bottles at a time.  Also is used for goosed up coctails in trendy bars. Try something different and give yourself the benefits of ginger in your life. Mildly spicy with a Jamaican flare. Twist off cap, so bring it with you.  If I have a little stomach queeze, this drink will fix the problem.

This bubbly crisp ginger ale has an excellent strong ginger bite to it. There is no sugary taste to it like far too many ginger ales on the market. There is just a hint of honey to this lovely concoction. The crispness of all of Reed's Ginger Ales is incredibly refreshing on a hot summer day. Try it over ice cream for a ginger ale float!

Seriously, if you have a stomach ache and drink a bottle of this, it will go away.  I started drinking ginger ale a few years ago because I had stomach problems and read that ginger helps as does peppermint tea.  It both does indeed help, but when I found this I became hooked.  I drink one every day and have no more upset stomach, ever!  I love this stuff and don't understand the bad reviews.  I have tried some of those other brands people are mentioning and they really don't taste any better.  It's funny how someone always has to come along and slam something good and tell you how to do it better.  This is my favorite of all the gingers I've tried.  Get a bottle ice cold and drink it and you will love it.

Trader Joe's consistently has the best price on this, barely under $1/bottle. This has got to be about my favorite beverage. I am surprised to see any negative reviews. This does not taste like Ginger Beer. Ginger beer has more bite and is very sugary. This is much more refreshing, but it also has a bite, not much, but enough.

This ginger beer is really good. It is not as aromatic as some of the others which is one of the reasons I like it. I usually buy it for about a dollar a piece at the local grocery store. Can't beat that anywhere.

This item was a gift for a relative. They were so overjoyed that I was showered with compliments. Now that we have the order straight I expect to conduct further business with Amazon in the future. Thanks.

Reed's is probably the most well known brand of premium ginger beer on the market, but it is a mediocre beverage by itself and as a mixer. Even the Extra Ginger doesn't pack much of a ginger punch. I would give it 1 star, but it's better than Canada Dry and uses doesn't use HFCS. I prefer Natural Brew Outrageous Ginger Ale for drinking by itself or as a mixer and Gosling's as a mixer only, although Gosling's contains HFCS.

While certainly not as awful as Ginger People's ginger beer, I don't recommend it.  I love a good ginger beer, and this is all that my local grocery store carries and I still won't buy it.  To be fair, there are different styles of ginger beer and taste IS subjective.  But I can't help but feeling that something like Cock and Bull or Barritts is MUCH better and more "authentic".  (Although they are not nearly as natural.)
Trader Joe's discontinued Bundaberg but kept this line. Go figure. Exotic label, bland taste. Bundaberg is one of the best I've ever tasted. Reed's: forgettable.

I have been searching for a good ginger beer, trying to find something that might compare to Bundaberg Ginger Beer, and was EXTREMELY disappointed with Reed's.  I was looking for that sweet gingery flavor, with a nice strong bite, and found Reed's to be nothing more than a bland drink with a lingering burn, NOT a bite, that resembled heartburn more than the gingery spice blast of a decent ginger beer.  Reed's was rubbery tasting, and tastes similar to a cheap non-alcoholic beer.  I literally couldn't finish my first bottle.  I pride myself on being able to eat and drink just about anything... so to be unable to finish this drink says a lot.  Oh Bundaberg, why aren't you sold in US grocery stores???

We found these wonderful treats in Scotland a few years back. Since they're 95% dried fish, our terriers went nuts for them. (The tiddler size is perfect for smaller dogs.) They were difficult to locate in this country, so every time we went back to the UK we would stock up. Now that Entirely Pets features them, life is perfect...

While I agree that these nuts are quite tasty, the total weight of the eight packs is one pound. Thats $26.00 per pound for cashews! I can buy fresh-roasted spiced cashews at the local gourmet nut shop for half that and see them roasted right in front of me!
I tried these nuts at the Food Network's Food and Wine Festival and become a fan. The unique flavor of the Indonesian spices are unforgettable. A must try item for those cashew lovers!

What a really great product! All the flavors from this company are delicious! (I'm lucky enough to have tried them all!) The cashews are amazing quality and the recipes reeeaally pack some flavor - these are anything BUT bland! Love the convenient vacuum seal packs...prevents you from having to open a whole jar - everything stays fresh. Much better than your normal snack mix!!

These cashews are so delicious! They are fresh, full of flavor, and packaged for easy to-go activities. Helping Indonesian farmers produce a quality product is an added benefit. They are a great snack to get you through a Pilates or yoga routine.
This is the best bargain for green tea and the jasmine adds a bit of sweetness to it. I drink it every morning.

As a connoisseur of fine green tea's, it's my option that is brand is the tops!  Hot or cold the balance of green tea and Jasmine is perfect!  And how can you argue with the price for this box..?  Great job Legends.  Bravo Amazon for carrying this!!!

I am so excited!  I haven't been able to find this double black soy sauce since (I worked in Boston) I shopped at the markets in Chinatown on the outskirts of downtown Boston.  The flavor of this soy sauce really makes my dishes, especially my pork lo mein, taste authentic (I guess I mean as it tasted in the restaurant).  Go easy though, the flavor is intense!  Thank you, Amazon, for carrying these wonderful imported treasures.
The soy sauce I received is wonderful.  It is full-bodied and worked well when making Hot and Sour Soup.  Thank you.

For those who does not like the bones in sardines, Kippers are good alternative.  This one in tomato sauce suits my palate.  The one in grocery stores are all smoked brand, so if you like it plain, this is it!

For some reason, they sent me the "mini" small swedish fish. Not the regular sized ones as I was led to believe. However it was still a 5 lb bag and the candy is good tasting so I've taken off 1 star for that order error
This is a delicious, light tea.  Try putting a few fresh mint sprigs in when the water comes to a boil but before drinking, also it tastes good with a little simple syrup.

I have had cats for over 50 years, and this is the best litter I've ever used.  I currently have three cats (including one 20-lb guy who can urinate till the cows come home) and find this litter absolutely wonderful in controlling odor. I have switched litter brands over the years every time something "better" comes along.  Now I just pray that this one will never go away.  I've been using it for about a year and am thankful I was convinced by some of the online reviews to give it a try.  Best decision I ever made where cats are concerned.

This is the best cat litter ever. It destroys odors better than any other cat litter I have used. When my
friends come over to my house, they always tell me that you can't tell that I even have cats. There is no cat litter box odors lingering in the air. One of my friends said that her sister has a cat and you could always get a strong scent of the cat litter box when you would walk into her house. My friend asked me what cat litter I used so she could share with her sister. I told her it was scoop away plus crystals and that it was the best stuff. She shared the information with her sister. Her sister started using scoop away and she was so pleased that she uses nothing but scoop away. I know my cats love it and so do I. It clumps well and it has a nice fresh clean scent. You won't be sorry if you switch over from you present litter to scoop away. It's the best.
I find this is the best litter for controlling odor.  Many of the stores have discontinued this product and since I feel it us the best available I order it online

Have been using this litter for 9 years. It is the best litter on the market. It used to be carried at Petco and Petsmart but no longer carried within the last year as they have their own proprietary blends of crystal litter. Very glad that Amazon is now carrying it with $0 shipping after $25 spend.  The crystals absorb all the odors.  I have tried other blends of Scoop Away including multicat and fresh scent as well as Arm & Hammer and this one is superior by far. I wouldn't use anything else!

I used Fresh Step and Scoop Away cat litters for many years and was quick to tell any of my cat owner friends that they were the best "bang for the buck" litters. They clumped hard, making the chore of cleaning the cat box a relatively easy one. Sometime around 6 months ago, that all changed. Now, they form a sludge in the cat box that is nearly impossible to scrape out. The amount of effort necessary to clean the box could easily induce a muscle strain or hernia for those unfortunate enough to purchase one of these litters. Both products are made by the Clorox Pet products Co. Consider yourself warned!

These salted Season kipper snacks are almost as good as the non-salted, but not as good. There's no saltiness that gets in the way of the herring flavor, but somehow the full herring flavor doesn't come through the way it does with the non-salted version. Of course, if you prefer salted herring, this would be the best for you, although the salt certainly does not dominate. For me, I hardly notice it. That may be good or bad for you. But ordering this by the case from Amazon costs less and is more convenient than buying it at the grocery store if you use a lot of it--and with all of the omega 3's in this, you should use it a lot. A painless way of getting a lot of omega 3's.

been eating seasons for years but the local supermarkets seem to only have 4 or 5 cans or none on the shelves...the delivery  here is prompt the supplier adequate...3 cans in a pan, butter old bay lemon juice and fry  'em up delicious breakfast...if only i didnt have to get spam mail from amazon asking me to buy things...this would be perfect

We tried to get kippers on subscribe-and-save, but reviewers on the products we looked at mentioned that the pull ring frequently broke off the can, making it impossible to open without a separate can opener. Not what we wanted!!

So we tried these -- which are a win!! My husband loves them. He says the taste is excellent, and the price is terrific, too, because there are 24 per case -- 6 more than other brands, he says. And he has had no problem whatever opening the cans, which was what motivated us to try these in the first place.

Motto: subscribe and save is fabulous, but sometimes something not on subscribe and save is even better! :) And many, many thanks to reviewers of the other products who alerted us to the problem opening those cans.
Very tasty, handy protein snack unfortunately the all ingredients are listed per Sunbutter : Sunflower Seed, Evaporated Cane Syrup, Salt, and Natural Mixed Tocopherols to preserve freshness.
Sunbutter tastes great and is a great way to get some much needed calories in to our preschooler's diet.  I'm so glad that they made these little portable packets!

We ordered the Sunbutter Sunflower Seed Spread On the Go Pouches because we were traveling with a 5 year old grandson who has allergies to peanuts.  He regularly eats Sunbutter and loves it.  The convenience of these travel pouches was terrific.  The amount in each pouch easily provided one sandwich, the size made packing easy and convenient.  They helped to make our 15 day European trip worry-free.  I highly recommend them.

The On the Go Pouch is just perfect! My food allergic children carry these in their backpacks in case plans change and they don't have access to safe foods.  We also keep a supply in their lockers and classrooms in the event of a school lock down, where each classroom is locked down no one can exit or enter the classroom (sometimes for hours).  They are perfect for school earthquake kits too for states that require a kit for each student.  I can't rave enough for the convenience, taste and ease of mind in case of emergencies!
Perfectly packaged. I take these to the gym to have as an after-workout pick me up. Protein and fat and just a little sugar. Marvelous.

The sunbutter travel packs are so convenient and yummy. Not messy. I take when traveling as I No longer eat peanuts.
I got the creamy in the packs. I prefer the crunchy in the jars.
Great for road trips and dealing with peanut allergies.  It's a great idea that I've been looking for when traveling for quite some time now.  Really great!

Because of finding this in GoPicnic meals from Amazon, we searched this item excited to have a case.  It's good but didn't expect it to expire in just a few months.  We have 3 cases now...  I know you can get better expiration dates than that so was disappointed and took off a star.  Otherwise it's a great alternative to peanut butter and from what we've heard so far...better for you.

My dog is 16 now and has always been a finicky eater, it has always been hard to find things she likes, but these are one of her favorites! They are also so healthy. She has also always had itchy skin in the late summer to fall, I found these treats last fall and this past summer her skin was so much better, hardly any itching. I would recommend them. Be sure to read the directions though, the amount you give your dog is recommended by their weight. They are also good for dogs if they tend to eat grass.

My wife and I share our home with the Three Muske-Terriers: A male Westie, a male Cesky and, the Empress-of-All-She-Surveys, a female Scotty. The Empress is alergic to wheat, (along with corn and soy), so I had my doubts concerning Pet Greens Roasted Chicken Recipe w/ Wheat Grass Dog Treats - wheat grass after all is just "juvenile" wheat. But apparently not to worry! We're half way through our first bag and no allergic reaction, (you haven't lived until you've seen a crazed Scotty in the middle of an allergic frenzy chewing on her tootsies). Now, putting aside her allergies, the Empress will eat almost anything - and so will the Cesky. But the Westie gives new meaning to the term "finicky" - and Asta gives these treats five barks - I mean, stars. So what's up here?

The treats are mostly roasted chicken meal, supplemented with dried chicory extract, organic ground wheat grass powder, lecithin, salt, cultured whey and garlic, preserved with "mixed tocopherols," (I'm not a chemist, but I think that's a fancy name for vitamin E, sourced from vegetable oil). The wheat grass doesn't contain any wheat glutten - which I think is the reason it doesn't trigger the Empress' allergies. Wheat grass is an excellent source of any and all of the nutrients contained in fresh vegetables.

The treats are small "jerky-like" rectangles - no more than an inch by 3/4s of an inch, and maybe 1/16 of an inch thick, (they may be more appropriate for small to medium size dogs - a large dog would want three or four at a time). They're great for a quick reward and at only about 4 calories a piece, there's not much danger that your dog is going to put on unwanted pounds, (however I wouldn't suggest that you carry them loose in your pocket or purse - they smell strongly of garlic - I keep 'em in a zip lock baggie).

As far as I can tell, the ingrediants are all natural, but only the wheat grass is organic - if you are interested in organic treats, I suggest that you check out those made by Wagatha or Robbie Dawg.

Bottom Line: I think that Pet Greens offers both a change of flavor and a change in texture from most common dog treats. The Three Muske-Terriers are scarfing 'em down - your furry buddy probably will too.

I was looking for a product that is not made in China, contains mostly meat and does without a long list of unhealthy ingredients. Having older rescued dogs with very few teeth, the treats also needed to be soft enough for them to chew. Pet Greens Treats fulfilled all of these requirements. The dogs aren't crazy about them, but will eat them. With all the dubious treats coming from China, this is a good choice.

It took my dogs a minute the very first time I gave them these. But after they sniffed it for the first time and ate it. They were hooked. Now if my dog even sees the bag he starts drooling. They just love them! I just wish they were a little more affordable...

This is a favorite of Boxer and Rottie.  It has a pleasant aroma and is soft.  On long walks it is great when I need a rest.  I intend to buy it again.  Mixed with dry Iams it adds a flavorable extra.
I purchased these for a friend who has a dog and he told me that his little doggie loved them!! Thank you!

Product was advertised as Porcini Powder.  The product that we received was labelled 'Dried Mushroom Powder.' It looked greyish rather than the richer cinnamon-brown color of porcini powders that I have purchased in the past from another company.  More importantly, tasted/smelled like "watered down" porcini, not 100% porcini.  Looks like a 'bait and switch' to me and we will definitely not order again.

This porcini powder tastes wonderful. It adds a deep richness and depth to tomato sauces and especially any type of Italian recipe. It's concentrated so don't use a ton at once. Has that distinctive mushroom smell when you open the top, but adds sooo much flavor to my cooking. Great in soups, too!
This mushroom powder is great with pasta, on popcorn, on pizza - anything, really. So glad I found it.Use Wine to Make Sense of the World

Very happy with this powder. I sue it when I want to add richness to soups, stocks, stews, whatever. A little bit adds a subtle amount of umami and richness (not necessarily identifiable by most as mushroom flavor), and if you use more the mushroom flavor is more pronounced. It doesn't take much to really enhance whatever you put it in.
What a great product to have for adding that extra mushroomy taste to many recipes.  Great in soups and sauces.  Also great in burgers and meatloafs.

This sauce has a great Mexican taste beyond its peppery fire, and the bold color, even though created by dyes, is just plain fun to look at. The splash of red on fresh veggies, lettuce, and other dishes is a treat for the eye as well as the palette. A little salty and acidic, its bright flavor goes great with finished Mexican dishes if you want to kick them up, as well as in soups, beans, chili, and added to salsa when you think it needs a little heat. This sauce is not incredibly hot as some are (the kind that work better as dares, really, or can only be taken in a very diluted form), but it's not for the babies either.

It's just right for most people, who like some spice, and putting it on the table lets you make milder dishes, and let the individual diners decide how spicy they want it; likewise, it helps you make those Mexican dishes spicier and tastier if you want to cook with the sauce. The price is great--just over a dollar per bottle, but the large quantity works better for restaurants than individual use.
I've tried MANY hot sauces, and NOTHING COMPARES TO THIS. Flavor, heat, color, this is my favorite hot sauce of all time. Try it, you'll agree!

Great flavor I just can't get enough.  One of the bottles broke in shipping though. Amazon can't seem to package heavy items properly those plastic bags justy don't cut it.  The sauce has a great flavor and adds the right amount of heat.  I like it hot.  If you are really insane they make a xxx verson also.  This one works for me though.

I have tried many recipes for gluten free bread. Most of these recipes claim to be the "best I have ever tasted," or "Can't tell from regular bread." Nonsense! Soggy, dry, crumbly, tasteless, or weird tasting is more like it. One recipe from Australia turned purple!. So, I didn't have high expectations for my latest recipe made with white bean flour. Surprise! The gluten free bread made with the white bean flour is my most successful bread so far. No one would mistake it for regular bread, but it is light, toasts well, and doesn't crumble. I will be ordering more white bean flour.

I have no complaint about the product itself, but when I ordered it it said there were 6 (24oz.) bags. When I received it there were only 4. Now I see that it has been changed on your site to say 4, but it DID say 6 when I ordered it!!

I'm always looking for a good source of fiber, Almond meal, coconut flour, any thing that gives me 3 g or more fiber, and this work horse is it, 6 big grams of it. I add it to pancake and or waffles, soups, breads, you just name it and it will fit right in.

Great food. My dog prefers this to Blue Buffalo, and I find the ingredients and quality to be comparable. I used to sell Blue Buffalo, so I know the value of good pet food. My decision to switch really comes down to my dog eating this more regularly.

My dog loooooves this  we live in uzbekistan so being here we are nervous about feeding him local dog food. even if the package says purina. so when i found this online i was happy it had other great reviews. he seems to have normal stool which is what we def wanted. his fur is super soft he does have dry skin but i think thats because we have to wash him with people shampoo ( cant ship that out here) cant wait to be stateside :-) enjoy the product its great

We love this food for our dog, his coat has a lot of improvement and his allergies are way better now that he switched to this food, we used to use large breed Science Diet and Nutro and they dont even compare to this food.  We even feed this to our little terrier dog as well as our Mastiff with the problems.  Definately recommend this food!

My daughter has a Saint Bernard named Julius Ceasar but we call him Ju Ju.  He is a gentle giant indeed.  Castor and Pollux Large Breed dog food is his favorite by far.  I save 15% through subscribe and save and have it delivered monthly for free.  Terrific!!

After switching my cats from Iams to Castor & Pollux, we decided that it was the dog's turn. Our big dogs (100lbs & 110lbs) had been eating Iams large breed for about 3 years. Even though Iams is considered a premium food, our concerns were:

(1) the second ingredient is corn meal and one of the proteins is chicken by-product meal (Chicken by-product meal consists of the ground, rendered, clean parts of the carcass of slaughtered chicken, such as necks, feet, undeveloped eggs and intestines, exclusive of feathers, except in such amounts as might occur unavoidable in good processing practice);
(2) Our dogs were putting on weight despite the fact that they are active, high energy dogs; and
(3) An olfactory-related concern - when resting, the dogs passed gas - a lot of gas!

The gas got us. Even though Castor & Pollux is a more expensive dog food, we decided that it was worth a try. Forty-five pounds of dog food later, I'm happy that we switched because the dogs love the food, their coats are healthy, they are active and seem to be slimming down, and, best of all, the gas issue is no longer an issue.

Since this information isn't listed on the Amazon product page, and since ingredients are a main consideration when purchasing pet food, Castor& Pollux Large Breed ingredients are (from the back of the bag):

Chicken, Chicken Meal, Brewers Rice, Ground Whole Grain Barley, Oat Groats, Turkey Meal, Chicken Fat Preserved with Mixed Tocopherols (form of Vitamin E), Dried Carrots, Dried Bananas, Dried Apples, Fish Meal, Dried Egg Product, Brewers Dried Yeast, Natural Chicken Flavor, Ground Flaxseed, Cultured Whey, Monocalcium Phosphate, Potassium Chloride, Salt, Chicken Cartilage, Dried Papayas, Dried Blueberries, Vitamin E Supplement, Zinc Sulfate, Ferrous Sulfate, L-Ascorbyl-2-Polyphosphate (source of Vitamin C), Zinc Oxide, Choline Chloride, Zinc Proteinate, Copper Proteinate, Manganese Proteinate, L-Carnitine, Niacin, Copper Sulfate, Vitamin A Supplement, Biotin, Calcium Pantothenate, Manganous Oxide, Thiamine Mononitrate (source of Vitamin B1), Vitamin K1 Supplement, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride (source of Vitamin B6), Riboflavin Supplement (source of Vitamin B2), Vitamin B12 Supplement, Sodium Selenite, Calcium Iodate, Vitamin D3 Supplement, Folic Acid, Cobalt Caronate, Yeast Culture (Saccharomyces Cerevisiae), Dried Enterococcus Faecium Fermentation Product, Dried Lactobacillus Acidophilus Fermentation Product, Dried Aspergillus Niger Fermentation Extract, Dried Trichoderma Longibrachiatum Fermentation Extract, Dried Bacillus Subtilis Fermentation Extract and Fermentation Solubles.
Each bag has a Best if Used by Date, and comes with an Unconditional Guarantee from the manufacturer.

Our final decision is to stick with this food. Our dogs love it & we love the results. Highly Recommended.

My Lab's 12 yrs old, and her coat had become dry, dull and she was shedding handfuls every day. This is all I feed her now as daily kibble, and she's silky, shiny, hardly sheds at all. She's also slimmer, perkier, more playful. Combined with Voltage (sold here on Amazon, good price too) to deal with stiffening failing hips, it's like she's years younger. [ASIN:B000K7J8GU Bio-Kinetics Voltage for Companion Animals, 1 Jar]] If her fur didn't have so much white hair, no one would believe she's over 7 or 8.

Once my delivery arrived w/the bag torn. Amazon replaced it, free. I love the service on Amazon![
Great dog food shipped to my door monthly. My boxer enjoyed the food from day one. Great amount of meat, fruit and veggies!

My 125 pound Rescue Cane Corso has been thriving on C&P for the three yearws that I've had him.  The vet -- on his "rgular" visits (no emergencies to date) -- often compiments me on his beautiful silky coat. . . . .The price is reasonable too -- although I wish it cost less. . . . .I LOVE the delivery service.  Purchased, of course, through Amazon.

We have a big black dumb Great Dane named Otis. Otis is six years old. We switched him from Eagle Pack Large Breed to Castor & Pollux due to the availability of Eagle Pack in our geographic location and price. After eight months on this feed, I have no negative feedback on the product. Otis's elephant-sized poos are firm and he loves the stuff (I suspect he'd eat just about anything though). His hair coat is shinny and energy level is sufficient.
*Otis approved review*
JB
My dogs love this food. My older shepard would have runny poop alot but since we switched to this food about a year ago it stays solid and she is happier.

Made in the USA, has fruit and vegetable pieces you can see. If you are subcribe n save, it will cost you less than buying it in the store. Additionally it comes to your front door so you don't have to lift it in the store, to your car, to your house, etc

This dog food's ingredient list definitely makes you feel better feeding it to your dog, but I do notice ours are really gassy after eating it.  Not sure why that is.  They have been eating it for months, so it isn't just the transition to new food.  Maybe all the veggies?  I also notice that they do not digest the carrot pieces at all.  But a natural food is way better than what they used to eat, so we are sticking with it for now.

Although I do love Castor and Pollux Organix marketed items for my dog. If you prefer your dog be on organic, this food is not. It's "natural". Natural Ultramix. Considering the level of ingredients, it's not near it. The Organix one equal to this has more Red on it. But it's up to the individual, their pets needs, and the level of income to what they can afford :)

It was a gift for my dad, he hasn't seen this extract in 30+ years.
He is enjoying it very much.
Thank you.

Excellent service for this very hard to find product.

Thank you so much.
What is it really?  I'm not going to purchase it unless there is clarification.  Plastic bottle?  Black Walnut extract is too precious to waste in a plastic container.
The picture on your ad is not a black walnut.  It is an english walnut.Though I have not tried your black walnut flavoring, showing an english walnut might be confusing for the consumer.
I bought this extract for my parents because they could no longer by it at their local grocery store.  They were so pleased that I was able to find it on Amazon. Thank you, Andrea G.

It doesn't taste like walnuts, plain and simple. It tastes like paper glue loaded with alcohol. And I got heartburns afterwards. Who knows what is in this. I really regret buying this, what a waste of money.

I had to put in a rating or it would not have taken my review...I have never used this product so it may be a good flavoring...I just wanted to clarify the picture.  It is not a picture of a black walnut....it is a picture of an English walnut...there is a big difference.......I was looking for a fine black walnut flavoring....

This product is packaged in plastic bottles.  I buy all of my spices, extracts, etc. in glass containers only. I would not have ordered this had I known it was shipped in plastic bottles. Because the price was low, we discarded the un-opened plastic bottles rather than try to return them.
The peas are way too salty to eat I talked to the owner she did't care about the condition of the peas.

These taste like a fruit roll up with bits of crunchy seeds in them. Overall really good, though a bit too sweet for me (I don't like fruit roll ups for the same reason). I gave one to a coworker and she loved them so much she went right online and ordered some. I didn't notice it curbing my hunger at all, but it'd be a good snack if you were craving something sweet.

I wasn't sure how these would be, I'm looking for something that my kids can grab in the morning if they are in a rush or just an after school snack. I ordered one in each flavor cut them in 4ths and the kids went nuts! They loved them! So I'm ordering cases of them now! Yes a little pricey, but I would rather spend extra money and know they are getting a healthy snack!

After trying one bar I went back and ordered an entire box!  These are very tasty just like the Fruit leather/strips you can get at Target or the Health Food store but with some crunch (aka Chia Seeds) but they taste amazing.
I agree with the other review.  I didn't know how this might taste but I was suprised how delicious it was - going to order lots more.

The shipping on these fruit chia bars was very fast but it wasn't free. The mailman left me a little envelope saying I owed him
85 cents! Also, I thought these were sugar free but the lable says there's 23 grams of sugar! Also, the flavor wasn't that great. I won't be buying these fruit chia bars again.

The chicken freeze dried medallions are great! My cat loves these and goes nuts whenever he hears the bag open.

The freeze dried medallions are only labelled for supplemental feeding, as they have not underwent feeding trials (per the customer service at Nature's Variety). I tend to use these as a treat, or mix with the raw or Instinct canned.

Serving is very simple. Add warm water to rehydrate, wait about a minute and done. You can also crumble to add over the top of other foods. Storage is simple as well as the pouch has a zipper closure at the top.

Customer service at Nature's Variety is also very helpful.

I think this tea has a lovely light taste to it.  It's a bit on the pricey side so I just have it a few times a week and drink a cheaper brand daily.  I was introduced to this brand during my visit to Jordan, Amman and was happy to find it on Amazon.

I really enjoy this tea. It's a simple Jasmine Green Tea, but the luxury bags and the quality that went into the presentation is really admirable. The price is pretty good for two tins of 20 quality tea and bags. So all in all this was worth the price.

I ordered the green tea and the cinnamon flavor one.  I savor the flavor everytime I have them.  I have them after lunch at work and then some nights when I need something soothing.  I would highly recommend the quality.  The packaging is impressive -- maybe overdone unless it contributes to its freshness.  Highly recommend it.

Most wonderful tea - aroma is out of this world. It is a medium bodied tea which brings in all the health benefits of pure Green tea and naturally imparts fragrance and distinctive flavor of the Jasmine flower. The triangular mesh bags allows large leaf teas to be used and to brew better. A great refreshing tea after a strong tasting or rich food.

Great gift idea for tea lover!

Dilmah Green Tea is a medium-bodied tea, with only a little bitterness. The Jasmine flavor is not very pronounced, but I like the combination. (Overall, it is a good tea for around 4.00 a can. I used the promotional discount)

When we first buy this, we want to make the soup, but actually we just eat as it after opening. it taste good even without cooking. we like the texture. now we use it for salads as well. So definitely a five starts.
These are great mushrooms and you can't find them in the stores.  A bit pricey though which is the reason for the four stars instead of five.

I love G2 and for a while I was buying it by the case. I stopped buying it just because of how much waste it creates. Then I saw that there were little packets available and I immediately bought a bunch. No change in taste or anything! Yay for G2!

The small size pouches are perfect for taking backpacking & pouring into the water packs when needed.
Also I travel a lot & prefer Gatorade over any of the airline drinks. These tiny packs are perfect for that.
I have happily given up on buying the gatorade bottles because I always have these packs handy!
My son-in-law recently was deployed overseas and these are the perfect size to slip into any care package we are sending. The individual packets are also easy for him to carry out in the field.

Dear Gatorade:

Biggest fan of the G2 powder pack! I have bought hundreds of these boxes in the last 18 months! Tastes great, less filling! Boxes stack neatly in the pantry! No more boxes??? G2 in my store now comes in a slippery plastic cylindrical tube (for more money). Doesn't stack in the pantry. Yeah, it's still Gatorade G2 powder, but it's a pain in the posterior. Packages teeter-totter on the shelf and fall all over the place. Why do companies like yours screw up a good thing? Did you feel you needed to make your product look all spacey-agey and better than the other box powders? Have you tried to put this on your own pantry shelf? I gave this 2 stars only because it used to be a perfect product. I've reluctantly moved on to Propel.

These are dry biscuits that my dog likes a lot. I expected them to be soft; but they are dry like dry dog food. They are easy to crunch for my dog. My dog is about a hundred pounds and these biscuits work good as training treats which are easy to handle and use. My dog likes them; so I'm glad that I bought them. I had used the soft varsions of Natural Balance training treats (chicken and beef ) about a year ago with good results; I had to cut those up into smaller sizes where as these biscuits are at a good size now for immediate use.

I bought this product because my daughter had a hard time with all the other formulas except Enfamil Gentlease.  I had to quit breastfeeding due to some medicine I was taking and did not want to pay $50.00 every two weeks for two cans of Enfamil formula.  I had used a formula by the same company with my first daughter (it is the same as the Babies R' Us brand) and knew that the quality was great and dependable.  Also, it had all the same ingredients as Enfamil Gentlease.  So to me it is a matter of do I want to pay around $25.00/ 24oz just so I can have something name brand or do I want to pay $16.00/ 24oz have all the same benefits of Enfamil Gentlease at a much cheaper price...Well, go figure I decided to save money!  I love this formula, it mixes well, she loves the taste, it is nutritionally complete, and with all the things you already have to buy for baby, why not save a little money when every little bit helps.

These pretzles are delicious! As a new member of the gluten free club I will say that I have been missing pretzles and these satisfy my pretzle craving. They are more on the crunchy side and have a faint taste of butter which I love. My kids who are not gluten free love them and I have to fight them off my pretzles. I like the 100 calorie size as I can grab and go when in a hurry.
The price of coffee has been rising, and I am addicted (or at least used to) this brand of coffee.  This pack will keep me in coffee for a while - and at a great price.

product was broken [???] could not be delivered,other item on order never arrived.called customer service and also told them
that my credit card # had been hacked and I knew it was from this company.no interest at all or concern at what I was telling them.
Would never order again from amazon.
I love the taste of the Republic of Tea teas and I love the fact that they are surgar free! A win win for me!

I have tried a few other "sleepy" teas. None worked. This tea is wonderful. You better be ready for bed because within a half hour you'll be heading there. The flavor is supreme. And the smell is heavenly and relaxing in it self. Highly recommend for those occasional sleepless nights. But wouldn't recommend if you had to drive somewhere. Gave it to my daughter who never sleeps and she even got good results.

Great Chamomile Lemon Tea.
Whole Foods charged too much for Republic of Tea, so Amazon to the rescue.
It is a "calming" tea, but if you have tasted other Chamolile tea and haven't liked it, this may be the answer. I love it.

These are the first snacks and finger foods I ever gave to my daughter. I was so scared of her choking on anything that I thought I would wait till she's 1 or longer... and then I came across HappyMelts Yogurt Melts and I totally felt in love with them. They melt in her mouth quickly and they are delicious. I've tried all 3 of them: Mixed Berry, Strawberry and Banana and I have to tell you they are all different.
Mixed Berry - purple, very flat oval shaped, very easy and quick melts, very sweet
Strawberry - pink, very hard acorn shaped (like little Hershey kisses), chunkier and melts not as quick, not as sweet
Banana- yellow, softer acorn shaped (like little Hershey kisses), chunky but they melt quickly
I thought there was something wrong with all strawberry ones, as they seem to be really hard, but I guess that's the way they are. Mixed Berry is my baby's favorite and I love them too :)
My 8 month old loves these yogurt melts.  They are super easy to dissolve and taste amazing.  The fact that they are organic and support Project Peanut Butter in Africa is a plus.

Son loves these, these actually taught him how to chew. We thought he didn't like them at first, but after a few tries he was not afraid of them anymore (these were his first non-pureed food) and now he crawls to the pak and begs for them and wants lots at a time. These are organic and so much better for kids than Gerber Graduates yogurt melts which contain food coloring and other additives.. We will be re-ordering these very soon!

I picked these up at the health food store- as the Dr. Sears reccommendation caught my eye. My eight month old son immensely enjoyed them, and I looked at the ingredients and was really surprised to find sugar listed second, right after the cultured milk. It is organic sugar yes, but still added sugar- and I'm bummed as this was not something that I wanted to introduce to his diet yet. My fault that I was swayed by advertising, and didn't read the back.
I actually eat these myself due to a very, very restrictive diet. They are very tasty, and I really like this brand over Gerber's.

I have 2 boys, 5 and 8 and they love Happy Melts! They have been on a kick with Banana Mango but love all the flavors. My 5 year old was asked to bring the snack to school last week and we brought these to share. All 13 of the kids in the class loved them and asked for seconds. My 8 year old is an extremely picky eater and he loves these as well.
My favorite thing about them is that they contain probiotics (helps maintain a healthy balance of good bacteria in the intestines and boost your immune system) and prebiotics (which keeps the good bacteria healthy). I have checked other brands and Happy Melts is the only product to have both of these. I also love that it comes in BPA packaging and does not contain anything artificial. I wish I could give this product 10 stars!!!

These are so much better than Gerber...all organic, real fruit inside and much less sugar! I bought them for my 2 year old but my 7 and 5 year olds like them just as much! I pack them for their snacks at school! I give my 2 year old the bag when we're in the car or at the store.
Great too for a little one under one because they disolve easily in the mouth.
If my kids ask for dessert after a meal, I often reach for these so we get the best of both worlds- they taste like candy for the kids but they are filled with healthy fruit and nothing bad for you!

I wouldn't suggest feeding your little one a million of these a day, as they are high in sugar, but they sure are delicious!  He loves them (and so do I)!  They melt almost immediately, so they are a great first finger food.

I would definitely recommend these. They taste a lot better than Gerber yogurt melts, and they are better for you. Even my husband likes them and will snack on them, which is saying something because usually anytime I have him taste our daughter's snacks, he makes a horrible face and asks how in the world she can eat it. Not the case with these. And my daughter (now 17 months) likes them, too!

I've been feeding these to my 10 month old as "dessert" for the past month or so, and he loves them.  I like them too, and have been known to pop one in my mouth when I'm putting them on his tray.  We were out the other day, and our local grocery store doesn't carry happy bellies, so I picked up a bag of Gerber melts.  How different could they really be?  As it turns out, very.  Baby ate the Gerber ones okay...but I tried one and almost spit it out.  It tasted like cardboard. These ones actually taste like strawberry yogurt.  You can't go wrong!

My daughter loves these yogurt melts.  Banana and Mango are two of her favorite flavors.  The melts themselves are a smaller size than the Gerber melts, which is nice for younger babies.  I was always breaking the Gerber melts into 3 or 4 pieces, which got a little messy.  I don't have to do that with these melts.  These are tasty AND organic.  We've had a lot of success with all of the Happy Baby products we've tried.  Highly recommend.

My daughter has loved these since she started with finger foods at about 8.5 months. They are great for 'on the go' and keep her occupied (as well as a nourished snack!). She is breastfed but had yogurt already so I knew she didn't have a milk allergy. Less sugar then Gerber!

My son started eating these at 12 months. He's now 18 months and still loves them!! They're healthy and I feel good about giving them to him. I would say this is his favorite snack - always cheers him up!
Shared this flavor with my moms group kiddos and they were a big hit. I have put in a request that our local Publix start to carry this flavor because they don't carry it and no one had seen it yet.

These are the first finger snacks I gave my 8-month old, whom was already on solids at 5 months though. I found them originally at my local Target. He absolutely loves them.  They melt in your mouth.  I've had nieces and nephews that love to snack on these too whenever they come to our house.  They range from 3 to 8 years old.  I like how it's just organic yogurt, and how they're perfect for little fingers.  I only wished that they'd sell these in a variety pack for all the flavors.  The banana mango is my son's favorite.

Our toddler LOVES his HappyMelts!

These little yogurt bites are healthy, yummy, and organic. Perfectly sized for toddlers who are learning to become independent eaters. The Happy brand has less sugar and none of the harmful artificial colors/flavors that other brands contain. I feel good offering these to my toddler, and he always finishes his pile.

All flavors are hits in our home.

My 10 month old baby loves these. She can pick them up and eat them. I tasted one myself and they dissolve in your mouth and they are not too sweet, just enough sweetness. I love that they are organic and don't have anything artificial.
We used to get the gerber ones, but for almost the same price these are a bit smaller for him to handle and he seems to like them much better.

My 11 month old loves these melts - she's been eating them since she was about 7 months old.  The only problem - not really a problem just an observation - is that once her fingers get wet the melts tend to stick to them and she has some difficulty getting them from her fingers to her mouth - she generally ends up with several stuck to her head and behind her ears (not unlike the rest of her food I suppose).  She also likes the berry flavors - I think they're pretty tasty too but all the other adults who've taste-tested found them foul.  Oh well.

Would you believe that my daughter doesn't like yogurt?! Odd b/c I thought every child loved yogurt... these are the answer for my yogurt-avoiding-14-month-old! She thinks these are candy and pops them in her mouth one after the other. I have to admit that sometimes I enjoy a few myself! Price is good at a couple of bucks per bag. I mix these with her cheerios and it makes a delicious snack. I too tried the Gerber brand b/c they were on sale at our local supermarket but they were not such a hit. Strange b/c to me, they taste about the same... go figure!

We have always bought the Gerber Yogurt Melts and my kids were not too much into them. A friend gave me a bag of the Happy Baby Banana Mango yogurt melts.... WOW! The kids (2&4) ate the whole bag- they practically fought over the bag. I thought they had so much more flavor than the Gerber brand. Very happy with the Happy Baby products. Looking forward to trying the other flavors too!

The Banana Mango flavor is not our daughters favorite so will not order again but I love the melts in general and we all enjoy them so rec. to any baby/toddler.  Great alternative to the other popular sugary brand.

My toddler son loves these melts. They are a great way to get your child extra calcium if they aren't fond of drinking milk. They are a wonderful on the go snack for the times when feeding your child real yogurt is just way too messy.

These are such a  wonderful alternative to the non-organic, sugar filled ones you find in your basic stores.  The melts are very tasty (I have tried them) but are not all the same size so for new solid food eaters you may need to watch which sizes they are given.  Have not tried the other flavors yet but plan to get them.  Wish they would sell a varity pack instead of having to buy 8 of one flavor.

My baby loves these treats (as does the rest of the family). The fact that they are organic and are sweetened with natural cane juice rather than added sugar like the name brand grocery store type makes them even better. Even though you have to buy 8 at a time we just found someone to share the order with.
Have also tried the mixed berry flavor with equal favor.
Highly recommend!!

Pro:
1. Organic
2. Price in the pack is cheaper than the health food stores
3. Tasty

Cons:
1. Easy to eat too many, so need to watch the sugar level but good.
2. Sizes are sometimes quite uneven, but not a big deal and pretty expected.
3. Not a lot for the price, but this is the same buying elsewhere.

Overall the cons aren't really cons, just wanted to make sure parents that haven't tried these were aware. Buy these regularly, so not really negatives.

I purchased this organic yogurt snack for my daughter.she said the snack melt in her mouth quickly ,the different flavor tastes different, she likes the mixed berry most.
The only concern is the sugar content is still a bit high ,so I try to limit the amount I give her when on the go ,at the playground ,recommend other moms to try.

I am a first time mom, and our child had A LOT Of difficulties with solid foods and had an overactive gag reflex. This food (and we do buy these in the set of 8)was and continues to be a lifesaver. When nothing else would do, our baby LOVED these. I will say that they are on the expensive side compared to what you can get in the grocery stores and "big-baby-chain" stores. We compared these to the GERBER yougurt melts and I believe there to be a noticible difference in quality/ taste, with these coming out on top. In the begining when she was just starting solids she would eat bunches of these on her own. They melt very quickly and for us, there was never a concern for choking (or puking with the overactive gag reflex). Our baby is older now and can eat a lot more table foods, but we still mix these in with other puffs, cherrios, and small cereals for her to eat as a mix.

I have purchased three orders of these from amazon (and enjoy amazon prime shipping)- so will likely purchase again, would recommend to a friend, and would buy (in smaller portions) as a gift for other moms to try out.
My son has been snacking on these since 9 months old and he absolutely loves them! I even think they are tasty. Would recommend them as a great starter food/snack.
My daughter is 16months old, I bought it for her, she like it very much! But I don't wanna give her much one day and let her know to share with her parents and friends!
These yogurt snacks are staple in my one-year old's diet. She eats them every day and for snacks out on the town. No complaints at all.

i first gave these to my older daughter when she was a yr old, and started giving them to younger daughter around 8mos.  now they're 3 and 1, and they both love these yogurt melts.  but i only let them share half a bag as a special treat sometimes when we're out and about, else they'll each eat a whole bag!

I purchased this snack fo my baby, but after i tasted I thought it's good for all family members!!! so yumm~~ first it is kinda crunch and melts right away inside of your mouth~~ .you can fully taste yogurt flavor!!
However, do not forget to seal it tight ! specially rainy day!!! it is very easy to get soggy!

I got these as an easy on-the-go snack. My toddler loves them and will eat them non-stop if I let him! I even sneak a few of them myself as they are incredibly tasty.
They are a little too pricey for me to eat myself though. Wish more baby yogurt products were as low in sugar as these! My son refuses more than a bite or two of regular yogurt but loves these. I don't think he has much of a sweet tooth and prefers the mild tart flavor of these.

My ONLY complaint is the price. SIGH

My daughter loves these yogurt melts.  She's been eating them since she was nine months old and is now 18 months old and still enjoys them as a snack.  For me, the sugar content is still a bit high so I try to limit the amount I give her.  These are great, no mess snacks when on the go, at the playground or at the beach.  I have to put a small amount in a separate container in my diaper bag because my daughter recognizes the packaging and would really like to eat the whole bag.

I was so glad to see the 8-pack and the great price for these baby treats.  Our baby loves them, but in stores, it is hard to pay the retail price for just one bag.  Now we have a pantry full and I don't feel so badly about using them up after getting such a great deal.

I first tried these with my twins when they were starting on solid food.  I figured they liked yogurt, so they'd probably like these.  And they did, but only for the first couple of bags.  Fast forward a few months when they spotted an unopened bag and pointed... now they love them!  Afternoon snack often features "yoga melts" along with a happy dance.

We have been buying these melts for about 7-8 months now for our daughter. They do tend to go fast, and since they are pricey we buy them sparingly and give them to her as a special treat. No funky ingredients in these that you cannot pronounce. I love how you know exactly what you are giving your child with these (and bonus, NO artificial colors/dyes!). I definitely recommend them as an addition to your diaper bag essentials. They keep my daughter busy when she is getting antsy while out running errands. Overall a great snack to have on hand for your little one(s)!
