I got the savory chicken flavor for our dog, and he totally loves it. He'll perform any trick just to get some licks. It's easy to use and there's no mess. Great idea for a product! I plan to buy more!

I have 2 large dogs who I allow to lick this every day. They seem to like it.  It must smell and taste good to them.  I like giving this to them as a treat for doing something good instead of something with a higher calorie content.

I tried this product on a new dog I had in training, because I liked the idea of a liquid for increased reward value. It has turned out to be a great reward for many dogs I work with as well as a great reward in numerous situations. In many performance sports you need to be very careful when rewarding your dog on a practice field that there are no crumbs left behind. This product is PERFECT!! I also don't need to worry about my pockets getting eaten out of my pants after training.

My advice is to watch the price you pay here!!!! I buy mine locally at less than 1/2 the price you see advertised here. Even Petsafe will sell it to you for $8.99 not $13!!!

Otherwise certainly a 5 star product!!!!!

We have two little dogs and they have shared the licks. I can't speak to the taste, but I feel like I'm giving them puppy crack because they became very upset when I put the stick up.

As a human, I'm a little less enthused about the whole thing. First, it's more like a bottle of shoe shine than a bottle of deodorant. So, as you turn it upside down, you have to squeeze the bottle a smidge to bring the liquid to the ball. Squeeze too hard, and your dog will get a face full of Lickety Stik juice. The dog doesn't mind, though.

Both dogs started to try to chew the bottle. They sort of got the hang of it, but I'm not sure that I'm giving them a life lesson here or anything. It's certainly not worth the patience, for instance, used in showing a toddler how to drink from a straw.

Still, as a novelty, I'm cool with this. I really do think the dogs will get militant when the bottle runs out, though. For all I know, it's just sugar water, but whatever it is, they really like it.

The five stars are from Panda the Puppy.  This thing smells horrible, and looks disgusting, but the puppy loves it. He loves it so much that I can tolerate the horrible smell for him.  Panda loves treats, like most puppies, but this treat in particular gets his attention. It is working as a great training aid too.  He sits, he licks.  It is a treat that he is motivated to work for, and it makes training easier. We do have other treats that work, but this one has the benefit of a fast grab. I don't have to dig in a bag or really search for it.

This is like a deodorant bottle with gravy in it.  My dogs took to it right away and did every trick as if I had a chunk of steak in my hands.  I figure it's a lot cheaper than conventional treats and not as messy as wet ones.  You do have to squeeze the fluid out sometimes so if they aren't ready for it, it drips.  If you aren't over a rug or other cloth surface it's not a problem, because they'll lick it off the floor.  I do have to keep it out of reach when I'm not using it because I'm afraid they'd jump up when I'm not looking and run off with it for me to discover it all chewed up with a stained carpet under it!

My dog was pretty confused when I put this in his face. Whenever I do he'll lick it once or twice then step back and look at me like, "Can I have a real treat now?" At least he doesn't hate it, but he sure doesn't get excited about this whenever I pull it out.

But don't go off my review alone, other dogs seem to like it. Just not my poodle.

OK, so my dog loves this and she is a picky eater.  I literally had to force her mouth open and give a roll of it on her tongue and she has been hooked ever since.  I usually only give her high quality treats and chews but I figure a few licks of this roll on won't her her.  I don't think I will buy it because it really is not a healthy treat for her but since she likes it and it does not make a mess I gave it 4 stars.  If it was better nutritionally I would have given it 5 stars.  This is definitely a great concept!  I just wish is contained better ingredients.  : )

This is the most unique dog treat I've seen. The liquid treat is dispensed from a container that reminds me of a large lip gloss tube with a roller. I've given this unique dog treat "4 stars" instead of five as an average based on the varied reactions from my two small dogs. The smaller Malti-poo loved the treat and from his reaction would give it "5 stars". He immediately licked the roller, received the treat, and wanted more. Our Cavalier King Charles Spaniel is a pickier eater in general and wouldn't even try it at first. He finally did, but didn't seem to like it. We have the chicken flavor and it may be he just didn't like the flavor.

Since our Malti-poo likes it so much, I have just ordered the three-pack that has chicken, liver, and bacon flavors. The three-pack is a better value than the individual packs and I'm hoping our Cavalier will like one of the other flavors better than the chicken. This is a unique idea to reward dogs with a treat without filling them up like traditional dog treats.

** Update: I ordered the three-pack and my Cavalier definitely likes the bacon flavor much better than chicken!

I came across this PetSafe Lickety Stik and decided to give it a try. We just got an 8 week old Bassett Hound puppy and decided to try out this Lickety Stik as a training reward due to its low calorie content. Bassets are know to get fat quick so a low calorie reward is needed as Bassetts basically only respond to food.

Basically, this thing has the same construction as a stick of roll-on deodorant. You turn it upside down, the liquid inside saturates the ball in a second or so and your dog takes a lick or two of the ball. It works fantastically for training a puppy or dog. We got the bacon flavor and she absolutely loves it.

The puppy loves it and will do anything to get a lick of this thing. It smells terrible to us(a really disguisting rancid bacon odor)but she absolutely adores it. The price of $8 may seem a little high, but we've have been using the same Stik for over a month now, numerous times each day and we still have a third of it left. We will definitely be buying more of these.

Lickety Stik is a fantastic product that is great for training or just a treat. Highly recommended!

Imagine doggie treat flavored underarm deodorant.... have to squeeze just a bit to get the roller wet, then turn upside down and let the dog lick it. Unique idea. Would probably be useful as a training tool. Our dog definitely likes it. I imagine this works best as a daily treat. I shudder to think what would happen if you let the roller dry out, dog ends up with a tounge rash trying to push the roller past the dried out spot... or worse, squeeze to hard and drip doggie treat juice all over!! I'm just saying... :)

All in all, worth a try for the dog that has everything or just needs a change of taste...

All the best,

Jay

I have two dogs, one Black Labrador and one Chihuahua.  The Lab can't get enough of this stinky treat and even tries to grab it from me with her teeth.  She will lick on it all day if I let her. The Chihuahua sniffs it and snubs it. She couldn't be less interested. So, one out of two dogs loves this stinky treat.  Humans, on the otherhand, hate the strong smell.  I think it's fun and can imagine it is a great treat substitute for obese dogs who need to watch their calorie intake. If you aren't adverse to strong odors you'll love the handiness of this Lickety Stik!

I am only reviewing the Bacon flavor, but my dogs picked up on how this works pretty quickly and love the taste of it.  At first they wanted to bite the bottle and chew it like a treat but I worked with them for about a minute or so and they got down that you only lick it.  I have 3 dogs and all three of them liked the taste of it.  I like it because it seems like a more personal treat than just a dog biscuit.  I recommend this!

I am of the curious sort when it comes to dog treats and new ways to reward dogs so I jumped at getting this product.

Lickety Stick arrived and three dogs were eagerly sitting in front of me; a cocker spaniel, a norwegian elkhound, and an australian shepherd.

I unwrapped the stick and squeezed a little juice out of the tube onto the roller. I presented it to all three dogs. The cocker spaniel and the aussie eagerly licked away. The aussie licked away so much the cocker needed a wet cloth over the top of her head due to dropping juice on her head. The elkhound however, wanted no part in it.

After a couple days of using it and trying it out I am left with the premise that it's an interesting take on a a dog reward - but in the end, the execution and possibility of making a mess leave this treat stuck in the treat drawer. I don't see myself buying these in the future.

I guess I didn't really read the description of this product very well, but this was not what I expected! It is like a little roller ball of deodorant only it is filled with liquid log treats. (this one is bacon) It was easy to open, but I did have to squeeze the bottle a little and then roll the ball around to get the initial liquid to come out. Once my dog realized what she was supposed to do, she was ALL OVER IT. In fact, she got so excited that she made her self sick. I'm saving this one for an "every now and then" treat.

What a great idea for a treat. Lickety Stik is constructed like a roll-on deodorant with a flavored dog treat inside. Hold the Stik upside down and my dog licked away at it. It is low calorie (great for my dog who is on a diet). It is also very easy to carry. I keep it in my pocket.Since it has a cap and has plastic construction, it doesnt get crushed in my pocket. It makes a great little reward during training sessions.

I find it especially helpful to reward my dog when Im teaching him a new trick. With the lickey stik he was very eager to see the stik come out.

A few notes on the Lickety Stik's use. The first time you use the Lickety stik, you may have to move the roller-ball with your fingers to get the treat to flow a little. Once the dog understands that licking the ball makes the treat flow, it is not an issue. Also when he is done licking, there is no dripping.

The Lickety Stik also has a clear window at the base of of the bottle so you know when it is time to reorder.

The Lickety Stik is not large which makes it easy to trasport. However it does mean that if it is your primary treat for you dog, you may run out quickly.

Overall, I can say that the dog was enthusiastic about the stick. It was easy to use. It was fun to give. I am happy with this product.

When I picked up the padded envelope from our mail basket, my cocker spaniel snapped to attention. By the time I had the bottle out of the envelope, the Rottweiler had joined us. Their anxiety grew as I struggled to break the plastic wrap around the top. Finally I had the bottle ready for action, after a very long 30 seconds.
I had to rub the roller ball to get the liquid inside to lubricate the ball. Squeezing the bottle forces the liquid to ooze around the ball. Both dogs wanted to eat the bottle rather than lick the ball. They give it a five-star review and suggest that the Vine program send more to our house.

The rottie still wants to eat the bottle. The cocker has learned the licking technique. The cocker is quite responsive to the sound of the bottle being shaken. (Cockers are the original foodies.)

The major problem I have is that the ball does not move freely. I get some liquid on the ball and hold it out for the cocker. She licks it very clean. Then I have to squeeze more liquid out and roll the ball around with my thumb.

The ingredients seem to be healthy, or as healthy as something with bacon fat in it can be.

This product can be a great training reward, but you will have a sticky thumb. The first time I offered my thumb to be licked clean, the cocker started to eat it. If you are training your dog, you probably will want a rag to keep your thumb clean.

My vine review philosophy is to first test the product without regard to price. Now that I have checked the price, currently around $8, it seems a good value for a training tool. $8 does not buy a decent size bag of training treats. And the dogs are much more responsive to the bacon than to freeze-dried lumps. However as just a treat for being a good dog in general, it is not as satisfying as a regular-sized biscuit. Pity my poor dogs who are only getting this one bottle of bacon treat.

First off, i would have to say that I did not find the Bacon flavor to be appealing at all.

OK I'm kidding. I didn't actually lick it.

But my dog did, and she loves it.

The basics:
The container is like a roll-on antiperspirant. If you use roll-on deodorant, and buy this product, you may accidentally sport a new aroma if you are particularly groggy in the morning.
Its a no-calorie treat if your dog is ... uh... "easy to see" as they say. My dog is a bit thick (like a barrel on stilts), so I had some high hopes for this product.

The pros:
My dog loves it.
Its low calorie.
No crumbs!

The cons:
You can't throw it in the laundry room as an easy way to get them to be put up.
I had to hold it upside down, and it would drip.
When my dog is aggressive she threatens to take it away from me.

Overall, I would say that this is one of the few products that delivers exactly what it promises. I recommend it.

For those that follow my reviews you know I have many dogs so I just had to try out this product.  It was so funny the day I received it. I was surrounded with furry friends. Incase you don't know dogs can smell just about anything and they knew something was in my hands that they were going to like.  The container reminds me of roll-on deodorant.  I know that sounds gross but nevertheless it did. It is made where the dogs lick the top of it to receive their treat.  Okay, now all I had to do was let the dogs lick it and believe me they were ready.  They piled around me and all took their turns, it was so cute.  Now, did they come back for more?  You bet they did, each seeing who could get their tongue on it first.  I could tell to them it was a tasty treat and for me it was a time to interact with my animals and show them love. You can't just let them play piggly wiggly and lick it all in one day, because they would, believe me. You have to allow only so many licks.  I liked this product and so did my dogs and plan to purchase it for them. Dog biscuits are of course a lot easier, you just throw them and they catch, but this is a special treat that allows you time with your animal. Nice product.

The Lickety Stik is fabulous! My dog immediately took to it and gets so excited when he sees the bottle. I have been trying to train him to fetch a ball and then give it back to me, but I have had to wrestle the ball away from him. I was worried about giving him too many treats because of calories, not to mention the expense. I started letting him lick the Stik once or twice each time I got the ball away from him. It didn't take long before he would drop the ball when he saw the Stik, and now he puts it directly into my hand, just so he can lick the Stik. I plan on using it to train him to do other things, as well.

Considering how many times I have used it, it is a good value for the money. It's kind of awkward to give him as a regular dog treat, so I save it for training and give him dog biscuits or other treat.

First of all, let me say that my dog likes the taste of this treat - a lot. However, I have a large dog...and evidently an impatient dog. Rather than lick this "roll-on" treat, she would rather just bite it and chew it. That's really the only down side. Found out my daughters kitten liked it too. It's weird, like a 1980's deodorant company trying to do something profitable with their out of date product line. I wouldn't buy it, but my pets liked it.

I was excited to get the Lickety Stik for my dogs. It sounds like a good idea BUT the roller part DOES NOT roll and in order for the dog to get something to taste you must squeeze the container which can be a mess. I have four dogs, as I dog train in obedience and in tracking. In the beginning all four were interested, but then they all became frustrated with it. I ended up with $25.00 of this garbage. SAVE YOR MONEY.it's not worth it!

I have three beagles and a lab. To be honest, when I read about this product, I was dubious as to its ability to make them happy. A lick? That's it?
Well--I was right, and wrong.
When I first broke it out, the lab tried to eat it--he wasn't happy with the one lick. The beagles saw him try to eat it, and then they were all about eating it, too. But once they realized what it was all about, they LOVED it. They were like crack addicts. I put it on the dining room table, out of reach, and we kept catching them walking on their hind legs, noses over the table ledge, trying to get it. They got so sneaky! Climbing onto the chair? Really? When it was time for bed, when they usually get a cookie, they all ran to the table and gave me the distinct message--"WE want THAT!"
Last night I put the Lickety Stik on a tall shelf in the hallway of the house--and this morning, they "knew" exactly where it was, and wouldn't leave the hallway until I grabbed the thing and walked them outside.
So, we're calling it either crack for dogs or catnip for dogs haha..

It's sort of like a roll-on deodorant style container. The beef-gravy-like substance covers the ball and they simply lick it off. Of course, as I said above, they will try to eat it at first, until they get the idea. Although I'm convinced that should it get left within reach, they will eat the entire container.)

It's a small container--about 5 inches long. The picture made me think it would be much larger.

My two dogs apparently loved the scent and taste based on the way they were all over the Stik as soon as I uncapped it. The problem was the roller ball. It didn't roll very well. This became the pattern -- place thumb on ball, roll, let dogs lick off residue, place thumb on ball, roll again ... It became tedious very quickly. My main dog grew impatient and latched onto the bottle with his back teeth, easily piercing the neck allowing the flavored goo to ooze out. I tossed the Lickety Stik lickety split.

This product is a bit odd, to say the least. It is designed in a roll-on deodorant type of bottle and your dog must lick the rolling ball to enjoy his treat.

When first trying to get my dog to try it, he really looked at me, looked at the bottle, looked at me, looked at the bottle etc. You could literally see in his eyes that he was wondering what the heck he was supposed to do, or what I wanted him to do. Finally he took a swipe at it with his tongue. I assume he was unimpressed because he made no effort to go for another lick, despite my encouragement.

The whole idea is just weird. I give my dog treats as well..treats, or to reward good behavior, or just to be nice, or to get him to lay/settle down for a little - in other words to keep him busy for a few minutes or so. This type of treat obviously goes against the idea of keeping him occupied for awhile while keeping my time free since you have to sit/stand there and hold the bottle for him. Now, don't get me wrong, we always have a variety of snacks on hand and I would not mind standing there holding this bottle for him if he actually liked the treat. It's just one of those little extra things we do to show our love. However, he just seemed to not like the taste once he did figure out to lick it, otherwise I assume he would have continued to lick.

The texture of the liquid inside just looks gross to me. It is a clearish, somewhat dark brown color. Kind of like pancake syrup although not as sticky/tacky.

If your dog will lick the roller ball and likes the taste, then I guess it is a good buy, but if not it is obviously a waste.

I also cannot help but wonder who sat around and thought "Hmmmm, let's create a liquid dog treat and put it in a roll-on deodorant dispenser!!"
My dogs would not lick it or even pay attention to it. I thought it would be great for training as I am a consumate treat "dropper", but they were not the least interested. Too bad

First and foremost make sure you DO NOT let this tea steep too long. If you let it steep for the recommended two minutes, you shouldn't have to run to the bathroom like your pants are on fire! If you let it steep for the 2 minutes, it's a decent trip to the bathroom...not explosive diarrhea.

With the way we eat (mostly women) we need to clean out our plumbing every once in a while and this is a fabulous way to do it. It's not recommended for everyday use!
This product is great it really works. I have lost a total of 15 pounds in two months wihout exercising. I reconmend this product to everyone.

I did not buy this tea through amazon.. But from my grandmothers cabinet(haha). I have been dieting for the past 3 months now, and i was completely oblivious to special teas for cleansing although i know of drinks/pills that cleanse, I wanted to steer clear of any type of pill and again oblivious to benefits of cleansing(even when not dieting). Now I tried this tea two months ago & only because of the words "Super Dieters" I thought ohh special tea so i drank it(in the evening) it did for me do its job and loosen things up which i found odd at first then i read the package, and then I got it. So for me it did help being that I usually dont um go as much as I should and this has helped that. Not only that but since I have been using it along with my eatting habits, and exercise my diet has been showing better results nothing drastic but still better results and that is always great! This tea (Cinnamon Spice) I think tastes devine, I do add not even a teaspoon of sugar but I think this tea doesn't even need sugar at all(i just like it sweeter). But all in all I do and have recommended this tea to a few family members and friends(who do and dont diet) because i love the taste and the results I'm having with it.
I love this product, it helps keep things moving!  I use it twice a day afternoon and evening while dieting.  A great product for helping maintain your weight.
This product works very well. It taste great. Its a nice touch to the end of a day. PLEASE USE AS DIRECTED! PLEASE!!!!!
Works great for me and also help me with my weight.  I don't like the drink as much but I drink it as needed.
I have used this product in the past and was highly satisfied. It works very well. I would just caution first time users not to make the tea too strong or your results may be "too good".
I like this product, but I wouldn't use it daily. I learned this the hard way. It is stronger then you think!!!!!

This tea product got me running alright, to the crapper. But it did help loose about 10 lbs, mostly compacted fecal matter. I also feel more energized and feeling alot better. Before taking this product my best friend was a couple of cups of black coffee but since taking this for the last month my craving for coffee and sweets has subsided, however i now have to bulk up on toilet paper. Great product great buy!

I love this tea the taste is really good and it smells good as well my husband and I are year around tea drinkers and also we dont even have to add any sugar ( well I use honey on some teas) but this one you don't need anything extra and I will say it really does work drink plenty of water threw out the day .... And usually in the am you will be cleaning  it out lol ... I didn't have any stomach pains or anything but I eat well also!! I recommend this to any and everyone!!

I never drink this tea alone. I always steep it with another tea, such as Oolong or Jasmine because the taste isn't the best. I use honey and sugar to sweeten and down the hatch it goes! Expect some, um, gastrointestinal responses the next day. Sometimes I feel a bit of cramping and sometimes I don't. Sometimes it will take most of the next day for it to 'work'...and sometimes it won't!!

I have been using this tea for a few years now, and I drink the full 2 cups every night before I go to bed.  It begins to take effect the next morning.  I gave a bag to a friend to try & she loved it as well, she now orders it online.

This tea works on my fiance's digestive track as she has an issue with colitis and this product along with essential enzymes helps her to absorb and digest foods that otherwise would give her pains while in her digestive track, Thank you for making this product we plan to continue using it as long as we can.

I have been using Laci Le Beau Super Dieters Tea for years.  There is no subsitute.  Many women in my family use it as well.  This keeps me moving better than anything else and I suffer from Chronic Constipation.  I would recommend this to anyone who could use a gentle, natural laxitive.  I've never felt like I've taking a harsh stimulant, it just makes you feel & go like normal :)  I hate poop talk but this is worth sharing!  LOL
One must know that this dieter's tea helps mostly by moving your bowels along.  Be careful at first, or it will be unpleasant!

I don't use this tea for dieting but more so for a natural cleanse to keep the body free of harmful toxins.  It is very effective have used it for years!  First time users may experiece cramping but, after awhile they cease.  Great Effective Product!

the one i got says "cleanse" on the box, I don't know what it means, but I know that I picked the one that doesn't say "cleanse" on the box. i'm all the more angry because that one costs way cheaper. and all the more am i angry because i'm not going to bother to go through the refund process. plus it took it ages to arrive
A lot of tea for the price... ...no sweetener needed... The product works better than I expected it to. I also didn't realize how much I was ordering. I am enjoying this product. Has very good taste.

This tea has a superb taste.  I actually look forward to drinking this tea with my dinner.  Now that it is summer I drink is as an iced tea, but this is also a very delicious hot drink too!  I use splenda and fresh mint when I brew it.  Fabulous!
Reality strikes.  I have been drinking this tea every night for 10 years !  It is the best thing to keep me on the straight n narrow!

though i did not purchase this through amazon, i did get this recently from thw grocery store, and have to admit im really disappointed. i followed the instructions the first evening EXACTLY as instructed with the included paper, and no results. the second day, i brewed just a little longer, still no luck, (basing this off some other comments from other users here on amazon) then today i only did 6oz, not 12 as the paper instructs, and even brewed this for 6 minutes. still nothing.

i really wanted this to work for me like it has for others, i had heard good things and was so excited, but still no luck. i guess im one of those people this doesnt affect. ill keep trying it daily till i run out, but looks like ill have to try something else.

as for taste, its not bad. just tastes like tea leaves, not deliciously fantastic, but not nose-pinchingly undrinkable. good luck to anyone else. hope you have more success with this than i did

I have no idea what all these reviews for this brand of dieters tea are talking about. I followed the directions nothing happened. Brewed a stronger cup-still nothing.Even measured out the water to 6oz and let the tea bag seep for five minutes-nothing just stronger tasting tea. On the box it tells you not to drink more than 1 cup in a 24 hour period- I drank three the other day not even thinking about it and nothing happened! Just tasted like cranberry tea and nothing else. Strange.

I bought this product based off reviews saying it tastes great and I was extremely disappointed. As soon as I started steeping it this smell filled my kitchen (my daughter even asked what the horrible smell was). Sadly, it was this tea. I tried it and it tastes like sweaty socks also. It is so gross. I have tried adding honey, drinking it cold, drinking it hot, etc and they all taste horrible. As far as a diet aid, I don't think so. I guess if you had a lot of excrement in you, possibly. I even doubled the suggested amount and I still did not anything happen (and no, I was not on the toilet a lot either). All in all, this product was a big thumbs down to me.
I was very happy with my order.  It arrived on time and as described.  Thank you!!
Yummy spices. It's nice that it comes in 3 smaller containers. The moisture in the air makes it stick together a bit.
This is a great spicy rub. I made a bbq brisket with it and combined it with a smokier rub and it turned out incredible. highly recommend. Also used for chicken with equally fantastic results

I love this stuff ! contains no gluten for us who are sensitive! i use this for homemade chicken wings, either on the grill or in the oven. also great on ribs.great mixture of spice and sweet, not to hot.also have used it for making a dip for chips etc.mix with sour cream and/or cream cheese.YUMMMMMMM!

This stuff is great to have around.  I won't eat Pizza without it.  It's great for adding some flavor to bland, starchy foods (rice, potatoes, cous-cous).  Also try it on green beans and brocolli.  I brought a can of this to work and now everyone uses it on their food.

This rub has lots of flavor and is not to sweet.
I have used it on roasted whole chicken, broiled and grilled breasts of chicken.
Rubbed only 20 minutes before use.
The color is wonderful.
Also rubbed on pork chops and let them sit in the refrigerator overnight. Moist and delicious.
As an interesting twist sprinkle some on mashed potatoes and popcorn.
This is a terific sauce for faijitas!  Highly recommended.

This is a divine chocolate, rich and full-flavored as many of the Cote D'Or products tend to be. It is a blend of roasted cocoa beans from West Africa and beans from South America as well. This is amazing alone but even better when paired up with a creamy espresso.

These bars are very tasty.  And I got a low sales price so they were much less overpriced than such bars usually are.  But I consider them to be more like slightly-less-sweet cookies than like health bars -- not that there's anything wrong with that.  They come two thin ones per pouch, so though you get 72 total, there are only 36 pouches.  And most people would consider one pouch to be one serving, so you're getting 36 servings here, not 72.  Also, the bars are extremely crumbly so I suggest having something underneath when you eat them to catch all those crumbs (or have a cordless vacuum handy if you eat these in the car).

Like most of us I bought these for a snack. Great for emergency snack to at 160 calories for 2 bars(2bars in one envelope).

These bars taste great as most of the reviews agree.

The APPLE CRISP is my favorite flavor!

GREAT VALUE: 6 Boxes for $16.5 with subscribe and save. Each box has 6 packets with 2 bars. So, 6 boxes of 6 packets per box = 36 packets = 46 cents per pack of 2 bars. Delivered to your door!

Basic Nutrition (1 packet of 2 bars): Total fat 6 of 42 grams. Zero cholesterol. 11 of 42grams are sugar. 140mg sodium. Protein 3 of 42grams. Dietary fiber 2 of 42grams. Protein 4 of 42grams. These won't hurt you and they do not replace a good well balanced meal.

Crunchy: These can be messy to eat. When you take a bar out of the packets, crumbs fall out. I solved this by pulling both bars out of the packet over a sink or trash can. Shake loose all the crumbs then put them back in the packet. Problem solved.

For those that think these are too crunchy. Try: break off a piece and leave it in your mouth less than one minute then chew. I do this and it works great!

I also have the chocolate and they are very good, but this is my favorite

Enjoy, I do.

I've long since been a Nature Valley fan and regularly buy a variety pack at one of my local 'big box' stores but, the price I could get by utilizing the 'subscribe and save' feature was, by far, superior to that of the big box.  They arrived fresh, in date, and 'in tact'.  I must say, I was a bit worried that they'd be granular granola by the time they were shipped/handled but, that simply didn't occur.  Two thumbs up!
I can't find these in the grocery store! My family loves these, so I will continue to buy them on Amazon.

I love these bars, tasty, quick and easy.  I have one of these everyday for my breakfast on the go.  They're not the sweet, sticky, candy bar type granola bars you may have tried.  It's more like a freeze dried type bar.  Mild flavor with enough substance to get me through till lunch.  I've tried them all, but apple is my favorite.

Has a nice apple & cinnamon flavor!!

Previous reviewer did not read the description, as it states the bars are in two-packs, and the bars are crunchy. I break the bars into three pieces before opening the pack, makes it easier to eat.

This is one of the harder to find flavors of Nature Valley Granola Bars. Most of the time you'll see the Oats N Honey, Peanut Butter, and Maple as the only flavors stocked in stores. I was lucky to find a local grocery which sells these, in addition to the Pecan flavor.

When I went looking for the Nut Roasted crunchy bars, I ran across this flavor "Apply Crisp". They do not disappoint. Tastes great. In order to get a discount, I had to order 6 boxes. I gave it my best to finish all 60 bars but ran out of steam, so I've been putting them to good use. I hand them out to the homeless. A small token of assistance from me to them.

As a college kid(in a masters program) I appreciate these little bars. They go for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Really awesome taste with milk. I wish they were sold without the plastic packaging(that would be cheaper), or as granola cereal.
My kids really like this one. Just wish Amazon would sell assortments so you don't have to buy so many of each flavor.
Good Buy for the price. Great with the morning coffee. This is the brittle kind, but this is perfect as a breakfast substitute. I always have a box or two in my office desk. Good buy...and healthy !

Ever since I had my first Nature Valley Granola Bar I have never purchased any other brand. I love the fact that they are so crunchy. (My husband likes chewy ones, and he buys his and I buy mine). I always have some in my car in case I get hungry. That way there is no temptation to go to a drive thru for fast food! I have never seen this APPLE flavor before, and I could hardly wait to get the box from AMAZON open. There is NO flavor of NV granola bars I don't like, but this flavor became my instant second "favorite" (after Peanut Butter). When I eat these in the car I break the package in thirds cross wise (breaking BOTH of the bars), then I go back and break each to those sections in half lengthwise of the package. Then I split the package open the length of its seam and put it where I can reach it. By doing this I generally get 12 fairly uniform pieces and very few crumbs (which I eat later when the car is not moving). This method works well anywhere you want to eat them and definitely seems to generate far fewer crumbs.
I ORDERED THESE AS A SUBSCRIPTION JUST BASED ON HOW GOOD ALL THE OTHER FLAVORS OF NATURE VALLEY ARE.
NOTE: Another flavor I have never heard of: Vanilla Nut is listed on Amazon as "out of stock" with a place you can sign up to be notified when they are again in stock. They've been rated very well by past Amazon Purchasers so I am waiting with a dripping tongue (my dogs taught me that).
Excellent taste and value.  Quick easy order and mailed to my daughter. This flavor of bar is hard to find in grocery stores in the USA.  She loved them, too.  Thanks.  Ardie in AZ
Not too sugary and the apple flavor is a plus. I leave a bar or two in my backpack as an emergency snack during school. It doesn't crumble too easily as long as it's not tossed around or crushed.

I absolutely love these. Great to know I'm getting whole grains, and the taste is lovely. Not quite like biting into an actual apple crisp, but darn good just the same! I only wish they had less calories; but then again, I wish that on every food.
Very handy food suplement for hiking or just whatever. The flavor of these is excellent. Just the right amount of sweet, with a slight buttery apple taste.
We love apple crisp and are most distressed that Nature Valley quit making them. Please keep them in your stock as long as possible. Thanks

My husband likes the crunchy granola bars to dunk in coffee and these fit the bill. The only drawback is that we had to order what amounts to 72 packages of bars! It's a good thing he likes them! I wish it had been a little easier to customize for a variety pack.
I have only recently tried cooking Chinese at home.  I have served Kung Pao Chicken made with this sauce to rave reviews.  There are fights over the leftovers!

Good prices at JVS, considering the fact that if you order from one of the other Asian sites, you will pay on average about 12 dollars for shipping. So, JVS is a dollar or two cheaper. This is good authentic sauce.

I bought this as a gift for my rich bitchy grandma. And she loved it. She said the cheese and crackers were great the thing was to damn cute I wished i would have gotten myself one. I bought a bunch of hickory farms stuff for my other family this was the only thing that everyone thanked me on. It's good for one or two people.
My wife and I has been drinking folger half and half for some time now. We enjoy the great taste. I shop between amazon and walmart for out coffee.

This is a great tasting product that also came in a very appreciated packagin. I do thank you guys. I will order more when I am running out. No biggie. You all hae a good day. Later.

G.
This is a delicious sauce that my entire family loves.  We can't get enough of it.
This is a delicious product.I have made roasted barley tea from scratch.This is much easier and same delicious taste.I will buy this product again.Nice packaging and large quantity.

I absolutely adore this tea, especially in the summer.  It is very refreshing and caffine free.  This is a nice large package to get you through the season since 1 bag makes about a gallon of ice tea.  The service and shipping was fast...but I didn't get a free pack of Meiji Mini Candy with my order of 2 bags.

I love mugicha and am disappointed that it's so hard to find.  It's great for our kids too -- a healthful alternative to sugary drinks.  My  former Japanese teacher said children and pregnant women in Japan drink it all the time.

The idea of boiling grain to make a tea never occurred to me. Surprisingly in Seoul, many restaurants serve barley tea, called bori-cha as their standard free beverage. Most of my Korean colleagues love it. It is a kind of cultural icon. Growing up with Honey nut Cheerios, I assumed that barley needs honey, so I added honey to my barley tea and it is to die for. My Korean colleagues consider this sacrilege, but I still recommend it.

Barley tea is also popular in Japan and Ecuador. Apparently, we are behind in the discovery of this wonderful tea.

The taste of barley tea is a bit like regular tea, say Lipton, but softer. Most importantly for me, this tea is healthy and natural. I don't drink coffee, black or green tea for health and personal reasons. Tea made from barley is healthy, refreshing and enjoyable. You must try some.
This tea was a disappointment. The tea had a weak barley flavor no matter how many tea bags were used. I do not believe this tea was very fresh. I will try another variety.

I spent last summer in Japan, and recently found myself missing the refreshing taste of barley tea. The tea tastes exactly as I remembered. I dropped a single bag in a liter of water and left it in the fridge for two hours, and there was my tea.

The smell of the tea bags pre-tea is a bit offputting, but it's well worth putting up with for the tea.

Also, the bags are not for individual cups, but for pots or pitchers. This is what I wanted, but make sure you aren't expecting smaller tea-bags made for individual cups.

Also, good deal for the price in my opinion.

Mugicha is so delicious, especially when ice cold.  It really quenches thirst and has a nice, slightly astringent flavor.  It was the first thing I consumed when I first went to Asia, specifically Korea.  I drank it a lot in Japan too.  The Japanese drink it mostly in the summer but I like it year round.  Enjoy a glass today.  Oh, and it is so simple to make, just put a bag in a big jug and add cold water and put in the fridge, it is ready in 2 hours.  So easy!

I really enjoy the natural decaf property of barley tea. I normally use whole barley at home but needed bags for the office. I had brought some back from China on my last trip that I could not find in the US, so I tried this brand. These large bags are actually for a teapot, not a cup as I expected. As mentioned, the flavor was not full-bodied and so I will keep searching.

I first began using the roasted barley to make a beverage almost thirty years ago while learning Hapkido. It is good for the heart, stabilizes the pancreas, and works as a fat emulsifier. It goes well with roasted corn to make an even more healthful drink. I would suggest buying it from a local Korean, Chinese or Japanese market. I just got 4  bags of roasted corn and the roasted barley for less than $9. Then you can either brew it whole on the stove, or grind it and brew it in a French Press. Both ways work well. Adding sugar or honey diminishes some of the health benefits. In spring and summer I have it at room temperature. If it is cold outside I drink it warm. Either way is great. Try 4 tablespoons to a quart of water.

I had a craving for this while I was pregnant, and ate it almost every day. Th flavor is excellent, and true to the directions, it only takes 12 minutes to make. Use a nonstick pan, and keep it on a full boil just like it says. Worth every penny! You won't be dissapointed!

The label says that you can make this risotto in 12 minutes. It took me about 35, and there was still a bit more liquid than I would like; I finally decided to just let it sit on the cooling burner to absorb the last bit of liquid.

The flavor, however, is excellent. Cheesy, but not overpoweringly so. I'd definitely order it again.
I love this product, and everyone must too, because the prices are going up. I now use it sparingly. More for a treat. That is what I ask for Christmas every year. I hope I get it this yr. 8)
If you want to pay a lot for sugar, then buy this box of sugar. No Kiwi was hurt in the production of this so called Kiwi Smoothie, because it does have any Kiwi in it.
I LOVE THIS CHUNKY VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP BECAUSE IT IS GREAT TASTE. I LIKE THIS SOUP. I ENJOY EAT IT.

My 3 dogs love this food. I mix it with a small amount of dry dog food that is also very healthy (no grains). All three push their bowls around the kitchen floor licking up every small bit they have left and then lick the other dogs bowls just to make sure they haven't missed anything. A very healthy food and if it looks that good to you, you could eat some too. It's made in a facility that also makes "human" food so it wouldn't hurt you if you were very hungry and had nothing else to eat.

I just used my new wok to make a stir fry, and took a gamble on this Hoisin. I usually use one from an Asian foods store. WOW, What have I been missing all this time!!?! Dynasty brand is so much better, deeper, and well...less weird than the type I was using. I didn't even know what I was using was that bad, I enjoyed it until I tried Dynasty. Now I'll never go back.

It has that earthy, rich flavor that you can never quite identify when you go to a Chinese restaurant. I used to think I just needed to add more soy sauce to make my stir fry or beef and broccoli taste like it does when I get takeout. No. It's the hoisin!! You don't need much, but this will bring out that depth and richness you want in a sauce, thick or thin, to really taste wonderful.

Personally, I used a bag of frozen stir-fry veggies (I know, life is short, frozen is okay sometimes!) and a handful of shrimp and a block of tofu cut up. I added about 1/3 c soy sauce (kikkoman, of course!!) and a dash, probably a 1/4 teaspoon or so of Dynasty Hoisin, mixed well and DANG! That was so good!!! If you like a lot of sauce you could totally double or triple it, adding hoisin to taste. I also added about 1/8th teaspoon oyster sauce, another one of those "Why is this beef and broccoli so good??" items, but you could leave that out. Also, you could add cashews and sub chicken for shrimp and make cashew chicken! Yum! Enjoy!

Ok.  I've been making a lot of Vietnamese spring rolls at home with peanut sauce; they're surprisingly really easy, but I need a lot of Hoisin to make the peanut sauce.  Ran out of real Hoisin Sauce, and because I didn't have the time to go to the local Asian market, I took a chance with Dynasty (got it at Wal-mart).  The best thing I can say about the Dynasty Hoisin Sauce is that it's a small bottle, so I didn't feel too bad throwing it in the trash.  IT IS REALLY BAD!  There's no way anyone who likes to eat yummy food could possibly rate this sauce over 1 star.  I would give it negative stars if I could because I find it offensive to eat food that tastes so wrong.  I'm completely baffled by the 5 star reviews.  TIA?  Stroke?  Alzheimer's?  Tumor?  There's got to be a reason beyond just not knowing any better.  In my humble opinion, Koon Chun hoisin is the gold standard.

Hard to find Hoisin Sauce at my local supermarkets here in this small town. This is a good product at a good price. Hard to believe that Amazon can sell and ship these for just over $10...but they did!  Packaged really well.  Use this for creating that authentic Chinese BBQ food taste for ribs and pork.

Our 3 English Setters prefer these dog treats to anything else (except meat). I read the ingredients and researched it a bit and then took a bite of one myself. Yum!!! Frankly, I could eat the whole box myself. These are a winner. Not as sweet as human cookies and full of wonderful flavor, tender crunchy. I approve!

Every morning she has to have one. If I gave her one all day, I'd be buying these every week. She plays with it. It's so cute. I throw it down the hall, she goes running after it, then jumps all around it. I used to chase her like to try and get it from her, but she got too impatient for that. Soon as I throw it now, she eats it. Also a good hiding spot for liquid medicine or pills you can crush.
i received a different brand: brown color Anateon something like that. that brand is not great, all stuck together. i dont know if the picture showed is different brand. it's worth it!

Don't get me wrong, these pistachios are fantastic.  Though, it's something that I've never thought of... but these nuts are not salted.  Antep pistachios are great, but when you take away the salt, they're just not as addictive.  I'm still going to eat them, I just won't horde them all to myself like I used to.  From now on, make sure you order your turkish pistachios with salt.  It makes all the difference in the world.

I purchased these pistachios as a present for my husband.  he loves Turkish pistachios and we can't get them here in rural Maine. These nuts are fresh and exactly what he wanted. The price per pound works out the best I could find.

I like this cereal over all the other ones out there, so I gave it 5 stars. You pick up the box and can just tell it has more substance to it. A lot of cereals show plenty of fruit and nuts on the picture on the outside of the box, but then the actual cereal has very litte. This Quaker cereal is different and I hope they don't cheapen it over time like the others are doing.
But $21 for a 56 ounce box???? Are they out of their mind??!! One 28 oz box cost $4.50 in the grocery store, so 56 oz would cost $9. Where do they get off charging $12 more is a mystery to me. Unless I'm reading this incorrectly, and they are selling several 56 oz boxes for $21.

UPDATE 9/1/2012: I see they have reduced the price from $21 to $11.24. But it's still not $9 like it would be at the store, and what would shipping add to it?
excellent salame - it is a luxury product that will make you throw rocks at ordinary dry salami.  I will order it for my next special occaision.

This salami is not what I am used to when I buy Genoa salami.  Too much fat, great lumps of fat in the meat which I took out one at a time before eating what was left.  Very greasy.  Threw it all away in disgust.  Would not recommend to my friends.

Finn Crisp Multigrain are very tasty very thin "crackers" each 1 5/8 x 4 3/4. Finn Crisp are wonderful with melted cheese (about 20 seconds in a microwave). They can be used anyway you'd use crackers, with the benefit that they are less fragile, less likely to spontaneous disintegrate with the first bite---so Finn Crisp are actually better than crackers for dips and spreads and such. In fact, a very tasty, very healthy snack (if you aren't counting every calorie) is simply a thin layer of mayo on a Finn Crisp.

I suppose Finn Crisp are healthy, a good source of fiber, with minimal processing, no preservatives, and such. However, Finn Crisp are simply my favorite crackers.

OTHER VARIETIES
Multigrain Finn Crisp have a mild neutral flavor, excellent with very delicate cheese. Finn Crips original has a slightly sour flavor, like (unseeded) rye, pumpernickle or sour dough bread. Finn Crisp Original, Delicately Thin Rye Crispbread, 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 9) If you like the flavor of seeded rye bread (i.e., with caraway seeds) try the Caraway version (my favorate). Finn Crisp Caraway Thin Rye Crispbread with Caraway, 6.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 9)

PRICE
$26 for a pack of 9 (or $21 if you sign up for a periodic shipment subscription) direct from Amazon is a fair price. However, when Amazon is out-of-stock, I've seen the price as high as $42, which is excessive.

Recommendation: After major grocery shopping expeditions, sit down at your computer with your reciept, and check if you can buy any of the non-perishables through Amazon. When you find items (even if more expensive than you just paid), put the item on your Amazon wish list, and add a note to the wish list of the price you just paid. Check your wish list frequently, and when you see an item you need at a bargain price, buy it.

After having gastric bypass, I find that I really miss the "crunch" of crackers. After looking for a good whole grain cracker with low or no sugar, and low in carbs, I stumbled across this cracker and decided to try it. I AM SOLD!! This cracker is just what the right cracker. Its made of all healthy ingredients, all good grains. Yes it has carbs, but they are healthy carbs and only 10 grams for 2 crackers, which are good size cracker. I will eat 2 or 3 crackers with cheese or tuna, or sometimes peanut butter (for the protein) and I am full.

I took the package to my doctor, and he said it was a good healthy cracker. Its great for anyone with diabetes too!!I now order them by the case from amazon. I am glad to find this cracker and its now the only one I will eat.

I always loved the Finn Crisp Rye w/o Caraway Seeds, but I had to order the Multigrain b/c they were out of the rye ones. Now I've got some of the rye again and I realize--I love the Multigrain! Maybe they changed the recipe for the rye ones--they're almost like sawdust when you chew them. The Multigrain ones are so yummy--you can just grab a couple and munch on them for a snack. They have a very slightly sweet taste, like whole grain products often do, but they go well with everything. My favorite thing to top them with is plain cream cheese with salt and pepper. If you like healthy foods and want an easy way to be good to your diet, buy these!
A healthy snack option.Such as great taste!You should definitely have the courage to try it.I'm eating one while writing this...

I have known and enjoyed Finn Cisp for almost three decades, because I was able to buy it in Germany. I now live in AZ and was not able to buy it here.
I was so glad to learn that I could order through Amazon.com. I love the product because of its taste and it's low calory and fat content. My whole family and many of our friends love it too. I now order it through Amazon's subscription thereby taking advantage of lower prices and free shipping.Finn Crisp Multigrain Thin Crisp, 6.2 Oz Boxes (Pack of 9)

The wholegrain rye with caraway taste great. These were served at the Finn Embassy in D.C. at recent open house and they are great eaten plain or with a bit of topping. Also try with quark, sardines or salmon.

I first had this bouillon in Switzerland and LOVED it and brought some home with me.  It is hands down the best vegetable bouillon - adds so much flavor to soups, vegetables and dips etc.  It is organic  too- Yea! I was thrilled to see that Amazon carries it!  I am about to order a case now.  Thank you Amazon!

When visiting a friend in London last month, she strongly encouraged me to try this broth. Wow, it was delicious. I bought a can and wish I would have bought more! I've been sipping cups of it and just can't get enough of it. It is very flavorful, easy to dissolve, and has a pure, natural taste. It is fantastic - I highly recommend it!

Hey, this stuff is great!  Just a teaspoon in a cup of hot water is marvelous.  This is not your Mom's much-too-salty old foil wrapped bouillon cube.  Every kitchen needs some Marigold Bouillon Powder.  I chose the reduced-salt product and I was a bit skeptical that I would be able to use 6 containers, but that's how they were packaged.  Now that I've tried it, there's no question I'll use them all and be reordering very soon.
This bouillon is great and VHTF. I love the low sodium version. Please add it to your inventory. Thank  you.

but it isn't very flavorful.  a friend suggested it and i jumped on it when amazon got it back in stock.  i do like that it is made with vegetable products but i won't buy it again.  shoot, i have enough for the next ten years!
I use this exclusively to make spaghetti sauce.  It's also excellent when i want an Italian theme for pork or chicken dishes.
My husband is English and drinks a LOT of tea. PG Tips is his and my favorite. so happy to find it on Amazon at such a good price.
I believe this is one of the best deals to buy PG Tips in bulk.  My package arrived on time in good condition.  I'm pleased with the product and service.

I was expecting a lot form England's No 1 tea. If you like the Black tea Lipton tea bags then you may like this product. I find this one very bland, mild, no taste, no color. The tea in the bags is like powder.
Syrup of Cassis is hard to find.  Most people settle for Creme de Cassis which is alcohol based.  But the non- alcoholic syrup doesn't overwhelm the wine.
I lived in France for over a year and used this to make kir and kir royal.  I was very excited to see that it was for sale and the same product you can get overseas.
This is legitimate cassis, just like in France.  It is definitely worth buying, except for the price.  The price Amazon is selling this for is a bit high.

Great tasting coffee - goes well with entrees as well as dessert. I easily tasted nutmeg, cloves, allspice, and just a hint of cinnamon. I will definitely purchase this again.

My only regret is that it apparently does not come in whole bean; however, the ground was very fresh.

This was not as strongly flavored as I was hoping, If you want something with only a HINT of spice than this is for you. I had to end up adding a tbls of pumpkin pie spice to the coffee filter when I brewed a cup. The was a total wast of money & time
I am enjoying this coffee. It's a well balanced and yet subtle blend. Trader Joe's ran out of their pumpkin spice coffee - this isn't as strongly spiced but is a pleasant substitute.
Good pumpkin spice flavor. Just pay attention to the size 10oz bag. So its not cheap. But its an affordable way to refill your own kcups.  Kcups prices are ridiculous.

My cat is on this special diet. Works great...she has been UTI free for over a year. But I can purchase this from my vet for about $47 for a 17.6 pound bag. So before purchasing here shop around...I have also found other websites that sale for $60 or less.
This basket was absolutely not worth the $40.00 that it cost. I was humiliated when my boss opened it. There were also items missing from the basket. It was quite tacky.

The items in this basket collectively are worth about $10. Not quite sure what I was expecting when I bought this. The gloves are something out of the 70's, gummi worms (50 cents?), stale cookies ($1?), seeds ($3 on Amazon!), and some tea (~$5?). This is way overpriced for what was delivered.

This is a great gift. I was looking for something different for my wife for Mother's Day. This was perfect. Shipment was very fast. I've never been disappointed with anything I've purchased from Amazon.

Not going to say much since I never got to see the actual product, but I had it delivered to my mom for mother's day while I was outside America.

She seems to like it!
My family and I thoroughly enjoyed the quinoa. The shipment arrived as described and in a nice sturdy container. There will be many future orders.
We have 2 labradors and these are the best chew toys.  Box of 90 bones last 4-5 months.  This is great.  It takes them 1-2 hours to finish.  Can keep them busy if they chew a few minutes at a time.
I have two medium size dogs that love to chew and these rawhides are awesome!  The 6" bones last a few hours which is a few hours of serenity for us!

My dog loves these rawhide bones. He's a black lab mix and it takes him a an hour and a half of pure chewing to get through one. You can tell that the bones are quality rawhide and thoroughly pressed (always a plus!)

The only thing I didn't like was that each bone had a tag. A small issue, but only takes two seconds to take all of them off. (Just silly to waste paper I guess.)

In total, these bones are worth it and will not break into little pieces on the floor. I will certainly buy these again in the future!

Great price on these pressed bones.
My dogs love em! The bones arrived
within a couple of days and were in
great shape. Will be ordering more!
My dogs love these, i been buying these at my local pet store. Buying these in bulk is saving me a ton of money. Shipping was super fast.

I have a friend with two Bull Mastifs and they love a good rawhide chew!  Finding these chews in bulk, at a reasonable price is difficult at times. A quick search on Amazon, revealed exactly what I was looking for. Good value for the money. Shipping was fast and as stated.

Don't feed Rawhides, they are unhealthy.
Sadly, rawhide bones are very dangerous to dogs. While some dogs go their entire lives scarfing down the fun-to-chew treats, they can be deadly. Rawhides can be full of bacteria and poisons. Aside from what is in rawhide, dogs can choke on them or sustain intestinal blockage from ingesting them.

Rawhides often come from less developed countries. This means that the hides are transported over poor roads and without refrigeration, before they cleaned and dried. Under these conditions, they can grow salmonella which can kill your dog. It is also unsafe for humans, especially small children, to handle. The problem has been so serious that in 1999 the FDA to issued a warning on the subject stating "These products may pose a risk of bacterial infection such as Salmonella...FDA is urging pet owners who have these products to handle them carefully. Anyone who comes in contact with these treats should wash their hands with hot water and soap. Elderly people, young children, and people with weakened immune systems are particularly at risk from exposure and should avoid any contact with these chews."

Read up.

I bought this to make a cornbread recipe. Coconut flour and cornmeal makes a cornbread where you don't know if it is a cake or a bread, you only know you want more of it. It is a recommended item for those wanting less wheat in their diet.  Trying coconut flour recipes is a total delight.

I like the natural sweetness and high fiber content of this flour. I am using it in gluten free recipes in place of sweet brown rice flour, until I can purchase that.  So far the cookies made with it have come out well. It's also great to use in pancakes.  The key is only to use a little of the flour. Too much c. flour in any recipe probably won't have the results you would prefer.

This is a wonderful flour to use. low carbs, and full of nutrients. I dont use it though because it has a very strong sweet coconuty flavor and I am not a coconut kind of person. If I DO add it, it is a minute amount. But defintiely number one flour to buy and use..even for baking for your doggie cookies. I only gave it 4 stars cause of the taste.
How does $ 8.99 for 16 oz....calculate out to 12 cents an ounce? this marketing doesn't make a bit of sense. My math says this is 57 cents an ounce. What gives?
Needed some flour to make muffins for a friend who has celiac disease.  This fit the bill!  Bob's can always be trusted to have a good product at a good price.
This Kenyan tea is very smooth and malty. A four minute steep gives a rich,satisfying cup of tea. Excellent with sweetener (Stevia)and a shot of half and half. One of my top 3 breakfast teas.
This is the only stuff I can count on when ever I'm out playing sports it nevers slow me down. I can drink as much as I can and not even go to the bathroom for a while.

Easily the best cereal on the market, Kashi: Good Friends Cereal is the perfect blend of crunchiness, flavor, fiber, and protein, without a cloying sweetness. Pretty much everything you'd want in a cereal. I'm also a big fan of Good Friends: Cinna-Raisin Crunch. My only question: Who's friends with whom? Is it the cereal barrels that are good friends with the cereal twigs? Or is it me, am I good friends with the cereal itself?

Fat Cat makes the most imaginative toys for cats. They entertain me as well! The cat nip in the toy is an attraction to the cats as well as the feathered tickle ones, making my indoor cats feel like they are hunters. They even make my floor look cute when it is cluttered with cat toys!
My cat loves these lures, especially the one with the red fuzzy hair.  I only wish the fishing pole itself lasted as long.  Oh well.
Both of my cats like these and they are cute too.  I stick them in catnip.
I bought these extra lures for the broken cat toy that I purchased with these. My cat likes the fluffy hair on the one butterfly character but once he ripped it all out the fun was over. ...meh.

I discovered this product at Whole Foods when I was looking for a supplement for my kids. The 10 year old has Asperger's Syndrome and can be very picky about his fruits and veggies, and the toddler has pretty typical capricious tastes so it's sometimes a challenge to find foods they both will eat.  I've been fixing this in smoothies for them (bannanas, pineapple, strawberries, 2% milk, and crushed ice) and they LOVE it!! 2 scoops of the supplement works well for both. Great product!
My 2 year old sons loves this powder.  He actually takes it with water vs. juice.  I am happy to know my picky eater is able to get his vitamins for the day.
This works well as a smoothie supplement for my kids, or mixed with orange juice. They weren't "sippin' the Kool-Aid" though, when I mixed it with water.

I had all kind of trouble with my enlarged prostate. Even Mayo clinic Docs advised for surgery. I tried pumpkin seeds and then went to this oil taking one table spoon in the AM, another in the PM. I tangibly improved and have decided not to do the surgery. I do not need it. This oil is like a magic food for the prostate. I was told it is very good for libido, but I am content just to be able to urinate normally :-)

The taste is absolutely genius. This is the best discovery for me on Amazon thus far as it changed my health and helped cope.

I had tried this product at a friends for a lunch salad. It was so delicious I couldn't wait to get home and see if I could find it on line. I really appreciated the no shipping charge. It arrived last night and it was just as good as I remember, so happy I found it. I will buy it again. Try it for a change.

I used this oil as the fat for homemade pie crust, as well as adding 2-4 tablespoons to pumpkin pie batter for additional richness, and a deeper pumpkin flavor!  Its awesome, and adds a unique color to the crust.

My sister-in-law introduced me to this oil, which is sold at our local farmer's market. It adds a nutty deliciousness to salads, soups (like carrot or squash soup) and green vegetable smoothies. Highly recommend this product

I only learned about toasted pumpkin seed oil recently, but it has already become a favorite food. I have tried other brands, but this is the best so far. It has a complex aroma of toasted nuts, and goes as well with oatmeal or vanilla ice cream as with a salad. A word of caution: this oil is fragile, and needs to be stored in the refrigerator after opening to preserve its flavors and aromas.

This arrived yesterday and so far I've only tried it once, which made a great dressing for watercress and cabbage. When you bite into the dressed salad, there is a brief moment when you can taste the pumpkin flavor.

The bottles are very tiny, and the plastic seal which you pull to open seems secure. There was no leakage.

The oil is a very dark greenish/reddish color. I know it sounds like an implausible combination of colors, but that's what it looked like to me.

Looking forward to trying the suggestion of drizzling it on ice cream. Look forward to using this oil with other foods and in other ways.

It's nice we can order these from amazon as the local Whole Foods only has the walnut oil and pecan oil from this brand, but does not carry the pumpkin seed oil.

I might try this brand's walnut oil next, as it is significantly cheaper than the pumpkin seed oil.

The oil is quite tasty, though not quite as strong as some of the pumpkin seed oil that I ate when I lived in Austria. The price is much better than some of the others, especially when using subscribe and save. I love this on salads with balsamic vinegar.
The product is fresh  and well packed. Very good for use as a oil for  salads. While making them tasty, it is very good for health too!
I like dried papaya and this brand is some of the best I've tried.  Good price too.
I bought this for my three parrots and my consumption.  It has a very good taste and a good price.  Papaya has a lot of Vitamin A which is good for birds and humans.
These are good, nice cheese flavor. If your out of croutons break up afew for your salad, or float them in onion soup. Pretty Good!
I found these cheese snacks just terrible.... they smell like dog treats and taste like, what i would imagine... dog treats to taste like.. I whole-heartedly implore you to avoid these snacks.

I like white cheddar. I can eat half a pound of it at one sitting. I like soy. I can chug plain varieties of it by the quart.

But 'Just the Cheese Rounds, Cheddar Plus Soy' as a snack? It's hard to get down one of these calcified nuggets, let alone a portion.

Peanut oil is good for baking and frying. It does not have an odor in baking and it does not easily burn at high temperatures when frying. I am just a regular house wife who likes to cook. Peanut oil does not make my house stink. I used to be afraid of frying because of the smell but that has changed. I am more willing to fry now. I tried to find peanut oil in regular grocery stores but couln't. Costco used to carry it but not any more. I ordered through Amazon.com and I am very happy with the purchase.

This is a GREAT product.  Use it all the time, but don't buy it here for $168!!!!  You can get it elsewhere, including Sam's Club, for less than $35.  Same size, same company, same everything for way less than half the price!!!!

Like a lot of people, I guess, I got scared of chicken jerky made in China. Even though I used a very respectable brand that's sold broadly in every major chain (Dogswell), I still felt a little queasy. So I bought this stuff, which is made in Colorado. Colorado! What better state for dogs than Colorado? Great terrain changes, fresh air, active residents--boy, was this jerky gonna be great. Only it wasn't. It was rock-hard. Another Cristmas present for the lady of the house. She just told me that it's some of the most excellent tea she's had. Too bad we can't buy this in the stores around here. Ah well, we will keep purchasing it from AMAZON until it comes this way.

We are from the UK and we cannot but these peas here in USA, Thank God this seller has them. We but 8 at a time and will continue to do so as long as they sell them. Bigger than your average pea, the water inside is slightly flavoured with mint. A real treat.

When I saw this soup on the shelf at the store, I was immediately interested. I love Thai food. The flavor is nice without being overwhelming. I find no need to add any additional spices or seasoning. A nice soup for a rainy day like today. Warm and comforting.

I've NEVER seen such small cans of Chunky Soup. You know, Campbell's Chunky soup has been sold since the 1970s and in that time I've seen only one size of can. This is not the usual double but a SINGLE SERVING CAN! If you think you're getting a good deal, THINK AGAIN and compare the can size.

I've been noticing recently that this and all their chunky soups are becoming more and more watered down.

That and the incremental downsizing of their products(as with just about everything else in the grocery store) means I'll be passing their section of the soup aisle. Time to make my own I guess.
Every single can of soup in my order was dented. Not just slightly, but as if someone had taken each can and personally threw it on the cement before they shipped it to me.

It is my own fault that I didn't realize I always buy the 18.8 ounce and this is only 10.75 ounce cans. (I've never even seen them in this small of a size). I only buy them on sale so the price per can for the 10.75 ounce is more than I normally buy the 18.8 ounce for.  Amazon will not allow you to return food even though this is cans and was still in the plastic wrap.

Price is too high compared to the 18.6 oz cans. At 18.6 oz can price a case of 12 of the smaller 10.75 oz cans should only cost $12.11 if the 18.6 oz cost $20.96 for a case of 12. That is .02 cents per ounce more, buying it by the smaller cans.
I purchased a few cases of the smaller cans when they were on sale, then seen the 18.6 oz cans were cheaper by the ounce and bought four cases of them to try.

WOW, was I SURPRISED. I have gone back to eating the smaller cans of the soup. The flavor in the bigger cans does NOT even come close to tasting the same as the soup in the smaller cans. Why that is I have no idea. But I find the flavor of the smaller cans MUCH more flavorful and tasty vs the larger cans. If the larger cans contained soup that tasted the same, I would purchase the larger cans every time. But all 48 cans in the four cases tasted the same. Something just not quite right with the flavor.

Personal preference I am sure, but that is part of life. I grabbed the salt and pepper mills and added a little of each to the big cans of soup. Nope, I couldn't make it taste as good as the soup in the smaller cans, no matter how I dressed it up. The smaller cans needed no salt or pepper, and the flavor was/is perfect, thus I bought seven cases of the smaller cans in the past three months.

I would give it five stars, but doc it one star because of the high price. And, yes, sometimes some of the cans are dented, but I think most of these cans, which they sell for about half of what you pay in a grocery store for them, are distressed goods. e.g. Picked up from grocery stores because they ARE dented. A dent doesn't bother me since I am only paying about half price per can and getting it delivered for free. Campbell's large cans of rib roast are great flavor, but that is another story/review.Campbells Chunky Soup, Classic Chicken Noodle, 10.75-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)

For "canned" soup, this actually tastes pretty good and I am VERY particular. So for me to say that, it's saying a lot. If I had to rate this out of all the canned soups I've eaten in my life, 10 being best, I'd give this a 7.

I add hot sauce and salt to mine, plus I eat it with Lay's Spicy Cayenne & Cheese chips. It gives the meal a crunch to it, which makes me feel like I'm really eating. Otherwise, it's just mush.

I actually LIKE the smaller size because I can't finish the larger cans. It's perfect for how much I want to eat. Most portions are too big and too much food for one sitting.
These cans wound up being about $1.83 a can. And they're not even a full can of soup. I should have read the size closer- but this is almost like scamming. Not right to do to customers!!!!

It was a bit of a surprise to see how poor the reviews of this soup are. In terms of taste and texture, this chicken noodle soup is very close to the 18-ounce Healthy Choice Chunky chicken soup that Amazon also sells. And that gets five-star ratings from reviewers.

This soup has a fairly rich and tangy chicken broth. The noodles are substantial and just about as good as canned noodles can possibly be. There are chunks of white chicken meat in the soup. There is also a hint of other vegetables (carrots, I think) in the broth. The Healthy Choice version of this soup is actually a bit more bland than this soup because the use of salt is minimized. The 10-ounce size of the can makes this an ideal choice for a quick snack, whereas the 18-ounce Chunky soups are a bit too large as a snack for one person.

So what's not to like? The negative reviews seem to focus on three things: the soup is watery, the cans are too small, and the price is too high. Let me take these in turn:

1. The Chunky soup line is not condensed soup. I know from other reviews that some people think it is, add water, and then complain that the soup tastes watery. This soup actually has an appropriate amount of broth as it is. That broth is fragrant and has a distinctive chicken-y taste. If you add water, though, it will taste watery.

2. The cans are exactly as big as Amazon claims. I know some people buy this expecting the big Chunky soup cans sold in supermarkets, and these people understandably feel disappointed. I had to learn myself to be careful and check the quantity or volume with any online grocery purchases. But as I said above, the 20-ounce cans are ideal for quick snacks. I knew I was buying something in smaller cans, and I personally found this size preferable.

3. The soup right now is in fact overpriced at $22. The Healthy Choice 12-pack of 18-ounce chicken noodle soup costs less, around the $18-19 range. That's a much better deal. When I got this particular item from Amazon, I paid about $13. The soup is a good deal at that price. Any higher, and it's a poor deal.

By the way, I add Parmesan cheese and baco-bits to this soup. It makes for a more entertaining treat. I hope some of this proves helpful.

Ten Ren has different grades of oolong tea, but for me since I drink oolong tea a lot, I purchased this since this was very affordable.

I have so far ordered three of this syrup .tastes yummy. delivery is very prompt and its the cheapest i could find anywhere. will recommend to go for it.

B. Dague
I was happy with this product.  It had a nice flavor and had a great price!
