Arrived soon enough, last for a pretty long time, tastes good and it is good for you. Will buy again.
Great price for a very good quality syrup. It really has a deep and full maple syrup flavor. Not dull or wishy washy.

This maple syrup is excellent in taste and economy. We do not use any of the processed syrups on the market and to find a great real maple syrup at an affordable price is really tough.  This Organic Maple Syrup from NOW has it all...price, ease of ordering and best of all wonderful flavor with nothing added.  I'm buying another jug soon.

I bought this maple syrup for the master cleanse diet but then ended up eating it for some healthy pancakes and boy o boy is this syrup super yummy!!!!  My 2 and 4 year olds love it.  Also, the price is great!

This maple syrup is delicious and is strictly maple syrup -- nothing added.  Plus, you receive wonderful minerals and vitamins.  I used for the Master Cleanse and it really made the "lemonade" drink tasty.  If I were to eat pancakes, I would only use this syrup, rich in minerals and vitamins.  Enjoy!

If I could put zero stars I would!

I purchased two 64-fl oz containers of pure maple syrup from Nutricity through Amazon. The product was fine. Then without ever using it, I decided I wanted to return it for a refund. I printed the return authorization and the shipping label from the Amazon website, paid an extra $15 for shipping, and sent the items back. About two weeks later I got an email from Nutricity stating that their policy is no refunds on grocery items, and if I wanted the product back I would have to pay for shipping back to me. That's fine if that's their policy, but it was not clearly stated, and if that is their policy, I should not have been able to print a return authorization from the Amazon website. I feel like I have been ripped off. VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Save yourself the headache, and just buy this from someone else!

This is good syrup and my 2nd favorite. It has a medium sweetness when compared with the other 2 that I've tried. I typically don't like things very sweet. I used 3 syrups listed below for my Master Cleanse. They are all good quality and I'd recommend any of them. You probably will want 1 jug for every 5 days of a cleanse. It is possible that you'll need more. I'm not an expert to comment on darkness or many other factors. Here's my brief breakdown:

Coombs Family Farms 100% Pure Organic Maple Syrup Grade B, 32-Ounce Jug - The sweetest of the 3 for sure. It is also probably the thickest but still runny. 200 calories per serving of 4 tbsp. When I put this in my lemonade for the Master Cleanse, it makes the lemonade sweeter than how I like it.

NOW Foods Maple Syrup Grade B Organic, 32 ounce - Is less sweet when compared to Coombs but a little sweeter than Family Heritage. Runnier than Coombs but these syrups are all a little runnier than grocery syrups. 200 calories per serving of 4 tbsp. It provided the right amount of sweetness for the Master Cleanse specifications for a drink.

Family Heritage Organic Vermont Maple Syrup, Grade B, 32-Ounce Jug - Good quality and tastes sweet but definitely not as sweet as the other 2. Didn't get the calorie info before throwing the bottle away but I'm figuring it's the same as the other 2. I usually put an extra 1/2 a tbsp in my master cleanse lemonade to get it a little sweeter and curb the hunger.

This is really good maple syrup, packed with flavor, dense, and dark. Naturally it takes homemade waffles and pancakes to the next level, but it can also add a dash of magic to other breakfast staples, such as oatmeal or muffins. It is hard to imagine how commercial syrups laden with artificial flavors, colors, and other content can even be marketed as syrup---this is the real deal.

I'm from Maine and I have to tell you that I would never buy grade A maple syrup. If I'm going to use maple syrup, I want that rich, distinctive taste, not something that's barely different than white sugar. That's actually a good comparison - grade A is to grade B as white is to brown sugar. I know we're all used to thinking of "grade A" as meaning of superior quality, but that's not how it works with this. It is referring to the level of filtering/processing the sap goes through. If you want generic sweetness, go grade A. For everything else, grade B. This is a trusted brand of organic syrup with a great flavor. By the way, for baking and real maple syrup afficionados, there is also a grade C (even darker)!
This is my favorite syrup. I was happy with the price, the shipping and the flavor of this syrup.  The 64 oz lasted a very long time.

just what i was looking for and at a WAY better price than my local health food store!

thanks!
Excellent syrup!  If you haven't tried REAL maple syrup then you are missing out.  Try this delicious treat on your next waffle/pancake/ect...
This has a nice full flavor. i thought that since this isn't made in Vermont it wouldn't be very good but it's just fine.

If you are thinking of doing the Master Cleanse, this is the product you are looking for.  It is reasonably priced, high quality and exactly fits all the specifications they recommend.  One note, if you are going to do the full 10 days you will either need 2 or an additional 32 oz. I personally liked it as a table syrup as well.  It's the "stout" of maple syrups.

The maple syrup is delicious!  The product was shipped very quickly.  I needed to talk with the shipper about a minor problem and they were very accommodating.  I would definitely buy from them again.
I use maple syrup for almost all of my sweetening - in baking, granola,whatever; and Now Grade B organic syrup is wonderful! We also received it within a few days of ordering.

I started using this product for the Master Cleanse (lemonade diet). I have tried other brands but found this one to be the best.  I highley recommend it.  The only problem I have found is in the shipping sometimes the plastic cap gets broken even though they pack it well the delivery people most likely have dropped it at some point.  Thats the way it goes sometimes.  Since the jug is sealed it's still usable.

I have all three in my frige, so I did taste test"s"?-

1. Just pouring straight into a spoon/tasting?-

Coombs
Highland
NOW

2. Heated 1/8cup (all 3), mixed in 1tsp of LandO'Lakes butter (Canola), and poured onto 3 Eggo Blueberry waffles?-

NOW Shines "On Food"!- I can Really taste the yummy maple, and not too sweet! :o)
Coombs was just OK- The maple was Very mild, but the sugary sweetness was overpowering (ALA Mrs. Butterworth's (HFCS!)).
Highland- Virtually tasteless, and I tossed it.
Awesome product looks good and tastes great!  Good price, too.  Bought this one from Supplement Warehouse.  Makes a great sweatener and tastes good by itself as well.

It took me almost 2 weeks to get the product only because it was out of stock, but I have no complaints really. I think I will have to put another order, for the master cleanse I dont think this will be enough for 10 days, I could be wrong.
Due to dietary restrictions, I cannot use this myself. However I sent this to my sister in Germany as part of her Christmas present. She absolutely RAVED about it!

Due to it's economy price, I was concerned about the quality before the order arrived. But when I received the order, I found the maple syrup has great taste with excellent flavor. The order arrived in time as expected. Good customer service. Highly recommended !

Based on the other 2 reviews I chose to give this brand of syrup a try.  WOW, it has a deep, rich, buttery flavor and aroma.  My husband has been wanting pancakes just so he can eat the syrup! I've used it for a Master Cleanse and don't know if it's the quality of the syrup or what, but have had better success with detoxing using this than a Grade A or other brand of Grade B (this is my 3rd MC).  I look forward to using this for breakfast and baking, I will reorder again and recommend to friends and family! It would make a great gift in a gourmet gift basket!

I have used real maple syrup for years.  When my kids were small I used the standard stuff until I started becoming a label reader, then I could not in good conscience continue to serve a product that amounted to a liquid chemical concoction.  I recently discovered grade B syrup, which has a stronger, more molassas kind of flavor.  Besides the obvious pancakes and french toast, I also use it on oatmeal and in baked goods.  Will continue to purchase.

This syrup is delicious! My husband and I had some this morning on our pancakes and we both loved it. However, my 8 year old son, whose taste buds have been conditioned to the tune of high fructose corn syrup type syrups, thought the taste was too strong. Hopefully his taste buds will develop and he will learn to like this as it is SO much healthier than the typical grocery store offerings. Will definitely purchase again!

This looks like a better deal than it REALLY is, and I wonder how many people who actually did the math for themselves would truly be pleased.

This product is listed as 64 ounces, for a cost of $39.75, and they break it down as $0.41 per ounce. This would be a fantastic deal.

HOWEVER, $39.75 for 64 ounces means this costs over $0.62 per ounce! This is not cool. I'm not sure if this was done intentionally, but it's bad business.

This is a nice way to go if you need maple syrup in bulk, like in order to do the Master Cleanse, like I did. It will last you nearly a week.  It is not too sweet, so you don't get a headache if you put a little too much on your pancakes, either.... wait - Is there such a thing as too much syrup on pancakes? No.

I have done the master cleanse several times and the last time I used Now's grade B syrup instead of buying it at our local health food store to save money.  It tastes great but I have health problems and the last few times I've done the cleanse I have felt really bad and I assume that is why and not because of the quality of the syrup. I only mention it in order to give an honest review...But as I said it tastes great so I assume if it were inferior it wouldn't..
The Maple Syrup was shipped very quickly.  We are very pleased with this seller and would purchsae from again and again!
I've ordered this syrup 4 times now and I use it for the Master Cleanse.  Tastes great and can be used for "regular" syrup as well.

Non-GE - "GE" stands for genetic engineering and is also referred to as GMO (genetically modified organism). Genetic engineering of food products uses gene splicing to overcome natural boundaries that would otherwise prohibit the creation of a product. Genes from different species can be combined to create a hardier product resistant to certain exogenous factors. As an example, you might be able to add fish genes to corn to make it resistant to pesticides. Although there may be "instant gratification" from such benefits as better taste, longer shelf life, and greater yield, serious concerns exist about the long-term ramifications of using these types of products and ingredients. Until more research backing the safety of GE products is available, we'll continue to make every effort to use only non-GE ingredients and products
I am very satisfied with this product.  I would purchase this item again. I did not give it 5 stars because I am not so knowledgeable on Maple Syrups to know if it is the best out there.
I can tell you it arrived in good shape and in good timing.  We have not opened it yet though.

THIS PRODUCT IS NOT AS IT APPEARS! THE BOTTLE IS TINY, BUT LOOKS LIKE A STANDARD 32oz BOTTLE, IN THE PICTURE! If you fall for the picture, as I did, without paying attention to the fluid oz. size, then you end up paying 30 dollars for a 32oz. bottle, which normally sells for under 20 dollars. Legal but very deceptive....BOYCOTT these Charlatans!

What does Non-GE mean?
One of the most annoying things about Amazon, whether the product be sold by them or through them, are the incomplete descriptions.
The information would be helpful to potential buyers and therefore to the seller. Incomplete descriptions only lead me to ask: what are they hiding, or, are they trying to dump something on the unsuspecting?
Product is listed as flaxseeds and that's what I received however, I was interested in flaxseed meal, as indicated in the product description.

I recently discovered ordering Bob's Red Mill products through Amazon for baking ingredients that may be difficult to find in local stores. I grind the whole flaxseeds to a meal using a coffee grinder and primarily use the flaxseed meal to replace all or some of the butter and oil in baked goods recipes. Sounds sketchy but it really does work - in my experience, even in yeast bread recipes! It has a very subtle, almost undetectable flavor and you'll see little flecks of the meal in your baked product, particularly if all white flour is used. Store ground flaxseed in fridge or freezer. Flaxseed meal has multiple health benefits including Omega-3's, lignans, fiber. Here's how to add the meal to your baked goods (copied from Livestrong.com):

-Add flaxseed meal to breads, muffins, pastries, cookies and other baked goods for extra nutrition and to produce a nutty flavor. According to the Barleans website, flaxseed meal should compose a minimum of 6 to 8 percent of the dry ingredients in any recipe.

-Replace the oil, shortening, butter or margarine with flaxseed meal in any baked goods recipe at a ratio of 3:1. If a recipe calls for 1/3 cup of oil, for example, replace with 1 cup flaxseed meal. Flaxseed meal has a high oil content, but contains less fat than most oils, shortening, butter and margarine.

-Reduce the flour in any baked goods recipe by 25 percent and replace with flaxseed meal. If a recipe requires 1 cup flour, for example, use 3/4 cup flour and 1/4 cup flaxseed meal instead. Using flaxseed meal this way adds a slight nutty flavor and a golden brown color to your baked goods.

-Use flaxseed meal as replacement for eggs in baked goods. Combine 1 tbsp. flaxseed meal with 3 tbsp. water for each egg and let the mixture stand for about five minutes before using in batters and doughs.

Much better than the crushed seeds I get a local store. I eat them every day in my oatmeal. When cooked, they swell a bit and are crunchy.

It's hard to find good sushi ginger when you live in a small midwestern city, so I am glad that I can get this product through Amazon.  I used it as an accompaniment for grilled tuna, sushi, and other Asian dishes.  It's also great as a little snack just by itself!

This ginger is very tasty on its own, with sushi, and with any seafood. I signed up for the Subscribe and Save program for this item, which gives 15% off the price and allows you to choose how often you want to receive the product (no obligation, no shipping charges.) Initially, I indicated 6 months, but my daughter and I ran out of it in a little more than a month, so I changed the order to be delivered every month. In addition, there is a promotion until March 31, 2010, which allows you to save an additional 10% (bringing it to 25% off) if you use the promo code ROLAND77
I love pickled ginger. This has a little more bite than I'm used to but it still has a wonderful sweet taste. I eat it with sushi or even with a sandwich like olives or pickles. It's good anytime.

I purchased 8 jars based on reviews I read.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the ginger compared to what I get in restaurants and what I buy at the store.  The ginger was much thicker that what I considered normal and not the "pink" color I was expecting.  The taste also was not what I consider to be "premium".  Maybe I just got a sub standard batch, but I definitely would not reorder this product.

When most reviews are so  good, I tend to be suspect of the  rare poor one. Unfortunately, after trusting the good reviews (and figuring the negative one was an outlyer of sorts), I purchased this ginger.  Extremely disappointed!  It is very thick - which to me is not a problem. But, it is unusually hot...I've never had HOT ginger before (spicy -yes,fire HOT- no).  Moreover, the balance of the spices/ingredients is just weird, leading to a very nasty bitter... almost chemical, lingering aftertaste, which I'm attributing to possibly (??) the type of or an overuse of preservative, since the nasty aftertaste isn't consistent with any of the common ingredients. If you must, try it for yourself (as did I), but be forewarned. Hopefully, I'll be able to send it back and get my return shipping reimbursed. This is NOTHING like the wonderful ginger served in a restaurant with sushi.

This Roland Sushi Ginger is my husband's favorite by far. I also think it tastes the best. It has just the right balance of ginger flavor and sweet and sour. We have tried two other brands and have found them wanting. One was waaay too salty. The other just didn't have enough of a ginger taste. We are patiently waiting for Amazon to return this brand to stock. I hope we don't have to wait too much longer. PLEASE, PLEASE bring it back.

For the most part, I really like this ginger. I would, however, encourage the company to use glass jars rather than plastic. I just don't trust plastic jars. In fact, I went ahead and emptied out all eight jars into one large, glass Mason jar. We go through ginger pretty quickly, so I'm not worried about it spoiling.
This is great to have for finishing up at your sushi party table. The ginger is so good even though you only need a little to complete ending a wonderful meal of sushi. So Good.

For those who like ginger, this product is fine on its own merits. However, for sushi, the product is not appropriate. For one thing, the slices are really thick and large which completely overwhelms the sushi flavour. Ginger is a supposed to be a complement to the sushi meal. The ginger should be thinly sliced, almost translucent. This is something else which is fine for other meals. For instance, I dice the slices for my other dishes.

I loved this product!!  I made sushi using the Sushezi and it came out great!!  For me, the ginger is the essential ingredient to finish the sushi. It can be a little thickly cut, but for me, this is not bothersome.  I will definitely order this again.

I used to spoon big gobbets of this stuff onto my plastic plate at salad bars, here in New York city, and was thrilled to find it was available as part of Amazon's Subscribe and Save program. By signing up for delivery at a specified interval, I saved 15% off the price, with every shipment coming free of shipping charges.

My elderly father, who favors rather sweet mango chutneys, was similarly enthralled, and we may have to invoke one of Amazon's Subscribe and Save options. You can order an additional shipment, or cancel a given shipment, at any time.

Great stuff, hard to find, sold in bulk, delivered free - that's Amazon.

I have been eating Sushi and Ginger for over 25 years and this is the worst Sushi Ginger I have ever tasted. Unfortunately, my entire family feels the same way and we're stuck with 8 jars of this stuff...

Received this ginger in the mail and at least two of the bottles were leaking.  The 'liner' used beneath the lids does not appear to be sealed well at all, on any of the bottles.  We were actually a little nervous about even eating any of the bottles.  After going through and tossing several, we decided to keep the remainder and re-package them in canning jars to help preserve them.  The ginger is sliced fairly thick and we have to cut it down to make it managable for eating on our sushi.  All in all, the flavor is decent, but a lot of tedious work to get to that point.  In the future, we will either can our own or try and find a local carrier to buy our sushi ginger.

The seller states in the product description that the quantity of Kefir grains will be enough to make one cup of milk. The amount I received was just over a teaspoon and the seller's directions which came with it said to put it in a quarter of a cup of milk. The grains seemed rather delicate and I've been "babying" them for about a week now and still haven't been able to make a cup of Kefir. Their fragile state was probably in part due to the way they were shipped. They were put without any liquid in a tiny, sealed, thin plastic envelope which was placed in an un-padded, business sized letter envelope. The $5.49 shipping seems rather steep for two stamps and a remarkable lack of special packaging. If I had it to do over again I would probably order from somewhere else. That being said, I have been able to make Kefir--albeit in doll portions---and the flavor is good.
Seller talks about growing kefir is like art, but the kefir that i got from him was flat. After readind on "DOM'S KEFIR" site i believe the grain was squeezed by the "Seller" ouch !

The grains were fresh and plump and produced Kefir well...re-produced more grains well also. They grew very quickly and we ended up eating many because they have re-produced so much.
I liked the recipes and instructions that came with them also.
I also appreciated the list of the numerous bacteria contained in kefir he/she included.

Good seller - good product. Sorry to see others had problems.

I bought grains from the Amazon seller "Drybyma Treasures" about a month and a half ago. I received them in 3 days, and they took about 3 days to recover from their ordeal in the mail, producing some very nasty sour-milk-tasting stuff the first day and some very yeasty-tasting stuff the second two days. But their fourth attempt was delicious and by now they've fully recovered and are reproducing like mad. Drybyma sent about 2 tablespoons of grains in the original package, but in a couple of weeks I had half a cup and a week after that I had almost a full cup of grains. I've had to give some grains away and eat some in order to keep the population down.

The grains looked like cottage cheese curds when they first arrived. But then they started producing noodle-like shapes and recently began producing tiny cauliflower shapes. It's interesting how they develop.

The kefir they produce tastes similar to the kefir I used to buy at my neighborhood Whole Foods store. Sometimes it's more tart than other times, and thickness also varies. I've used both Jersey milk and goat's milk. The thickest, mildest kefir I've made was with raw light cream.

Unfortunately Drybyma doesn't seem to be selling kefir grains at the moment. Perhaps they sold out and need to rebuild their stock. Hopefully they'll return so other shoppers can enjoy their product. I can't really rate any other seller's kefir grains because quality can vary.
I don't think the seller, greenyoung, could have possibly sent a smaller amount of kefir.  will buy from another supplier.

Real-man-of-genius provides excellent and timely support for his kefir grains. I just received mine and had a question which I posted late last night.  This morning to my suprise the answer arrived.  I look forward to making my kefir.
Not only did the product arrive in a super speedy manner, but the grains are of the highest quality. We've been making kefir that is out of this world!!!
these things grow so fast I have way too much now.  They are real easy to care for and produce great kefir.

The grains I got didn't look like the one you see on the pic. The one I got had to come from Antarctida bec they were yellow (probably they were frozen before)they also not growing...the amount I got was invisible to my eyes, I complain to the seller so they send me a little more grains but they were still yellow and kind of dead bec they didnt grow. If you want to waste $10 and some time go for it!!! I would really recommend to order it somewere else.
I can't say enough how happy I am. I got my grains on November 5th and just yesterday I gave I tbls to a friend. I am Making delicious kefir everyday.

I used organic whole milk** to try to grow the grains from the scant teaspoon I received from the seller. The milk didn't develop a sourish smell, so I guess it stayed fresh, even after 30 days, but I had few and very small--size of uncooked rice--grains. I will stay with the packaged Kefir Starter that I've used for years and which I purchase from Amazon.com.

Though I received a couple of pages of instructions from the seller, whose product is shown here at Amazon, those instructions didn't really help me, a novice at growing my own grains. I haven't bothered to contact the seller for help and/or more grains, because it seems a waste of time. I would guess from reading his enclosed instructions that while he tried to be helpful he doesn't really know how to instruct a novice in using the small amount of grains he sent.

I am guessing that the pics showing huge grains on websites could just be marketing examples wherein the grower has been using raw milk or something like it. That's just a guess on my part, and if that is the case, it is an example of good marketing, but the sites need to give more-helpful information to the novice.

**Perhaps that was my problem? At any rate, I love, love, love kefir as do my kittykats.

The grains arrived in less than one week from date of order.  There were a few yellowish curds with a milky coating in a plastic baggy, inside a small brown envelope.  I placed them in milk and a day later the milk had curdled.  I strained and got a very watery whey that I drank.  It had a curious taste, not unpleasant, but not yogurt-like, as I had expected.  I put all the curds back in the jar and covered them with a cup of milk.  The next day the whey was more white, but very watery.  It took about ten days of this routine before I was getting a good creamy kefir through the strainer and a good separtion of the grains for re-culturation.  I'm seeing an increase in the number of grains each week, but not overwhelming.  I think my strainer allows some of the very small ones through.  It's an interesting process and I love the results.  My wife's heartburn has disappeared in the past month and I attribute it to the kefir.

This is my first experience ordering kefir grains and growing them. It seemed to me that
the shipping and handling charge were rather high for such a small amount (size of a
walnut or less.) Also the directions should have come with the grains - not 6 days later
via email. Why so much later? By then I had already handled them following directions
from my son who had recommended a source for them. So, I was not pleased.
Carolyn Hocker, Newville, PA.

The Kefir grains arrive in good shape and packaged very well.  I used them in raw goat milk but did not have great success.  I did send an e-mail to the seller but never had a reply.  I eventually discarded the grains.

Grains came very quickly. Produce great tasting kefir and multiply like rabbits. My girlfriend and I have been selling our new grains to locals and giving them away to family and friends. In about 1 months, we had 8x as many grains as we started with.

The kefir granules arrived in excellent condition.  I followed the instructions but found that my granules "worked" very fast and required a quart of milk very soon after I got them.  The first 2 weeks the kefir was very watery, as the granules were "settling in."  I had to leave for a short trip, so I put a batch in the fridge for 2-3 days.  Ever since then the kefir (I make 4-day-old kefir cheese rather than 1-day-old kefir) has been beautiful and creamy and very tangy.  I'm getting used to the flavor, introducing it to lots of friends, and enjoy making it!  It's so easy.  I love that you just throw it in a clean jar with milk and put it in the cupboard for 1-4 days.  No cooking.  The straining is easy and the whey is super sour.  I use it in smoothies and use it to ferment/pickle veggies.  Best of all, the kefir cheese is high in vitamins as well as being a fantastic probiotic.  I don't think I'll ever stop drinking/eating it.  I do a lot of traveling, but I can easily take it with me in a 3 oz. or smaller glass bottle that I keep in my hand-checked bag when I go on trips.  I use fresh (or powdered if fresh is unavailable) goat milk and it's really good and healthy.

First batch was lost in the mail so a second batch was promptly sent.  The amount of grains was small but you do not need a lot!  After several months, the grains are about two tablespoons in size.  I have already given some away to other kefir drinkers here in Brazil.
I got the Kefir from BIGGIRL22 and received it in 2 days from the order.  The grains were plump and practically ready to go!
The first time I received the grains, they didn't grow at all. The second time I received them for free, they grew wonderfully.Thanks!

I made the mistake of putting too much milk in the jar the first time I made kefir with these grains (old habit) but thought, what the heck, it won't hurt the grains. In 24 hours I strained the milk out of the grains and added just less than a pint (about 12 ounces) of milk to them the second time (I drank the slightly soured milk from the first batch--not bad) Within 24 hours that short pint had turned into the thickest, smoothest, yummiest kefir ever! I've made 2 more batches since and the last one was with 3 cups of milk. Absolutely perfect. I'm convinced that my next batch will do a full quart. Highly recommend this product.

PS: I use a low heat pasteurized milk. I would not recommend using regular pasteurized milk and absolutely DO NOT use ultra-pasteurized milk. Raw milk will work but only for the first and maybe second batch as the wild bacteria in the raw milk compete with the kefir grains. If you use raw milk then always let your kefir grains renew themselves in some pasteurized milk.

These work exactly as described. It took about a week before the Kefir tasted the way I like it, but now it's great. I experimented a little with the timing, but prefer approximately 24 hours per batch. The instructions were fine and they offered a phone number for questions.

**NOTE** When I bought this item, it was sold by "Lifetime Kefir." That no longer appears to be the case.

I received about a teaspoon of live milk kefir grains with my purchase and I was not expecting very much out of them, but after a week of following the enclosed directions I had kefir. At first I only got about a cup of kefir every 24-48 hours, but the grains grew very quickly. After less than a month, I am now getting a pint or more of kefir every 24 hours and I now have several tablespoons worth of grains.

I was rather wary about buying this product after seeing some of the reviews, but it was well worth the money.

I received about a teaspoon of kefir grains in the mail a little more than a week ago. They have since multiplied into well over a tablespoon. I've bought several kefir cultures before and none ever grew nearly that quickly. These grains make a good potent kefir too! This can also be used to make a very flavorful, yummy cheese. Be sure to follow the seller's instructions closely, as these little buggers are potent!

The flavor of this is much stronger than store-bought kefir. If you aren't used to the taste you can try mixing it with fruit juice.

If you end up with too many grains, and can't give them away, you can eat the extras. They're good with honey. (If you're not used to eating kefir grains you should start with a small amount.)

If you have any problems, the seller is very nice and extremely helpful. Probably the nicest person I've dealt with on Amazon.

I purchased these grains a few weeks back. There weren't very many in the small plastic envelope and I wasn't sure how this would turn out. Well, They are finally multiplying and I was able to get a first decent batch yesterday. They still have a long ways to go to produce a pint or two a day but at least they were alive and are doing well. I expected more for the money, but in the end, I got what I wanted.

When the grains arrived, they we're in the form of a liquid. I was concerned that they looked nothing like actual grains. The seller sent along instructions which addressed this. Having been my first experience with grains, I didn't know what to expect. Her instructions, which also contained a source where I could learn more, we're invaluable. The seller was communicative and helpful; standing behind her product if I wasn't satisfied. My grains continue to grow and I am delighted by the service and product. Thank you.
When the tiny bit of kefir came I immediately ordered a more expensive product thinking I'd never get anything out of this.  I was wrong--This product is doing everything I wanted and more.

The live kefir grains are amazing! I received them quickly and they were packed in a sanitary and tightly sealed manner. I am extremely satisfied with this product. They are performing better than my expectations, thank you amazon.com
I was very leary about buying online. Amazon.com has shone me otherwise.
I've made a new batch of kefir via these seeds every day for 2 1/2 years or so and have shared the extra seeds with many. So far so good!
I was so impressed with how quickly the grains grew and really love having the healthy milk drink.  We milk so the grains go into fresh milk right from the cow.  I am using keifer cheese too.

These arrived as described. I got them into milk as soon as I could and they have responded very nicely. After about 3 days, as I have replaced the milk about every 12 hours, they've grown and seem to be doing very well.

I recieved the grains within a couple of days of placing my order. They arrived in great condition. I followed the directions included in the package and was amazed at how quickly they multiplied. It has been a little over 2 weeks and I have more grains than I need (that's a good thing). The product was everything I'd hoped for. Thank you.

Kefir grains purchased on Amazon.com.After 4 weeks I am just begining to get a consistent yield, during this time I have had everything from dirty water to soft cheese and the flavors are all over the place. It takes some trial and error, timing and temperature are critical and cause tremdous variations. However for 3days I have been yielding good consistent product and the nuts are increasing in size.

The kefir grains were delivered properly packaged and protected. I was pleased with the result after only one try. I had heard that the first two attempts may be a little bitter, but the second attempt was great. I need this for a medical condition and I am glad to finally find a good product.

These Kefir grains were very much alive when they arrived, about 1/2 tsp, still moist...after 3 feedings...they grew, and grew!! I have had other grains that have died off.
Highly recommend!!
Arrived very fresh and ready to go. I had kefir within 48 hours. Tasty and healthy it is now a regular part of our diet.

Arrived 04-13-2010. By noontime
bath on 15th. Already separating and
lovely large kernels on top.
Using room temp whole organic milk
( Organic Valley) and pouring just about
one cup into kefir. Stir about, not even close,
to 12 hours and bathing in another cup
of milk next 12 hours. Already too thick
to strain thru bouquet garni bag ( just clear
whey came thru) and almost too thick to
strain thru one layer of cheesecloth.
Yellowish-clear layer of separation just
halfway down glass about 1/4" band and
fat kernels crusting up on top of milk when
time for bath. Just let it sit on table with
papertowel tied over top. Next time I shall drink some!

ive had kefir grains in the past and these were never solid.  there was not a clump that I could strain out to save for the next batch.  I tried working with it to make it work hoping they would "grow" so I could have a  grain to strain out.  this never happened.  when i wrote them about it they said i was past 90 days.  well i guess i shouldn't have spent so long trying to make it work.
My grains are dead. Where the heck do I contact these people to send me a knew one? Poor packaging. 2 teaspoons worth of Kefir. No instructions. Please send me some new kefir, thanks.

I am really dissapointed with the product. I received less than half a teaspoon. I has been really hard to make then to work. I've had kefir pearls before. I know how to take care of them. I would not reccomend this seller. Try a different one.
I started making my own Kefir with this product and had great results from the very beginning.  The grains grew fast and are very healthy.

This is not for the weak! It requires work and I mean DAILY maintenance to grow your grains and maintain them. I can buy a few people getting "bad grains" but most are probably irritated by how much work it is. You have to keep them fed and alive and you have to care. It's ok if you give up and decide it's just not for you, but don't blame the seller for your own issues. My sister in law got me interested but her milk grains were suffering because she was using Raw milk. SHE researched (not me) that using low pasturized milk helped to grow the grains so when i bought my own (from this seller) I took her advice and used low pasturized milk only as a start. HOLY COW! I uploaded a picture of my grain and it is HUGE. That is just ONE grain mind you, I have either gifted the others, used them for making cheese or (sniff, sniff) tossed them in the disposal because I don't need that much kefir. Most of my grains I have gifted have been murdered because the folks who took them didn't like the maintenance they require. It is hard work people, but it's all about what you are willing to put yourself through for good health. It's ok if you can't handle it, life is hard enough but like I said, don't blame the seller just because you couldn't hack it! Just FYI (more sis in law research here) for a casein and lactose free diet you must let the grains sit for at least 25 - 28 hours. I screwed up and only did 24 hrs and my son is supposed to be on a casein free diet so be careful... It's a science after all. My grain is now large enough that I can use raw milk but I have noticed I still have to rock back and forth between low pasturized and raw in order to keep the grain healthy. I'm sure some folks would disagree with me but I'm just going on my own experience here and the proof is in the pudding so to speak. Have fun!

Excellent! The  "grains" arrived quickly. I read the easy to follow directions and then got to work. My friends, these"grains", moved fast. I quickly had two then four cups of kefir. For two people, we are getting plenty of kefir. In fact, I regularly put the starter jar in the refrigerator to slow the growth down. My "grains" have grown, so I now have a dehydrated  batch of grains, in case something goes wrong. The kefir is delicious! The kefir "grains" are happy and we are happy. Very pleased with the product and the supplier!

I just received our kefir grains in the mail.  There was about a tsp of healthy looking grains.  After 12 hours of doing what the instructions said, the grains already doubled in size.  Very, very happy with this seller!

I don't know if I'm doing it wrong or if the kefir grains I have are not any good. I've had the milk grains for about 3 weeks and I'm following the directions exactly. The grains are actually growing but every batch that I've made has that rotten sour milk taste.  Any tips that anybody might have that could save this batch or do I just chuck these and start a new?  The water grains I got you are doing great.
Purchased live kefir grains. was afraid that they would suffer in shipping, but they are strong and healthy and producing good kefir. Very pleased. Thank you.

I bought these to avoid paying high prices for kefir in the store when I could culture it myself. I've been culturing my own kefir for over 3 months now and have been able to share grains with family and friends. I have no reservations recommending this product!

I received my kefir grains well within the time allotted.  As I'm new to kefir making, I was happy to see the excellent instructions included with my order.  Believe it or not, I still found a way to screw things up (by using milk kefir grains to make water kefir!) and sent off an email to Seller. Actually I sent three emails, and all three were promptly answered, with all the help I could ever ask for.  As I had perhaps ruined my kefir grains (too early to tell), Seller offered to replace them!  I can't imagine anyone being unhappy with this Seller's service, and I'm betting I'll have some very good kefir before too long!

These great grains! I kept them in my refrigerator for over a month before starting to grow them. In only a little over a week, I'm making 2 cups of kefir a day,it tastes great, and the grains are growing very well. My first Kefir making experience has been a success! Thanks!

The first time I gave my cats this cat nip, I put a little on their toys, scratching post and left to go to work, (my usual routine if I leave for more than a few hours). When I cam home,late that day, my most lazy and independent cat, Luna would not stop following me around. He cried and purred and wanted to be on my lap and in general, acted super weird. I phoned my husband in a panic - I was so sure he was ill! We retraced Luna's day together - I had forgotten about the new 'nip- My husband started laughing.."He's stoned!" What? "It's the new Catnip!" Oh. That was the only new thing and Luna was just super happy.
Well, I started giving waaaaay less catit nip in the morning before leaving or whenever, and now they are more normal, but even the other guy, Besos, actually climbs into the csbinet to try to find the catit 'nip if I don't give them some! They are acting younger again! they have never loved 'nip before, just kind of played with it, ate it and acted like, hey this stuff is pretty good, thanks.... Now they ask for it. Cute! Get some, but don't give too much the first time!

This review is for the 1.7 ounce bottle. I bought some, because I do not like the fact that over 95% of Equal is dextrose, sugar (only 1.7% is aspartame). White sugar is a mix of dextrose and fructose.

First off the white powder you get is sweet and tastes just like Equal to me. For one gallon of tea I use 0.5 grams of the aspartame powder. If you use too much you will get the bitter taste. This is true also with Equal, if you put too many packets in it tastes bad.

I fixed this problem long ago, I never use just Equal. In the early days of my usage I added white sugar. Then later I found I could drop the sugar and replace it with Sweet'N Low. So to my tea I used 10 packets of Equal to 4 packets of Sweet'N Low. You can drink as much as you like all day long without an after taste. So with the aspartame powder, to my 0.5 grams of the aspartame I add the 4 packets of Sweet'N Low.

The real problem with powdered Aspartame is it does not dissolve in water well. It is a very fine powder and can't break the water's surface tension. It tries to clump and even when not clumped it forms a cloudy water. You solve this by the same method of making gravy from starch. You put your powder in a small bowl and add water drop by drop and make a paste. Then dissolve the paste in the water of your tea or whatever you are sweetening.

But this is why the powdered Aspartame is packaged with dextrose in the Equal packets. So the particles of Aspartame are separated by the dextrose particles. Thus it dissolves.

Just to be clear- this is not authentic French onion soup.

I've made the real thing- versions that require a few days and a lot of beef to make the stock, and those are delightful if one has the time and money and dedication.

This kit is for when one does NOT have that time, money, and dedication. It also has some rather odd- as French onion soups go- but flavorful additions such as carrots and tiny lentils.

However, when made up it is easy and very good; it does not taste like it was made from a mix; it does have a lot of onion flavor- rather the point of FOS; and the added ingredient list is not excessive (to my recollection, it calls for a sauteed sweet onion in butter, 6 cups low-sodium beef broth, apple juice, and Worcestershire sauce).

I served it with gruyere toasts: pieces of italian bread, toasted, with gruyere melted onto them, as a nod to the classic "croutons",and my family liked it very much.

Sauteed browned mushrooms would be an excellent addition, which I will do if I make this again!
I made the French Onion soup and Didn't care much for it. Maybe I put to much onion in it.

I'm a big spice mix fan and have to give a strong thumbs-up for Chef Tom's Bengal Masala Rub. Surprisingly, this is neither a 'burn your mouth hot' rub, nor is it even heavy on the cumin and curry flavors. (Though why *wouldn't* you be surprised, given the exceedingly generic Product Description that Amazon lists for this mix!)

There really isn't a single dominant note in this rub, it's a balance of cardamom, smoked paprika, garlic, and even (I suspect) cinnamon. I'd advise people who want to kick things up a notch to add a dash of cayenne or black pepper.

This works very well on lamb, chicken, and (surprisingly!) fish such as catfish or snapper. Tends to be lackluster on red meats and fish like tuna and salmon.

Only the two standout mixes that Chef Tom sells: Chef Tom Douglas Rub With Love Salmon Rub and Chef Tom Douglas Rub With Love Chicken Rub are better than this one, mostly due to their extra versatility.

I was first introduced to the Rub with Love products through the Salmon rub, which is one of my favorites. When my local store stopped carrying it, I looked it up on Amazon, I was pleased to find the whole line of rubs.

My favorite use of the Bengal Masala Rub is when roasting root vegetables in the oven. It's also great on baked chicken.

This is the tastiest spice!  I mix it with olive oil, rub it on boneless chicken breasts and cook for about 30 -45 minutes, then serve with hot or sweet mango chutney, everyone raves about it!  Has a little bite to it, also good on mild fish.  Don't pass this one up!

We have used Tom Douglas' rubs for years now. I first found them at a winery on the east side of Washington state. Nice to see them available on Amazon with the free shipping. I love the masala, I cook with chicken breast, with ginger and cilantro, remove chicken, then add either coconut milk or 1/2n1/2 with chicken broth (also some cashews sauted in sesame oil on the side). I agree with the other reviewer not too spicy but lots of flavor.

For more spicy hot, I use the Tokoyo rub in my steak fajitas and use the Peri Peri on chicken cooked on the grill for spicy chicken sandwiches.

I've been using barley and wheat grass juice for about 20 years. I use to grow a lot of it myself, juice it, and drink it. In recent years I have travelled extensively and don't have the circumstances for growing and juicing barley/wheat grass. (from this point on I'll simply refer to barley grass, although all statements also apply to wheat grass).

In recent years I have watched a multitude of cheap barley/wheat grass powders make their way onto the market. Please note that most of these products are, in my opinion, next to useless. They are made from whole dried barley/wheat grass--cellulose and all. The primary concept of having barley/wheat grass is to have the juice, free of the almost indigestible cellulose fibre of the leaf. All the early research on the many benefits of barley grass was from ingesting the pure, fresh juice. Then a process was developed (in Japan, as far as I am aware) to spray dry the juice whilst keeping most of the enzymes and nutrients intact. That processed involved using using simple sugars as a medium to help the juice turn to powder. The result is a high quality product, but one that is not pure juice powder.

Fast forward many years, and I come across the grass juice products from Pure Planet. As you will see from my review on Just Barley - Organic Barley Juice - 80 gram - Powder I give it five stars.

Having used 5 or so jars of this product from Now Foods I have to say the product seems identical enough that I can't tell the difference. However, Now Foods gives you 118 grams for (currently) around $20 on Amazon. The Pure Planet product on Amazon is (currently) around $14 to $15. When you do the math, the Now Foods product is almost half the price.

Obviously the many barley grass powders (not JUICE powder) as going to be a lot cheaper, but I really don't think it's worth it. Much of the nutrients in those powders are still going to be bound up in hard-to-digest cellulose, and they are far less concentrated. I've tried a few and they taste pretty poor and don't give me the lift I get from JUICE powder.

Stash Chamomile Herbal Tea is tea bags with dried, crushed chamomile flowers.

Honestly, as far as I'm concerned, chamomile is chamomile. I suppose that when you use loose flowers you get sediment in the cup and I have seen this happen with some brands of chamomile tea bags, these don't do that.

I have also had organic chamomile (this isn't) but I can't taste the difference.

Each bag is individually packaged and that is either good or bad depending on how and where you use it and if you are concerned about excessive packaging.

If you like chamomile tea, this is a good choice.

I would give it a 4.5 if the grading system would allow. Taste bud friendly: I love a dark and oily bean and this one satisfies the foodie in me. Pocket book friendly: Buying bulk beans and using super saver helps save money. Environmentally friendly: This last Earth Day I learned about the importance of shade grown coffee; buying it is one small thing I can do to have a positive effect on the environment. Although these are not listed as shade grown beans, after contacting the company I've learned that they are. I like that I can save money, satisfy my foodie nature, and help the environment.

The beans are large and evenly roasted, with no "quakers" --the runty, wizened bits that Cook's Illustrated determined are the cause of that truck-stop coffee flavor. It's organic, and has a nice rich smooth dark taste that isn't burned at all.
We spent several months trying various organic coffees that amazon.com sells. There were two that were our favorites. This is one of them. It is not acid and it has a wonderful flavor.

Buying direct from Amazon via a monthly subscription has ensured that this coffee arrives quickly and in the freshest condition possible. Oh, and did I mention that it is $5.00 cheaper than anywhere else?  And free shipping to boot!  Wonderful bistro flavor is now possible in my own home with this fabulous, rich, organic coffee. I am a die hard coffee snob and this is simply the best brew out there in my humble opinion!

My taste runs to a bold Dark Roast, with lots of flavor- i.e. Cafe Altura Dark Roast Peruvian/Sumatran.

This is a bland/tasteless Breakfast type blend, with no distinctive flavor (2 rounded tbs per 6oz)- i.e. Folgers Classic.

I like to switch around to different Organic beans (no burn-out), and was hoping to add this to the list?- NOT!

Now I'm stuck using these beans up.
A great value on subscribe and save and great flavor! This is a superb organic coffee.

This is a very fine coffee indeed.  The roast is not too dark not too light.  I believe the beans are from Chiapas Mexico and have a very clean effect.  I don't get all jittery and sweaty like some other coffee beans do to me.  Highly recommended.

I like dark roasts.  I like a strong cup of coffee - as strong as it can be without tasting burnt or bitter.  I like this better than comparable roasts I have bought from Starbuck's, Tully's and Millstone.  It's really, really good.

EXCELLENT dark roast coffee.  It compares with the expensive brands - and you can't beat the price.  We are a bit on the "coffee snob" side, so I am happy to have found coffee that we love that is affordable.

I bought a pod coffee maker because I was wasting whole pots of coffee just to have one cup.  I never thought I'd be dissatisfied with the pods.  Heres's what I think - if you can see through the coffee, it's not coffee - it's tea.  These Buzzworthy pods are great, and I think they're comparable to Starbucks - which is, in my opinion, a good thing.

I'm from Greece and there's no such thing as "instant greek coffee". There seems to be a confusion among reviewers between "frappe" and "greek aka turkish coffee", we are talking about two completely different kinds of coffee. To make frappe,which is cold coffee, you can use ANY KIND of instant coffee, add cold water, milk (if you want), and ice cubes,shake and serve in a tall glass. To make traditional greek aka turkish coffee (the one served in a small cup like espresso) you need a DIFFERENT TYPE OF COFFEE (eg Loumidis papagalos greek coffee). This kind of coffee is made by adding coffee, sugar (if you want) and water in a tiny boiling pan (called ibrik) and slowly bring it to a boil until the coffee rises. Nescafe classico is a very nice coffee, but it's totally different than the traditional greek/turkish coffee.It can only be used for cold frappe or hot instant, NOT traditional greek coffee.
Perfect for a classic Frappe! Enjoy. Make sure you purchase the coffee packed in Greece, as others are different and will alter the taste of a classic Greek iced Frappe or hot Ness.

I've been looking for a decent instant coffee, and since I like Greek coffee, decided to give this a try. Long story short, it's not bad stuff -- but since I don't read Greek, it's taken a lot of experimentation with amounts to get the amounts right. I find that if I don't use enough of the instant granules, I get a thin acidic cup, so I personally use about two tablespoons per cup of hot water.

Remember that this is intended to taste like strong Greek coffee, not drip-brew, and is best taken with sugar, no cream. I normally take my coffee black, but this doesn't taste quite right to me without a little sugar.
Great item. Tastes fantastic and smooth. Perfect for the tea enthusiast! I will buy again. The package also reseals easily.

This is a strong, quality mate.  The mint flavor is faint, perhaps due to the use of spearmint instead of stronger peppermint (a personal preference).  Yet it's just enough to add a pleasant, cooling effect to the mate bitterness and earthiness.

Was not worth buying. Prepared according to directions and ended up in the trash. Batter was extremely thick, the bread did not rise and had no taste to it.  Now I'm stuck with the remaining three which I'll need to figure out how to doctor the recipe in order to have better luck next time.  I can make much better pumpkin bread from scratch using my own recipe.

If you need a brick that tastes like flour, is heavy enough to keep the car from rolling, and has no taste, color, or smell of pumpkin or spice, buy this mix. It was quite a disappointment. I made two loaves, just in case the first was a fluke and the second was worse than the first.
I tried 2 of 4 in the bread machine and both came out like uncooked dough.  I couldn't find an expiration date on the packages.  Could have been old or just a bad product.

The package suggests adding nuts, raisins, grated carrots and coconut.  I added only pecans and raisins.  The next time I will try the other suggestions.  The bread is very good, just sweet and spicy enough.  I ordered more.

I considered buying these in bulk here on Amazon, then realized that i would be over paying! The very same bars are $3 for a box of 8... to get 48 bars, would would be spending $18, instead of $22+ (shipping, tax, etc). Plus, then i can choose the variety of flavors we want, not what is pre-boxed. While some of the bulk items here are a deal, many are not!

Having 3 athletic teens, we're always feeding them and their friends.  Better than chips and candy bars to ward off their munchies and cravings, we subscribe to a frequent delivery of a case of these from Amazon to get an even better price, and keep our closet stocked with bars like this instead of junk foods.  Our kids grab these in the morning on the way too school, keep them tucked in their backbacks for quick nibble-fixes during the day, and if their friends come over after school or if they have team events to go to and have a quick hunger attack.  These are handy and filling, and a great Amazon Prime value.

My son is not a breakfast eater at ALL. He hates to
eat anything in the morning. I tried everything
and he finally will eat these. It is nice because
then he can eat them in the car or on the way to the
bus. And if he doesn't finish it, no big deal, like it
was when I would get up half an hour early to make him
a breakfast sandwich. ;) These are a great price for the
amount of bars, and taste wonderful, too!

These Nutri-Grain Kellogg's Cereal Bars aren't as horrible as you'd expect.  In fact they actually taste pretty good.  No, nothing will ever be able to replicate an actual bowl of cereal on a hungry Monday morning, but when you're late for work and having trouble getting the kids out the door and to the bus stop in time, you can count on a nice healthy cereal bar as a worthwhile alternative.  These are significantly more delicious than pop tarts too.  I never understood the appeal of pop tarts- whether in a toaster or eating cold, they still taste horrendous.  Cereal bars -especially these ones- are much better.  Your tastebuds will thank you... and thank me for the recommendation, haha.
48 pack is nice, and the variety is great! A good healthy choice for snacks. Since I don't have a Sam's club membership, buying off of amazon was an excellent idea.

I like the taste. It is not that nutritious as one would think as it has high fructose corn syrup but it is still better than eating lots of candy or chips for snack. I keep it in my office and eat it on the days when I forgot to carry a snack.
Nothing surprising here. The product arrived on time and is what I had expected. Also, it was a good deal.
I love these soft delicious fruit bars in the morning with my tea--this was more economical to buy in bulk--being a prime member I also had no shipping cost...
Brought these for my grandson and he loved them. They received them fast and were freash and not outdated or ready to expire.
The products came in timely manner, fresh and packaging was in good condition. Which is important to me.
These are great, my kids love them and so do I! I got them on sale here for about $ 13 with free prime shipping! Great Deal! Also they were fresh and within expiration
I love these things. And I love getting a big box so that I don't have to spend $1 for each one in the vending machine at work. Good stuff.
I hope that Kelloggs stops trying to save $.01 cent by using High Fructose instead of sugar and gets out of bed with the US Corn Industry.

Do not bother buying this product. It is processed food. The definition of unhealthiness, it does not fill you up at all. It makes you feel sick after wards. America does not need to be any fatter than it already is, so please go to the grocery store and buy something healthy for your kids.
Freeze the concentrate in ice cube trays.  Put 4 cubes in a blender with 1 TBS powdered plain yogurt.  Add milk to cover cubes and blend.  OUTSTANDING!!
This is the best flavor that Dr. Smoothie makes. All of the flavors are good and natural but this one is the best. Great taste of pineapple and a hint of coconut!

Zoe is made from big fat olives that are meaty and buttery tasting. When my husband and I went to the Pennsylvania Macaroni Company in Pittsburgh, PA, the olive oil buyer guided us through our first olive oil purchase. She had us eat the olives that went into different kinds of olive oil and then pick the olives we liked best. Our first purchase of Zoe was the result. It is an olive oil with a distinctly buttery taste. I use it in baking cakes whenever oil or melted butter is called for. It tastes great! Absolutely great! Plus, it's heart healthy, which butter is not. Sigh. Other olives, particularly Italian olives that are made into olive oil are very peppery. Hence, their oil is peppery. This might be what other people are talking about when they say they don't like Zoe. Zoe is not a bit peppery. So please, you must try for yourself in this case. It is not a good idea to take anyone else's product review for olive oil to heart. (a pun!) You must decide what you like in an olive oil and buy according. Also, I want to mention that the buttery taste stays there even through a saute. We bought different types of Italian olive oil in smaller bottles that same first time at the Pennsylvania Macaroni Company, and then we came home and made fried eggs with all of them. In that venue the taste of the olive oils really came through and Zoe kept that buttery taste. Good eating!

I have tried a lot of olive oils in the past, and being on a tight budget, I try to stay in the lower price range category. As you can imagine, I've ended up with some really lacking oils. Not so with Zoe Organic! This olive oil is light and mild with an excellent clean taste that doesn't overpower the flavor of what you're cooking (I like that in an olive oil!). Perfect for salad dressings, sauteing, baking, etc. There's nothing I wont use this oil in. Another plus is the size, no more trying to find a cabinet space tall enough for a tall bottle of oil. I've finally found an affordable winner!

The EVOO is as tasty as described in other reviews. I thought I'd comment on the container. It is hard to open at best. The green pouring spout is accessed by pulling a ring pull which is very hard to pry up. Then it takes considerable pulling to expand the pour spout. The cap then unscrews however it is very hard to pour without a large amount of residue accumulating on the top of the container.
I recommend the oil but also recomment decanting it into another container or pouring bottle.

I bought this olive oil since it was organic, and went through 6 (750 mL) cans on a subscription, but in the end I decided to stop buying it. I bought this oil to be my basic mid-priced olive oil primarily for sauteing. I like all sorts of olive oil -- from soft and buttery to peppery and green. This oil has a heavy woody scent, not as fragrant as other good EVOO in this price range. Sampled uncooked, the oil has mild initial taste, not much olive flavor at all, but not unpleasant, but what I didn't like is its harsh after-taste. It was not good in salad dressings. With other flavorings, the harshness is muted but still remains. In cooked dishes any olive oil flavor mostly disappears. In the same price range, I've had better luck with obscure Spanish or Greek 1 L cans of EVOO from the supermarket.

I usually use Bariani of California, and that stuff is like GOLD.  You could sip it from a spoon, no kidding.  But there is no way would I ruin the delicate flavor by heating it or cooking with it.  So I tried Zoe Organic EVOO, really not expecting much, hoping it would be "good enough" for baking and stir-frying.  I was really pleasantly surprised!  It is stronger than I'm used to, but still mild enough to not overpower things like pie crusts and cookies.  I am back to renew my subscription for this great, all purpose EVOO!

The price and quality of this product are both fantastic. I love that the dark, tin container greatly protects the taste and integrity of the oil (versus the typical glass bottle). However, there is an inherent problem with the pouring spout. It is plastic and very short. This leads to oil dripping on the top during usage, which is both wasteful and messy. If the manufacturer would alter that one component, this would be the perfect organic olive oil.
Good stuff -- but make sure you have a bottle to decant into. You will just make a mess if you try to pour from this container.

I like that the Zoe olive oil comes in the metal containers, as opposed to plastic. The packaging was good; there was not the slightest dent in either can.

But there's the BPA thing. Buying organic, you'd like to know there's not any bpa in the lining of the can, lurking there for months, canceling out part of the benefit of organic. If Zoe does not tell us, we have to assume the bpa is there, as in other canned foods. I did a casual search but wasn't able to find out anything specific for Zoe on this. The same casual search turned up many questions about bpa, no definitive answers.

I did find a 2003 government sponsored scientific study --- [...] that found BPA was taken up by (absorbed into) olive oil in greater amounts than either water or 3% acetic acid! Apparently, BPA links with lipid molecules very easily.

Why can't we be sure, 8 years later, that BPA isn't leaching into food? Unfortunately, I found that study link AFTER I'd bought these two tins, so the only thing to do is tranfer contents into glass and refrigerate. I always keep olive oil refrigerated after opening anyway, in spite of the inconvenience when it solidifies and you have to pour warm water over the container to get it to pour.

There's the pouring problem... I'd read reviews beforehand, so I knew that you had to pull on the green tab to raise the plastic spout. However, I usually don't pour much at one time, so am still getting a bit of dribble onto the top of the can. So the plastic spout isn't working for me. I'm considering glass containers such as the Global Amici drizzlers, just for pouring; this must be a common problem with olive oil.

I can't detect anything buttery about Zoe Organic's taste. And it's not as olive-like a taste as Colavita, for example.

Next time, organic or not, I'll try something else for more flavor and to use as a dipping oil. I'd consider the Zoe special varieties, but apparently they come in plastic containers, with no BPA disavowal in the descriptions. With so many plastic items being imported from places with little manufacturing controls, it's not sure that any disavowal could be trusted, anyway.

Was looking for a real good olive oil,just happened upon Zoe.Has to be the best oil I have tasted.So rich and beautiful as a good oil should be. Also like that it is from Spain .Have read how good their oils are ,have to say its true.Love it.Cant beat the price on AMAZON.

Amazon just cancelled the 1L 2-pack of this good oil via subscribe & save @ 18.71 for my last shipment. That is 67 oz's of oil. Now it's 51 oz's for 22$ in subscribe & save, that is an increase from 0.28$ per OZ to 0.43$ per oz -- about 30% increase in price. Not anywhere as good a deal as it was before. This is good middle of the road, organic olive oil, been using it for last 2-3 years. But it's getting way to pricey for what it is.

Maybe it's not Amazon - maybe it's the supplier price increase -- but it is a sad turn of events.

Just read a bunch of articles about how low olive oil prices are hurting europe -- sounds like gouging to me.

The only other olive oil I can compare this to is "Filippo Berio" from the supermarket. I did a smell and taste test comparing these two oils. The supermarket stuff smelled awful and nothing like olives, while the Zoe had a nice olive scent to it. The supermarket stuff tasted nothing like olives while the Zoe did.

Not a great comparison, but definitely a good buy if you can get it on sale or with coupons.

I have been using olive oil for many years, even in sweet baked goods.  A couple of years ago the New Yorker magazine contained an article exposing all of the problems with Italian olive oils in recent years.  So I decided to switch to a Spanish olive oil, preferably organic.  Zoe ended up being my choice, mostly based on price and its fairly middle of the road flavor.  I have now been using it for about five years and remain satisfied.  It is not the best olive oil around, but it is consistently good and not priced so high as to cause pain.  I have not had problems with it going rancid.  I like the tin, but am still careful to keep it in a cool area rather than near the stove.  Once I have used half of the can's contents I prefer to decant the rest into a smaller, dark glass container.  I can't say that I love the spigot, but once I figured out how to pull it out I have had no problems.  The product stays in the tin or pours nicely into the dish or pot I am using when cooking.  I have not had any counter messes nor do I find a lot of oil around the spigot.  Finally, I like being able to buy through Amazon's subscribe and save program, which makes this oil a bit more economical to use.

This was a pretty good olive oil.  I tried just dipping my bread in it to see the full flavor and this is my conclusion, even thought I freely admit I am no expert or anything.  First thing I noticed was the viscosity of it, pretty thin.  I don't know if that is good or bad, just an observation.  I figure this is good for salads, and didn't have too much effect on me dipping bread, but would rather have it a bit thick.  The flavor was good, not great.  It didn't have the rich fruity, nutty flavor I was hoping for, but was OK.  I had been using Pompeian and think I prefer its flavor better, at least in dipping.  After I use this up I will go back to Pompeian, its cheap at wmart and to me has the best flavor of any I have tried.  Conclusion is if you want a thin, light oil then this is a good choice, for a more robust flavor, there are better options.
Very buttery and rich. A wonderful oil for the price. Especially like the fact that it's organic. Wish there were an expiration date on the can.

I lived in sicily for over a year and I have had the best olive oil known to man.  Once back stateside trying to find something even remotely comparable is near impossible.  Then I found this.....So far it is the best I have been able to find over here.  Light, perfect, great flavor.  I will continue to use this for all my olive oil needs.

I am getting this regularly via subscribe and save option and I must say this is a pretty good deal given the quality of the product. Although the taste difference in organic vs regular Zoe oils is subtle, I like to believe going organic is good for me. If you know much about or have used olive oils regularly, you'd love the taste of this particular extra virgin olive oil. Apart from being healthy this is full flavored - real extra virgin and not diluted like many store brands- and comes in a can to protect the oil from exposure to direct sun light. Go for it, with free shipping, you can't go wrong.
We use this olive for everything; marinades, sauté' and dressings.  Very solid flavour and texture.

I HAVE STARTED TO USE OLIVE OIL FOR HEALTH PROBLEMS, TRIED MANY OTHERS, ZOE IS THE ONLY OLIVE OIL I HAVE FOUND THAT IS MELLOW AND SMOOTH TO ME. FOR THE VALUE YOU CANT FIND BETTER,  JUST GIVE IT A TRY. I HAVE USED OIL FOR ABOUT A YEAR , I USE ABOUT 6 TABLE SPOONS EACH DAY. SKIN IS SMOOTH , HAIR LOOKS BETTER , FEEL BETTER. I AM 83 YRS YOUNG  AND I NEED ALL THE HELP I CAN GET.

Zoe is an excellent cooking oil and the metal container promotes its integrity for long shelf life.
It is also useful for other processes calling for olive oil.
works well for cooking, but prefer a better tasting not so bitter one for salads, etc...still a good value especially on subscribe and save.
would have given 5 stars, but the tin spout is poorly designed and the precious oil spills all over the place!

It's of high quality, but the usage of the lid needs more instruction for the new customer.
I messed it up and it will leaks a little bit every time after use. A small card of instruction on how to open the lid is helpful.

Love this stuff. I use it for everything from cooking, to salad dressings, to dipping my (gluten-free) bread in. It has a rich texture. I love that it is full-bodies, yet not overpowering. For the price, it is an excellent oil for being organic. I buy it through subscribe and save. I will continue to buy it. Not only is it good flavored, and a good value, but I can easily fit it on my shelf.

I am pretty upset about the recent pricing change on this product. I have been buying this for years and have had this on S&S for sometime. My S&S was recently cancelled by Amazon at the same time it was suppose to ship (hence i ran out of Olive Oil). I went on to re-order the product and thought at the time it was cancelled due to Amazon Frustration Free Packaging (yes I should have paid closer attention to the ounces when re-bought)however to my dismay when opening the package today the tins were HALF the size than the old ones. So basically I am thinking ok - I wont be buying this brand again, I'll have to find a new one. Now I am even more upset as I just came on here to write a review and when I search Zoe Olive Oil - the 1 Liter tins came up - but are no longer on S&S Zoe Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 1 Liter Tins (Pack of 2) and they are 50 cents more than the 25.5 ounce 2 Pack on S&S. These are basically a rip off now. I hate to leave a negative product review about something that I like, but this one bothered me so much I felt completed to inform other consumers about the recent changes.
This is the only olive oil I buy anymore!  Good price, quick shipping, great taste, and the tin keeps it fresh for a long time.  Will continue to buy this product.
I have used the Zoe Olive Oil for some time, and cannot or will not do without it..I have even shared with family and friends to get them to use it also..Keep up the great job..

We only use olive oil, peanut oil, and grass fed butter for our fats. I have been using Zoe organic olive oil for several years now. When I first started buying it from Amazon the packing was not so great and cans were frequently dented. New packing works wonderful and no more dented cans. Zoe olive oil works wonderful for baking and general purpose needs. It makes great homemade mayo. For the quantity we use the price is right. I use it in salad dressings also and it tastes just fine.

This is great for cooking and gift giving. I like that it's in cans, takes less space, and is organic. Not the best I've had, but for daily use and cooking it's great.
I have it on subscribe and save every 4-6 months or so. I live alone, so they last a long time. I use olive oil, coconut oil, almond oil, for everything . . . I don't use butter or other oils anymore.

Great product, well packaged for shipping, since Amazon likes to just toss things in a box without protecting anything. This company thinks ahead, and the cans are very well protected for shipping.

They are much smaller than they seem on the computer, because of the shape, I guess. Still a great value, even though they raise the price every order by about $2.00, so I probably will be shopping for another brand by next order..

This is a terrific olive oil. I am pretty picky with EVOO, and often buy higher priced stuff. I admit to pouring it into a class olive oil container for easier use, but it's well worth the small effort. I highly recommend this to anyone who likes quality olive oil at a terrific price!

I have used lots of brand for the olive oil. I love the salad and cook with olive oil.
This one is very reach and good quality for all kinds of food.
I have seen reviews and I didn't regret buying this brand oil.
I strongly recommend this product and the price also is very reasonable.

This olive oil has a nice, subtle flavor. No acidic "bite" like you may taste from some cheap Italian or Greek olive oils. Great for salads and mixing with herbs for dipping bread. Not a bad price for an organic, either.
Very good quality olive oil. Not to heavy, gives fried food a great taste. I also use in my brownies works great

I have read that olives are a heavily pesticided crop, so switched to organic evoo. This Brand, on subscribe and save, is the best priced organic evoo I have found. My one complaint is the spout, which tends to spill. I transfer it into a bottle, to minimize the waste.
I am very pleased with this product. It's taste good. The little sit back is the tin itself. You have to pour the oil in an other bottle or will have a mess every time.
I first purchased this brand of olive oil after tasting it at a wine and cheese shop. It has a great flavor and I paid three times as much for it. It's beautiful tin also makes it a great gift.
The taste is great. I like it. But the cover is not good. It is easy to spread some oil on the top of the cover when open it.

I order this oil via subscribe and save - I chose it because of the convenient size and because it is organic. It has a slightly bitter/sharp flavor that makes it too strong for some applications but I use it for all my salad dressings and cooking and have not looked around for any other for many months.

Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil is a lighter, less intense extra virgin olive oil - the fact that it is organic is an added plus. This oil is perfect for multiple uses such as dipping, baking, and incorporating into dressings and sauces which require oil. It is also the perfect introduction for those individuals who are new to using olive oil since the olive (fruity) taste is less pronounced than it is in other EVOO's (Extra Virgin Olive Oils). My spouse is one of those individuals who was encouraged by the cardiologist to switch to olive oil, but who did not like its taste. That is until, after reading the reviews on Amazon, I purchased Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil. It is the first in a long line of EVOO's that has met with his approval.

Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil is light and has a buttery taste. One can add herbs to the oil for extra flavor; it does not overpower their taste. Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil is excellent for adding to baked goods which call for oil. Its mild flavor does not compete with the taste of other ingredients; there is no fruity aftertaste. Personally, I did notice a peppery bite in my throat after using this oil as a dip, without the addition of either herbs or pepper. The aftertaste was not particularly strong and was not evident when the oil was combined with balsamic vinegar or herbs. Amazon's price for Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil is excellent; it is far better than the cost of better EVOO's at the warehouse stores.

This is a five-star product packaged in a three-star container. The spout is difficult to pull out completely; pouring the oil can be a challenge. The spout on the first can I opened was defective and split at the base when it was pulled out. I did not notice this until I began to pour the oil and ended up with a puddle on the countertop. Amazon's customer service was excellent with respect to resolving that issue. I do like the size of the can which is easy to handle. Unlike other EVOO's, Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil does not specify in which region of its country of origin the olives are grown, nor does it specify the year of harvest. Further, unless the date is coded, the can does not indicate a best-used-by date.

Despite these minor issues, this is a fine EVOO and I recommend it to anyone looking for a lighter, less intensely flavored EVOO. You can't go wrong purchasing Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil from Amazon.
I bought this because it was such a good deal, but it went rancid so quickly I will not buy it again.

I'm sure I'll reorder this product.  I cook quite a bit with Olive Oil...everything from Veggies, to Pancakes, to Burgers, and Steaks.  For cooking, it's tasty without any suprises.  Raw out of the bottle it has a bit of taste/zing to the back of the throat... a bit of burn.  That is entirely natural, and due to a naturally occuring penolic chemical in Olive Oil called Oleocanthal.  If your olive oil doesn't zing or burn the back of your throat, then it probably is a washed out, watered down version of the real deal.
