Zoe has done a superb job here with Organic Oil at reasonable price.  Choose Zoe Organic, and be happy.  I recently read an article about a vinyard in Italy that had some 500 Olive trees.  Due to weather conditions, roughly half produced annually.  Many of the trees were over 250 years old.  Olive trees live 500-900 years, and some in Syria are as old as 1,500 years.  Anyways, the point is this.  With a crop of 500 trees, rough weather can produce 300 liters of pure organic olive oil.  The average tree in normal conditions will produce about 4 lieters of oil.  The current price you see for something like this Zoe Organic product is a steal.

I grabbed this on a special because it was such a good price for a quality olive oil. When I first tasted it, I was somewhat disappointed, because it had a strong "green" flavor, like the olives hadn't fully ripened. I relegated it to cooking and foods that it would be mixed in with, like hummus. Over time, I have grown to like it more, and now occasionally even use it for drizzling on salads and other foods where the olive oil's flavor is a stand-out part of the dish.

I usually drizzle a little EVOO on top of hummus when I serve it along with kalamata olives, feta cheese, tzatziki and tabbouleh. Mmm, one of my favorite meals! I use the Zoe when I make the hummus, then use my favorite 'Nunez del Prado' Flor de Aceite Olive Oil Glass by La Tienda, for the drizzle. I have bought it in a 1 Liter tin at my local upscale grocery store, but it is more expensive than the Zoe. I discovered Nunez de Prado when I asked them to let me have an olive oil tasting (like a wine tasting), and this one was by far my personal favorite.

The special addition you get by drizzling the oil over many different foods really adds a lot of dimension and flavor, so you really want to get one that you love.

The spout is messy no matter how I hold the can, so I decant it in into a glass bottle (store it in a dark cabinet).

Bottom line: I would definitely recommend this oil for the price, it is very good quality, though it's not my favorite.

If Amazon does not smash it with their lame packing ideas, this is good stuff.  If you would rather support some good American olive growers, look up BARI in California. I alternate between them both.

I love the size of these cans because one can easily decants into my glass bottle for daily use.  The remaining can stores the oil better than if it were in a bottle so it works out nicely.  I recommend it!
I bought this on "Special" and am so glad I did.  It has a wonderful strng Olive taste.  Exactly what I was looking for.

This is my second pack this year. We all love the taste and texture. Mainly we use this oil for salad dressings and cooking in cast iron, which brings out the aroma as well. Great product for the price and quality.
This olive oil is so good. It's light and buttery. I will never buy another kind of evoe again. The price at amazon is good, too.
We have used several olive oils, this one is very nice. I stopped my automatic delivery when the price was automatically increased. Anyone that I have given this to as a gift, also enjoyed it.

Seriously, I like this product a lot, and think it better than those recommended in the Cook's Classic Best Recipe series cookbooks: Davinci; Pompeian, and Colavita!

The smaller cans are a bit of a pain, but I do get to lick my (compulsively washed) fingers.

My favorite artesanal EVOO is Il Borro from Tuscany - I'll be there for the last 7 nights in March and plan to return with as much as I can carry. It is very floral/fruity with a hint of rich spicy herbs, and a bit of a bite on the finish - great stuff!

Provecho.
I subscribe to this product and really like it.  It has a good flavor and food cooks well in it.

its olive oil...not much to say
trans fats free! high in antioxidants
great on pasta, bread, meat,
or even just as a dip with some spices
the fact that there were 2 made up for the small size
it was some real quality olive oil

We are very pleased with this product.  I like the packaging, they fit nicely into our pantry vs. the clumsy bottles we used to get at the supermarket.  The oil is flavorful and not bitter, a quality product for sure.  We will buy these from now on.
There must be hundreds of different Olive Oil brands out there.  Zoe has the best taste.  Cod fish fried in this oil taste better than any other oil.

I am very happy with this purchase (and subscription).

I usually make a salad every night to get my green leafies in and make a fresh evoo dressing. The dressings are awesome with this brand. I also use this oil for light sautéing and have not noticed any unpleasant taste as described by one of the other reviewers.

The subscription for this evoo is super because I use so much! Good thing it is good for us. :)

Oh, my husband always fills my Rachael Ray evoo bottle from this tin and one tin fills it perfectly. So I don't use it directly from the tin.

I am at a point in my life that due to health concerns I am going away from processed foods and trying to buy organic whenever I can. Amazon is making that very easy on me with this olive oil. When you purchase this item through subscribe and save it becomes the same price as non organic from the grocery store. I will definately purchase this again and again.
This is a good tasting light olive oil, unlike others that are very heavy it is great on salads or for cooking. Would buy again.

I could not belive the size of these tins for the price, so I ventured to measure the quantity since it didn't seem possible that the tins could possible hold 25.5 ounces in oil. Surely, the weight includes the weight of the tins which feels heavy enough to raise suspisions The quality was average and thus overpriced. Perhaps the fact that the oil is organic may due some justice. I will continue to do what I have been doing in the past and shop around.

Update

This oil is dangerous for frying in a pan, it splashes as if water was added to make this oil which would explain the lightness in texture. Disapointed that the container does not disclose that this is not pure oil and that water is being added.

Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil brings out the best in food, whether you cook with it or use it in salads. When I first bought it, my wife complained that it was too expensive. But after a while she said that it was better tasting than any oil she had ever used and insisted that we reorder it.

We use olive oil because we are concerned about our cholesterol. Just a little bit of Zoe is all that is needed to cook foods in an Orka steamer for delicious and healthy meals, microwaved in just minutes. We use it almost daily to make wonderful tasting, fish and vegetables that way. Chinese leftovers and rice tastes like it was freshly cooked when you reheat it this way with teaspoon of this oil.

We recommend it highly!

For the price this olive oil is very good.  We use it all summer on our fresh salads (especially caprese!) and in addition to having a crisp flavor, it is very smooth with a slight sweetness.  Excellent with a good balsamic.  It is wonderful for cooking as well.
I bought the Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil because it was at a great price.  I like the fact that it is organic.  The style of the container does a wonderful job of avoiding spills.

This is a great olive oil.  It is really low in price for its organic certification and the fact that it is first cold-pressed (first cold pressing yields a much more nutritious, flavorful oil).  Other olive oils that can make those claims often cost twice what Zoe does, or more.  As to flavor, it is soft, buttery, and a little bit sweet; it tastes like olive oil (sounds dumb, but many olive oils sacrifice their fundamental "olive-ness" to achieve a wider appeal).  On the other hand, it is not so strong as to overpower other flavors when you cook with it.  Great for roasting garlic, as a base for sauces, and for sauteeing vegetables.  The two small tins are a nice touch, too, as you get a decent amount of oil, but can keep it half of it sealed up for freshness.

This olive oil so far is great. I love that it is in a tin so that I can leave it on the counter rather than having to place it in the cabinet.
However, it is best to put it into a carafe or olive oil dispenser because it can be quite difficult to pour and not spill.
As for the taste, it is very light and a bit nutty. Levels above many of the other oils at the same price level.
For the price, one should certainly try it out.
This olive oil is great.  I buy the organic and the regular Zoe olive oil on a regular basis.  I use it for all sorts of foods.  Another 'hard to find' product that's right here on Amazon.  Thanks!

For some reason I like this oil much more for cooking then straight on salads.  This Olive Oil is very good and a much better priced than at my supermarket. I like the idea that it is from Spain but originally thought it was from Italy. This gives you a different variety of nutrients and omegas that are healthy and nutritious.

the quality of oil is great. I give it four stars because of the tin design. It is difficult to pour out the oil without it dripping leftovers on top.

For those who haven't had real evoo, it might taste bitter at first- as a fresh oil will. I was initially surprised by the bitterness, but over time have appreciated it because it cuts down on the unctousness; works great with the acidity in vinegars for dressings or dipping bread. EVOO is very healthy and should be used raw if possible, only apply light heat to it. this isn't an oil for frying.

This is my over all FAV olive oil!  its just strong enough and pure enough to go into everything without over powering, but at the same time is awesome alone as the "flavor ingredient" I never find it bitter or week in anything I cook.

High quality, organic extra virgin olive oil with a great rich taste at a great price, nothing more nothing less.  I recommend the product to all who enjoy olive oil with the added benefit of organics.

I found this on DealNews and applied for the subscription to get a discount. Well I forgot about it and it was auto-shipped but that's okay. The oil is really tasty and I feel better knowing it's organic.
This seems like a good product. We buy a lot of organic food and the price was reasonable for the olive oil.

No question as to the integrity and quality of the olive oil. Dip, sautee, Momma Mia !!
And... a wonderful bonus:
These tins are adorable, and sized for decor.
They add a touch of color to your kitchen -and stay within easy reach.
Good stuff and adorable too!
I subscribed for an irresistable price.

The opening on this container is perfect for keeping the container clean and free from drips and spills. There is a plastic spout that pops up when the tin is opened and this allows the oil to flow free away from a neck.

The amount that comes out at once is slower compared to most oil bottles and tins and this is another feature I enjoy about this tin. The size is compact and easy to handle.

I was that guy who always just bought a massive jug of extra virgin olive oil at whatever price I thought was decent. I had been getting the massive Bertolli jug at Sam's and thought that was pretty much the be all end all of olive oil. Man, I was wrong. I just accepted the fact that olive oil had a funky and unpleasant after taste.

On a lark, I picked a few tins of the Zoe Organic when it was selling for $13.65 per two. This stuff is awesome. Great soft, mild taste that doesn't have the slimey and chemical flavor that most other olive oils have tried. I'm not an exceptional taster by any means, so I can't say it tasted like roses, or buttermilk or pepper or anything else. It's just good.

I was a bit surprised at the small size of the tins. It isn't as big or as much oil as I pictured, but the sealed and dark tins should help it keep fresh for much longer. I don't think the price or quality can be beat.

I just got this today and haven't had the chance to use it, but I love the packaging. This is super cute and perfect to keep on the counter. From all the reviews I'm going to like the product as well. I'm having this delievered every six months, but I think I may need to make it more frequent.

I have since used this oil and I like it. I bought it mostly because it was organic. The light green color is lovely and the taste isn't overpowering. Excellent oil for the price. Buy it for your next extra virgin olive oil. You won't be disappointed.

All the other reviews mention pouring. I pour mine into another container and I haven't had that problem.

Zoe Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 25.5-Ounce Tins (Pack of 2)
We use this Zoe Organic EVOO all the time and it doesn't disappoint. Amazon.com sells it at a great price and I get a few tins each year.
After returning from Italy I wanted to find a better one than I had been using.  This one is it!

This Olive Oil is very good and a much better price than my local source.
I like the idea that it is from Spain. This gives you a different variety of nutrients.

I love this oil, good flavor, love that it's organic, BUT the pour spout makes such a mess on the top of the tin that you have to wipe up & waste (1/2 teaspoon with every single pour) and sometimes even runs down the side of the tin that I won't be buying it again unless the tin is designed better.  I've tried pouring fast, slow, etc. and it just doesn't pour well at all.

This is very oily. And Olive-y. I think I'm going to like it, because I love olive oil, but I won't know until Christmas, when my wife will give it to me, and ask me to cook something for her with it.

I miss read before I ordered, got 2 very small tins of oil.  Later realized that there is a 2 LITER pack for nearly the same price.  So I'm going to say this particular version of the product is overpriced.  Especially for a tin can, I have used this packaging for olive oil before and you tend to lose that last serving or so in the lip of the tin.  Drives me crazy!  For this reason, I'm 2 starring it, and am going to make sure to check my ounces before I send in a future order.
I bought this olive oil because I thought it was a good deal for a large quantity of olive oil and it wasn't nearly as much as I thought it would be.
I am addicted to potato chips.  I love these Ruffles in the individual bags, because I can limit myself to 1 oz. a day.  That's a good thing, right?

My dog did well with this food for about a year, but the latest bag we purchased caused recurring bouts of profusely bloody diarrhea, resulting in an expensive trip to the emergency vet. I later found that there has been a recall of this pet food for possible salmonella contamination. We've switched to another brand, and she's doing great. I think I'll avoid this one in the future.

This dog food is saving my wife and I over $90 a month! Before putting our Kerry Blue Terrier on this dog food we were giving him anti-itch pills daily; the itching and licking was so bad he was itching himself raw (and no they weren't "hotspots"). The groom recommended a diet change, we had tried a diet change years ago (recommended by the vet before trying the pills) but it did not help. The groomer recommended Duck and Potato which seemed to help a little. When we ran out of Duck and Potato, I did not want to go to the groomer to get more so I went to the locally owned pet store and picked up a bag of Chick Soup. In the time since he has been on this food we have not had a need to give him any more anti-itch pills. Also, his eyes are weeping less; by that I mean the black gooey/crusty stuff has pretty diminished greatly (we used to have to clean his eyes multiple times a day and now it's down to maybe once every few days). This dog food if the best. I will buy it from Amazon (our locally owned pet store stopped selling it) when it gets a prime status. Buy it, don't let the "recall review" wacko scare you. Give it a try!
I did a lot of research looking for the best value vs. quality balance, and this is what I found.  It truly does compare ingredient-wise to much pricier brands, and my Cairn Terrier loves it.

We have used Chicken Soup Dog food for years. It has the right ingredients and is reasonably priced. We have fed our German Short hair the senior food and our Jack Russell on the adult. Both seem to agree with the dogs.

I LOVE THIS PRODUCT BUT LIKE ALWAYS THE DOG EATS IT WHEN REALLY IS HUNGRY. THEY LOVE WHAT I EAT BUT NOW I DON'T GIVE NO MORE PEOPLE'S FOOD. I KNOW THAT THIS PRODUCT IS EXCELLENT FOR THEIR HEALTH, BOUGHT FOR CATS TOO AND THEY LOVE IT. THANKS FOR HAVING VERY HEALTHY ANIMAL FOODS.

We have two picky Lhasa-poo dogs that have turned up their noses at lots of dry dog food. We thought we would try one more time, and were greatly surprised at how much the dogs loved this food.

Packaging is like all dry dog food, delivered in a box to protect the bag. We and our dogs highly recommend this Chicken Soup for the DOg Lover's Soul Dry dog food. (a real mouthful to say!)

This food worked great for my two dogs up until about a year ago. Something changed in this food which caused both dogs severe diarrhea. Trialing them off and then on this food again caused the problems to return. We switched to a different brand.
best dog food in the world, use this and  your dog will be happy more lively and look great  ,, just great

We have been feeding Chicken Soup for the Dog Lover's Soul dog food to both of our dogs for about three months now (since Julyt 2012) and they love it.  By necessity, we have to be very budget conscious, but did not like the budget-friendly dog foods out there that are all made mostly of bone meal and corn by-products.  The ingredients on the bag of this dog food speak for themselves...it's real nutrient-rich ingredients that humans would eat (duck, beef, chicken, broccoli, barley, etc).  Both of our dogs are rescue dogs - one is a 4-year-old  Aussie Blue Heeler who is extremely picky with her food and the other is a 10-year-old Pug/Welsh Corgi/Staffordshire Terrier mix who has extremely severe food and pollen allergies.  This is the ONLY dog food out of many that we have tried that meets both of their needs very well and fits our budget very nicely.  I've read about the recalls only through other Amazon reviewers and am yet to experience any negative side effects (only good ones, like empty food bowls, full bellies, and less pooping!).  We love this food and highly recommend it.

I have two dogs that eat this food.  Both got very sick off of it.  The company offers a coupon or a refund for the bag of food.  What about the $500 worth of vet bills I had to pay because my dogs ate this food????  I will never ever buy this brand again and would not recommend it.

Let me preface this by saying I LOVE AMAZON. They are an amazing company and I will always shop online with them.

I had been feeding my older dogs Chicken Soup for the Dog Lover's Soul (Senior) for about a year. And about two weeks before the "voluntary" recall came out in April of 2012, my dogs were both extremely violently ill (vomiting, diarreah and no appetite that lasted a week - until I got them help). Both had to be seen by the vet and both were perscribed antibiotics. Shortly after these bouts of illness I learned about the salmonella tainted food in the South Carolina plant. Diamond Dog Food (the manufacturer of many foods including Chicken Soup for the Dog Lover's Soul) had denied that any dogs were sickened by this food but I am 2000% positive that they were. They said they would not accept responsibility unless I could prove it. But I couldn't because I didn't save any of their poop to have it tested (my vet's assessment was not enough for them to accept responsibility.) Also be aware that they were also involved in a recall back in 2005 (I think that's the year) that killed several dogs due to their neglegence. So this isn't the first time Diamond has harmed dogs. I personally will not forgive what they did to my dogs and to me. I also know that my dogs were not the only dogs sickened. They currently have a class action lawsuit against them for sickening HUMANS, but sadly there are no attorneys willing to represent animals in this matter.

What I find even sneakier on the part of Diamond was the timing of their recall. I actually purchased the tainted food in February 2012 and didn't begin feeding it to my dogs until April because I had a previous bag of the same food that was already open. So they knew the timing of this dog food recall was well beyond anybody being able to prove their dogs were poisoned. (They also told me that once the bag was opened, I couldn't prove it was poisoned because the bag could become poisoned/contaminated through "other" means...meaning they would accuse me of poisining my food and my own dogs. I had a 35 lb bag of that tainted food of which maybe only 5 lbs. was eaten.) This company is SCUM. People, if it's made by Diamond...RUN don't walk in the opposite direction!!!!

If I could give them a ZERO rating - I would...In fact I would WARN anyone who loves their animals to avoid this manufacturer once and for all.

Though I don't know if this particular one is recalled.
But I just thought I'd try to give a heads up.
So, this is not a true review about this products features per say.....but I feel that everyone needs to know that this company has recalled their products and it is going on right now.
To begin with, I want to say that I know that unfortunately there are plenty of human products that get recalled too and that is the most important thing. And yes, I know that every time we go eat out or buy any type of store bought food.... that it is a gamble too.
But, my family considers our dogs as part of the family and this is very important too.

Many years ago I did research to find the best priced grain free. no dye or by product food.
I found that Diamond Pet Foods had the first ingredient as being the actual real meat.
Plus,the grain free food made my baby girl look so healthy and shiny.
Also,since it had no fillers and quality ingredients it actually made her stool smaller and less stinky.
She has less allergies and it stopped most of her constant itching/biting/licking at her paws and less tear stains.
She actually loved the product, by the same maker, named "Taste Of The Wild" in Bison the most.

But,I am saddened now because Diamond Dog Food has now been RECALLED for "SALMONELLA CONTAMINATION"
This company makes various products that have been recalled.
Such as:
Diamond Naturals, Wellness, Natural Balance, Taste of The Wild, Apex, Chicken Soup Soul, Canidae, Country Value, 4Health, Natural Balance, Kirkland Signature, Natural Balance, Premium Edge, Professional and Solid Gold.

I am saddened that we actually spend more money on these "better than store" dog food and they keep getting recalled!
So many families have unfortunately lost their fur babies babies and have spent thousands of dollars on Vet bills....when all we are trying to do is buying the "better" which are higher priced, dog food ingredients.
I am pretty thankful that I had signed up online,for emails about the latest dog food recalls last week.
My hubby and I was devastated to see that Diamond Dog Foods, Taste Of The Wild was on the list now.
I am sickened by these companies being so careless. When the reason we buy their higher priced food is cuz they are suppose to be healthier!
I just wanted to write this and try to stop another baby from getting sick or even worse dying

We have usually always been a little disappointed in how the tea k-cups turn out, but not this one! Surprisingly dark and really flavorful! Very pleasant surprise and delicious with some honey mixed in! Tastes like black tea and not just hot water. Give this a try as an alternative to coffee.

'Nothing bad to say about anything Keurig w-h-a-t-s-o-e-v-e-r. Hands down one of the greatest modern day conveniences and something to put a smile on my face each and every morning. This tea is a nice, strong brew, much like all of their tea varieties, and surprisingly so. I'm your average loose tea, fresh from the source type, and I still love these for their ease and speed while on the go, while not sacrificing a good cup of tea or joe.

I bought this product, along with coffee and the Keurig coffee maker for my son and his wife.  The tea was for her and she loves it; a fast and easy way to make tea for one without microwaved water or a kettle on the stove.  It is a real hit and "mom" scored, at least this time!

This very enjoyable "English Breakfast" tea was included in the Celestial Seasonings K-Cups Tea Sampler 44 Cups (Pack of 2) we bought for use in our Keurig B-40 B40 Elite Gourmet Single-Cup Home-Brewing System.

It is a very rich, traditional tasting tea that works well in both small and large cup brew sizes.

Highly Recommended!

CFH

I think this is the greatest thing. I got a Keurig as a gift and found a whole new world for coffee and tea. It is so nice and convenient to have hot beverages without wasting so much coffee or tea when there is only one person to fix for. I will reorder this product again.
Needed Kcups for my daugher at collge.  Thought it was a coffee/tea variety pack, but she didn't mind since she loves tea as well.  Service was quick.

Most people buy the Keurig drink maker for coffee.  I am not a coffee drinker.  This machine does a great job on the English Breakfast tea variant.  Wish they had more selections (Irish Breakfast tea etc.)
Great tea.  My son loved it.  K cups are really handy, maybe a little expensive, but if you want easy, I guess you have to pay the price.
The tea flavor was just as I remembered  at home in the UK. Strong full flavor.

This was the perfect product for the application I needed. I need to make white chocolate or candy melts taste more like cream cheese frosting. This did the trick! I am excited to use it in other recipes.
I use this stuff to flavor yogurt.  It makes it a treat to eat. I like to make sure I have plenty on hand so I can have my good-to-eat and good-for-me treat whenever I want!
I just love this tea.  It's the only tea I drink.  It has that nice smooth flavor--not like black tea.  I would recommend this product to anyone.

I love White Tea and Bentley's is the best.  All the flavors are good.  I especially like the Ginger Peach and the Mango.  I was buying this at TJ Maxx, but their supply is limited.  I've got the subscription service from Amazon and they deliver a new shipment every month.  It's convenient and easy.
This is GREAT TEA!  I would highly recommend this tea.  The flavor is great hot or cold.  I wish it were organic :O)

Bentley's Ginger Peach White Tea, 25-Count Boxes (Pack of 4)

What can I say? Since we discovered this tea some two years ago, it is the only tea that we use. Bentley is known for it's high quality and this white tea is just that. The light hint of ginger with the pleasant blending of peach makes this a very smooth delight. While it is not caffeine free it certainly is lower in caffeine than other green or black teas therefore also making it a fine evening dinner tea. TO YOUR HEALTH!

I have to say this is one of my most favorite flavors of white tea so far next to blueberry white tea. Also, Bentley's is the highest quality and best tasting brand for Ceylon white tea that I've tried so far. I highly recommend this brand and flavor of tea.
This risotto is excellent, creamy and delicious!  You must follow the directions for preparation for optimal success.  I prepared it with chicken broth, mushrooms, and parmesan cheese.  It was a hit!

I love all kinds of rice, and this is my new favorite one. Cooking rice is not rocket science...and this one is no different. Very easy to make, as long as you have the other required ingredients (onion, chicken broth, etc.) I used chicken stock instead of broth, and I don't know if that's what makes it so yummy, but you will NOT be disappointed with this one!

I have a new Keurig machine and I don't really like coffee, so this selection was perfect for my needs. As promised, it is all tea, and there were only 5 duplicates (Celestial Seasonings Lemon Zinger, Bigelow's Cozy Chamomile and English Breakfast, Cafe Escapes Chai Latte, Twinings Decaffeinated Early Grey Tea) and there was only one extra of each of those. There were 6 different Celestial Seasonings Perfect Iced Tea, and I was pleased to see 4 of the Timothy's cups. I even liked the sampler box the cups came in.

I'm looking forward to trying out this array, and seeing which ones I want to buy more of.
This was a nice selection of K-cups that our staff enjoyed.  They arrived in a timely manner and in very good condition.  We would purchase them again.  Thank you

I am so very impressed with the excellent quality of the Beef Wellington.  Extremely tender lean meat like filet mignon and the flaky crust is just fabulous.  The quality is that of a very fine restaurant.  Absolutely delicious!!  I will definitely stock up on these when I want a gourmet meal!!
These are my very favorite K cups of all I have tried...and I have tried a lot.  It is also a good value

The Van Houtte French Vanilla is a substantial, creamy, somewhat nutty cup.  I much prefer it to Gloria Jeans (though I like some of their other flavored coffees.  GJ's FV is also weaker.  Timothy's is a bit stronger than GJ's, but lacks the complexity of the VH cup.
We purchased a Keurig for our daughter to use at college.  She LOVES these coffee flavors which we got thru amazon.com.  Good quality, good taste and shipped quickly.  Hightly recommend.

I could certainly go on for more than 20 words about how much I hated this coffee.  Fortunately I didn't pay for it because it came with my machine as a sampler.  Yuck!  It doesn't taste like good coffee and it doesn't taste like French Vanilla.  Point blank I couldn't even finish the cup and had to pour it down the drain.  The aftertaste is even worse.  I don't understand how anyone could give this a positive review but I guess it's all a matter of individual preference.

I had some of the Green Mountain coffee and it was very acidic and way too strong so I wanted something with more flavor and I bought this one. I think it is a great coffee flavor. Those who say it has no flavor obviously are expecting something like a powdery flavored coffee. This isn't too sweet but sweet enough and has a great after taste unlike most coffee which is too acidic. If you are looking for a light roast coffee with a sweet hint of vanilla then get this for sure! can't wait to try other van houtte flavors!

I really enjoy flavored coffees so when we opened the 12 pod sample pack that came with our new Keurig machine, I was excited to find a sample k cup of Van Houtte's French Vanilla. It ended up being one of the best flavors we had an opportunity to try!

Van Houtte's French Vanilla is not quite as good as some of the french vanilla coffees I've had fresh brewed at local coffee shops, but it isn't too far off either. It's a very mild, but flavorful coffee with a smooth finish and no bitter aftertaste. I don't like extra dark coffees with lots of acidity, so of that's more your cup of tea, so to speak, this blend isn't for you.

I will definitely be picking up more of this blend and if you're in the market for a french vanilla flavored coffee k up for your Keurig brewer, this one is an excellent choice.

I bought these k-cups at the store to try out in my Keurig single cup coffee maker, they are horrible. Absolutely no french vanilla taste at all, it's not just a weak taste, there is NO TASTE! And to make sure it wasn't just my taste buds, I made several more cups (using 1 k-cup per mug of coffee of course) for family members to see if they could guess what flavor it was, none of them knew and when I told them it was french vanilla, they were of course surprised since you can't taste anything at all.

I will never buy Van Houtte again, what a waste of money.
Excellent coffee, but on the expensive side.  I like medium blends.  If you like medium coffee, this could be the coffee for you!
I don't always like flavored coffees, but this had a good vanilla flavor, with or without milk.  I like the k-cup system, does a nice job when you want just a single cup.
Love this coffee!!!  Will buy over and over again.  You can't beat Amazon's price with free shipping!

I do love my Keurig coffee machine, and have sampled a wide variety of coffee flavors they offer. This one is NOT one of my favorites. It's acidic, and that overpowers the vanilla and coffee flavors. You can do much better. The two best I've tried so far are Green Mountain Wild Mountain Blueberry and Gloria Jean's Mudslide (chocolatey). If vanilla is your favorite flavor, I would try the Green Mountain or Gloria Jean version, or one of the others.

I love French vanilla coffee and was looking forward to this. It turned out to be a huge disappointment because all I could taste was the milk I put in the coffee.

When you read reviews of the Keurig coffee makers, people recommend using bolder, darker roasts. The Van Houtte French Vanilla is a light roast so I obviously knew it wasn't going to be strong. But to be devoid of any flavor is not acceptable. When I made the coffee this morning, I even paused the Keurig during the brew cycle to wet the grounds better in order to produce a more flavorful cup. I also used the 8 oz setting rather than the 10 oz setting on my machine. None of this had any effect. The coffee pouring into my cup was a nice, rich color but there was no coffee or vanilla aroma emanating from it.

In this case, I honestly don't understand the positive reviews on this product. I actually like light roasts but this is the first time I've had one that left me wondering where the coffee and the vanilla flavor was.

Lurid...weak, chemical tasting all describes this K-Cup. French Vanilla is not the best flavor but Van Houttes makes it seem like the worst. If you like weak, chem-tasting coffee then you will love this!
I love this French Vanilla coffee. It's not over powering but still has a great vanilla flavor. My husband and teenage kids love it also. It's a household favorite!!
Not as impressed with brand of coffee.  It was very weak with the flavor. I would recommend the Green Mountain French Vanilla.

The French Vanilla is wonderful. This is our first time and it is wonderful. My wife loves flavored coffees, so, this was just a natural way to go.
We both enjoy a coffee in the morning and one when entertaining some evenings.
These k-cups are perfect for entertaining and fast perks. Enjoy!!!
Personally, I prefer the decaffeinated brands by this manufacturer but it was good for the price!

I received two of these in a sampler package I had ordered through Keurig.com I made one cup, added my Coffeemate and Splenda...and...EWW! It was so bad I poured the rest down the sink and threw away the other K-Cup. I will not be ordering this variety EVER.

I love this French Vanilla.  For those of us who don't want our coffee stripping the paint off the walls this is perfect. I always add water to my coffee, just my preference as most are way too strong. The vanilla is not over powering and the blend produces a great light roasted cup of coffee.  My favorite.  If you like "BOLD, DARK ROAST" then this one isn't for you.
The item I purchased was delivered in a timely manner and was available at a good price.  The shipping cost seemed a bit high, but the product was fresh and received in good condition.
THE half turkey we served for thanksgiving was fantastic very tender and moist would buy again and again

I've been on a quest for the perfect homemade wings sauce and couldn't come up with it using different recipes.  Then I bought this sauce and bingo, great! Use it with the Hooters wing coating.  It gives the outside of the wings the same kind of texture you get at the real Hooters.

Good wing sauce had a bbq and everyone one ate the drum sticks right up. Best of all the sauce says its Medium and tastes even milder to me. More of a buttery flavor base. I get heart burn really bad and am not a big fan of super spicy sauces. So this was right up my alley and made everyone happy. Try it out good quality product.

I love this product! It works! I have been using it for about a month now and I have lost 10 lbs I just need 5 more pounds to reach my goal (size 5 jeans)! It does exactly what it says it's supposed to do. I received it when they said I would :)

This is a great tea and the Ultra Chai is my favorite flavor!  I have a cup every morning and take it on trips--I am never without it.  The tea is incidental to my weight loss, I am sure, but just for full disclosure, I adopted a low-fat plant-based diet at the same time I started drinking this daily and I have lost 100 pounds.  I just love the flavor and love this tea!

This is a great tasting tea.  I use one bag for my 16oz commuter cup each morning.  I started ordering it online when the supermarket price went up rapidly and now...the cost has doubled since the first time I ordered it in 2009. I am assessing whether it is that good.

I just LOVE the BONKERS SUPER SKINNY CHAI TEA. It tastes so good. I have been drinking it for about a year now. I have not seen a big weight loss but have stayed the same weight. I don't know if tit really works I just love how good it tastes

I am Italian and have a son with gluten issues. I've tried all types of pasta and this is my favorite. The all-rice brands seem gloppy and bland. This, to me, had the best flavor and consistency. I even eat it - al dente, of course.

My son used to only eat the Penne by Bi-Aglut, but once they stopped importing it, we were screwed.  We tried numerous brands and he didn't like any of them until we switched to Orgran.  We buy a box about every month or so.  I only wish they allowed you to put this on the subscribe program so we could get a break on the price.

My cat normally loves and reacts strongly to catnip.  I've used a spray catnip before and he rolled and played.  However, when I spray this on his toys or his rug there is no reaction at alll.  I finally threw the bottle away.

Big League Chew.

True Story: I was addicted to Big League Chew. Almost destroyed my life until I checked myself into the clinic. What a reality-check. The therapist slapped me in the face for even thinking of kicking my Big League Chew habit.

The product description reads, "Target consumer: Boys 6-12 with an active interest in baseball" but declines to mention the rock-star status one receives upon bringing a box of Big League chew to work. Since I brought the box to work this morning, I've since been promoted nine times, from mail-room drone to Executive Director of Awesome.

So I buy this item on amazon in every flavor probably once a month for my husband cause he loves this gum and it is super hard to find and it is usually expensive. Why I go throught the trouble of buying gum online you might ask?! well, it is way cheaper - I always buy two packs at a time and get the free shipping! - and I get a great selection of all the flavors! I am sure I have reviewed all the flavors by now hehehe love it!
This stuff was pretty good.  I like the flavor and it came fairly quickly.  Gum was very fresh.

I like the original flavored Big league chew gum and decided to buy this but this flavor is just gross.  I still have 8 packs left after giving away a few to my friends who did not enjoy it either.  Amazon did great on their part but this gum is just disgusting... stay away and don't buy this!

This cooks and tastes like regular wheat pasta.  It is a bit firmer so no worries about ending up with mushy pasta.  The kids didn't even notice it was Quinoa.  They eat it with just a bit of butter and pepper.  So far we have used it with marinara but I am sure it will work great with lighter sauces.
I have been using Olive Oil for cooking for several years and this was my first Crisco product in a long time.  The price is for 3 bottles that are a great size for the cabinet.

Compared to other sugar free candies this candy has little taste of the fruit or of the sweet.
It is not worth the value.

The zylitol hard candies are delicious and have a nice variety of flavors. They were recommended to me by my dentist to help promote saliva production in my dry mouth which will help prevent cavities. I would recommend this product and the amazon web site to others.

Quite simply one of the best teas I've ever had. I've tried a few other varieties of chai, including Twinnings Apple-Chai, Dunkin Donuts bad rendition of chai, etc. This tea has so much depth, and so much spice in it that the bag is a little greasy. The smell that wafts from this Chai is absolutely heavenly.

I love making Bangalore/Bombay Fogs with this tea. (That is: make a chai concentrate using the tea and one shot/two tbsp of hot water, and then adding 16 oz of hot milk. I finish my fogs with vanilla creamer, for an extra rich taste that vanilla syrup just doesn't have.)

Have fun~!

As a lover of pickled eggs, these were satisfying. The large quantity was great for the camping trip I took, and the eggs kept well, even in high heat. My only minor complaint is that the pickled taste itself is a little mild and could use a little more kick. Perhaps some hot red peppers!
I bought the mint chocolate and banana coconut to use in shakes.  They both were very delicious.  Shipping was quick, ordered on the 23rd and received on the 26th.

Use all flavors to flavor food without calories and sugar.  Tastes great, but you MUST be careful on pricing.  I only paid $2.99 per bottle and at the time of writing this, the price is now $6.95.  Consumer beware!
I bought this to flavor margaritas.  I didn't need much of the flavoring to have the effect (taste) that I wanted.

This flavoring smells amazing; I bought it to make homemade Bubblegum Ice Cream just like I used to get from Dipper Dan's Ice Cream Parlor when I was a child.  Ordered this but didn't get to make any icecream during the holidays.  Hope to make some soon.  It smells just like bubblegum & I am sure it tastes like bubblegum in recipes.  Thank you so much.  Sincerely, RL

Perhaps it's because I live in northern Canada (although that shouldn't be an excuse), but it took a few days for the product to be shipped. Once, however, it was, it arrive on the last day of the projected delivery day.

No complaints.
Bought it for the ice cream maker which did not make ice cream since then sitting in the fridge.

I am very sensitive to MSG and all its derivatives (yeast extract, etc).  This is the only Cream of Mushroom soup I have ever found that does not have yeast extract in it or MSG.  Even other "organic" cream of mushroom soups contain yeast extract.  I had to give up some of my favorite recipes because I couldn't find a cream of mushroom soup that didn't cause me to have my "MSG headaches."  Well not any more.  I can enjoy all my favorite recipes again!  This soup is great tasting and adds wonderful flavor to my recipes.  I even love how it comes in a carton rather than a can.  The quality of the soup is great and the ingredients are all natrual.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who has MSG sensitivities or who is just looking to add more great tasting natural ingredients to their recipes.

The Pacific Brand "Cream of" soups are a great replacement for those to have to go gluten free.  The taste is as good or better than the traditional condensed soups.  The only reason it's four stars is that most often, you must add some GF flour or other GF thickener as it can be a tish on the thin side (compared to traditional soups).  Will buy this again and again and so thankful to have found a GF version that is high quality and tastes just as good, if not BETTER!

The taste and quality of this soup is far superior to the stuff in the famous red can and white can but without all the unpronouncable ingredients.  We originally bought this because it was the only cream of mushroom soup without soy.  Not only am I allergic to soy but it is so unhealthy it should be avoided by everyone if at all possible.  One thing to be aware of is that this is a 12 ounce box whereas the name brand cans are only 8 ounces so when comparing prices remember that these are 50% larger than the other guys and you'll need to adjust your receipes accordingly.

If you're looking for a Campbell's cream of mushroom soup substitute, this isn't it. It doesn't have the milky-creamy consistency of Campbell's. It has a sour taste, from the cultured cream and whey. The broth is transparent. The pieces of mushroom are bigger. It's really nothing like Campbell's in taste or appearance. It's definitely much, much healthier, but I don't like the taste or texture and won't be buying it again. I'll be making my own cream of mushroom soup from now on.

This soup has a strong garlic flavor that I love in recipes.  Lots of delicious mushroom bits, too.  The soup blends easily with milk without the "fatty clumps" typical of Campbell's and many other brands.  The container is tricky to open at first -- you have to pinch the box flat on top, then tear off a strip.

This soup is incredible. It's concentrated so not as heavy and bulky as other soups that are basically just costing you more money to ship around filtered water. The price is great.

Pros:

Taste is incredible.
Concentrated and thus not as bulky.

Cons:

None really.

This is the only soy-free brand of soup I've been able to find, and I'm thrilled to have it for casseroles and other recipes. I'm unable to give it 5 stars, however, because of the strong garlic flavor. I LOVE garlic, but it's not always a welcome addition to my recipes, like chicken casserole (this is true of their Cream of Chicken soup, too). Still, I can live with the garlic taste if it means avoiding an allergic reaction!

It's hard to find great tasting gluten free soup, but we found it!  It's great to add to lean beef, vegetable soups, makes cooking a lot easier.  This tastes better than Campbell's mushroom soup.  Cheaper on Amazon, for sure!
This is a great side; if you are considering a a brand like Campbell's or Progressive, please give this flavor and brand a try -- very unprocessed, fresh taste with real flavor!

This product allows individuals who are restricted from having gluten and msg in their food, to have traditional dishes using Cream of Mushroom soup.
This product is in condensed form and is perfect for cooking. Never mind the pale color...the taste is all there and your recipes will be delicious.

Thanks for the return of the hotdish, Pacific!

Equally enjoyable is their Cream of Chicken....yum.

High marks for PN's quality of ingredients. Except for too much salt, the Pacific Natural ingredient list reads pretty close to how I'd make a homemade batch if I had the time. (FWIW, the red & white canned brand is even higher sodium).

As for the salt, one package of the PN packs 2220 mg of sodium - pretty much 100% of the RDA. I find it ironic that Pacific Natural would make this mistake, given that presumably most people buying an organic soup are probably more health conscious than those who do not. As others have noted, this soup is also more garlicky than one might expect a mushroom soup to be. I've found adding some onion powder (unsalted!) and fresh ground pepper offsets the garlic. I wish PN would do this - cut waaay back on the salt and add a bit of onion powder and black pepper to replace some of the garlic. And more mushrooms would be nice.

Despite the cons, I prefer the healthier PN brand to the red & white canned stuff. I had given up on having condensed cream of mushroom on hand so was thrilled when I found this brand. It works well in recipes calling for condensed soup, serves as a good gravy base, and makes a nice traditional cup of soup as well.

I feel like this soup is an 'upscale' version of your grocery canned cream of mushroom. We subscribe to this product, so it tells you we really like it!

1. I like that the container is environmentally friendly and no concern over BPA.
2. It's gluten free.
3. It's thick and creamy, works well as a substitute for other cream of mushroom soup recipes.
4. Organic! This was a big thing for us as well.

This product does have a strong flavor. It may take you a while to get used to it if you are used to the typical can of COM. The first time I used it for green bean casserole I was appalled. After getting used to the difference and not comparing it - it's a great option. This also is delicious in tuna noodle casserole. I haven't tried it as a soup alone, so I don't have a review for that.
Not bad.  On a low carb diet and it had more carbs than I thought it would.  18 per serving.  I will probably switch back to Campbells.

I love garlic; in tomato sauce, on braised dishes and elsewhere. I can handle garlic when I expect it. I didn't expect it here. At least not in this strength. I guess I'll have to go back to the red & white cans.
Hey! You may like it. Not for me.
I used one and threw the rest out.

I love Pacific Natural Foods organic soups, especially the creamy tomatoes and butternut squash. But this cream of mushroom soup has no flavor at all. I went with the 12-pack based on my confidence in the brand. Now I am stuck with 11 packs of bad soups.

We have a boxer (skin allergies, etc.) and a boxer/beagle mix (thicker coat than the boxer) that both love Fromm Gold Large Breed food! We tried every top brand of grain-free food (Orijen, Instinct, Wellness, etc) and experienced horrible gas in both of our dogs...so bad that  we kept cans of febreeze in every main room of our home. We started going to a new groomer at a pet supply store near us and they recommended Fromm. The store said Fromm is a family owned company with NO food recalls since opening their business in 1904. We buy our food locally, not from Amazon(we are avid Amazon shoppers in other departments), but I felt compelled to write a review to potentially help other consumers find this amazing dog food. We are on our 6th bag of Fromm and both of our dogs have beautiful coats, are maintaining healthy weights and are totally gas free! There are not enough positive words to say about this food!!

My two great danes eat this. It is high quality food and they seem to love the taste. We had a problem with very loose stools and this food has helped immensely. Check around for prices. Sometimes it is cheaper on line and sometimes in your local feed store.

Our German Shepherd was a picky eater until we switched to Fromm dry dog food. Our Golden retriever had skin issues as well but cleared up once we switched to Fromm's. They are 100% USA sourced as well.  Highly recommend.
I bought this due to my dog seeming to have a food allergy to corn and grains. He eats it and seems to enjoy it so time will tell if this solves his skin problems.
This food was recommended by my dog's breeder and my dog, a Golden Retriever puppy, is thriving.

I'm a big fan of dark chocolate. Given the choice, I'll always buy the dark semi-sweet chocolate version of anything.

We don't buy brownies all that often - they're kind of a once-a-month thing. But when my local supermarket had a super-sale on the Duncan Hines brownies for 77 cents a box (!!!!), we stocked up a little. We got the Chewy Fudge style, the Chocolate Lovers style, and what the heck, since they're only 77 cents, let's get a box of the Milk Chocolate. We left that for last because I assumed it would be pretty tame.

O.M.G.

When my wife and I ate them, we both just looked at each other in surprise. How could these be so much better than the other flavors? I mean, it's just milk chocolate, for cryin' out loud! Milk chocolate is like "toy chocolate", made for people without the fortitude for real chocolate.

So now we've got a $2.50/box substance abuse problem, hoping and praying for another 77 cent sale.

My family has been eating the milk chocolate duncan hines brownies for a couple of years now and absolutely love the them!  Duncan hines brownie & cake mixes are the best.  But, I can buy the brownie mixes at my local Wal Mart or sometimes Target for less than I purchased on Amazon.

White tea generally has a delicate flavor, but this tea has a more distinct "straw" flavor that you might like--or not.  I notice that this particular brand is higher in caffeine than the white teas from Republic of Teas.  The latter has a more subtle flavor as well.
my two Golden Retrievers loved these -- AND they kept them busy longer than other chews.  A bit expensive, so they will not get them often, but they WILL get them again.

My dog (A silken windhound) loves any and all rawhide, any and all bones to be truthful. But she injured a tooth once cracking through a beef knuckle bone, and I have since stopped providing her with hard bones. My dog has no interest at all in toys, unless there is a treat in it, then she pulls out the treat in 5 minutes and ignores the toy from then on. So I sought out rawhides as something to engage her off and on during the day. Though she'll chew eagerly on any rawhide I give her, I worry about her choking or gagging on a large hunk of it stuck in her throat, or a large piece getting stuck in her gut. This piggy twist, because it has such tight skinny strands, does not have that risk. On top of that,she'll take nearly two weeks of picking at it to finally finish it off, in spite of her persistance. I am so glad that she can have the rawhide she enjoys, that it doesn't get devoured in a day, and which allows me to feel safe giving it to her. I do wish I could get the 9 inch in a 3-5 pack.

This is my dogs favorite bone.  She is a Shiba Inu/Labrador mix and loves these bones.  All the dogs that come over all love this bone too!  Even though it's 9" any sized dog can chew on it because of the individual strands.
These Gummies are tasty.  No complaints from the kids.  Less guilt giving them real food sweets than the synthetic alternatives with all their preservatives and artifical ingredients.

These gummies are delicious. There are 6 different flavors in each bag and each flavor is distinct. Not only do they taste good, they also smell very good. The gummies are not hard like some other gummy candies that I've tried in the past. I purchased these for my family and they loved it. I would definitely recommend this as an alternative to other gummy candies.

I have a similar product that I purchased at Wal-Mart for less than $5 for 19.25 oz., so this price is way too high.  The product currently comes with 20% free, so it probably is usually available in a 16 oz. size.  The product that I purchased is called Ann's House "Good Health Energy", but it appears to be a similar mix of soynuts, cranberries, almonds and pumpkin kernels.  A 1/4 serving provides 8 grams of fat, 6 grams of sugar, 3 grams of fiber and 7 grams of protein.  There are other mixes available including Macadamia Perfection, Cranberry Nut Antioxidant, Chocolate Nut Antioxidant, Creamy Strawberry Almond and Pistachio Perfection.  I did not see all of these at the store.  The product is very high quality and Ann's House has been in business since 1973.

I stumbled on Ann's Soy Energy Blend at Costco about two months ago.  I've been buying two tubs every two weeks since.  My husband & teenage son won't touch it, but my toddler & I eat some every day.  I have to have protein to keep from shaking during the day & often I'm not even hungry enough to eat anything, so the Soy Energy Blend makes a perfect snack that gives me the boost I need without making me feel like I overate.  It's also a great movie night guilt-free snack.  I know the soy nuts can seem bland, but they've honestly grown on me.  Whereas I used to pick out the cranberries & almonds first, now I only eat about half of those, letting my toddler pick them out for herself instead.  Now, the reason I'm here.  I ran out yesterday & made a special trip to Costco today for more.  They're all sold out!  I did an online search to see if I could find them anywhere else in my area & found them here.  But $22.00?!  Seriously? I pay just under $7 for the 36oz tub at Costco!  If they don't start carrying them again I'll have to start buying the items in bulk & making my own mix.  Cause this price is simply outrageous.  UPDATE:  February 2012 - Costco has them back in stock!  $6.99 a tub.  It's the first aisle I check every trip and today I bought 4 tubs.  :)

Ann's House Soy Energy Blend is fantastic. First, a word about price: Costco carries Ann's at the moment, but you know Costco- that could change, however, at Costco, I think it's cheaper by about half over some of the sites I've seen. Secondly- this stuff is dynamite! I bought Ann's for work precisely because I didn't want something that tastes "too good", i.e. trail mixes or candy that are full of fat, sugars, salts, and chocolate. Ann's is not sweet, but the cranberries, pumpkin seeds and occasional almond adds ample taste-appeal to the protein-packed soy. When in a captive environment like work, nibbling Ann's Energy Mix is good for you and super satisfying for the deep hunger that usually only meats, or peanut butter can fix. And, you will not even be aware of the benefit until 5 minutes after eating a handful or two. The satisfaction overcomes hunger and there is no guilt. Men may trip about soy and phytoestrogens, but the amount you're likely to eat will not affect any man. Hey- do they have a problem making babies in Asian countries where soy is their staple? Right! Get on with it then!

I bought this at the local Costco, where, as others have mentioned, it is much cheaper there than here on Amazon. At first, I was hesitant to purchase, as I had bought a giant canister of soy nuts once and found that they were completely bland and left me with cottonmouth and a bad aftertaste. I had a hard time even giving them away in the office. So after comparing the label on the Energy Mix with several other nut & trail mixes, I found this mix to be the healthiest by far. Per 1/4 cup serving, there are 8g fat, 3g fiber, 6g sugar(!), 0g sodium(!), and 7g protein. As you can see, there is plenty of fiber and protein, no added salt, and the only sugar comes from the dried cranberries. This is a big difference from other nut/trail mixes which might have a good amount of salt and/or sugar added. That is what makes this Energy Mix a great, guilt-free snack for when you're stuck at your desk at work and feel bad about quaffing down M&M-laden trail mix to stave off your hunger. I usually go for a run or surf after work, so I toss back a couple handfuls of the energy mix before leaving the office, and find that it gives me just the right energy fix to make it through a hard workout, and all the way to dinner.

And the taste: well like I said, I'm not a huge fan of soy nuts, but just the right amount of dried cranberries are added to balance out the dry blandness of the soy nuts. Throw in the almonds and pumpkin seeds and you've got a good, nutty taste to round things out. I will say that if you are looking for bold flavor or to satisfy your sweet tooth/salt craving, then you will be let down. But if you are looking for a good tasting, satisfying snack that you can nibble on all day without feeling guilty, then this is a perfect choice.

This is a Great Product. I would like to ask Keith S Francis where he got his so call information that the Soy Energy was not safe under FDA guidelines. If that were true it would not be allowed to be sold in the stores. It is available in COSTCO all the time. I just purchased four 36 oz containers today at costco for $7.79 per container. I also contacted the FDA and was informed that there is no truth to your posting as to the safety. Not all COSTCO's purchase the same products. It is available everyday here in California and at $7.79 per 36oz container it is very reasonably priced. The 22.00 per container price is high but the vendors on AMAZON can ask any price they want we just don't have to buy from them.

But with zero sodium in it I consider that a fair trade-off. Being one of those not-so-lucky folks who have blood sugar issues, I've been told that soy is a good way of getting one's protein, and when I saw this at the big warehouse store I decided to give it a try. I like the almonds and cranberries the best (although those do have sugar so I take it easy), and yes the soy nuts are not so flavorful and might not appeal to all. I see mention in another review about the pumpkin seeds coming from China, a valid concern, but I've been snacking on these for a few weeks and haven't seen any ill effects yet :)

In the end, it is all about choice - and there are plenty of trail mixes and nut mixes out there packed with sodium. Your call, but as long as the big warehouse store carries this I'll keep on buying and snacking. I also took some into work and gave a sample to two healthier choice minded co-workers and they both liked it as well.

I bought this Soy blend at Cosco for under $8 and would probably pay up to $10 for it...but this is ridiculous! It is a good blend, tasty and healthy. Too bad. I will not search it out, especially at this price. I would definitely buy it every other week or so, if it came back to Cosco, at a similar price.

Found this at costco while visiting my brother in Phoenix Az. As one of the other reviewers said this works for me being a Type 2 Diabetic it is easy on the blood sugar and zero sodium is a winner in my book and tastes good also. But the price hear is wacked as $7 bucks at costco is a great deal. I have not been able to find it in my local costco here in the Seattle area but will request it !

Recently, I picked up a 30-ounce plastic jar of "Ann's House Soy Energy Blend" which I discovered in the snack isles of my local Costco warehouse store. It's a mixture of soy nuts, almonds, pumpkin seeds and dried cranberries. I'm a sucker for things like this. I can use them as a healthy snack. I can pack them in little sandwich bags and include them in my lunch package. I can bag them up for snacks in hiking walks. My wife likes them too. We snack now and then but we try to avoid salty and sweet snacks and stick to things that are nutritionally sound. These things fit the bill. They're a little bland tasting and you might wish that they were salted at least a little bit, but the protein and fiber content will make up for any taste deficits, at least in my book. It's a good snack. I love discovering things like this!

Gary Peterson

I brough mine in Costco is cheap there for only like $7. compare to $20+ amazon charge, is great snack, has NO Soldium and lower fat content since is made up like 50-60% soy nuts.  Just careful at portion size, this are great snacks in my opinion.
My family loves this product, however I can purchase the same brand, same 36oz size at a local store for less than $8.00. Great with a cold beer during a game. Try it, you'll enjoy it I am sure :)
This soy energy blend is the best thing to put on salads or add to Chex cerel for a healthy trail mix.

This is the best blend of healthy snacks I have found without the typical high sodium content. Cranberries add some sweetness that makes it a perfect midafternoon pick-me-up! Used to be carried by a warehouse retailer, but no more.  I am thrilled to have found it on Amazon!
I use to purchase this product at Costco for half the price,although I really like the product it's too expensive..
could not find this at the store this year. so was very happy to find it here with amazon. ordered it and it came quickly. this is a great snack or on salads.thanks
This product is addictive. Sprinkle it on your oatmeal or just eat it from the container. The soy nuts are a bit dry but delicious none the less. Glad that I found it on Amazon.
This is a great snack anytime of the day. I tastes good and is good for you. No sodium or cholesterol and all natural. It is also a great pick me up for the late afternoon.
This snack is highly nutritious and great tasting.  Amazon's price is far too high.  I buy the identical product at Costco for $7.79.

We enjoy Ann's House Soy Energy Blend.  We started buying it at Costco, but they stopped selling it and started selling Ann's House Edamame.  We like the Soy Energy Blend so much better.  It is good and apparently healthy for you.

I found a 9oz version of Ann's House Healthy Energy Blend. I really liked it and wanted to purchase more, but wasn't sure what store I found it in. I checked Ann's House web site and found that Walmart supposedly carried it.  I did not find it at Walmart, so I decided to order some online.  I couldn't find the 9oz version online, so I ordered Ann's House Soy Energy Blend 36oz value container.  I was hoping it was the same blend, just with a different name.  Since I saved the 9oz packaging, I could compare the ingredients and it seems to be exactly the same.  Boy was I happy to have 36oz of this good snack.  All the ingredients are really fresh (soy nuts usually seems to get stale quickly).  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this snack.  Thank you Ann's House!

For a fatty like myself it's hard to keep from gobbling up a bunch of garbage... This stuff keeps me relatively satiated for several hours with a single serving...

Costco has the same container, same brand, same product for 9 bucks.
I love this mix! $19.99 seemed high and I checked our Costco receipt. $7.69 for the same 36 ounce size. Enough said.
What can I say....its a great snack type food that curbs your appetite. Can find it cheaper elsewhere but good on here when in a pinch.

Wow this stuff is addictive and energizing. We can't stop eating it! My girlfriend has gained 30lbs. She is a vegetarian and this is her new favorite protein! We have a pig and today he climbed on the chair to eat them because he loves them too! Also her cousin is in the CIA and says this is what secret agents eat while they are on missions. Highly recommended for Y2k/2012 end times.

Received this in a gift basket, it tastes good but.....and it is a BIG BUT.....look on the ingredients listed and the pumpkin seeds in the mix are imported from China.??  I apologize and hope I don't offend but I refuse to give my children untested food imported from China given the current manufacturing problems they have had over there with toxins and chemicals placed in food products (I.E.  baby formula)  These must be extremely cheap pumpkin seeds to warrant this which makes me nervous, why else import them from China and not use USA pumkin seeds?  Sorry, will take a closer look at all ingredients from "Anna"s House" in the future.

I fell in LOVE with this product while visiting my Son in Honolulu, he purchases this at Cosco. As soon as I arrived back to the midwest I called EVERY Costco and requested and researched as to why this Cost's SO much on line and is unavailable in the Midwest or any Markets.

It would apear this product is NOT safe under the USDA guidelines and this to be the reason for a HUGE cost Increase on line and the reason it is Unavailable in the stores normally found in.

WHAT a SHAME ! ! ! I found a greater Energy prior to my daily Yoga and after my daily hygiene regimine for the day while eating this Mix. I would think this company; "Anne's House" would find a substitute to replace the requests for thier product. If this product is not safe under the guidelines of the FDA it should have been found before ever allowed to be placed on the shelves in the USA.

I WISH I could find A Substiture Product as good Anne's House Soy Energy Blend that is Safe and is Reasonably priced on the shelves in the USA once again.

The bulk of this product is soy nuts which is pretty much inedible. I tried a few and they are tasteless and bland. I put some out for the squirrels and birds. They ate the almonds and cranberries but left the soy nuts. Even my dog won't eat them and he eats horse manure! Out of the 36oz in the package there's probably 25oz of soynuts that I can't even give away. Waste of money.

This is the richest most milk-like rice beverage and the label on it does not mention canola oil, which contains up to 2% toxic erucic acid and is found in many rice beverages that are fed to children! Canola oil cannot be used by US FDA regulation in infant food. (One research paper found higher levels of erucic acid in red blood cells of autistic children compared to non-autistic children, and there are many other well established toxic effects of erucic acid in humans and animals. Look in the medical journals.)

This product is sold in my neighborhood Ralph's (best price), VC discount, and Whole Foods in Los Angeles.

The 365 brand (Whole Foods own brand) is also canola-free. It is much cheaper but watery in comparison. I use it for cooking.

West Soy Rice beverage is also canola free. It has a more neutral taste and less body.

Many people find rice milk better tasting than other milk substitutes. I find it to be much easier to digest than soy and nut products. Soy milk, however, has much more protein. Aside from being hard to digest, I don't eat too much soy because of the anti-nutritional components; so I get my protein elsewhere.

The chocolate flavor is really great tasting, too.
Add to water, stir and voila! Delicious slightly tart cherry drink for those times when you want to be refreshed, but also want a bit of flavor to your water.

My wife and I have slightly different tasates in coffee, I like mine darker and she like a milder coffee.  This one however is just right for both of us.  I drink it daily without cream or sugar (which I only do when I actually enjoy the flavor of the coffee).  And we are on our second 5 pound bag!  I wish we had found this coffee sooner, it is great.

I like a good cup of Joe and when our friends turned us on to Kona coffee we were instant fans.  But the cost was killing us.  So when I saw that Amazon had their new grocery line I was on it checking out their price.  This is a great cup of Kona for the price.  I hate bitter coffee - this is smooth.

This Kona blend has smooth flavor and good taste for the price.  I would definately consider buying this again as 100% Kona coffee is very expensive, so this makes for a nice compromise.  As long as you know that when you are purchasing this product that it is a blend, it is my belief that you won't be dissapointed.
I found Jeremiah's Pick Kona Blend lacking flavor. I tried every trick I know to bring out all the taste it had but still found it weak.
Great coffee from a familiar maker, this kona blend really rocks and the price is unbeatable anywhere!

We really liked Jeremiah's Pick Fogbusters coffee in the five pound whole bean package, so I ordered this one for a bit of variety. We're SO pleased!

Yes, it's a blend (what did you expect for the price?), but the mellow smoothness of the Kona really comes through and makes for an outstanding pot of coffee. Without the almost-bitter notes of the Fogbuster, this Kona blend is complex, rich and delicious.

For a 12 cup drip coffeemaker, I use two and a quarter coffee scoops of the beans and grind for 15 seconds. It's perfect, and way better than Maxwell House or Folgers. Highly recommended!
It took a long time for me to receive this coffee, but it was worth the wait! I'm spoiled now and I find that regular coffee is lacking in flavor.
It was a nice product with a value price what can I say but great job and thank you
Very happy with product. Roast is just like I like it, not too light, not too dark. Makes a nice cup of coffee with just enough of the Kona to make it enjoyable.

The true test of a coffee's flavor for me is to drink it as espresso.  I've been roasting my own coffee for years, but mix it up sometimes by buying already roasted coffee.  This coffee has a great flavor with no bitter after taste when I drink a shot from my espresso machine.  When I drink it as regular coffee, I'll blend several of my favorite beans to get more complex flavors.  If you really want to find your favorite coffee, do a blind taste test.  It's fun and you might be surprised at which coffee you choose when your preconceived notions are taken out of the equation.
It is a great coffee, my husband and I bought 18 different coffee's made cappuccino, espresso and latte. This coffee is great for everything, no after taste or bitter residue.

This coffee is NOT what I expected! I have had Kona coffee before which was spectacular! I guess that is what I was looking for. But you will not find it here. This is a blend, and that is probably why. I will never buy this again!

We usually drink french roast coffee (San Francisco Bay) that we grind daily and we've been enjoying that kind of coffee for a while.  We were visiting friends and we were served coffee which tasted very good and it was a bit milder than what we drink, so I asked about the brand and was told it was Jermiah's Kona mixed with some french roast.  I ordered my bag from Amazon and the shipment was prompt and well packaged.  As for the coffee, it was terrible: stale, no aroma, beans were dry.  I figured that since I have the bag I might as well brew some and the result was undrinkable coffee.  I tried it by itself, mixed 1/2 french roast, 1/4 ...without any success.  I don't know if I got a stale bag or what, but my experience left me with a bad taste. Amazon was great and they offered a refund.  Thank you Amazon!

We were given a pound of kona as a gift and loved it so i was tasked with finding a coffee for everday use thaT tasted close. Well after looking at the cost per pound of what we were using, starbucks breakfest blend at 12.00 per lb and then buying this at around 8.00 per lb it was a no brainer. I don't know I didn't do this years ago.
I honestly can not tell the difference between the 100% kona and this blend and its priced at a little more than folgers?
I hate to put this reveiw out there for fear that the price of this and availablity will be affected.
SO HERE IT IS FOLKS. AS CLOSE TO 100% KONA AS YOU CAN GET AND CHEAPER THAN MOST A++++.

This coffee has a very nice rich flavor without being bitter or over powering.  I use it in my espresso machine and regular drip maker.  It is very good coffee although a bit pricey... but worth it to a coffee lover such as myself.

Been drinkin gormet coffee many years now, bunch of different brands and roasters. It's hard to beat the Coffee Fool for quality and freshness, but I've come back to this Jerimias' pick for the quality and the savings I get here at Amazon. Its a great value and superb freshness--you'll be very pleased!

I thought this blend was an excellent alternative to the regular coffee I buy. Jeremiah's Pick Fogbuster is my preferred coffee, however if you are not of fan of bold coffee and want a solid mild coffee...The Kona Blend is an excellent choice.

I like my coffee black, but found this pretty much undrinkable without milk, and my office mates agreed.  It really does just taste charred.  I'm not sure if it's all like this or I just got a bad batch.  Anyways, the price isn't bad, but I can't recommend this to anyone.  I'm still looking for a good, reasonably priced 5lb bag.

This has been our new go-to coffee. It's got a balanced taste and smells great. Good price for the bag, too.

The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that I wish they offered it as an Organic option.

This is great coffee.  I make 8 cups every day and we use extra when we have company.  I have a bag sent to me every month.  It is the best coffee.  I have had many compliments on it. I got a rubbermaid container that has a handle and pours and it holds the whole thing.  I grind the beans every night when I set up my machine and it is very fresh.  We like strong, but not bitter coffee and we drink it black no sugar.  This is rich full bodied but never bitter or acidic tasting.  I have been using it for over a year and I will continue to use it until they no longer sell it.  My in-laws like it so much I am planning to get them a subscription for Christmas.  We used to use Gevalia, but this is far superior and less than half the price. When I first ordered it I was afraid we would not like it because it was so cheap.  It is the cheapest stuff I have ever bought.  I only bought it because a reviewer that was reviewing a different coffee I planned to get recommended this instead.

Jeremiah's Pick Coffee Kona Blend, Whole Bean Coffee, I am addicted to it !!!  I buy it every time it even gets close to running out.  The folks at Jeremiah's Pick are very prompt and every order is right on time or early. Everyone has their own taste but as far as I am concerned , this is the best coffee I have ever drank !!!
The first time I ordered coffee, it was fresh and sealed tight. Second order the coffee wasn't as fresh. Good price though for bulk
These beans are so dry they crumble.  Horrible coffee.  Reminds me of the starbuck's beans you get at Walmart.  Yuck.  Avoid at all costs, they are not what they appear.
A lot of reviews say this coffee is smooth, my wife and I disagree.  We think it is very bitter.  We will not order these beans again but are open to trying other Jeremiah's products...

Valerian and Chamomile are blended with spearmint leaves, lemon grass, hawthorn berries and orange blossoms to create a delicious tea to savor late at night before you drift off into dreams.

This tea is much more effective than regular Sleepytime and I can say this because my sleep cycle has been fairly regular with much fewer nights of tossing and turning. You may also find that your mood the next day is rather mild and you feel more relaxed in general. This could be due to getting a good night's sleep for a change or it could be that the valerian has a lasting effect.

Valerian is a very effective herb if you can't get to sleep and this tea is highly recommended for insomnia. Unlike sleeping pills, you won't feel groggy the next morning. Blend in a little lavender or orange blossom honey to enhance this deliciously mild minty tea.

~The Rebecca Review

This is a great cereal.  My kids, grandkids, and I have been hooked on this since it came out.  We really like it in a big bowl with white...OR chocolate milk.  Kids don't usually like to drink the milk left after the cereal is gone?  No problem. The milk is delicious, also.  There are more marshmallow pieces than Lucky Charms and they are larger in size.  We usually get the big bag and it lasts...oh, maybe a week.  Try 'em.
This was a bit strong from what I am used to but after drinking it a few times the flavor was great. I was pleased.

What can I say My cat loves them so I assume they are pretty tasty.

I can't say for sure because I have really not tried them myself :)

My first exposure to Patchi choclates was in Abu Dhabi, where Patchi stores are found aplenty. Now that we are back in the States, Amazon is the only place I've been able to find Patchi. Hooray! The chocolates are as rich and delicious as I remember. If you have never enjoyed Patchi chocolates - do yourself a favor and buy some!

This puppy formula is great. I have a Rat Terrier puppy, Maggie who had problematic diarrhea with other canned puppy foods, especially ones with rice, even when I changed the brand slowly as recommended. However with Holistic Select,the diarrhea stopped and she has been fine for the last four weeks. The "Puppy Recipe" looks and smells good, like a real home cooked chicken dinner. She is happy and healthy and growing like a weed.

I purchased this puppy food for my friend who has an elderly, toothless poodle named Prissy. My friend was hand-feeding her, desperately trying just to get her to eat.
