We picked these up at our warehouse club store... They are under forty cents per cup. Delicious, dark roast. I love the fact that each k-cup has an exposed filter rather than the plastic cups. We will be sticking to these!

I bought this at a local HEB in Texas for $6.99 and was skeptical but alas! this is great in my Platinum Keurig. I had decided not to use k cups anymore because the price is over the top but these will keep me going until Keurig prices come down! I brewed on the 10 oz setting and is VERY bold for me, I wwas even able to add more water through it because it was too bold for me. Love that it doesnt use all the plastic too...

When I opened the packaging for this coffee, at first I was concerned that they don't look like the normal Keurig K-Cups. They have a mesh bottom instead of the plastic cover all around. I tried them in my Keurig coffeemaker, and the cups work just fine, just as it says on the advertising.

This is absolutely THE BEST cup of coffee I have had in a long time. Great flavor, but no bitterness. Usually with the Keurig, the coffee cup isn't always full, even at the highest setting. Sometimes, the K-Cups produce a less than full, too strong cup of coffee.
Not this coffee! It is absolutely wonderful and the aroma is nice also while it's brewing. My husband came home from work shortly after I made a cup to try. He too, was really impressed with the aroma and taste. We will continue to purchase this with the "Subscribe and Save" feature Amazon offers. Wonderful coffee!

"By far the best cup of coffee ever!!!". I received a Keurig machine as a gift for my birthday and had been using the regular run of the mill products that were available. Then low and behold I found the San Francisco Bay brand of one cup brewing pods and you could not pay to stop using them! By far the best cup of coffee ever, every single

Coffee is fine. But I won't buy again. As another reviewer reported, this is not a standard K-Cup design. Simply a paper filter below a plastic collar. Shorter than a K-Cup, so doesn't come in contact with the bottom punch. Water flows through the filter and into the cup . . . albeit at a faster rate than being forced through the small bottom hole of the standard K-Cup. Do not attempt to brew a large cup, it will be too watery.

Twelve servings come packed in a vacuum packed plastic bag. When you open the bag, all twelve containers are exposed, so you'll need to repackage them in a zip-lock bag if you want to keep them fresh. They do not fit in the standard K-Cup carousel.

This coffee was not as good and rich I hoped-leaves a bitter taste even when sugar is added.  Also when op;en the package containing pods, the coffee is exposed to the air-only has a filter around it so smells nice in the coffee drawer of your kitchen.
These are my new favorite French Roast. If you subscribe and save, you get 36 cups for under $15. Do the math.

This review is from: San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Rainforest Blend, 36-Count (Grocery)
As the other reviewers have said, this is not a K-cup! I uploaded an image of one of these pods next to a K-cup for comparison. The difference is the filter is exposed in these pods as opposed to being fully sealed in a K-cup. Since the coffee is exposed to the air when you open the package, you will have to seal them with a clip or put them in an airtight bag or tupperware to prevent the rest of the pods from loosing freshness. Having said that, in my experience they are a great inexpensive alternative to use in your Keurig brewer. The 36 count boxes arrived as unmarked brown cardboard boxes, not the colorful retail packaging shown on amazon. Inside each cardboard box, there are three clear heavy duty plastic bags, each of which holds 12 of the pods. The bags are not resealable!

I like this brand because it is closer to a normal cup of coffee than most k-cups. I drink mine black and in my opinion if you make a pot of Folgers and a Folgers k-cup they are nothing alike. This is a closer taste to a cup from a pot made.
My husband is very fussy about his coffee and this one is the one he likes best.  Very robust taste.

I like these for a couple of reasons. First, the coffee is very good. I like a dark, rich roast and if I put this on the smallest setting for my Keurig brewer, I get a cup comparable to when I go to my favorite local coffee house.
Second, I like that they are little pouches rather than the k-cup - less plastic, less waste. And I've never had one leak coffee grounds.
The one drawback, as some have commented is that they may go stale faster. They are sold in boxes of 12 (Amazon sells you 3 of those boxes at a time), so as long as you just open one at a time and you finish the box within two weeks, it is not a concern - at least I have had no problem with staleness!
They are also less expensive with the Subscribe and Save - a win-win all around!

This is great coffee! Delicious flavor,a little on the strong side for those who like it strong.Love the cups- no extra plastic that goes into the land fills!!! This is a great idea for a k-cup. Keep up the good work !!!!!!
this is a great cup of coffee for that first morning wake up jo, I do keep it in a lock and lock container and in the fridge and it stays very very well, will keep getting it delivered from amazon.

I order coffee from Amazon all the time because of the good prices, this coffee not only one of the best buys but it is sooo!!! good,  one of the best yet not too strong but strong enought you got to try it to know ,it's good.
I love how I can make a fresh cup every morning without wasting a drop!  The French Roast for OneCup for Keurig K Brewers was tasty! I look forward to trying some of the other flavors.

I bought this thinking it was a good deal, and I remember in my Keurig brewer's sampler pack that I like the french roast cups.  So, I ordered this "deal".  Do not buy this burnt, after-tasting, muddy coffee!!  Not worth the pennies saved.

Well, lets say that I wish that I had heeded the warning of other reviewers. Since there were so many great and so many bad reviews, I didn't know what to make of it all - thought that possibly this was a fair cup of coffee, but that other reviewers had above average tastes in coffee. Nope. They're just regular old coffee drinkers like me that just don't want a funky taste, and funkier aftertaste. Not too much to ask from a finely brewed cup of coffee. I bought the French Roast...reviews of Fog Chaser were worse stating it tasted like dishwater, ashtray, etc.

Let me start by saying, other reviewers are correct that once you open the sealed bag, you must contain them in something else because it will not stay fresh. I just put mine in an empty coffee container because I am just lazy with my coffee...that is afterall why I own a Keurig...ease of use and a quality cup of coffee. Once I opened the outer sealed bag, I couldn't help but think it smelled like something that may have washed ashore on the San Francisco Bay!! I did approach it with an open mind, however, and brewed a cup of coffee.

It is easy to use just like traditional k-cups, despite the uniquely different design. I did get coffee grounds in my cup (really just a few), and that has happened to me before so I did not want to fault the product for that. As for the taste...that's where I fault the product itself!!! I gave this two stars because it is drinkable. Barely. I will fight my way though this pack, and never order again!! Let me put into this context for you...the coffee that I have drank at work from the old, stained coffee maker with some cheap store brand grounds thrown in tastes way better than this.

There are other ways to save a buck with your machine...there's that giant gray bullet looking filter contraption, there's a small red plastic version, there's the snap on lids, and then there's the aluminum foil that someone recently introduced me to. So here goes...I'll give you a break down of all that I've listed.
Giant Gray Bullet Filter - Does NOT taste anything like a traditional k-cup brewed cup of coffee, but by FAR better than this coffee here! The downside with this is that you have to push out the inner part of the machine that the k-cup usually rests in. Dishwasher safe though.

Small Red plastic and metal mesh filter - tastes closer to a traditional k-cup, and no popping out the machines inner parts. Have to dump grinds into garbage, but it is dishwasher safe. Good option. Also sold on Amazon.

Snap on lids - Amazon sells snap on metal or plastic lids. I have the metal ones. With these, you have to peel the foil off of your k-cup after first use and dump out grounds, and clean them out. Sounds like a hassle, but I guess that I've gotten used to it. Put two scoops of any coffee grounds that you like, snap the lid on, put it in your machine and brew as usual. Out comes a good quality cup of coffee that tastes the same as the traditional k-cup. Possibly because the filter and the cup are what you are reusing. Now someone recently told me that you can reuse the same k-cup over and over again, until the filter gives out. Haven't tried yet.

Aluminum Foil - first of all why didn't I think of that!! A k-cup only has a small piece of foil on top that the machine pierces. Really. So obvious that I can't believe that I never thought of it. Tried it the other day. Here's the scoop...still have to empty out a k-cup as you would with the above methods, add coffee grinds, etc. Tore off a small piece of foil, tried to get it just right around the lip because you can't just slap foil over it and have it fit in the machine with all of the excess foil...so it started to feel like a bit of a craft project. Once I got it to fit, I brewed a cup of coffee that tasted like what I have come to expect from a Keurig machine. There were a few grounds that fell into the coffee, but no more than with this crappy coffee!! I will perfect this aluminum foil method...measure, and pre-cut circles one day when I have time.

Truly, I have no spare time, which is why I RARELY review a product, but I felt strongly enough about this terrible product, that I should save someone else the palatal distress! Not worth the money! Not worth feeling like you wasted your money when you throw them away! Not worth having to endure 36 cups of sub-standard coffee!! Again I'm no no connoisseur...just a regular coffee drinker!
sorry, but this coffee was a little too roasted for me, even thoughts of burnt coffee go through my mind.  I'm using it up, but not for fixing my friends a cup of coffee

Being a huge fan of the "subscribe and save" program through Amazon, I decided to add coffee to an ever growing list of products delivered.  This coffee, however, is the worst my husband and I have ever tried!  Beware.

THIS COFFEE TASTES GREAT BEST VALUE FOR KERIG SYSTEM ONE THING YOU MUST DO WITH THIS COFFEE AFTER UNPACKING IS PUT IT IN A PLASTIC BAG TO KEEP FRESH YOU MUST KEEP THE AIR OUT DONT PUT IT IN THE FRIGE KEEP IT ROOM TEMP IF YOU ARE A COFFEE EXPERT LIKE ME YOU WILL LOVE THIS COFFEE RICH FLAVOR ALL FLAVORS ARE GREAT EVEN THE DECAF YOU WILL SAVE AROUND 10 CENTS TO 12 CENTS PER POD LEAVE IT TO AMAZON TO BRING US THIS GREAT COFFEE I AM A PRIME MEMBER I SAVE ON SHIPPING AND HANDILING BECOME A PRIME MEMBER AND SAVE WAY TO GO AMAZON

This is the WORST coffee I have had in years.  Either they do not know what French Roast is or someone really messed up.  I put cream in my coffee so at least I can taste that.  Avoid this brew! Does not deserve any "Stars" because it cannot be coffee.
I thought that this was a great idea for a K-Cup...still do...but after one cup we threw the rest of it away...oh my!

I AM NOT A COFFEE EXPERT BUT AM VERY PARTICULAR.

I FOUND THIS COFFEE THE BEST OF ALL I HAVE TRIED.

I TOTALLY BELIEVE IN RECYCLING AND CREATING THE LEAST AMOUNT OF WASTE POSSIBLE.

THIS DESIGN HAS ABOUT 1/4 THE AMOUNT OF PLASTIC THAT ALL THE OTHER BRANDS HAVE.

IF FACT, I USE TO FEEL GUILTY EVERYTIME I USED ONE OF THE OTHER, ALL PLASTIC K THINGS,

NOW I AM HAPPY WITH THE COFFEE AND GUILT FREE.

The Rogers Family Company continues to be a tremendous supporters of local schools. As Principal of Jefferson Elementary, I appreciate the kindness and generosity this company has shown us. A few years back they donated $10,000 to our school and most recently they provided our staff a one cup coffee maker and samples of these wonderful Keurig coffees. My favorite is the French Roast. Strong flavor with a smooth finish. Please support this company by purchasing their coffee.

This is without a doubt the worst coffee I ever tasted!  The only reason I ever tried a box of this coffee is that the "wonderful" people at Amazon canceled my subscribe and save item of Diedrich french roast.This coffee even smells horrible right out of the box.

Not going to mince many words on this terrible coffee.  It is substantially inferior to a K-cup or Solofill/My-K-Kup as it leaves a LOT of mud in the cup with your coffee.  It's over-roasted, having a burnt, ashtray-flavored quality.  Very disappointed with the product.
I have never had coffee as bad as this. If you like bitter flavorless coffee maybe this is for you. I am very disappointed and would not buy it again at any price.
Save yourself from trying these k-cups - not a good substitute for the typical ones, like the ones from Green Mountain.  Bitter taste and unpleasant after taste as well.  Not worth it at all.

Gave them a try.

It does brew a cup of coffee but not with the same quality taste as the K-Cup.

The difference is not brewing the coffee in the K -Cup is evident in taste,

It is a patent work around that for me is not worth what frankly is a trivial cost savings.

Yes, sometimes quality matters.

This coffee is awful, very bitter, and I have had others taste it, my sister and my husband, its not drinkable. I wanted to return it, but its grocery, so I am stuck with it. Very disappointing. I bought it because it had good reviews and a great price.
these arent k-cups but can be used in a keurig and go stale, they are getting sued by gmcr for a patent violation

These Kcups?? were flimsy imitation want a bees and were not what I expected at all.  Very disappointed and will not fall for that again.  The coffee was weak and the containers split.  I threw them out after trying a couple.

I tried it when it arrived and did not like it. I tried to send the other unopened bags back but that request was was denied by Amazon. I tried to drink it when we ran out of our reg k-cups and we waiting on the new delivery, it was all I had in the house and I still could not drink it. I gave it all away. The man of house also could not drink it. If you order it for the price as I did, beware if you are somewhat spoiled by good coffee. I am a fan of most Starbucks products, although I am not crazy about the Starbucks k-cups. We have been drinking the Donut Shop K-cups forever. I also like Green Mountain breakfast blend. I spend over $50.00 a month just on Donut Shop K-cups.
This was the most disappointing coffee I've gotten for the Kcup. The only way I was able to drink it was to add milk and chocolate syrup to it to cover the taste. Not good.

I love my k-cups and this is the worst I have ever tasted!  I thought most of the reviews sound good....so give it a chance...after a few sips, I threw the entire 36 cups into the trash! Don't listen to the rave reviews...stick to brands you already know and love!

The cups are smaller and hold less coffee than the competitors. They also are not airtight so will degrade once the package is opened unless used quickly. But even if used quickly they are weak and watery. Actually, more like dishwater. They should come with a warning label. I would have wanted to know that they were weak and watery by design.
Open air cups - not a good idea. Better off with real K cups.  Open air cups - not a good idea. Better off with real K cups.

Finally I don't have to be beholden to Keurig's outrageous prices.
Nor do I feel bad about all the packaging that goes into the trash as SF Bay's done the OneCup all eco-friendly. I have loved buying this coffee in bulk @ Costco - now I can use the Keurig my Mom gave me for Christmas last year, Amazon & my Prime(free) shipping so this is a WIN-WIN!

I ordered this because of the price and when it arrived and the box said "fits MANY keurig brewers" I was a bit worried.  But the pod fit perfectly in my B70 and the coffee that it made was outstanding.  I understand the concern about it not being "airtight" but storing it in an airtight container works and I like that it is a little less plastic being put into the trash.  This, and my Ekobrew refillable k-cup, are my favorite things for my Keurig.

I could smell the aroma of this french roast coffee when I took off the plastic covering the box. It smelled wonderful.
It was just as good when brewed.
I like that the pods are not solid plastic and take up less room in the trash and hopefully less room in the landfill.
Good product.
This is a great coffee. Dark and smoky without being bitter. Combine great taste with a great price and you really have a winner!  The decaf is really good too!

These pods work great.  I usually drink emerals, double black diamond, and recently newmans.  All of these are extra bold and dark. I brew 10oz.  I was concerned about weak coffee body and flavor.  These cups are definitely worth trying.  You won't be disappointed.  The 10oz came out great!

I've purchased the Fog Chaser and the Rainforest Blend from Amazon, they are both very good, I was thoroughly impressed.  I like strong flavorful coffee, and SFB definitely delivers!  I found the 80 count French Roast at Costco over the weekend, and couldn't pass it up - it is also excellent!  I also like the eco-friendly packaging, and the mission statement of the Rogers family.  Highly recommend it if you like a strong cup of joe!

We usually buy the Newman's bold K-cups, thought we would try this for something to switch up occasionally, and since this is less expensive, it caught our eye... we are very pleased. Love the "less packaging" and it works just fine in the Keurig. Of course, we keep these stored in a ziplock baggie. The boldness of the french roast comes thru without being bitter. We will continue to keep this on hand!

When I first got these K-cups I looked at them in disbelief. They had nothing in common with the regular K-cups. It looked more like just a plain coffee filter in a shape of a K-cup, sort of a look through contraption. But in the end they worked well and I have to say made one of the best cups I ever brewed in my Keurig machine. Better than Newmans and Tullys, for sure.

A good, strong French Roast with a smooth mouthfeel and no bitter finish. Definitely planning to try San Francisco Bay's other products. I love how much less plastic is wasted. (My Keurig is my best friend, but there's so much waste in most disposable K-Cups!)

I was a bit skeptical about ordering this coffee, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's very good and the cost is a fraction of what other K-cups are going for these days. I paid less than .50 per cup. I have a Keurig Platinum Edition brewer (from America's favorite home shopping channel:) and the cups work fine in my machine. I prefer a medium roast flavor so I brew the 8 oz cup and it does not taste watered down. If you prefer a light tasting coffee you could even brew the next size up; someone who enjoys a darker flavor may want to use the smaller cup setting. The cups do fit in my Keurig carousel display holder. However, the coffee is essentially contained in a thick paper filter so if you won't be using the pods quickly then you might want to get yourself an airtight container to store the unused pods/cups to maintain freshness. They arrive in a vacuum-sealed package that is not resealable. If you're on the fence about whether or not to try this brand, go for it - you'll be glad you did.

This is right up there with Green Mountain Revv for bold, dark flavor. For packaging, it's genius. They figured out how to eliminate more than half the plastic waste involved in making and using K-cups...and without any loss of coffee quality. I end up throwing very little into the garbage by first emptying the grounds into my compost. My only suggestion for San Francisco Bay Coffee would be to use a zip-lock bag to help preserve the freshness of unused K-cups. Give this a try--its great coffee!

I was so happy to find this deal on this rich, robust French Roast for my Keurig coffee maker.It smells wonderful when you open the packages-one thing I have really missed with a one-cup system. I will definitely keep buying this product.

I have been using kcups for a few years now and recently discovered these. I was sceptical but decided to try the SF Bay French Roast, Fog Chaser and Rainforest blends. I generally like strong, dark blends like emerils or dark magic. Overall, all 3 of the SF Bay blends are really good. The French Roast is my favorite though. It is strong and has a rich flavor and is not bitter. The fog chaser is STRONG and a bit bitter. The Rainforest is a bit less strong and has a slight bitterness. All are good strong blends but I like the richness of the French Roast. Overall these are really good and are much cheaper than "traditional" kcups which is an added bonus.
better for the environment with less packaging and by far the best priced keurig cup now. Costco is 8 dollars cheaper though on the 80 pack

I was fascinated by the description of these new K-cups and decided to take a chance after reading the reviews. I am very pleasantly surprised at the wonderfully flavorful coffee that they made! I am very particular about my coffee and like only very dark flavorful roasts. I had not really been pleased with any of the K-cups--some of course were better than others--and had pretty much settled on Starbucks Verona as my favorite, but these are better! (And--MUCH less expensive!)
My Keurig Platinum is at my beach home (only weekend usage and not every weekend at that!) so I was a bit concerned about this style K-cup staying fresh once the individual bag was opened. A bag ended up staying very fresh for several weeks--of course I resealed the bag with a couple of clips as well as I could--so this is no longer a concern of mine. I will be a regular consumer!

This is decidedly the best K-cup coffe I ever had. Before I tried this one, my k-cup carousel was a multi-colored mess with samples from variety of k-cups; from green mtn breakfast blend (just OK) to Emeril's dark roast (fairly decent) to Kona blend (terrible). Now with SF Bay french roast, I dont even need the carousel. These cups stay fresh in their original packaging. The taste is just the way I like it - strong but not bitter. Just a great coffee.

I had not read the reviews and was quite surprised when I opened the package. There are K-Cups! I was about to return them, when I read the reviews, so I just popped one in, and WOW! nice and strong coffee, with less packaging!

Will definitely try all the flavors from this great company!

After an awful experience with those vile tasting Grove Square wannabee Keurig cups, I was very hesitant to try anything but authentic 'K-Cup (tm)' coffee portions. I had been eyeballing these San Francisco Bay brand here on Amazon for awhile, but hadn't purchased them. When I saw them at Costco (by the way, they sell them in a box of 80 for about $25), I decided to take the plunge. And they're not bad.

As mentioned by others, the 'cup' design is essentially a paper filter filled with coffee grounds and then attached to the underside of a plastic ring which fits into the Keurig brewer. The top is sealed off with the traditional thick foil which is pierced by the top needle of the Keurig brewer. The bottom needle which pierces the bottom of the standard K Cups does not even come into play with these as the water is forced into the grounds. The coffee passes through from the filter and then directly out the bottom of the k cup holder and into the coffee cup.

Like every traditional K-Cup these are a bit on the weak side, especially as you increase the cup size on your brewer, but I usually brew at the 8 oz setting and I thought these were acceptable. It does have the (for lack of a better word) 'burnt' French Roast flavor which is surprisinly absent from most so-called 'dark roast' K-Cups and that is much appreciated.

My only issues with these cups are the freshness issues. Since the coffee is basicaly hanging out in the open air (only the paper filter separates it from the outside world) they will change taste very quickly. I saw someone mention that the Amazon package has them in individual bags of 12. The bos from Costco has them in individual bags of 8, so of course the manufacturer is aware of the issue of them going bad more quickly. I personally would prefer they be bagged with quantities no more than 4 or 5 - the quantity I would use up in 2 or 3 days. I don't have one, I think they look tacky, but if you have one of those 'Carousels' on your counter to display your k cups, I think this product would be completely incompatible with it. My other issue is that since this coffee drips directly from the filter into the k cup holder on the machine, the holder will have to be washed regularly (probably daily) lest the coffee oils build up and change the final coffee taste even more..

I'm generally happy with this product though, and probably will buy it again. with proper storage in an airtight container, I think the economical price evens out the freshness issues.

I drink Starbucks with my own grinder on the weekends, but during the week, due to convenience, I use a Keurig. I have tried the Starbucks pods, and they are ok, but not as good as some of the other coffees that I have had.

This is a strong roast. It came in 3 bags with 12 "pods" in each bag. They do not use the plasic cups on the outside, but just use a little coffee filter attached to a plastic disc which still fits in the keurig pod hole. The needle in the Keurig Machine is not touched by the SF Bay pods. This eliminates those stray grounds from finding your cup of coffee, or potentially clogging up the your brewer. The filter bag with the coffee in it is not firm before it is used, but the grounds swell during the brewing process and the bag has a much firmer, fuller look after it is brewed.

The coffee itself is pretty decent. I think for the price, I would much rather pay 13 for a pack of 36, than 13-18 for a pack of 24 any day. After the bag is opened, I put the unused coffee pods into a zip lock bag and have not had an issue with freshness. I actually tried a green mountain donut house from a previous order, and when compared with the SF Bay, I prefered the San Fran Bay French Roast.

EDIT: 29 Mar 2012
I usually leave the pod in the brewer until I brew again. Recently noticed that the SF Bay pods have been dripping a little coffee after being brewed. Not enough to make a significant mess, but it has been getting on the bottom of my mug and I notice a ring on my desk occassionally if I have 2 cups in the morning. Nothing that a wet paper towel can't take care of, but just something to note.

Bought this because it was suggested to me via email from Amazon. So disappointed! I love bold, dark coffees (French Roast from Tully's, Green Mountain, etc), but this tastes like an ash tray.

Gave it two stars because the more environmentally friendly design is clever. Otherwise, it would have been one star for sure.
Robust, full-bodied and delightful. If you like deep, rich complex coffee, this is the perfect blend for you! Appreciate the reduced eco-friendly packaging too. Added to my Subscribe & Save account.

I bought this as an alternative to the .60 cent K-Cups I had been buying previously and I'm glad that I did. The coffee is good, aromatic, and strong. So strong that I can usually squeeze two cups from a single K-cup. It's also environmentally friendly due to the packaging containing a filter at the bottom instead of plastic. This is a double edged sword though because it tends to result the coffee losing flavor after extended periods (2-3 weeks if left out and open).

Overall, if you're looking for coffee that costs $.30 cent per cup, this is a good choice - just be sure to put open bags of it in a zip-lock for freshness.

I bought this coffee without reading through the description thoroughly, so when they arrived minus the plastic cup I was used to I was shocked and ready to send them back.  But I decided to give them a try and I have to say that there is no difference between these and the regular Kcups.  The coffee is rich and full bodied and I like the fact that they are a little more environmentally friendly that the regular plastic cups.  I will and actually have ordered them again.  I normally use my adapter for my bagged coffee, but when I am in a hurry (or for my husband who would rather not fool with the adapter) I use the occasional K cup, or this kind now that I have tried them!

I will start off saying i'm not a coffee snob, but I think these are great. For the price they can't be beat- and we keep them in a mason jar on the counter (so cute!) to keep them fresh. my husband also said they are easier to prepare to go into the compost pile.
Any reservations on this, please order them and try! what will you be out? with ship and save only $13.50.
Strong coffee at the right price the one cups work just as well as the k cups do for a lot less money
I have been searching for a good tasting French Roast Decaf and I finely found it. I also love the packaging,it is easier to store.

Bought a Keurig last year but have struggled to find decent coffee.  We finally resorted to the little refillable thing but it was a mess and a hassle.  We've always enjoyed SF Bay Coffee and these pods are wonderful.  The quality of the coffee is SO much better than anything else we've tried.  Not sure about those negative reviews--nothing watery or dishwatery about the cups we are brewing.  I like the packaging much better as well, I don't want things I consume touching all that plastic that is getting heated up.  The French Roast is perfect in the morning and the Rainforest Blend is wonderful too.  The Company has also made a big commitment to the communities where their coffee is grown, including fair trade and sustainable ventures.

This is some of the best coffee of any kind that I've had in years. I don't write a lot of reviews, but had to give these folks credit for an excellent product. I like very strong coffee and San Francisco Bay French Roast delivers - rich flavor, delightful aroma... yes, due to the unique pod design (which works perfectly with my Keurig brewer) you have to store them in an airtight manner, but it's totally worth it. The only improvement I'd suggest is making their shipping bags - which have a valve like on a regular bag of coffee - zip-top, so I can use them without a rubber band after opening. But I expect that my have price implications, and I prefer the lower price over a better bag.

I just recently tried the San Francisco Bay Coffee one cup for the Keurig and instant brewers. I was a little leery of trying them as many people have been but decided to give them a try. They were a little less expensive and I figured if I liked them it would be worth it. I love the flavor. I don't mind the way its packaged at all. And they work great in my Keurig machine. The only difference I find is because of it being a filter holding the coffee rather than the plastic cup with a tiny hole - after the coffee is brewed it drips a while longer because of the open filter. Not a big deal - just something to mention. The other thing about the SFBay French roast that I bought - compared to the other French Roast varieties - when I use my largest cup setting on my Keurig machine (mine has 3 sizes to choose from) it is not nearly as strong. If I use the small setting, which is about half the amount - it is the same strength as other French roast K-cups. So for me - wanting to save a little money by trying the San Francisco Bay cups - it really isn't working out that way as I use 2 K-cups on the small cup setting to fill my big coffee mug. So price wise - it comes out about the same as what I have been paying for the others. But it is excellent - strong and good flavor. I kind of like that they come packaged in individual plastic bags of 12. And it is no big deal to put them in a little jar or container by my machine. I do that with my regular coffee maker - so this is no different. Not sure why others feel that is a problem. Hope this helps anyone who is considering buying this brand. I would definitely recommend it - and would give it 5 stars on taste - but just did 4 because of it not making a large mug as strong as I like.
THIS IS THE BEST K-CUP DESIGN. IT ALLOWS A RICHER AND GREAT FLAVOR TO SEEP THROUGH.  A FAVORITE AND AT A BETTER PRICE COMPARED TO OTHER K-CUPS.

The coffee is wonderful! Excellent and I would purchase again, great price too.

The 'pod' is a bit different design than the K-cups I have been using, but they work just fine with my Kuerig.

Unlike some of the reviews of this coffee I've seen, I did not detect any "off" flavor and the coffee is GREAT. I can get two 5.25 oz. cups (actually the smallest cup size is really 6 oz.), from one unit and that lessens the already good cost of this particular brand.
Great coffee! Nothing more to say -- good product --  highly recommend it to any k-cup users!  Much more reasonable than other brands!

I really like these French Roast k-cups.  I was concerned having read other reviews and ordered the Fog Lifter first (which I like as well but it is not as strong).  I ordered 80 k-cups which is a great value.  I have no issues with the "cupless" k-cup. I also do not find the flavor "burnt" or "bitter" which I read in other reviews.  I find it to be a full bodied bold coffee.  It works great in my Keurig and the coffee strength is perfect.  Flavor is robust and I look forward to having a cup.  I would recommend this coffee to others who enjoy the French Roast bold coffees.
WE enjoy this blend very much at our home.  It  has the good strong coffee taste that i like.  Works well both ways,  with or without creamer.

Please see my complete review for all the San Francisco blends under the Rainforest blend. Except I forgot to mention the Fog Lifter
I would put in the little lighter than this French Roast, which I believe is the best Bold I have tried.
San Francisco Brand is the only K-cup brand we purchase now that we have found all the PLUSES!

I purchased "San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, French Roast" about 2 weeks ago. Since then I've compared it to "Green Mountain Nantucket Blend", alternating between the two with an occasional "Tully's Italian Roast" mixed in.

My wife prefers the slightly bolder blend of the Tully's; I prefer the Green Mountain. Both of us have found the "San Francisco Bay, French Roast" to be a good blend that's robust while not overwhelmingly bitter. It may well become our coffee of choice.

Personally, I find the "Tully's Italian Roast" and "Newman's Own Special Blend" to have a bit of a biting after taste that I don't experience with the "San Francisco Bay, French Roast".

I have friends who only use K-cups. I've given them samples of the "San Francisco Bay, French Roast". Their taste runs more to the bolder coffees. Both of them love the coffee.

Several reviewers have commented about the sediment left in the bottom of the cup from the "San Francisco Bay, French Roast". I agree with them, there is sediment; it's just like I experience with the "Tully's Italian Roast" and "Newman's Own Special Blend". That seems to be typical of some of the bolder blends and especially the darker roasts. It may also be that the beans are ground finer on these blends to extract more flavor in the brew cycle.

These are not traditional K-Cups but they'll work just as well in your Keurig coffee maker. I actually think I get better water flow through the coffee with this new design. My only complaint is the need to keep them sealed rather than in the carousel where I normally store my K-Cups. The cups are packaged in a very heavy plastic bag, which is properly vented for storing coffee. I cut the top enough to remove one cup at a time, then fold over the top and put a clip on it. We drink enough coffee that the 8-cup bag only lasts a couple of days. It's really not a big deal.

Should you try it? Probably.

I enjoy good coffee, even more when it's reasonably priced. I'm not a "coffee snob" and I'm willing to try new things. For me, the "San Francisco Bay Coffee" has been a good experience. I'll probably try some of the other blends as well. And, although I bought an 80-cup pack for this first try, I'm happy I have the choice of 36 or 12 count packs to try on the other blends.

The San Francisco Bay Coffee One Cup for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, French Roast, 36-Count was a great value. This is my second time buying the SFB brand. I like the Fog Chaser much better and will stick with that one next time!

The trouble I find with a lot of the Kuerig cups is that I like my coffee strong and most cups aren't strong enough if I want a full cup of coffee without using two cups at a lower volume. With these, I get the strength I want with just one.

The concept for packaging this coffee was great. Simply putting the coffees in a ziploc bag preserved their freshness and the idea that I was putting less plastic in our local landfill was great as I live in a little village on the Yukon River.

However, I found this roast to have a very bitter aftertaste. I generally enjoy a full, dark roast and I like the bitterness of coffee. That's the whole point. But I was really unhappy with the finish in this particular French Roast and won't purchase it again. I am slowly working my way through the 80 count I bought, on days when I have a taste for added creamer flavors. This isn't a comment on any of the other San Fransisco Bay products, as I haven't tried them, just this particular roast.

I love the fact that this delicious, strong K-cup ready coffee comes with an exposed filter. I'd been trying to cut the bottoms off of the K-cups I had been using, in order to recycle them. (good intentions, but not realistic!) The fact that they don't even have the bottom portion of the "regular" K-cups while still maintaining excellent, rich flavor makes me a convert.

This flavor, French Roast, is bold, strong and just what I'm looking for as a morning coffee, and holds up very well as iced coffee as well.

I'll be buying many more of these!

This is a great waste saving package 'k' cup. Lovely strong nutty flavor. Be careful to seal the cups between use. To me, this coffee is fresher than standard k cups. Definitely worth the added hassle of reselling the pack.

Coffee is bold and very good. I like it better than Newman s and Folgers K-Cups. It is a bargain for the price. Also it is great that the "cups" are not plastic but just a filter :)My favorite k-kup for sure!
The cost of the San Francisco Bay K-cups is the lowest I have been able to find anywhere.  Good coffee too!  This deal is hard to beat.
I am a coffee snob.  This coffe is a mild french roast.  It works great in my Keurig.  This company has the right idea of less garbage, by using less plastic.  They prices is very resonable also.

I tried these alternative k-cups for the first time and thought they were pretty good. I don't think I'll be buying the traditional k-cups again. The French Roast were nice and dark roasted.

My 80-pack came with 10 bags of 8 pods. When I opened a bag I put the ones I wasn't going to use right then in a ziplock bag. Not much hassle to save 50% on the cost of k-cups.

PURCHASED FROM MY FAVORITE INTERNET PROVIDER, Amazon.  I am a coffee nut...love a great cup of coffee.  If you want a full bodied coffee with great aroma and taste (not bitter), then I strongly suggest San Francisco Bay French Roast.

If you like Star Buck coffee, you'll love San Francisco Bay coffee. Nice bold taste. Fog Chaser is very strong. It will wake you up. French Roast is milder than Fog Chaser, but still has a great taste. It make Green Mountain taste like flavored water.
If you like strong coffee, this is the best one I have found. To keep it fresh, you probably want to put it in a zip lock bag after opening the 12-pod packs.

Love this coffee and love the price!I love the smell when I open the container and it is my new favorite coffee. I would recommend this to anyone. I keep it in a zip lock bag after opening to keep it fresh until used.
I work from home and drink aobut 5-6 cups off K-Cup coffee a day. This is good tasting coffee and the lowest price K-Cup on the market!

I did not buy these from Amazon, but apparently will in the future. I was in my local membership-required-big-box store (am I allowed to say Costco?) when I saw this stuff for about 27 cents per serving. Since it's very easy to return stuff there, I bought it. As others have commented, it's unusual looking, in that just the familiar looking K-Cup ring and foil at the top are there. The plastic cup around the bottom is missing. But that doesn't matter and it actually creates less waste and probably costs less to manufacture.

Off course, being green doesn't matter if the coffee tastes bad. In this case, it does not. It's got to be one of the two best French Roast K-Cups I have ever had. Full of flavor, without being bitter or burnt. I went back to the store a few days later and they had sold out and they are not sure of plans to get more, so it looks like I will continue to buy my coffee from Amazon, but instead of my usuall brand (Green Mountain French Roast), I will be buying these.
These K-Cups arrived promptly after ordering; the are convenient to use, and the coffee tastes great. Highly recommend the product. Have had no problems.

This has become our daily coffee. We were previously Starbucks (brewed at home) coffee drinkers, although I will say these are not quite as strong as Starbucks brewed coffee...not weak either though. I usually buy them at our local wholesale warehouse, where the price is a little better, but I come to Amazon when I am needing it fast and don't have time to go to the store. It makes a good cup of coffee, that I happily serve to guests. The only down side is that the individual packaging does not allow for display. Not a big deal.

The coffee is very good.  The cup looks different than the standard k-cup but who care as long as the coffee is good and cost effective. With monthly subscription,  it saves me about $10 a month for regular drinking for 1 person.  Do the math if you have more people drinking.  Recommend the coffee and subscription

The lowest price I could find for k-cups and still tasted delicious!!! K-cups fit my Kuerig and deliver the same results! I tried several flavors and everyone is true to taste. I will order again!!
Why pay more for the exact same flavor as the other brands??

We purchase on Subscribe and Save, 3 boxes a month.  I like the little filters instead of the pods. The price is great. My husband thinks the coffee is stronger than our previous French Roast.  However I really like the robust flavor and, at this price, he just adds a little more cream.  If this had resealable bag I would give four stars. We had to buy a large airtight jar.

I'm generally a fan of dark roast coffees, and this is one of the better K-Cups of that variety. Perhaps not as strong as Emeril's but better than the Starbucks French Roast K-Cups. (None of the K-Cups I've found are as tasty as a well-made Aeropress cup, but the ease-of-use, cleanup, and ability to change varieties for each person more than make up the difference.)

The form factor doesn't seem to have any significant disadvantage for my. This box contains 3 12-count sealed plastic bags (each with one of those one-way air valves). I've kept the "open" dozen in a Gladware tub. All's well.

I like this coffee and the design of the cup. Not the same as a K-cup but works just as good. I like the Fog Chaser better than the French Roast but this is a pretty good tasting one too. Can't beat the price..15.99 for 36 is much cheaper than any other on Amazon.

Always in the market for a cheaper k-cup (and living in San Francisco) I was happy to have stumbled upon the  San Francisco Bay brand. I was worried about the weird shape at first but it still works in the brewer. I like that the packaging is trimmed down so I don't feel as guilty about the environental impact of overpackaging  (told you I live in SF!)  The French Roast is very bold and at first I was unsure...I think I like  it just fine but plan to try another roast next time. It also tastes a bit more acidic than other brands but that isn't such a bad thing either. I think I am getting used to it. My problem is that I switch from several different brands all the time so I may y always notice that difference. I recommend this and plan to order this many more times!  I would give it another half star if i could!

I enjoy a good cup of coffee, when I found these little gems I was hesitant like other people. We were all brain washed thinking we had to use the wasteful K-cups. As they continued to raise the price of coffee up and up and up I was trying different ways to utilize my Keurig coffee maker, purchased refill cups etc you know how that works. Well this is by far the best way to enjoy a good cup of coffee, the way the cups are packaged does not bother me at all, I don't let it sit around to get stale , I drink it. If you notice the bags are vacuum sealed and a zip lock bag would not work people. If it is not broken don,t fix it, and this is not broken so just keep these prices affordable, and keep the quality of the coffee just the way it is.
I have tried a large variety of french roast k-cups over the last 4 years, even the re-usable k-cups where you add your own coffee, and this is by far my favorite.

I really like this coffee - no problem with the bags being open as they are long gone before they would have gone stale.  They work well in my Keurig B40 - I'm wondering if some of the people who've had trouble haven't perhaps used these in the really tiny version of the brewer that does not have a water reservoir.  Love the price and love the coffee.

I was surprised when I got these from Amazon because like the other reviewers said, the cups do not look like traditional K-Cups, because the bottom of the cup is a filter - not plastic like the traditional ones. But don't let this bother you - they worked just fine.

The coffee was better than most - strong flavor. One of the better stronger brews.

The only issue I see is that after you open the package, you must use the cups quickly or they will get stale. Some people like the K-Cups because they don't use that much coffee and so it is always fresh. But if you are like me and drink a lot of coffee, I don't see how you can go wrong with this coffee.

Yup not a K-Cup. If you don't like the non-plastic cup, then don't buy them.

For our family, we like the taste, and the price. We've tried both this French Roast and the Fogchaser, and enjoy them both. We have not had any issues with grounds in the coffee. We keep them in a zip-lock bag after opening the 12 pack bag, so we have not had issues with them tasting stale (we drink them in about 2-weeks). I'm guessing that these cost less since they don't have to pay a royalty to Green Mountain Coffee Roasters for using the K-Cup name and design.

If you're looking for a fairly inexpensive alternative to the K-Cup, these are a great choice!

Great bold french roast for the Keurig coffee machine. The flavor is bold and strong. If you are  a french roast fan, this is the best I have had for the Keurig yet. Even more, the cups are much more environmentally friendly than most of the others on the market because hey use much less plastic- just a small ring and the with a soft biodegradable filter attached.

I bought these in an attempt to get some Kcups at a reasonable price that were NOT instant coffee. While I'm not picky about coffee, I'm not going to waste my  time with instant-coffee Kcups no matter how cheap they are. Using Subscribe&Save, these are half price compared to what I pay at Costco for my husband's favorite Kcup: Starbucks Cafe Vienna. They do not have the white plastic "cup," instead the part under the foil top is coffee-filter material in a curved-bottom shape. So only the foil top is pierced when the machine brews. I like to think this means less waste! They are packaged in thick sealed plastic bags in groups of 12. Aroma is extremely fresh, taste is great, just as strong/rich in my opinion as the Starbucks ones. Wish they came in more flavors and larger quantities!

I'm certainly no coffee snob but I do know what I like... and I very much like the SFB french roast "k-cups". I do the S&S on these and it's pretty much the only coffee I drink now. The aroma is fantastic and the flavor is great. As for the folks bemoaning stale coffee, put the things in a tupperware container after opening the plastic bag. It's not an intellectual challenge.

This coffee had all the rich flavor that I expect from a dark roast and minimal bitterness. I suspect most folks are checking these reviews to find out if these weird cups actually work in a Keurig machine. They do. I had no issues. The unexpected benefit was the great coffee aroma. I love the Keurig system, but I miss the smell of coffee before it is prepared. The aroma is back with these as soon as you open the plastic bag that they come in. As much as I enjoyed the aroma, I felt compelled to store these things in another air-tight container, lest they lose their freshness. I also decided that I could not keep these cups in the rotary K-cup holder that we keep next to our machine.

Despite storage issues, I would get these again for their flavor, aroma, and price.

Function: these cupless k-cups work perfectly in our Keurig B130 (the business version of the small personal brewer) which makes only a small cup.

Less waste: We were really disappointed when we discovered that the plastic k-cups aren't recyclable. These are a terrific low-guilt, more responsible alternative.

Less storage space: they take up much less room to store. I buy k-cups in quantity to save money, but then I had to dedicate a large cabinet to storing them! Not so with these, partially because they're less bulky and partially because...

Great Price: these k-cups are much less expensive than other brands, especially at the Subscribe & Save price. At this price, I can buy less at a time and still pay less per cup than I could finagle with coupons & sales & bargain-shopping the major brands.

Taste: Amazing! I love a good dark French roast, and these are the best I've ever had. Dark & rich but not bitter. In fact, this morning I forgot to pour the creamer before I took a sip and I was amazed that it tasted really great. I've tried to go without creamer before - I'd like to get used to coffee without it - but could never stand to...until I did it by mistake this morning and it was so smooth I drank the whole cup that way. Trust me, this speaks volumes.

Conclusion: I'm keeping my subscription, and I just increased the frequency of my deliveries because we found we drink these more than the regular k-cups. How can you beat cheap, tasty, less bulky, and less waste?

As the other reviewers have said, this is not a K-cup! I uploaded an image of one of these pods next to a K-cup for comparison. The difference is the filter is exposed in these pods as opposed to being fully sealed in a K-cup. Since the coffee is exposed to the air when you open the package, you will have to seal them with a clip or put them in an airtight bag or tupperware to prevent the rest of the pods from loosing freshness. Having said that, in my experience they are a great inexpensive alternative to use in your Keurig brewer. The 36 count boxes arrived as unmarked brown cardboard boxes, not the colorful retail packaging shown on amazon. Inside each cardboard box, there are three clear heavy duty plastic bags, each of which holds 12 of the pods. The bags are not resealable!

This coffee is very good, it has a nice aroma and a good strong flavor.

I also like the "minimalist" k-cup design, but have a couple complaints with it. Since the individual pods aren't sealed, you have to keep them in a sealed package to prevent spoilage. It would have been nice if the plastic bag they came in was re-sealable.
Also, since the coffee doesn't just come out of a small hole in the bottom of the pod, the first cup you make with these will wash all the stray grounds out of your machine and into your cup. Be forewarned that you should wash the pod holder before using these.

Overall I like the product, just be careful about the different pod shape.

Unlike many others, I haven't paid much attention to the price of K-cups because I've been on Amazon's Subscribe & Save for K-cups for over a year now. Wanting to try another brew for a change prompted me to try these. I'd used this brand before in whole beans because they were at Costco so I knew I would like. Wow! These are very different from regular K-cups. Like another reviewer said, the aroma wafts like real brewed coffee and the flavor is rich and bold. I am so happy I took the chance on this. Subscribe and Save is the way to go!!!!!!!

I have been purchasing San Francisco Bay Whole Bean French Roast for years, for the money it has been a very consistent good cup of coffee. I bought a K-Cup brewer to please my guests. K-cup brewing really provides something for everyone without throwing pots of coffee down the sink.

But I must admit that I didn't fall in love with all the K-Cup selections out in the market no matter what the price, brand or blend. They were generally hitting a 6 to 8 on a scale of 10. I tried the San Francisco French Roast last week and I really loved it. For me, it is the best out there in the K-cup world.

Though the lower than usual price caught my attention, I was concerned that this coffee, marketed for Keurig, was not packed in the common cups.  Rather, the coffee is in small bags.  Not to worry! They fit as well as the usual cups do. I was so pleased with my first order, I have ordered several more...and given some as gifts to other Keurig fans.

At first I wasn't sure but I figured, at the price i'd give it a try.
I was pleasantly surprised at the flavor and quality of this coffee.
The K-Cup design is somewhat different and you will need to store
the coffee in a zip lock bag after opening the bag containing the
coffee. Other than that, it's quality coffee at a very nice price.
We are talking $0.41 each rather than $0.50+ each.
You can't beat it!
I'm now buying the 80 count and enjoying it even more as
the price is now $0.35 each.
Try it...you'll like it!

I ordered this to see how it compared to the Fog Chaser. It is a good French Roast coffee and is comparable to the Tully's that came with my machine. French Roasts are good for K-cups because you stronger flavor out of one, however, for overall flavor this is not as good as the Fog Chaser.

Price is excellent and the packaging is great as it has a much lower waste profile. It's also much easier to compost the grinds with these.

This hot sauce is not to overwhelming and has a nice garlicky flavor to it. Awesome taste or the Moruga in there, this hot sauce is liquidy so it had the dot plastic thingy in the middle. I put it on everything and i would definitely order more.

So I'm a pretty big fan of GT Dave's Trilogy and Synergy lines of bottled kombucha, and, as anybody familiar with true, natural kombucha knows, it has to be kept refrigerated, or else so-called bad things could happen (like continued fermentation). This brand does not need refrigeration, as it has gone through some sort of processing (pasteurization perhaps, yeast removal, I don't know really) to negate the need for storage and shipping complications. Of course, the downside is that health benefits attributed to natural kombucha are somewhat lost here, since processing kinda tends to that, but it still contains bacteria cultures (at least according to the label), it's still "organic" and most importantly, it still retains that vinegary kick that sort of defines the kombucha taste. Make no mistake, this product is far sweeter than GT Dave's, 60 calories for an 8.4 ounce can (vs. 60 calories for a 16 oz bottle of GT's ), but it's still got some kombucha-y flavor. It's perhaps not as "yeasty", and is certainly missing any hint of alcohol from the original fermentation - I'd need a bottle of GT's to compare to be sure - but it goes down nice and easy anyway. It would be a good way to get into drinking kombucha for someone that isn't used to it yet.

So, it's not a replacement for GT's or any other naturally fermented and bottled kombucha product (several come to mind that have pulled from shelves), but it *is* tasty, organic, shelf stable, and convenient, and I like it for that reason.

As for the flavor, I've tried two (of many) from this brand now, the "traditional" and the "green tea and lemon". So far my preference leans to the "green tea and lemon" just because I like the tartness of the lemon. The "traditional" hints at stereotypical sweet tea, with that kombucha-y vinegar kick, but it's just a little sweet for me. Of course, it's better to find a sample around town before committing to a case, if possible, at a health-food store, or more progressive grocery chain. I'll probably order another case of the green tea and lemon when I finish off the first one.

This is way too sweet and artificially fizzy.  Somehow the pasturization process took out the goodness of the real Kombuchas. I've found that GT's Synergy is one of the best.  It also contains raw Chia, an outstanding energy food. Watch out for others, like this Wonder Drink, that try to use the same words and imitate the quality companies that produce Kombucha the way it is meant to be drank. Find one of the GT's Kombucha products and compare for yourself.

Will this drink give you good health, great longevity, inner serenity and incisive mental clarity? No, no, no and no. Does it contain live organisms? It is pasteurized, so again no. Is is manufactured and canned by special mystical people high in the Himalayas? No. Isn't cane juice just sugar? Yes.

If you are looking for a funky tasting beverage where the taste horrifies yet refreshes and leaves you wanting more then give this a try. The citrus/vinegar combo is weird at first but now I'm hooked. As I am on a diet I like that the cans are small so I can get my taste fix yet not go crazy on the calories.

This drink is tasty and made with some pretty simple and natural ingredients. However, carbonation is added (in true kombucha it is a natural part of fermentation) and the drink is obviously pasteurized, which destroys any live culture (and thusly the probiotics that make kombucha popular as a health drink).

When I first tried this, I shrugged my shoulders and went "eh". Wasn't sure about it. Then I started sipping more, then a little more until I really understood the Kombucha thing! I'm not a Kombucha connoisseur by any means but I do enjoy drinking it. I don't have any idea about the whole pasteurized, non pasteurized concept, but what I do know is that this particular Kombucha makes me feel great. Can't explain it, but I guess you can say it "wakes me up" or makes me feel more "alert" or something. Whatever it is, I enjoy it and I enjoy the way it tastes! It's definitely an acquired taste but my husband and two daughters love it, and that's saying something!!

We have it on subscribe and save. Love the fact that we can satisfy our need for something bubbly while receiving the added health benefits from the green tea and enzymes! Good stuff!
Very good  and arrived on time.  I will order this product again for me and my husband's use.  Very health product too.

First, this is a poor-tasting kombucha.  Worse, "Wonder Drink" Pasteurizes all of their products, eliminating any live cultures and therefore much of the reason to drink kombucha in the first place.  I do not recommend this product, and hope that Amazon carries a real kombucha in the future.
This product exceeded expectation, makes you feel better after drinking.  Will buy again.  Thank you Dr. Oz for talking about it on your show!

Served cold this drink tastes very good,Would not be good warm or even at room temperature.But ice cold out of the fridge it is a great tasting ,very refreshing drink.A much better substitute for "soda pop".
Price is right too.I enjoyed this product very much

Although possibly not a true Kombucha, although I am not a pro on the subject, the taste is great.  I have had the hard core kombucha and it took some getting use to, but filled with probiotics and other essentials.  This is a good introduction to the whole kombucha thing.  I'd probably read up to see just how valuable it is compared to other kombuchas.  Price is fair and shipping was relatively fast.

I love the carbonation and tangy, lemony flavor of this drink.  I like the fact that it's not too sugary, but gives me the feeling that I'm drinking a soft drink.  This drink is not for everyone, you have to have an appreciation for "kombucha" flavor.  It has a "tangy" flavor.  Very refreshing.
I DID NOT LIKE IT. IT MADE ME COUGH EVERY DRINK OF IT & DID NOT TASTE GOOD I HAVE NOTHING MORE TO SAY ABOUT IT...
This Grey Poupon is likely to be sold out at our local grocery store.  No other Dijon compares so far...  We tried another brand and it was awful.  We love this in our home and stock up all the time.

Do Not Buy!
I bought this case of 12 bottles 2 months ago and have consumed a few of them. At first I noticed that the bottle looked different than the ones I've seen before. The bottles are opaque instead of the clear plastic I have seen in the past and is pictured. Secondly I thought the taste wasn't as strong as I had remembered but I didn't have any other mustard to compare it to. The more I used it the more convinced I became that it was not truly Grey Poupon since it just tasted like cheap dijon mustard to me. At Christmas I received a jar of real Grey Poupon and compared the two, no question they are not the same. I cannot return this item and I have used a few bottles. I would not buy again and I would not recommend it to anyone.
One note, I purchased this product through Amazon but Sold by: J&M Goods, LLC
Not sure if that makes any difference now you can buy direct.

Anyone remember that old joke about Grey Poupon that involved two old sophisticated men in a limousine? I remember that commercial with fond memories, and in fact is the main reason I avoided eating it for so long for fear that I'd become exactly like those men. Good thing it was just a big joke and *anyone* can eat this stuff without desiring to feel high and mighty!

The taste is good but it's not as appealing as it used to be. I believe they're either making it cheaper these days or simply have changed their recipe for the worse. Either way old time fans of this product that have been neglecting it over the years may be in for quite the disappointing surprise when they go to eat this overpriced stuff.

I've tried many different flavored coffees but this is by far my favorite.  I used to buy Gloria Jean's Southern Pecan Parfait (still really like that flavor) but this is much better.  I mix it with regular coffee to not only save but it makes the taste a little more mellow.  Soooo good!!

These are the best pumpkin seeds out of several brands I've tried.  Other brands have been roasted too much or too little or didnt use the right seeds or something...Im not sure.  what I know is that these taste the best to me.  Ive eaten many many bags of these and while it is true that some bags seem more salty than others, on the whole they are very good.  i dont know if its the seeds or the oil or the amount of roasting.  whatever...they're good.

Got a 6 ounce bag at Wal-Mart for about two bucks.  Stands to reason you can get a quantity for a big discount?  Just look at the price of these seeds.  Way too much money.  No thank you.  Nutsonline has got better deals.

I bought these and the Eden brand and find these taste better. So I recommend the Good Sense brand. These are moist and the Eden's are more dry. Both appear to have been made in the US but it is hard to really know. Great snacks. Both come in reclosable bags. Good Sense gets my vote.
These seeds are great and good for you too! I would prefer the product to have less salt but I limit the amount I have daily, so all is good!

These roasted little gems are a must have if you are on a low carbohydrate diet, or if you just want a snack that won't spike your blood sugar but still is nice and crunchy and satisfying.  I tried the salted version but I am tempted now to try some of their other flavors.

These are better than the other brands I have tried. Most have an ingredients list along the lines of "Pumpkin seeds, salt, (maybe some kind of oil)" and that's it, and usually taste as bland as paper to me. I like salt, nay...I love salt. These have a nice roasted flavor, and salt you can actually taste. They are not overly salty tasting, you don't feel the salt on your fingers, and there isn't a layer of salt in the bottom of the bag like you see in a bag of pretzels. It was nice not to have to get out the salt shaker and dump some in the bag.

I wound up eating nearly a whole bag in one sitting. If you like nuts and seeds, and enjoy a tasty salty snack then you will most definetly like these.

Okay, the doctor said, after the second heart attack that some changes could help. Caffeine was one area. But I did not want to give up my coffee, and it was always Starbucks (home brew), no store in our small town. I've been hooked on the strength and goodness of Sumatra for years. No restaurant in our area makes coffee as good as my wife makes my home brew Sumatra. So I give Decaf Sumatra from Starbucks a try.

HONEST, NO LIE, I COULD NOT TELL THE DIFFERENCE. I even tried mixing half regular with half decaf. It always comes out tasting great and tasting like Starbucks Sumatra. There was a couple of days of headache that goes with caffeine withdraw, the reason for the 1/2 and 1/2 mix. But now, Decaf is as good as Regular. We keep the regular available for company, and I imbibe when that is made, but I never really know unless I see the bag and read the label. Honest!

True, Starbucks costs a bit more. But you get what you pay for.
Stock up when you see a sale. I've had Starbucks in the freezer (we always use the whole bean and grind weekly) for over a year and it tasted fine. I've even bought outdated Starbucks, and it tasted better than the popular shelf brands, even past its sell-by date.

No I don't work for Starbucks. They don't pay me for this ad. But they do make plenty of profit from my personal demand that I buy only Starbucks Sumatra--be it Regular or Decaf.

The La Lechera item immediately preceding this on the page was priced at 4/$12.53. The Dulce de Leche, which is usually a few cents more expensive than the condensed milk was priced at $14.95. I thought that was also for four, but when the order arrived there was ONLY ONE. $15 for a $3.30 item (Walmart price) is outrageous.

Returning it would cost over $6, so I guess my wife will enjoy a few gold plated sundaes and I will have to learn to read descriptions more carefully. I feel that many Amazon Prime items are overpriced to recoup the cost of free shipping.

The product is delicious, but a dollar an ounce is way out of line for a product that usually sells for under 25 cents per ounce.

P.T. Barnum was, unfortunately, right.

I love that this is a no-stir option without hydrogenated oils. I really hate stirring natural peanut butter. Plus, oily peanut butter - yuck! My only issue is that it's far too sweet. I got used to peanut butter without sugar. I also think the company is being a little deceptive. They say that there's "no added sugar," but then admit in the description that there's cane juice. The carb count, for anyone who's interested, is 8 grams (3 grams of which are sugar) per 2 tablespoons. Whether it's cane juice or sugar or corn syrup, it's really all sugar. Because of the over-sweetening and higher carb count, I probably won't be ordering from this company again, but if they ever make a no-stir peanut butter without any kind of sugar, I'll be the first in line.

Fortunately, I was able to turn the peanut butter into low-carb peanut butter cookies. The sweetness doesn't bother me as much in cookie form.

I like all the flavors in the Peanut Butter Co. line. The Maple one is fantastic -- not one I thought I would like and it turned out to be my favorite. The smooth operator tastes like most other natural pb's - nothing out of the ordinary. The price is higher than some other brands. It's worth a try and definitely better than the non-natural brands, but don't expect too much difference from other natural brands. (There is some added oil and salt.)
This is good peanut butter without additives. we eat lots of it and have just ordered our second 6 pack. I'd recommend it.

I love this peanut butter, but suprise suprise, so do my kids!  I have always bought the large container of the jiffy/skippy brands from costco, but wanted to get away from the hydrongenated oils and excessive sugar.  I still wanted it to taste good, be smooth and not seperate like the high end organic food stores.  This is a great alternative, and I feel better feeding it to my kids.

This has become by far our go to choice for peanut butter.  I was not sure what to expect when I placed the order but must say the taste is very good with a clear peanut taste all most like fresh store ground peanut butter, but sweeter, and no stirring.

This has become my absolute favorite peanut butter.  Buying by the 6 pack and also with my Amazon Prime membership, it's a great bargain.  I just wish they made this in bigger jars.  My family eats a lot of peanut butter so 6 jars do not last us very long.  I like that this is all natural, and you don't have to stir it.  It's not that sweet tasting, so if you like a sweet peanut butter this might not be for you.  I think it has a really good taste and texture.  Their other flavor the PB and Dark Chocolate is amazing as well!
Cheaper than store brand in my area, and much better.  Bought on the word of a relative from the NY area...excellant choice to have made!
Very happy with the quality and value of this peanut butter.  I dont really like that there is sugar added, but at least its not corn syrup or trans fat.

I love that this is a no-stir natural peanut butter. It has no trans fats and no cholesterol, no hydrogenated oil and no high fructose corn syrup. What I didn't expect was the extra sweetness provided by the evaporated cane juice and palm fruit oil. I prefer pure, ground peanuts. Nevertheless, I would purchase this again. I think children would probably prefer it over natural, oily p.b. too.
We love this PB! its the best out there, and we order this online be cause it is often out of stock at our local grocery.
I love, love this PB!! Its so smooth and taste so good don't even need jelly with it its so good!
My husband and I love this peanut butter!  The taste is great and we love that they support cycling.

I don't know about you, but when I go looking for a product that explicitly states it has no added sugar, I mean sugar in the general, anything-that-is-chemically-sugar sense. These folks make the "no added sugar" claim, and then follow it up with (oh by the way) "a little bit of cane juice for sweetness." Which is to say, added sugar. 3 grams per serving, in fact, if my online search for this product's nutritional information is correct.

Who are these people, unemployed politicians?

I'm sticking with the Fifty50 brand. Not only are they not lying through their teeth about not adding sugar, but they also donate half their profits to Diabetes research.

The place where I get most of my essential oils from has started to sell these Himalayan salt diffusers. They had little jars filled with olive size pink salt and you pour the oil over them, close the lid when not in use. I thought I could do that myself. I found these on Amazon, just what I was looking for. Perfect size and price.  The salt does not influence the fragrance of the oils at all, the perfect diffuser. I even will smash some with a hammer for my salt grinder. Spice Lab shipped it out quickly, very happy with the product and Spice Lab.

The flavors in the chocolates are only outdone by their beauty. They a soo good! I know the chef, he trained in Switzerland to learn how to make these, and you can tell. They melt in your mouth and rival any "name brand" out there.

I have loved chocolate my whole life and have sought out many types.  This chocolate is smooth, creamy and delicious.  It's hard to put the box down.  I am spoiled for other chcolates!! I highly recomend them to others.

I have English Cocker Spaniels who are allergic to grain. These are GREAT! I have ordered them before and never seem to have enough. My dogs are VERY happy campers. Healthy ingredients and taste good too! They will obey any command I request when they know these treats are available. Wet tongues and wiggle bodies make my heartstrings sing!Northern Biscuit Grain-Free Honey Glazed Duck w/ Real Papaya Dog Treat

Grand Aroma Insalata is so wonderful I refuse to make a salad without it. I dribble a small amount on my salads, toss lightly and then add a favorite dressing - lightly, again. Using Insalata takes the bite out of overly-vinegary dressings and adds a tiny bit of lemon flavor to all dressings. I always order several and share a bottle or two with my daughter who sometimes uses it with a tad of balsamic vinegar - nothing else. I don't often review products, but Insalata is so spectacular I'm happy to do so for it.Grand'aroma Insalata Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 8.5-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
Is this for 10LB Case of Jelly Belly Tutti Frutti Jelly Beans or is this for what the picture shows "Baby Flash Pop"... Please change picture or description, very misleading... thank you.

My wife and I used to eat these all the time back when I lived in Central Illinois. Strangely, when I moved to Chicagoland, we couldn't find them any more. So, I was thrilled to discover I could get them from Amazon.

These are incredibly tasty. And, unlike many other brands, they are free of trans fats. My only criticism is that they're a bit more fragile than some other brands, especially after heating them in the over per the package directions. You have to be careful biting into them to prevent your entire taco from falling apart. If they were a bit more robust, I'd give them 5 stars.

One thing to note: being preservative-free, they have a relatively short shelf life. The case I got from Amazon had a "best by" date about 3 months in the future. So, before ordering 12 boxes, make sure that you can go through at least a box per week.

When you live in Kalamazoo it can be difficult to get taco shells without preservatives.Sounds weird I know. Even so I was delighted to see Little Bear Shells on Amazon. Unfortunately, there was a severe communication issue. My shells arrived -- 1 box of 12 shells. I called customer service and tried to explain that more than $20 for one box of taco shells was crazy and that clearly there were supposed to be 12 boxes of 12 shells each or 144 shells in my order. The rep did not understand. She was confused by my complaint, after all the site said 12 and I had received 12. We agreed to disagree. To her credit, she was very kind about refunding the money. I may order these shells again (they are yummy tasting) but I'll wait until they change the number in the package or the number of packages in the order.
Bought these shells because i love the bearitos brand.  The first order came with a bunch of cracked shells, but amazon fixed that issue for me.  No complaints here.

I picked up a package of blue corn taco shells locally but when I went back for more they were discontinued and I couldn't find them anywhere else.  I really think these are better than the yellow or white corn shells.  I mix shredded chicken with only a small can of chopped green chilis, stuff it into a shell with lettuce, tomato and cheese and they're wonderful.
Have tried this brand before and love it. These cookies are really good. Will try more from this brand. They know cookies.

This was the best $18.00 I ever spent on a box.  I ate that box so fast I was dizzy.  I was skeptical about ordering a box online but there wasn't anything too fishy about this one so I just went to town on it.  I spilled some on the carpet but the dog came over to clean it up.  Whoah, Sparky! That's for me!

Wow, this actually tastes good.  Light tasting with a subtle berry flavor.  Each 16 ounce can has 30 calories and only 8 grams of carbs even though it has Organic Agave Syrup.  It does have Stevia but not enough to give it any off flavors.  A welcome change from the other energy drinks!

Amara is so refreshing it has replaced my need for one to two cokes per day.  It is a win-win proposition......vastly fewer calories and no sugar.  Not to mention that the taste is so much better.  And I feel great!

I must say I am not someone who usually writes reviews, but I am making an exception because I finally discovered the perfect healthy drink product on the market and trust me when I hear about a new beverage I am quick to try it, kinda like the inner researcher in me ;) .

I am an avid food and beverage label reader and Amara's ingredients are legit. The drink isn't 'fake healthy' like a lot of other 'healthy' beverage companies. It is the perfect mixture of health in a can and it's low calorie (low cal's are important to me, since I don't like to drink my calories). I love how Amara is like "water +". I am someone who tries to drink at least 8 glasses of water a day and water can get boring, but I have found Amara to be my go-to as my water with a kick. I like that it is low in sugar, has a light zing of carbonation, and that I can drink multiple 16oz cans (can't do that with any liquid besides water) and it's never overwhelming nor boring. It truly is my water alternative and it is sure addicting.

I will admit I was nervous to try Amara for a few reasons, one because it looked like an energy drink (I really dislike those). Two, because I am sensitive to caffeine, but I've never felt glittery or weird from the amount of caffeine in Amara (maybe because of the electrolytes it has and so I never feel dehydrated or off from it), and three because I am a runner and thought the carbonation would hurt my stomach, but surprisingly it never did and made me feel great during and after a workout! I even like to drink Amara in the morning on my way to work!

I came across Amara a few weeks ago while shopping at a Whole Foods.  I was impressed by the taste and the uses and I started using it after my workouts and love the effects!  When you really need to rehydrate this is the way to go!  You feel it right away and it tastes great!

Amara is a great product.  It tastes delicious, not fruity and is lo cal.  A perfect beverage after working out.  Red Bull and Monster are so heavy...like a weight in your stomach.  Amara is a refreshing recovery beverage.  Who wants to fill full after a workout?  Not me!
