If you like a bold cup that lingers on your tongue and hold up under creamer too (I use unsweetened coconut milk), you will be happy you tried this coffee. Oh! A huge added bonus of the new environmentally friendly K Cup design is that you get that heavenly coffee aroma from the minute you open the vacuum sealed bag! You don't have to wait until its brewing to "wake up and smell the coffee!" :)

This is the best coffee I've had since my Mom's percolator brand. The best part though is the cup can be re-used. I have a K-cap My-Kap Green Reusable 3 Piece Cap Set for K-Cups and I just clean out the cup and refill with whatever coffee I choose. It's really the perfect design for re-use as the grounds dry out completely overnight and dump out very easily. I'm buying the whole bean San Francisco coffee to grind and refill the cup. The possibilities are endless!

Personally, I received this product by going down the list of K-Cups trying to find that perfect cup to put on scheduled delivery.  This is a nice bold coffee, and oddly fiscal.  I personally like the first brew, and the house mate likes the second and third, now THAT is a good deal.

Cheaper than typical k-cups, more environmentally friendly, and better, fresher, stronger coffee. This stuff is dynamite.  They're priced where the traditional k-cups used to be priced, but they're better coffee.

I adore this coffee!!! I also tried the french roast style (which i usually drink in other brands) BUT I LOVE this FOG LIFTER roast so much better! It's simply the best K-Cup I've had! And the cost is amazing, especially if you sign up for auto delivery, which is cool because you can choose your delivery time and not just a default one!!! LOVE IT! WILL KEEP PURCHASING FOR SURE!
Bought this product however it doesnt seem like a great way to keep the coffee airtight. I tried the other K-cup similar cups and they seem to keep it fresher.
This is a robust roast. Definitely a morning coffee.  We love the flavor and the value! Be sure to store in an airtight container to maintain the flavor.

I don't usually write a review unless I think a item deserves it but this coffee deserves it. It came in 3 separate vacuum sealed bags. Make sure you store them in a proper container after you open them or they will go bad. When I opened one, the smell was super strong. I thought the coffee was going to be bitter but after brewing it in my Keurig B130 a few times I was hooked. Not bitter at all but the smell is a little strong. But it grew on me. I brew it with 8oz. of water and the strength is good enough for me. Just a bit of creamer or milk and no sugar. I drink only a cup a day. Also, its cheaper than normal K cups and less waste. I'm not going to say that this will be my favorite forever, but it is good and if you are looking at trying something new with your K cup maker then these are worth a shot. I will keep these stocked along with other the flavors of K cups I have enjoyed.

I recently purchased these K-Cups, I have to admit, because of the price per cup. And now I can honestly say I will never go back to the regular K-Cups again! I usually run a K-Cup through the largest setting and then through the smallest (my coffee cup is rather large :). This Fog Chaser coffee holds up rather well. I've gotten a great, bold cup of joe every morning since receiving these. There have been no problems with grounds in the cup as sometimes happens with regular K-Cups or the refillable K-Cups.

The 80 count box came with a reusable storage container that holds a week of pods. It's just a flimsy, clear plastic container but it does keep the coffee fresh.
This is the second month we've ordered this coffee and love it!  If you like a strong cup of coffee, this is it.  And, the price can't be beat!
The fog chaser has a great bold body taste,unlike some brands which leave a harsh after taste.Great product which I recommend.
I have tried 5 or 6 different brands and found this brand to be the better one. I am sticking with this for now.

First time trying SF coffee and found it to be a good coffee with a reasonable taste. Yes, the coffee smells burned prior to use but I believe thatunless you are a  connoisseur of coffee I believe most might smelled "burnt".  Good coffee for the price and the "K-Cup" new packaging works just as well as the original stle K-Cup packaging. I believe I will try another brand for taste but would stay with SFbay if the price were 5 cents less per cup.  I drink alot of coffee.!!

Not the coffee for us. Very strong. Did the subscribe and save, for got to cancel the next shipment, went to and complete the return forms- No such luck. Great idea, just tastes awful. First item that I could not return, back to buy coffee at QVC, they will take it back if we do not like it.

Ahhh...nothing like a good cup of coffee! I'm a bargain hunter and have considered going back to my drip coffee due to the rising prices of K cups.I read all the reviews,and feeling there was nothing to lose I debated between French Roast and Fog Chaser. San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser did not disappoint (haven't tried the French Roast yet). Fog Chaser is a moderatly bold coffee, smooth, with no hint of bitterness. As for the skeptics concerned with the "netted" base of the cup affecting taste and freshness...the product is packaged in mini packs ( sealed thick plastic) of 8 cups to protect freshness. In addition, I feel the netting (not flimsy by any means) offers a better fitration system that the typical K cup. I only write reviews about products that excite me, or repulse me. Obviously, I am a San Francisco Bay Coffee fan. If you choose to try this product, I'm pretty sure you will be pleasantly surprised.

I decided to give these a try based on the price, the favorable reviews here on Amazon, and its sales rank in the K-cup store. I was not disappointed as this is a strong, but not too strong, good-tasting coffee that not only tastes great but has a nice aroma.

The pods are a little different than your traditional plastic K-cup portion as, instead of any plastic around the sides or bottom you have basically a mesh coffee filter holding the coffee grounds. This appears to make a more complete brew, and allows more of the flavor to come into the actual coffee. You will see a dirty residue at the bottom of your cup due to this filtration system vs. a "clean" look from a normal K-cup pod. This seems to make sense as the normal K-cup pod has all of the brewed coffee escaping through the pinprick hole vs. the full brewing experience of these pods.

As the pods are in this filtration medium the coffee is not air-tight sealed after you open the package of pods. I have put the unused ones in a sealed Ziploc bag to keep them fresh.

I also shared this with some folks in the office, who liked it so much they ordered their own so it's not just me who likes this stuff. Who knows, I may have found a new favorite coffee!

SF Bay Coffee's Fog Chaser was a nice "bold" surprise.  I am a big fan of Amazon's Subscribe & Save program and have been getting my K-cups this way for over a year.  Of course, once you find one you absolutely love (Timothy's World Midnight Magic), poof!  The Magic's gone!  Midnight Magic is still available on Amazon, though no longer offered through Subscribe & Save, and I refuse to pay $35 for 48 K-cups of any brand.  S & S now offers SF Bay Coffee's Fog Chaser and based on the quantity of favorable reviews, I decided to give it a shot.  The pods are far different than what we've all been used to, but they work like a charm, have less waste, and deliver a pretty bold, smooth cup of coffee.  My morning coffee always consists of two pods at the 6 oz. setting each for one eye-opening 12 oz. mug of coffee.  On that setting, Fog Chaser lives up to its name.  I have noticed some residue occasionally, but it certainly is minimal.  The pods come packed in plastic bags (12 pods/bag).  Once cut open, I just fold over the edge, clip it and store the bag in the fridge.  Strength is a personal decision, and to me, more than 6 oz. of water with ANY pod is too weak.  If you are a fan of Rev of Jet Fuel, this coffee is comparable.
This coffee was really good Fogchaser will get you going. It's a strong bold cup of coffee.  This cofee is valued price with a great taste!

Decided to give these a try based on price.  The coffee tastes great but since the 'cups' don't have the plastic bottoms (a filter element), we had to store in a sealed jar to keep them fresh and not have the coffee bean smell thru-out the house.  (or you could use a plastic ziploc - original bag was not re-sealable).  They did one thing finally right - you don't have to pay MORE for going green when buying LESS packaging.  Kudos.
My new favorite!  A few Gr. Mtn. are great: Br. Blend, Half/Caff especially.  Most other brands are more like Folgers than real flavor brews.  How do I get free shipping?

i dont no what the big fuss is about a lot of bad reviews but if u read the description you shoulld no it comes revealed and not in plastic like regualr kcups anyhow i ordered the fogchaser and they were great i amade iced coffee with mine and the flavor was perfect i just keep it in some tupperware to keep fresh is all i plan on buying all 3 flavors and encourage they should come out with even more flavors the price is awsome beats paying 15 bucks for 18 kucps when i just paid 14 for 36 kcups i will def keep on buying these

The price was the initial reason for my purchase but I would have to say now that my reorder is based on the taste. Coffee is very rich and fresh tasting even without the sealed k-cup design. I will continue to reorder if the price stays down under the other k-cups.

Fog Chaser has a very good flavor, and it is reasonably strong especially for a K-Cup.  I like it better than their French Roast version, which seems stronger but more harsh to me; and I like very strong coffee.  Their Rainforest version has a more mellow taste that is also very good, but it is weaker strength than Fog Chaser.  The price for any of the versions, especially for the "subscribe and save", is very good.  The packaging, which is a box of 3 sealed bags of 12 is fine to deal with; once you open a sealed bag (you can't reseal the bag), just use a ziplock to seal the remainder for the week.

I have been a picky Keurig fan for about ten years, have always bought my coffee from either onegreatcup or amazon (because stores just don't have the selection), and until now had settled on Jet Fuel as my favorite -- just so you know what I like. FogChaser is in that league: rich, deep, dark, zesty, overall INTERESTING and best of all (unlike the plastic-bottomed K-cups) brewing it makes my kitchen smell good again. I'm putting it on subscription.  A good find; a keeper -- glad I tried it.

25 lbs. of hard licorice pieces were dumped into kitchen trash bags, unsealed, then put into a cardboard box. The most disgusting, unsanitary packaging I've ever seen. I tossed the entire thing in the trash.
To top it off, the first ingredient in the whole thing was corn syrup. Yuk.
Avoid like the plague.

Our nine-month-old daughter is ready for a more substantial breakfast than plain cereals.  We want her to get the nutrients and vitamins she needs (especially iron), so plain fruit or vegetables aren't enough.  This blend of fruit and grains (and, in some cases, yogurt) provides everything she needs for a good breakfast and keeps her full for several hours.  Plus, the flavors are not overly sweet.  One note:  at least two of these flavors include yogurt.  Some babies younger than 1-year may have a reaction to yogurt and other dairy foods, so just watch out for that.

We feed our baby this Wholesome Breakfast at any time of the day, not just for breakfast.  We're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  We particularly like that this food contains yogurt.  When she was young (~6 months old), our baby loved yogurt but couldn't eat it plain because it would cause a rash around her mouth.  She was never bothered by the yogurt in this food, though, perhaps because it was mixed with other things.  Now that she's older (10 months), our baby can eat all the yogurt she wants without a skin reaction, but for awhile, this variety of Wholesome Breakfast was the only source of her favorite food.

We're not sure why, but this this flavor of Earth's Best Wholesome Breakfast (Peach, Pear, and Barley) is our baby's favorite flavor.  She'll eat this any time of the day, and we're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  Also, our baby is a picky eater, so we're thrilled to find something she likes that's more substantial than Puffs!

My daughter loves the entire Earths Best line.  I taste everything before I feed it to her and each item tastes pure and fresh.  Very happy.  We've tasted other popular name brands, and Earths Best is really good in comparison.

My son is lactose intolerant but he's able to eat this for some reason!  Moreover, it's great to start off a day with a nutritious meal versus eating empty calaries with little to no nutritional benefit.  Regardless, I'm very pleased with the quality and taste.  Yes, I tasted this and it is delish!

My little guy just loves this jar. I love the line of breakfast blends.  I am happy with Amazon's "grocery" business. It is great to have the convenience to order these on-line and have home delivery.  I can't imagine going the store and having to get a whole case and go through check out. I try to make him some meals, but I trust Earth's Best and love the flavor combo's and they are so convenient.
I tried all kinds of oatmeal to give my LO but this is her favorite one. I also love the fact that it comes on time.

If I had only figured out to order baby food online before.  The price is right on the money and the convenience of the shipping to the house is great.  No need to go to the store and have baby jars flying all over the cart.  This flavor is my baby's favorite.  It's a go to when she is not in the mood for anything else.

I love Earth's Best products and only use them to feed my baby, besides home made foods. I rate this one one star because the seller didn't specify that this product contains milk, which my baby cannot tolerate since he is lactose-intolerant. So for us, it was a waste of money, and I bought two packs...

This baby food, labeled for 6+ months, contains heavy cream. My baby could not digest it; we had a very bad day. Maybe I missed that in the description, but in any case, everywhere I've read and according to my pediatrician, you're supposed to avoid cow's milk products before age 1 (why they make formula using cow's milk and not a much more digestible milk like goat baffles me and is a rant for another time--my son drinks the lactose free kind, in any case). I ordered another variety of "Wholesome breakfast" too: Pear, Apple, Oatmeal. Same thing there. I'm guessing they all have heavy cream in them.
My daughter likes it now, but when she was younger she did not want to have it! Go figure! Now she is almost 14 months she digs the flavor.
My son hated it. I tasted some and saw why. It's tart and the barley gives it a weird smell and flavor. Yuck!

I wish Amazon would include a list of ingredients on baby food in bulk. This has cream in it and my baby has a cow's milk intolerance. I had already opened the jar when I read the ingredients and now I'm stuck with 15 jars of food I can't use. So disappointing.
I bought quite a lot of these in the past. My son loved them. I like the fact that they are organic and the combination of fruits and vegetables in them is just right.

We do fruit and cereal for breakfast daily.  This comes in handy when we are on the go, since i dont have to bring cereal long.  I also like that it is 4.5 ounces, since some of the earth's best fruit and cereal combos are only 4 ounces.
My son eats these for breakfast every morning and he seems to really enjoy them. It is a nice alternative to fruit and rice cereal and it has all the nourishment my son needs to start his day.
Price was great, variety, flavor was good, baby likes it! She takes a while to eat, but it's safe and clean to leave in the refrigerator.
Great baby foods!  I like the variety pack.  Much cheaper than buying it from the local grocers or co-op!  I Just wish they came in the squeezie pouches!
Right combination. We originally thought our baby had some allergies. However, as we fed these food baby got used to them and she liked them all.
Little one loves these and glass is recyclable forever which plastic (Gerber) is not. About the same price, food is healthier and she's more likely to eat this stuff.
We love the organic baby food. It costs just a small amount more, but it is totally worth it.  Our son loves the different choices.
I love how it's thicker than other Stage 2 baby food. My son gobbles it down! Way better than the lunch or dinner varities!
This was by far my daughters favorite Earth's Best breakfast.  It's nice that it contains organic fruit and whole grains.  Plus the prices on amazon can't be beat, especially with subscribe and save!

This is one of my sons favorites. Even though it's called "wholesome breakfast" he usually has this for lunch. It is packed with nutrients, including 35% of his daily iron. This is a staple in our baby's diet!

We initially tried few sample from Ralph's and our Baby started liking it .. We don't give formula to our Baby and we give only Mom's milk.
i think when we combine that with this wholesome breakfast you will have a satisfaction that you are really taking a good care of the Baby..
What's more it had got more calories than the regular baby foods and it had got 35% iron which i consider important.. It has dates in it. Very few baby foods for breakfast have dates in them.. on the whole it's really a wholesome breakfast.. Add organic on top of that what else can you ask for.. I had only one thing to complain about.. it's availability is rare.. i had to wait for a month to get it.. I don't find it in the store shelves either..

We feed our baby this Wholesome Breakfast at any time of the day, not just for breakfast.  We're happy she's getting a good balance of vitamins and minerals.  Most jarred baby food is pretty light on the calories and nutrition, but the plain cereals that are fortified with essential vitamins/minerals are so boring and don't train a baby to enjoy different flavors.  We've been mixing cereal into our baby's food to enhance the nutrition, but that's inconvenient and messy.  This Wholesome Breakfast provides the best of both worlds:  the vitamins/minerals of a fortified cereal but with the stronger flavors of a real food.  Also, our baby is a picky eater, so we're thrilled to find something she likes that's more substantial than Puffs!
I enjoy most of the Yogi teas but this particular one tastes almost sinful. I don't know that it necessarily tastes a lot like vanilla or hazelnut but it has a very delicious spicy taste.

The title above refers not only to a semi-obscure Damon Runyan-based movie with Bob Hope (we ALL knew that), but to these classic lemon drops with a truly international pedigree:

Made in Spain; owned by the French(Cadbury France, located at 143 Boulevard Romain Rolland, Paris; imported by New Jersey's own "Euro-American Brands," Paramus, NJ 07652.

All the way from Paris to your local candy seller or movie theater (which is where I experieced my first taste of La Vie en Lemon). They were everything a lemon drop should be: A sugary entrance, developing into a deeply satisfying, soul-stirring essence of pure lemon. The mouth-watering joy of the lemon drop is seductive and addictive, and I am nearly certain that sucking on these golden gems made Kurosawa's "Savage Dogs" even more enjoyable.

They're hard candies. but not so hard that you couldn't cheat and bite into one, breaking it up into ten or so smaller candies, zig-zagging around your mouth like offshoots from a single magnificent fireworks explosion.

One 2-ounce tin lasted longer than the 2 hours or so of Kurosawa's brilliant detective drama, one of his first with Toshiro Mifune, who once again delivers a compelling performance. Although the packaging is a bit precious, there's nothing pretentious about the taste of Les Citrons, and as for value, these drops are the working man or woman's workhorse. They're far less expensive than other candy (to say nothing of popcorn), and their staying power is extraordinary.

Still, this vendor charges more than some others, and with the added shipping fee one may wish to purchase these at a local outlet (or occupying it until your lemon drop demands are met). If you're serious about your lemon drops, tt's Paris 1968 all over again.

Nutritional Information per Package (30 pieces; you could try to eat the suggested serving size of 3 drops, but I find this highly unlikely). 240 calories, no fat or sodium, 60 grams carbohydrates, 60 grams of sugar, no protein, and no trace of food allerges. Sugar, corn syrup, citric acid, natural flavor, and tumoric for color. THh lemon-decorated little tin adds a touch of Europe to any room, and is ideal for holding cuff links, tickets, keys, small, delicate make-up products, or quarters for the laundry. To paraphrase the great Margaret Dumont:
"Les Citrons, Toujours...Les Citrons!"

I bought 4 high end dry foods that my miniature poodle simply would not eat. I tried mixing it with canned food and broth, but she'd lick off the canned food and leave the kibble. I was worried that she wasn't getting the nutrients she needed. Then I found Utramix and I am thrilled. She loves it, actually cleans her bowl. I merely drizzle a little warm water on it since I'm no longer mixing in canned food and she gobbles it up. There are chunks of bananas, peas, carrots, etc. that she seems to love. The mix even contains probiotics. Highly recommended.

In 2006, I was assigned to a project in San Francisco. A co-worker/friend introduced me to a coconut pudding. I hate coconut but fell in love with this stuff.

I recently found some in World Market, but it is no longer a offered product. I searched on Amazon and found it. I am so happy I know where I can find when I want.

A extremly healthy plant that has grown dramatically since its arrival. It should be an exceptional plant for blooming if it casts blooms as readily as it grows vegatatively. I have high expectations for this one!

Some years ago my husband and I were lucky enough to visit Ireland several times. While there we discovered Bewley's Tea Shop in Dublin, and also their Irish Afternoon Tea. It was better than any other tea I have ever had -- and I am a committed tea drinker. The 'finish' is incredibly smooth, with just the right 'body' for an afternoon pick me up.

We bought several boxes to take home in our suitcases;then when we ran out, we had coworkers who were going to Ireland bring more of it back to us. When our Irish trips ended and our sources dried up, we were truly disheartened, since we had only found it in one location in the States [a little tea shop in Alexandria, Virginia.]

When I found out that it is now available through Amazon/Sullivan's I was elated and placed my order that day. Unfortunately I didn't see that the large box of it [80] teabags would soon be available until after I had placed my order for smaller boxes. The large boxes are a MUCH better value [80 teabags for $8.99 as oppossed to 25 teabags for $5.99]. That is certainly the way I will order in the future. But I'm delighted to find a source for Bewley's teas, especially Irish Afternoon. And I am anxious to try the Dublin Morning tea, which I also ordered. Happy Nonnie!

About 10 years ago while visiting disneyworld in orlando florida my wife and I met a nice english couple. Being a tea drinker I inquired about good english teas and they gave me a napkin with the names of bewleys tea on it and about 6 teabags for me to try. I put the napkin in my back pocket and the teabags got wrapped up in an old sandwich bag and put in my wife's purse. We parted with the nice english couple and as we traveled around disneyworld it began to rain that afternoon and we got soaking wet. I found what was left of the napkin that evening at the hotel and it was unreadable. About 6 months later at home the bag fell out of my tea closet as i was fixing to make a cup and I decided to finally try the tea those nice folks from england raved about. I loved the tea and I believe I have finally found it in bewleys. Some of the best tea I have had. The english surely know their tea.

So far, my all time favorite teas come from Bewley's. Not quite as strong as PG Tips (i like that too, but a bit of a kick). This tea is more rounded out than Lipton and stronger. A wonderful flavor. -- Those Irish have got it going on!

I have been drinking Taylors of Harrogate, Yorkshire Gold Tea until I tried Bewley's. I have always like my tea very strong using double the amount of most people. I drink it with cream and sugar and this tea is perfect for me. I do not have to put in extra because it is full bodied and stands up to cream and sugar wonderfully. I have been drinking it in the morning and have been using the Yorkshire Gold for the afternoon. Bewley's is my favorite now, not that Yorkshire Gold sucks or anything but I like it strong. I will still search for another tea perhaps as good. Life is an adventure and you never know when you're going to bingo.

If you like a strong, not bitter brew try Bewley's! After you've had Irish it is hard to go back, teawise that is.

Recently purchased these treats for my 4 dogs from local grocery store. After giving my dogs these chews, my 3 month old puppy threw up the treat. By the next day at lunch time, he was exhibiting neurotoxic symptoms. We immediately took him to the vet for blood work, which all came back below normal limits. He was given IV therapy and monitored over night. Over the next two days, my older dogs (ages 4, 7 and 9)began vomiting and acting lethargic, but with no neurological symptoms. We traced the cause back to these chews, as it is the only coomon thing among all the dogs (puppy eats different food than adult dogs, puppy is walked on a leash not allowed to run around in yard yet, puppy is not out of his crate unless he is beig observed, etc.). After speaking with someone at a pet store, we learned some rawhide chews are pressed with water, while others are pressed with formaldehyde. While it is not listed which method these use, we are concerned it is the formaldehyde. In the case of the older dogs, their GIs are rejecting them due to the toxins. With the puppy, his immature renal and hepatic system exhibited neurotoxicity.

I ordered these tails a while back for my Parents to be shipped to St. George, Utah. The customer service and express shipping were excellent. The tails were recieved on time and still frozen. The best part is the tails are very large and sometimes from other sources, I have recieved tails this size that were "Soft" and not firm meat. These were fantastic and were saved up to 3-4 months with a couple retrived from the freezer and broiled....perfectly every time..Thank
s for the great product and service!!

I confirm another review here that perfectly describes the texture and taste of this product as like chewing on a cellulose sponge! OMG! I love tofu, by the way. This is the first tofu I've eaten in decades that I did not like.

I bought this after reading that review and thinking the person was maybe not familiar with the taste of tofu, or perhaps tried to eat this without re-hydrating this first. No, it is like chewing on a sponge (Have we all by accident done this, or is it an early childhood memory of times when we tested everything with our mouths?) At any rate, you will instantly think "sponge" if you ignore these warnings and buy this tofu. I do not mean just the texture, it really tastes like a cellulose sponge!

I am also a fan of Eden Foods and enjoy many of their products, they make great tamari, for instance. I was looking for that texture and taste I find in freeze dried tofu pieces that come in soup mixes as in instant miso tofu soup packets or soup cups. This isn't that tofu! It will not be wasted, it has good protein and I can chop it in very small pieces and mix it with Creamy Tomato Soup by Pacific Naturals, that makes it innocuous enough. But I'll never buy this again!

I am looking into buying a food dehydrator to make my own. The cost of tofu is much lower that this item reflects. I will update this if I have success drying my own tofu. Believe the reviews here, this isn't good.

If you feel compelled to buy this, get it from Whole Foods so you don't waste money buying the 6 pack. Buyer beware that you cannot return many food items. The texture of this after rehydration was like a cellulose sponge.If you must have dehydrated tofu for hiking or camping trips, make your own or buy the tofu in the sealed boxes.  On the flip side, I love many of Eden products but this was a waste of my money.

Koya Dofu, or freeze-dried tofu, requires a specific approach to cooking. It not only has to be rehydrated in a particular way, but also will not taste good without proper cooking to flavor and soften it. Even at that point, it will have a chewy, slightly spongey texture, but if cut and cooked appropriately, it is not a strange texture and is very delicious as a side dish.

Google recipes for Koyadofu and try one that involves simmering it (after rehydration) in a broth made of katsuobushi (if you are not vegetarian -- if you are, then use mushroom or vegie stock), shouyu or tamari, mirin, and a little sweetner. My child loves this, and I pack it in her school lunch box along with rice, and some vegies that have been simmered in the same broth.

I've tried almost every ground coffee there is, and I have to say that Melitta French Vanilla (and Hazelnut) is the best tasting coffee ever. You don't have to use a lot of coffee, so the can lasts longer than leading brands. The taste is a non-powerful, strong blend with a subtle vanilla. Even when the coffee is brewing it's out of this world!

Amazon has a great price for this item. WHEN my store has it on sale, they ask $4.89 for a can, so this is a nice price plus the wonderful free shipping offer. I received my coffee two days after I ordered it! I will now add this to the list of groceries I now order through Amazon.

Highly recommend you to try this coffee and see if you agree too!
This coffee is nice and strong, but not bitter. Buttery smooth and just the right touch of vanilla.

We'd been buying the four-pack of Melitta French Vanilla coffee once a month for the past 2 years. We won't be any more. In the last month they changed their packaging, which is fine, but also changed the grind. All of a sudden, these four packs come in "extra fine grind," which simply doesn't work well at all in our drip coffee maker. The whole pot tastes weak until you get to the last couple of cups, which taste more like mud because all of the coffee has settled. Here's hoping they switch back at some point, because this is just bad.

When it comes down to so many Americans, they are right now skipping going to Starbucks to get their favorite flavor of coffee and lattes, and having them right at home. Fortunately, Melitta knows that feeling with their coffees, and make them well from the heart. Their French Vanilla is a delightful tast that just melts your heart away. It is delicious after the first cup, and just everlasting. My one and only gripe with Melitta though is that with their ground coffees is that they are very hard to open the cans, considering you'd have to use a regular can opener to get them open, rather than peel the top off from Folgers or Maxwell House. That definitely is the only thing that is not only frustrarting, but can easily cause the consumer to break the can. Still, the taste is great and if you want a nice soulfully delightful cup of joe, Melitta can take you there.

Price: B-

Taste: A-

Convience: B-

Overall: B

If you love good medium-roasted and well balanced coffee then you will love Melitta.

PROS:

1. Melitta only uses the top 2% of the world's supply of 100% Arabica coffee and it tastes it. (and NO, I don't work for the company!) Arabica is the finest grade of coffee available on the market. The other grade, "Robusto" is generally less expensive, lower quality and used by most other major coffee processors such as Chock Full O' Nuts, Folgers, Maxwell House and almost all generic and store brands to name a few).

2. The 11.5 oz. cans are nitrogen-flushed and well-sealed to retain its integrity and fresh roasted flavor upon opening. I have found consistently that coffee packaged in plastic or paper bags or pouches DOES NOT, in my opinion, retain its flavor and freshness well.

3. If you have a drip coffee maker (Like Bunn, Mr. Coffee or others), Melitta's fine grind works exceptionally well. Remember...the finer the grind, the more flavor you will extract from the coffee. In addition, the finer the grind, the more efficiently your coffee maker will use coffee. Since you can generally use less coffee per cup, Melitta is a winner for price per ounce.

4. Melitta seems to be a very transparent and consumer responsible company. They place clear "Best By" dates on the bottom of each of their products.

CONS:

1. Some of Melitta's flavors, like French Vanilla and a seasonally-offered coffee called "Morning Decadence", are very hard to find but well worth investigating and sampling if you have a chance.

BOTTOM LINE:

The best commercially available coffee for drip coffee makers. Outstanding grind, well-balanced flavors and consistent freshness can after can.

First of all, 10 days ago Amazon ran this coffee on a great special, about $4.70 per pound.  This was my first try; I should have bought more because Amazon has about doubled the price in less than two weeks.  This is a medium blend and grind as advertised.  The top is tightly sealed; it was the hardest pull off top that I've ever encountered, and you could hear the air express as it was opened.  The aroma is great in the can, when brewing, and in the cup. The taste is, for me, somewhat artificial although not obnoxious, but it cost a star in my book.  There is no residual acidity or aftertaste.  The expiration date is fine, at May 2012; it won't last anywhere near that long.
Excellent coffee, great price, delivered to my door. The subscription program is flexible so you can buy sooner or push back the delivery dates. What else can you ask for!

I have been a big Starbucks fan for a long time now, but thought I would try something that I could do the subscribe and save deal on. I chose this one because of the great reviews and thought it would make a change to have a flavored coffee. I am so glad I did! I love it. It is so smooth and the aroma when you open the can is wonderful. Can't wait to try the other types of Melitta coffee now too.
We use this in our Keurig coffee machine in the reusable filter.  Comes out great every time, just make sure not to fill past the line.
Yes the coffee is good but why do you raise the price without letting anyone know??  I expect 1 price to be debited from my account and then the price goes up $5 without warning or notice!  Not Cool!

I was a little apprehensive about ordering coffee online.  I had never heard of this brand, but to my delight, it is absolutely delicious.  I love it and my husband enjoys the Vanilla and also one of the other blends.  I would recommend if you are fan of any flavored coffee.

I love it! Great smell and exceptional taste! I've tried lot of different sorts/tastes of coffee from cheap to exclusively expensive, but this one remains one of my faorite for years.
Great Coffee! Worth to try and you will not be disappointed!

The Melitta French Vanilla has been a hit with both family and with guests. Great aroma, balanced and smooth coffee with a rich taste. We ordered more to give as gifts and ordered other Melitta blends because we were so impressed with this one and like changing our coffee every week or so.

I thought these were going to be the same size as the ones in the grocery store. I found they were smaller and more expensive to buy online then if I just bought the bigger ones for 99 cents each at the grocery store.

We got a super deal (under $12) on this box of Twix King Size candy, so I can't really complain... BUT the caramel was a tad harder/chewier than it should be for fresh bars. Perhaps they were clearancing them out.

$23.52 for ten pounds of these beans???  I just bought a bag of these at Sam's Club for $8.95.  If you want to pay nearly 4 times the going rate, by ALL MEANS, purchase this!  Seriously, how STUPID would a person need to be to pay $2.53 for a pound of dried beans?

but WHY would you package the product into four separate pouches (which I love) and have a nutrition label say the box contains "about 10 servings"???? I may agree that one pouch is enough for two small servings, great with milk warmed up by the way, but how do you get 2 1/4 servings from a pouch?

I like variety in my gf cereals and this granola is a nice addition to my shelf. The granola comes in packets inside the box so it is handy for travel. It's sweet but not too sweet. I eat it in a bowl with milk and it is just the right amount. Granola is more dense so a portion is smaller than a bowl full of cereal.

I've been eating Glutenfreeda's Granola for breakfast the past two months and I love it!
especially the individual packaging, keeps it fresh.

Glutenfreeda's gluten free granola is an ideal breakfast food for people who have to eat gluten free.  It also makes an on the road snack that is easy to pack in your purse or carry on luggage.  The oats in it are guarrenteed to be gluten free.
Although this coffee tastes fine there is nowhere enough coffee in the pod.  The cup that is brewed even with a smaller amount of water is weak and watery.
The Parisian Cafe blend is wonderful but it is too thick to fit correctly in the Senseo machine.  The box advertises universal fit but it is not.

Coffee has a great flavor and is not too acidic. Fits perfectly in out "Juan Valdez" pod maker that was purchased at Target several years ago! So hard to find these so was glad to find them on Amazon!
Smooth coffee, but a bit to big for senseo, interestingly all the other Melitta One pod flavors fit just fine in senseo, my fav are french kisses and vanilla haze.
My husband didn't care for this coffee at all.  He complained it lacked flavor and aroma.

We love Melitta coffee pods.  Makes a perfect cup of coffee every time. The coffee is always delicious, even the decaf blend!  If you have a coffee pod machine, try all of their blends...they're great!
I love coffee and at night really miss out if I don't have the decaff.
This decaf pod has wonderful flavor.  It is much better than their previous decaf "Skip the Buzz".  I'm glad they upgraded their product.

I had bought a Black and Decker one-cup coffee maker that used these pods.  It didn't work properly, but I have managed to use the pods with my old, stand-by coffee maker and am please with the flavor and convenience.  Someone had commented about a problem with some of the pods being sealed in the outer packaging.  I have not encountered that problem.  Overall, I am pleased with this purchase.

My mom has the Hamilton Beach single cup coffee maker and was using Senseo pods in it. They were too strong / bitter for her and I was searching for something else.  Found these and Wolfgang Puck's and decided to get both for her.  These Melitta Breakfast Blend pods are her favorite! She says they have a smooth taste and great flavor. Granted, neither of us would ever be mistaken for a coffee judge by anyone (I don't even drink coffee so my opinion means nothing), but she really likes these and is happy to have them.

To make a decent cup of coffee I have to use two pods at a time. I prefer a strong cup of coffee even if it IS decaf.
What happened to Senseo decaf?
this was delicious coffee for a great price which i could not find at any store in my area or areas nearby
Enjoying my Java Pods very much. Easy and fast. Medium strong to wake me up. I get positive comments on the convenience of making coffee.

This coffee .Melitta One:One Java Pods,Breakfast Blend Coffee, 18-Count Pods (Pack of 4) is terrible. Cheap beans, bad roast, whatever, my lot actually tastes like it is moldy. Maybe I just got a bad batch. I have tried the Buzzworthy dark roast Melitta Pods and they are drinkable, even though I prefer medium roast coffees. Suggest you try one box of these, not the 4 box lot I'm stuck with. Also, to help you evaluate this response better, you should know that I like quality roast Kenya AA or Sumatra or Columbian Supremo, etc. rich flavor type coffees. I don't like Folgers, Maxwell House, pedestrian type blends, but even those are way better than this coffee.

Melitta Pods are an inexpensive alternative to k-cups  that also save in the amount of material you have to throw away. Buyer Beware: Pods vary GREATLY in the amount of coffee they have in them. These allow for a good size cup of coffee.

I have a Melitta One:One machine and have been using Juan Valdez pods in it.  When I ran out I searched for pods for it & only came up with these Melitta-brand ones. I figured (incorrectly) that the others weren't available & purchased these. VERY disappointing.  My coffee had been nice, strong & tasty, but coffee made with these is weak & tasteless.  I bought a 4-box package of three different types & am now stuck with them. Forget these & head to Juan Valdez (same price range) unless you like weak coffee.
I've been using these for a couple of years now. I highly recommend these if you only need 1 cup of coffee.
This is one of the best decaf coffee's I have ever had.  I was ordering this product from another website but found that Amazon's subscribe and safe plan is the most economical.  Great Product.

If there happens to be one thing I definitely love, and that happens to be coffee. It is one of my favorite drinks in the world, and I absolutely love the smell and taste of Folgers. This coffee is one of the nicest tasting coffees ever. I still don't know why people always buy ground, rather than instant like this edition. Nevertheless, it is worth buying. Bottoms Up!
just the greatest thing when you have your favorite coffee at such a fair price deliverd right to your door :) I will be doing this again. Thank you !

I just had to let you know what a miracle this food has been for me and my dogs! I have four Chihuahuas of my own and a fifth as a foster, and I spent a long time researching foods to make a switch after P&G took over Natura (we were on Innova). My female can be picky and does horribly with food pieces that are too big, so I was thrilled when I saw the thin triangles in the bag. She happily crunches right through them, which is great, since she and one of my boys have horrible teeth and having to chew the food helps.

My alpha male has been on Hills C/D almost all his life because he was diagnosed with struvite crystals as a young dog (he is almost 11 now). He was the only one of my pack who looked old. Dull coat, dandruff, and a gaunt look to his face and body. I knew it had to be the food, so looked at all the levels and decided on the Whitefish formula as a food trial, hoping he wouldn't develop crystals again on a hollistic food. WHAT A DIFFERENCE! He looks fantastic, he and the female (same age) are more active, and I'm happy to report that after 2.5 months, his urinalysis was clean!

Our third dog and our foster dog both have very course hair, and since starting this food, they have both become much softer. Everyone is shiny and (before the weather got so dry) dandruff-free! Best of all, each and every one of the dogs is absolutely CRAZY about the taste of the food, and even my girl who we used to have to push to finish her dinner now eats with everyone else in under two minutes and then licks the crumbs up off her eating blanket. It's truly miraculous. I couldn't be any happier with this food. It may cost more than the lower quality foods, but if you added all the supplements it would take to get this level of nutrition, you'd be spending more anyway. Love it, love it, LOVE IT!

I only buy Fromm for my dog. He loves it and I feel good about feeding it to him.  No fillers, the first ingredient is meat/fish.  This seller had a more than fair price and shipping was faster than I expected.  I would definitely buy from them again!
This product is great!  I can't seem to find it locally at my pet food stores and it's worth feeding my pet the best!!  Super fast delivery from this seller!
The hazelnut flavor is unique.  I'm glad Amazon has decided to carry them, because they are hard to find locally.

If you've never tried Kona coffee, Aloha Island is definitely the one to start with.

Kona coffee is grown in the Kona district of the Big Island and regarded by some to be the best coffee in the world. I'm not a coffee aficionado by any means, but you can taste the difference with Kona coffee - it's full and rich and almost mocha-ish. I always reserve Kona for lazy weekend brunches or to serve with dessert after a lovely dinner.

Aloha Island operates the only quality management program in Kona, so their coffees are certified as 100% Kona. Which just means that you're guaranteed to get quality Kona coffee if you order from them.

Keep in mind that Aloha Island has three grades of Kona coffee that they sell - gold, platinum, and diamond (which is supposed to be their private reserve). Obviously, it gets more expensive as you go up the ladder. The gold is very good and a great place to start sampling their fare.
Hands down this is absolutely the best kona coffee I have ever had in my life..This is the smoothest and richest coffee you will ever have...Go ahead and spoil yourself, you'll be glad you did!!

The aroma from a pot of this coffee is earthy and heavenly at the same time. Everything about this product--packaging, texture, and taste--tells you that it was lovlngly produced under rigid standards. Moreover,if you've tried a lot of "kona" coffees like I have, you know how widely the taste and quality can vary. This is the coffee you serve to the treasured few in your life who really appreciate the finest.

I can see why plenty of people will think this is the best coffee ever. It's some of the smoothest, least bitter coffee I've ever tasted. The aroma is also delicious. Opening the bag and taking a whiff right away is a must if you want to try this.

But I'm the type of coffee drinker who loves it black, so I need a coffee with a rich flavour on its own. I don't wanter bitterness, but I love coffee with kick to it.

I'd call it too mild but that's kind of oversimplifying it. It's worth a try to make up your own mind though.

Aloha Island Coffee Company Bonzai Pipeline Dark Roast is a very mediocre, insipid coffee, rather acidic for a dark roast. The beans are of unknown origin, but if there are any Kona beans in this anonymous mix, they must be the ones other roasters threw out as it doesn't even vaguely taste like Kona. Actually, Aloha Island Coffee Co. isn't even in Hawaii, it's located in Santa Ana, CA, an area not exactly known for great coffee. The coffee is extremely overpriced for the poor quality you get, which is why I gave it one star, and you would be better off buying some of the better brands commonly sold in supermarkets at about one-third the price. I ordered the 2-8 oz bags, but I couldn't even make it through the first one and have thrown the second in the garbage. I would never buy anything from Aloha Island Coffee company again.

I'm more of a tea drinker but occasionally want something different and I like this to keep me up or wake me up too. So, keep in mind I haven't tasted lots of coffees. I find most coffees bitter and gross, like starbucks or whatever my mom buys. With some splenda I actually enjoy this, so even if you don't like coffee give this a try. It's definitely one of the better one.

This coffee is the absolute best.  I found it by accident a couple of months ago and now I can not have any other kind of coffee.  It may be more expensive than some, but well worth it.  Plus, you aren't going to want to go out to Starbucks anymore!  Manufacturer ships quickly too!

I'm not a fan of Senseo brand coffee pods so I've been using espresso pods from Green Mountain (not great but way better then senseo) for some reason they quit making them so I was searching for pods that fit the Senseo after reading the review I took a shot in the dark and ordered a box of them from Amazon and fell in Love I use them with the espresso pod holder I got from amazon (not the single pod holder that comes stock)and have been enjoying the best espresso I've had in years.  I liked them so well I just ordered 2 more boxes

You wake up early on a sunday morning and you turn on your other side because you want to sleep a little more. But then you smell something like scrambled eggs, fried oignon rings and above all the strong scent of espresso...

This is strong coffee like the Italian espresso. Take care you don't boil the water, otherwise it will loses its flavor. The water should be between warm and hot. I use it black with a small lump of brown sugar. A real amateur will tell you that the use of any sugar is sacrilege. But what can I do? The flesh is weak.

Pretty good coffee I really liked it
It is a bit on the strong side or it may be the way I brewed it but it is a good tasting coffee in my opinion.

Product looked and smelled great - however, it was not clear from the description that this product is for non-ESE pod machines. I like the idea of organic and US source, this just didn't work for me.
Coffee from Hawaii is the best in the world, specificly the Kona side of the island and this is no exception.
This was purchased for my daughter and her husband.  I was very pleased with the selection of items in the basket.

These crackers make a handy quick snack on the go or at my desk.  I do wish that the mix was four of the cheese filled crackers and four peanut butter rather than two cheese and six peanut butter, which is why I only gave it four stars.  But I like the taste and convenience so much that I have this on auto-ship monthly.  And I like having some variety, which is why I order the variety pack instead of all the same flavor.
love these little crackers and a great price on these will be ordering from this vendor again expiration on these was bout 6 months away

My husband is in a Physical Rehab facility and these crackers make a great snack for him in between meals or with medications he can't take on an empty stomach.  He also takes one along when he has to travel to other facilities for treatment in case he gets hungry on the road.  Just wish there was one more variety instead of two of the toasted ones.

Fast delivery by Amazon.

I've always liked Keebler products and think these are good. I use them for a quick easy feed. My dog also likes them and recommends them to other dogs.

Purchased this product after extensive research on coca tea and reviews from others on various brands. Upon arrival I made a cup for my overly tired feeling sick husband. After drinking the tea (two bags in 8oz) he said he felt alert and more awake. He was easily able to finish his day. He said it tasted good (no sugar or honey) and he usually does not like anything natural.

I personally have not tried this tea. I bought this as a Teacher's Appreiciation gift for my sons' teacher. She had mentioned trying this flavor at a tea shop years before. So I searched for it and hoped that this would be a winner. And it was!! She loved it!!!
This is the best iced tea around!  The first time I had it was at Emeril's Tchoup Chop in Orlando.  It tastes great, but I think the aroma while it brews is the best part.

Just had this for the first time at PF Chang's in Sacramento yesterday.  I was utterly amazed at how good it is and I am a tough critic, having been a long-time Earl Grey lover.  It's great with food because the taste is light and refreshing; it's also delicious, by the way.  It's perfect for summertime, perfect frosty cold with lots of ice.  And it's real tea, not a powder.  It smells so good I almost want to wear it! Can you tell?  I LOVE this tea!

I had blackberry jasmine iced tea in a restaurant recently, and loved it.  I searched for it online and found it here, reasonably priced, promptly delivered, and just as delicious as I tasted in the restaurant.  So glad I found a place to buy it so I can enjoy it anytime.  Best iced tea ever!
We eat at PF Changs fairly often and love the jasmine blackberry tea they serve. Looked all over for something like it, found China Mist and are delighted that it is the exact, same tea!

We drink a lot of tea in our house.  It is the drink of choice for lunch and dinner with both myself and my husband and our oldest son.  This blackberry jasmine tea is wonderful.  It tastes very much like the Jasmine blackberry tea we get at PF Chang's restaurant.  I don't know if it is the same but it tastes very simliar.  I add just a touch of sugar which seems to bring out the flavors so much.  If you are a tea drinker who appreciates flavors other than the typical, this is a wonderful product.  Also, the service was fast and accurate.  We will definitely be purchasing this again when we run out.

China Mist just makes REALLY good teas anyways, my first introduction to the brand was the Passion Fruit flavor, which is to die for, but this Blackberry Jasmine is really awesome too! Sooo refreshing even from the fridge a couple days later. The blackberry flavor and smell is amazing but not overpowering the green tea. Only wish the Jasmine flavor would come through a little more clearly, but all in all, very well done!

I gave up diet coke last year. I drink water but it gets old after a while. I don't like sweet tea, but I do like to have a little flavor. This is has such a wonderful, light flavor. Even my kids like this tea! I've been stocking up so that I have plenty at all times!

A friend of mine got me started drinking unsweetened green tea at Starbucks, and I fell in love with it. It was delicious. Because I enjoyed it so much, I ordered green tea when some coworkers took me to lunch at Kona in Baltimore Inner Harbor. It was SO good, it blew the Starbucks stuff out of the water. We eat at Kona a lot, and I always drink so much of the tea that I feel like I'm sloshing when I leave. It's so rare that I find a drink that I enjoy sipping ... not just guzzling it down because I'm thirsty.

Today, I finally asked the server which brand they serve, though I didn't have hopes of finding it in consumer size containers (I assumed they'd be buying from direct-to-restaurant suppliers). I am SO thrilled to find that it's accessible. And cheaply at that! I'm about to order several of these to keep myself pleasantly stocked in the house. this stuff is delightful.
this was actually pretty good!!! after working out i get very hungry.. I didn't want to eat late so i started taking these and it helped quench the hunger and feed the muscle at the same time
I have only tried the Strawberry and it was suprisingly good. Some after-taste as would be expected but really good otherwise. I use this to supplement my workouts.

I love the Cocoa ones, but I like these a little better.  And there isn't any sugar, just Sucralose (splenda), which makes it that much better.  One of the best sweet things to eat when watching carb intake.

After being on a low-carb diet for the past few months, I was desperate for something sweet.  These almonds were like HEAVEN!  They were just what the doctor ordered and just a handful satisfied my craving for sweets.  I now eat a few after dinner every night and don't feel like I'm missing anything.  They are sweetened with Sucralose so they fit into the low-carb diet.  I liked them so well that I'm going to try the chocolate ones.  I'm also going to crush some up and put it in my "lite" vanilla yogurt for a granola like breakfast.  I highly recommend them!

Almost all low carb breads I've eaten taste like cardboard. Not this one! It has a coarse, nutty texture that is great. It soaks up egg for a great french toast and just toasted, it comes out crispy on the outside and still soft on the inside. The other breads from Health Express that I've bought were the Flax-yummy! And the sesame seed and the oat of which makes the best grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had!!

For those following a low carb diet, this bread is a godsend.  It is real bread that tastes homemade!  When you are tired of protein and berries this bread offers a real taste of bread.  It had no effect on my blood sugar, so I know the labeling is true.
26 dollars to ship 2 loaves of bread?  I can go to the grocery store and get like 12 loaves for this price.

This is delicious! If you cook the sauce down for about 6 minutes with the pasta (I use penne normally) and add some shredded cheese on top (I like mozzarella more than parmesan for this dish) you have a real treat. I used to add robust to it by browning a half pound of ground beef and making a meat sauce but I have found that sometimes it's nice to let a flavor sit on its own and not add much. With a dash of olive oil, a pinch of extra oregano and pop it in the oven for about 10 minutes you have a meal that rivals some restaurants in my area.

I am not sure about the price here on amazon. When I go to Walmart I can score a jar of this for $1.68. So 12 jars would be $20.68. For this reason I recommend you hit up your local Walmart. It may be higher if you go to other grocery stores but Walmart is cheap. Other than the price I totally recommend!

I purchased this sauce at a local grocery store this afternoon. I opened it and gave it a quick taste. Absolutely no flavor to be realized . I don't know why a company would put out such a bland product when spices to repair the taste are readily available. This is a bad product. Buy something else.

I'd label this as flavored water, but bottled water has more flavor. I noticed when I poured it into a sauce pan for heating it up, almost half, maybe more, was just water. Upon actually eating it, I couldn't help but notice what little bit of flavor there was tasted like regular olive oil (as opposed to the "Extra Virgin olive oil listed in the ingredients). I'd like to think it was a bad batch, but even then you'd think quality control was better than that. Either way, I'd recommend buying a single container locally and trying that before buying a bulk quantity.

I wasn't sure how many nuts were going to be in this package. I just wanted a few, but there are over a dozen nuts in this package. I have given many away to friends and family. There is a brief description about the use of the outer layer for mace and the inner kernel for the nutmeg. If you don't have a need for so much nutmeg, it makes a great gift for the other cooks in your cirle of friends.
There's really not a ton to say; they're whole nutmeg nuts.  But they're at a darn good price, and Barry Farm has always shipped promptly and without any issue.  What more can you ask for, really?
A really decent, fresh product at a very good price. This defines "value" and it certainly applies here. Highly recommended.

I was very pleased with the quality of this this product plus the cost. I could not have done so well in the super markets.
Thank you Amazon.

I can not find these Cella Milk Chocolate Covered Cherries in local retail stores.  So I ordered these online.  I was surprised to receive them so quickly.  I had them 2 days after I ordered and I ordered on a Sunday.  However, once I opened them and ate a few I am disappointed.  The liquid center in these candies is gone and the cherries inside are all dried up.  Somehow the liquid filling either evaporated are just dried up as there is no sticky evidence of leaking in the box.  Also, the milk chocolate has a chalky look as if it has oxidized.  We can still eat them as they are okay, but they are not as advertized on the outside of the box as containing a clear liquid center.  I think it's obvious that these Chocolates are just very old and probably have exceeded their optimum shelf life.  I will not order from this reseller again.
they had slightly melted but were still reasonably ok to eat.  It's best to buy these any season except the summer months.  Not the sellers fault if it's hot weather while in transit.

The first thing I noticed was an odd smell. That dissipated after a half hour or so. Off to a bad start. But I was willing to try one. It was sticky. The wrappers clearly had a layer of the cream filling all over the outsides.
In fact half of them were sticky. There was the source of the smell. There is no indication any of them were damaged and leaked that might have caused the stickiness. There are three levels separated by a sheet of cardboard but no stickiness on the cardboard. Because of all that they were sticky before they were put into the box.
Never again.
Especially now that they included the warning about pits on the box. A. You know they are using real cherries and B. You could bite into a pit so chew carefully.
I ordered these on Dec.17,and I was hoping it would get to where it had to go by Christmas,it made it by noon on the 20th.Great service.

These cordials are in my humble opinion 1st class. I try and order at least a case them every year and share with my best friends.

Thank you, God bless, and Merry Christmas
Suffice it to say that no other chocolate covered cherries are as good as Cella's.  These have been my favorite for many, many years.

I tried this around Christmas time. It is so good,I find myself smacking my lips to get the last of the taste off. This six pack price is much cheaper than buying 6 individual bottles in my local supermarket. TIP: Sprinkle chicken or pork with J&D'S Bacon Salt, before putting in the oven. When it's time for the sauce, add generously. The combination is wild!

I've been backyard sugarin for several years and this filter clears the syrup like nothing else and is reusable.  It is large and you do need to figure out a home set up, it's easy enough to use and washable/reusable.  Our syrup was the best it's ever been this year!  Filtering throughout the process is key and for $14, it's well worth the investment.  We set it over a coffee pot with spout, work in small batches so the syrup doesn't cool and you have a spout to fill jars.  You could use a cone colander/sieve/strainer as well, probably could pick up in an antique store cheap.

If you are a backyard sugarer, you should definitely consider getting a maple syrup filter.  Just understand how large this filter is and make sure you are prepared to use it.  The 8-quart filter is 19" tall, which may be larger than what many backyarders will need.

I wanted to make sure my maple syrup was clear for long term storage and for that gorgeous warm clear colour. I needed something that could do the job while i wasn't there and just slowly filter the product to be canned. This is perfect. I just throw it in the washing machine when finished and pack it up again for use next year. It just works. Strong and practical and easy to use.

This past season was my first sugaring experience.  I was happy with this filter, it took out a lot of sediment and crystals for a pretty nice syrup. I would wet the filter with warm water before running the warm syrup through it and it worked effectively. This is tall and skinny and I didn't have anything to really hold it up, so actually filtering took a bit of coordination.  I somewhat wish I had a shorter fatter filter, but haven't seen any out there. I cleaned it quickly each time I used it, but by the end of the season with the darker syrup it did get some staining. I will consider getting the filter liners for next season and maybe something that will hold it in place for me (if that exists).
This filter did a great job on my small backyard operation.  After running my syrup through it I didn't have any sentimentation.

I ordered this filter after using cheese cloth and other methods of making my syrup clear and free of debris. I didn't want to spend any money on a product that won't help me be self sufficient. So I bought it, and I was amazed by it with my first small 2 quart batch. So I washed it in the washer, bad idea, it held onto some soap and my next batch tasted soapy. So I suggest always wash this by hand, and don't use soap every time. Be sure to clean it out very good as it will hold old debris if not cleaned well. It does hold onto a cup or more of syrup, I dip it back into the next batch of syrup gently to transfer some of the old syrup sugar back into the new batch. DO NOT REVERSE it or turn it inside out to do this. Gently dip it in... Glad I made this purchase, it has helped me make a great end product. Modern Pioneer

I bought these in bulk hoping to be able to enjoy for a while. However, they are so good I went right through the box. Laffy Taffy is always hard to pass up on when I see in the store (espically Banana being my favorite flavor). Again being prime shipping, makes this an easy buy.

I have tried several of Frontera's sauces. I've liked them all and that may be because they each have overlapping flavor profiles. This particular sauce has similar essences to the Frontera Pouch, Enchilada Skillet Red Chile, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6). Even the green sauces have similar profiles. The Frontera Pouch, Taco Garlic Steak Skillet, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6) overlaps a little with this. While the product's packaging makes suggestions for use for a particular protein, I feel that many of the manufacturer's other sauces could be used in a pinch. They seem to favor chipotle pepper and garlic. This sauce doesn't have much heat and it isn't too heavy on the chipotle. It is good sauteed with vegetables for fajitas. I liked to pair the marinated, cooked vegetables with avocado slices. Again, this is a fine sauce, but once you have tried some of the other Frontera sauces, the flavor profile becomes familiar. This particular sauce didn't have much honey flavoring at all.

Ingredients: Tomato puree (water, tomato paste), chipotle pepper, tomato, honey, distilled white vinegar, canola and vegetable oil, salt, roasted garlic, xanthan gum, paprika, spices.

Serving Size: 1 Tbsp
Servings Per Container: 11
Calories Total 15
Total Fat 1 g
Sodium 290 mg
Total Carbohydrates 2 g
Dietary fiber <1 g
Sugars 2 g
Protein 0 g

I am not old enough to remember the original fizzies, I bought a package of green apple fizzies as a stocking stuffer for my diabetic son 2 years ago.
He loved them, and I have been buying them ever since. I love that they are fun and different but sugar free - it can be hard to be a kid and can't have all the fun candy like your friends. My other (not diabetic) son loves them as well - I don't buy soda, so they are like a special treat.
Make sure you use the 6 oz. water as directed, the first time we made a drink we were so disappointed with how watered down it was - ooops! we used about 3x the amount of water.
I love Fizzies, and find them best, when broken into three or four pieces, then I put one piece in a glass of regular soda pop. which makes it fizzier! It's all about the fizz!

I drank Bailey's Irish Creme for years and thoroughly enjoyed it. I saw this brand at my local liquor store and asked another person picking up a bottle of this brand what they thought of the two in comparison. They liked Carolans better. I bought a bottle to try and I find it smoother and cheaper than Bailey's. It has the same rich flavor. I have tried competitive brands of other liquors before and been disappointed that they tasted "watered down" or were harsh and went back to the standard. I won't on this one.

A diluted hot sauce derived from the jalapeño pepper. A 5 oz bottle is far too small given its diluted nature. You might use close to a bottle for a single family sized meal.

Ingredients (as listed, in this order, from the product label): Water, acetic acid, jalapeño peppers, carrots, sugar, ...etc

Tasting notes - diluted heat along with a heavy vinegar taste and, at best, a vague jalapeño flavor. The vinegar flavor dominates (acetic acid is a component of vinegar).

As noted in the title of my review - a below average hot sauce. I'd pass on this one. The vinegar taste is over powering. Note that the second ingredient (after water) is acetic acid (a chemical component of vinegar)!

I'd recommend the El Yucateco Hot Jalapeño Hot sauce which uses the same Jalapeño pepper but it has a much purer and fresher taste. I love the Jalapeño pepper but this sauce does not feature its fine qualities very well.

PS - As should be evident -- I enjoy taste testing hot sauces and writing up my results. I've tried about 50 different ones to date. I try very hard to describe flavor notes and list the actual ingredients.

This is my favorite hot sauce.  My favorite way to use it is in macaroni & cheese.  It adds the perfect amount of heat & smoke to anything that needs spicing up.  I used to be able to buy it at my local grocery store but now it's impossible to find.  Hate spending this much to buy online but I love it that much.  Bufalo makes many different flavors but the Jalapeno is my favorite.

I saw a bottle of this at my local grocer. I love jalapenos and seeing a red jalapeno sauce made it a must buy.

The sauce was not what I expected, I was expecting a thin vinegary kind of Mexican hot sauce. This sauce is much thicker than that, but not as thick as ketchup. It is a bit tangy with a balance of sweet and heat. The label says "Very Hot", but it will only seem this way to those who are more sensitive to heat than the average spicy food fan.

After my first taste the first thing that came to mind was hot wings. They have the perfect tangy/sweet/hot sort of flavor profile, along with a consistency that lends itself very well to sticking to wings (both cooked and raw). It is also thick enough to be brushed on wings while they are being cooked on a grill. I began to wonder if the brand name was called "Bufalo" because it was intended to be used for wings, but after some research I found out that the company name precedes Buffalo Wings by quite a long time, the name is pure coincidence.

As a wing sauce this stuff is a welcome addition. It is a very slight change from your standard hot wing flavor, being made with Jalapenos, while still very true to the flavor you expect from hot wings. As a hot sauce on its own it is good but each time I try it on something else I keep coming back to how much this tastes like a wing sauce.

I recommend giving this stuff a try to see what you think. Definitely try it on your next set of wings. My next bottle will be the larger sized bottle because I plan to make some more wings with this stuff.

If you are looking for a strong and robust cup of coffee, look no further.

You can even run the same bag twice into one cup to get a slightly weaker cup of coffee....it's still eye opening however!
