The tree came with no problems. It was packed well, no issues with the packaging or anything, it was all perfectly intact. It is very healthy, with a ton of buds and has no problems whatsoever. Fancy fancy little tree.

I received this as a gift and think it is a wonderful plant. Much better than cut flowers that will die off in a week. My bonsai arrived in really good condition with no broken branches and green leaves. It doesnt have any flowers or buds but I am hoping with a little love and care it may eventually get some Gardenias.
I sent one of these to my Mom as a gift and she's still talking about it. Delivered quickly and in perfect condition and at a very good value. More importantly, she loves it!

PURCHASED AS A GIFT FOR MY WIFE. LOOKED GREAT ON ARRIVAL AND WENT DOWN HILL FROM THERE. THREE WEEKS LATER ALL GONE, UNLESS YOU LIKE MINATURE BROWN TREES!  IF I TOOK CARE OF IT I'D EXPECT THAT OUTCOME. BUT MY WIFE HAS A GREEN THUMB AND REALLY TRIED TO SAVE IT.

i got this for my mom for mother's day, it came right away in the mail and already had flower buds on it, its very easy to take care of and the flowers are so pretty and they smell very nice. everyone has complemented her on it.

This gardenia tree looked so cute online and we love gardenias. It arrived with a note to hurry and purchase a tray to go under the pretty pot which has 2 draining holes. It was a surprise this was not included. The plant did however come complete with ectoparasites (something like green scales clinging to the branches) and white flies. It was also not as mature as shown in photo - more like 3 branches with scant green and yellow leaves.

I was a bit hesitant about ordering this because of the mixed reviews.  However, the good seemed to outweigh the bad and this just looked like something my mother would like so I ordered it.  Ever the procrastinator, I ordered this for Mother's Day.  As I ordered it on a Wednesday (the 9th), I knew it wouldn't make it in time...SURPRISE - even though the The estimated date was the 15th (the following Tues), it actually arrived on the 11th in plenty of time for Mother's Day.  My mom called and told me it was gorgeous with lotzzz of flowers.  I asked her about the leaves, size, etc., all the warnings from some of the bad reviews and she said it was in perfect shape and she LOVED it.

The plant came very well packaged & very fast.It came with two flowers on it, smelled so good. I know the gardenia is an indoor plant, but it started showing some yellow leaves,(I live on the west coast)so I put it outside where it get some early morning sun, no afternoon sun.It is doing very well!! In the winter we will bring it in. As for the pictue of the plant I saw on line and the one I recived are very differnt. Mine is more of a bush than a tree. But the price was only $31.00 and this is a bonsai so I can train it anyway I want. I am looking forward to putting my touch on this tree.

I am really please with this bonsai. I can already see that it is going to bloom soon, i am so looking forward to the sight and the smell.
My only problem with this item is that i received it WITHOUT the plate that i shown on the pic. Amazon resent me the whole thing again (They can't send only part of the item) but still the plate didn't come with it.
I don't understand why i didn't get the item the way it was shown on the website....that's a pity i am quite disappointed.
Shipment was delivered fast. Dogs love lamb ears, good for their teeth and healthy for them. Will purchase again.

I found buying online by the 50-count box -- with free shipping -- considerably cheaper than buying individually at my local pet supply store. These are a nice size for my two small dogs, and
are very clean with no odor. Many body part treats seem to be messy and smelly, but not these. I recommend them for small dogs, a big dog would probably demolish one in 2 seconds. Keeps my guys
busy for about 20 minutes.

Product received quickly but unfortunate it gave my dog diarrhea after one lambs ear.  After waiting several days I tried again with same results.  Returned the lambs ears, placed an order for more lambs ears with a name brand that she had eaten before.  I went through the same company so they still got a sale.  Wish I had of waited before ordering.  I received a credit minus 6 missing lambs ears.  Since I had only taken two from the box, I figured I must have been shorted to begin with.  Meanwhile I paid shipping two ways and had a vet bill for $225.00 because the dog had to be put on antibiotics to clear up the diarrhea.
I received the plants in good condition and they have thrived since transplanting. They are now three times the size as when I got them. I would buy them again.

Product was shipped lose in a large box, 3 times to large, resulting in the container breaking.  Most of the product was crushed, melted, and unusable. I will not be shopping with this supplier again.
Items were received quickly, well packed and taste as great as any Andes mint. Worked out great for my tradeshow booth -- no cumbersome bowl refilling from bags of candy.

The Mints arrived with a chill pack to insure they would not melt in the summer heat! The jar is handy for serving and the mints are fresh and tasty. Recommend this product for entertaining and as a gift to send or bring.
Bought two of these for a green and blue candy buffet and these are perfect. They look great and are super tasty!

Even though I did not get to eat any, my children told me they went through it like nothing and exclaimed they were DELICIOUS! I wasn't expecting anything less knowing that Andes mints are scrumptious ^_^
Got these for a xmas gift. There is a lot of them in there to satisfy even the biggest mint fanatic!! Highly Recommend!! Great Deal!!

I ordered 2 different types of mint chocolate in the month of august and the one shipment from a competitor arrive all of the chocolate had melted.  Had expected the worse for the shipment of the Andes chocolate but to my surprise they had packed 4 ice packs with the chocolate and had no melted chocolate. Very impressed with service and chocolate and will be ordering more soon.
very good service recieved it alot earlier than expected I ordered right before christmas kinda late but recieved it in enough time for christmas  thank you great service
I've loved Andes ever since I was a kid.  I hide my stash in my room and nibble at it a little at a time like a mouse.  Beautiful blend of creamy chocolate and fresh mint!
My package was perfect. My husband is so happy because we can't find these mints in our area.
The tablets had discolored from age.  These tablets are suppose to be yellow, not orange or rust colored.  I should have returned.

ANYTHING is better than these. Some taste bland. Some taste like wax. Most just taste really weird, kind of bitter, and just not Good.

Here are some chocolates that taste a Lot better than these...

Sees
Ghirardelli
Lindt
Reeses
Godiva

Just to name a few...

Even Palmer Chocolates found at Dollar Stores taste better than these!!

Just got this as a gift, and we were really impressed with the box/wrapping. The chocolate is good, but I think I've had better from Sees in general. This box has about 12 flavors per box. I think the hazelnut (?), chocolate (square one), and french vanilla (?) are really good- most have a light texture to the filling that is really nice. It would be nice if it came with a list of what the flavors are...
Oops- just noticed that this is $40 for 2 boxes. I think it's good enough to be $20. :)

Just got this as a gift and it tastes like it's sold by junior highers to make money (like wrapping paper). it's not chocolate as much as it's cheap waxy choco-flavored covering a ball of sugar and lard. Do not buy this. Disgusting product. Don't be tricked.
There is no better tasting tomato juice. Thick, rich, filled with vitamins. Yeah, it's still the old can and you have to use a can opener, but it's really worth it!

I've always been a fan of Figs, and these are the best I've tasted.  I don't like the dates and apricots as much but even if I could buy the Figs by itself, I'd probably still go for this mixed pack since it becomes a snack with a bit more variety and texture.  The figs are very soft with an odd crispness to the outside, while the other items are much more chewy.  Watch out for the small seeds though!
Tried these in a movie theater instead of popcorn and enjoyed them a lot. I felt I was doing something good for my body, too. They are a bit expensive though.

I purchased these and once home ate them and experienced a severe gluten reaction. On the bag in small print at the bottom it said they were manufactured in a facility with wheat and dairy. The label also stated that routine testing occurs only to maintain gluten free label status. Our bag tested positive for gluten which caused severe bleeding.

Please be careful when buying this brand as the statement is for CYA and labeling purposes only. That way they can charge more for the product.

My daughter and I both have celiac and these are my favorite gluten-free cookies. I loved ginger snaps and molasses cookies before I was diagnosed with celiac and this are a lovely indulgence in a sparce market. I dip them in milk, my daughter eats them plain. Good texture too!
This sandwich cookie is crisp, not too sweet and delicious with a cup of coffee or tea.  Really satisfies the craving for something to dip into your coffee.

Out of all their different kinds of cookies, this is the one that rocks.

You would never know this was gluten free.

We know a lot about GF producs in my house and my son really likes these cookies.  They are good Oreo substitutes.  The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the cookie part is very hard and brittle.
My 5 yr. old son (Tyler) who is Autistic and had to go on the GF diet likes them very much. I found these cookies at Liz' Healthfood in Conway, AR. They taste almost like an Oreo. Great cookie.

I keep these in the house at all times.  They are a fabulous cookie- nice taste, not hard or crumbly.  I also use them as a pie crust.  I put them in the blender to chop them up, then mix in a bowl with melted butter.  I spray my pie dish with non-stick spray before pressing it in the plate.  My family likes it as a crust for chocolate pie, but I've used them with others also and it turns out great.  I've never used them for baking pies so I can't recommend that, only for no-bake pies, cheesecakes, etc.

I like all the gluten free flavors of cookies that Mi-Del makes.  These are a perfect ginger snap.  Yes, they are crunchy and spicy, but that is what I expect in a ginger snap.  They are wonderful to dip in milk.  The milk cools the spiciness and softens the cookie.  My kids like them so much I have to hide them if I want some left for later!
These are the best gluten free cookies ever.  If you have had the real thing before you won't know the difference.  Even my friends that aren't allergic to gluten like these cookies.

The outer layer of the cookie is good but the center is far from creamy. It's rock hard and inedible IMO. I bought these and after eating a couple they sat in our pantry until they went stale and were tossed. I won't buy these again. However MI-DEL makes other cookie varieties that are delicious--my whole family loves the GF arrowroot animal cookies and the GF ginger snaps.

These cookies are cloyingly sweet, i had to throw out the middle as it tasted like sugar! The cookies themselves are hard without much flavor. I wouldn't buy them again. I'm wondering what to do with those that are left.

Not only will these cookies satisfy a "sweet tooth" attack, but they're healthy and will calm nausea and/or upset stomach.  Strong ginger flavor, not sugary, so although adults really like them, a lot of kids probably won't be crazy about them.

These are some of the best mass-produced gluten-free cookies I have found. (Never mind the gluten-free part -- most people could never tell that these ginger snaps are not made with wheat flour.) They've got great snap and just the right amount of gingery heat. When crushed and combined with a few other choice ingredients, they make a fantastic pie or dessert crust.

So why only four stars? Well, I've bought these ginger snaps many times at the grocery store, and never have I had so many broken cookies as in the box that Amazon sent. The box itself showed no signs of damage, so I'm a bit puzzled as to what transpired in the Amazon warehouse or in transit. All in all, however, I love the cookies and am pleased with the Amazon price. I'll be ordering these again.
Hard as a rock.  Some companies are able to make gluten free sweets palatable, but these are really not very good.  Soaked a cookie in milk for 5 minutes and it did not soften.
yummy! these are amazing. thanks midel for making delicious gluten free cookies. these melt in your mouth. most gluten free foods taste like cardboard but these are very tastey. i'm hooked....

Found out I gotta go gluten to due to nursing a gluten intolerant baby , I love my gluten desserts so I have to have something good to eat. These Ginger snaps dipped in almond milk are soooo good mmmmmm mmmmm : )

I haven't been gluten-free my whole life, and Oreos were a common dessert item I used to have. These cookies are very similar in flavor, although the cream filling is a bit more crumbly. These do have corn and soy products in them, which I'm not fond of, but as an occasional treat isn't too horrid.

I have been buying this cookies for a long time now, and enjoy them very much.  They taste great - as good as oreo cookies.  LOVE THEM, and will continue to buy them.  I recommend them highly to anyone who must eat Gluten-Free.

We buy this type of product because of a health condition. We ordered these cookies fully expecting them to arrive in a some what good condition. Instead all we received was crumbs and partial cookies, there were very few whole cookies. I suspect the lack of care in the packaging was one of the main problems.

I am a huge fan of ginger snaps. When recently diagnosed as needing to be gluten-free, and recently pregnant, I've been on the hunt for GF ginger snaps. I've tried three:

Mi-Del Gluten Free Ginger Snaps
Annie's Homegrown Ginger Snap Gluten Free Bunny Cookies
Mary's Gone Crackers Love Cookies Gluten Free Ginger Snaps

1. Mi-Del
Texture: a bit grainy. Crunchy, but crumbles in the mouth in that gluten-free grainy way that is not my favorite texture
Ginger flavor: middling, a tiny bit spicy on the tongue but not too much
Sweetness: sweet, like you'd expect a cookie to be
Size: about 2 inches, and about 1/4 inch thick
Density: the most heavy or dense of the three
Overall 2 or 3 out of 5 stars

2. Annie's
Texture: a bit grainy, but less so than Mi-Del. Very crunchy. Little goldfish-sized crackers perfect for kids or snacking.
Ginger flavor: the most mild of the three, has that gingery hint to it, but not enough where it is spicy or leaves a tingle on the tongue
Sweetness: mild, less sweet than Mi-Del. More like eating an animal cracker than cookie. Tastes great with a slice of cheese.
Size: about 1/2 inch to 3/4 inch, and very thin
Density: light
Overall 4 out of 5 stars. If you wanted a kid-friendly cracker-like snack, this would be 5 of 5 stars

3. Mary's
Texture: VERY crunchy, not at all grainy. Texture was the least "gluten-free" like of the three. Felt like I was eating a regular cookie.
Ginger flavor: very spicy. I could only eat two or three crackers before my tongue needed a break (but I'm not big on spicy foods in general so consider me on the sensitive side). I actually prefer a ginger cookie to be like this though. Plus, it killed my pregnancy nausea in minutes - bonus.
Sweetness: not as sweet as Mi-Del, but not as mild as Annie's. very pleasant to me.
Size: about 2 inches, and about 1/4 inch thick, basically the same as Mi-Del.
Density: Ultra light, most airy in the center
Overall 5 out of 5 stars.

Everyone's tastebuds are different, but these were my perceptions. I personally want a ginger cookie with a good "bite" to it, and I really can't stand gluten-free products that are grainy in texture (which seems to be most of them). I want the texture to act like a regular gluten item. For me, Mary's fit the bill exactly, and Annie's was a close second. Annie's was so different though, I'd eat Mary's as a cookie, and Annie's as a snack, so I could see having them both in the pantry.

The one I still want to try is Pamela's, because it has great Amazon reviews. I just don't want to buy them in bulk until I try them, so I need to find them locally.

"Oreos" are America's favorite cookie. Frankly, I've never understood the fascination. But my kids sure do! They devour these cookies. I have tried them myself, and they are very similar to the gluten-containing version. But the important thing is that my kids love them and don't have to feel like they are missing out on a vital part of American childhood!

I am on a gluten free diet and enjoy the ginger snaps as a snack.  My cookie jar is often empty as my husband loves to eat them too. We have bought them at major grocery and health food stores. It is wonderful to have fresh ones delivered.  The next order is for 2 boxes a month but then one box a month until winter.  I must try them in cooking:  sauerbraten or pie filling.  They are very tasty and great with tea or coffee.  I receive the MI-Del Ginger Snaps from Amazon.

I received a basket of gluten free items for Christmas and these Midel cookies were included.  These cookies tasted just like Oreo's and, so far, they are the best gluten free cookies that I have found!  I do not understand why anyone would give them a bad review.  I am glad that we received them as a gift---we just love them!

The cookie part is ok, but the filling is not good at all. It is dry and splinters apart when bitten into. The taste is barely noticeable and then all of a sudden there is an odd chemical frosting taste. *sigh* I will continue searching for a gluten free cookie, but have resigned myself to the fact that I will have to cook most everything from scratch from now on. On the bright side, it will certainly make me plan ahead better and a more inventive cook.

I purchased these cookies blind, I had not tasted this brand. They were a little crumbly, but not enough to affect the taste. I thought they were wonderful, with only a few broken ones in my delivered box. I would order these again.

I really struggled  finding a decent replacement for Oreo's. This is the closest thing I've found. It is a bit more grainy, due to the rice flour but the crispness is there and the chocolaty sweet taste of and Oreo is satisfied. Use it for recipes as well.
Good tasting cookie.  Will satisfy your sweet tooth.  Very hard, though.  Definitely good for dunking in your coffee!

THESE LITTLE COOKIES ARE VERY SPICY.

SO IF YOU LIKE VERY SPICY THINGS YOU WILL LOVE THESE.

FOR ME I AM NOT ONE OF THOSE PEOPLE.........
I try to find different snacks for my girlfriend who is gluten intolerant. She really likes these and I have had a few myself and think they taste pretty good too!

These Mi-Del Pecan cookies are excellent!  They are, like all gluten free stuff pretty hard (like trying to eat a poker chip) but if you dunk them in coffee, milk or (I use) Root Beer they soften up nice and taste great!

These are my least favorite of Mi-Del's gluten-free lineup -- which is sad, because I love chocolate and caramel and had high hopes. However, these cookies are hard and dry. I'd compare them to biscotti, but that would be unfair to biscotti because these have neither the delightfully craggy texture nor the depth of flavor that good biscotti do. The "chocolate" part of the equation comes not from true chocolate, but from cocoa, which makes the flavor dull and flat. The caramel flavor is not awful, but it's marred by the hard-candy-like texture of the caramel bits. And when Mi-Del describes these as "bite-size," they mean it: These cookies are approximately the size of a nickel in diameter.

If I were to do it all over again, I'd find a bag of these in a local store and try them first. As it stands now, I'm stuck with a case of the lil' suckers.

I WAS SCEPTICAL AT FIRST ABOUT A SANDWICH, GLUTEN FREE COOKIE.  BOY WAS I WRONG!  THEY TASTE GREAT!  HOWEVER, I HAD TO STOP EATING THEM, I AM ALLERGIC TO POTATO!  WHAT A BUMMER.  I WANTED A SANDWICH COOKIE AND THIS FIT THE BILL.  I BOUGHT A CASE, TOOK SOME COOKIES TO WORK AND EVERYONE IN THE OFFICE LOVED THEM.  (I AM THE ONLY ONE WITH CELIAC DISEASE IN THE OFFICE)  SO WHEN I COULD NO LONGER EAT THE COOKIES, THE OFFICE ATE ALL MY COOKIES!  THEY WANTED MORE.  I DIRECTED THEM TO AMAZON.COM.  THE LADIES IN THE OFFICE HAD NO IDEA, GLUTEN FREE COOKIES TASTED SO GOOD.  THEY HAVE ALSO EATEN MY CHOCOLATE CHIP, GINGERSNAPS, SHORTBREAD COOKIES TOO.  SO THESE COOKIES APPEAL TO EVERYONE!

Finding gluten free products that taste decent is a challenge and I bought a box of these cookies expecting them to taste "good" but still, with an off taste from being gluten free. Wow, was I wrong! These cookies are amazing!! They are shaped like animals, light, crunchy, buttery, and a hint of lemon. These are hands down the best cookies I've had in my life, including "regular" cookies, and this is the first time I can actually say a gluten free item tastes better than its gluten counterpart.

My WalMart sells these for 3.38/bag and I got them here for a bit over 2.00/bag with subscribe and save. This will definitely be a staple in our household! We've eaten an entire bag in less than 24 hours. Nobody could ever guess that these cookies are gluten free, they are AMAZING!!

We love these cookies, better than "K" vanilla.  My husband is not gluten free, and this is his favorite cookie too.  Yes, they are a crisp cookie (some may call hard), but that is why I like them.  They have a rich vanilla flavor which the "K" cookies do not. I carry these in my purse when when we are dining out so I have a gluten free dessert, restaurants never mind this.  For chocolate, we still like the "K" chocolate the best. Note: I use the auto delivery every 6 month for a better price.
These are so tasty! Just the perfect amount of sweetness! They are nicely brown around the edges, so delicious!

Mi-Del Gluten-Free Ginger Snaps are the only gluten free cookies I've found that I would put on par with really good regular cookies. Besides a taste that I enjoy, they have a nice slightly chewy texture. You'll be doing double takes to make sure the label actually says gluten-free.

These are the best "wheat" free cookeis.
This was a great price and availabiltiy.
Would love to business again! Thanks.

These ginger snaps are delicious with a lot of ginger flavor. They are good alone or with fruit, and they make an excellent substitute for graham cracker crumb crust, especially with lemon merengue pie. We love them. No one would ever guess they were also gluten-free.

I use these cookies to make gluten free cheesecake crusts.
I turn them into crumbs using a chopper and then use these crumbs in place of the graham crackers in the recipe.
I also use less butter than the recipe asks for in the crust as the cookies have some oil already in them.
Anyway the cookies taste great as a gluten free cheesecake crust and everyone gives compliments ;-)

My husband and I also like to eat these cookies with pudding by Kozy Shack, which is also gluten free.
The flavor of my first bite was unbelievably intense.  I've tried numerous GF cookies, these are my favorite by a long shot. The package has been redesigned, it is now cream & blue in color.
I will buy these cookies again. I am glad that I order them regardless of the not so good reviews.

To date, this is the only gluten free cookie I've tried and absolutely loved.  They have a livelier flavor than vanilla wafers and are sweeter (but not too sweet) than what you expect from regular animal crackers.  I subscribed to these and am glad they come in the bulk quantity they do, since even my gluten-loving coworkers devour them as soon as they see they're out for taking.

Delicious? Check!
Gluten free? Check!
Good price? Check!

Thank you, amazon, for making these great cookies available! It is difficult finding things to eat when you have a gluten intolerance and it is even HARDER finding things to eat that TASTE GOOD!

All of the celiacs in my family enjoy these animal crackers! Five stars!

Mi-Del Ginger Snaps are far better in texture and flavor than any I have ever purchased. I have eaten many varieties of ginger snaps in my 85 years of life, and appreciate this as an exceptionally good product.  The only problem I have is that I can't stop eating them!

My grandson's gluten allergy led me to these cookies because animal cookies are a tradtional Christmas gift for children in our family. Our entire family loves them, but the real test is on unsuspecting gluten consuming individuals and they past the test. Recently the contractor came by in the afternoon with his son's 8 and 10 years old.  They looked hungry and so I offered cookies, with Dad's permission.  They almost wiped out the bag. Good Cookies!
These animal cracker cookies taste the most like the "other" kind that I have tried so far.  So much fun to eat with the grandchildren.
My son loves these cookies! They're tasty and reasonable-2 traits which often don't describe gluten free baked goods! Enjoy!
These are great cookies.  I have two girls with celiac disease, one is a toddler. Finding foods that are like the "real" thing is tough these are a great treat and we love them!

These cookies are a wonderful replacement for any kid ( or grown up ) wanting to eat a long time favorite. There is about 80 cookies per bag, so it makes it well worth the money spent. They are light, buttery and crispy making them great for milk. These pack well in bags for lunch  ( don't break up easily ) so they would do great in a kid's lunch for school or daycare. I actually give these cookies to people to show them gluten free doesn't mean cardboard.

These ginger snaps aren't too overpowering on the ginger and go great with some milk. Really enjoyed having these in the house and they are a great buy - so affordable compared to most alternative diet foods. They'll last for at least a week or so and store well.
I love these cookies.  I can't eat gluten and they are a healthy treat. Family members who can eat gluten enjoy them also.
Ginger Snaps are delicious.  Not too sweet and loaded with flavor. Wonderful texture, great with a nice cup of tea.
Very good gluten free animal cookies... We use them as re-inforcers for my son.  Very good product.

I picked the Cinnamon Snaps up at my Grandma's local health food store the last time I visited and loved them.  I have yet to try the ginger snaps but I'm sure they are just as good.  Hopefully Amazon will start carrying the Cinnamon Snaps.

These are one of the two best gluten free animal cookies on the market. The other being: EnviroKidz Organic Gluten-Free Animal Cookies, Vanilla, 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) I prefer Mi-Del because they are more economical than EnviroKidz and my daughter loves these cookies.

Even if you're able to eat regular cookies (not Gluten free) you'll love these. Really sweet, and incredibly tasty. Since I can't have Gluten in my diet, these have become my staple desert. I buy them two cases at a time so I'll never run out.

Hard to find products that my son's diet allows him to eat.  This is a great treat.  He loves them.  I have a hard time keeping out of the opened bag of cookies myself.  They are crunchy but we love them.
These ginger cookies are great if you are on a gluten-free diet. They are spicy, not too sweet and are great for dunking!

This cookie is too hard to bite into and the center is like eating crispy sugar.  I did not care for these at all and now I have a whole case of them.  Guess they will end up as a pie crust or something.
These are spicy, and my kids love them too. They are crispy and I am SO glad I found these after being diagnosed with Celiac.

Thanks to hubby's recent diagnosis of gluten allergy, I've begun to explore the world of gluten free foods. While some are quite bland, these little cookies pack a flavorful punch! Nothing "depriving" here.

These Ginger Snaps were very good but I ordered the gluten free ginger snaps and they were shipped in error and all my complaints to Amazon were ignored.
Bill

I ordered these for my son (age 11). He doesn't like them at all. I thought they would be similar to the Kinnikinnick cookies we get at our local health food store, but they're not. These are rock hard and although sugary, otherwise have no flavor. We'll stick with the Kinnikinnicks. I'm just hoping maybe I can use these for making a cookie crumb crust.
I love these and it is the best treat.  I love cookies and couldn't find one that was very good until I found these.  I can eat a whole bag in one day!  Matter of fact, I need to order another case.

These cookies are so good - you'd never know that they were wheat free!  The bags are not filled anywhere near full (my only compliant - too much packaging) so a package of 8 is not really too much.  2 bags of cookies will fit in a medium clamp-top glass jar (which is how I store them in my kitchen)  Looking forward to trying the Chocolate cookies next...

I have a 4 yr old and a 2 yr old that can't eat gluten and this is an awesome products for them. We always have some with us where ever we go and they absolute love them. They are moderately sweet and crunchy.
They also make a wonderful pie crust. 1 1/2 cup cookie crumbs, 5 TBS margerine, 1 TBS surgar. Mix and pat into pie plate. Bake 10 min at 350 degrees.
We couldn't live without them. Thanks Mi-Del!!!

Mi-Del: Slightly cheaper per ounce, crackers are actually animal shaped, butter cookie taste (like those that come in a tin around the holiday season)

Envirkidz: Square cookie/cracker, vanilla flavor
Nature's Path EnviroKidz Organic Gluten-Free Animal Cookies, Vanilla, 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)

Both have similar nutrition profiles (calories, fat, grams of carbohydrate) and are GF.

My shipment was not stale, unlike the other reviewer's complaint. Both taste fine and I find I can't put the box down sometimes, but I am not a big sugar/butter cookie fan, so I think I prefer the Envirokidz. Definitely a better deal than the local health food store and, trust me, you WILL be able to eat the whole box before they expire.

Great replacement for traditional animal cookies.  My daughter, like me, cannot have gluten but loves these cookies.  I even serve them as a snack for the nursery at church.  The kids love them.... and here at Amazon, they are the right price for sharing.

Although made with butter (my son is GF/CF), my son has no digestive or behavior problems after eating these.  He's thrilled to be able to have animal crackers again.  They are perfect for school snack or in the car.  The cookies are tasty enough that Mom and Dad (who do eat wheat) will snack on them as well.  They are quite pricey in the store, but Amazon's subscription price makes them fairly affordable - and much easier than always making homemade.

Both my kids (8 and 4) love these cookies.  They have always been really crunchy.  We've never had them mushy like in another review.  They are not too sweet and have fun shapes.  Great for anyone gluten sensitive, and everyone else in the family.
Sadly, the cookies in this shipment  were soft (they should be crunchy).  I now only buy them from the store self where they are fresh.
If you are looking for mild ginger flavored snaps...these are not it.  If you however, enjoy a very strong ginger taste, give these a try.

These cookies were AWFUL!  Really bad.  My co-worker and I each bit into one and we couldn't finish it.  I tried one a week or so later when I was really hungry and it was still terrible.  Not only do they not taste good, but instead of being bland, they actually taste BAD and leave a horrible aftertaste.  I buy a lot of Gluten Free products and almost everything is really good but this was far from it.
Took FOREVER to arrive and the case is way too many cookies to consume! Will stick to my local organic grocery next time. Once again, ordering food from Amazon has fallen far below expectations.

Wow! I've been buying dog treats for over 40 years and this one takes the cake! Pay no attention to the photo in the advertisement for this product. What you get is two (2) small chews in each of three (3) shrink wrapped over cardboard packages. That's a total of six (6) small chews for $30.00 not including shipping! I couldn't return my order quick enough.

I was not impressed about this product (Made in China). Cheaply made and not very good quality. Outside was coated with redish brown sweet something which stained the carpet.  My dog first tried to lick the coating and then bit the "bone".  It was like hard leather, more than bone, and left a mess of shreds about as well.
Okay, my chihuaha is finicky...i have wasted lots of money on other rawhide chews and finally found one! Thank you beefeaters.

My little yourkie absolutely loves these treats. He chews all the chicken off first, which I think helps keep his teeth clean, and then goes to work on the rawhide.

GREAT product, but the packaging wasn't too great. The bones were falling out when I got them... a little concerning.
Each evening before going to bed my dog gets a chick n top.  It relaxes her with a treat that she really enjoys.
My hound is surprisingly picky about treats.  But these are his all time favorites.  He, Wimsey, likes all the chicken top/treated Beefeater products
THIS IS NOT A PACK OF 12 BUT OF 3. I AM VERY UNHAPPY. PRODUCT IS NOT AS DESCRIBED  DO NOT ORDER IF YOU EXPECT 12 BONES. RIP OFF.  AMAZON SHOULD BE ASHAMED.

My 30 pound puppy goes crazy for these, he really loves them.  He's just in heaven when he's chewing on one of these, but they only last about 20 minutes.  If you're looking for something that lasts much longer than a biscuit but doesn't need to last for hours like other rawhide treats then this is perfect.

I like the convenience of subscribe & save along with the box sizes which makes it convenient to give to day care for our son as well as carrying it with you in his diaper bag (either the full box or a few of the packets inside the box). Even when traveling it was convenient to carry the packets rather than a box which when opened is always spilling out.

As for the taste, our son loves it. We have tried other Earth's organic product like the food jars and our son loves all their products.

We've used this cereal many times for our twins and have had no problems. It's a great brand. Earth's Best rice cereal is made from whole brown rice whereas this one lists organic whole oat flour as the first ingredient. Flour compared to whole grain, for the same price. That first ingredient is a qualitative difference, whole rice versus oat flour, is the reason we go for the rice one when we can.

I have to load up at the store when they have Earth's Best rice cereal. They always have this one, the Whole Grain Oatmeal Cereal though. This one is never sold out.

Both of the two above-mentioned cereals work perfectly in formula, mixing right in as you'd want. Our babies are growing and they liked these cereals the moment they were introduced. Of course, one has to test a food out on one's baby(s). You never know if for some reason your baby will have a negative reaction. But we've had a very positive experience with Earth's Best. We also subscribe through Amazon to several Earth's Best baby food jars.

I was thrilled when they developed Diet Moxie as I usually drink diet soda. This is faithful to the recipe of the regular Moxie, without sacrificing too much of what makes Moxie Moxie. For a very limited product (only really available in scattered locales in New England), I was frankly surprised that they would produce a diet edition, but am very happy that they have. I understand all the reservations the full-octane drinkers have about diet drinks, but if you love Moxie as I do, your avenue is not cut off for enjoying the flavour of it if you need a diet variety.

I was very pleased to discover a few years ago that HometownFavorites continues to sell Moxie, which according to Wikipedia has "a unique flavor that is not as sweet as that of most modern soft drinks and that is described by some as bitter". Most sodas are too yucky sweet for my taste, but Moxie has a zingy flavor that I really like.

Even so, I don't drink any non-diet soda (non-nutritional junk, imho), so I'm glad that a diet version is available. I've bought it both directly from HometownFavorites and via Amazon.

Some of its appeal to me is undoubtedly nostalgia for a regional brand from New England, where I grew up. (I don't recall actually drinking the stuff as a kid. It was out of fashion by that time, and like most kids, I probably wouldn't have liked the slightly bitter taste.) If you're looking for a soda for grownups, you might like Moxie.

I don't care for Moxie, but my husband remembers it from when he was young and loves it.  We order a couple of times a year for him to enjoy.  My 10 year old grandson loves the taste also.  Will buy again from seller, very fast shipping.  Shipping costs are a little expensive.

If you ever wanted the fine taste of used motor oil in a soft drink then Moxie is the One for you!  And now you can get Diet Moxie with the same old flavor with none of whatever diet drinks are supposed to take out!

I originally purchased from my local Wegmans supermarket in mid-March 2011, but they no longer carry it. My brother and I found this to be a delicious sauce, though much spicier than other Kung Pao sauces we were used to.

I highly recommend it, and will be ordering from Amazon as it is actually less expensive than ordering from Starport directly.

The "heat level" is probably closer to or slightly more than the "heat" of a product like Gold's Szechuan Duck Sauce, which is usually easier to find in the Philadelphia area.

One other note: this has the unusual name of "GENERAL Kung Pao Sauce", which I had never seen associated with "Kung Pao" before. I only every saw "General" with "Tso", as in "General Tso's Sauce". And, as I inquired about availability from other local retailers, they invariably thought I meant "General Tso". Surprisingly, Starport did not provide an image; I copied this from their website in case you want to share with friends or show to a local retailer ~ hope Starport doesn't mind...).

Our local Bristol Farms market offers a stir fry bar with various asian sauce flavors.  I tried their kung pao sauce and was quite impressed with its spicy, intense and smoky flavor.  I wanted to find out what was in the sauce in the hopes of making it at home.  When I inquired of the person behind the counter he showed me a large bottle of the General Kung Pao sauce.  I ordered several bottles from Amazon.com and found it just as delicious as the offering at Bristol Farms.  You need do little more than cut up your favorite vegetables (and meat, if so inclined), place some oil in a wok, and pour in this pre-made sauce.  I usually make my stir fry sauces from scratch.  When time is short I now reach for the General Kung Pao sauce.

I ordered this for a friend for Mothers Day and she cannot stop raving about it!
The shoe is well crafted and the packaging well done. It's a delightful gift, something definitely different and I just ordered another one for a Birthday present!
Jayme Wills

The description says 12/5 oz bottles, but you only get one bottle. What a rip off! The sauce is delicious, but you'd be better off buying from the manufacturer ([…]). Or if you are in Boulder, stop by Vitamin Cottage ([…]).

This is great hot sauce, but this is false advertising. Only one bottle will be sent, and they'll charge  $10 for shipping it--$20 per 5 oz of hot sauce. Totally absurd. Notice that they still haven't changed the description!

I remember whipping up a batch of these bad boys when I was about 14 years old (I'm 22 now) I went to town on the whole batch! After a while I noticed almost everyone stopped selling these even Wallmart who usually tries to provide products for as long as they can. I almost thought they were discontinued and I was heartbroken when everyone stopped selling them at local stores, but Amazon is like my retail hero! They keep all of the best stuff in stock and they stay in contact with people who distribute. I even found U.S. military issue meals ready to eat here on Amazon.com. I don't trust eBay with anything! Thanks for keeping these available Amazon.com! I Will be ordering them when i have the money! They seem a bit pricy tome here.

WOW!!!!  these are Easy and fantastic!!!!  I will be buying these again.  If you need a quick desert this is it!  3 step process and then put them in the fridge for 30 minutes to firm up.  The end result is fantastic.  they were much better than I expected.  Everything in the process worked just as easy as it looked from the instructions.  Usually I make this kind of thing from scratch but not anymore.

I've been using Turmeric powder for years after I read how beneficial it is for many health problems.  Prevention  is my way, whenever possible, to combat the possibilities.  At least I can try and be in control of my own health care.  It's tasteless and add a nice color to eggs.

First Impression: The friendly folks over at "Exclusively Dog" heard about my website and sent me 5 of their products to test.
Let me just start off by saying that I Love how sweet all of these treats taste. Dad was/is considering trying one because they look and smell so much like human cookies. Plus the ingredients are very straight forward, they are probably healthier than most the stuff Mom eats... But there in lies the problem. Dad thinks that they are too sweet for a puppy of any age. The second ingredient in almost all of them is sugar. As we all know puppies have a hard time processing sugar, and just like humans can develop diabetes.

Conclusion: Your puppy is nearly guaranteed to LOVE the taste. However these should only be used as an occasional treat! If you were to feed your puppies these sugary sweet morsels every day, they would soon plump up. If you puppy is already overweight or does not exercise regularly, you may want to think twice. On the PRO side they are all natural, with no animal bi-products! 3 out of 4 paws, because Dad made me! If we were judging on taste alone they would be a 4.
They look and smell like human cookies so keep away from children (or your dog will be upset!).

A family member brought this product to St. Martin where we were vacationing.  The six of us ate it with a variety of crackers and it was delicious!  We finished the whole thing in one sitting.  The foi gras is thick but fairly easy to spread as long as you have a sturdy cracker, and it has a delicate flavor that I love.  There is a nice layer of fat at the top.

As a California resident who feared the loss of access to Foie Gras  mandated in July, I stocked up on Rougie Duck Foie Gras.  It is not as good as the product we purchased in Paris and brought back with us in January, but it was all I could find that was affordable.  Store in Refrigerator and note the long shelf life. Very tasty.

So, Amazon, you're back to selling whale meat, fois gras, and other gross foods?  What gives?  Is it because few American's eat it, or even know what it is?  And, it's expensive which helps your bottom line.  So, why not take stuff American's don't or are forbidden to eat (remember the ban on whale slaughter is now world wide and it makes your selling of it illlegal).  People are becoming more informed on a daily basis, and finding this kind of stuff on Amazon is little less than appalling, much less, law disregarding.

The item was received in only a few days of placing the order, and it was in excellent condition.  As it was milk for cats, I personally have no knowledge as to the quality, taste, etc (I love the cat but there are limits!) but the only important qualification was that my cat enjoyed it, and he surely did, so it's a winner all around.  Thank you very much.

My husband has been a Diabetic for years........and until Diabeti Sweet came out.......it was a real problem to try and bake any items for him, that would taste, bake and LOOK like the item was supposed to.

Diabeti Sweet looks like real sugar....feels light real sugar....and weighs like real sugar....thus when you make a cake, or cookies or any other item......it comes out looking just like the original recipe made with real sugar. When you use "those other" sugar substitutes, they don't have any weight, as a result, your cake is flat both is looks and taste....your cookies never set up, because there is no volume to them.

Diabeti Sweet IS the best thing since sliced pickles!

THE Southern Sweet Tea recipe is:
- 1 part boiling water
- 3 parts hot water(not boiling)
- 1 family-size Luzianne tea bag per cup of boiling water (use more bags for more flavor)
- 0.25-0.75 part granulated sugar (depending on taste)

1) Pour boiling water over tea bags (DO NOT AGITATE, JUST POUR)
2) Let steep for 5 minutes without agitation (don't stir, don't squeeze, don't do anything!)
3) Remove tea bags quickly without squeezing or draining and discard
4) Pour steeped tea into hot water
5) Mix in sugar and stir until dissolved
6) Serve over ice

We in the south make the best iced tea you'll find so here is how to make souther-style iced tea:

Ingredients
6 to 8 tea bags of Luzianne tea
1 & 1/2 qurts of cold water
1 Cup of sugar
lemon slices
lots of clean clear ice

Equipment: large-sized well cleaned and strerilized pickle or maynoise jar with screw lid.

Directions

Place the water in the jar and add the tea bags. Place in a sunny locqtion for one to three hours. Pour warm tea into empty pitcher. Add the sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Fill remaining pitcher with ice!!! and lemon slices.

Just a helpful tip:

I have tried several different brewing methods -- stovetop boiling, microwave boiling, iced tea maker -- but the best one that works is just heating the water until it is hot (not boiling). I've had problems with it coming out too strong and this is just right. Let it steep for the full 5 minutes.

Some people use home brewers, but they take all the fun out of tea making. I've adopted the below strategy for the perfect cup of iced tea.

Place six cups of tap water in a pot. Pour 2/3 cup of sugar into the pot, and then bring this simple syrup to a rolling boil, with an occasional stir. When you reach the rolling boil, steep three of the family sized teabags for about 10 seconds, then remove from heat. Allow the bags to sit in the pot for 5-10 minutes. Use a wooden spoon to squeeze any remaining tea out of the bags, and discard. Allow your tea concentrate to cool to room temperature. Pour six cups of fresh water into an empty gallon jug (preferably glass, but BPA free plastic works as well). Then, pour your tea concentrate into the same jug. You now have delicious iced tea - refrigerate, and serve with ice and a wedge of lemon! Variations: 1 cup of sugar for southern sweet, 1/4 cup of sugar for sunkissed sweet, or no sugar at all if you like unsweetened tea.

Enjoy!

Win-win!

Best Pasta for Gluten Free there is! It's a huge plus to have this aviliable to order through amazon at 1/2 the cost per package than the markets.  Best tasting gluten free pasta, and great to buy in bulk to save a lot of $$$.
This brand of rice noodles is the most like wheat pasta. It is delicious, the texture is perfect, it doesn't get mushy when it's cooked. I really enjoyed it!

I am sensitive to wheat and corn, and it's hard to find a wheat-free product that doesn't use corn! So I stumbled upon this at our local health food store and fell in love with it. Even my husband (who has no allergies and is a picky eater) found it to be palatable. He couldn't taste the difference in his favorite "old world" recipe. I am so thankful that we found this product AND that we can buy it in bulk through Amazon!

In my opinion, Tinkyada is the one of the best gluten-free pastas there is. I no loger get anything else. The fettucini is wonderful as well as the spaghetti.
If one did not know it was not "regular" pasta, they would not tell the difference. It does not get mushy although it takes alittle longer to cook and you need to stir it often so it doesn't get stuck together. I ordered a case of 12 because whenver you have to have a special diet the costs in the health food stores can be outrageous, and this way you get a better price (even with shipping)

This is a great substitute for regular pasta - doesn't go gummy and taste funny like some brands (I'm lookin' at you, DeBoles). My significant other and a friend who often eats with us can barely tell the difference in the taste.

It's not so great for leftovers, though - unlike regular pasta it doesn't save very well (although it does save better than most gluten free brands I've tried). Save your leftover sauce separately and boil a new batch of pasta to serve it over.

I highly recommend this to anyone who eats a gluten-free diet. Other than price, it stacks up quite well to wheat spaghetti, though the taste is slightly different. My pasta-loving kids eat it happily and I can enjoy "spaghetti night" with them now. The texture is very good with either the normal or energy-saving cooking directions. However, I've found that there are a few things that make a difference in the final quality.

First, regardless of which cooking method you use, after you add the pasta to the boiling water, STIR until you're sure all of the noodles are completely separated. If you don't separate them when you first add them to the boiling water, they might stick together and not cook properly. (This is true of wheat spaghetti, too, but the Tinkyada pasta seems a little more prone to it.) After they are all separate, you don't have to stir again if you're using the energy-saving method. With the normal method, I recommend a quick occasional stir to make sure none of the noodles are sticking to the bottom of the pot.

Second, don't skimp on the rinsing. You'll see the water goes very cloudy when the pasta cooks - a lot of starch is being released into the water. You have to get that rinsed off or the pasta will stick together after you drain it. If you do the rinsing right, it won't stick together - even leftovers that have been refrigerated won't be sticky. The cold water rinse seems to be particularly important. Since I like to serve spaghetti noodles hot, I start rinsing with cold water and then finish with hot water. The result is hot spaghetti with no stickiness.

Third, unless you're on a low-sodium diet, I recommend salting the cooking water as directed on the package. Salting improves the taste (it's slightly sweet if you don't salt the cooking water) and it also seems to improve the texture slightly.

About the energy-saving cooking method: This is great in the summer time since you can turn off the burner sooner and not dump as much heat into the house. But when it's time to rinse you may find that not only is the water very cloudy, but a skin of starch has developed on the surface of the water. It's not pretty, but it rinses right off. (I mentioned this because it freaked my husband out the first time he saw it; I thought I'd save someone else from that surprise.)

I have heightened sensitivity to touch/texture. It can make enjoying food a little difficult sometimes unless the texture is JUST RIGHT.

And this pasta, in my opinion, is great.

I cooked it according to the energy-saver directions (where you boil water, place noodles in, cook for a couple minutes and then turn OFF stove, cover and let sit for 20 minutes). The package says it can withstand a lot of overcooking, but they were a TAD mushy when made this way. They were still VERY tasty, despite being a tiny bit too soft. (I would have subtracted 1/2 star for this, but since we can't do that I decided it was still worth the 5 stars)

It had a nice flavor too. Slightly sweet and mild, it's best when you salt the water- it balances this out nicely. The price may seem expensive to some, but my husband is very picky about pasta and usually wants us to buy a certain brand that is just about the same price as this stuff- so it's not much of a difference for us.

MOST importantly, after eating a fair amount, I did NOT feel "bloaty" like I usually do after eating wheat pasta. I felt very satisfied without feeling overfull.

I don't know, my husband is one of the pickiest eaters when it comes to pasta and even HE liked it.

I think next time I will just cook it a little less. Will definitely be getting this on a regular basis now.

This is the only gluten free pasta product that I have eaten (I have eaten most of the pastatutes out there)that tastes like real pasta. Cook it according to the conserving energy method listed on the package as this delivers the best taste and texture.

My family loves pasta and this brand is outstanding.  I have learned to treat any hollow (penne, etc.) pastas gently when I rinse them as they will tear if you shake the colander too vigerously.  Celiacs take note - Tinkyada is the one you have been looking for!  This gluten free product is every bit as good as a wheat product.

This pasta is really tasty and doesn't get so soft that it falls apart, like other ones. The cooking method where you boil it and then turn it off to sit for 20 minutes works best and is so easy!  We also like the twist, lasagna, and macaroni noodles.

When I had to give up gluten I thought that I would never be able to enjoy a great pasta dish again. All the other GF pastas I have tried were gritty, mushy, or just tasted offal, but Tinkyada Brown Rice Spaghetti has a wonderful texture and flavor. My whole family enjoys this pasta.

My husband is wheat-intolerant, and I'm always looking for healthy alternatives. Most of the gluten-free pastas I've tried had been just awful, until a friend recommended the Tinkyada brand. It's easy to cook, and has a taste and texture so close to ordinary pasta that most folks can't tell the difference when it's smothered in pasta sauce. (Some of the pasta shapes -- like the lasagna noodles -- tend to fall apart more easily than their wheat counterparts, but still taste great.)

I don't have a problem with wheat or gluten, but I do face a challenge managing my blood cholesterol, and Tinkyada pastas -- made from brown rice with added rice bran for fiber -- are much better for me than ordinary (refined) wheat pastas.

The one problem with Tinkyada products is their price. As of now (August 2012), the price for a 16 oz package of spaghetti in our local health food stores is close to $5 USD. I was happy to see the product available in cases of a dozen at a significant discount. It's still pricier than wheat semolina pasta, but much more affordable.
I am pleased with the spaghetti.  I am trying to keep away from gluten & it is nice to be able to have spaghetti.

I'm Italian and I freaked out about pasta when I was diagnosed with celiac disease. Thankfully I found Tinkyada right away. I have an Italian neighbor and I fed it to him. He said he couldn't tell the difference. It's great stuff.

Best brown rice pasta that I ever tasted! It's not mushy at all as you may concern it may be when it comes to rice pasta. Flavor, taste, texture, and pretty much everything, I prefer this pasta over regular pasta! I don't have any problem with wheat or anything, but I keep buying this pasta after I tried once. Great with any kind of pasta dish, creamy or tomato-based. Totally recommended!

Perfect texture, and I love that it is made from brown rice!  It makes it that much healthier - I don't feel junky when eating it since I know it is healthier.  Plus it is gluten free!  Perfect for our GF family!

I am not gluten intolerant nor is anyone in my family but we thought we'd try to reduce the amount of gluten in our diets. I tried this pasta not knowing what to expect. We actually tried the white rice version and the brown rice version (in separate dishes) and we LOVED IT. The kids couldn't tell the difference.

The one thing I did notice about it is that it is more filling than traditional pasta. So I didn't need as much pasta on my plate to be full (which I also liked). We're switching to this pasta for everything not because we have to but because we love it!

I was diagnosed with gluten intolorence 7 months ago and have had fun trying to find all of the gluten things that taste good and have ran across all the things that taste bad untill now! Our family has some kind of pasta atleast once a week and had a melt down when we didnt think it would happen anymore. Finally I was in a health food store and ran across a long time celiac and she told me about this pasta. The entire family loves this pasta including a very picky husband and very picky 4 and 6 year olds. I live in a small town and after many requests the local store started to carry this for me and the local gf group and they cant keep it on the shelves. I have yet to try the other pastas by this company but I trust they will be good to. The sticky issue I never have bacause I usually add plenty of water and a little oil. love this pasta and always have atleast 2 or three packs stowed away in the pantry!

I can't emphasize how happy I am that I found Tinkyada. For years I haven't been able to enjoy pasta without the side effects that gluten sensitivity can bring on. I also searched fruitlessly for a good substitute, but alas everything tasted like something from a different planet. Yech.

Then came Tinkyada :) It cooks just like regular wheat pasta, and the texture, taste, consistency is the same. I've made this numerous times for people without telling them that it's gluten-free pasta, and they never suspected a thing (always a fun thing to see their post-meal astonishment).

Quick weeknight meals are back again :)

My attempts to find a healthy alternative to regular pasta were to no avail until I found this "brown rice" pasta in the organic section of my local Publix Supermarket. I had already tried "whole wheat" pasta and even though I eat, and actually prefer, whole wheat products like pizza and breads, the TEXTURE of the spaghetti was awful. I found whole wheat egg noodles and that was better, but I missed the look and twirl of spaghetti. I saw this; I like brown rice, it's organic, it looked edible as I measured it up in my mind and, alright, I put it into my shopping cart. I followed the instructions and boiled it for 16 minutes. I rinsed it well with cold water and added it to a large hot frying pan which had olive oil. After mixing for a minute and a half, I added Lucini brand marinara and mixed it, covered it and, when hot, ate it. My review, excellent; be proud to serve and not have to apologize that it's healthy.
Like that old TV commercial used to say, "Try It, You'll Like It."

Three of my four children have been diagnosed with Celiac Disease.  Over the years, we have tried many different gluten-free pastas.  Tinkayada is the absolute best we have tried.  The taste and texture is fantastic. I recommend this pasta to anyone who must be on a gluten-free diet.

I have yet to find a noodle by Tinkyada that wasn't really good.  The flavor doesn't collide with or overpower the foods you serve with them.  Other GF noodles have fallen apart but not these.  Don't be alarmed the cooking water goes cloudy but the noodles are great.

I've tried several rice pastas since eliminating gluten from my diet. This is by far the best pasta! It tastes just like the "real" pasta and it doesn't turn gooey on me like many of the other rice pastas. My family cannot believe it's rice past and I like that I can get the brown rice variety versus the white.

Tinkyada brand is hands down the best GF pasta around.  I hear Biaglut is also good, I have not tried that one, and I hear it is much more expensive then Tinkyada.  So I will stick with this one!! I love it!!

These are good!  One of my Celiac children rated it better than corn pasta and one didn't.  The consistancy reminds me a little of spagettio's.  I will probably alternate between these and corn based pasta.

Finally a gluten free spaghetti that is just as good, if not better, than wheat spaghetti. I tried soybean spaghetti but it doesn't taste like spaghetti to me, and the flavor doesn't mingle well with spaghetti sauce. I love Tinkyada Brown Rice elbows as well.

I've known about my celiac disease for over 25 years, tried many brands and varieties of gluten free pasta, and Tinkyada - hands down - has the best in this variety and all others they make. It's not particularly sticky, and very much like "regular" semolina pasta in texture. The taste is excellent. My (non-celiac) wife loves it! She doesn't even bother making two different pots of pasta anymore because she finally found one of "my" pastas that was quite satisfactory for her too. I don't feel like I'm giving up ANYthing with Tinkyada's products over what I used to to eat in my "BC" (Before Celiac) days.

One other nice feature is the price. It seems to be a bit more expensive than some other gluten free pasta products, but compare the price AND the weight. Once both are taken into consideration, I've found that Tinkyada doesn't cost much if any more than the much less desirable brands of gluten free pasta, and it's often less expensive. This truly earns 5 stars, and I try to reserve that for the best of the best.

This spaghetti is the best ever.... it is even tastier than wheat varieties....
It does not get gummy like regular wheat spaghetti...
Even if I were not gluten intolerant, I would choose it over wheat spaghetti. It is that good. I love it!!!!

My husband got us this since we are avid eaters of brown rice. We love it. The secret is that it is closer to whole wheat pasta, and it does not stick together to form a big noodle bundle! If you are into wheat-free stuff, this is just for you.
My husband, who doesn't have to eat gluten-free, loves this spaghetti. Other than an awesome flavor and texture, it reheats very well, allowing leftovers to save money.

Honestly, I cant understand why this pasta gets such high marks. I tried it and it is nowhere close to normal pasta.

Since being told I have to be gluten free, finding a good pasta substitute has been difficult.
All these rice pasta brands are glue-y, sticky and slimey in texture. this one is a little less so but it still has that wierd slimy, sticky quality. the rice noodles are pasty colored too. not appetizing at all. And all this gluten free marketed stuff is hideously expensive so trying all the different brands gets costly.

I have found the quinoa+corn based noodles to be the closest thing to real pasta -- The texture is much better. I'm still trying to find something I can live with but so far, the quinoa pasta seems to be the most acceptable.

All Tinkyada brown rice pasta products have been wonderful!  You do need to learn not to overcook them.  I find using the energy saving technique (boil a minute or two and then cover pot and wait about 15 minutes) works perfectly.  We love this pasta and find it better than the pasta we ate before our gluten free days.

Based on reviews, I tried this pasta. It may have been better than some other brands, but it certainly didn't taste good. The only gluten-free pasta that I think tastes like "real" pasta is made by Bionature--both their penne and their spaghetti are terrific.
This deal is the best deal I can find for this name of pasta.  I'm trying gluten free, and this fits easily into the budget.  Taste great or better than regular (wheat) pasta.
This is our go-to pasta.  It is easy to cook (definately try the energy saving method).  The price is reasonable and leftovers keep well in the fridge without breaking down.

I bought this thinking it would be nice to eat a spaghetti that was gluten free and not expensive. I bought a few packages because I always follow the package directions first, then I play with it if it's not to my liking.

Attempt 1 was like eating a gummy spaghetti noodle with a nasty after taste. I had to add sauce and butter to kill the taste.

Attempt 2 wasn't any better. It was still gummy and gluey like and the flavor wasn't very good either.

Attempt 3 was a little better in that the water didn't look like a gelatin style mess when we drained it but the noodles were chewy and I couldn't finish the second bite.

Attempt 4 was when I finally said no more "pasta joy". I ended up trying to cook it by breaking the noodles in half first, thinking maybe it just isn't that great for cooking as long noodles. Oh no. I ended up having to take out clumps of noodles, tear them apart from each other and put them back in the pot. I gave up towards the end and just threw the clumps of noodles out. The texture was slimy, gummy and sticky and the aftertaste is still like pet food.

If you are used to over cooked spaghetti drowned in sauce, I could see how this would be great... But if you want something that tastes and acts like spaghetti, this is NOT it.

I can't figure out how this got 5 stars. It was horrible in taste and texture and was nothing close to spaghetti. I bought Hodgkins Mills rice and flaxseed noodles and they are perfect in texture and taste. But I won't buy pasta joy again.
I have been eating this pasta for years.  I think it's the best in terms of taste and texture.  You can't beat this price.  Excellent value.

This stuff takes awhile to ccok, but it doesn't turn to mush when you cook it! Holds up really well in soups, slow cooker meals and pasta main dishes (both hot and cold). Nice flavor, too.

Before I ate gluten-free, I used to eat 100% whole wheat pasta. This is nowhere near as flavorful (and is softer in texture), but I've gotten used to it. If you like white/refined/semolina wheat pasta, there will be less adjusting to do (regarding taste.) This pasta definitely has more flavor than white rice pastas, and it really does hold up much better in cooking.

I've been eating this pasta for at least 12 years- no other GF pasta compares to this one! I do salt the water, put the pasta in when the water's boiling, and I always have to cook it for a few minutes longer than recommended. Afterwards, I rinse in cool water. I like that it is somewhat nutritious because of the rice bran and brown rice. I also like the taste and the consistency of the pasta. It is quite filling, but I've found this to be true of all GF pastas.
Have brought this pasta to dinners and people just think it's whole wheat pasta. My husband and I really like it.
This is the best pasta we've tried.  Add more water to the pot because it's a bit starchier than regular pasta.
This is the best rice pasta I ever had and enjoy every week now that I have found what will be a staple in our home.
After trying many different kinds of pasta....this is almost as good as the wheat pasta that I have used for years....

This pasta is so authentic no one in my family could believe it wasn't wheat. We were buying the Tinkyada white rice pasta and, while it was pretty good, it didn't quite have the same taste & texture as a wheat-based pasta. This one is great. The price on Amazon, by the case, is much cheaper than in local stores, esp. with super saver shipping.

Can't say enough about how great this pasta is. If you are gluten free and have to serve pasta to family members or friends that you can eat, this is your best bet.

This company makes the BEST non-wheat-based pasta I have tried! Taste, texture, the way it holds up and everything considered. The only one I've had trouble with was the lasagna - it broke. But that may have been the way I was treating it. I have not been able to enjoy pasta for a while now,... until I found Tinkiyada. MMMM... macaroni and cheese! Spaghetti and meatballs! Didn't know I missed them so much.

I have been gluten free for over 2 years, and I've tried many types of gluten free spaghettis, and this is the best by far. It has the best texture and flavor. It sometimes sticks a bit, but if you put a little olive oil on it before you boil it, and add a bit to the water then it doesn't stick at all.

For those looking for a delicious brown rice pasta Tinkyada is the best.  I've tried just about every brand and Tinkyada is the best.  My family loves it.  We choose to eat this pasta as opposed to wheat pasta to be healthier.  It cooks up good.  And buying from Amazon is great.  We can buy large quantities at a substantial discount.

We tried this pasta on a whim when grocery shopping one day.  No one in our family eats a gluten-free diet or anything, it was purely an impulse buy.  Wow- was this a good purchase!  I fed our whole family (6 including 3 teenagers) with this one bag and we had a lot leftover.  It is of such high quality that it filled everyone up on less than traditional white pasta AND they couldn't stop talking about how good it taste!  I used this brand's mini-shells for a dish a few nights ago and again- THEY COULDN'T SAY ENOUGH ABOUT HOW GOOD IT WAS!! This will now be our pasta of choice as the flavor and value (because less fills up everyone)from now on!  Can't say enough!

I really like this product especially since I can't have wheat. The flavor and texture are great. One word to note though is you should eat it the same same day you make it. It holds it's texture better that way. Otherwise it tends to brake down into smaller pieces the next day. Also, I found the best way to cook this is by boiling it for two minutes and then letting it sit in the hot water with a cover for 15-20 minutes (depending on how you may like the texture to be). This seems to be a fail proof way of making it. I found if you boil it for the whole 15-20 minutes it has a tendency to become mushy and breaks apart easier. Otherwise it a very good alternative to wheat spaghetti.

Tankyada spaghettis are first quality. My husband has celiac disease and has to eat a gluten free diet, which can be a real pain. We have purchased other brands of pasta before. They turned into mush and were very sticky.
So we purchased Tankyada spaghettis from Amamzon, and we are thrilled.
They don't stick together and are easy to serve, if one follows the directions. My advice is: If there are leftovers, please, rinse them in cold water again, drain and store in the refrigerator.
I hope my review will help others.
This pasta takes about 20 minutes to cook but it is delicious, firm, gluten free and hard to mess up!
This pasta has a great taste and texture.  It is very similar to "regular" pasta.  My husband, who does not have celiac, enjoys it too.
This tastes better than spaghetti that is made with wheat.  Gluten free is more expensive, but I got this at a good price.  Will buy more when I am finished with this.

YES, you can have yummy pasta!!Love, love ,love it!! just remember to boil it in lots of water then rinse it when it is done to your liking. No one even guessed that it was not regular pasta in my house. I am so glad it is here so that I can get a better deal as it is well worth it in my opinion. To use leftover pasta drop into boiling water quickly and strain and its ready for another meal. The rotini is great too but I have not tried any others from this brand yet. Enjoy
Great pasta. Tastes the same as regular pasta if not better. I really like it!

I've started buying this in bulk from Amazon because it seems to be the only GF pasta that works.  Others fall apart or are simply awfultasting in addition to being overpriced. I have to keep telling my mother in law not to buy the little $4 a bag GF pasta she buys because I've found the one that works.  If you follow the "energy saving" method, it works even better.  That way the pasta isn't torn up by all the boiling.

Tinkyada is the best brand for gluten-free pasta we have found so far - and I'm not inclined to keep looking, it's that good!  It's made of rice and bran, instead of wheat, so of course it will taste differently, and cook differently, than what some people are used to when they first switch over to wheat-free, but it's thoroughly delicious.  Also, let me say again that it is (hands down) the best brand we've found for gluten-free pastas!

I was diagnosed with Celiac Disease in Dec. 09. I have tried a lot of different rice noodles. This brand is by far the best I have tried. They are not gummy or sticky like others!Tinkyada Brown Rice Spaghetti with Rice Bran, 16-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12)
This is the best gluten free pasta brand I've ever found on the market, I buy this in bulk every 6 months on schedule, and I recommend it highly!

Since I developed a wheat allergy I've tried every gluten-free pasta out there. Most are gross- they either have a strange taste of corn or beans or they get mushy or have some other weird texture. The leftovers have a tendency to turn to a weird sort of paste. Yuck!

This stuff, however, is fantastic! You must follow the directions correctly but if you do it has a great texture that is close to regular pasta. While the flavor is obviously slightly different than regular pasta I've served it to people with a properly seasoned sauce who said it was better than regular pasta. It holds up, covered in sauce, as well for leftovers as regular pasta.

I especially love the spaghetti with a homemade marinara sauce and the lasagna noodles made in the best lasagna recipe EVER [...] though I alter the recipe a bit by making extra sauce, baking a little longer, and don't bother pre-cooking the noodles.

I'm LOVING that I can buy in bulk from Amazon, at a much cheaper price than my local health food store.

After being diagnosed with Celiac, I tried many, many brands of pasta. They were all a disappointment. Grainy, squishy, and if they even got slightly cool they'd harden up. Or they'd just fall apart in the pot if they weren't carefully watched.
Then an online friend recommended Tinkyada.
I bought a package. Just one. I figured it couldn't hurt to try it. My non GF'ers in the house couldn't even tell the difference from their regular pasta. The taste, texture, and ability to be al dente unlike most other GF pasta's makes this pasta the King of All GF Pasta's in my house. We've tried all the various pasta's that Tinkyada makes by this point and not a single one has disappointed us.
The ONLY con to this pasta is if you don't use it all at once, and refrigerate it for later. It tends to get stiff and grainy feeling. However, my 15 yo GF daughter microwaves the pasta for a couple minutes with about a TB of water and then puts them in a microwave safe dish to take to school for lunch. Just those few minutes with some extra water fixes the issue no problems.

All in all, I definitely recommend this pasta to anyone struggling with a gluten-free diet. This pasta absolutely replaces all gluten containing pasta's, especially with how very many varieties Tinkyada makes! No more feeling sorry for yourself or your child with yucky pasta.

I've been gluten free for almost 20 years and a cook forever but since I discovered the Tinkyada pastas I'm actually having fun making pasta again. This summer I treated guests from out of town to a picnic featuring pasta salad - no one guessed the dish was gluten free. I've made mac and cheese to die for! And spaghetti? Wow! Don't get me started. Don't know how they do it but this stuff beats the heck out of any gluten free pasta I've ever used. Was ready to order a couple of cases from the factory in Canada until I discovered I could order it on Amazon.

The only difference between this brand and "regular" noodles is the cooking time. I made these terrified they would be awful, and delighted that my husband actually liked it more than regular pasta. (He doesn't have to be gluten free, so if he likes it, that's a good thing!)

When you're cooking these, you'll notice the water gets really white, so be sure you rinse it off and they do tend to take a little longer to cook than traditional wheat pastas. When you think they are done, take a bite of them to make sure they're not too "al dente". Once they are cooked, they have the exact same color and texture you'd expect.

The price here is pretty good, especially if you have to travel a distance to find them near you - if 12 is too many, split the case with a gluten free friend or two.

Tinkyada makes the best gluten free pasta. It's relatively inexpensive, takes the same amount of prep as any other pasta, and typically people won't notice the difference between this and conventional pasta. Make sure you add a splash of olive oil before boiling the water to prevent sticking. Also, stirring frequently prevents the pasta from sticking together, too. All of Tinkyada's varieties of pastas are great, even the stuffed shells and lasagna.

My family has been on the gluten-free diet for the past nine years. I have spent literally hundreds of dollars trying out various brands of wheat/gluten free pasta - that have generally ended up in the trash. I even quit trying to find a good substitute for a long time. UNTIL a friend suggested I try this brand. I was skeptical, but it tasted great. It won the approval of every member of the household, even my husband who isn't gluten intolerant.

I have tried 6 shapes of the pasta and they have all been consistently good. I can make spaghetti, mac & cheese, casseroles, lasagna and all of the other foods we used to enjoy before going GF. I follow the cooking times listed on the package, and I have never had a problem with mushiness, or the pasta being undercooked in the center. If I am going to bake the pasta after I've boiled it, I cut down on the boil time by 2-3 minutes. There is NO CORN in this pasta, so if that is concern for you - know that you can purchase this!

I really do love these pastas and I hope your family will too!

I only use pasta products made by Tinkyada. The pasta always comes out perfectly and non-celiac people can't tell the difference. I've used the spiral pastas for my veggie pasta salads and they turn out great. I eat Tinkyada pasta every week!
Tinkyada makes the best gluten free pasta I have ever tried.  It cooks up great and my whole family loves it.  The Lasagna and Penne are equally good.

We adore all of Tinkyada's products, their pasta keeps it's shape far better than any other pasta rice product we have tried. Friends are never able to tell it isn't a traditional pasta product. I served a cold Rotini salad made with Tinkyada pasta at our BBQ last night and no one knew it was Gluten Free, they all said it was delicious. A guest who was also on a Gluten Free diet said she couldn't believe it was really GF - she has been so disappointed with other rice pastas and was happy I'd discovered the Tinkyada line of products.

As one who suffers with gluten and wheat sensitivities, this product was just what the doctor ordered. I love it. I make lots of dishes with this  brown rice pasta, spaghetti style. It works great when making spaghetti, pasta with shrimp. Keep up the good work, you've got a customer who's very satisfied.

Being gluten free can be a challange to find products that can be fun to eat not just a substitute that reminds you that you are being deprived of what everyone else eats. So far, (and I have tried several) Tinkyada is the only GF pasta that I have found that is close in texture and fun as wheat spaghetti and I am including other pasta shapes in this review.
