Regular popcorn shreds my gums and gets stuck deep down in them. This popcorn is a dream. It is easy on my gums and nothing gets stuck.

I like to put 1/4 cup of kernels into a paper lunch bag and microwave it. The flavors are fantastic without adding anything to it. I'll never buy regular popcorn again.

Save your money.
Go buy yellow or white popcorn from your local grocery store (under a $1.00 a lb.).
They are charging $4.80 a pound here.
I found two of the three verities they are selling here are no more than yellow and white popcorn which cost less than $1.00 a lb. at your local grocery store.
Their third verity here the 'Purple' has no significant different taste or flavor than yellow or white popcorn.
Popcorn is popcorn after being popped.
Also save your money on their caramel topping. You are just buying brown sugar.
They are charging ($11.58) for a 10 oz. jar of what amounts to brown sugar.
A 2 lb. bag of brown sugar is around $2.00 at your local grocery store.
By the way brown sugar a very good popcorn topping in my opinion. As good as I have found.
So there you are.
My opinion for what it's worth.
This does not work in a hot Air Popper.  It is light in weight and size. and the hot air blows it out of the popper.  Might be okay for other type of poppers, but not Hot Air, like the Presto Units.
you cant use an air popper for these because they are to small and just fly out I dont know how they taste I gave them away to a friend who had a kettle popper

Please take the numbers in this review with a pinch of salt (and maybe a little butter).

My pack came today. The directions said that a serving was 3 tablespoons, so I took one tablespoon of each of the three varieties and put them in my (very old) hot air popper and turned it on. It popped fine with only a few un-popped kernels and the number of old maids more numerous but also very small -- perhaps 1/3 of the number that I get with "regular" popcorn. The popped kernels are about half the size of regular popcorn when popped, but the that's to be expected since they are about 1/2 the size when it starts out. The flavor of all three varieties is good and I could tell that there were at least two different varieties based on the taste. I could not distinguish between the three varieties visually (but I didn't do a careful inspection, I just grabbed a handful and glanced at it as I was putting it in my mouth. I used about half a tablespoon of melted (real) butter and a decent size pinch of salt. I thought the three tablespoon serving was reasonable, perhaps not as much as I usually eat by volume but probably slightly more than I usually eat in terms of number of kernels. I'll try some tomorrow popped in oil and post an edit to this review.

In summary, it's a touch pricy for popcorn, but the flavor is slightly different from grocery store popcorn and I'd buy it again (especially with free (Prime) shipping).
Popcorn very good, I did not get all the kernels to pop. May have been my popper. Price was a little high for the amount of popcorn received.
Popcorn tastes OK -- but the kernal pop way too small.  It's like a whole bowl of the bottom of the tub of popcorn crumbs.  Regular Orville Redenbacher popcorn is much better

We bought this for our air popper and we "LOVE" the Purple corn! The smaller corns like the baby white is too small to pop in an air popper, I had it all over my kitchen when I tried. However we have a LOVE for that great PURPLE corn! We need to support more Amish farms that care about the integrity of the foods they grow (not trying to make a buck on GMO's). It is well worth every penny spent. Tried the Blue corn too recently and that was awesome, the family loves this stuff.
After popping the Amish Country corn I found many hulls that did not pop.  The corn wasn't very fluffy and tough to eat.

I had expected a large popped pot of popped corn but what I received after popping was a "fresh, but small popped kernals. They were rather tasteless. I still have 2 3/4 lbs. left and probably will seek another brand.
One of three packages, LADY FINGER TYPE,  was inedible and did not pop. Could not determine until used other two types which were ok.

I am disappointed in this product. For reasons unknown to me, it doesn't pop well at all in my electric air popper.
I've never had a problem with other brands. Perhaps it has to do with the small size of the kernels. But rather than pop, they pretty much just fly around the kitchen...unpopped!!

I don't pretend to be a popcorn expert but either fresh or even  a few days old, salted, I'll eat it. Of the three offered in this package, I don't have a favorite. They are all tasty in their own way.

This popcorn pops up in very small kernals.  However, the flavor is very good and much better than the "store" bought popcorn.  The small baby white is my favorite.  The purple is the most bland.  Overall though, worth buying if you like good popcorn.

I was on-line looking for a popcorn popper for a wedding gift.  The Amish country popcorn came up as a match for my search.  My family loves popcorn so I thought I would try it.  I love this popcorn.  They a little pieces of popcorn.  They are almost hull free, which is something I really like.  The popcorn kernels are fresh!  I will be purchasing more of this product!
I still had the same amount of unpopped seeds in my microwave popper.  however, the taste is super. I enjoy the hulless 100% better and will continue to purchase.

I got the combo starter pack. Flavor is good with all of the varieties, but they have their pros and cons. Baby White are very tiny and a bit hard to eat with fingers, so I ended up using a big spoon to eat (also too many unpopped kernels).  Gourmet red IS less hulls, but a bit larger than Baby White, but still too small for my tastes, but it DOES have great flavor. Gourmet White medium is an excellent choice, pops well, crunchy, flavorful, easy to pick up. My Favorite is Purple Popcorn with good sized kernels, nutty flavor almost, tender, perfection and looks good in the bowl (not that it matters).  All of their popcorn is grown so much better than conventional popcorn - no doubt due to their old-fashioned ways of farming.... thank you Amish Community for being this way. No more Jolly Time or Orville's for me.  My only negative review is that glass corn popper device they sell, does not work well in microwaves... too many un-popped kernels and if you put too much it'll burn real easy and ya end up with a very stinky microwave and kitchen UGH!  IF they know how to make it work, give very detailed instructions or discontinue.
Received this set as a gift and they are a wonderful tasting product.  Perfect for my West Bend popcorn maker.

This popcorn is sweeter and more flavorful than the cheapo brand we used to buy at the store. I'm hooked. My favorite is the purple, but I usually mix all three together and that's just as good. Tastes excellent and is healthy when cooked in expeller pressed coconut oil.

I love popcorn and eat it almost everyday. Great source of fiber and low in calories. I never had Amish popcorn before, so when I ordered the popper, this was recommended. Will be ordering more and different kinds.

I got this as a small gift for my girlfriend who was always forgetting to buy more cheap popcorn at the store. I thought she would enjoy some unique and gourmet popcorn and I was right - she really liked them, especially the purple kind. We cook it on the stove with oil and it worked perfectly. However, don't be an idiot like me and splash oil all over your face! Does NOT feel good. Popcorn has a great, distinct flavor and I think we will be returning for more.
It was a Christmas gift and the recipients were very happy to receive it.  It also came in a timely manner.  Thanks.

When I bought my popcorn popper I figured I'd try this popcorn just to see how it was.  Please dont waste your money on this stuff.  The colonels were very very small and tough.  I thought maybe since it was my first time using it  wud try it again in case it was me with a new popper....and again it was awful.  Threw the popped popcorn out and even the birds wudnt eat it....
I purchased an airpop popcorn maker.  This is a small kernal popcorn that did poorly in the machine.  Kernals were flying out and many didn't pop.

I was ripped off! Promised a superior product. I purchased the medium yellow, small kernals, lots unpopped, flavor: below average, texture: odd sandy. would love to get my money back for this obvious tourist trap crap.
I was looking forward to the popcorn and was disappointed it never arrived.  Possibly it is back ordered.  Hoping to have fresh pop corn soon.
not at all worth the cost...purchased a great hot air popper and used this corn in it...tried all three varieties with same results...popcorn was stale and tasteless...using Orville from now on.
This was a very nice gift for my mother and father in law. They really enjoyed it!

If you ever go to an Indian restaurant with me, order your own papadams (English spellings vary). Once these delicious wafers get to the table, I suddenly become sharing-impaired.

You've certainly seen them at Indian restaurants. They're the saucer-sized crispy wafers. Thin, crunchy, and often seasoned with big flavors (black pepper, cumin, garlic, or chilis, to name a few), these call to mind some Western crispy snacks, all of which pale in comparison. Made with bean flour, these offer a bit of protein with their crunch, but without a bean-y flavor. And, if it matters, you don't have to be a chemist to pronounce any of the ingredients.

I've had a few flavors in the Lijjat line, including plain. I've had other brands, too, but this is the one I keep coming back to. These can be cooked many ways, including frying or toasting over an open flame - but a stack of three in the microwave for a minute come out very nearly as good, and with fewer calories than you might expect. Each package contains about 15 wafers, so the 20-pack is only for large families or the truly fanatical. If you can't get to an Indian grocer, though, consider splitting with some friends. They'd better be good friends, though, because sharing is a real problem.

-- wiredweird

These are the best brand of poppadoms, and I have tried many. I am in a rural area and recently unable to find them in the local stores. I even watched a video on how to make poppadoms. Living in Florida, I knew the sun-dried aspect was obtainable. But as it is winter, I decided to wait until summer before attempting this.
Not wanting to wait until summer to have poppadoms with curry, I went back to searching online. As they are called many things by many different people, I now search for poppadom (yes, many different spellings), udad, papad. I was really happy to find these on Amazon.
These are fresh and "bendy", unlike the more famous brands which are truly brittle and dried out. I can almost see these by Lijjat being sun dried a few weeks before I use them. After cooking, they are larger, lighter and more crisp than the usual poppadoms, and taste wonderful.
I may never try to make my own, as these are probably much better than I could ever make.

Lijjat Papad is the only brand I trust to consistently perform well for me. I tend to roast mine over an open flame (god bless gas stoves!), but my sister-in-law likes to do hers in the microwave. It's the papad that my mother bought in India, and it's the one that I buy in New York. We're trying to watch our weight, so these are a much tastier, lower fat, higher nutrition, version of potato crisps that you see in the stores all the time.

Like the other reviewer, I have a tough time sharing these, so the 20 pack isn't unreasonable for me. Think about it: you have a snack that's ready in seconds, and can be eaten with pickles, with chutneys, with meals, or all by itself. AND it's not dripping with fat. I have a lot of friends over, so I tend to run through papad fairly quickly.
We ordered the twenty pack and split it with another household.  No one could eat them.  They tasted like plastic.  We tried several from a few different packages and had the same results.

This stuff is great, my kids love it! No artificial colors, flavors, no sugar, and no harmful chemicals like the blue stuff, pink stuff, or yellow stuff.

You have to know how to do it right though!

First off, use about half of what they suggest. You can always add more later if you want more, but with Stevia if you use too much it will taste bitter. Some flavors require more than 1/2 strength. With orange for example I use their recommended amounts, but the other flavors are anywhere from 1/2 to 2/3 the recommended amounts. Always start with less and add more until it tasts right for you.

Secondly, it takes a long time for it to dissolve. Mix it in and let it sit for at least 10 minutes before trying any, and really it is best after sitting in the fridge overnight. If you just dump some in the top and take a drink you will be VERY disappointed as it will clump and just sit there.

We use a dispensing refrigerator container so the kids can serve themselves. I make 5L at a time, one of each flavor and it is always a hit.

OK, I know, I know, I know . . . drink more water.  Only problem is . . . I hate water.  This solves my problem.  Natural sweeteners without any sugar. No artificial colors. The light strawberry flavor is like cotton candy if you use a little less mix than recommended. I love it. I actually look forward to drinking this at the office all day. Makes my water a lovely pale pink (sort of like pink lemonade) that makes every one ask "what are you drinking?"
This product is pretty delicious.  I love using stevia instead of other fake sugars because it's a natural product and seems less likely to cause cancer.  I wish more things would use it instead!

So far I've only tried it in plain yogurt and it was AMAZING!!!  It was very strawberry tasting and just the right amount of sweet.  I started slowly by only putting in half the recommended and then added in a little more.  It is a little strong so start low and add to your desired taste.  :)

i like the strawberry, lime, and cherry, but i think i like the strawberry best.  This drink solves my problem of getting enough fluids, and aside from coffee i don't drink anything else anymore.  Take the suggestions other positive reviewers have done - let it dissolve (I shake the container), and DON'T USE TOO MUCH POWDER!  It is delicious if you get the quantity right - just use a measuring spoon.

We recently got this product, not knowing what to expect.  If you like flavored waters, than this is the stuff for you.  You're not really going to get a kool-aid type of beverage from it.  I have a quart sized water bottle, and I put in about 1/4 tsp of the product then add water.  I don't have the clumping issue, because I shake my water bottle.  I get a nice drink that isn't too sweet and is refreshing.  I'm going to try other flavors too. =)

I would have given this product a 2 star. The taste is not that good... so it gets a 2* for flavor. However, the health value is tremendous. For people with diabetese, this is a miracle.

What is nice about the flavor is that it is NOT overpowering. Therefore, if you want to add you own flavoring to it... I suggest something like unsweetened kool aid... or something like it that is healthier.

This product has a great potential and it's health benefits are superb!

This product is delicious, not to mention all-natural, and I use it almost every single day.  I mix it into plain yogurt and it makes it downright addictive. I'm slowly collecting all the flavors of Stevita (I only wish there were more!!) and this one might just be my favorite; it's the perfect balance of sweetness and authentic strawberry flavor!

This product has a great flavor and it even has vitamin C in it.  Most water flavorings don't offer that except Propel; and propel has artificial sweetener in it.  I prefer using Stevia products because they have no chemicals in it.  The only problem I had was with it dissolving in really cold water.

For someone who is trying to slowly switch over from regular diet sodas/drinks to all natural diet substitutes, I have tried a variety of stevia flavored drinks (aka stevia sweetened sodas and teas). This my first time trying a powdered drink. And it's better than what I expected. I was bit wary after reading some of the reviews. You can add just a little bit and it's enough to sweeten my tea or just water. I am not a fan of drinking water (except fiji or while working out) and this can easily quench my thirst when I add the right amount. If I add too much its a mix between bitter and sweet and it's not that good. It's something I add for flavour and a great alternative for a healthy diet nut who likes tasty drinks. I would like to try the orange so I can add it to tea and make it DIY iced orange tea.

I really hoped that this would be good for milk and yogurt like Quik or Hersheys syrup, but sadly, it is not.
Being a newly minted diabetic, I am
very limited on things I can have, that of course, I used to love.
Like Strawberry Ice Cream, or a Strawberry shake. I had hope that this product
with Stevia would be a good alternative.
I am afraid however that this stuff tastes nothing like strawberry at all, frankly I am not sure what it
tastes like.

I ordered this after I had purchased their Chocolate product, which is AMAZING.
I loved it so much I had just assumed the strawberry would be
just as good, so much so I had bought 2 containers of it.
Well, you live and you learn. Will I buy it again? not a chance. Will I buy the Chocolate
stevita again? darn right I will.
That stuff tastes great in skim milk, and that greek zero fat yogurt ( which I can have ) and makes that stuff taste
fantastic.

So. Strawberry Sevita NO.
Chocolate Sevita YES YES YES.

As usual, taste is an personal thing, and you might like the strawberry stuff, so Your Milage May Vary.

I will start by saying I love stevia! I have used it for years in just about every form there is (powder, liquid, packets, teas, etc) so I do understand it's taste and concentration. Unfortunately, this stuff just taste nasty no matter how you mix it! I've tried using less, I've tried using more, nothing helps. So far, I have only tried the strawberry so I'm hoping other flavors are better, but this one is just not drinkable, sorry.
Do they test their product before selling it? This wont dissolve, it lumps up into chunks on top. Total waste of money.

My local grocers quit carrying this product AFTER I had already developed an affinity for it. It's quick, easy, tasty, and if you put it together with a package of ramen noodles you have a meal in a snap! I work a lot of hours and I greatly value resources that put a meal in front of me with a minimum of hassle and adequate value. This hits the spot! Thanks Kikkoman, thanks Amazon!
This is an outstanding product that I add to and makes the best Hot and Sour soup going
This Hot and Sour soup is excellent! We like to enhance it some with a little extra spice (habanero powder), some firm tofu, chinese dried black mushrooms, egg and scallions.

This soup is so light and filling at the same time and has a wonderful flavor that is balanced with just the right amount of hot and sour. It is not overbearing on either side that would leave you wanting more of the hot or more of the sour, it is very delicious.
This makes a tasty, low-calorie soup.  I often add extra vegetables and even a few noodles. Love this product.

This is a Kikkoman product and the quality is apparent.  Quick and easy to make and very tasty, certainly as good as or better than I've had at most Asian restaurants.  I like to add crushed Tien Tsin peppers to give it a little more kick.
This is the best hot and sour soup mix we have ever found.  We add a few sliced mushrooms, and often a little pork and/or seafood, and it's nothing short of wonderful.

I love this soup!  And my grocery store stopped carrying it, so I am very grateful that I can order it here, and have it shipped to my home!  It arrives in perfect order, right on time every time!  TY TY TY
I love this soup, I used to be able to buy it at Walmart and then they discontinued selling it. So thanks to Amazon I can still get my soup.
After buying this product for under $1.50 each, I cannot see paying that price. It's a good soup mix ,,,But not $3.41 good.

I was really tired of going through all of the recalls & not knowing if or when either my dog or myself was going to get sick! I have bought the best dog foods on the market literally and nothing even came close to making my very picky Australian Cattle Dog happy. Then a friend suggested that I try Annamaet.  The day I took it out of the mailbox, he started jumping up & down bumping the box with his nose - I figured that he was only trying to amuse me.  So, we did the usual routine: Take a little of the food put it in the bowl & see if I get the evil stare, bent ears and disgusted look as if to say "Really, are you kidding me?" Not this time! When he saw that I had some of that wonderful smelling food in my hand, he immediately sat down and barked - he actually ate it out of my hand. His coat is incredibly soft & shiny and he looks great.  Also, he does not shed or blow his coat hardly at all like a normal blue heeler. I can not say enough about this food - I only wish that there was a store that sold it in my state, but that's ok - I will continue to order through amazon.

I am spoiled because I caught, marinated, smoked and packaged my own salmon in the NW for years. I ordered the small packages for stocking stuffers for the holidays. I live in Louisiana (although salmon do not migrate to the Gulf) these days but salmon can be purchased semi-fresh all season. Should have bought some fillets and smoked them myself. I do know why it so overpriced it is a very easy process and never had a bad batch.
This Alaska salmon I purchased is (without going into details) would make a nice pet treat or crab bait after sampling it...I would not give it as a gift. Nice, authentic style packaging...gives you a star. But I trust Amazon, however I do not believe it was sampled by anyone in QA.

Jim Kansier
New Iberia, LA
Super easy to make and the flavor is awesome!  We love the restaurant in Chicago and were happy to see this in the grocery store.  Love this!

I am so happy to see these carried on Amazon. I have been buying them from my local health food store, but I am going to start buying them in bulk here.

Let me start by saying that I buy very few processed foods. I make nearly everything from scratch including: pasta, bread, tortillas, crackers, ground meat, baked goods, marshmallows, etc. I feel like I have very high standards for grocery items. The only reason I even tried these was that I have a ton of respect for Rick Bayless. I have several of his cookbooks and I have enjoyed many awesome meals and learned a ton from them.

Anyway I have tried 4-5 varieties of these pouches: the red enchilada, the green enchilada, the fajita, and the beef taco. All four of them blew me away! To the point where I actually wonder if I should even bother with making any of it from scratch anymore.

Take my word for it.... these are totally worth the money! I will always keep them on hand.
My wife brought five different flavored. They are all excellent! We used the taco flavor last night and it is some of the best tacos we have made yet.

If you love the flavor of toasted pecans, this coffee is for you.  Great flavor, good coffee taste.  It was very easy to brew the right strength. What a pleasure to wake up to the smell of toasted pecans and freshly brewed coffee! This is the second time I've purchased this coffee and I'll definitely do it again.
Came upon Cameron's Coffee strickly by chance at a local store. Loved the flavor so later did an Internet search and found it on Amazon, PLUS it's available as a subscription. Talk about convenience!

This coffee will blow your hair straight back. Make sure to wear a ball cap while drinking. It's just that good. As with any coffee good drinking water is the key ingredient to perfecting a great cup of coffee. Hence, lousy water, lousy coffee. I try to stick with distilled water to make my coffee or invest in a good countertop water filter to at least get the lousy chlorine out of the water. But for those of you who are lucky enough to have excellent well water you probably won't have to bother with distilled or filtered water. Lucky you!!

I first saw this coffee at Amazon. I had never heard of Cameron's and this particular flavor sounded good. The aroma of the beans is wonderful. The aroma while brewing awakens me clear in the bedroom as its' set using the built in timer. My first cup and that was it ! Although I still like a strong dark French roast, this medium roasted Cameron's Toasted Southern Pecan is now my favorite brew. The Aroma and Flavor is GREAT ! I would like to try some other roast by Cameron's, but I can't seem to make a change since I like this soooo much ! Really good coffee ! I highly recommend !Cameron's Toasted Southern Pecan Whole Bean Coffee, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 3)
Coffee arrived on time, was fresh and the value was good. I always use Amazon to purchase my specialty coffee.

This is the only coffee I've bought for a few years.  I grind the beans myself and make it strong with a little half-and-half.  The flavoring is not necessarily noticeable, you might think that it is an unflavored coffee.  It tastes smooth and creamy, not bitter.  I prepare this coffee the same way when my parents visit and they ask, "Why is your coffee so good?"  So I now give them bags of this coffee for gifts.  I prefer the whole-bean coffee, I think it tastes fresher.

Too mild and I'm not sure that it tastes of pecans at all.  We ended up mixing with stronger dark beans to give it some heft, but that doesn't make me want this again.  The price is good (esp given the rising price of coffee beans), but we won't re-order this one.

This coffee is fantastic and each cup makes me craving for more. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars - the smell is much less when the coffee is ready, the beans themselves smell much stronger and better. But over all it is pure pleaser and I am now a returning customer. We live in the Dominican Republic and when I first have ordered this coffee beans, my husband was very irritated, said - we live in the coffee republic, to order coffee via Internet is equal as to try selling snow to Greenland. But now he is the first one, who reminds me that our coffee stock is coming to an end and we need to order some more.
I don't like flavored coffee that has a strong taste.  This is extremely good with a mild pecan taste and a great smell.

This coffee has enough real coffee taste to please real coffee drinkers and enough flavor to please those who only like flavors!  Simply put, one pot will please everyone in your house or at your party.  Great for every day or at a party; morning or dessert.  I love it and it is the only flavor I order now!  I am a bold/espresso drinker and my mom is a weak coffee drinker, but we can agree on this.  You won't be disappointed!

I figured this coffee would be great from seeing the good reviews. I'm starting to think they are from the company. I was looking for a good southern pecan coffee and this tastes nothing like pecans. It tastes like hazelnut. If I wanted hazelnut, I would buy it. The coffee itself tastes okay, but it doesn't taste how it should. I expected better from this company since I love their other flavors.

I was unable to buy the particular brand of Southern Pecan coffee locally that I've bought for years so started researching on Amazon for a replacement. Read the various customer reviews and this brand seemed to be the perfect choice.

This is what I've found since purchasing it: The coffee is very weak in flavor, watery in taste and........when you grind more coffee beans to compensate........it doesn't improve. No creamy, rich flavor - not even close.

For my money, I will never buy this coffee again. It's just not worth it.

believe all the 5-star reviews, this broth is restaurant quality...I'm thinking some restaurants are using this broth???

Make sure you buy all the additions (greens, beef slices, bean sprouts, hot peppers, siracha, hoison sauce, etc...)

Only thing I would modify is to add more water. It's a little salty for my taste. Water it down. So, one package suggests 2 gallons of water...I would add an additional gallon of water. Or whatever you like to get it just right.

But it is awesome, it's got the aroma of Pho, it's semi-oily at the top of the broth...I mean...good, good, good!!!

I didn't know how to cook Pho & tried a few ways until I found this product. It made my cooking so fun & interesting as it's so easy to prepare a delicious bowl of Pho at home. "My Pho" was so delicious that my husband (American who came to VN regularly for business) wanted me to cook Pho 3 times/week until we both were fed up eating Pho :) Now we only cook Pho at home once/month or cook it for our American guests to introduce :)
Any way, I strongly believe you can save time & energy & will get compliments by using this product to cook Pho at home :)

I have NEVER left a review for anything and have been buying stuff online for years. This soup base makes the most authentic and delicious pho! My family was amazed that it tasted exactly the same as our favorite restaurant. ****Use high quality beef-it makes all the difference!

My wife and I have been trying to make Pho like the ones at the Vietnamese restaurant but no sucess.  When comes to Pho, I am very, very picky on how it should taste.  I've gone to many restaurants and even some of their pho does not meet my expectation....only a few select restaurants actually does.  First time I found VV Foods' Pho base was in an asian store.  Unfortunately, they don't always have it in stock.  I guess someone else found out the "secret" base as well.  I called up VV Foods and they said that I can order directly through them or through Amazon.  Best Pho base ever.  Even if you can't cook, this pho base will make you a pro.
This is the only way I make Pho!  All you need is the beef bones and add this soup base then you're all set.  This is even better than the restaurant.

I've been trying to make beef Pho at home for several months now with zero success. I finally did some extra searching when looking for some type of Pho base and found this. I read the reviews and ordered instantly.
It's so good. It's as good as our local restaurant. I followed some advice such as using less base so I made a gallon and used 4oz (5oz or half jar is what it calls for) or base and one spice packet. I let the spice packet boil for about an hour. I tasted it after the first boil as the instructions say but it didn't have as much flavor as I like.
My whole family loved it.
The only thing is I used rice stick noodles that weren't very good. I've tried thin rice noodles but those were about the same as the sticks. My local restaurant uses rice noodles that are very soft and look close to an angel hair pasta size. Maybe I'm not cooking the rice noodles long enough because they didn't get as soft as I like.

Flavor of this broth was spot on!  I have been to many Vietnamese restaurants for this soup and the flavor was quite similar to this product.  My only complaint was that it was a bit too salty for my taste.  I added an extra quart of water to dillute but it was still too salty.  Next time, I may use a bit less of the beef base.  I would definately recommend this product.

Yes! I don't have a pho restaurant anywhere near me.  This is the next best thing.  It truly has the pho flavor.  It comes with a jar of pho "paste" and two packets of seasoning.  I make two batches out of these and it makes a lot. I can also freeze any extra broth for later use.  I don't follow the directions regarding the onion and ginger.  I just simmer one seasoning packet for an hour to really pull out the spicy flavor, then I add half the paste mix.  Serve with the traditional pho ingredients.  YUM.

I fell in love with Pho on the east coast and when I moved to Texas one of the saddest moments was realizing there was no Vietnamese restaurant. I could not even get some of the spices in the recipes I found online. I tried five different times to make it from scratch, or from other Asian mixes, etc. and failed miserably.

THIS IS IT! It's perfect. It tastes JUST LIKE the Pho at Pho Vung Tau... a perfect broth. JUST GREAT. With beef, chicken, or seafood, and romaine, sprouts, rice noodles plus fish, hoisin, limes and srichia (sp?) sauce, it's amazing!! I introduced this dish to my neighbors and Texas family and they're all Pho addicts now too. Especially fun with sweet fish dip and Chun's shrimp spring rolls. :) Can't say enough how great this stuff is if you love Pho and want to have it at home.

Did I mention this is VERY YUMMY???? I wish I could post a picture to show how incredibly *pretty* this broth is when it's completed - such a rich color with a great sheen.

A-plus!

Altho this is a good pho base to make at home, however, the expiration is not visibly outside on the box but on the bottom of the jar inside the box. I bought a couple of these from a local store and have been using them last week. Just now I notice that they have expired three months ago. I checked the box and see no dates so I made a call to VV Foods asking why expiration is not outside on the box instead. The lady told me that the FDA's law that they have to have an expiration date stamped on the bottom or on the lid of the jar and not the outside packaging. Also, it's the store's responsibility to check and rotate the products. She then educate me that consumers have the right to open the boxes to check on expiration dates and take back to store for refund if products expired. Uh, each box contains 2 spice packages inside and for a customer to open the boxes up just to get a non-expired product would look very weird and even a waste of time. And really made no sense at all.

What if you buy from online because they're not available at local stores? I don't think it would be a problem with Amazon to refund and/or resend but if it is Amazon's responsibility to open up the packaging to check for expiration dates before sending them to their customers would cause a problem in their shipping lines.
Health concerns due to heaps of MSG and animal fats aside, this is one good tasting soup base that will last you for quite a while.

when i first received this product, i was psyched.
but after making the broth then i realized there's tons of
msg enbedded in the paste. we had to down tons of water afterwards.
i will not purchase or recommend this product to anyone who enjoys
a flavorful bowl of pho.

This is a very handy product that I always have on hand.  Price here is a little high, but if you do not have access to it from Costco Warehouse, then you should buy it here....Same product at Costco is sold for $3.99 each jar.

Here's an item that we like keeping on the kitchen shelves. It's a 13.5 ounce plastic jar of Kirkland Signature Dried and Chopped onions. We usually use fresh onions wherever possible, but these fine-grained chopped onions lend themselves for using in meat balls, meat loaf, soups where the fine grain size is important and in a variety of dips. Nice taste. Easy to store. Long shelf life. Ours is now over the "best by" date, but the still work fine and I wouldn't think of throwing them out. It's a good, useful product to have around.

Gary Peterson
So glad to have dried onions grown in U.S.A.  For most purposes, I chop up fresh onions, but I like to have dried on hand.  These have excellent flavor.

I regularly cook with onion, but don't always have the time or energy to dice fresh onions. This large container works out well. I put the onion into the cooking pot and get the desired flavor with no effort. The free shipping (Prime member) made the online purchase decision easy as well.

I have one lab and one beagle and they liked these rawhides. They are a good thickness and kept them busy for awhile. My dogs are 12 and 13 years old and they had no problems or issues with this product as another reviewer has stated (maybe a bad batch?). They finished an entire bag and I just ordered another.
Bad product.  Gave to my 2 Labs & Beagle 3 times over 3 days.  All 3 dogs threw up each time.  Trashed the rest of the bag.

I'm not a fan of granola by any means: at least not until now. I have tried making my own on many occasions but the mess, expense, amount of ingredients to keep on hand and the less than satisfactory results have pretty much turned me off. I purchased this product in 3 flavors as a last ditch effort: Cherry Walnut, Almond and Maple Walnut. They arrived together in 2 days, well packaged, fresh and crunchy. Did I mention FLAVORFUL? I am a true convert. This is the best. While I like all 3, my favorite is the Maple Walnut, followed by the Almond and then Cherry Walnut (mostly because the huge dried cherries taste more like golden raisins than cherries, but still very good. I should also mention that while the dried cherries are about the size of the bowl of a teaspoon and look like they are soft and pliable, they are very hard and take a lot of careful chewing, after which they become sticky. I didn't find that texture pleasant). And when the ingredients listed walnuts or almonds, I figured it would be microscopic smooshed up pieces mixed in so small I wouldn't be able to tell the difference between a sesame seed and a piece of walnut or almond.  BUT, the almonds are large pieces or whole almonds while the walnuts - well, the walnuts are planet-sized: sometimes 1/2 of an entire walnut and there are tons of them in a single bag of this granola. The maple walnut is the only one I find a bit on the sticky side, but not like caramel popcorn sticky-just a bit tacky. I've already used this in yogurt, cottage cheese, oatmeal, as a snack in mid afternoon, in salads, pancakes and yesterday morning, I made Bisquick biscuits and added some of all 3 flavors as an experiment. The biscuits were marvelous. Now, if I could only remember WHAT I did so I can make them again with the same success! Try this. I don't think you'll be disappointed. If you are, you can send it to me!! :)

Really liked the 10 flavor sour mix from Jelly Belly, but couldn't seem to find them locally anymore.  Now they are selling the sour mix as a 5 flavor mix.  Was concerned following the other review about beans sticking together, but decided it'd be worth it to have 10 flavors.  Box arrived and they were stuck together, but only 5 flavors.  A waste of my time.  Never would have ordered if product had been described correctly by the seller.  Just drive to the store and get the 5 flavor mix that's not already stuck together.
This is a 5 flavor assortment, not the 10 flavor assortment. If your looking for the 10 flavor assortment as I was, DO NOT ORDER THIS!!! False advertising...
I buy these for the office and put them in the candy machine from Brookstone.  The partners love them!

yeah...
This came in as a package. Candies are in the paper board package without plastic bags or any sort of containers. Yes, I am still alive, and this is my second package. Everyone is calling me crazy for buying 10 pounds of candy, but for the quantity vs price...I think it's worth it.

I ordered the Teisseire for making mai-tais after noticing that the Collins orgeat I had been using didn't even list almonds as an ingredient. When it came I had my family do a blind taste test for me. It actually tastes pretty similar to the Collins, both are sweet and taste like almonds. But the Teisseire has an additional nutty or earthy flavor that the Collins does not. It's made from almond extract, not just flavoring, and sugar, not corn syrup, and nothing with a scary chemical name.

It does cost almost twice as much, plus shipping, but it takes me months to go through a bottle so it's worth it for me. It has a very nice pour spout that eliminates the crusty buildup you get on a screw-top bottle like Collins. My only complaint is the metal container. You can't see how much is left, and I think glass would be less likely to impart a taste. Right now there is no metallic taste at all, but in six months who knows?

Note that the Amazon listing is wrong in a couple ways. The bottle is metal, not plastic, and the name is spelled "Teisseire." Yes, I know it looks plastic in the photo, but it really is metal shaped like that.

As far as I can tell this is the only "all natural" orgeat available on Amazon.  Here are the ingredients: sugar, water, fructose, almond extract.  Great but how does it compare to the other orgeats?  The only other one I have on hand at the moment is from Fee Brothers.  The Fee Bro. while being pretty good does come across as more "almond-like" than just tasting like actual almonds.  It's almost too sharp.  The Fee Bro. orgeat does contain some orange flavor (again "orange-like" not actual orange).  Teisseire's orgeat  tastes like almonds and it comes through nicely in the cocktails I tried it with (Mai Tai and Japanese).  It doesn't have the orange or rose water that orgeats traditionally have but even without that it tastes better than Fee Brothers'.  The lack of orange water makes it 4 stars instead of 5.

I recently purchased this orgeat, as well as two other orgeats available on Amazon: Monin and Ferrara. I tried them in various cocktails and Teisseire came in last--a distant last--in every test. Compared with the other two it is thin and its flavor is too weak to stand up to other ingredients in a drink. I do give it bonus points for the nice bottle and pour spout, but it's certainly not worth its price and I do not recommend it for cocktail enthusiasts.

My dogs loved this Natural Balance stew!  And no wonder - I have never seen such appetizing looking dog food.  You read the ingredients and know it's good for them, but when you actually see it and serve it to your dog, it's amazing how tasty it looks!  Five stars!
These are good berries, and not hard like some. I put them in a "trail mix" with coaco nibs, nuts, seeds and other dried fruit. Very good!
They came tighly sealed and in clean good shape. I found the flavor to be a mix between raspberries and raisins.
I bought these berries for help for the kidney.  They are a very rich berry that tastes like a wine-raisin berry.  They are wonderful.  Only five for a woman & 8 for a man.  THis is a helathy snack.
This plant was grown with the love and care only a lifelong green thumb and nursery person could manage

I ordered the Stephanotis Variegata (Madagascar Jasmine Variegated) from
Emerald Goddess Gardens on September 24, 2012 and it arrived 4 days later on September 28. The plant arrived in healthy condition in a 4" plastic pot.

It is a vine or stem attached to a bamboo stick and it is about 25" tall. It has 24 leaves which are medium/dark green with white edgings and occasional white patterns. Leaves measure 2 1/2 " to 3" in length and about 1" in width.

It is very pleasing plant and a good sized one.

~~~

Here are general directions for growing as a houseplant in the North.

1. Give bright light. Avoid strong sun. The light of early morning sun is fine.
2. Minimum temperature is 40 degrees.
3. Let the soil dry between waterings.
4. Flowers from May to September.
5. Avoid sudden temperature changes and cold drafts.
6. During winter, keep the soil on the dry side as the plant rests. Keep temperatures cool.
I liked it very much.I would give it five stars but when I got the pocky all of them were melted together and it was a mess!

This pocky is amazing. good service, fast shipping, and super fresh!! very good 5 Stars!!

Cory

I LOVE pocky. I think it's the best Snack food.
I won't say it's perfect, though. It's quite expensive for little sticks with flavouring, but it's really tasty.
I'm not going to lie. If you do not have a taste for them... They'll probably taste like sawdust. But I've only met two people who thought that, and everyone I know eats pocky but my mom. All my friends, my brother, sister, and even my dad all like pocky.
I just demoloished a package. I'm thinking I need more.
I bought these "treats" for my son because he had read so much about them and I am glad I only bought one, they pretty much tasted awful.

The size was great! We were not sure about how it worked until we saw it used the regular size pez candy. The base is a little to thin for the size of the dispenser. The seller sent it just in time to make it in the Easter basket for our son.He was so shocked!
Though it shows 5 different flavors our bag only really had 3. I ate one that had the taste of pine sol. Really disappointed with the purchase.
I enjoyed my recent purchase very much.  The taffy was exactly what I hoped for.  Thank you.
was stuck to bag and each other all flavors taste the same.. like plastic.. very upset.. taffy town is way better. Taffy Town ~ Assorted Salt Water Taffy ~ 1lb

I received the package with melted pieces, some that weren't all the way wrapped, and almost all chocolate and bananna. The plastic bag they were in, inside the box was ripped open.  I was so dissappointed, salt water taffy is a favorite treat! I suppose that's what I get for ordering it online.
I enjoyed all the different flavors of the salt water taffy and not expense at all. Just order this item in the cold months.
While I'll admit some flavors tasted good. They were all stale. And half the flavors were completely bland. Waste of money.
Certainly the best blend available. Far superior to the ground, dry product being sold. Makes the best shrimp curry imaginable.
Not bad but could use a little more buttermilk tang and definitely needs a pinch of salt.  Very versatile, too.
Best mix for buttermilk biscuits I've ever found. easy to make, and does the job. As close as I can get to my great grandmna's home made biscuits.

Jiffy mix has been around forever, and the biscuits are a big favorite. I absolutely love Jiffy biscuits and dumplings; they always come out light, moist, and tasty, with nothing extra but water. Jiffy tops Bisquick, hands down!

We have a favorite cookie in this house (from England) called Jaffa Cakes. It is a soft cookie with orange jelly in the middle and a dark chocolate topping. The best part of it is the jelly and chocolate.

So when we came across these, we were in heaven. The best of Jaffa Cakes and available locally!

The middle is an orange flavored jelly and the outside is a dark chocolate coating. They are not super sweet but that's what makes them tasty. They are semi-tart orange with the deep flavor of the chocolate. A perfect combination.

The chocolate can look cloudy or scuffed when taken out of the bag but I believe it's because they get tossed around inside. If you want a perfect chocolate finish, you have to buy them individually packed.

I picked up a 2 lb bag at BJs for $10.
Never mind a candy bar for a treat, this tea is delicious. Smooth and satisfying, a favorite with the family.

My older sister got me this brand of chai for Christmas, because I've been hunting for something that was somewhat like the Starbucks chai tea latte. I've tried everything from the Tazo chai that they sell IN Starbucks to different recommended home recipes. Well, this beats the Starbucks brand by a long shot. A little bit of a hassle to get a hold of, but definitely worth buying. Love it, I've already gone through three tins or so.

I'm not here to bs anyone.  This Tropical Fruit Salad from Roland is absolutely the best i've had in a long time.  I'm still trying to figure out how it's not soggy at all.  It's canned, yet so fresh as if you just cut up the Fruit and served it.  Buy this and try it.  You won't be sorry.

Vegan. Natural. Firm, refreshing chunks of tropical fruit packed in a light syrup with passion fruit juice, which is a treat in itself. Not overly sweet or thick or heavy. A great choice for enjoying the benefits of tropical fruit year-round. Made with yellow papaya, red papaya, pineapple, guava, sugar, & passion fruit juice. 210 calories per can. Product of Thailand. Highly recommended. This review is out there for those for whom this makes a difference. See all of my reviews and the vegancompassion Profile for more great choices. Check out "Vegan Grocery Favorites" and "Vegan Grocery Top Ten" & all the other helpful "Vegan Grocery" Listmania. Your input counts and will be greatly appreciated to benefit the search of others. Thank you.

The pieces of fruit were ripe, flavorful, firm, not "water logged" and mushy like some canned fruit I've tried. The light syrup is only fruit juice, not the typical light or heavy corn syrup which I was quite grateful to find. The reason I did not give 5 stars is there is an approximate 65 to 35 ratio of fruit to juice. It is listed as 4 servings, but it was one cereal sized bowl for me, including juice. Granted I should have made it 2 servings considering the calories, but to make 4 servings you would need to use the small custard bowls which would not satiate me. I wish they had an organic version (yes, I've tried Native Forrest and I thought it was mushy). I will reorder until I find another organic version I like. I have bought other Roland organic and non-organic products that I have enjoyed, so I consider this brand trustworthy.

If you want a fruit salad that tastes like you've just chopped it, this is what you need to buy.  I bought a case for my husband when he was ill and he ate a can a day for months.  If you want to make it a light meal, just add almonds, pecans or walnuts and some orange and grapefruit slices and place on a bed of spinach.  I made a very light topper with sour cream, sugar free whipped cream, a little of the juice from the can and a tiny bit of nutmeg.  This can be adjusted to taste.  If you ever order this, you will order over and over and never get tired of the fresh taste.
If you just want fruit and or can't afford the high cost of fresh fruit this is ok. It's packed with large size pieces of fruit.

This is a great snack for Type 2 diabetes people. I carry them in my purse for a protein pick me up when on the go....Planters uses sea salt and it has the heart healthy seal so you can't go wrong. Planters is a name to be trusted.

These are great, healthy, grab and go packs of nuts.  I'm a almond and pecan fan; these are a lot woodier or nuttier than I'm used to, and a little dry.  However, it's good to mix it up every once in a while.  These are about twice the size of a "100 calorie pack".  The variety inside each pack is ok, seems a little peanut and hazelnut heavy though.  I'm glad I tried this, but will not be purchasing again.  I'm going for the 100 calorie almond packs instead.  Good packaging, great to grab and go, just not my cup of tea.

First off, I love these things. They taste great and each bag contains just enough to satisfy.

However, my latest purchase consisted of only 12 bags per box - not 18 (so I'm paying a whole lot more for 30% less than when I originally bought these).

Please be aware of this before you buy.

The "Nuts to Go" package is very convenient and somewhat healthy, however, the ratio of Peanuts is too high compared with the other varieties in the package. Also peanuts are a "Legume". It would be nice to have more of the other varieties of "nuts."

I've been feeding my dog Evolution for a couple years now. I wasn't sure if it was a good idea at first, but my veganism made me do it! If there had been any adverse effects, I would've taken her off right away. I'm not going to subject my dog to my own moralism if it does her harm. The first thing I noticed was that she dove right into her new kibble, so it passed the taste test. Of course, I slowly transitioned her from her other food. As time passed, it seemed that 2 cups total of dry food per day were enough to maintain her weight. I suppose this implies Evolution is very concentrated? She averages between 60-63 lbs throughout the year. I feed her only once in the evening, adding enough water to the kibble to make it stewy. Instead of giving her treats, I merely give her a small handful of kibble out of the two cup total once or twice a day. My dog is now twelve going on thirteen and just passed her senior checkup (blood work, stool and urine check, etc) with flying colors. I don't dare tell the vet what I've been up to. I don't think she'd approve. I let the checkups speak for themselves.

My dogs have been eating Evolution for about the past 5 years. People always remark about how gorgeous their coats are and ask me what I do, that I must brush them and bathe them all the time. I do neither. People also can't believe my older dog is 9 because she looks and acts so young. They still love the food after all this time. I usually mix in a little canned, which Evolution also sells. The only thing I wish for that could improve it would be for it to be organic.

I have 2 Chihuahuas - The first one I got as a puppy 9 years ago and the second one I got from a rescue a few years ago when she was already 7 years old. I started feeding Evolution to my first dog at least 6-7 years ago when I first found out about it. I've been a vegetarian for 10 years, so I wanted a healthy option for my dog, too! :-) It disgusts me to know what ingredients are in other dog foods, and I can't fathom feeding that to my dogs. My theory is if I wouldn't consider eating it, why would I feed it to my dogs?

My first dog has always had a smooth shiny coat that gets many compliments from vets and others, she never smells bad or "dog-like", and her breath is never bad. It actually smells good. I attribute all that to Evolution. Being 9 years old, she still acts like a puppy. She is full of energy and very healthy.

My second dog, when we first got her, was smelly and her coat was very rough. Since she switched to Evolution, all that has changed. She doesn't smell bad, neither does her breath, and her coat has gotten much softer and healthier-looking. Now only if Evolution could stop her from shedding... :-)

Overall - I'm expecting that my dogs will live happy and healthy lives from eating Evolution pet food, and I'm so glad this product is available!

My pets (2 Dog and 2 Cats) have been on Evolution Diet for 8 years. Both my dogs and my cats love the food and have been on it since they were 4 months old. My younger cat was very sick when I brought her home and I was nervous about putting her on a vegei diet until she was well. My Vet uses this product and recommended that I switch right away because it's such a high quality food. Once I put her on Evolution she had a speedy recovery. Everyone that has had contact with my pets have made comments on how beautiful their fur is.

This is a very healthy dog food. There are no by-products in this food. It is vegetarian and it is very healthy for dogs. I personally think dogs will live longer by eating this type of food. In fact, Evolution company has testimonials from owners about how the dogs actually live longer and are healthier. If you love your dog, get this food. You and and your dog won't regret it. When dogs eat this food after a period of a week or two, I have seen a major difference in the softness and shine of their coat.

Peace and Happiness,

Patrick Leonardi
I was worried my dog wouldn't like the taste of this food because it doesn't have meat.  But he seems to really enjoy it.
HEALTHIEST VEGETARIAN DRY DOG FOOD WITH GREAT NUTRITION!  I am so glad I found this dog food online.

I feed my cat and dogs the vegan kibble from Evolution. It really is a great product and I add it to my own homemade vegan dog and cat food or if I am traveling it's great for on the go! My dogs and cat really love this kibble, and their health is so much better for it.

Sometimes I think my dog eats the best food in the house.

My dog is over 10 years old, she acts like she's half her age and her coat is beautiful and glossy. She has eaten this dog food for almost all her life and I attribute this dog food to taking such good care of her.

For the price, you get a lot - it actually works out to be cheaper than any other vegetarian dog food on the market that I've found.

It's just the best dog food. Every dog deserves to feel good :)

Bon Apetit, doggie!

Purchased food on a referral by another dog-owner who's dog suffers from IBD.  Good stuff, smells like tomato.  I find the soaking period a bit of an inconvience, but probably worth the preplanning.  Haven't had any problem feeding to my 4 dogs.  Dogs look healthy, good appetite, but didn't fix the IBD unfortunately.

I have been feeding my three dogs Evalution diet for five years now.  I pre make a batch mixed with different vegetables and sometimes cooked turkey meat, and keep it in the fridge for the week. (This way the rest of my family can feed the dogs if I'm not home! )
This Indian Pudding brings me back to my childhood in Boston.  It is delicious, has a wonderful texture, and is a most satisfying dessert.  My compliments to the chef!
This product used to be carried by the Vermont Country Store.  We are grateful to be able to order this product on Amazon.  This product is well made and fun to used during the Holiday season.

if you can't make it to durgan park or your fav restaurant that serves up great indian pudding this is a pretty
good alternative. just warm, add vanilla ice cream or whipped cream and serve. a great at home treat.
Living 3,000 miles from NH I appreciate a taste of home, particularly in Dec.  The pudding was very good-better than I can make. Carried me back to Durgan Park. Thanks.

I love indian pudding, but this was the worst that I have ever tasted. Half of the the cans were badly dented from their packing case. This is a lousy product. I tried two cans and then threw the other nine cans away

This is the first and last time that I will buy anything fron amazon.

The minute I tried this I was instantly hooked. The sad part though is just how difficult it's become to finding it. Lucky's had quit carrying it and Costco promptly followed their lead. As of now I'm restricted to purchasing it from Whole Foods or here on Amazon - why?!

i am a fan of the tassimo machine, and many of the t-discs.  however the signature blend should be retitled the signature bland.  perhaps i just look a fuller bodied coffee particularly in the morning, but this one was exceptionally disappointing to me... take note of the different roast levels posted on tassimos website before buying discs that cost about $.50-$.75 per cup...

Try the Tasimo coffee maker and the T-Discs and you will love it! The selections of coffees and creamers, and the great service you receive from Amazon is fast and stays up to date with each delivery. Thanks Amazon!!
If you've ever ate it..You know..I've had it sent to Korea, Iraq, Afghanistan, and a few other places..It's always the best..Crush up crackers in the chili to make it like the restaurant.

PROS:
Akmak crackers are the all-time champion with peanut butter. In fact, Akmak are what graham crackers want to be when they grow up. Delightfully crispy, slightly sweet whole grain goodness beyond compare.

CONS:
This non-retail packaging sucks. The packaging is two little crackers per package, just like you would get at restaurant. At least half of our crackers were smashed.

We bought these through Amazon because the only place that sells these locally is Trader Joe's, which is about 30 miles away. If the retail packaging is available, buy them that way, otherwise enjoy your crumbs!

A friend had been getting these Ak-mak crackers served to her at Whole Foods with a soup she would order for lunch.  She wanted to buy some but Whole Foods told her they were not for sale.  Being a somewhat resourceful person, I got on the internet and found that I could order them through Amazon.  They are very nutricious and  taste wonderful.  Thanks again to Amazon for coming through for me.  My friend is happy to find her crackers and I am happy to find a new nourishing cracker for myself.  June Dunaphant
The Akmak crackers in the carton we received were not as fresh as they are when bought at a store and wrapped in individual packages.

I was putting together breakfast bags for the homeless and ordered Ak-Mak crackers along with Barney Almond Butter individual packets and other items. My goal was to give these folks something wholesome and nutritious with some fiber -- which people who eat on the run rarely get enough of. The crackers are tasty. I love the sesame seeds and robust crunch. The broken crackers (there are a few out of the 180 2-cracker packets in the box) taste great in the chili I'm eating for dinner tonight. Highly recommended.

I had tried this craxker in a snack pack at Starbucks...well they must have a special cracker mad just for them..cuz these were yuccky..yes i own a huge box of nasty crackers..even took them to work where people will eat anything..cant give them away..oops

I love this tea.  Never bitter if you brew it correctly--I let boiling water sit 3 minutes, then brew tea 40 seconds.  I get two steepings that are equally delicious.  I'm sensitive to tanins, and this tea doesn't cause a reaction.  It's delicious.  Almost a floral aftertaste.

I heard that this genmai cha tea had won an award, so I tried it. Aroma coming from the tea is fantastic. The tea is smooth and has an excellent brown rice taste. This is wonderful genmai cha tea. I will keep buying for more and try other teas from this company as well!

The taste of this tea is excellent.  I like to make my tea loose without using tea bags and this tea great for that.  There are extremely few leaf steams compared to other genmaicha teas I've tried in the past.  I don't like having to pick them out, so being able to make a few cups and not see one makes me very happy. It also has a stronger green tea taste than roasted rice, which I prefer.  Considering how long 1.1 lbs of tea will last me, I find it to be a great deal for its high quality.
I have tried several brands and this one is the best. Great deal when you buy the bag instead of the can and the quality is the same.I steep it for under a minute.

My family and several friends have benefited from daily use of this tea. I can't say it "cures" cancer....but I have personally seen very positive results in a young boy who was literally being eaten up with numerous tumors...in the brain, spine and legs. After numerous surgeries to remove what tumors that could be safely operated on, the boy's doctors felt they could do no more and advised the family it was "only a matter of a few months" before some would grow back or others grow bigger. Family members knew of others who were currently using this tea, and optimistically got the boy started on a daily regimen of drinking (3 oz) twice daily. The boy's surgeries were done in 2006/2007. Today the boy is doing well,has returned to school part time, is walking again(after surgeries he was wheelchair bound), and is slowly regaining his health. Progress is slow, but it's progress. The tumors have not returned or grown, in fact the remaining ones are slowly shrinking. So, who knows?
A side benefit that I personally saw as well as they boy mentioned above, is the results I saw in my own father who had emphysema/asthma. His nighttime breathing was extremely noisy, worse than snoring. Within about 2 weeks of drinking this tea, my mother woke in a panic one night because it was so silent in their bedroom. She thought my father had stopped breathing. Not so. His breathing had silenced down to normal and even during the day his breathing was much easier and quieter.
So, does it help? You decide. Does it hurt? Not at all. And, it tastes similar to alfalfa tea, so it's easy to take.
You can find better prices than the one here, though. Check [...] for other outlets.
This is where the herbs are grown:[...]
Learn more about the developer of the tea:[...] CAVEAT: When I contacted this site to ask about buying the tea, they are selling exactly what the nurse who developed it said NOT to drink....a serum/drops or a brew already made up. They are trying to sell it as a 3 week "treatment" for a very exorbitant price. Not at all what the nurse intended. So BEWARE!

I can't believe that no one has ever reviewed the magical Flower Of The Ocean sea salt.  I say magical, because I never believed that salt could so powerfully transform food the way that this Celtic Sea Salt does for me.  I've been using it for a few years because a couple of my friends were using it after seeing a nutritionist who highly recommended it.  I think this is because it is much higher in minerals and other trace elements from the ocean.  I use it while cooking as well as sprinkling on top of food when it is ready to be eaten.  I just roasted some organic beets.  I sprayed them with olive oil and then sprinkled the salt on top and it truly tasted different than when I used to make this with regular table salt.  There is a definite flavour to this salt that is hard to describe.  That is why I call it magic.
It's hard to find good smokehouse bacon.  This one fits the bill.  Cook over low heat to avoid burning.
I use the hazelnut flavor to make  my own coffee syrup.  It smells great and tastes great.  It's does a great job  of saving me money on the syrup I was purchasing at my favorite coffee shop.
I really like hazelnut flavored creamers, but I find them too sweet.  I use this extract to make my own sugar-free creamer (with fat free half and half) and it works well.

I have a great amount of experience with water kefir; have been producing it at home for many years and enjoying the great health benefits gained from drinking it daily. I wanted to share this experience with a friend and thought to bring DEHYDRATED grains with me on a visit to get her started. I did not want to travel a lond distance with wet grains (I could have shared my own) and thought it would be easier to bring them dried. The product description here states that they are dehydrated grains...NOT true. What I received was a padded manila envelope, a ziploc baggy with about 1 to 2 teaspoons of some very badly crushed, wet grains (looked like they got squished by the postage cancelling machine used by the Post Office), and a photocopy of instructions. Not as described or pictured in this listing. The grains smelled bad and so far, have not been able to produce good quality kefir. Who is the product manufacturer...Real Man of Genius? It is most certainly not Cultures for Health as pictured.

"Each Packet of Water Kefir Starter Culture Contains: 2 teaspoons Live active water kefir culture in a dehydrated state (will rehydrate to 3-4 tablespoons of water kefir grains; sufficient to yield 2-3 quarts of water kefir every 24-48 hours). For additional information on this product, please contact the manufacturer."

I contacted the people at Cultures for Health and asked about real-man-of-genius. I was told that real-man-of-genius is NOT Cultures for Health and that it is not even their product. This is a man in Kentucky who uses their picture on Amazon to promote his kefir grains. He sends about 1/2 the amount that Cultures for Health does, packaged in a ziplock bag.

I bought this particular water kefir because I had spoken to and watched the video from Cultures for Health.  This company is using their logo, but it is NOT from Cultures for Health! It came from another company in a different state.  I emailed CFH to tell them about this impostor and they were aware of it.  Why is Amazon allowing this? Anyway the grains were not dehydrated and there was not a sufficient amount (in my opinion) to get good kefir. I do not appreciate their false advertising. AMAZON, check this out!

Ordering live grains (or anything else "live") online was a new experience.  I only hoped they would grow and produce a fine product; some of the reviews made me wonder.  Now that I've been using them for several weeks I am so pleased.  Since our milk kefir grew prodigiously I expected the same from the water grains.  When they didn't, I contacted the seller who personally answered questions, gave very detailed instructions, wanted feedback, and was very helpful.  For instance, the water kefir wants warmth -- a heating pad on the lowest setting works perfectly -- do not let the water get cold and I had done that. The process may take several days, longer than I thought -- using the taste test(often 5-6 days for our liking)works every time!  At this point I am able to keep two jars going; patience has been rewarded. Adding fruit, as apricots or strawberries, during or after gives a delicate and delicious flavor. The grains thrive and multiply, giving us a healthy and tasty beverage that also makes great smoothies.  Our thanks!  Kudos to the seller for excellent service and delivering a fine product.

I didnt realize the return date had just expired otherwise I would be returning these which I dont normally do. I was expecting these grains to make fizzy water and all I am getting is vinegarish water.

Very happy with my water kefir grains. Soon as I made my first batch they started growing and multiplying.
Obviously healthy grains.

I was originally unhappy with my order as it appeared dead but after a complain they got back to me and sent a replacement. They gave me no trouble and the culture grew well since for several months and I am well pleased. And in there defense Pennsylvania had a earthquake and very strange weather the first go around.

The first batch was a little disappointing, but as the batches progress, they keep getting better. The grains are now large and healthy (4 batches) and the kefir water is greatly improved.

I want to note that that while there are no guidelines on the box as to how much of this natural probiotic to drink, you are not limited to amount per day. Also, note that the kefir water, if placed in the refrigerator, will keep for up to 2 weeks. I use a small jar (about 1/2 gallon) at a time. I use organic sugars--palm sugar, coconut sugar, etc. Experiment, because all of the different sugars will give you different flavors. One idea (that I haven't done yet, but will) is to add dried fruit for flavor.

There are some sites online that will help you with the process.

Handle the kefir grains with care. They are living organisms, and will replicate and grow if you take good care of them.

Keep the kefir water in a cool place while it "grows", preferably in the dark or under a towel.

This is good for you--and the flavor grows on you :)
My grains came in a zip lock bag, a very small amount and is of very poor quality. I will have to start over, as the grains I received have not grown at all, despite careful care. Very Disappointed!

After the intial rehydration period is over. You can make a  tasty, healthy, probiotic rich drink for your family. It is really tasty with sliced fresh ginger and sliced organic lemon added to the finished product. You can flavor your drink with fresh fruit, dried fruit or even juice just to name a few Once you buy the grains as long as you keep them feed, they will live indefinately.

I purchased my grains from Baine King of Lifetime Kefir just about a month ago and they arrived in excellent condition. I have used the grains a few times now and they have grown enough for me to share them with my son, who wanted to try them too.

I enjoy the water and am trying some fruit recipes to make summer drinks. Fun way to make a healthy drink!

I've had these water kefir grains for several months now and they perform beautifully.  I've given up drinking conventional soda/pop because it's so horrible for my health.  It's cool to be able to come up with my own flavors ... and even better to know that it's so healthy for me.  These grains are great and the seller is always there if you have questions.  I'd order more kefir grains from him in a heartbeat!

One star because you can not indicate no stars, which would be my rating.

I ordered this product because I trust "Cultures for Health" products. When I received the package it was not in the Cultures for Health package but rather in a plain bubble envelop in zip lock bag. I contacted the vendor to ask what was going on. The vendor responds: "You have ordered and received kefir grains from Fermentation Cultures, we have no association with Cultures for Health."

So I say, "If you have no association why does the the product description say: Water Kefir Grains by Cultures for Health LLC."

He responds, "That is how amazon works, if I have to sell things similar to those that are already on amazon, they will place it this way."

What? Fermentation Cultures???

I wrote to Cultures for Health and they were aware of this fraudulent use of their name and had contacted Amazon with no results.

I have ordered many products from Amazon and this has never been the case. This drastically reduces my trust in Amazon. I asked Amazon to please explain what the seller means by "that is how Amazon works," wanting to know if what he stated is true in any way.

Amazon wrote: "I'm sorry this has been a disappointing order experience for you; this doesn't normally happen." What is it that doesn't normally happen? I never received a satisfactory explanation regarding this false advertising.

Amazon did provide a refund but that is not my concern. I ordered frequently from Amazon and until this occurrence I was under the impression that sellers were offering products as advertised. I wanted to know if this is a routine practice of Amazon. And if not, why wouldn't Amazon have the faulty association removed from the product description? No answers. The seller's page is still up and the product description still proclaims it's by "Cultures for Heath."

I have not purchased anything from Amazon for six months. I have found other sources for many routine items; this equates to many hundreds of dollars. I may consider a purchase here and there but Amazon failed big here.

You can find the authentic product by doing a simple search; they do not sell on Amazon.

We've been pretty satisfied with these overall. They produce a nice stinky drink that does its job. My husband thinks the water should be more carbonated, but I'm not sure if that's us doing it incorrectly, the grains themselves, or him being too picky.

Make sure you have lots of glass bottles. We look like crazy people now with all the bottles we have around the house.

There was a problem with shipping and they sent me more kefir grains to avoid the delay that was caused by the shipper. They were more than helpful and responded promptly to my email. The grains are working great, as it says in the instructions they take about a week to start working but now they are multiplying and happy. Thanks so much for you help and great product!

I am so happy with my kefir grains.  I received them quickly and they had instructions on rehydrating them.  They are very easy to work with.  Now we are having the fun of experimenting with different flavors to find out what our favorites are.  I definitely recommend them. :0)

I have bought from Cultures for Healthy (directly from the site) several starter cultures; buttermilk, water Kefir, Filmjölk, greek yoghurt, and kombucha. All the cultures came in sealed pouches in dry form. They need to be hydrated first before doing the first batch of the medium. I didn't activate as soon as I got them; got to do it last Friday. The kombucha "mushroom" is triving; I can see it getting thick and as they say in the enclosed instructions it make take up to 28 days for the culture start to create another "mushroom". The buttermilk starter took 48 hours to culture one cup of organic milk (it is delicious), the Filmjölk also cultured in 48 hours (it lookd a little disgusting and I though that I had made a mistake, but I took a tablespoon of the stuff to culture a cup o milk and it did look a little like spoilled milk with a "cheesy" smell, but after mixing it and tasting it, it tasted fine, a little sour but not tangy new taste for me, but I ate it with some diced mango; delicious). The water kefir is still going, and I am waiting. The Greek yoghurt starter I didn't use it yet. Overall, the packaging is fine, the product is good, time is needed to let these starters come to live; now, I decided to warm the milk to "lukewarm" before adding the cultures because I though the milk from the fridge was too cold. Overall, I am satisfied with the products from  Cultures for Health.

This is WONDERFUL!!!!!  My kefir grains are thriving and my family has homegrown probiotics instead of having to rely on supermarkets products (Yogurt etc.) that have too much sugar.  I can feel the difference and know that they are working and our illnesses in our home have been reduced since adding these and mega vitamins to our regimen.  I would recommend everyone take these.  They have milk kefir grains and MANY others.  Cultures of Health has a wonderful product line to choose from as well.

Fermented kefir beverage is good for my health maintenance. By following the instructions given by the Seller + with right  care,the water kefir grains will be reusable for an indefinite time. Hence, makes it an  affordable and cheap probiotic health beverage. I have been drinking daily since past three weeks after have received the grains that I bought from Cultures for Health via Amazon.com.  Services rendered by Amazon and Cultures for Health are fast and excellent.
What arrived is not a true cultures for health product. I would not feel safe using as I don't know the home where these are produced.

I was hesitant to buy these grains after reading some of the reviews, but the lower price convinced me to give them a try.  They were great!  The water kefir had a great taste and multiplied like crazy.  The grains were in a tiny glass jar with a lid-- no baggies with my order-- and there was also an instruction sheet included with my shipment to get me started.

I can't believe how great service I got, I just placed my order this morning and I have the product in my hands right now!!! My order was delivered personally by the seller(he left like 10 minutes ago), I am fortunate to live close to them. The grains look great they were delivered in a glass container with some liquid, the guy said that they were not going to need any recovery time and that I was to start making kefir immediately, and he even showed me how to care for them! OMG I'm so happy!!!
I will for sure recommend this seller to my friends in church and school!!

Thank you Dave from the Kefir Store!!

I have purchased many cultures from Cultures for Health over the years, and I have never been disappointed. They are always 100% healthy and pure when they arrive. I also love the clear instructions that come with each culture. I have purchased Sourdough Starter, Water Kefir Grains, Milk Kefir Grains, and a Viili Yogurt Culture just to name a few.

Cultures for Health also has an extremely easy to use website full of tutorials and information that really walks you through step by step and helps troubleshoot any problems you may have.

You honestly couldn't ask for a better company or product.

Highly Recommended!
I was so lucky to find these on Amazon! I am on my second batch on kefir water, and my family is hooked!

I couldn't find whole wheat pastry flour in my local store. Bummer, because I had just gotten a new baking book where most of the recipes called for this kind of flour...!
