he also likes to eat grass. i switched around to various dog foods looking for the answer. after buying blue buffalo life protection he has only thrown up once in a month. he has also quit eating grass. i didn't have to blend blue buffalo with how old dog food. i just poured it in his bowl and he loved it. this is a PICKY dog as well. some dog foods he just wouldn't eat. i know that blue buffalo has superior ingredients to most grocery stores food. this has made a BIG difference in the way he looks and act as well. not having to clean up dog throw up a few times a week is worth the extra cost between cheap dog food and great dog food. the dogs that died from poisons in their food were from cheap, artificial ingredients. i love my dog so much i would do anything and spend anything to keep him around longer. wouldn't you?

This hands down is the BEST dog food I have ever purchased in the almost 50 years I have had dogs. My chubby Rat Terrier has easily lost weight on BLUE and is maintaining now. My dogs' coats are healthy. My dogs are active and healthy at 11 and 7 years old! Thank you BLUE!! And thank you Amazon for the free shipping. I can't lift more than 8 pounds, so shipping this to my home is a God Send:)

I am in Alaska and my dog's food was no where to be found.
I was able to get it from Amazon with free shipping. TO ALASKA!!
It arrived in a very timely manner and even the postal clerk was shocked that I could buy dog food like this with FREE shipping.
I am VERY pleased.
My dog LOVES blue Buffalo and I did not want to change her food so I am VERY pleased that I was able to get it.
I give you a five star plus!!!!!

Our pug has flourished on this food.  He suffered from a bit of acne on his muzzle, and after eating BLUE, it's cleared up.  He's lost a few pounds and is now at his ideal weight.  He loves the food and we can see the benefits of this product.  We highly recommend it!

We have used this dog food for quite some time and think the nutritional value is worth the price. I am very disappopinted however that I am finding that
the 15 lb bag has not been available. The smaller one is too small and the larger one would get stale before my terrier could consume it all. Have been forced to go to the local pet store and they didn't have the 15 lb either. Got stuck with the smaller bag and paid as much for it as I have paid for the 15 lb with Amazon

My dog loves this food.  As soon as I feed him he scarfs it down.  He would sniff his old food and eventually get around to eating it, not w/ this food.  He absolutely love it.  I will definitely be buying this again.

Blue Buffalo Weight Control Formula Dry Dog Food, 15-Pound Bag

The 5 stars are from my two fat Hot Dogs. They just love the little nuggets.

As for whether or not it shall help slim them down, it's too early to tell but I sure hope so.

I love and my dogs love blue buffalo...but this particular bag was mostly life source bits. (compared to the last bag I bought.  Lets put it this way...poured 1 cup and only 10 pieces of meat bits and the rest life source bits.  Can't possibly be healthy and has made me a little gun shy of ordering this particular version of dog food.

I first purchased this product for my cats at Whole Foods. They went nuts over it. It was fun to watch them sit and eat it! They went a bit goofy too. My mistake of leaving the lid off 24/7 - as it lost it's oompf! But they still ate it! My cats recommend it!

The product image you see is an image of the 5 (FIVE) pound gummy bear. Not of the .5 (POINT FIVE) one.

Also, in the description it says ".5 pound gummy bear". That's just deceptive. They know everyone's going to be looking for the 5 pound one, and thinking this is it, since that's a picture of the larger bear.

Deceptive. Wrong. Uncool.

Do not buy. (I've bought the 5 pound one. I easily recognize its dimensions. You're welcome.)
I love this buffalo wing sauce. It is the best blend of flavor and spice. I've used it for wings and shrimp, both come out great.
Being in the Middle East(definitely not the South), it is wonderful to have a taste of home. As always your product is spot on in the flavor department, no need to add anything, just heat and eat.

The Margaret Homes Seasoned Field Peas and Snaps are very tasty and different from any "ordinary" canned beans. The snaps add interesting flavor. The "field peas" I'm familiar with more closely resemble "black-eyed peas", but these smaller, firmer peas are more flavorful.

Margaret Holmes products are "Southern" canned vegetables. My very Southern grandmother (God bless her) could not cook any vegetables without a thick slab of fat-back (very fatty bacon), which she called "seasoning". I must admit, her vegies were very tasty, if unhealthy. I have found that generous use of good olive oil Colavita Extra Virgin Olive Oil - 17oz. bottle and a tablespoon of Hormel Bacon Bits (actually ham chips) Hormel Premium Real Crumbled Bacon can duplicate Grandma's "seasoning". These go very well with Margaret Holmes' products.

I use the Field Peas and Snaps to make a great, almost instant, soup or stew. Ingredients: 1 15oz can Seasoned Field Peas and Snaps: 1 1/2 cup water; 1/4 cup olive oil; 1/2 cup wild rice blend Lundberg Wild Blend, Gourmet Blend of Wild and Whole Grain Brown Rice, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6); 1/4 cup of Hormel Bacon Bits. Mix ingredients and bring to a boil for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Try it, it is truly a fantastic hearty satisfying soup---especially on those days when you are out of fresh ingredients. Makes 2 large servings. The peas are already spicy, so do NOT add pepper unless you are VERY sure you want more pepper. The peas are also very salty---if making soup, you may wish to drain the beans rather than use the salty "juice". If you use the juice AND add chipped ham---I guaranttee that the soup will be much too salty.

You can use the same recipe with pork hocks instead of ham chips, for a VERY economical, VERY tasty dinner. Boil the pork hocks (1 per person) by themselves for 2 hours (in addition I usually roast them until they begin to brown), then add the other ingredients and boil on low for 30 minites to 1 hour.

For my reviews of the Lunberg Wild Rice, Hormel Bacon Bits, or Colovita Olive Oil, click on "See all my reviews" at the beginning of this review.
I use this all the time, its just great texture and fine so there are no pieces that are not dissolved in food...Natural is always good.

I have had this salt before, I needed minerals desperately and it worked like a charm. When I tried buying it via my local health food store they recommended another product and I bought it. Two weeks later I had had it! I was missing my pink salt, the other products is in my cupboard still, sometimes I use it for cooking, but the pink salt travels with me wherever I go. I actually have some in my car, for those extra hot days

I purchased a 25.5 oz. jar of this organic pasta sauce at my local whole foods market.
.
It contains organic ingredients. Each 1/2 cup serving is 50 cal., 280 mg sodium, 1 g fat, 10 g carbs, 1 g fiber, 6 g sugar, & 2 g protein.

It has a garlic punch that is very pleasant, but it is low on real flavor.

It contains chunks of tomatos and bits of garlic. This is not a thick sauce.

It taste much like diet sauces, and it is made from mostly tomato puree (water & tomato psaste). And that's what it tastes like--water & paste.

I give this sauce 1/5 for flavor, 2/5 for texture/thickness, 5/5 for organic integrity, & 5/5 for packaging.

This sauce will require you to doctor it up to make it palatable.
My Daughter gets motion sick almost everywhere we go.  The Queasy Pops have really helped her feel better when she has "that feeling" coming on.  I just purchased 4 more boxes!

I'm thrilled with this extract. I ordered it on a Tuesday night and had it by Friday afternoon. It came wrapped nicely in plenty of bubble wrap and tissue paper and was accompanied by a nice little note from the seller thanking me for my order.

It smells wonderful. It smells just like cocoa powder, and I use it in all my baked goods and even savory foods. Added to gravy it gives it that little something extra, and it's phenomenal in whipped cream, cookies, brownies, sweetbreads, cakes, even coffee and hot chocolate. It's not a sweet extract so it gives some depth to foods without adding additiona sugar. I will definitely be ordering this in the future and definitely ordering from this merchant again. I am very impressed with the quality and the customer service provided!

I love chocolate extract, and I'm so happy to have found a source that is cheaper than the outlets I normally buy from.  One warning:  Chocolate Extract only boosts the chocolate notes of products already containing some kind of chocolate or cocoa powder. Used in non chocolate baking, it brings a boost of flavor that may make someone ask "what is that I'm tasting?".  They may recognize chocolate, but you don't have to tell them what it is!
This is a good product, but I didn't taste the chocolate. I use it with plain yogurt and Equal. Still, it has a flavor that's tasty.

I have been looking for a way to make carob powder taste more "chocolaty" and this is it. I made a delicious fudge using 1 tablespoon of Star Kay White Chocolate Extract and I couldn't tell it from real chocolate. Delicious fudge but with no caffeine!
Try putting a teaspoon of the Chocolate Extract in your coffee carafe prior to brewing your coffee.  It adds a nice mocha taste.

I use this for making chocolate stout homebrew, and it's the way to go. Cocoa powder mostly adds bitterness, and chocolate malt isn't all that chocolatey. If you really want to make a beer with chocolate flavor, this is your product.

I got this because I got a new cookbook for cupcakes. I love it... The flavor is so perfect for red velet cake or brownies I have also used it with a few drops in store bought whip topping is great on pudding for a low fat snack! Highly recommend!
I used this product and made the easiest recipe for chocolate liquor.  In a blind taste test the product produced a taste equal to the name brand.  The color is lighter but the taste is the same.

This product is wonderful.  The flavoring it offers is genuine and amazing.  I've used it initially in my cupcakes and everyone loves the flavor!  Thanks!  I would definitely order this product again, I don't plan to be without it in the cupboard!  Makes me want to bake more and more cupcakes to share!
I love this extract.  Good flavor, not too overpowering.  I use it in proten shakes that need a little extra 'something.'  Will buy it again.

This product arrived very promptly and appropriately packaged. We used it to make a chocolate
liquer. It worked splendidly! We couldn't have asked for more.

If this product is what you've been looking for well you found it. Great for anything were adding choc. flavoring will work, including a dark beer, wink! Yes I said beer, but coffee/chili/bbq will work to or how about cake. Good quality and flavor, and worth the money. Order it you'll see (:

These are the favorite of mine that Bush's makes. I sometimes have trouble getting these at the store. Because they are grabbed up by people right away. So, I guess others like them as well as I do. They have a little more liquid in them than the B&M beans do, but they are still good.

I am very pleased with this pasta. It has good taste and texture, and does particularly well in pasta salads and stir-frys.

One caution: the package says to cook for 8 minutes. I find that these gemelli are perfectly al dente after 5 minutes.

My puppy loves these treats! She's allergic to wheat and gluten so it's hard to find treats for her (and ones that she likes). She has naturally dry skin and these definitely help! The omega 3 & 6 fatty acids provide what she needs to keep her coat healthy and shiny. It's great-- they don't contain any wheat, soybean, glutens, bad preservatives, or by-products. Not to mention that the salmon and sweet potatoes in it are known to be easily digestible. She gets so excited when I bring out the bag. Worth the money! Highly recommended!

I am downgrading from a 5 star to a 1 star because they are made in CHINA. Treats from China have been associated with kidney and liver failure and rare cancers in dogs. Another series of dog deaths from treats from China has been released. There is no oversight. These treats may be OK but I will not take any chances. I am really irritated with Amazon and the vendor for not disclosing the source of the product. They say in the online description, "read the label carefully". In very small print the country of origin is disclosed. I do not knowingly feed my dogs anything from China.

These are great treat. My dogs love them and they are no artificial stabilizers or fillers. However, at most other on line pet websites they are half the price. Usually Amazon is competitive in pricing but not on this line of products.

The product itself is great, thus my 5 stars. My dogs love these and I think it's helping their dry skin, but ... WOW @ the price! I had no idea the 6-oz. size is the same package I buy at PetsMart for $4.99 - HALF the cost I paid here - and for 3 bags at that! :((((( I had run out, so I didn't have a package to check the size. I thought I'd add these to my Amazon order for convenience, and *assumed* the 6-oz. bag must be considerably larger than the ones I get at PetsMart, given that the price was TWICE - very odd for Amazon, so I never suspected the packages are the same size! People - definitely get these from PetsMart, or check PetsMart or Petco online even - this is WAY OVERPRICED! If I could have rated the price itself, it would have gotten ZERO STARS ~

My dog (14 year old toy poodle) hates just about every food for dogs.  This is the only treat I've ever found that she never refuses!  The treats are a bit pricey but, for once, they won't go to waste. I do limit the number she eats in a day, as specified on the bag.

My dogs absolutely love these treats - we get them in salmon, duck and chicken. There is nothing they won't do to get one! If they are ignoring me outside, all I have to do is shake the bag and they come running...licking their chops on the way!

More importantly, the omega is great for their skin and coat - one of my dogs has issues with dry skin/flaking. As long as I give these to her on a regular basis - her skin is flake free and her coat is absolutely beautiful!

It's a win win - my dogs love them and they are good for them! What more can you ask for from a treat?

These two-millimeter long treats don't have the pronounced smell of the tuna treats. Like the other Omega treats these are easy to break in half, but are small enough for many dogs to eat in one piece. The shih tzu pair, with their dainty snouts, prefer to have their duck treats torn or cut in two. Since the first ingredient in these Duck treats is duck liver, the girls are becoming treat snobs and act as if they are actually dining on Foie gras. I don't have the heart to tell them anything different.
Often the Omega Duck treats are mixed in with several other snacks on the breakfast plates. Always the duck treats are the first to disappear. It's funny to watch Piper push aside the other treats so that she can pick out the pieces of Omega treats. I have some reservations about the treat's country of origin, but the girls love these things and their lip smacking comments have all been positive.

First of all, they stink. Imagine fish lying around in the sun for a couple of hours. Yeah, they're that smelly.

But that, as it turns out, is why my dogs love them so much. These treats are so special, in fact, that they're only given out when we want to get our girls into their crates, like at bedtime, or if we're going out or something. They even know the bag...all I have to do it get it out of the cabinet and they're running off into their crates, waiting happily for their treats.

I had read the review from the person who wrote that a fishbone had been found in one. What I do is bend/break them down the middle before handing them out so I can feel if there's something sharp inside.

So the bottom line here is...if my dogs love them, then I love them. :)
Not only is this treat good for my dog, but it is great for her coat!  She loves them.  She normally does not do tricks, but will sit, give her paw and do anything you say for those treats.
our siberian husky loves these!!! they are a special nighttime treat and she goes crazy when you say it's time for your salmon!!
I have some incredibly picky dogs and they love these treats.  The pieces are nice and small.  I reccommend this to even the most finicky of dogs.  My dogs have had no digestive issues with them.

These treats come in Salmon and Duck....my dogs LOVE both. They go crazy when they even see the bag.... Perfect size for a training treat. These treats stay moist...I have the Bear Treats also, they are good too, but more of a dried salmon "meal" consistency.

I bought these at a local store. I broke up the first one for smaller training treats. My finger was stabbed by a needle shaped fish bone. This bone could have easily perforated my dogs digestive tract and made him very ill or dead. I have contacted the manufacturer and have yet to receive a response.

I opened a bag of this treat a week ago. It was a part of the Christmas present I gave to my 5-month old miniature schnauzer. My pet is crazy over this treat! I would have given this product five stars because my puppy loves it and it's highly nutritious (as claimed by the manufacturer). But I reduced my scoring to two-stars because it makes my puppy pass obnoxious-smelling gas. It doesn't bother him but it does me! When I reviewed the list of ingredients, I found a possible culprit: sweet potato. This is a root crop known to cause flatulence.

I would have given this product five stars because my puppy loves it and it's highly nutritious (as claimed by the manufacturer). But I reduced my scoring to two-stars because it makes my puppy pass obnoxious-smelling gas. It doesn't bother him but it does me! I would have given this product five stars because my puppy loves it and it's highly nutritious (as claimed by the manufacturer).  But I reduced my scoring to two-stars because it makes my puppy pass obnoxious-smelling gas.  It doesn't bother him but it does me!  When I reviewed the list of ingredients, I found a possible culprit: sweet potato. This is a root crop known to cause flatulence.

this is a fantastic tasting snack and i had no problem with the seller whatsoever. i first saw this snack in target years ago and started buying alot, finished them all, and never went back to buy more. by the time i did, target stopped selling them and so, i searched for these crackers again and found them here online and at foodtown. this is the perfect snack for people allergic to gluten as i am and a healthy cracker

These crackers are so good! I love their cheddar flavor. They have a nice crunch, and best of all
they are gluten free!
My family loved these crackers.  Gluten free crackers are pretty expensive and we eat a lot of them.  So, having some of our groceries delivered by Amazon is certainly nice!

These crackers are hard to find in stores, at least where I live. They are salty, but taste very good. They are small, so they would not work too well as a canape base. They would be good for dips, though.

Irish cream teas tend to make me sad. What I've found is that they tend to taste like regular tea with a hint of Irish cream in the background, like you had poured a drop or two into your tea. Which is all well and good, but I drank Irish cream straight up when I was in college, and I want something that tastes like the drink itself. At this point, you're probably wondering if I did anything but drink in college. The answer is....no, not really. Ha! I want an Irish cream tea that I can splash into other teas to make them taste like Irish cream.

So I cheated a little with this one. Just a little, I promise! I mixed my spoon of matcha with a few drops of my Irish cream agave before adding the water. I was blown away. It was so, so, so good. It got me through an incredibly long day at work and it kept a smile on my face long after it was gone. It smelled and tasted so strongly of Irish cream that my boss side eyed me a few times until I showed him it was just matcha. And then he was jealous.

I love this tea. With the milk allergy issues, Irish cream was one of the things I had to give up and it was with a heavy heart that I did so. This is one of those teas I've been searching and searching for and once again, Red Leaf Tea did it right. I am constantly impressed by them...you'd think by now, I'd just expect their matcha to be amazing. But no, every time I get a new package, I'm floored by the tastiness.

I got this one special for my boyfriend as a surprise. Last time he got to pick out a matcha, we ended up with Cola, so this time I thought an alcoholic drink matcha was in order. More sophisticated? Well - more adult anyways ;)

He is loving the flavoured matcha as much (if not more!) than I do! This one smelled sweet from the get go - creamy and .. tangy? Smoky? Not smoky! I'm trying to describe what irish cream smells like - it doesn't have the smokiness of whisky - but it definitely is sweet and creamy! I knew it was going to be a real treat - just like the real thing!

What a neat flavour experience! I prepared the matcha straight and thick for the first bowl. In this state I tasted mostly matcha with an aftertaste of sweet cream that lingered after finishing the bowl. It was very creamy and pleasant.

Next I tried it over ice with 18% cream and sugar. I thought my eyes were going to roll into the back of my head and be lost forever! This was mine and Mike's favourite way to enjoy it. It's sweet, but because you have control over the amount of sugar, it's not crazy sweet and cloying. You could probably enjoy cup after cup with the only buzz coming from the energy of all that matcha you're drinking!

This one is so so good mixed with the Madagascar Vanilla matcha - it just adds a bit of something that takes the creamy flavour over the top. Come St. Patricks day, it would be an awesome drink to mix with mint matcha (Mint is on the way in the mail as we speak!) and hey - it's already green! No need to add any food colouring for your Paddy experience ;)

Now - if a Guinness Matcha ever comes out - I know the perfect one to mix it with ;)
I love hot sauces and this is one of the best.  It has a touch of sweetness, a lot of fire, and is great on all sorts of food, from oriental to grilled meats.
these are great tasting candies, even if they were not sugar free! sure beats the typical mints, or other artificial tasting fruit flavors!
A great flavorful hard candy that provides all natural ingredients that helps curb hunger while keeping your breath fresh and your mouth moist. Just delicious as a treat.

Same great carbonation as always from kristian regale. Red raspberry color, but almost with a touch of orange, and smells very different from any other juice I've had, must be the lingonberry, and I can get just a touch of the apple, a bit of a tart smell. A bit of a musky, dusty rose scent. It's a bit more strongly carbonated on the tongue, the fizz completely evaporates. Only a hit of the apple gets through the very powerful lingonberry. As typical, it's not as sweet as most juices, but also has a slightly bitter finish, and medium acidity. It had some noticeable dregs at the end.

As for paring I'd drink it with something that you'd normally have with a fruity drink, maybe mexican food like fajitas or burritos.

Did I Like it: Not as much as Kristian Regále's Pomegranate offering, but it's still a unique drink worth trying.

As a non-drinker, I have had lots of non-alcoholic beverages.  There is something classy and smooth about this one.  Tiny bubbles seems more akin to champagne rather than large bubbles in the others that is more akin to soda pop.  The ligonberry-apple really makes it special and holiday-like.

Adds great flavor to any dish where vinegar is used. My local store does not carry it anymore. I decided to get it here because it is so much more enjoyable than the brands in my local store. The product was shipped in a way that there was no possibility of breakage.

I've been drinking this for several months, and every 5 lb. bag has been consistently great. I use it with a Capresso Coffee-TEC (drip) and a Jura-Capresso ENA4 (espresso). This coffee is a great example of how decaf doesn't require a trade-off in flavor. Highly recommended.

I am very happy with this coffee.  I used to have a very expensive Starbucks habit, combined with a heavy sugar habit.  While trying to reduce the sugar in my life, I have discovered that I don't like Starbucks without all of the added sugar to tone down the bitterness.  This decaf is much smoother and tastier to me.  I brew a strong cup, and this worked very nicely in my french press.  Even without sugar, I'm enjoying it very much.

This has become our "go to" decaf coffee.  It mixes well with regular coffees for a reduced caffeine blend and it is excellent on it's own as an accompaniment to an evening dessert.  The low acidity of the coffee helps to prevent the indigestion you can get from other coffees, especially when they accompany a rich dessert.  While this is billed as a dark roast, it's more like a medium dark roast.  While it isn't super flavorful, it is very good for a decaf.  The price of all coffee has increased recently but the price of this coffee is fairly reasonable when purchased in the 5-pound bags.

This is best decaf I had from Coffee Bean Direct.  It is very hearty for a decaf which is what both my wife and I like.  I always buy the 5 lb bag and keep the part I'm not using in the frig.  Will continue to buy.

I got some of this from a low sodium foods website. I can't believe how much flavor this has for only 170mg per oz.  I am on a strict low sodium diet and I don't like foods where they have simply left out salt (bland) or they cheat and add potassium chloride, something just as bad as salt to my diet. So I am constantly on the hunt for low sodium foods that are naturally that way. This is a perfect cure for my salty food cravings. I haven't tried the other flavors yet but I plan to.

I wanted to feed my chickens, turkeys and goats just a little extra protein to keep them fit and healthy while the goats are pregnant over the winter and the chickens and turkeys are getting ready for breeding season.  Sprouts seemed like a good idea but everytime I tried to sprout regular beans they would go bad before the sprouts were big enough to interest the poultry.  So I saw that the ones I was eating out of can were grown from mung beans.  Never heard of them before but thought I'd give it a try.  The beans took longer to get here than I would have liked (almost two weeks) but that just tells me the time frame I need before I order more.  And the beans!!!!  Oh my goodness, you'll get 100% germination and sprouts that are easily eaten and really quite yummy in just three days.  I need to get a bigger growing apparatus so that I can make more at one time.  The chickens, turkeys, goats and even my pregnant cow LOVE the sprouts.  I've found the extra source of protein I needed.  Thanks so much.
The packaging was great - flavor definately not the same as it used to be.

This was my favorite as a child. I would put one in my mouth and let it disolve.
Ghiradelli stopped making them when their packaging machine was broken when then moved from San Francisco to San Leandro (about 15 years ago). Rather than repair or rebuild it they just stopped making them. Despite years of protests from candy lovers. Now a new company is making them.
If you never had them before you may think "so what?" But if you grew up with them and miss them you will be thrilled.

Flicks used to be my favorite candy until they were discontinued by Ghiradelli way back when.  I'm so glad they're back.  They're like bigger hershey kisses, but the chocolate is better.  The cardboard tube (assuming they still come in them) also smells great after the candy is gone.  A childhood favorite!

Good. Brings back the old times from the 1970's. The only problem is that the wafers are thinner and slightly harder than what I remember. It isn't the same. But it is as close as I can get. The idea of chocolate drops with the swirl on top in a colorful foil cardboard tube still brings back some nice memories.

Reminds me of the ALEX theater back in Glendale, CA.

Very chocolate, very good, mmm
I tried the new product but its not the same as when Ghiradelli made it.  Very disappointed.  They shouldn't bring a old time product back unless they can duplicate the exact taste/recipe.

They are now made by a different company, TJerrild, located in Fresno, CA. They definitely do not taste the same as Ghiradelli. Supposedly they are made with the same ingredients, but I would say not the same recipe. A huge difference in taste form when I was a kid. Thanks for the memories Ghiradelli....

I remember when I was younger, I couldn't go to the movie theatre without buying a package of Flicks (sometimes two)! They are so rich and creamy with that wafery taste. I can still remember the flavor like it was yesterday and can't wait to get them again! Yummmmmm!!!

I just got back from a trip to England where I had the most wonderful homemade tomato soup at a tearoom in Ashburton, Devon.  I thought I would never find anything to equal this homemade soup. I bought a can of Amy's Organic Chunky Tomato Bisque and one sip of this heavenly soup and I knew I had found something just as good if not better than the homemade soup in Devon, England.  I have now been adding some fresh Basil to this awesome soup!!!.  I hope that Amy's never changes their recipe for this excellent fresh tasting soup.

Was craving grilled cheese and tomato soup and came across this at the supermarket. Delicious. I added a little salt and black pepper but otherwise this soup is awesome. Chunky tomatoes really make this soup a winner. I came to Amazon hoping to get more but at $2.88 a can, might as well get it in store. I paid $2.69.
This is as good as any restaurant, home made, or specialty shop tomato soup. You won't believe it comes from a can. It's delicious -- chunky, slightly sweet, and hearty. I highly recommend it.

This is the BEST tomato soup!!  It has small chunks of tomato in which give it such a homemade flair to it.  The taste is pure tomato and has a very smooth, velvety feel to it.  I just read all the other ideas people have shared using it.... I am ready to try some new things ;-)
This is the best canned tomato soup on the market bar none!  Best of all, it's organic!
Though the texture is hearty and thick, this soup tastes way too sweet for me. Is it really necessary to add 14g of evaporated cane juice to a soup?

My favorite winter meal has always been a grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup.  Like most folks, I grew up eating Campbells, but after trying Amy's tomato bisque, I can tell you that this is in another league!  It's delicious and is my new favorite soup, and I now keep at least a case on hand at all times when it's cold outside.

Last week, "The Hungry Girl" (from the Food Network) was on Good Morning America and claimed this was "The best soup ever! Ever! Ever!". I am not a big fan of Campbell's Tomato soup, but have enjoyed the various Progresso Tomato soups. I had to try this.

It was fantastic.

I see one of the other reviews mentioned using it as a pasta sauce. I can definitely see that.

One thing that surprised me is that the low sodium version of the soup has a couple of negative reviews about it being too sweet. But it has the same amount of sugar in it, so I wonder if the lower salt content makes the sweetness stand out more?

This is by far the only tomato soup one should ever eat - sorry campbells! I also throw a can of this into my vegetable soup - also a great base for any bisques  - throw in some corn, diced potatoe & shrimp or any shellfish  its amazing
Can't believe it came from a can.  Made me a lover of tomato soup, of this brand anyway.  Much lower in sodium than Campbells.

I ordered this soup because Campbell's Tomato Bisque price had gone up and I was able to get free shipping on Amy's.  Wow! This soup is much better than the Campbells.  The texture is thick and it is quite flavorful; it is the best tomato bisque I have experienced. I will definitely purchase Amy's again.

This seriously is the best soup I have EVER tasted (well out of a can at least). I recently moved to a small town, and none of the local grocery stores carry it. It is so amazing that I have to order it online. I just can't live without it!
I like tomato soup but Campbell's reminds me of a giant bowl of ketchup - this is much better, better ingredients, good quick go to lunch with some whole grain crackers.

This is absolutely delicious and I don't think I could make a better-tasting, more-affordable soup like this at home. I added some broken up angel hair pasta (organic, of course) to this and heated it on the stove with some chili flakes. It tastes like grown up SpaghettiO's. Divine!
Amy's Organic Chunky Tomato Bisque, 14.5-Ounces (Pack of 12)This is the best Tomato Soup I have tasted. My grandson, age 2, loves it too! The best part is that it is organic!
This soup tastes like my homemade tomato bisque, I am soooo happy to have found this! I want to eat it every single day.

I can't believe I got so excited over a soup, but I just LOVE this!  I have never been to Italy, but when I tasted this soup, I imagined I was there, being served a plate of pasta with a fresh-tasting sauce.  Condensed a bit, this would be a great sauce with noodles or meatballs.  As is, it is a delicious soup.  Try it!
It's hard to find a vegetarian tomato soup that isn't bland. This was delicious and even had little chunks of tomato in it.

This is pricey but hard-to-find these days.  It used to be possible to buy inexpensive edible gold and silver leaf (vark) in Indian groceries, but there seem to be problems nowadays with importing it.  So I was very happy to find this on Amazon.  Great for making a big impression by gilding a whole cake!  It's not hard and you don't need too many leaves.  Just carefully slide them off the paper leaves onto the cake, then smooth using a brush (a cosmetic type brush works well).  It won't be perfectly smooth, but good enough, and it'll wow whomever you're serving the cake to!  They're not likely to have seen something like this before.  Obviously this would be great for a golden wedding anniversary cake!!!

We are very pleased with the edible 23 karat gold leaf. Our holiday fruitcakes are dazzling, you can see some pictures at[...]. The items arrived on time and were very carefully packaged.Gold 2 lb Fruitcake Dark is one of our products that turned out great with the gold.
This is an awesome product.  It adds such a beautiful touch of class & elegance to my dessert presentation, I just love it.  Fast shipping & great customer service.  This is my go-to for gold leaf !

These little things are gems. They store heat from your "too hot" coffee and release it later. Really perform great in an insulated mug adding hours to my coffee's drink ability.

They are not:
-Ice cubes
-A miracle

Best used with:
-Insulated coffee mug
-With a cover

I use three in an older Thermos insulated coffee mug and my coffee stays hot for about 5 hours and still is warm enough to enjoy for a few hours after that. Before Joulies my coffee was too hot then just right and then cold after about two hours.

Main point:
The coffee stays at about 140 degrees for hours so it can be enjoyed. Expanding the window of comfortably hot drinking temperature.

I first purchased Joulies when they got their start on Kickstarter. Since I purchased them I have used them almost every day in my coffee on my way to work. I use them in a Thermos vacuum mug (in my opinion the best way to use them).

Before I had Joulies, I would pour my hot coffee into my mug before I left and have to wait for about half an hour to actually drink my coffee. This is because the mug does such a good job of retaining the heat in the coffee.

When I use Joulies, my coffee is ready to drink in about 5 minutes. The excess heat gets absorbed by the Joulies as the material inside changes phase from solid to liquid. This heat is then released back into the coffee as the material goes from liquid to solid, so the coffee stays hot for a lot longer (this doesn't benefit me very much, because I drink my coffee pretty fast).

I have tried using them in a regular coffee mug, and while it got cooler a little faster, it didn't stay hot for very long because so much heat is lost to the environment. I wouldn't recommend using them this way unless you really need your coffee one minute faster.

So far they have been really durable, I've dropped them a few times and shake them in my mug to circulate the coffee. They have gotten a little scratched, but it is no different from well used silverware.

I have purchased a couple sets as gifts for the coffee lovers I know, and they have been well received. Perfect thing to get for someone who has everything and can appreciate the nice bit of thermodynamics that Joulies demonstrate.

Love this product! If I am completely honest, the first couple times I used them I wasn't sure if they worked the way I expected. Then I noticed such a big difference when I didn't use them that I became a believer and now use them every time I drink coffee.

Depending on the type of cup you use, you get different results. The one thing that stays consistent is that the coffee becomes drinkable (hot, but not scalding) within a couple of minutes. I use cream in my coffee, so in a coffee cup I will usually use 2 joulies and with my travel mug I use 3 joulies. The general rule I have come up with is it increases drinking time to about 2 or 2 1/2 times the original time. For example, in my open, no cover coffee cup, my coffee stays hot about 20-30 minutes and in my poorly insulated travel mug with cover, my coffee stays hot about an hour and a half rather than 30-45 minutes. I just recently bought an insulated mug and am very excited to use the joulies with it, because I know I am going to have perfect temperature coffee for hours (much longer than my coffee usually lasts).

This is a product I would recommend to any coffee drinker, as long as they know the type of cup you use does make a difference in the results you are going to get! If you follow the guidelines provided with the product (pre-heating, using an insulated mug with cover, and experimenting with the number of joulies) you will find the combination that works for you.

I have fallen in love with Coffee Joulies. I backed them when they were on Kickstarter and waited months for them to arrive. But since they came I have used them every day. They really do work at cooling your hot beverage down and keeping it at that optimal drinking temperature for longer. However your experience can vary wildly if you do not use them correctly. There is no golden rule as how to use them, you just have to figure that out for your own tastes and your drinking mug.

Here are a couple of key things that you need to think about in the order of most importance:
*How much beverage you have
*How well your beverage container insulates
*How hot your drink is at the start
*How hot you like your drink
*How long before you drink it

Let me explain a little bit. The more drink you have to cool, the more joulies you want to use. The better you container is at insulating, the better the effects of the joulies are. The hotter your drink is at the start, the more joulies you need to cool it down and the longer it will stay warm. If you like your drink cooler, use more joulies. If you like your drink still pretty hot, use less joulies or you can preheat your jouies with hot water before putting them in your beverage. If you are drinking really soon, make sure to use more joulies.

The size of the joulies has been a complaint I have heard before. But really the amount of space they take up is very surprisingly negligible. If it bothers you, buy a bigger mug or drink less. I have heard people say that they do not work that well, if this is a problem for you get a better insulating mug. When I use these in a standard coffee mug it is usually hard to tell that there is any effect from the joulies. Also try stirring your beverage with the joulies in the mug, this help the joulies absorb heat better and release heat better when they need to. Some people worry that they will fall and hit your mouth when you try to drink the last bit of liquid. Don't be worried this does not happen, I thought it would at first too.

Here is my method for making tea with joulies and it has really worked well for me. I have a Contigo 16oz mug for tea. It is great at keeping tea hot (5hrs+) but it takes forever to be able to drink it (1hr). With the coffee joulies I add 3 in, at room temperature before brewing my tea. I add my tea and hot water into the same mug and brew for 3 minutes with the lid on. Take out the tea, add some sugar and milk, and close the lid. I give the mug a few shakes to stir things up. Now in just about 5 minutes after the tea is brewed I can sip it (it used to take an hour for this). I can drink it comfortably in just about 15-20 minutes and it will stay hot at the perfect temperature for about 3 hours. I rinse my joulies between drinks and wash them every week or so.

I love this product and would gladly buy it again. The price is a bit high, but they really will last you a long time with good care. They make great gifts and are really a conversation starter.

Just started using my Joulies and could not be more impressed!!!  I went to Dunkin Donuts, put 4 Joulies in my insulated mug and bought a medium with cream.  In 2 minutes the coffee was perfect temperature and good to the last drop!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This was my first kickstarter contribution, and now I'm skeptical of ever doing another! These coffee joulies simply don't work, and they take up all the room in a cup.

NOTE: This product probably works best if you are going to put them in a thermos, but it doesn't work that well if just placed in a coffee cup.

I purchased these back when it was a kickstarter campaign.

I'm the type of person who likes a hot cup of coffee and I tend to sip slowly so I find myself going to the microwave to heat up my cup all the time. I thought this would be the perfect solution.

I did follow instructions to warm them up first. I would pour boiling water over them for 4 minutes while my press-pot coffee brewed. I would then pour out the water from the cup and pour my coffee onto the now-hot Joulies.

For me, there was absolutely no noticeable difference in how fast my coffee got cold - so I'd have to go through the extra step of pouring the coffee into a different cup so I could microwave it as the Joulies can't be microwaved. What a Pain.

I tried them every day for a week to make sure I wasn't doing something wrong and then put them in a drawer someplace where unused kitchen gadgets go to die.

I tried them in a thermos a few times and they seems to work ok (thus the 2 stars) but I don't really use a thermos all that often. So, for my purposes (keeping a cup of coffee hot) they did absolutely nothing.

My husband was really excited about these things. He read about them in a magazine over a year ago before they were available for purchase, and decided to buy them for me as a gift (now that they're available), to replace the two ice cubes I dump in my coffee every morning to make it "chuggable". Um, I'm not impressed. My coffee remained too hot to drink initially (just as it would be WITHOUT them in it), and was cold within one hour (again, JUST like it would be WITHOUT them in it). In fact, the only thing different about my coffee with these little Joulies in it is there was a LOT less room in my cup for actual coffee because they're quite large and you need several in your cup. Maybe they're more geared for those who enjoy their coffee in travel mugs? And because I cannot speak to this I thought one star would be inappropriate.

I will of course lie and tell my husband they're miraculous and wonderful. But secretly I wish he'd saved the $50 because my ice cubes have been working just fine for years and are what I'll continue to use when he's not around.

**Update**
I just realized these things cost him $60 and decided to return them!

I had such high hopes for this product, but alas no matter how I tried I could not get this product to keep my coffee hot. If I can't return them, at least they look nice and I can use for decoration.

I brought this for my husband and he said that it did not work at all and he tried it both of the ways that it said to now trying to return it and find that it is not that easy to return things will remember that when I think about ordering on here again

Haci Bekir is THE company that makes the best Turkish Delight.  I went to the store when I visited Istanbul a couple of years back and have been yearning for this treats ever since.  I tried the other brands, but they're just not the same.  It's a rarity to find this brand in the US (store or online), but I found it on Amazon!  Eating this pistachio turkish delight treats brings back memories of the best candies I've had in my life.  Thank you!

Got this as a gift for my dad's birthday because he likes pistachios. He liked it... and mom did too! Now I'm planning to get him two boxes for Father's Day so he can enjoy a whole box even if mom *is* 'helping'.

We'd never had Turkish Delight before, and this seemed like a good one to try, based on the earlier review. These are chewy but not sticky, sweet but not overly so, and have a nice overall flavor. I'd recommend this as a gift again! Dad really liked it, and it was something he'd never tried.
These were easily the best Turkish Delight that I have ever had. You must try them!! I have tried many others and these have big pieces of nuts and aren't too sweet.

My local Walmart and Target both have this, ground or whole bean, at a regular price of less than $9 per 12 oz. bag. It's WAY overpriced here.

It is an excellent coffee - I'm drinking it as I write this: an interesting hint of woody, creamy, citrusy taste that's dark but without the burnt aftertaste that comes with many dark roasts.

Excellent pasta. Great flavor and texture. Rough surface holds the sauce. Perfect texture somewhere between North Italian fresh pasta and the "al dente" hard Semolina quality of South Italy. But where's the Rigatoni and the Penne. And the Pennoni. This is crime against civilization that Amazon has run out. I would buy the 20 pack case. Please bring it back. Subito!
All you need is the meatballs and you have the best meal going.  Can't beat "Lensi" pasta!  True meaning of "Al dante" pasta:)
Delicious! It's like a Nutty Bar, but with less guilt. And not too sweet! I was worried the peanuts butter would taste fake, but it was great.

This bar taste's great, and is much lower in calories, carbs, etc., than an actual candy bar. I would definitely buy these again. They are healthier and better for you, along with satisfying your hunger for something sweet or chocolaty.
If you love peanutbutter and chocolate, you will love these bars! They are like Nutty Bars, but without all the calories!

Skinny cow does it again, with a yummy wafer cookie with peanut butter and covered in chocolate.  Does it taste low cal?  Heck no, and does it fit the bill when you want a sweet treat that is nicely portioned and you can let go of the guilt and calories of a regular candy bar?  Yep, this one does it for me.  I've purchased them and have put them in my husband's gym bag and my purse when we are out on the road and just need a little something.  This one has it all, great taste, good proportion and a not so guilty treat.  Overall, love it!~

The oil itself is excellent and the lemon flavor is just right--stronger than the stuff that you might get in a local grocer's, at least here in Texas--but it doesn't have a processed, chemical taste.

I find that using it as the only oil in a vinaigrette is too strong, and so you needn't go to the expense, but if it comprises a fourth to a half of the oil, and if the other oil is good, the balance is quite nice. In fact, if the acid in the vinaigrette is a good sherry vinegar, the flavor of the lemon in the oil is more noticeable than the vinegar.

Agrumato oil pressed with lemons is superb on salads and in cooking. The lemon flavor is not overwhelming but adds a freshness that is surprising. You can use it in most recipes that call for EVOO. Try it in untraditional ways and you'll find you love it.
This olive oil is sublime. The lemon flavor and scent is not too over-powering. I'm looking forward to finding all kinds of reasons to use it!

This is by far the best olive oil infused with pressed lemons that I have ever tried. For a really spectacular salad dressing that is sure to win rave reviews mix together Agrumento Extra Virgin Olive Oil with Pressed Lemons and "Marukan" brand seasoned gourmet Rice Vinegar Lite in approximate equal amounts (or a little more of the rice vinegar depending on taste). If desired add a little salt and pepper and wisk all together until blended. This is so easy, but so delicious! Enjoy!

This is tasty satisfying all natural honey candy. While that is fine in and of itself, if you have interstitial cystitis and are avoiding citric acid this is the only candy that I have found so far without citric acid or corn syrup which I am also avoiding.

For anyone who likes the flavor of honey, and eats honey on certain foods, you are gonna love this.  I bought some while on my honeymoon at Red River, NM.  I'm usually really leery about trying new foods but this I had to try it.  The minute I tasted it, I thought I was actually eating honey. The flavor lasted until the piece was completely gone.  Makes a sore throat feel a bit better.
I love these little candies! They are great for a sore throat or a sweets craving. I got my first bag at Whole Foods, but I would definitely order them in bulk next time! :)
CAN NO LONGER FIND PRODUCT LOCALLY, FOUND ON LINE, REASONABLE PRICE AND QUICK SHIPMENT. WILL BUY AGAIN.

My dogs are digging this flavor as they do all of Merrick's dry dog food products.

Fast shipping from this seller made the purchase even better!

Thank you!

I used AvoDerm products when my Basenji, Emmy, was alive.  She thrived on the dog food and dog bone treats.  Her coat was shiny and soft while eating both the can and dry food.  She passed away of old age.  My daughter has a Boxer with digestive issues.  After introducing Rocky, the Boxer, to AvoDerm his problems disappeared.  Buying the food online is a cost savings compared to Petco and PetsMart high prices.  Thank you, Amazon!

Maybe it has changed, but it's exactly as the Amazon.com description I  read. It's Montreal Smoked Meat, presliced and in packets. It's not pastrami. If you want pastrami, buy pastrami. It's Montreal Smoked Meat and perfect as such.

this is what smoked meat in montreal tastes like - it's nor pastrami or corned beef. it comes in 5 packets so it stays fresh. all the information is in the description so i'm not sure what the confusion is. if you're looking for really good montreal smoked meat, here it is.

Before I post my review, I'll state the following:

I've never been to Montreal so I can't compare this to the meat found in an actual Montreal, Quebec deli.

This product is from the USA, but at least according to wikipedia it's from an area of the USA that does produce a "true" Montreal beef brisket, although the article also implies that some feel that only brisket from Montreal is the "true" Montreal beef brisket.

Give the two items above, I found this product to be excellent. Smokey without being overpowering, tender and quite fresh despite being sliced and then vacuum sealed. The pepper along the edges of each slice add a bit as well, but again it's far from overpowering. This works well, cold or warm as a sandwich meat, or heated as sliced meat on a plate.

Product shipped very fast, and was well packaged. Despite my getting home late and thus the package sitting for nearly 2 hours (I'm single and I couldn't arrange for someone to pick it up for me) it was still quite cold, being packaged in (if memory serves) a styrofoam box with "blue ice" (not the actual brand, but something similar, a gelled "ice" that is at least in theory reusuable). As currently advertised as of June 2012, it was in (again if memory serves) individual one pound packages and again both pre-sliced and fully cooked. Fat content is fine in my opinion, although I haven't tried making an au-jus with it like apparently one reviewer did when he possibly mistook this for pastrami (he doesn't mention au-jus, but does mention a "pastrami dip"). The one time I did reheat it though, I didn't see enough "drippings" to make anything like an au-jus.

Anyway, when I do run out I'm going to consider this product again. It's of fine quality and is shipped very well.

I purchased this product as a birthday gift for a Canadian expat. Communication with the seller was very easy and the replies to my questions were prompt. The meat was shipped via 2-day air to get to us cold and fresh, and it was packed in a cooler with gel ice packs.

It's just splendid meat. Not too fatty, perfect for sandwiches. The flavor is very smoky and delicious, and the person it was purchased for said that the taste was spot-on for what was remembered from buying this same product in Canada proper.

The amount of meat for the price is very reasonable.

We'll be shopping from this seller again.

It tasts fine... But I was expecting a 3 1/2 lb. beef brisket...instead i got five packs of shaved smoked beef. Not bad mind you, but the description clearly leads one to expect a WHOLE beef brisket... I can get sliced meat at the local deli... I was expecting much more.

James Hatsis

Our dogs simply love these. They can even double as pill pockets if the pill isn't too big. I have never found a good replacement for them since moving away from the PetCo that carried them, which is why I'm not ordering them off of Amazon. It would be easier to pick up a different treat when we go grocery shopping, but they ALL have high fructcose corn syrup listed as the first couple of ingredients. Here are the Bil Jac ingredients:

Chicken Liver, Chicken, Chicken By-Product Meal, Wheat Flour, Glycerin, Propylene Glycol, Phosphoric Acid, Salt, Potassium Sorbate and Citric Acid and BHA and Calcium Propionate (Preservatives), Iron Oxide.

Notice the first three ingredients are all CHICKEN.
These are the best for keeping your dog happy!  And they really help emphasize tasks completed well!

I bought these as a gift for a friend's dogs after one had surgery. I previously had wrapped these up at Christmas for my dogs and put under the tree ... but only for one year. They could smell them and chewed up the carton to get to them while i was out! I couldn't be mad, i should have known better. Anyway, these are great treats.

My dogs love these treats, and I do buy them occasionally because they are cheap and perched at the check-out counter of our local garden/feed store. But check out the ingredient list-- I don't think anyone can feel good about feeding their dog high-fructose corn syrup! Just not the healthiest option-- when so many of our dogs are overweight, it seems better to feed them a real liver treat, versus this product which is "made with liver".

My dogs absolutely love Pro-Treat Beef Liver, Freeze Dried 14 Ounce (the larger size packages are more economical). I just feel a lot better about feeding real freeze-dried liver that doesn't have all the extra junk in Bil-Jac liver treats.

Specifically, these treats have chicken "by-products"-- that means liquid slaughterhouse run-off and other non-human grade leftovers from the slaughterhouse. UGH! Bil-Jac also includes three preservatives, glycerin (?!), and the corn syrup.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Here's the ingredient list for Bil-Jac liver treats, so you can make your own decision:

Liver, Chicken By-Products, Chicken By-Product Meal, Corn, Chicken Fat, Glycerin, High Fructose Corn Syrup, Propylene Glycol, Wheat Flour, Phosphoric Acid, Salt, Sodium Propionate and Potassium Sorbate and BHA and Citric Acid (Preservatives), Iron Oxide.

Hmmmm. I read somewhere that a little dark chocolate is now good for you. Well, I was passing the desert isle in my nearby Fresh and Easy Market and there were some Gamesa Sugar Wafers. I had tried the Vanilla ones and then felt guilty afterwards. The were sure good. Imported from Mexico. But today, there were also some Chocolate Sugar Wafers next to the vanilla ones. How could I resist? Especially after reading about the benefits of a little chocolate in your diet. Into the cart a 6.7-ounce packet went. Mmmm. They're good. Nice and fresh and tasty. Now the trick will be to keep the amount down.

Gary Peterson

Bought these for a party...guest of honor's favorite cookie! EVERY COOKIE IN ALL 4
PACKAGES WERE BROKEN!!!!! So if you wanted to put out nicely...forget it. Just thrown in the box.
Fresh, but broken to pieces! I ended up using them for a pie crust!!!

The Mint Milano cookies are wonderful. They have a light and crispy texture with a mild mint chocolate taste. The flavor reminds me a lot of the chocolate mint Girl Scout cookies although the texture of the 2 cookies are very different (the girl scout cookie is much denser).

Unfortunately the cookies usually arrive with very few intact and several of mine were even broken into multiple pieces. They still taste pretty good though.

Nutritional Facts copied from the actual package (July 2011):

Serving size 2 cookies (25g/ 0.9oz)

Servings per container about 8

Calories per serving 130

Calories from fat 70

Total Fat 7g

Saturated Fat 5g

Trans Fat 0g

Cholesterol less than 5 mg

Sodium 65mg

Total Carbohydrate 16g

Dietary Fiber less than 1g

Sugars 8g

Protein 1g

Vitamins A and C 0%

Calcium 0%

Iron 4%

FYI, I purchased my cookies during 100 degree weather and except for some of the chocolate melting onto the inner wrapper the cookies were fine (I used 2 day shipping which might make a difference since the cookies weren't in the heat that long).

At 15.88 for 4 bags of cookies the price per bag is 3.97 which is 48 cents more than the price printed on the cookie bag (3.49).

These are our favorite kind of cookies! Usually, I just buy the dark chocolate one, but Pepperidge has so many different types, I recently decided to try the others. The mint adds a refreshing hint to the chocolate, which we like. These are nice to enjoy with tea as a midafternoon snack or something of the sort.

All of the flavors I've tried are great; but my favorite are the mint.

I was concerned re the shipping issue based on other reviews. When they arrived, the cookies were packed so tightly into a box filled with canned goods that the outer carton was pushed out of shape right on top of where the cookies were - which carton was pretty battered on that location, as one might expect from an incorrectly packed carton. Amazon, what is up with your packaging logic? It's so weird what you do when packing things....

Anyway, I figured the whole batch of cookies would be crushed. To my amazement, only 3 of the cookies were broken (out of a pack of 4 bags). I think that was a fluke really. Anyway, otherwise they were fresh etc. The only other odd thing was that these seemed to be different cookies than what I was used to. They seemed to be thinner. I've noticed since moving from the West Coast to the East Coast that a lot of products seem different here in various ways, so I figured it was either that, or maybe I was imagining it; but I don't think so. Anyway - I actually preferred the thinner ones, as the overall flavor balances were better and the texture was more appealing.

So while my shipping story was a success, I can't claim that the product was really properly packaged, and I wouldn't therefore want to leave a review claiming that.

This review is regarding the cookie, not the price set by this seller. The cookie.... is fantastic. What a perfect little treat. Three cookies are only 180 calories. Since I am trying to watch my weight, I eat one - only 60 calories!! It's perfect for those times you NEED something sugary or chocolately. You can eat one of these and not blow your entire day dieting.

Yum. Yum.

These cookies hardly need a review. They are so amazingly delicious. The perfect amount of rich chocolate between the cookies. Pepperidge farm sure did it right with these cookies. Stick to the classic ones, though. I've tried a few other variations and they aren't nearly as good.

The cookies were delicious, chrisp and whole. I can only say they did not last long.  Pepperidge Farm Mint Milano is the only cookie I realy enjoy and would eat a lot off.  The others, even in Peppridge Farm I would only eat one or two.  But I have found that the Mint Milano is hard to get.  Pepperidge Farm should try selling in Canada and Jamaica,  West Indies.  I actually live in Jamaica, W.I. and can not get Mint Milano there so I either ask friends to buy it for me or buy it on line.  Would recommend this cookie for all those people that like a lite combination of mint and chocolate.
These have minty chocolate in them, but it's not too minty, wich is good.  They're a lot like the Thin Mint Girl Scout cookies in reguard to flavor, but the texture is lighter and crisper.

I LOVE raspberry, and Pepperidge Farms, so I thought this would be a "no brainer".  However, when I received them they were already a week past the freshness date, and they were very dry.  I don't think I will order again.

By the time I buy a few four packs and get amazons free shipping to my door it is a better deal than my local store.Its a wonderful crispie cookie that holds up well in shipping Try it for yourselves  :)

We've tried a lot of Progresso soups lately, and this is one of the few I've been disappointed in. Normally even their light soups are well seasoned and thus have a strong, good flavor. That was not the case with this soup. It was just kind of blah tasting. It also had very little chicken in it. It did have their big twisted noodles, which I'm also not a fan of. They tend to be tough and irritating. It is only 70 calories a serving, which is its only real plus. However, a lot of other Progresso soups are in a good calorie range and also a delight to eat. Try one of them instead.

Finally: candy that is good for your teeth. My kids love it. Nice to have a variety of flavors in a single container. And with the amount in the package, it lasts a long time.
In the car for misc diversions.

We first tried this Olive Oil in a high-end restaurant, and fell in love with it. It is subtle and smooth. It's less picante and more clear flavors. We dip bread in the oil, or spread over an argula pizza. Highly recommend this for anyone.
I like the other reviewer bought this from World Market, and it is DISGUSTING. I chucked it and the other boxes I had bought straight in the trash.

First and foremost I will say that I was sorely disappointed with this item. I purchased mine at World Market where I have previously had great success with another brand that they sadly no longer carry. That previous brand was real tabouli. This one was not. Tabouli is made with Bulgar wheat. This is couscous. The packaging is very misleading.

I only give this two stars because the finished product was edible, but not flavorful. Moreover, in trying to follow the instructions for preparation, the first instruction says simply, "empty package contents into bowl and add an equal amount of water." I tried to eyeball it and was able to come out with a decent guess at 1 1/2 cups. Regardless, one shouldn't have to guess. I will not buy this again.

Real Food Toppers is truly a quality product with an extremely small amount of hard, unusable pieces. I am pleased with this purchase and so are my cats. I will continue buying this product for my finicky kitties. Thanks for money well spent.
The best micro popcorn by far.  Totally unhealthy, what with that buttery packet and all, but worth every bite!  As close to movies theater popcorn as you can get without leaving your house.

Makes you so sick, stomach hurts, stay away!!!!

Not worth the cheap buy. Just go to the grocery store and pay a little more for good mixes.

Or go with brand name brands instead

My dogs eat nothing but Halo brand dog food because it has all REAL ingredients and they love it!  The treats and chews are just icing on the cake for them.  It's their favorite!  I know they love it and that it's good for them so I can feel good about feeding them Halo!

I was given a couple of these as a gift for my dogs.  I always read the label and make sure that the dogs chews/treats/food is made in the USA and wholesome products.  The ingredients look healthy and today  I gave one to my senior wire fox terrier to keep him occupied at my office.  He went though it in record time and vacuumed up the crumbs as well.  A four paws up from here. Giving only four stars because I still don't know the outcome of today's chew!

I was quite impressed by these chews!  My dog is allergic to almost everything, so a lot of dental chews are out, but these have very few ingredients that are allergens and my dog just loves them!  The pumpkin one also helps with her digestion (pumpkin always has a way of doing that!)  They are definitely tough to chew, but my 15-pound dog is quite the chewer so she's in heaven!
My Chow girl Anaya loves these & they are made in the USA. Always a plus with so many treats that are made in China! YUCK.....

I am impressed by Halo's products, although the canned food variety is the only thing I had previously tried, when I was babying my dog while she was recuperating after her spay surgery. I can feel good about feeding her such wholesome food, and she devours it. This was my first time buying Halo treats. Even though the package says they're for dogs 25-60 lbs, my 17 lb, one year old terrier mix is still in the puppy stage and is an avid chewer. I was looking for a product to change it up from the old reliable rawhide, for something she would not demolish in 5 minutes, and something different than meat-flavored treats (for variety). I was unsure if she would go for the pumpkin flavor, but this was an instant hit! She LOVES the taste of these treats and has no problem chewing them. I gave her a whole stick and she worked on it (kept her occupied) for about 45 minutes until it was completely gone. They smell really good, like pumpkin pie spice, and although they are dark brown in color, they do not stain like some of the red-colored rawhide products I've tried. I have gone through half the bag so far (7 sticks in a bag), giving her one every few days, and she really enjoys them. I am definitely buying these again, and I am going to try the mint variety and see if that's a winner too. I'd recommend that even if you have a small dog, give them a try to switch up your choice of hard chew treats if your puppy or dog is a big chewer.

Our 1 year old pup loves these things! They are a bit harder to break like the previous review stated but the whole stick is actually perfect size for our Mini Aussie (med. size dog). The leave his breath smelling minty fresh! Also the heart shape is a cute touch.

Too bad our local Petco stopped carrying these all of the sudden, but thank goodness for Amazon :)

Halo truly is a great brand, natural and healthy. My only drawback for these are that if you have a smaller dog they are very hard to chew and break up for them it seems as my dog is having trouble with them. They are good though an stick by this product as well as the seller!

These have great ingredients and smell so good, I wanted to eat it lol. However they are really hard so if your dog isn't a big chewer, like mine, it's not such a good idea. Brownie stopped trying after 30 minutes. So these are going to be donated to the animal shelter. These are for medium to large dogs, not so much for small dogs unless they're really aggressive chewers.

We've tried other Halo products previously and have been happy so we thought we'd give this one a try.

We first bought these at our local pet supply store when we ran out of Paragon toothbrush chews one day. It turns out that our 15lb pom mix loves Spot's Chews and they smell great to us as well. The only issue is that it's a lot of chew for a small dog, although they are labeled as being for "small/medium" pets. They are hard to break so my husband was slicing them into thirds with a knife and we'd give a third of a chew a day.

One cute thing is that if you look at them top down, they are actually shaped like hearts.
I worried that my dog would swallow one of the chunks that came off the stick whole. It looks very dangerous! I gave my dog one and threw the rest away, as a precautionary measure.

I ordered the 200-count box of 4-inch bones for the first time, and I'm happy with the purchase so far. My dog is small but a ferocious chewer, and supervised pressed rawhides are the only way I can afford to sate that desire. Amazon has the best prices I've seen anywhere.

I do think I underestimated how small the 4-inchers actually are. They're not bad, but for the next purchase, I may opt for the 8-inchers, which are currently slightly cheaper on a per-pound basis.

I ordered my bones direct from Amazon. Based on one of the reviews, the first thing I did was count the pieces. There were exactly 200 in the box. As seen in the product photo, the Ranch Rewards box has a large opening. Before shipping it, Amazon places it into another, much more secure, box. Perhaps some of the third-party merchants take less care.
i dont know if they taste good or not..my dog eats them, and every time i ask her she tilts her head sideways and gives me the silent treatment like i'm speaking some foreign language to her.
THERE SHOULD BE A WARNING LABEL ON THE PACKAGE THAT SAYS: "YOU MAY NOT BE ABLE TO STOP AT LESS THAN THE ENTIRE BAG; HOWEVER, SCHNEIDER'S IS NOT LIABLE IF OVER-INDULGENCE DOES OCCUR!"

Pleasantly surprised, should have been the original pretzel-type recipe!
...but, am sure technology is the only way they could make a pretzel-type snack so light and crispy, not hard and sawdusty at all! I usually can't eat more than a few pretzels, but these I can probably munch at least ten.
The dough is rolled with random air pockets somehow inside and if there weren't or aren't it's still airy-light and crispy, unexplainable...
Well, that's the texture, the taste is light and delightfully tasty.
These would be terrific if I had some dip, but on there own they are great, but not terrific.
They don't seem to fall apart into little pieces either, pretty stable when you bite it.
Ir looka about 3 inches long...hey, I believe they were rolled up on a piece of metal, then cooked...why they have a hole throughout the center that is not punched, but flaky layers around it.
Some bites taste buttery, some multi-grainy, all great...I love a snack that every single spec tastes the same. It's not often an actual five star pretzel-small breadstick at a reasonable price with a hefty portion....they are a lot lighter than pretzels, so more volume.
Tastes more buttery and less sweet than the Trader joe's honey twists.  Kids will eat it for snack.  Good stuff, but if you're looking for a sweeter taste, go to TJ's for the Honey twists.

Love it!!!! A pleasant soothing cup of tea.  Always order this tea at our favorite Indian restaurant , now we can have it at home whenever we like. Plenty of recipes for making it as they do in restaurants. Enjoy!

As the other reviewers have said, this is not a K-cup! I uploaded an image of one of these pods next to a K-cup for comparison. The difference is the filter is exposed in these pods as opposed to being fully sealed in a K-cup. Since the coffee is exposed to the air when you open the package, you will have to seal them with a clip or put them in an airtight bag or tupperware to prevent the rest of the pods from loosing freshness. Having said that, in my experience they are a great inexpensive alternative to use in your Keurig brewer. The 36 count boxes arrived as unmarked brown cardboard boxes, not the colorful retail packaging shown on amazon. Inside each cardboard box, there are three clear heavy duty plastic bags, each of which holds 12 of the pods. The bags are not resealable!

I did not buy this at Amazon even though I am an avid amazon shopper. Needless to say I went to cosco with a friend and got this exact box for $25 at Cosco. I debated getting it and once it was in my cart I had two different people tell me how much they loved the coffee and with 80 pods at that price I figured I would try it. I came home at 8 pm and decided to open it up.

IN THE BOX: Inside I have 10 clear plastic bags each with 8 pods. The bottom has no plastic white thing I am used to and not only is the coffee in a mesh bag making it so you can not store it in the carousel (it is loose and falls out) you would not want to because it would lose freshness. SO the other 7 went in Tupperware. I give it 2 points for helping the environment and 4 for the price without trying it!

TASTE: Brew it at 8pm (not the best time for coffee but ahhh) It smells absolutely amazing! Super strong odor if you like the smell of coffee. Color is very dark, smell is strong. I taste it black and it is stronger then even the jet fuel k-cups. Add some creamer try it again and then add a little more and it is the best coffee I have had in my life and that says a lot as Paris had some amazing coffee!

Needless to say I grabbed the phone and called my friend who also bought a box after the two people commented on how much they loved the coffee to find out she had tried it and loves it as much as I do! If you are debating trying this like I was I am hoping this review will help as I think I have finally kicked my expensive k-cup habit and I no longer need to worry about losing a bang for my buck! Hopefully amazon will start matching Cosco prices as I do not have a cosco card though :)
These are a wonderful alternative to expensive K-Cups.  After opening up the sealed bags, I kept mine in a ziplock bag until use.  The 80 count French Roast is significantly cheaper at Costco.

This is a wonderful coffee, and it works perfectly in my Keurig Platinum. There is no noticeable residue in my coffee cup, and the flavor is excellent. I recommend storing the unused 'pods' in a resealable storage bad to maintain their freshness.

I think I have tried almost all of the k-cups, and really was ready to get rid of the machine because of the weak, almost tasteless coffee.  I like strong, bold coffee, and this one is excellent.  And the price is very nice, too!

I was mildly surprised by the shape of the K-Cup but the first time I tried it in my Keurig Coffee Maker, I was provided with an excellent cup of very rich coffee.  This is a great product for an excellent price.  I highly recommend this product to any Keurig Owner.

We purchased this coffee yesterday for the first time. It's a very good coffee.. an 80 count box was under $25, that's half the price that it's listed for here. Of course it was at Costco.. The most worthwhile membership I've ever owned! If there is one near you, pay your membership.. buy your coffee there.. it will only take saving half the cost on your coffee on 2 boxes to pay yourself back for your membership! You can store your pods in a ziploc bag to maintain freshness after the celo packs are opened. If you are like us as coffee drinkers, it won't last long enough to get stale anyway.
this is a delicious coffee that is good any time of the day.  black, with half & half or milk & sweetener it is great.
Pelindaba Lavender and honey is the perfect combination. It's so heavenly tasty, that all other honeys are just not worth it anymore.

I have actually visited the Pelindaba lavender fields a few years ago on a visit to the San Juan Islands so was thrilled to see this product available.  I was reminded of the warm smell of lavender growing in the July sun with bees swarming around the plants.  One of my best travel memories.  Love this honey- it has a more lavender flavor than some honies but is really wonderful.  Great value for the money.  Adds a wonderful something extra to Greek yogurt or to a bowl of fresh blueberries.  Fresh blueberries take very well to a little dollop of lavender honey. Try it!
Priced in the range of a CASE, this is a single box.  If you buy this you are paying three times the full price for a box.  You are getting ripped off if you buy this!!!!

I've been a tea lover for a long time, though I generally drink loose leaf varieties. I tried this for the first time at an office location I was doing some work at and was immediately addicted. I now keep it and the caffeine free version on hand at home at all times.

I've tried many different spiced tea's and have never found anything similar. The spicy smell is comforting and warming while the flavor is strong and delicious. The 25ct package is the commercial package and larger than I could find in the local grocery for a similar price making it a good deal.

The only thing I've found is that I like it steeped longer than usual. Typically you would steep this for 4-5 minutes, but I like it with a stronger flavor and generally leave the tea bag in the entire time I'm drinking it. Make sure you squeeze the bag as well or the flavor can sometimes be a little weak.
This herbal tea is wonderful and naturally sweet.  I highly recommend for anyone who likes drinking healthy and decaf products.
I really love the Good Earth Tea, too, and have it every day.  But until they changed the formula a few years ago, I could get 2 good cups of tea from one teabag, and now it only makes one.

I ordered this partly because I wanted the cute paint can.  The shipper was slow to ship it, and when it did arrive, the gum was not in a can.  It's in a cheap plastic container.  If that's what I had wanted, I would have gone to Sam's Club.

If you like the taste of strawberry Pocky or strawberry Yan Yan, you will like these. My fiance and I have an American palette, but we were hooked on Hello Panda ever since he bought the "Milk" (Vanilla) flavor on a whim from the international aisle of a supermarket.

They arrive in individual boxes packed in a display box (like at a store). The individual packaging make them easy to throw in a bag or purse on the go (easy for pacifying fussy kids too!), and the individual outer cardboard package means these creme-filled cookies don't get crushed by your water bottle. :)
These cookies are great. The biscuit part is not too sweet and the inside is a nice vanilla flavor. The designs are super cute as well~

These little chocolate cream filled cookies are pretty darn good.  I sent a few boxes with a friend of mine to take to work with her.  The people she works with devoured what she handed out and they were asking for more.  Looks like those folks will be placing orders with Amazon.com for more of these little chocolate cream filled devils.  Thanks Amazon.com.
