Sucks because i bought a huge size thinking it would be good. hopefully i can return it. thought maybe it was just me since i am new to flavored creamers but i think the votes are in...stay away from this product.

My wife is a flavored-creamer junkie, so I have tried a LOT of different creamers, so when I say that this is probably the WORST coffee creamer I have ever tasted, I know what I'm talking about. The chemical aftertaste is so strong, it's impossible to determine what the underlying flavor is. I honestly thought I had gotten a bad batch, but after reading all the reviews here, I realized that is how it is supposed to taste. Several of the other International Delight flavors have a slight aftertaste, but nothing like this!

I'm not sure who they had taste-test this flavor, but whoever it is should be tested for brain damage, or maybe they just lost their sense of taste completely.

I just bought this White Chocolate Mocha creamer in the dairy section of my grocery store, and I have to say...it's terrible!! I am so disappointed. I usually enjoy International Delight creamers, but I honestly dont know how this made it to the shelves. Did any of the International Delight workers try it before deciding to package it up and ship it out? It tastes like plastic. And I am very upset that I spent $4 on a 32 oz of this stuff...I wont even use it now. What a waste!!! I would give it 0 stars if I had the option to.

I love white mochas, but this is horrible. I can't even drink it. I came on to see if others felt the same or if there was actually something wrong with my creamer. I guess I'm not alone in thinking this is horrible. I'm calling international delight tomorrow :/ how does a company let something this bad into stores!?!?

This is by far the worst coffee creamer I have ever used. I was at the store and I decided to try a new creamer and I picked this one because I never had international delight before. But this gave my coffee a horrible taste, I had to use at least 1/3 of this to coffee before it tasted kind of ok.

I can't even describe the flavor of this creamer...it's definitely not chocolate or mocha.  It's terrible.  Like others have said, I thought maybe it was expired or may it was just one in the box that was bad.  I tried tasting some of the creamer alone (without coffee) and it was just as bad.  Hopefully the other flavors are better...kind of an expensive way to have to find out by buying a whole box and then not liking it.  Who'd have thought I needed to read a review about a creamer before buying.
This stuff does not taste good at all.  I thought that maybe it had gone bad or something but it's not close to expiring.  Definitely the worst tasting creamer I've had yet.

I hate drinking my coffee black.  These white chocolate mocha singles are easy to keep in my desk at work, they don't need refrigerated unless opened.  I use 1/2 of a tub to a cup of coffee, any more and it's too sweet for me. Until I got the combination right (1/2 tub, 1 packet of Splenda), I didn't care for these. After experimenting some, they are pretty good.  I hope these eventually are offered with dark chocolate instead of white. The more chocolately flavor, the better!

Awful, awful, awful. After the first sip I thought I somehow screwed up the coffee without knowing it. I kept sipping, and with each swallow, I realized that it wasn't getting any better. This is the most disgusting creamer I have ever tasted. What a disappointment! The taste reminded me of burnt popcorn covered in moldy chocolate. Gross!

When I received this order, the outside of the box was wet from the leaking contents inside. The creamers were just thrown in the box and were not even in a plastic bag. It was a mess. I had to wash the few remaining creamers that were still in tact because everything was sticky and dirty.  I will not be ordering this item again.
Since I've lived in India and Pakistan; I know chai first hand...this is by far the only best powder form available...my friends all agree.
Great Product, love it!  Add cinnamon to it, and it will taste even better :)

Talk about comfort food and drink!  This is pure yummy at its best!  Pricey...and well worth every penny.  The steamy smell is intoxicating and the taste even better.  After a long hard day...wind down with this marvelous blend of chai spices.  Wow!

My husband and I share a cup of this on a cold day.  We bought it first at marshalls and couldn't find it again.  We were able to get on line and get our shipment every 3 months automatically, this beats driving around looking for it as we have been doing.

I ordered this product for my daughter who LOVES it! We had bought this product at Sam's Club in the past in a larger can, but they have not had it since. So when I found out I could order it online I bought several cans. My daughter drinks at least 1 cup a day of Chai, usually at night after a long day at school or when it is chilly. It is especially nice on rainy days, that chill to the bone, it really warms you up!

She always drinks it warm but I have heard it was good over ice as well.

The reason I gave this only 2 stars is not because of the taste. It tastes great! I actually had this at a restaurant for the first time, which is what prompted me to find it online and buy it.

But, almost every ingredient is artificial. Hardly anything about this product is something I would willingly put into my body on a regular basis. It's a powdery mix when you open it and pour one scoup into a cup of hot water. It makes you wonder where the tea actually is.

I don't recommend this highly processed, chemically manufactured, mostly artificial ingredients, product to anyone. Unless you just don't care what you put into your bodies and just want it for the taste.
My first purchase of this product was made from curiosity. I have been using it for a few years.  I really enjoy it and even share it with my cousin.

I love the Chai latte @ Starbucks. Since I couldn't find that at a reasonable price in Amazon, I chose to try Mocafe Divinity Spice Chai mix. To my surprise, it came out really very well. The Starbucks chai and this one are totally different things. Both taste good in their own fashion. Starbucks chai seems watery but this one is the thickest you will ever get. Mocafe is highly creamy all the way down but Starbucks is not. This is a powdery product, Starbucks is liquid product.
Again, I seem to love Mocafe even though I am a big fan of Starbucks Chai. I highly recommend this to all the Chai lovers out there.
Note: This had a price advantage over starbucks chai when I initially bought. But I later found that Costco is selling Starbucks chai at a very cheaper price.
I love that I can still have my Chai tea at work and not have to worry about having milk there. Tastes great!

I have a cup every morning!  Cant describe it but it just makes me happy :)  its not too sweet and just the perfect amount of creamy (I mix mine w water)I have been buying this at a local small coffee shop at 13$ per can. I can't tell you how happy I was to find this on amazon for such an amazing price. If you are looking to try a new chai, look no further!

This Chai tea has a delicious flavor.  The only bad thing about it is that it doesn't dissolve completely no matter how hot the water is or how much you stir it, which makes the last 5 sips or so a bit gritty.
We have tried Chai at a number of venues as well as buying various brands to try at home. This is the hands down winner - and company always agrees. Cannot recommend this product more.
I can never find this chai in the last 2 states i have lived in. so i order it here. I have tried other chai mixes that i can find at stores to replace it, but this one is the best. so delicious!

Paid over $4.00 for a cup of this at a coffee shop in town.  After raving about how delicious it was (and thinking of how I was going to need to come back...soon...for another cup) the owner told me it was MOCAFE.  She mixes equal parts of the spice and the vanilla chi tea mix and wow--it is amazing.  I was so happy to see Amazon has both flavors!  I buy them both, dump them together in a container and mix well.  Then I spoon back into the tin (I also put into jars and gave as Christmas gifts...well received!) and enjoy!  The only thing I add is a puff of whipped cream on the top of the mug.  Now if only they made a sugar free version....

this chai is the best! fast shipping, can only recommend it to everyone else!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! you will love it,  i can also recommend the vanilla chai as well! great taste! love it in the fall and winter time

I enjoy drinking all types of tea, in loose and bagged forms, but this tea is a delight to drink.  It is a chai tea mix with the spice, sugar and milk already added so all you have to do is add hot water.  It tastes great cold as well and though it already has the added milk, I sometimes add a touch of coconut milk to it to give the 'spice' of it a little more exotic taste. Yet no matter how you may want to serve it, this all-in-one drink is a taste-tea, tea-licious treat!

I buy this all the time and drink it just about every day as my special treat.
I use soy milk or almond milk with it and it is delicious. I mix it with 3/4 cup hot
water and then 3/4 cup of whatever milk you want and then micro-wave again. My sister told me about it. That is how I found it. Then I found I could order "MOCAFE
Precious Divinity Spiced Chai Tea Mix" from Amazon.
If you like iced Chai - this is it.  Disolve powder in a small amount of VERY hot water.  Add ice and milk.  YUM x 2!!!
This chai is less creamy than some I have tried.  It is heavily spiced and I use less than the amount called for when I mix it with half water and half vanilla soy milk.  Tasty.

You will love this Chai it is perfect for a chilly fall evening.  I purchased it to share with family and friends.  The product is delicious and the shipping was super fast. Try it, you will not be disappointed.

I was tired of paying $4 - $5 for each chait tea drink at the coffee shop but it was an adventure to find an at home product that tasted as good as the coffee shop.  THIS IS IT!  It is really delicious you won't be disappointed.  :)

I have been drinking MOCAFE Chai for 6 years, always finding it at a discount retailer.  They no longer carry it so decided I would go to MOCAFE and see if I could purchase directly.  Was pleased to see that Amazon.com is now carrying --- I appreciated the free shipping as it saved a considerable amount and allowed me to buy more of my favorite, yummy, morning drink.  A great beverage for coffee drinkers and non-coffee drinkers like myself.

We keep this stuff around the house and drink it during the winter a lot, as well as around just about any holiday.  It truly is amazing stuff!  Everyone I've had try it absolutely LOVES it.  It tastes like... pumpkin pie-it's awesome with whipped cream on top.

I have tried various chai teas and this is the only one that I LOVE!  I would go to ROSS to see if they had any more but I got tired of looking so I decided to see if they sold it online and the price on here is great.

I am not a big coffee drinker, but several years ago someone turned me on to the chai tea latte at Starbucks.  During the winter, I tend to treat myself to a tall chai a couple days a week, which can really add up!  My sister bought me a tin of the Precious Divinity Spiced Chai Mix for my Christmas stocking this year and I LOVE IT!  It has a nice, mild, sweet flavor.  I just ordered a four pack of the tins for myself, and I keep one at work so I can enjoy a hot, caffienated drink in the morning.  Each serving is fairly small, but even if you make a double, you're still paying a lot less than you would at Starbucks. Very good stuff!
This is buy far the most delicious chai mix I've ever had, way better than what I've bought in actual cafes. I am never going to Starbuck's again.

I originally purchased this Chai tea at Sam's and fell in love with it however, Sam's quit selling it at their stores.  I got online and found that Amazon.com sold it.  I was in love all over again!  I serve it with milk instead of water and put a little hazelnut syrup in it as well.  To top it off, I put whipped cream on top with a sprinkle of cinnamon sugar.  By this point, the tea has now become a decadent dessert instead of a hot tea.  Thanks to Amazon.com I received my tea in record time and the product was in perfect condition!  The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because I wish the containers held a little more product.  Other than that, I love, love, love it!

I love this stuff!!!!!!!!!! Share with all your friends !!!!!!
watch the calories !!!!
This is a weekend morning ritual for me and my wife.  The product is sweet, delicious, and keeps me going when I'm deployed overseas.

I love this chai! Better tasting than Trader Joe's, Oregon Chai and Tazo. I love the Vanilla version too! I discovered it a few years ago and stumbled upon it at a discount grocery store. So now I order it using Amazon's "Subscribe & Save" feature.
That's the best thing I can say about this formula.  Clumpy, does not dissolve and tastes pretty well nasty.  I'm trying to find people I can give the cans away to without feeling mean.

Use the following recipe for this dip:
1 pkg Fiesta Ranchero Dip
1 cup grated cheddar cheese
1 cup real mayo
1 can chicken breast, drained
1 cup sour cream

Mix all ingredients and serve in a small crock pot or warm up portions in the microwave on a low setting. If it gets too hot the cheese will become oily and yucky looking. Serve with tortilla chips. Your guests will absolutely love this dip.

I absolutely LOVE this dip, simple as made with pretzels.  However, when I went on a diet it got stuck in the back of my pantry until I discovered that using 2 cups of fat free Greek Yogurt produces a delicious low calorie substitute for the mayo and sour cream that the box calls for. So now, my favorite pretzel and veggie dip is back on the forefront of my snacking!

I bought 2 boxes of this dip at a flea market.  I used both of them by Christmas and was afraid that I wouldn't be able to find them again.  I was so excited when I found them.  I will reorder them again and again....

Just because of the bad review based on packaging above let me say Deboles makes top of the line pasta and we are extremely lucky to get the deals we do from amazon. You can pay double or triple the price in any store that sells this pasta. The recipe for their Jerusalem Artichoke pasta is the same for all types afaik so I would direct you to reviews of the De Boles Pasta Organic Artichoke Fettuccine, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12). To that I can only add that with regular semolina pasta it took about double the amount to fill me up as the Deboles Jerusalem Artichoke which stands to reason because it's got 2x the protein. Just be advised with this deal (2.40/lb is a great deal) you'll want a tub or some kind of jar (2 gallons will do) to hold 10lbs of pasta.
There's no going back!  Absolutely tastes like the real thing... the only difference is it's less sticky, a smother surface, which is a great difference.  I'll never miss wheat pasta!

DeBoles elbows are better than any other elbows I've tried. Believe me, at my age, that is a lot! However, as one reviewer stated, the product does come in a plastic bag.

Rest assured, it IS what you are ordering. How do I know? Went to another web site and viewed a large image of the elbows in the box from DeBoles.

The pasta's are exact. There is what appear to be cracks in the pasta. All is good however!

This product is genuine and excellent for your health. Especially if you are diabetic.

I reordered these elbows to make macaroni salad for a friend who is diabetic. She will appreciate that when she checks her glucose levels.

Love this product and wish everyone would try it at least once.
This is best pasta I ever ate plus nutritional. I will never go back. Its worth increase in price to me & buying in bulk makes it affordable.

I LOVE Snack Factory's Everything Pretzel Crisps. They are full of flavor but not too salty. I would be content living off of these crisps, veggies, fruit, and water for the rest of my life, seriously. Kudos.

The first time I tried these I bought them at a local health foods store in my hometown.  I loved the taste but was discouraged from the price.  After checking out Amazon, I bought two (yes, I love them that much) cases of these Pretzel Crisps.  I am a closet snacker and have tried to find healthier alternatives to traditional snacks.  I pair these crisps with hummus for a delicious treat!! And the price was much better with Amazon!

These pretzel crisps are delicious.  The flavor is very similar to Bruegger's everything bagels.  Shipment was perfect.  They arrived on time and the box was packed well.  No flattened bags with broken pretzels here.

I am just trying to help you out. Do yourself a favor. Don't just buy one bag of these. I mean, if you live alone, maybe you will be okay, you might be alright. But for the love of all things good and fine in the world, if you plan to open these around other people or ::gasps in horror::: share them!!! then stock up by buying a few bags, not just one.

Don't say I didn't warn you. They are everything an everything bagel is, but super thin and crunchy. Everything should be crunchy.

Sheri Gill

Best low calorie snack that goes with any other foods. Put cream cheese on it; dip it in cottage cheese, eat it with an apple, try peanut butter on it, snack it plain when hungry and dinner is not ready, gives you a lift when you are tired from working out, take it for lunch with a sandwich or a wedge of cheese, have it with soup, have it with cocoa, coffee, tea or just munch some while watching TV. I love them!!!

I picked these up while grocery shopping and love them!  They do give me a slight, weird aftertaste (that "everything bagels" don't, so I'm not sure why)...but even that isn't enough to stop me from snacking on them.  I'm excited to try other flavors!

I took an oath, no more kettle chips...rice chips are good, not great. These pretzel chips are super crunchy but not hard on your teeth like some fancy brands I cant name that make their pretzels more like something the dog would love to chomp on. Snack Factory Pretzel Crisps are crunchy from being well toasted and thin, then sprinkled with caraway, sesame, poppy and salt; I think there's a pinch of other spices, but its so mild we used them for dipping.
They are darn delicious.
I love these! If you look around, you'll find them cheaper else where! I got them for $3.69 a pack at my local store.

I discovered and got hooked onto pu-erh during a recent trip to China and have only had the teabag variety thus far. Among the 3 brands I have tried thus far, one store bought, one an international brand, this is the best tasting pu-erh in a bag I have found. I intend to try couple other brands available on Amazon.com or if I see in any of the local Asian grocery stores.
One thing that could be better about this brand is the bag around the tea bag, which is a bit hard to open (even though it has the guide slit). On the brigther side, each tea bag is individually wrapped in a 'plastic like' silver cover, which helps seal in the flavor very well.
Characteristics of this tea:
- 'fishy' like smell when you first dunk into hot water (not overpowering or nasty by any means)
- steeps fully in about 4-5 minutes
- neither bitter like the stronger black teas nor mild like the greens. perfectly balanced somewhere in-between.
- satisfying flavor, makes me feel good about drinking a cup of tea.
If you have not tried this brand, worth giving it a shot. I typically drink 4-5 cups every week and will likely get a refill ordered soon, unless I find an even better pu-erh out there. Giving it a 4 star rating since this is a good buy, and my reference point is limited at present.

I think the other reviewer's right about the under-cooking, but hadn't thought about it--partly because it didn't diminish my enjoyment of this soup at all. It's quite well-seasoned, with the beans giving adequate "body". Though I enjoy a number of other Dr. McDougall's soups, this is among my favorite.

WORST PURCHASE I EVER BOUGHT OFF OF AMAZON AND I HAVE BOUGHT 100'S OF ITEMS THIS PRODUCT SMELLED LIKE A SMELLY OLD CLOSET. I THREW IN TRASH, MOST DISGUSTING SMELL, HAD TO BURN A CANDLE TO GET SMELL OUT OF MY HOUSE.

The tootsie pops were not fresh.  They were very old.. The outter covering was not crisp and brittle as all tootsie pops are. The outter covering was very soft and mushey and a lot of them had holes in them. And the inner tootsie roll was very small and looked old too.  The Green Apple flavor is very hard to come by in the assorted flavor bags. I loved the taste of the Green Apple Tootsie Pop that came in the assorted flavor bags so I thought I would I would order just that flavor in the 5lb bag.. .I was very dissapointed in the quality of the product.

I got this Dinner of the Month Club pasta meal as a gift from a very special person back in CT where I used to live--I believe they are one of the leading gourmet presents companies nationwide.
The pasta is ready literally within 15 minutes--a quick meal is a good thing, especially for a single guy like me who doesn't have the time of day to cook complicated stuff--and not only that, it tastes excellent! (I added some parmesan cheese to the sauces that I got in my fridge and it made it even better). Honestly I wasn't expecting it to taste this good. As an Italian food fan, I was pretty satisfied with this gift. If you don't want to leave the house or what to stay home to watch the game, it's a perfect gift. Do I recommend their food and services? Absolutely! Giving gifts like these are a good idea for single people like me, so I am thinking returning the favor and sending these to some people I know for the upcoming holidays.

I recently joined the dinner of the month club and I am so glad I did! It may be the best gift I've ever given myself:) My entire family reaps the benefits because it is a treat for everyone, no matter age or gender. We always look forward to the arrival of a new and exciting pasta in the mail every month. We even have a tradition now in our house that we all cook dinner together on "pasta night" and enjoy a savory dish provided by the dinner club.
It is so easy to make an impressive dinner with dinner club because they even send recipes to go along with their noodles and sauces! I recently received the Vegan Pumpkin pasta fettuccine paired with the Butternut Squash with Parmesan Cheese. I also got the Italian Spice Linguini with the Organic Roasted Garlic sauce. Even just boiling the noodles warms your home with a delicious fragrance. Everything I have ever received from Flying Noodle has always been of the highest quality. I have friends over to play dominoes every Tuesday night and I always brag about my Flying Noodle packages. They have tried most of my dishes and always want to know where they can get the noodles and sauces at our local grocery store. There is just nothing like it that you can buy from the store, I have since gotten all of my domino friends on Flying Noodle- dinner of the month club.
I definitely know where to go to do my Christmas shopping this year! There is something for everyone and I know I can trust Flying Noodle to deliver the best quality of products to my loved ones.

I love Celestial Seasoning's Madagascar Vanilla Red tea, which is sadly becoming harder and harder to find in stores.  But don't order this item.  I placed an order for it, and had the order randomly canceled by the company.  The seller was listed as ABC Wholesale, and it is now listed as RED TAG sale, even though it's the exact same item.  Buy it from another source, it's a great tea.  I personally think it works great in combination with other teas, my favorite is a combination of four bags of this tea and one bag of plum black tea to make a gallon pitcher, which tastes great both hot or cold.
These are a great, portable snack. Am so happy to have found them on Amazon as most local stores have stopped carrying this flavor.
I'm slowly working through these but it's a chore. The Glutino breakfast bars are very good and I ordered these because I assumed they would be good too.
I miss eating the way I used to before I found out I am allergic to wheat.  This is a great substitute for cream of mushroom soup.  You cannot tell the difference.  It tastes great!

My mom has a wheat allergy.  We have been unable to find Progresso Mushroom soup in stores here so looked here and could order it with free shipping.  Received the case in just a few days.  Looking forward to cooking all our recipes.

I suppose that every coffee lover has their own favorite brands, roasts, and blends.  Well, Cameron's has become mine.  The Gold Cup is an excellent roast of coffee.  We're not talking about any fancy flavors or tastes, but just a good, straight up coffee.  I also mix about 50/50 of this with some of Cameron's flavored blends when the flavors seem too strong.  If you want something that's a good coffee but won't totally break your budget, give this a sip!
Ordered these for a quick out the door snack, they are perfect! Delicious and perfectly portioned. They have a great shelf life as well.

I've ordered these cookies several times and never had any trouble with the packaging as the other reviewer has. More to the point, the cookies are absolutely delicious, and are always quickly devoured after I receive them.

I ordered this before and I was very pleased with the product and vendor. This is my second time ordering this product and the item was sent to me open and the packaging was terrible.  I contacted the vendor and they were sorry for what happen and offered to send me a replacement. When the replacement came it was package correctly, but the replacement item was totally different from what I had ordered.

I purchased this product as an alternative to a rawhide. Our 5 month old German Shorthair Pointer puppy ate it in a matter of 6 minutes or less. She loved it, but it was more of an expensive treat.

With a puppy, I needed something to satisfy her chewing urge. The treat fractured into small bits all over the floor but our dog was willing to pick those up. The pieces looked rather sharp and that was a concern. Others mentioned it was made in China and I would like to add the first ingredient is corn. It might last longer for very small dogs.

I picked these up from my local pet shop for a bit cheaper than what they are on offer for from Amazon, so you might wish to shop around.

Over all I am quite satisfied with these "bones." They are much safer than raw hide chews given they are made from dried chicken, which means unlike raw hide you know these are actually digestible. This is the biggest reason I bought them. My vet recommended not giving my Sheltie raw hide as they aren't properly digestible. Whether this is true or not, I've heeded her advice.

Baird, my Sheltie, really seems to enjoy them. When he sees one coming out of the bag, his tail is wagging like crazy. He enjoys these as much as our old family Sheltie McGyver enjoyed raw hide. The only difference I see between these and raw hide is that raw hide lasted roughly 30 minutes longer in chew time than these. I'd say Baird can chew through one of these in about 30 or so minutes, while our old Sheltie could chew on a single raw hide for an hour, at which point we would throw away the little nub. There is nothing left of these bones after 30 minutes.

As far as the dental application goes, it does smell of mint, so I assume it should, if nothing else, help with doggy breath, though to be fair Baird has never really had "doggy breath." I also use some dog mouth foam so I don't know what really keeps his breath "fresh" between the two.

If you aren't too sure about raw hide for your dog and want something you know can be digested, these are definitely worth it.

For those that try to keep track of where the things they give their dog come from, these are made in China. I've tried finding something similar not made in China, but it seems such a thing doesn't exist or I just can't find them.
SmartBones Dental Dog Chews are the perfect treat for my two pomeranians and one Pembroke Corgi. No rawhide, nothing to upset their sensitive stomachs. They "dance" when I give them their daily chew.

The girls lost their taste for rawhide, but were still looking for something to chew. They love these Smart Bones, and they are better for them as well. I will be reordering them when there gone!SmartBones Chicken Dog Chew, Mini, 24-Pack
Read your labels, people!!! SMART bones are made in China!!!!!! A neighbor told me how great these were. After buying them, I read the fine print in the back. "Made in China!!"
there wonderful, my dog loves them, and I feel good giving them to him, I will always get these for him.
My dogs just love these and the chews are safe for them. Their breath benefits from the mint and their dental exams show much less plaque . I must keep bags on hand; they expect them.
I have given this bone to several different breeds and sizes of dogs and it is a major hit! And I don't worry about them choking on it as you do with rawhides. LOVE this product and will buy more!

If you open the link to the Smartbones you will see that it shows a picture of a package containing a 3-pack of dog chews.  I did not get this bag, I recieved a single dog chew.  I was under the impression by looking at the description on the bag I was getting a single pkg of 3, Not just 1 dog chew.  This made these quite expensive and I ordered two :-(

I've tried about 7 different dry foods and 3 different wet foods. Non of them, again NON made my dog have normal running intestines, ever. I started mixing in preference with Oma's Pride (wet) and it has been about 2 years that he has NEVER had intestines issues again. Highly recommended and worth every penny.

Preference is an incomplete dog diet that is made complete by adding meat. Preference is added with equal parts water and allowed to rehydrate for 5 to ten minutes. Then you mix in meat an whatever else you feed your dog. I usually mix it with a ground dog food from the butcher that contains ground beef, liver and heart. I also throw in a couple of raw eggs and fish oil. The dogs absolutely love it! I've been feeding a raw diet for several years, and this product is a great supplement. The chelated nutrients in Preference are more readily available for absorption in the digestive system, something that is hard to find in the vast majority of dog diets. I don't feed Preference every day. I make large batches, freeze in single serving sizes, and thaw them out for two meals per week.

I also use Urban Wolf Dog Food Mixer 3 lb Bag, which is also an excellent product. But what I love about Honest Kitchen is that they make their foods from human grade ingredients, most of which are sourced in the US. After the scare with Chinese gluten poisoning so many pets a few years ago, I am careful about where my dogs' food comes from. Note that many of the chicken/duck jerky treats are from China!

Please note that this stuff STINKS while it's rehydrating -- I think it's the kelp or the alfalfa. Once I add the meat, and it smells fine -- unless I add sardines! I highly recommend using this product or a product like it if you're feeding a raw or otherwise grain-free diet. Your dogs will thank you.

My lab had to decrease some of her calories due to steroid induced hypothyroidism. Being that we already fed her a pretty limited diet as far as fat and calories go, cutting back even more was tough--after all, she's a lab..she's always hungry! Being able to bulk up her meal with this healthy veggie mix is a perfect way to fill her up but not OUT. It really comes in handy when I am low on fresh produce or am running late and don't have time to wash and chop. I add it to her raw in the morning and with her grain free kibble or canned at dinner. I love..love that it is made with some organic, human grade ingredients and she really loves it. I mix a tablespoon or so with yogurt for a snack between meals. Great product. Perfect solution for us.
have a lab with allergies and this is a great product to use.  Keeps the allergies down so she does not have to be on shots.

This Preference veggie mix has been an important addition to our dogs' daily meals for the past 2 years. I first began using one of Honest Kitchen's other products, Thrive, when our youngest dog (still a pup) was diagnosed with severe hip dysplasia. I chose to use a bunch of natural supplements/herbs to deal with his joint mobility/pain rather than twice-daily strong prescription meds that would destroy his liver. It put him off his food though since he didn't care for the taste of some of the supplements; so I tried to add plenty of good-tasting, healthy additions to his kibble (Pure Vita) to encourage him to eat. The "Thrive" dehydrated mix was convenient...meat and veggies together...and I still occasionally use it for that convenience when the dogs are being kenneled or kept by others. For regular daily use though, I use the Preference veggie base and add my own chicken, turkey, salmon, or bison. I find it a bit more economical to just add my own protein source since I go through quite a bit (2 dogs, and 1 is huge). Another thing that I like about the Preference mix is that one of the first two ingredients is alfalfa which has been shown to help with joint inflammation...just what my big guy needs.

I usually mix up enough for a couple days worth of meals and just keep it in the fridge. I just scoop the appropriate amount into each dog's bowl and then mix in the supplements for each pooch. I then stir in the meat and kibble along with salmon oil. They love it and they're both doing great on it!
Bought this to add into my own meat mixture for the dogs and they just love it. It's easy to make in any size and really fast.

Having recently moved here from Germany I was concerned to find a good mixer for the otherwise home prepared, raw food that I have been feeding since 2001. A Breeder friend of mine suggested the honest kitchen preference and I certainly did not look back. My dogs do very well on it and even tough the price appears high at first, buying all the ingredients seperately would be far more costly. Well done to the company for creating an excellent product that makes feeding a balanced raw diet much less complicated. I am very comfortable in advising my puppy buyers to use this product.

this company is against dog breeders of all kind. In their eyes all breeders are puppy mills... no exceptions!
Boycott their products until they wise up!

Crunchy is the key word here.

I purchased these snack bars because they don't contain the usual bugaboos: high-fructose corn syrup, hydrogenated oils, artificial sweeteners, etc. However, they're mighty hard to chew. And that's *probably* a good thing.

I'm a hardcore fan of Quaker Oats granola bars, because they're a quick snack and they're heavy-laden with sugar, but they also have the HFCS (bad, bad) and hydrogenated oils (bad, bad, BAD). However, they are easy to chew (probably because of the nice, soft plastics they contain). I am striving to slowly back away from the QO granola bars because of their unhealthy and lengthy ingredient list.

The Kashi brand snacks are agreeable to the palate and they do have enough sugar for my personal tastes, but I have a couple crowns and I wonder if my over-priced prosthetic teeth can survive this healthy eating experience.

That being said, these are the snacks of choice for long car trips. For one, I'll never pig out on them and two, they're good for the tummy. They provide a little energy boost and they're high octane fuel for this four-layer bio-suit we call a human body.

I'm working my way through the different flavors. My favorites are the pumpkin spice and peanut butter, yet honestly, I can't discern an enormous difference between these three (pumpkin, PB and honey toasted).
these are awesome little crunchy bars that taste just like the nature valley "oat and honey" ones, but with much better nutritionals and ingredients. a great, filling, slightly sweet snack!

Great breakfast bars-they keep me full until lunch.

It is hard to believe that these are good for you-they taste like graham crackers! I love them.

The [...] price is terrible though-You can actually buy 12 boxes on [...] for cheaper! 12 boxes is about $[...] bucks on their site. Amazon usually has the better deals but not this time.
These bars are so great....they taste good, its convenient to have them auto-shipped to us, and on top of that, they are healthy for me and my family.
It was a good buy, I really like Kashi products and the shipment arrived on time.

I usually grab granola bars to keep me feeling "full" between meals, and today I decided to try Kashi's Honey Toasted 7 Grain.

They are very crunchy. I prefer crunchy bars over the soft and gooey stuff, though. I really hate the soft chocolate drizzled bars from fiber one / fiber plus that taste excessively artificial.

These bars taste absolutely fantastic. This probably won't be a bar that I buy to eat in between meals, as I ended up eating them INSTEAD of dinner. They're sweet, but not too sweet.

To me, they are my second favorite granola bar, just under kashi's fruit and nut pumpkin bar.

I bought these without really reading the box, just searching for healthy honey granola bars and since I love Kashi these were simply grabbed off the shelf.

They are VERY crunchy. Don't both eating them if you need to hear anything that is being said in the immediate vicinity. But man they are tasty and very filling. I usually only eat one out of the pack and I'm full.

When our local grocery stores started stocking only the chewy Kashi breakfast bars, my husband went into a panic.  His absolute favorite is the Kashi Crunchy Honey Toasted 7 Grain eaten with a banana every morning.  Thanks to Amazon.com, we now have a regular shipment scheduled every 3 months.  Mornings are happy once again!

My whole family likes these crunchy snacks.  They are good in the car, at work or wherever when rushing from school to sports practice.  They do tend to spill crumbs easily.  Of course after I bought a case of them, my daughter decided she liked chewy ones better, but she still eats them.  I was a bit disappointing at the price - once I did the math I realized that these can be gotten cheaper from the local supermarket.
Very tasty and keeps me from eating junk food in between meals...perfect diabetic snack !!

The Kashi TLC Crunchy Granola Honey Toasted 7 Grain is very yummy.  Wonderful honey taste.  I guess the only thing I could say negative is the bar brake up in the package.  Also it is pretty crunchy so you need good teeth! The negative do not out wave the positive in taste and quality so I still give this product 5 stars.
Kashi bars are great, check them out!  This was a huge order though, they start getting boring at a certain point haha.
My family just loves the Kashi Crunchy bars. We go through so many that this was an excellent buy for my house!

These bars are very good, and I don't feel guilty eating them. They are very crunchy, like Nature Valley bars are, but they're more "natural" tasting. They're a little more "brown" than Nature Valley. I bought a whole case, and I'm not sorry. I'm sure I'll eat them up before the expiration date!
This is my go-to brand and flavor, since I can't find any Ichiban ramen on Subscribe  and Save. One of the 'top-drawer' choices of ramen.

I quote the word "instant" because, to the uninitiated, it might come as a shock that you actually have to boil the noodles rather than simply soak them in boiling hot water. The preparation time is still very quick, and it's definitely worth it.

These noodles are far thicker and chewier than your standard supermarket Top Ramen noodles. They also come with a spice package and a dry ingredients packet that contains bits of seaweed, mushrooms, and carrots.

I usually only put in about 3/4 of the spice package and add extra ingredients like nappa cabbage, shrimp, scallops, green onions, mung bean sprouts, and/or an egg. Kimchi also goes really well with these noodles.

The bulk price that Amazon offers is an excellent deal, especially for people who don't have access to Asian supermarkets. It's the perfect food to have for when you want a quick and flavorful meal.

been eating these noodles since the mid eighties. sad nong shim has discontinued the jam pong noodles. lllllooooove these noodles. i've been driving round trip two hundred miles to get them. now that i can no longer drive, i'm so happy amazon will deliver them to my front door!!!!!!! hope i can get them in a nursing home about twenty five years from now. john

First of all, I must state that this is the tastiest pre-packaged soup known to mankind. The spice mixture is a delight to my taste buds. The noodles are better quality than most pre-packaged Ramyuns. The ease of cooking this is just what you would expect. It's simple and that is why I'm often inclined to make this a meal when I know that I shouldn't. I opt to live a little in these situations.

Preparation is key. The soup by itself is probably a health hazard if you eat it each and every day. As others have mentioned, it has little to no nutrients of particular value for any diet, and high sodium content. However, when one adds a variety of meats and veggies, it could possibly be gourmet caliber soup.

I particularly enjoy cubed pork tenderloin or shrimp, mixing that with the soup. Poaching an egg or two in this soup will make it better as well. As for veggies, green onion is a definite must have, along with shitake/portobello mushrooms (I like both), and I like to add broccoli. Many times, I'll add bean sprouts and cilantro, but those are truly optional in my opinion. However, a personal favorite of mine to add to this soup is fishcake. If you don't know what that is, don't let the name fool you. Go to your local Korean market and pick some up. It's sensational in this soup.

As for the unhealthy aspect, simply use less of the packaged spice and you'll probably feel better about yourself. I use the whole thing myself, but I really don't eat these as much as I used to. Lastly, the soup without all the additional meats and veggies is still tasty, so it's not a necessity to add the extras - only recommended. I still must suggest that one poached egg be the bare minimum. Enjoy!
Our family loves these udon type noodles, thick and chewy. Very spicey so we only use half a pack of seasoning for each.
fast delivery, didn't expect it would arrive so fast. And the packaging was nice too!

I don't claim to be a noodle connoisseur and you shouldn't read it as such.  I have tried a limited number of ramen noodles, and most of them don't taste that great to me.  Something about plain chicken flavor ramen noodles leaves me dead inside.  There is a long laundry list of foods I rather each than that dreadful Maruchan Chicken Noodle flavored soup that I grew up eating.  Which explains why I hate that brand so much.  Enter Shin Ramyun noodles.  My mother bought this years ago through her Korean co-workers.  Initially I hated it.  Then some time passed and I learned that you can modify the ramen noodles to your hearts desire.  Well that was a game changer for me.  I started off with a egg and some frozen vegetables and haven't looked back.  Nowadays when I am looking for something cheap and quick (But not necessarily healthy because honestly when has anything cheap and quick wins up healthy and taste good?  Yeah I though so) I use Shin Ramyun noodles as a base.  What I would do is this: boil the water till hot, add my protein (be it egg, shrimp, fish, etc), then add the freeze-dried vegetables, then add a small amount of the seasoning packet (or usually none at all), keep boiling till soft/cooked.  Then I would add my vegetables (frozen or fresh), let it cook for a while, then I would add my noodles last and turn off the stove and let it sit in the soup mixture for about two to five minutes.  I like my noodles firm so I always add my noodles last.  The worst thing in the world is mushy noodles.  Then I would add my hot sauce (either the Sriracha[sic] sauce or the Korean hot pepper paste) and if I am feeling fancy, I would add some radish top kimchi and I am in heaven.  Basically I learn to experiment to see what I liked.  You don't have to use the seasoning packet.  Heck I learned that folks add butter to the noodles and eat like that, which is different (read strange as h*ll) to me but as long as they are eating it, who cares.

Yummy ramen.  Very spicy, but this has lots of seaweed, and the noodles are great - tick and chewy.  If you want to avoid some of the sodium & fat don't eat all of the broth - focus on the noodles!  Add veg for more nutritional content ;)  Ramen is supposed to be quick and easy and cheap and filling, not a "superfood" - all ramen are really bad for you.  This one is one of the better ones taste-wise.  And no I'm not Korean - I'm actually Eastern European!
Good Spicy Korean Instant Noodle. It will open up your sinus, great for cold weather.

This is one of the best instant noodle I have ever had. Be warned. It is very spicy if you put in all the spice in the red chilly pack. There are some other flavor of this kind, but seafood flavor seems to be the best of all.

Nong Shim Neoguri Spicy Seafood Noodle Ramyun, Family Pack, 4.2-Ounce Packages (Pack of 30) is a good product, easy and quick to make. some say it's too seafoody, but I think it has a good light seaweed taste. my Korean friends use this product along with some added cut green onions, fresh thinly sliced mushrooms and garlic and a little soy. this size packaging is the best value and is packed as family size 6 - five bag packages.

Nong Shim makes great ramen noodles.  This one has great flavor and the noodle is fairly thick and tasty.  However you need to add more water than the package suggested or it's going to be salty.  It's best to cook it in the pot with boiling water for 4 minutes and the noodle texture tastes different than my lazy ramen noodle mode (soak it in boiling water for 4 minutes).  Give it a try and their rest of the lineup (especially the udon bowl)!

When I bought this, I didn't realize the noodles are different from Ramyun spicy picante.  Ramyun is the thinner yellow noodle and neoguri is the thicker white japanese udon noodle.  Unlike the kimchi flavor, this has enough spices to satisfy your craving and since I do not dislike udon noodles, I give it 4 stars.  But it is not as good as Ramyun picante and I give ramyun 5 stars.  My boyfriend is german / irish American and he loves these noodles...even this spicy neoguri.  I believe the fishy smell would be for the seafood flavoring.  This is for a 30 pack/case and there is a 20 pack/case which may be cheaper.  So if you still aren't sure, try a pack before you buy a case.

I'm a bit surprised how foul this soup smells and tastes. I doubt that many, unless their ethnic roots are Korean or similar, will find this soup pleasing. The taste is a bit odd, to say the very least. The actual taste is hard to describe but "seafood" is certainly not the word I'd use to describe this product. Seafood implies to me - either fish or shellfish. The closest I can come to an adequate description of this soup is it has the smell of drying seaweed and/or the aroma of fish food.

As someone said in the comments section of this review: "I just couldn't get past the smell."

Beyond the unusual seaweed flavor (which I obviously didn't like) --- there are only three other dominant tastes - a VERY heavy dose of salt, the bitterness of MSG and a lot of cayenne pepper. The noodles are essentially tasteless yet ladened with 500 calories of saturated fats. The MSG just adds to the unpleasant flavor notes. To be clear - this is a highly processed "food". In fact, very few of the soup's many ingredients are even recognizable as any type of food.

HEALTH WATCH: While I'm not a health nut - this soup crosses even my very low bar for products that are better off avoided. One packet of this soup provides almost 90% of an individual's daily allowance of salt and 40% of the allowed Saturated Fats (thanks to the palm oil used to fry the noodles). While many of us think of soup as a reasonably healthy product - that is simply not the case with this soup. Each packet of this soup has about 500 calories.

HEADS UP - some of the reviews on Amazon strike me as a bit suspect: There are a number of 5 star reviews generated by One Time ONLY Amazon reviewers. Once these "reviewers" have promoted this company's product - they never publish another review. I've seen this same pattern, time after time, for all the other soups made by this particular company.

Even if you have no concern about salt, calories or saturated fats - the smell and taste I doubt will appeal to many.

I had a real craving for ramen a few days ago, and considering that the Spicy Picante from Nong Shim was pretty good, I decided to give this a try when I saw it at my HyVee.

Like the other reviewer, the smell itself was a huge deterrent. I, too, came to the conclusion that it smelled like fish-food the second I got a waft of it, and my friend agreed.

The noodles are good as they're much thicker/chewier. The taste of the broth, though, was just down-right disgusting. To me, it just tasted like spoiled fish. One bite and it was in the trash. Ran back to the store and bought a package of Spicey Picante.

I first got introduced to the Greenies brand with my cat who took to it like a bee to honey. Happy to report that dogs love the canine version just as much. The Value Tub guarantees your dog will be taken care of when the End of the World arrives ;) Slip a few in the pocket, bring a dog travel bowl like this one Bliss Paws Collapsible Dog Travel Bowl-Strawberry Pink and you're off to the races!

This is a regular item on my shopping list. Now that I see they have them for online ordering for almost $10 less than at my local pet shop. I know where to buy them.  They come in a larger quantity and are less expensive, so I don't have to order as often as I would normally have to go to the store. My dogs will do anything for these healthy treats.

My 2 small dogs LOVE these.  It keeps their breath fresh and does actually minimize tartar build up on their teeth. One of my dogs is not food motivated and could care less about chewing on bones and chew toys. BUT, she goes absolutely nuts for these. They are not messy and the new formula digests just as well as their dog food. I give each of my dogs one per day so I buy them in these bulk packages. I highly recommend these.

Greenies tries to position itself as a healthy treat, but I'm not so sure.

My dogs love them, but buyers should be aware that one of the main ingredients in Greenies is wheat, which, according to my vet, sticks to teeth like glue. In my mind this makes the product as deceiving as lip balm companies who put alcohol into their products. Buyers should also be aware of how much sugar is used in these products, which probably contributes to the high caloric value. I also take huge issue with the high cost and wasteful -- often non-recyclable -- packaging.

Overall, dogs love them, but they really aren't very healthy. You're better off giving them a cheaper rawhide stick, which does a much better job of cleaning teeth.
These thing are like crack for dogs. I am not sure of the make-up but the doggies sure love them.
My shih tzu absolutely loves these.  He knows when it is time for bed and he gets his special bone. He lays on the bed and smacks in pure bliss. I will buy them again and again!

My Cavalier is the best dog ever! Whenever I went to the pet store I would look at these and want to buy a big box. Due to the price I usually just picked up one or two singles for a nice treat. He loved them! I saw them on Amazon and decided to be a kind pet owner and get him a box. Everyday about noon he gets one. I know when it's noon because he walks up to me and puts his paws on my legs and then turns circles. When I say, "Do you want a Greenie"? he goes nuts and runs to the cabinet where I keep them.
Happy dog
Happy owner
Our poodle gets one every evening as a special treat. He loves them. I always keep a good supply on hand. It is not only a treat, but it helps clean their teeth.

My dog loves Greenies. They clean her teeth wonderful and is a great snack for her.  I have a very small dog so we cut them in half so they'll last longer.  I was pleased when we found them on Amazon at the price they sell them plus free shipping.  I love Amazon.

Greyhounds notoriously have bad breath.  I first bought Greenies years ago when my first greyhound, Sophie, was alive.  She very much enjoyed these treats and her breath improved, at least a little.  Several dogs later, I was excited to bring a box of Greenies back to Mexico to give to my two dogs, Etheldreda - a greyhound, and Sadie - a greyhound mix.  I'm sorry that I can't find them in Mexico and I hate to ration out the Greenies because of the short supply.  Greenies are expensive, but they do help with the dogs' bad breath.  And my dogs love Greenies.
My dogs look forward to their daily treat of Greenies.  Daily reward plus breath freshener for dogs.  Great price for the value size container, fast shipping.
They love it, and I love the price here. I have two yorkies and they both have one a day. Saving a little in the things they use daily is great. It is the same product as in the pet store.

My dog is still young, so no teeth problems yet.  She knows when I say toothbrush, she's getting a Greenie....the last thing she gets to eat at night.  For once, something that is good for her is also somethings she enjoys.

I love greenies as a treat for my American Staffy.  She has never gotten sick after eating these treats.  They clean her teeth and keep her breath fresh.  Unfortunately they are very expensive and even at a discounted price, at $1+ per treat, it is quite pricey.  I may look at comporable brands that are less costly, since she eats any type of treat thrown her way.  I am lucky that she is not picky.

My dog loves Greenies. It is usually a rare treat because it is so expensive. I was thrilled to find this lightning deal. I only wish that I could have bought more than one canister. Thanks for giving Scooter 24 days of delicious treats.
My dogs get all excited when I come home since they will get a Greenie as a treat.  They love the taste plus it cleans their teeth.

We had a dog for nearly 16 years, who had terrible teeth and foul breath, and ended up needing surgery to remove 19 teeth.  She had infections under the teeth into the bone beneath.  She ended up with kidney disease and we lost her several months ago.  We now have a 1 year old pit/lab mix, Daisy, who will not let us brush her teeth, and I am determined to keep her teeth healthy.  Daisy gets one regular greenie (she weighs 57#) after her evening meal.  Daisy goes bonkers when I open the package, dancing all around the kitchen.  She loves them so much. Daisy gulps down her food, but the texture of the greenies forces her to take her time when she eats them.  So far her breath is not even noticeable, and her teeth are pearly white.  Also, I never give her wet food, which sticks to her teeth.  And, she chews on nylabones throughout the day.  Buying this through amazon.com saves me at least $10, so I am happy to get this online.  The packages always arrive on time and in good shape.  When the weather was very hot and humid here, I did get one box where some of the greenies were stuck together, but the individual greenies were still in good shape.  I highly recommend this product.

i didnt buy them off of here simply because i get them cheeaper at petsmart
however i will say that my dog loves them! i swear she can eat them in 10 minutes and shes only six months old! i always tell people how much she loves them

Good product. My 5 yr old cocker spaniel LOVES 'em.
Great pricing and prompt delivery. Very satisfied.
Will order again when they're used up.

Ijust need to tell you, My dogS LOVE GREENIES. Besides Variety Snaps, These are my FAVORITE. one of my smaller dogs, Cloie. Had THE WORST BREATH. now since Greenies, I would let her Kiss me. Thank Yor So Much For Continuing to carry thtm.

I'm very happy & please with the entire process. it is not the first time I order it, so I wil keep ordering.
received the next day, my dog's favorite treat.  He needs them daily for his tarter and it is much improved!!

This is great!!! first time my dog had greenies is when I bought a single. He is a picky eater and we were desprate to do something about his breath. He loved it and helped his breath. We buy big boxes of them now.
My dog loves these treats.  They really help to keep her teeth clean in between brushing. They also help her breath stay fresh and works well as a reward when she is good.

My dogs bark at me every morning until they get their Greenie treat. They are addicted to them. I have 3 dogs so it is a bit pricey but that is why I order from Amazon so that I can keep up with their addiction! We use two different sizes of Greenies and the teenie size is good but then they want more than one. If I give them the size larger then I can get away with only one treat per day. I can't really speak to how well it leans teeth, but my dogs likes them.  I say likes because he doesn't go nuts for them, but he will eat them.  Overall I think it is a good product and I would reccomend buying it.

These are great treats, in moderation.  I find if Mollie (63 pound Golden) gets more than three per week, her stool "greens up".  Also, she likes variety.  The seller I frequent is fast, always packages well and the price is right.
My pug loves these. Great little treat for her and I know it's also helping to clean her teeth while she just likes the taste.

My dogs love greenIes.  They may not understand anything else, but they they understand greenies.  Every time I ask my partner to give them greenies, all there of them jump up and run to the and state at the container it is in.  They get there before us.  I have shepherd, lab, and blue tick.  Shepherd is the picky dog.  She does not like Hyde or even dog biscuits, but she loves these

These are great, both my dogs love these. so glad they shipped semi fast, and have a bunch to last me a few months. def recommend!

Recevied the Greenies before the expected delivery date.  Great value compared to the pest food stores.  Big plus not having to deal with car and foot traffic.  Dogs are happy and that makes me happy!  Thank you and keep up the good work.

THIS ONES ARE GREAT FOR MY 20 POUND DOG. THE RULE OF THUMB TO KNOW IF YOU HAVE THE CORRECT SIZE OF GREENI IS IF IT TAKES HIM MORE THAN 1 MINUTE TO FINISH IT AND LESS THAN 2 THEN YOU HAVE THE RIGHT SIZE.

This is a great bargain - a much better deal than I can get at my local pet store. I use these as special treats for my dogs - not an everyday thing but for especially good behavior or when I'm compelled to pamper them.
My dogs love Greenies and my cost savings purchase with Amazon was perfect timing for me as I was almost out.

We previously got a few of these at a local pet store to see if our dog liked them. Sure enough, she loved them. They are quite costly compared to other dog treats but they do a good job with keeping her breath "fresh" and as previously mentioned, she loves them.
These lower calorie Greenies are just what our dog ordered, or would have if he had fingers.  They are great for his teeth--and waist line--and beat brushing.
