I first tried this honey in a small mom and pop diner in Montrose Colorado. I came away from that diner with 2 bottles. That was 1996. I've been buying this honey long distance ever since. It does not have the after taste of regular honey, tastes richer, thicker, etc. etc. Only honey I will buy. Except for the HIGH Altitude Honey this company also sells. It is absolutely the most flavorful honey in the world, although more expensive. But worth every penny.

I read the previous reviews and was pretty shocked at the great feedback people had for this honey. After going out on a limb and ordering this I decided to try it myself.

First - the packaging. The plastic bottle itself is a bit cumbersome - sometimes I have give it an iron grip squeeze in order to get the honey out. It does really give off that "hometown raw" aesthetic though.

Second - the consistency & color. My wife and I prefer raw honey and have tried various other brands (whole foods, farmers markets) and usually the consistency of the other brands is an extremely thick goo, which you have to spoon out. What's refreshing about this honey is how smooth it is. Another thing with the other brands of raw honey is the color. The other brands I've tried have a dark amber color (resembles apple butter almost), however, this honey although slightly darker than regular grocery store bought honey, it still has a fairly normal color. My guess for the lighter color is attributed to the raw purity of this kind of honey.

Third - and lastly the taste. This is the primary reason why I give this honey five stars. Although as I mentioned the packaging is a bit cumbersome, I'd eat this honey if it came in a bowling ball. Well, maybe not, but you get the point. The taste is what matters. This honey is hands down the tastiest honey I've ever had in my entire life. It's sweet but not overbearing and no bitter aftertaste like other honeys I've tried. You MUST try this honey at least once in your life. It's refreshing to know that I no longer need to look anymore for great honey - I'm a customer for life.

I grew up on the Western Slope of Colorado and know exactly where this honey comes from since my mom used to take me to the fields to get honey comb when I was a kid. For me, it not only brings back fond memories, but I am so happy to have great honey again! I live in AZ now and the honey not only tastes funky but it sugars very quickly. Since the only sweetener I use is honey I am particular about the flavor; not only that, but this even smells like the flowers from whose nectar it is made. I've got it on subscription which makes it ridiculously inexpensive.

On the strength of the reviews for this, I decided to give Ambrosia Honey a shot. It's a gamble buying honey, having never tasted it.

Luckily, this honey exceeded my expectations. I normally buy locally-produced honey at twice the cost. The depth of flavor is much better with this honey. It's hard to describe, but the flavor is both complex and light. If you're used to cheap grocery store honey, Ambrosia Honey will be a real treat.

The price for this 4-pack is what pushes this honey to five-stars. It's an incredible value, considering what good honey costs.

The dispensers are well sealed, and it would be difficult, if not impossible, for these to leak in transit.

This honey is very good, but I had a problem with the top. I had to finally cut the tip off with a scissors, to be able to squeeze out the honey! Now, I am using that same top on the new bottles, which helps a lot. The honey, itself, has a very nice aroma and flavor.

This honey has a nice taste. But despite what the label says, I don't believe it is either raw or unfiltered. It has the clarity and consistency of garden variety honey found at any grocery chain.

The plastic bottles do not seal adequately for shipping -- one of the 4 bottles in my shipment was lost due to leakage.

Ambrosia Pure Honey is delicious and, unlike most honey available at the grocery store, this honey is produced in the USA.

My only complaint about this honey is that it comes in a bottle that is very inconvenient to use. The main drawback is that there's nowhere for the honey to come out of the bottle unless you unscrew the whole cap and pour the honey out of the bottle. If you want to be able to squirt honey out of the bottle's nozzle, you need to make a hole in it yourself. This is no easy feat because the bottle cap is made of hard plastic that can't really be cut with scissors. I usually end up pouring this honey into a different bottle in order to be able to use it more easily.

I love the honey and the price is right, I think.  The bottles are large and come in a 4-pack which I like.  Both my husband and I use honey in our coffee every morning.  When I purchased this honey I was looking for a darker kind than what I can find here in Western North Carolina. True, there are darker honeys available on Amazon, but most I looked at were rather expensive.  My only complaint about this honey is that it's a little messy when pouring because it does not stop cleanly and I usually have to just clamp the top down on it to stop it.  Not a big deal, really.  I just make sure to wipe the bottle off before I store it back in the cabinet.

Grocery store honey, with very few exceptions, is all I'm used to.

I gave this product a try based on other's comments and found it to be very, very good. It's thicker and more flavorful than what most are used to buying at the grocery store, and it doesn't leave one with an unpleasant aftertaste.

This will probably be the only honey I'll be consuming in the forseeable future.

(a few months later)

The plastic bottles this honey comes in are not very reliable, the last shipment had one leak out (came home to a box full of ants) and the quality of the honey I received in the summer was very different form what I had bought in the winter.

This honey is the best there is! We're in the Army so we travel alot, but being originally from Colorado I have always loved this honey, I just cant find it anywhere. So I was thrilled that Amazon sold it in bulk. Now I stock up on this honey because the flavor is so good, I have never tasted better honey. Also Amazon does a great job at shipping the honey, never recieved a broken bottle of honey and the honey has always been a perfect consistency, never hard or crystalized.

This arrived in perfect condition. It's hands down the best tasting honey I've ever had. I use honey to sweeten everything and have tried a lot of different ones. This is my favorite!
The bottles are the size of the little bears...perfect for squeezing into my coffee, tea, pancakes, etc!

Delicious honey!  It is hard to find a raw, unfiltered honey that tastes this good, and the price is great!  If you use honey regularly, I recommend the subscribe and save option for this product, you will not be disappointed.

I don't usually care for honey, but I love this Ambrosia Pure Honey From Colorado's Western Slope.  It is sweet, but doesn't have that overpowering "honey" taste.  It's hard to describe, but I do love it.  Also, I can't take sweets too well, as they make me nauseous, but I can have this honey on my buckwheat cereal and feel just fine. I've already ordered another 4 pack.

Very good Honey, at the price I paid for the 4-pack I will most certainly buy again. If you are a fan of pancakes or waffles try them with Honey instead of syrup! Did you know it is also a Natural pain reliever as well? Do the research. Enjoy!
This brand has its own distinct taste from other honeys. This is in my top three choices of honeys to use. Great price for the size and count. This is a good alternative for sugar and syrup.

I try to support anything USA made and especially businesses that are "doing the right thing." IMHO this honey has so special flavor or texture, in fact it crystallizes even when stored unopened. But I like the fact that it supports bee populations in a healthy locale. With the plight of the declining bee as it struggles to survive we need environments such as this to ensure the bee and our agriculture systems survive. So for that reason and since it is raw and unfiltered, I will continue to buy this product. Other honeys you may want to try that are sold on AMZN are Cal's Tupelo raw honey made in GA (incredibly good and smooth), and outside of the US consider Manuka Honey from New Zealand (amazing health benefits) and my very favorite is Bernard Michaud 1000 Flower Honey from the South of France. It is very expensive but truly heavenly and worth the price as a special treat. I use this one solely on toast or pastries or by the spoonful.  At Tropical Traditions I buy their Canadian organic raw and unfiltered honey that in order to be somewhat cost effective, I buy it in a 15# pail that lasts a year. I use honey mainly during the fall and winter for constant tea sweetening (yes. I gain a few pounds) but I rationalize it's healthier than organic sugar and it supports bee farmers.
This is very famous honey in Korean community.You can believe this product for the reliability. My family likes this honey a lot.Thank you so much for this product in amazon.

Great natural honey with clean, bright taste.  Doesn't have the chemical taste of store bought honey.  Not too sweet.. The packaging is easy to use.  Lid seals properly and doesn't drip.  Great on homemade breads.

I received my item(s) damaged (2 of the 4 bottles seals were not air tight,and caused them to leak)

After reading the reviews, I noticed a few other customers had the same problem with leakage.
I think Amazon should attach a second seal to prevent the bottles from leaking during shipping.

I called Amazon, and they fixed the problem! The only thing that sucks is, I have to wait a month until the order ships!!! (I think they have to wait for a shipment from their supplier?)

At least I got to keep the damaged order to hold me over until the replacement comes!

This honey is the best I have ever tasted, and very affordable!
I am so glad I purchased this!
These are the small bottles, but there are larger bottles available.

I was hoping for some reason that this being unfiltered honey, I would get an extra boost of energy or feel some kind of benefit. Didn't get anything like that, but it still taste really good, can't really tell the difference between store bought, but the smell is pretty noticeable. Not a bad or strong smell just a different smell. I have this on a subscribe and save plan, and will try other honey products from this company. Shipping was prompt and bottles were in great condition.

This honey tastes great, has the perfect texture and is very healthy for you. I ordered the case of four and one of the lids came off during shipping, spilling honey all over the inside of the box (nobody's fault, really). I called Amazon and they "made it right". Gotta love their customer service (and the honey).

I wish I could order more without the long wait... :(

I ordered two 3-gallon jugs of honey to cook with for the Specific Carbohydrate Diet.  I received four 16oz. bottles of raw Ambrosia Colorado honey.  It's great.  I haven't tasted good, natural honey like this in years.  I'll reorder, it's going fast.
Sourwood is my fav honey but this is a very close 2nd.  Good price too!

I have already tried before different kinds of honey that I bought from grocery stores but there is no honey that can compare to Ambrosia honey, the taste is so pure, not so sweet,I use it everyday for my smoothie drink and with almost anything. I don't use white sugar anymore as they are made from chemicals. I first purchased this at vitamin shoppe but I found the best price here at Amazon.com. I love...love...love the taste and I am already hooked...try it yourself, you will like it too....

When I was a kid I hated honey. Primarily because my mom always bought the stuff in the Bear. It always tasted like plastic too me. Fast forward 15 years and I am living in Colorado. I bought this on a whim one day just to see if there was a difference between the expensive (moderately) and the cheap stuff. All I can say is this is one of the finest tasting things I have ever put in my mouth. With my first container I found myself sneaking spoonfuls of nothing but honey for the first 2 months. Now I am content to add a teaspoon full to my Earl Grey every morning and anytime I have biscuits or need a tiny bit of sweet.

Simply amazing! Can't say enough good things about it.

Oh oddly enough my tabby likes a little bit now and again as well.

best honey ever but 1st u need to drain it n another jar.
when i squeezed the honey out the bottle cap burst off & honey flew everywhere!!

What happened?!?! I just signed on here to get more and it's saying unavailable. NOOOOO!
I kept forgetting to pick up honey at the grocery store so one night when I was making my tea and realized I was completely out I turned to amazon. This was priced close to store honey so I thought I would give it a try. SO happy I did. If they ever get it back in stock, this will be the only honey I buy. I've recommended it to all my family and friends. Taste is great, high quality, full of flavor. Bottles could be a little better, but they arrived in perfect condition. If you love honey, you HAVE to try this!

I haven't been too terribly pleased with the store bought honey I purchased, so I decided to check out Amazon for a tasty alternative. I purchased this particular honey based on the excellent reviews and terrific price. Sure you have to buy in bulk, but that's well worth it. This is honestly one of the best honeys I've ever tried. I'm thrilled with this purchase!

I think it s the best honey ever.
whenever I bake bread, add this honey.
This is a number 1 honey to me.
Tasty!!!
Good testing honey. The description claims that they do not overheat it, if it is true then it is great product for the price.
I use it for my tea everyday.  Very good flavor and excellent price.  Very fast shipping and great packaging.  Order yours today.

Much better honey than the stuff that comes in the little bear at the supermarket, and it's very inexpensive! The packaging is a little bit annoying, you have to cut off the tip of the spout but it's such thick plastic you need to use cutters or a very heavy pair of scissors, but it's also sealed with a foil seal which help prevents contamination during shipping.

You don't need a lot of words to review this honey...it tastes better, is healthier and less expensive than store bought honey. As usual, Amazon service was great too.

(And btw, the containers are fine. Strong enough and were not leaking a drop when I opened the box)
I am very pleased with both the quality and price of this honey. With subscribe and save, this is cheaper than the honey at Costco.
This honey is so smooth and delicious. Floral and sweet with a beautiful amber color, it goes wonderfully with my hot tea.

This honey has been consistently a perfect "5" for over a year since we started the automatic deliveries every 3 months. The honey is the color of the picture and not cloudy at all. It has a very nice mild flavor. We use it daily. I gave some as Christmas gifts this year to introduce others to it and they loved it. Since I depleted our supply, I ordered an extra shipment and it was sent immediately. Do yourself a favor: sign up for the auto-ship option to save some $ and time! This honey will not disappoint you! Perfect!
I had this shipped to me overseas from the States and I'm thrilled with it! It's delicious, and just the perfect taste and consistency for my afternoon tea!

This honey has an amazing taste and a natural, luxurious texture. Its color is dark and its flavor has a mild cinnamon-like undertone. It does great with my favorite green tea and makes an average slice of bread delectable!

The packaging is good as well. It doesn't leak and preserves the honey's freshness for long after opening the bottle. I haven't had to clean the sides of the containers like I used to with commercial honey because these bottles don't drip as much.

Another reviewer noted the honey crystallizes, but the company tells you how to avoid and solve the problem directly on the package. I almost hoped the honey would crystallize a bit, I love eating a little spoonful of honey with bits of crystals in it...

I live in Colorado but I will continue to order this honey from Amazon, as the local honeys available from my grocers aren't quite as good as Ambrosia's. I recommend this product.

I use minimum 4 teaspoons of honey everyday and since I had not tried Mountain Honey before I bought this hoping this was it.
While I don't know if this is indeed pure Mountain Honey, I can tell you that this is better than the only other brand in the market that I had been using until now.

I found both of them to be good quality honey, but this one is better. This one is less processed (which is a good thing) which I detected from the taste and viscosity. It is more viscous and only mildly sweet- just like how real honey should be.
I punched the same size hole as the one in the market honey bottle and I had to press hard to squeeze this out of the bottle while market honey would start flowing the moment I tilted. (I accounted for bottle size, weight etc.)

Regarding problems with punching holes (mentioned in earlier reviews), I have a small pair of steel scissors that just fits in my palm and it was a cinch to punch a hole with that. Alternatively you can use a thumbtack or a nail.
Please don't try to cut the top.

Regarding the bottle itself, while I do like the "Punch-your-own-hole" approach and the cap to close the hole securely , I don't like the fact that the entire top doesn't screw tight around the bottle. Some honey can flow out and stick on the sides. But that's neither much honey, nor does it happen often so its not a big problem.

This may be slightly expensive than the honey in the market but I think its worth it.
My honey arrived yesterday with no leakage. The honey tastes great! It doesn't have that acidic aftertaste that the honey at my local supermarket does. The price is very competative as well.

helping my Grandfather tend to the bee hives that he maintained for the Apple/Peach and Pear Orchards on the Mohawk Trail in Western Mass.

the taste is excellent - the packaging very good - the spout top better than the 'Honey Bear' head to pour from as well as wipe clean.

off to try on some McCann's Irish Oatmeal - McCANN'S Steel Cut Irish Oatmeal, Quick & Easy, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)

4 min in deep bowl in Microwave - Berries in bottom if desired - or even canned drained fruits/ Peaches - Pears

Topping with Honey and Whip Cream a perfect comfort food on a nasty winter day.
Even as bedtime snack - as will not upset stomach

This is wonderful honey. Four pounds of Ambrosia honey arrived today in square 16-ounce plastic bottles with tight seals. ...no leaks of any kind. Which is good because the honey arrived in the same box as our order for ocean fish canned catfood. But due to excellent packaging, all the flavors are wonderful, distinct and separate. (Our cats approved the catfood, we really welcomed the Ambrosia honey.)
Seriously, this honey is a natural and life-sustaining product, credit where credit is due. I tried some right after it arrived today; I had no joint pain after eating this honey, which means to me it is natural and doesn't contain corn syrup or high fructose corn syrup, a chemical additive to some other brands of honey these days, they tell me. I am grateful for no joint pain, no corn. Pure honey.
Other reviews have told you about gentle handling of the product, and that any crystallizing (solidifying) is normal and reversible in a bath of warm water.
So let me concentrate on what a terrific, necessary product this honey is in your kitchen cupboard and your emergency supplies. Honey, peanut butter, and dry milk (or protein powder like MLO) mixed together make a terrific emergency food.
Proportions are as follows:1/4 cup honey
1/3 cup peanut butter
1/2 cup dry milk or protein powder ,\\
Mix together into stiff dough that you can separate into bars or into 1-inch balls. (Many variations of this on recipe websites, if you want to look for them)
Keeps in fridge, but during a power outage this mix will be so popular and useful, it won't need to be stored, just more of it made.
This is an old Adelle Davis nutritional recipe, credit where credit is due, and in addition this homemade food resembles to a degree a French-manufactured product called Plumpy'nut successfully used by UNICEF to help severely malnourished children. (more about this on the Web, if you want to know more.)
Finally, for your emergency kit, a small amount of honey will help close a scrape or wound, and start it healing. So many uses for this helpful product from the honeybees. You can't lose but will win many times over with this Ambrosia natural honey.
Bought this honey and my family uses it for everything, toast, tea, coffee, peanut butter/honey. Has a good flavor, would recommend
Ambrosia continues to put out the best honey at a very reasonable price. We have ordered this honey many times and it never fails to disappoint.
I like it very much. it is really worthy. the quality is so good. and the price is very reasonable.

i had have a pretty handful experiences with honey and most honey i bought is disappointing. I saw this product on amazon and decide that let's give it a try. It is very exciting for me because this is "real". That means it's not made by sugar but come from a natural resource. I highly recommand this honey to everyone, good honey is worth your money.
HOPE THEY KEEP IT IN STOCK, SEEMS WHEN THERE'S SOMETHING GOOD IT'S ALL GONE NEXT TIME YOU ORDER.
Ambrosia honey is a good product.  It got here fast, and I am quite happy with my purchase.

This is definitely some of the best honey I've consumed. So far the product is used primarily as a sweetener for teas.

Would and have recommended it to a friend.

I'm not a connoisseur, but I like this honey. It's a bit sweeter than I prefer, but I like the flavor. I use it mainly in tea and can just adjust the amount I use. The color is rich and it has good viscosity. The 16 oz (weight) bottle is just the right size to keep at work.
Ambrosia is a fabulous honey - strong, distinct flavor - for a virtuous price.  Best deal around for raw honey!

I subscribed this product on June, and now I only have one bottle left. I love this brand of honey, and I use it everyday for everything. I use it to give peach iced tea more flavor, or use it for smoothie and many many things. Most importantly the quality is so good, but the price is so affordable. Much better than the honey I can get from supermarket.

My DSL died in mid-post so forgive me if this is a duplicate review.

First, I'd like to say that in the past I've been very critical of Amazon's packing jobs. But this time, the product was packaged expertly. Thank you.

A few years ago, I used to get fresh honey from a farmer/beekeeper close to a large metro area. Like this honey, his honey was pure and unfiltered raw honey - and it tasted great. So, to beat the taste of his honey, this honey had a high bar to overcome. And, it did. When I opened up one of the bottles, I squirted a bit on my tongue for a taste test. And when I tasted it, I thought I'd just died and gone to Heaven. This honey wasn't just great, it was incredibly superb. I guess the difference between the farmer's honey and this honey must be the Colorado wildflowers. And, they did make all the difference.

This will be a "must buy" item in the future and I might even do it by "subscription." Besides using it in my coffee instead of aspartame (yuck) or sugar, I'm going to keep one bottle on my office desk. And whenever I get a bad-tasting mouth, I'll just squirt my problem away (grin).
This honey is delicious!  It has good flavor.  We are repeat customers.  The honey did not crystalize through the duration of the two of us using 4 bottles.
This honey was some of best damn honey I ever used. Naturally, I'll be ordering more in the near future. Tastes so good, you can drink it out the bottle.
This is excellent honey with a delicate flavor suited to many uses.  I like it in hot tea or simply drizzled on fruit or cereal.  It definitely beats the usual products from most grocery stores.
You will be very pleased with this honey.  It is so very delicious.  No disappointment with this honey, you will enjoy!

I had no idea honey tasted this good. I had been looking for a healthy alternative to cane sugar and artificial sweeteners for my tea, so I purchased a 16 oz jar of honey from the grocery store for $15. This Ambrosia honey makes the grocery store brand look like garbage. It has a very sweet taste to it, almost like apple pie filling, whereas the grocery store brand was somewhat tangy/sour. This costs 1/4 of the price too...

Will definitely buy again when I run out.
This is the best honey I've ever bought. It tastes just like the one my grandma used to have when I was a kid. It's not cheap but worth every penny. The taste is great plus it's not imported.
The honey tastes great and you can't beat the price.  It's cheaper than the so called honey that is sold in supermarkets.
This is good honey flows easy has a slight cinnamon flavor clear and so far has not crystallized at all, I'm almost done with bottle two. I enjoy a teaspoon full in my tea.

Good luck finding a lower price on natural honey! I've bought this 4-pack several times with Amazon's subscribe & save deal. I use honey in my tea and recipes, and I make mead with it. This one has a vaguely spicy, but still delicate flavor. The only thing I can think to compare it to is cinnamon but it's much more subtle. Very delicious. The bottles are nothing special, kind of thin, and I have to saw the top off to get the honey to come out easily, but don't let that stop you from buying some! I urge anyone to try this honey if you're looking for natural, healthy honey, or if you want to get away from the filtered mass-marketed honey that is often smuggled illegally into the U.S.

Excellent honey. It's filtered and heated but not enough to kill the enzymes in it. I'll definitely buy it again and again :)Ambrosia Pure Honey From Colorado's Western Slope, 16-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 4)
Doesn't really resemble wildflower. Has the tartness and pungency of regular old clover honey. Much prefer the same company's other offering in the 23 ounce bottle.

This honey is sweet without the over-powering flavor of clover honey.  The price is right & I get a package delivered every month. (I signed up for the subscription service.)  This is great since I drink tea and go through one bottle a week.

I did find this so tasty like many people here, but it's just basic honey. It's great for a honey made by hummingbirds. It's rather expensive for what you get, you also have to "poke" out a hole in the plastic tip, which is hard if you don't have a point knife. So far I've put it on toast and in tea. Very great tasting and fresh.

This is very good honey. Rich, creamy, with a floral flavor. You almost get the flavor of honeycomb with out the waxy feel in your mouth. Some honey tastes strong, this honey just has a lot of flavor. I bought this to put in my tea but so far I have just been enjoying it plain.
We love this honey.  Great flavor.  Arrived quickly and it great condition.  I like that it isn't overly processed.  Would buy this again.

Title says it all. After reading an article regarding how virtually all of the honey bought in grocery and big box stores has all of the honey filtered out (short of the organic, etc), we decided to expand our horizons and are glad we did.

This honey is wonderful. It's darker than our store bought counterpart and really has a more complex flavor profile also. My parents were up recently and we had this out to finish off our pizza crust with and they couldn't stop raving about it either. Guess I just gave this company a new customer.

very sweet!!
it's got four packs in one go, and leak-free cap. Me and my family enjoyed the flavour, and the texture. I'd recommend this product to friends and neighbours.

Previously purchased organic honey from WF which we liked.  Wanted to try this highly rated raw honey and found it to have a very mild taste.  Will switch to Ambrosia  ;o)  Also 4 bottles were very well packed and not a single drop was lost in the shipment to Hawaii.

I'm only on my first bottle but in just a short time I'm almost through it already.  I use it for my morning latte.  It s very good and I like the convenience of it being pourable, although I don't know how they make a raw honey pourable.  If it's the real, genuine article, I'm very happy to have found it.  I signed up for the automatic shipments every 6 months.

My wife's been using this brand of honey in her tea for at least two months now.She likes it better than what we've been buying at our local store.I really like the fact that it's a product of the good ole USA.I have nothing against India mind you but...and have no issues with Amazon transactions
This is actually very Good Honey, Will order again in the Future When Stock runs Lower Recommend to everyone who ever Likes the sweet Taste

This honey is delicious and well worth the price. The taste is just on the right side between too dark and too light. I have so far eaten this honey on toast, in tea, on a bagel(went very well with cream cheese)and with peanut butter. Everyone who has tried has commented that it has a slightly spicy taste as if the bees had used cinnamon nectar to make the honey. I will be ordering this one again. I only gave it four stars because it is not a local honey but where I live that can be hard to find so I guess you make do with what you can.
I thought the honey was much thinner than any other honey I've gotten and It didn't have much flavor.  Even my kids didn't care for it.  Good price though and I like the bottles the honey came in.

You get 4 small bottles of tasty honey here.  I was expecting to get bigger bottles.  I am looking for the best deals when I purchase online, and to be honest I can get a similar price to this at a local supermarket for a bottle of honey.  So I probably would not buy this again.  The honey is tasty and I like it, but if you are not saving any money why go through the process of ordering online. Unless of course this is some sort of special honey you cant get locally, but thats your call.

This is NOT the same honey, as contained in the 23 oz. bottles I've ordered in the past. MUCH lighter in color and RUNNIER!
I immediately cancelled my 'sub/save'...WHY DO THINGS HAVE TO CHANGE...FOR THE WORST?!

I own a bread machine and use honey for my whole wheat loaves.  This product works great for a few weeks, but then something happens to the honey.  It gets thicker.  (And this was in bottles that were sealed and unopened).  This resulted in my bread not mixing properly.  The dough would get clumpy and would not blend together properly.  I had to throw out half of the honey.

I just opened my second can of this and for the second time there was no pot roast in braised beef pot roast soup.  It contains mostly broth with a few vegetables.  It's best suited for a vegetarian doesn't like vegetables.  Seriously, I suppose Campbell's might be having problems with their mixing equipment, but I won't be buying it again.

I bought the first one at the Las Vegas Bellagio hotel, the price tag on it was over $18. All that you have to do is add hot water. I have put them in my desk drawer and brief case and used them in my coffee to make wonderfully flavored mochas in the morning or afternoon for a pick-me-up. Of course, as cocoa they are outstanding with just water.
This stuff is tasty but caveat emptor: it's glorified non-dairy creamer, which is the first ingredient. Enjoy this with artificially flavored vanilla sandwich cookies.

top class chips, and can't find outlets on East Coast. Will reorder again soon.
you can't beat this Boulder Canyon chip!!!

Curry has become one of my favorite foods over the past year. We've always struggled to make good curry at home as the grocery store curry pastes don't have very much flavor. I always found myself having to use an entire jar instead of the 1Tbsp that they tell you to use.

A friend of ours recommended we try this brand. It had AWESOME flavor but ended up being a tad too spicy for our taste. I'm not sure we'll purchase it again. If we do we now know to not use quite as much.

We've really been enjoying the Mae Ploy brand of curry pastes which can be found here on Amazon as well.

If you like your green curry at Thai spice levels though, you'll LOVE this!

We love Thai food and was thrilled to find Maesri Thai Green Curry. This curry is great tasting, authentically flavored, and fairly hot. We like that it comes in a paste as it easy use in our cooking.

Highly recommended! You might also want to try Maesri Thai red curry - 4 oz x 2 cans.
good spicy tasty. but u have to develop a taste for it. If u dont like thai and trying this out as a first option, i would suggest that u wait

This sauce is very strange tasting with a lot of spice.
I was going to use this as the base for a pizza sauce, but not even huge amounts of sugar / honey could save this sauce. It also starts off very watery (not good value for your money).
I will never buy this tomato sauce again.

This is the most acidic tomato sauce I've ever used. It's almost as tart as a lemon. I put it in an old family lasagne recipe, but neglected to taste it at first. By then it was too late.  I tried to soften the astringent taste with sugar and sauteed mushrooms, but this was only partially successful. The only thing that saved the dish were copious amounts of Bechamel sauce in the layering. They claim they use only Roma tomatoes, but I'm doubtful. I can't imagine any recipe that would benefit from this sauce.

I was introduced to Zevia by a friend.  This is the "cleanest" pop you will find and it is delicious!  The grapefruit is my favorite but all have been really good. Warning to those who have NEVER tasted anything with Stevia in it be prepared for a different taste.  I recommend you use stevia in other foods to get accustomed to the taste before forking out the $$$ for this.  If you haven't had stevia before then you probably won't care to much for it.  In my opinion stevia is an acquired taste...which now I love!  I like the fact that I can give this to my kids with worrying about what the harsh chemicals and sugar are going to do to them!  They both love it too...especially the orange and grape.  Even my husband likes the rootbeer!  I can't wait to get the rainbow pack in this week!!  Yummy!

I know you're thinking no way, but actually this is really good. It is hard to find this soda on sale in grocery stores, so the price of this case is pretty competitive. The best part about this purchase was getting to try 2 cans of every flavor. Here are my favorites:

Cola, Caffeine free Cola, Root Beer, Grape, Dr. Zevia, Mountain Zevia, Cream Soda, Lemon Lime Twist.

Flavors I wasnt crazy about:

Ginger Ale, Black Cherry, Grapefruit Citrus, Orange.

Having a husband to pawn those last four flavors off on is awesome! Stranded on a desert island, I would pick the Root Beer. It even makes a great chaser, although I prefer the Cola for chasers.
This is such a great idea.  I like drinking all 12 flavors, depending on my mood.  Now I can buy them all at once.

Love the Zevia Zevia All Natural Soda, Rainbow Case, 12-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24)products. I don't eat sugar and the sweeteners in all the other diet drinks I've tried (they usually have aspartame) give me a migraine and make me feel horrible. This uses the stevia plant (or rebiana) and erythritol. I've researched erythritol and it seems to be the least harmful of all sugar derived substitutes (it also does not kick me into a sugar craving like some of the other substitutes). Anyway, some of the flavors were a little weird to me at first, like the cola flavor but after the second or third can I started to get a taste for it. I now find them more enjoyable than regular or other diet sodas. Other flavors were great off the bat, like cherry. My favorite is Mtn. Zevia but I read some other reviews that thought it was horrible. FYI Truvia Truvia Nature"s Calorie-Free Natural Sweetener - 40 Packetssweetener is also made of stevia and erythritol and I find it great for sweetening and cooking, though it took some practice. Zero cal. SOBE Sobe Lifewater Variety Pack - 12/20oz Bottlesalso a great drink and sweetened with erythritol. Many grocery stores carry the SOBE Lifewater for $1.00 per bottle.

Zevia arrived promptly and in perfect condition. Very satisfied with purchase and would purchase again. Good opportunity to sample all the flavors, many of which are not available in retail grocery stores in my area.

I had a ginger ale from a health food store and was hooked! I have been trying to get away from diet coke, a battle that has been going on for years. I use stevia in the raw in pretty much everything now and was really excited to find a line of sodas that used it. I, or course, was carried away and ordered a case on auto delivery. Mistake. The sodas really are all SOOO sweet, it's nauseating. The makers need to lighten up on the stevia. I still enjoy the ginger ale but am forcing myself to try and get through the remaining case. I can take 2-3 sips of the others before I am turned off. So just get the ginger ale or skip in general. Blah. too bad:(

My husband and I try not to drink any soda, diet or regular but I saw this on special on Amazon and got some. Really great flavor! My husband who likes regular soda when he can get it (we drink alot of iced tea and coffee) enjoyed this and all the flavors were a surprise! The flavor that was supposed to be like Mountain Dew was just gross to us, nasty so I took one star off for that flavor. The Dr Pepper version and the ginger ale were the best. I would still buy this in a mix and will give the Mt Dew flavor to my son:o)

I RECIEVED MY DRINKS AND WAS LOOKING FOR LOTS OF FLAVOR--WRONG.  THE FLAVOR WAS WEAK AND THERE WAS, WAY, TO MUCH FIZZ. NOT WORTH THE EXTRA MONEY YOU PAY FOR THESE DRINKS.  EVEN THE SWEETNER, WAS NOT MUCH PRESENT, NOT VERY SWEET.

Honestly, I hate drinking regular cola because of the excessively sweet sugar taste lingering in my mouth, and the diet or zero versions aren't much better because the sweet-n-low taste is just as bad as sugar. So I tried what supposedly is the only carbonated drink that is truly natural.
Taste-wise, it is NOT an alternative to other popular cola brands.
Zevia comes in variety of flavors that are suppose to imitate the regular drinks (Mountain Zevia, Dr.Zevia, ... really??), but they are not even close to how the originals taste.
However, different as they may be, I LOVE the taste of these Zevia soda, much more than other 'original' soda. They taste much more... crisp and natural, without having the lingering sugar/sweet-n-low taste. The natural ingredients, mainly stevia, really has a unique taste that is completely different than sugar.

If you are looking for a healthy alternative that taste pretty much the same as regular soda, you WILL be disappointed.

However, as an entirely separate drink with a completely unique taste, it is, by far, my favorite soda, and I am completely addicted.
If you are looking for a great tasting diet soda and want to stay away from aspartame and saccharin this is a great alternative-- tastes GREAT!

In an effort to cut down on my refined sugar intake, I use Stevia as my main sweetener so was glad to stumble across Zevia.  However, you need to keep your expectations in check.  Think of them as a bunch of new unnamed sodas without the sugar.  So enjoy the discovery of the new soda flavors.  For example, I was a huge Dr. Pepper fan and there is no way that I would mistake Dr. Zevia for Dr. Pepper.  And if you were to ask me if the Cola tastes more like Coke or Pepsi, I would have to say "none of the above".  For root beer fans, the Zevia root beer comes very close.  I do enjoy the Zevia flavors and Dr. Zevia is one of my favorites, but it just doesn't taste at all like Dr. Pepper.  The rainbow case is a wonderful idea as it lets you try all the different flavors.  Until they come out with a Stevia sweetened Dr. Pepper, I will enjoy the different flavors of Zevia.

I was looking for an acceptable substitute for diet pop as i am looking to get away from aspartame.  Zevia fulfills that need and i love all the Zevia flavors.  The 24 pack is great as i get 2 of each Zevia flavor. Can't wait to try their 3 new ones.

When i order this soda I was expecting the worst. But much to my pleasant surprise the soda was great. My Daughter 15 and 6 both love them. They pack them in there school lunch. The ginger ale is wonderful. The taste is great. I't hard to believe that this soda is the real deal but it is. I had put my self on auto ship for 3 month but the case a disappeared because every time someone come over I have to let them try it.I need a new case now. Can't wait to get it. I haven't had cream soda in a very long time but that Cream soda is Delicious.

With all the positive reviews I really was looking forward to trying this but was sadly disappointed when I received my shipment and tried 2 of the flavors.  So far I've had the orange and the cola...not enjoyable at all.  I had realistic expectations and did not expect it to taste like the "regular" sugar or even "diet" versions that are popular.  But, I had hoped they would at least be good.  My teens and I dislike the taste completely.  There is also a very bitter aftertaste that lingers for a long time.  Ugh.  I'm going to stick to my carbonated water with a slice of lemon from now on. **Have tried all the flavors and still do not like this product.  I have had other products with Stevia that are acceptable, the aftertaste on this one is horrible.

I bought this thinking it would be a good alternative to the regular soda I drink. And I have to admit, when you first drink it it is OK. It does have a weird aftertaste though, which bothers me the more i drink. Maybe I will get used to it but I doubt it.

I will certainly not be purchasing this product again.

If you are drinking diet soda for the taste, please read what other reviewers have written re: the taste of Zevia.  Stevia lends a unique taste that may take some getting used to.  It is "different" than standard diet drink taste.  That being said, if you are drinking diet soda to watch your waistline, you need to step over to Stevia as a sweetener NOW.  Journal papers in Behavioral Neuroscience and the Journal of Animal Science have established the so-called "sweetness response" in which insulin is released in response to sweet taste, rather than as a direct response to sugar-based content.  Insulin without something to metabolize is very efficient way of creating fat.  This is why drinking diet drinks does not help you loose weight.  In fact, if you switch to diet drinks and change nothing else about your diet and exercise regimen, you will GAIN weight.  I have not seen the scientific evidence, but I have  read in at least two non-science books, that Stevia does not cause the insulin release that nutri-sweet and saccharine  do.  This makes Zevia an actual diet drink.  While I agree that soda should be refrained from for reasons other than making one fat (it is bad for the teeth, irritates GERD, among other ill effects), it is unfortunately, the one habit I simply cannot break myself of.  While Zevia is not a health food, at least won't make me gain weight.

I'm not a huge soda drinker because of the carbs and calories. I don't ever drink traditional diet drinks because I do not like the diet soda taste. I use stevia in the raw at home daily and I have enjoyed the lack of calorie sweetness that it gives me, which lead me to try these sodas.

To wrap it up, they have a very strong diet drink taste which is what I was trying to avoid to begin with. If you don't like artificial sweeteners as a concept but don't mind the taste, these drinks may be a more natural alternative for you. Dont expect any of the flavors to taste like anything but a diet soda.

All the flavors are pretty great, the least tasteful mostly because the aftertaste is a little funky is the orange flavored one albeit everyone's opinion will vary. My wife likes the Dr. Zevia but does say it pales in comparison with the brand name product it's trying to replace.  Well anyway if your on a diet or can't use sugar this is the way to go! At least it'll keep you away from nutrasweet and similar other harmful products that are allowed in our food.

I've been using stevia for years, so when I saw this product, recommended by Shane from the people's chemist, I knew I had to try it. I am so glad I did! Now I can have a soda without feeling that I'm doing my body harm. And the best part is they taste great! The root beer is my favorite, but I do like getting  the variety pack so I'm never bored.

I believe many people who choose Stevia as their sweetener of choice are health-conscious and, as such, would prefer to avoid Aluminum cans (re: Alzheimer's risk) and plastic bottles (re: cancer risk from BPA and phthalates) so glass is the only viable packaging material for this discerning audience.  Otherwise  I enjoy the taste and appreciate the all natural ingredients (especially that no artificial colors are added). I have tried Grape, Cola, and Orange.  For now I will experiment making my own soda on-demand with club soda and organic flavor extracts with either Stevia or Dextrose sweetener.

I AM A TYPE TWO DIEBETIC....,I NEEDED A SODA THAT I COULD ENJOY BUT NOT RAISE MY BLOOD SUGARS........NOT ABLE TO FIND ANYTHING UNTIL FINALLY ZEVIA CAME ALONG....I LOVE THE TASTE....I EJJOYED TASTING ALL THE FLAVORS IN THE RAINBOW PACK....BUT MOST OF ALL I LOVED THAT MY BLOOD SUGARS ARE FINALLY LEVELING OFF AND I FEEL SO MUCH BETTER ALL AROUND........HURRAY FOR ZEVIA!!p>s> ANOTHER SUGGENSTION WOULD BE TO MAKE MORE FLAVORS IN CAFFINE FREE TO HELP THOSE NON SLEEPERS GET SOME SLEEP!!

I have not had soda in years because of all the garbage ingredients that they all contain. I decided to try these out since they were sweetened with stevia. I thought it might be a nice treat to occasionally have one. They are very good and my husband seems to like them too. I don't notice any weird aftertaste as some other have reported, and they also arrived quickly and in tact. They are a little pricey, but I would definitely be willing to order again as an occasional treat or to keep some soda in the house when visitors come over. The variety pack also gave us a good opportunity to try them out and figure out which ones were our favorites.
This 'rainbow pack' has a great selection of different Zevia drinks.  Love Zevia and this gave me an idea of what other flavors are available. Will keep ordering this.
Awesome,Shipped fast, and a great value.  Many flavor options and they are all good. Great alternative to other options available in stores.

As other folks describe, this soda has a different taste due to the stevia and erythritol sweeteners. It's not bitter or bad like other diet sodas, but it definitely tastes different than sugar sodas. However, when I crave a sweet soda, this fills the need without all the sugar and without the side effects of other artificial sweeteners. I bought the variety pack figuring that I'd prefer one or two of the flavors and so I'd buy only those next time. However, I like all the flavors equally.

I hate to say it, but do not expect Zevia to taste the same as regular "soda". It has a distinct flavor all it's own. So far I like the Dr.Zevia as it is not as strong and tart as the ginger soda. My local supplier only carries 3 flavors. The rasberry is also very tart. So this is the only recommendation I can make, but not having artificial flavors, caffeine , carmel coloring, high fructose corn syrup is worth getting use to in my opinion. Thanks Amazon, face book and Zevia for teaming up!

Greatly appreciate Amazon carrying this product, as it affords customers the opportunity to evaluate this product.

The case arrived without the Dr. Zevia (Dr. Pepper cans). Ginger root beer had been substituted and doubled. Unfortunately, I bought this specifically to try the cola, ginger ale, and Dr. pepper equivalents.

The grape and orange are the better products, although they have no coloring.

Unfortunately, almost all of the soda's have an aftertaste...reminiscent of saccharin in some peoples opinion.

Some found the taste to be cloying. No one found any taste to be fresh, crisp, or refreshing.

I had such high hopes for Stevia in soda.

Even Canada dry diet ginger ale has more ginger taste than Zevia ginger ale. Zevia cola did not remind me of any similar cola I have ever had. In fact, a blind test would have revealed a mildly sweet beverage with no outstanding taste markers and of benign flavor.

I'm amazed at some of the bad reviews here, but can only assume that some of them, at least, come from people who expected Zevia's colas to taste just like their more famous counterparts.  Well, they don't taste exactly the same... The ingredients are totally different, so of course they will taste different.  However, I LOVE the taste of Zevia.  It tastes clean and crisp, and makes brand-name sodas taste especially gross to me now.  I am a former addict of Diet Mt. Dew and was so happy to find a healthier product to replace it.  Was the first glass of Mt. Zevia exactly what I expected?  No.  But by the second glass, I was hooked.  I haven't looked back!  I've liked every flavor I've tried, and am on the hunt for the new Strawberry flavor to buy locally.

When I first started drinking this soda, I was really surprised. None of the flavors that come in the rainbow case accurately recreate their non-stevia counterpart. In general, this could be because  of the stevia, or it could be due to a flavoring. However, they don't taste bad! In fact, they're quite tasty, and in a lot of cases, I actually prefer the taste of this version over others. For example, while the "Dr. Zevia" tasted nothing like Dr Pepper, I loved it! Out of all of the flavors, I would say that the ginger root beer and the grapefruit are my favorites. I've gone through at least 10 cases at this point, and I doubt I will stop any time soon.

I was pleasantly surprised by what I've tried so far.  The grape, orange, etc. flavors are clear, no harmful artificial colorings. Friends over enjoyed it also.  Trying a variety pack is the way to go.

I have been drinking Zevia for about two years. They have a ton of flavors now compared to when they first started out. Their 'Cola' and 'Root Beer' equivalents are my favorite. I'm NOT a fan of their 'Dr. Pepper' equivalent. I have tried most of their flavors and enjoyed their 'Mountain Dew', 'Grape', 'Orange', and 'Cream Soda' equivalents, but again, really really enjoying their 'Cola' and 'Root Beer' flavors the best.

If you want to try a healthier less sugary version of your Coke Cola, give this a shot and I think you wont be disappointed. I just added their "rainbow pack" to my subscribe and save for the family. I have one coming every 2 months. They like them as well :)

It's really a guilt free soda and you don't have to worry about all the crazy chemicals that come with the name brand diet soda's.

As a side note, I had to deal with their customer service once and was happy with how they handled me question. It was in regards to one of their "natural flavor" ingredients.

At the very least, give them a shot, you might end up being glad you did.

I use stevia and sugar blend in my tea etc. I thought this would taste good but it tasted just like other diet drinks (bad).
Very expensive mistake.

I received this product last week and my husband and I have been slowly trying the drinks. Thus far, the horrible outweigh the okay. The Grape was okay...the Dr. Zevia was okay...and that's been about the only okay products. The Mt.Zevia was like a flat Mt. Dew, the Cola was nothing like cola, the Ginger root beer was like a carbonated chai drink. They have been such a let down. I am very bummed that this was not a good product as I grew up on diet drinks and am quite attached to them. Not these. Never again, nor would I recommend them.

I know this is supposed to be the "healthy" alternative for pop drinkers, but I'm just going to continue my shift towards iced green tea for my caffeine and drink fix.  The Stevia just has too much of a tangy aftertaste for me, and this stuff isn't exactly priced in the everyday-consumption price range.
My personal opinion is they are terrible. I will not recomend them, or buy them again. NO FLAVOR AT ALL

I do a lot of shopping on Amazon and this is the first bad product that I have received. I usually don't bash products but, these are terrible. The root beer and dr pepper clone do smell good at first but, it goes down hill from there. The mountain dew clone was the worst, I about gagged. All have the same nasty bitter taste and terrible odor with the individual flavor added on top. All 24 cans down the drain or should I say 27 bucks down the drain. It kind of reminds me of red bull or a preworkout/no2 drink. Fine if you have to drink it but, not if you want a drink to enjoy. I use stevia daily in my ice tea and coffee and it is great so, I don't think it's the stevia.

I so wanted to like this product.  I am trying to eliminate Splenda from my diet and was hoping this would be something I could use in this.  Unfortunately, I did not like it.  It tastes like Alka-Seltzer to me, with some flavorings thrown in.  :(

The all natural taste comes with a hefty price and a little bit of a bad after taste.  I have since went back to diet coke and perhaps the onslaught of all the bad health(Unproven) issues associated with it
My order arrived in a very timely manner and was in great condition.  It has been so nice to try the various flavors without having to purchase large quantities of them.

I like to drink diet drinks over tea but do not like to eat or drink anything with aspartame, so I tried these a few months ago. I was pleasantly surprised, the flavors are refreshin, love all except for their version of mountain dew, as I really don't care for the dew original.

I have several favorites, but will still continue to subscribe to the "sampler" case as I love having choices when going to the fridge or the cooler. And the price is so much better than buying the limited flavor six packs at Whole Foods.

Hooray for Amazon, my favorite place to shop for anything!

First I must say until recently I have never found a diet soda that actually tastes good enough to drink regularly. I was very excited to receive the Zevia All Natural Sodas because I have insulin resistance and I'm not supposed to have alot of sugar. I use the Truvia and Stevia sugar and I thought it would be a good idea to try the soda. I ended up giving the sodas away to a coworker and I'm sure my coworker threw them away. The taste is awful. The "coke" soda is way too sweet. The only flavors that I tried to convince myself that I could drink were grape, orange and cream soda and even those are not really good. If you are looking for a good tasting diet soda a coworker brought me a can of Sprite Zero, and it was actually good. It's not far off from the original Sprite. Oh, and my coworker was drinking Rockstar which I guess is another diet soda and he said Rockstar tastes better than the Zevia soda.

I saw this product on Amazon and was excited that it was all natural and zero calories, so i brought a case of the Cream soda. What a disappointment.  The soda has a really wicked after taste that lasts for a long time,very bitter. I will stick to my Diet Pepsi, it's cheaper and no aftertaste.
I'm so sad because I REALLY wanted these to be good.  They're not.  Seriously, don't waste your money thinking you'll enjoy one of them, as they ALL have the same terrible aftertaste.

I recently began using an artificial sweetener called ZSweet (ingredients: erythritol and stevia). THere is absolutely no aftertaste or bitterness to this product, and I nearly can't tell the difference between it and sugar - and it's the only zero calorie sweetener I can stand.

I went looking for products that contain erythritol and I was SO excited when I discovered this brand of soda. It would be so nice to be able to drink the occasional soda again. So I ordered this sampler.

I've tried 6 of the 12 flavors. They all have a very distinct, terrible aftertaste. What a disappointment.

I was very let down with this product, I have purchased the Switch The Switch Sparkling Juice, Orange Tangerine, 8-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24)brand soda and was very pleased with it's delicious flavor but this drink is totally different.
First of all it is sweetened primarily with Erythritol which is an alcohol based sweetener and is bitter tasting like other diet sodas,
but that isn't all, it also causes stomach cramping (among other things) within 30 minutes of drinking it.
Needless to say I'll be cancelling my future orders and going back to the Switch brand.

At first, the soda tastes great, but then the stevia or whatever else they put in it kicks in.  You are left with a very unnatural taste and feeling inside your mouth.  The aftertaste is a deal breaker.  I resolved to slam the last four of the sodas so I only had to deal with one final aftertaste.  The aftertaste/freeling of four sodas lasted for several days, even after drinking other things, eating, brushing, flossing, and waterpik'ing.

1. Box arrived with case wrapped in a plastic bag, containing one can (empty), and a soggy cardboard tray with the other 23 cans. It appears to have blown up either prior to, or at UPS, as the box was a UPS box.

2. Positive- the level of carbonation was very good.

3. The flavors reminded me of rancid cough syrup. NONE of the 12 flavors were worth more than a sip, or the second can. There was a full-on flavor malfunction and also an aftertaste that did not want to go away. The Dr. Zevia certainly was named well, for the resemblance to medicine. The root beer smelled like root beer. The fruit flavors weren't artificially colored, so essentially all looked like lemon-lime (which is actually fine by me).

I'm just glad I got the sampler case, and wasn't left with 23 full cans and one with a single sip taken out of it. The first two cans, I'd poured over ice, and took a good slug, and nearly choked. After that, it was a tentative sip of the remaining 10 flavors. I couldn't find ONE that I'd ever want to have again.

I REALLY wanted to like this stuff. I'm a diabetic, so diet soda isn't just a preference- it's what I have to have if I'm going to drink soda at all. I budgeted for 2 cases from my next pay check (guess I'll be getting more cases of WATER). I generally like erythritol and stevia sweetened items- especially erythritol- I use it on cereal. Tastes just like sugar, and can be used for baking as well as cold items.

Total waste of more than $25. That could have bought my perishable items this week.

There really isn't much to say about this.  If you like freeze-dried ice cream, you'll probably like this.  Like all freeze-dried ice cream, it seems ridiculously overpriced for what you get, but that's the way it goes.  About a quarter of the tube is filled with smooshed crumbs, but it eats the same.  The tube is small, of course - about 1.5 times the height of a chapstick and maybe twice the diameter.  It has white, brown, and pink balls (white seems to be the largest).  I listed them by color because I can't really say that they taste like vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry because they are so small.  All in all, I think I prefer the small bricks better than these little balls, but I kind of enjoyed flipping the top and pouring some into my mouth.
Glad to find good old fashioned dubble bubble for a good price. My whole office likes to indulge their sweet tooth, and the child inside!

Ah Dubble Bubble.  It starts out really hard, the flavor doesn't last too long, but you can blow amazing bubbles!  This is a great bucket to get for stuffing a pinata or just to keep around.  This is sure to delight kids or nostalgic adults.

I found out about the pepper sauce (actually more like a paste) from a recipe using it in the LA Times magazine. I decided to try a jar, & fell in love at first taste. Use it as a base layer on home made pizza dough, just smear some on & put your other topping over it. Heat up a big blob of it in a pan w/ some olive oil over low heat to get it melted into a sauce (I add a couple chopped clove of garlic in case of vampires, add some uncooked thawed shrimp till done, and toss with some al denta pasta. Shrimp scampi with attitude!Tutto Calabria Hot Pepper Sauce 6.7 oz

Definitely unlike other pepper pastes, like GIA and Amore that come in tubes. It's thick like a tomato paste. The flavor is tangy and hints a little Asian flavors, though it is distinctly Italian pepper flavors. I wasn't expecting a specific taste or texture when I bought it so I'm pretty happy with getting something that I haven't experience before. I will find a lot of uses for this.

I could see it being an excellent addition to a spicy pasta sauce, or pizza sauce. It may also work well mixed with olive oil and used as a base or spread for breads and pizza and such.

Also, it's fairly hot, but not too hot. It's fine for most people who like a little heat, but anyone who likes only very mild spiciness will want to pass on this.

I swear it tasted like vinegar, so very disappointed. I know I have bought Pepperwood Grove before, maybe it was the Chardonnay that was good but the Pinot Grigio was an absolute waste of money, won't even save it to cook with.

I just used 2 tablespoons with one half cup of milk and some ice and it tastes just like a green tea frap from Starbucks. Add a little whipcream to the top and it's perfect. It's at a fraction of the cost. We love it and I will definitely buy again.

I Made Green Tea Ice Cream with this using the recipe on our Ice Cream Maker, minus the sugar called for.

Janice M.

If you have ever spent the summer in Japan and had their green tea shaved ice this is what you had. They serve up shaved green tea ice in a big bowl and it is the cats meow. You can find it cheaper in some of the Asian stores. Buy it durning the winter as it us usually on sale and then enjoy it on a hot summer evening. Mix it up and freeze it until it is almost hard and throw it in the blender to make a slush. Pure enjoyment

If you are tired of spending 5 bucks at the local barrista for a green tea frappichino, cheat. This powder is the same mix as used by the big coffee house chains. Get out your blender and make your own. Addictive!!!
Surprisingly, the recipe on the back for Matcha Milk is just like the base of a Starbucks (or shall I say "Sixbucks") Green Tea Frappuccino. I will use this product wisely!
Bought this so I can make green tea cake and cupcakes.  When I opened the package, it was a smaller bag than i thought it was going to be but I guess a little goes a long way?  Great price.
I love love this product. easy to make and so refreshing. i was able to contact the maker and found it in my area, now i can save on the shipping and handeling!

I wish they would use xylitol or stevia instead of sugar to make this healthier.
It's very delicious and probably healthier than soda though. I would recommend this for an occasional sweet treat. Addictive.

this powder tea has granulated sugar in it to make it sweet. If your looking for it to be a healthy sweet your out of luck but if not I would say this product is delicious. It's presweetened so you ust put in a scoop and your on your way to drinking traditional green tea.
This stuff does taste kinda like starbucks. But with all the sugar I did'nt really enjoy it. Buy this if your running low on sugar and don't like green tea.

I first learned about maqui berries in a health food magazine, and couldn't wait to try it out. Not only is it jam packed with great vitamins and minerals, but it also has the highest antioxident value of any discovered fruit. The taste is very similar to the Acai berry, but in powder form, the maqui is quite bitter. I recommend mixing it with some other fruit. The way I use this powder is in a morning smoothie---it gives me a full day's worth of fruits and 1 serving of veggies all jam packed into my breakfast...I love this because it's always so hard to fit in fruits and veggies otherwise.

My smoothie:
2 tsp maqui powder
1 tbsp chia seeds (also a super food)
1 tbsp wheatgrass powder (another superfood)
1/2 cup fresh or frozen fruit (I normally use strawberries, blueberries, or mango)
6 or 7 ice cubes
1/2 to 3/4 cup water

Makes me feel full all morning long. Hope you enjoy this as much as I do!
This stuff is amazing. I eat it right of the bag by the spoonfull.The deep purple color is very captivating to the senses.

This tea blend is excellent and tasty. Usually teas with valerian root are hard to drink as they smell/taste bad; not this blend! The Healing Tree blend has great flavor and will put you to zzzzzzzzzz.
Finally a good valerian root blend on the market.
We also like The Healing Tree Herbal Blend Echinacea Immune, Caffeine Free Loose Leaf Blend Tea, 2.08-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)It works wonders especially during the cold season.

These are great snacks.  They're similar to the veggie sticks I often get in my local supermarket, but the shape is a bit fatter and hollow in the middle.  this makes them lighter and unfortunately easier for me to eat a lot of them.

I just reviewed the sweet potato variety of these and wanted to share my thoughts on the veggie tortilla. I have bought bagged snacks very similar to these in the past for my kids, but while relatively healthy they weren't GMO-free. My kids loved these and I really appreciated the lack of genetically modified junk.

I couldn't get enough of these things.
I couldn't get enough of these things.
I couldn't get enough of these things.
wow. they may have good numbers as far as nutrition (or lack of bad things) goes but where's the flavor? yuk.

Too pricy for what you get. I was expecting something delicious but unfortunately it's just a plain tortilla taste with a different look. You could get the same thing with any other brand name without having to pay a lot for it.

These really are great bars- no I am in no way associated with the company, but can say I have tried all kinds of sports nutrition bars and this is one of the best around for sheer performance.  Use it as directed and you will be impressed too. I think this flavor is pretty tolerable-- after about 10 of them they begin to feel a little like compacted saw dust, but if you mix up the favors a bit it is not a big deal.  My wife loves this flavor, but it is my 3rd favorite that I have tried.  I wish they sold them in larger boxes or you could put them on auto delivery and save a little more on them.  I wouldn't do another tough mudder race with out them!
I typically get these bars at race expos but ran out and needed some to take on a trip.  They were a great price,  delivered on time.  I really love this product.

There spices and products are great. I live in a very northern area that does not have big stores or specialty shops so it is wonderful to be able to fill my spice shelf with every thing I need. Fabulous customer service too.

My girlfriend procured a pack of these the other day and had me sample several of the flavors.
I generally have a discerning fruit candy flavor- I dislike many flavors (Eg orange, anything blue etc etc) however I was taken aback by the incredible flavor of these gummies.
The consistency is perfect- firm but yielding in each piece, lightly covered in non-overwhelming sour grits perfect for chewers and suckers alike. I will continually use perfect to an excessive amount, because this is exactly what these sour candies are.
The shapes are all in hearts, which makes perfect (again!) sense. There is a myriad of flavors, including out-there pomegranate and mango, which is not normally found in the sour candy sections. Each pack contains a generous helping of these candies, so each pack, regardless of the count, will last you quite a while (unless you're like me, or have friends).
Contains real fruit juice, great flavor and is so addicting I'm going to go steal more from her, and not finish this rev
Have introduced to a number of people & have them all hooked. Best sour gummy ever, great flavors! Got it at a great price!
I highly recommend this product. However, it is cheaper to buy it at a store than online in bulk!
I purchased these as a treat for my dogs.(Yes they are spoiled).My grandkids, husband and I found them delicious!! P.S. The dogs loved when they could sneek some.

Jack Link does jerky better than just about anyone, and these are no exception. Nicely chewy without feeling like your jaws will give out. Good salty and beefy flavor. Amazon's prices are usually lower than in the store, even store sale prices.

This Jerky has been the Greatest I Have Had in Years Only Home Made Jerky is Better.
Mick PHX AZ.

Ordered two packages.  Each was supposed to have four bags.  One package was opened and one bag was missing.  Whoever boxed the two packages must have been hungry and helped themselves to one.  In addition, they were overpriced.  I see them at the checkout counter at WalMart for $3 a bag.  Do the math.

Love this product, just wish it were available in stores near me. I have found the buffalo fire kind which I don't like. Have not found the turkey jerky yet. Till then, guess I'll continue to purchase it from here.

I'm a big fan of Jack Link's beef jerky, especially their flavored jerky's. I hadn't seen this one in the stores so when it went on sale on Amazon I scooped it up. Generally the beef nuggets and tendercuts style jerky's are not my favorite, for some reason the beef gets very rubbery compared to the regular style cuts, but I knew this diving into the bag of jerky.

At first the taste was like the beef had been dropped in a pile of debris on a smokehouse floor, smokey, meaty and ashy tasting. I thought maybe it was just the initial taste and continued to chew. It only worsened as I continued and eventually I swallowed and was met with a disgusting taste left in my mouth.

Now that I have all four bags remaining I'm not sure what to do with them. I may give them away as a gag gift for the holidays and literally watch people gag as they try to eat this.

Very good. Tastes like Original Jack Links only with a little more flavor. Very tender and not dry, but a little on the salty side. The bag is HUGE though and there is a tiny amount in the bag! It's disappointing.

It's hard to judge this stuff as jerky, really, since it doesn't have a lot of "jerk" - they're little strips about the size and shape of a french fry - perhaps three inches long, and about 3/8" square. Thanks probably to powerful industrial meat chemicals, they're incredibly tender, and make great little meat-flavored snacks. My only problem with them is that you get maybe a dozen strips per bag, and they're kinda expensive to get so little. Oh well, meat's expensive.

I buy the turkey jerky now and then as a tasty way to get some extra protein either before/after a workout or as a snack throughout the day. It's a little bit steep on the sodium to have a bunch of it but other than that it's great. I like it a lot. Recommended.

I liked that it was chicken, you dont have to rip your teeth out tearing a bite off. With a chew it comes apart. Probably would have like a different flavor and with the bulk that I bought that was kind of a bummer. Id advise people to get a bag of each to see what flavor you like best. Not do what I did and get a unknown flavor in bulk.
I couldn't eat this after 1 first bite. I thought I was chewing salt marinated beef strips. Yuck! So disappointed at Jack Link's
This is not up to par for Jack Links products.  These are awful!  Gritty, they taste like I imagine dog snacks would taste.

Make your own jerky and save money.  This product has MSG in it.  It's bad for you and unhealthy.  Just look on youtube how to make it yourself.  You don't need preservatives in your homemade jerky if you eat it within the week.

I by chance found this on the bottom row at a super Wal-Mart. I have tried a few other brands...some made from just corn and some from rice, but this company has got to be the best so far. It is just like eating regular pasta. I am hoping Amazon will carry it, but for now, I will just have to hope they are still being sold at Wal-Mart. Being allergic to gluten is not enjoyable. The alternatives that we find, most times are just not the same, so it was nice the night we sat down to dinner and discovered how good dinner was.

A distributor for foods here in Vegas gave me a package to try and I fell in love with it. I couldn't find it anywhere. Then I heard it might be a WalMart, and sure enough it was! I bought two packages and just finished a big bowl of spaghetti. On a hunch I checked Amazon and lo and behold it is here and on PRIME no less! Another reviewer echoed my same feeling that it is the perfect blend of rice and corn, so the corn doesn't overwhelm the sauce. Bravo!!!! I'll be making this pasta our household standard from here on. No more need to look. This is it!

Vicki in Vegas

This pasta is so much better than other GF pasta. It must be the combination of rice and corn that makes it so much better. I've not been too excited about pasta made from just rice or corn, but this one is terrific.
And my picky son even enjoyed it with plain butter.  No bitter after-taste, keeps its consistency, even when reheated in hot water for a couple of minutes.

My 15 year old daughter has just been diagnosed as gluten intolerant so we are on the quest to find as "normal" of food as we can.  This pasta definitely fits the bill - tastes great, just like semolina pasta. I'm very happy my sister told me about it - it will be our pasta of choice from now on.

Like most who find out about the GF world, we've tried all the pastas we could with mixed results.  The rice pasta would be a gummy mess and don't ask about leftovers...  The corn based pastas weren't bad, but still not as close to the old wheat flour pastas as Heartland GF pastas.  There's another GF company who also does a really good corn/rice pasta blend, but comparatively Heartland is a better buy and hard to tell the difference.  Now with both WM and Amazon carrying them it's a great buy vs. others at $4+/box!  Well, until Heartland or the like make the corn-rice blend in a full-size lasagna sheet we'll just have spaghetti night around our house until then.  At least now we're able to fully enjoy it!

We've been cooking gluten-free for 32 years, with three celiacs in the family.  My husband discovered Heartland GF Spaghetti at a restaurant and we all agree this tastes and cooks like "real" spaghetti.I was delighted when Amazon started carrying it.  Now it's out of stock!  Please say you'll carry it regularly.

I didn't buy this item, although I was about to. I went to the manufacturer website to look at the nutrition label. All is good until you get to the very end where it says it is processed in a facility WITH Wheat.

We have found this pasta to be the best we've tried yet in our 6 months of GF living. Definitely recommend this product for those who have to be GF and those non-GF sharing a meal. You'll love it! Tastes like 'regular' pasta.
So far these are the best gluten free noodles I have tried.  The hold up well when boiling and taste good.  I love them.
I'm very gluten intolerant, but my family isn't.  With this pasta, they can't tell the difference so I can fix us all the same and they don't even realize it's wheat free.  Love it!!!

This is the best gluten free pasta I have eaten to date. When it was no longer available at Walmart I started shopping, and bought up some Penne and Fusilli. A call to Heartland revealed that the gluten free products will not be run again until the fall. Start posting alternatives boys and girls because thats's all there is and there ain't no more.

This was the first GF pasta I tried and I'm happy that it was!  This made great spaghetti.  I cooked it towards the longer end of what the bag called for.  There is NO aftertaste and is edible without any sauce on it!  The great thing is that you can find this at Walmart.  I've stocked up now!  My whole family enjoyed it (including my toddler)!
This pasta is awesome. It has great texture and flavor. There is no difference between this pasta or wheat pasta.  I highly recommend this to anyone who loves pasta whether it is gluten free or not.

This was a super tasting pasta.  It did not stick together or taste very much different than regular wheat pasta.  Did not have the texture of rubber like some rice pasta's. Make sure to take note of recommended cooking time.  Will definitely buy again!

Customers with gluten-intolerance: Be aware that this product is described as "gluten-free" and "wheat-free," but it is "processed in the facility that uses wheat and egg."

12/02/2011: As "food," this item cannot be returned. However, Amazon still issued me a refund. Thank you very much. I am going to donate the item to a food-bank.
Was excited to try based on reviews.  No matter how much oil and stirring this is stickly and mushy and is nothing like the real pasta consistancy.  Do not waste your time and money on this product.

I really loved this pasta! It tastes just like natural spaghetti but without all the pain and issues associated with gluten. Many other products would come out mushy and like oatmeal - but not this one, it tastes so much like ordinary pasta, I cannot tell the difference.

I just purchased the "bionaturae Organic gluten-free pasta" because the Heartland G.F pasta has increased in price, is frequently out of stock, and no longer participates in the "Subscribe & Save" option (for those who aren't aware of this program, it saves you 15% and you can cancel at any time). The other product mentioned, the Bionaturae pasta gives you 6 packs of spaghetti (rather than 5 included in Heartland) and still costs less when choosing the subscribe & save. The Bionaturae is offered in the subscribe & save and also has great reviews, so we'll see how it turns out. If it doesn't measure up to the heartland then I will just bit the bullet and order the heartland product.

I prepared this pasta according to the package directions, cooking it for 12 minutes.  It was great! I served it to my hubby and my gluten-free daughter who has never had spaghetti as far as she can remember.  Well, she used to eat it when she was three years old until she was diagnosed with celiac.  She loved this pasta.  Now, I'm afraid she can't get enough pasta.  She recently discovered pizza (gluten-free, of course) and now she has it at least once a week.  My hubby didn't realized the Heartland spaghetti was gluten free until I told him.  He thought it was wonderful, as did I.  I will certainly buy it again.  Now, I'm just waiting for it to come back to Amazon, because I don't know what store I bought it locally and don't want to start searching each one.

Bought this after reading all the favorable reviews. The pasta clumped into a massive ball when cooked according to directions. I tried unclumping and rinsing off the "slime" as it cooked.
