They are great with fresh fruit and a little chocolate syrup on top or with ice cream.

My title says it all. I made 2 trays of cookies - 1 GF and 1 standard because there were folks from both sides of the isle attending. I added ground, toasted walnuts to the shortbread mix and, to my surprise, they were the first to vanish. I had GF folks argue that they had to have wheat in them because the are just so good! Nope, just an outstanding productBob's Red Mill Gluten Free Shortbread Cookie Mix, 21-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)

I was so happy to find these after eating at a German restaurant and sampling spaetzle noodles.  These work well in many dishes from soups to casseroles and the size of the box is (9 ounces)is a good size for two people.  Delicious and a Great Product!

Some time ago I ran out of chicken-flavored bouillon cubes and the store had none. However, they had 7.9 ounce jars of same. Well, I'd never tried the jars before but why not? As it turned out, I preferred the jar to the cubes. Well, next I was out of beef bouillon cubes and ran into the same problem. Same solution too. I bought the 7.9 ounce jar. It's excellent. Just yesterday I made a beef-flavored soup/stew and used the bouillon as a flavoring agent. Everything turned out perfect. This stuff has a real high sodium content, so I eliminated salt as an ingredient. The result was excellent!

Gary Peterson

This container is medium size but I like the size and it was convient for my to purchase this item because I could only find small container at the local grocery store.  I love to cook with beef flavored bouillon so it was a great purchase for me.
The item arrived quickly and as described.  The recipes included  in the box are great! Better than the recipes I originally intended to use.
Junket brand rennet is a must have for lower fat and no egg ice cream recipes. It is necessary for that old-fashioned-homemade taste, highly recommended.

There is a nice mix of sizes, small and round or larger oblong, just like how the root looks. It is nice and meaty in the middle with some pieces having that very strong "bite" of hotness that ginger has. The crystalized sugar lightly coating the ginger helps take the zing out. I use this for cooking, stomach soother, or unique treat.

Tender and spicy crystallized ginger. It seemed a little expensive with the shipping--next time I'll get the 5lb box, I think that had prime shipping available--but this was well worth it. I used it in a molasses cookie recipe and it made some incredible cookies! Some of it may have been eaten straight from the bag during the cookie-making process and it was yummy on its own too.
A bit pricey but since this is a hard item for me to find in grocery stores, its worth it to me.  Fast delivery and very delicious.
Didnt help with the smell of my dog at all left her white even after brushing her plus it made a mess trying to get it on her,would not buy it again a waste of money.

Ever since I came to know about this at Whole Foods, I have been purchasing it either from store or online. This gum does not hold for a long time and so it is an automatic reminder to spit it out before it dissolves.

I have been chewing Peelu gum for many years and I really love it. The quality of the gum has always been consistently good when I buy it at Whole Foods and Mrs. Greens. I bought some online, not from an Amazon dealer, and the quality was not as good. So I can highly recommend this product when purchased from Whole Foods and Mrs. Greens. I love the peppermint and the spearmint flavors and the cinnamon is nice too. I really like that it doesn't have aspartame/nutrisweet (and all it's other names like phenylketuronics) as that gives me headaches. I also like that I can buy it in bottles of 100 or 300. It is a good product.

I'm an avid gum chewing person who has been trying to switch over to natural sugar free gum.  Initially I purchased this product due to the price being cheaper than it's main competitor spry.  What a mistake that was.  Actually this product is no cheaper after you spend 4.99 on shipping and also count in the additional time you have to wait for the product (4 -5 days) to be delivered.  The product tastes great initially but after about 5 minutes of chewing it tastes like crap. It leaves a very nasty after taste in your mouth. I'm forcing myself to chew it so I don't feel like I've wasted my money but it's not worth it.  The Spry gum tastes soooooo much better and it lasts.  Also I've tasted the variety of Spry flavors and they are all good.  So my final recommendation is to save your money on this product if taste matters. If it doesn't matter and cleaning you teeth is the key issue then go right ahead and torture yourself.

This gum is not worth the money. There are far better Xylitol products out there for sale. This gum's taste lasts less than one minute before it is spent and tastes like an old shoe. Additionally, about the time that the flavor goes bad the gum turns to mush and does not even resemble gum at all.

Most Xylitol gums that I have tried to not last that long but this one by far is the quickest to go south.

I have had much better luck with others, you probably will as well.
Wonderful.  We have been looking for a recipe for Mulligatawny soup for years and this is by far the best we have rasted  Just add a little chopped chicken and rice, and it is perfect..

I first had instant whole dried milk when doing missionary work down in Honduras, CA. That dried milk happened to be either KLIM, a Borden product, or Nido, a Nestle's product. For all you dyslectics, you probably picked up on KLIM is just MILK spelled backwards......LOL.  I have had whole milk in the UK and even their full cream Jersey, gold topped, milk and thought that might be the best milk ever.  Matter of fact, I grew up in Houston, Texas and raised on a local dairy milk, Westmoreland.  During those days the very best milk was the one that was the creamiest and Westmoreland guaranteed that, as all their milk was from Jersey herds.  Peak easily surpasses that great "fresh" milk.  Not only does Peak taste great, not dried/instant, but it has the greatest milk taste ever.  I dare say that as long as I can order this stuff, I will never buy "fresh" milk ever again.  I am no longer a frequent milk consumer, but I do use it to make yogurt occasionally, on cereal, or even drink it, but rarely buy it as it typically goes bad/off before it is consumed.  Frankly, I do use it every morning in my coffee or tea.  I would recommend that it is made in a blender, chilled overnight, and then consumed.  I also have used half Peak and Sanalac powder to achieve a lower fat, but full flavored milk.

I tried this based on my mother-in-law's recommendation. This milk powder is nothing like the nonfat milk powder that they sell at most grocery stores. You know what I'm talking about--the kind that tastes like powdered milk. Blech. This one is so rich and delicious. You have to use a lot of it to make a single glass, so it doesn't last very long. This is also great to keep at the office to use in your coffee where it's not always practical to keep a carton of milk.

I can't emphasize enough how good this milk is. This may sound strangely random, but when I first made a glass, I noticed my dogs intensely staring at me, hoping I'd give them some. So I did. They absolutely love it, too. They reacted to it as if it were the most delicious thing in the world. They don't even react that way to steak. My husband even noticed and commented it's like doggie crack. I've never seen anything like it.

It's also nice that you can control the richness of it by adding more or less powder. I also tried the Nestle Nido milk powder that I got as a sample, and it is just as good.
This product is suprisingly delicious. Unlike the instant non-fat milk that I am familiar with, this product tastes exactly like milk on cereal, in coffee/tea and from the glass. Rich and creamy.

Homogenization and ultra-pasteurizing having ruined milk as a healthy product, we have long searched for a tasty powdered milk substitute. This product has superior flavor and is easily mixed into either cold or hot water. The container is a tin and has a tightly-sealing cap to ensure freshness.

I have only used Carnation or generic instant milk before. awful stuff. this product is excellent. I added it to oatmeal while it was cooking vs plain water and I was very pleased. I USED IT FOR MY ELDERLY MOMS COFFEE VS USING NON NUTRITIOUS COFFEE CREAMER.  Looking forward to trying it other ways but at this point I can forsee me ordering it again. I have now started using it in canned cream soups for my elderly mom. i fill the empty can with desired amount of water and then add the Peak.  and the best part because i use non fat or skim for myself....THERE IS NEVER ANY SPOILED OR WASTED MILK OR YOU NEVER HAVE TO GO WITHOUT MILK.

I was looking for milk for my coffee that I could keep at work unrefrigerated and was planning on purchasing those little creamer cups. After reading reviews on Amazon for Peak, I decided to try it. This is not like instant milk of old. It is a very smooth and wonderful powder that easily stirs into a cup of coffee. So much better than  coffee-mate type powders.

This is great for those that don't drink milk on the regular. This way your milk won't go bad, and you always have delicious milk on hand when you need it. It is really sweet, so if you don't like sweet, just add more water. It comes out creamy when you mix according to the instructions. Good packaging, doesn't get stale, and I usually keep it for about 4 months. Great purchase, and I have Amazon Prime, so it came quick.

I ordered this with several uses in mind, and keep finding more as I get more creative! I do not buy milk because I just don't drink it, however, this powder is the best tasting milk I have had since I was a kid! I decided that CoffeeMate is just alot of chemicals, so each morning I put a tablespoon or so of this into my coffee and it is heavenly!! It has vitamin A and D too! Any recipe that calls for milk, I just make the milk using Peak instant milk powder and water and presto! So convenient and it mixes in a snap. My latest kick is to make a milkshake (moderately low calorie) in a blender using the Peak milk powder, a few packs of Splenda, some water and ice and either some fruit or cocoa powder and a splash of vanilla! Delicious treat for under 150 calories. Satisfies that sweet/creamy craving I get. I used to eat ice cream and now I do this and I have kept off those extra 20 lbs. I lost without depriving myself of something I enjoy. This is so much better than the diet ice creams they sell at the grocery store, and no chemical additives! I cannot say enough good about this product. I highly recommend!

We have tried several different brands of powdered milk recently to see which is the best for food storage.  This is very good tasting milk according to my husband - very creamy.  My ratio is different than the directions on the can as I did not want 3.5% milk fat.  I mixed 1/3 c. powder with 2 c. water (or 2 1/2 level Tbsp per cup water).  This probably made a very creamy 2% milk - more or less.  The directions on the can call for 3 heaping Tbsp. to about 6 oz. water to make 6.75 oz.  That's not even a full cup.  The can will make 3.5 gallons (about 56 cups of milk) using my ratio above so that equals $4.95 per gallon or $4.70 with subscribe and save option.  Not so bad considering.  However, if you use the ratios on the can it can be very expensive.

I was skeptical when I was reading reviews but this stuff is awesome!! I don't drink much milk (mostly put it in coffee or cook with it) so the convenience of being able to make just as much as I need and not have to waste half a carton of milk is very nice. But more than that, this stuff actually tastes good. Not quite as good as Organic Valley fresh organic whole milk but definately as good as any regular whole milk or even Horizon whole milk. After you mix it up, it even coats the glass in the same way as fresh whole milk. But its powder, and instant. It tastes nothing like that nasty powder skim milk at all... it just tastes like good milk. It dissolves easily in warm water with nothing more than a quick stir. I haven't tried stirring it into cold water (the instructions say to use warm water) but I imagine it would take a bit more stirring. Anyways, I will definitely be purchasing this again. I have been searching for a brand of powdered milk to make  homemade instant cocoa and I think this may be the perfect thing.

I wanted to replace my old stand by Nido with this brand. It tastes great, with no smell found in the Nido product, but the price... This brand is about double what you pay for Nido!

On price alone, I had to take a star away.

I went to Africa and when we were leaving made sure to bring back 2 Peak containers home.  We ran out and I knew that i must replace it immediately.  I went to the Caribbean stores ad they had it on say for $20.  Checked on Amazon and it was $12.  Perfect price!  I no longer need to buy from overseas.

My parents took us to live in Nigeria in the eighties and one thing we missed at first was having a glass of ice cold milk after school. That is,until my Dad came home from the university he was teaching at with a huge tin of Peak Milk,given to him by a colleague who'd heard of our yearnings. It was perfect. For one serving ,just dissolve 2 heaping tablespoons of the powder in two ounces of water, mix thoroughly to get any lumps out then top up with another six to eight ounces of water, either hot or cold, depending on how rich you like it. Peak milk and Klim ( a similar product by Borden)were life-savers in Nigeria at a period in the nation's history when electricity was a luxury rather than a take-for-granted amenity.

* It is a splendid pantry item in areas where power is spotty and you can't keep things refrigerated for long;
* With the rest of my family on vacation(without me,*whine*),I find that I may not always be able to use up the container of milk before it starts going south so this is great if you find that happening to you a lot. (I need sour milk for several of my chocolate cake recipes,but there's only so many brownies a girl can bake when the rest of the family is out of town...);
* It works wonderfully for baking and yogurt making. Just reconstitute according to package directions and carry on;
* One strange thing I noticed: like many adults of African ancestry I began to develop lactose intolerance as I grew older but I find that unless you are truly allergic, drinking reconstituted dried milk somehow has no ill effects on "the pipes". Go figure.
* You will find Peak milk in powdered and evaporated forms(better than Carnation by me)in most African and Spanish stores,in varying sizes. The size offered here is the Granddaddy and great bang for your buck.

My wife only drinks powdered milk. She only had powdered milk in China although never as good as "Peak". Drink it hot or cold. Some vitamins and minerals. Best in a blender with ice. Also use it as a base for protein shakes.

This product has a great taste, but it doesn't quite have a regular milk taste. Nor does it taste like normal powdered milk. It has a unique pleasant taste of it's own..

However, for a heavenly unique taste, mix up a glass of this milk and add some "Pappy's Sassafras." Add your favorite sweetener. This drank is truly great.

I bought this for my mother who is allergic to milk.  She loves it.  She said it mixes well in both cold and hot water (unlike supermarket powdered milk which doesn't mix well in cold water).  She said the taste is great and she enjoys it on cereal, in her coffee and for cooking.  Highly recommend this!

I was surprised when this peak powder came,I found many uses for it,It is great used as coffee cream,it is a lot like Pream from the 50/60s.I will be ordering it from Amazon from now on,my daughter and grand kids take some home everytime they visit.

I bought 2 dried milks. Peaks dry Whole Milk and Now foods Non Fat Dry Milk. Peaks dissolves instantly even in hot coffee, Now Foods does not, makes a complete mess.  Bought it for making fresh Mozzarella Cheese. Haven't got around to making the cheese, need more ingredients. Wish they made Non Fat Dry Milk too.

Thanks.

They have a product dried cream on amazon. I forget the make. I'm going to order it and review it.

Peak blew away my expectations... I had tried powdered milk before. Never have I had milk taste this good. I use it as a staple in my diet and never worry about spoilage. Great for your survival stash. Highly recommend.
Almost tastes like "farm fresh" milk. A defined departure from the usual preconception of powdered milk. Has "texture" like red cap vitamin D milk.
This is better than the crappy 2% they make us drink. Who needs 2% milk when you can get 100%(joke). It also last's for a while.

I purchased this product because I wanted a powdered full fat cream substitute for baking and cooking on my low carb diet  ( full fat cream has zero carbs). However, when the product arrived, it was DRY WHOLE MILK which has 8 grams of carbs per 3 tbsp!  It has a decent taste and arrived as promised, but I would have never purchased dry whole milk... The product title is misleading.....

A puppy training book I read recommended these treats and they work great.  My pug loves these treats and will do most anything to get a reward.  I also use the leftover "dust" to sprinkle on his food when he isn't finishing his meal.
These are the only treats my apricot toy poodle will eat.  She loves them, and will do all kinds of tricks for them.  They are organic and healthy, too.
I found this item under puppy treats at Amazon.  When I received it there was a warning on the back that said for adult dogs only.

I am a diabetic and this is my one treat that gets rid of a craving for something else. I love these smaller cans--so perfect and so fresh and tasty. Packed with care and delivered as usual--on time. I love them---

Product is wonderful. Real stainless steel. Easy to use.
Should last a life time. Mesh is very fine, great for tiny leaf.

I like these Pomi tomatoes because they are fresh and flavorful.  Also, they come in a carton that is a welcome alternative to metal cans which impart flavor and which sometimes are lined with a plastic containing Bisphenol-A.
Compared to any brand tomato product, Pomi has less sodium, all natural ingredients and excellent taste.  Look at any can of 'reduced sodium' tomatoes and Pomi is significantly better.

I discovered Pomi many years ago.  There are always a couple of boxes of this staple in my pantry.  I love the taste of the Pomi tomatoes in my Italian dishes.  You get 100% percent Italian tomatoes and nothing more.  There is something unique about these tomatoes.  Vegetables taste different depending on the regional soil in which they are grown.  Apparently, the Italian soil does something magical for tomatoes.  I much prefer Pomi tomatoes over the locally grown tomatoes.  There is no comparison.
Just found these in our local store. Taste just as good as other chips, and my kids love them.great way to get nutrients and not feel so guilty about snacks.

Bought this as a joke to give to a friend that is a beer connisseur (sp) for his dog. The dog didn't really care one way or the other and tried to give some to my dog and he also turned up his nose. Not sure, but it appears to have a very salty, brothy smell that could be the reason for the turned up doggy noses. However, it was cute to put into staged pictures of the dogs with the plastic bottles looking like they were hung over, along with their master!
I just mixed a little of this with his dog food and he loved it, just make sure you know your dog is going to eat it in one sitting or else you will have to waste whatever you mixed.

50 lbs. for $22.00 + free shipping is a pretty good deal these days. The nuggets are smaller & have different shapes which is good for my 3 small dogs. It smells beefy. I mix Moist & Meaty with it & they seem to like it so far. My 2 larger dogs like to take a mouthful from the bowl & bring it in the TV room & pick on it. That's a good sign they won't be turning up their noses. I like the High Protein factor too. Even a couple of my cats have nibbled on it a bit because of the smaller mixed pieces.
The Dog was great, it took a long, long time to arrive and when it did finally get here, the bag was ripped at the top from the shipper. And I did post that info back to the company with No response

I have tried alot of asparagus, these are by far the best, enjoyed the garlic and spices in a lightly pickled variety. Excellant in Bloody Mary or all by themselves. This Vendor has the job done just right. I also highly recommend the brussel sprouts even for those who think they don't like brussel sprouts!! 5 Stars to this winner..
What a fantastic deal on bulk order of spice...be prepared to share with many friends and family though unless you have a restaurant, this is a lot of spices!! Great quality!
This product was a gift for my staff because we are going to Costa Rica.  It was a fun gift and taste good as well.  Great value.  The box it was shipped in was damaged but the bottles were all fine.

We add soy nuts to trail mix, salads, rice cracker mix, and anywhere one could use a peanut.  This is a great deal.  Buying small packs at the local store is expensive.  This supply should last us a year or so.  Thanks!

AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!!! I ordered a dozen bags of soy nuts, and when they arrived, the presence of nuts, salt, and misc. debris in the bottom of the box should have been a dead giveaway. Fully HALF the bags were not properly sealed along the bottom edge, and as a result of course the contents were not protected as they should have been from the outside dirt and germs and whatever other crap was floating around as they were shipped and delivered. Half the order, straight into the trash. And of course I feel less than 100% confident of the other half, given the slipshod inattention to proper packaging of items intended for human consumption.

"Melissa" -- this is a FOOD product! Hello? You think you might actually like to SEAL the containers that contain the food????
Half of the bags in case did not get sealed at the bottom of the bags so they spilled out all over the inside of the box. Notified the company weeks ago and they have done nothing.

Love the zip lok bags.  Nuts were not salted, lacked the hulls that help provide fiber and additional vitamins.  Nuts were tasty and fresh, I freeze the bags until I need the next one.  When including shipping, these are the best value of several sources I have found since Trader Joes stopped selling them.
The product is ok.  It is half "nuts" rather then the full ones I have gotten in other brands.  I ordered salted and got plain.
I had ordered the salted soy nuts but the non-salted soy nuts were shipped instead. I certainly would have prefered the salted soy nuts that I had ordered.

I can't review the product since I did not receive what I ordered. This is the second time I have ordered Melissa's Soy Nuts, Salted and this is the second time I received the "no salt added" Soy Nuts. As mentioned in my title, your record for order fulfillment on this item is pitiful.Melissa's Soy Nuts, Salted, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)

You see, my Wholefoods used to sell these in the tubes and cards, but now, they only sell them in the cards! Thus, I had to retreat to the internet to purchase them in the tube. I decided to be economical and purchase the 600 count of Spry gum as well. So after I run out of gum in my 30-count tube, I refill it with gum from my 600 count. They are inexpensive, aspartame-free, and good-tasting - which is enough to be 5 stars for me. Though, I wish they tasted stronger and didn't run out of flavor quickly.

I love Spry gum. It doesn't taste too strong, it doesn't stick to dental work, and it supposedly is good for your teeth.  You can get a giant jar and refill this little container for your car or purse.
It's the perfect amount of chocolate.  Maybe the other person who reviewed this got a bad box, because I thought they tasted great, especially the raspberry and the orange.

These jelly bellys are just so good! They made gourmet jelly beans über gourmet! I love the dark chocolate with the raspberry and the orange too. I consider them fine candy -- high enough quality to put in my artisan-made candy dish in my office.

i got this (dark chocolate) from my mom for easter, and being 22, im grateful for any present i get at my age. but this candy...i dont know..it just tastes funky. i tried all the flavors and none of them taste like the fruit its supposed to taste like; cherry and chocolate does have a slight sweet chery taste, but it only lasts for a split second and this is the only one that has a taste even remotly close to the fruit taste. the coconut one also has a fruity-ness to it, but coconut shouldnt be fruity... i love Jelly Belly jelly beans and i love chocolate and the idea of this candy is fantastic, however, they need to taste good....right??? i figure it had to be common sense but nothing about this is good..not even the chocolate tastes like chocolate. major fail on this product.

I love Decaf Cafe Verona, especially in whole bean.  It's definitely one of my favorite roasts.  It's a nice dark roast, but sweet and cocoa-ey.  I like this roast with dessert or in the evening.  The beans are nice and oily and fresh every time.  I highly recommend this roast!
Whole bean Decaf Verona is a strong decaf that I blend 50/50 with either Italian or French Roast whole beans (usually French).  This blend makes a robust, richly flavored cup of coffee.
Out of the four blends of Starbucks coffee I have purchased and tried, this is by far the worst. Super bitter with a complementary disgusting after taste.
This is our favorite dressing!  It stays mixed, and the dijon is just spicy enough but not too spicy.  The flavor of the tarragon with it is delicous!  You should try it!

I usually pick this up (every bottle available)when I see it at Home Goods or TJ Maxx but, it's so hit or miss. Sometimes I can grab 4 or 5 and sometimes it goes for months where there are none.
I'm hoping more people will catch on to how great this vinegar is, popularity will grow and I'll be able to grab it at the local Stop & Shop. I't so good that I'll search & buy on the internet when I can't find it and I don't do that for just any condiment.
This is great in any dish calling for red wine vinegar. If you think you don't like red wine vinegar, it's because you've been using such substandard brands (progresso - ewww!! and don't EVER buy the store brand!) that you don't know what red wine vinegar shoud be.
You should be able to taste the wine. It should not be watery in the least. It should make you happy!
I cook with this on a regular basis. I'm basting cornish game hens with this vinegar right now (Mud Hen in a Mud Pack from Barbara Byfiend's The Eating In Bed Cookbook copyright 1962)and I use it when I make my sausages in red cabbage [...]

I love the taste of Tabasco. Love it! However, I'm a wimp. It's too hot for me to use to the degree I'd like to use it and still maintain my dignity. Well, that's where Trappey's Red Devil Cayenne Pepper Sauce comes in. For those of us who love the "taste" of the heat, but not so much of the heat itself, or those of us who can't eat jalapenos or habaneros whole from the plant, or those if us who just want a little spice, this is the perfect condiment. It does have heat, don't misunderstand me. Your nose will run and maybe even yours eyes a bit, but, it's not so hot that you really can't enjoy it. I put this on chili, mac and cheese, pizza, chicken wings, and on and on. For me, Trappey's Red Devil Cayenne Pepper Sauce is one of the perfect foods around.

We have recently switched to decaf and were buying Starbucks' decaf espresso beans.  They were good but prettyexpensive and weren't organic.  We saw these and the price was much better PLUS they were organic.  We didn't have high expectations because usually you get what you pay for.  We were pleasantly surprised!  The beans are very smooth w/ an excellent flavor!  Due to this we're almost out again and will definitely be buying more.

Crispy crunchy and a delicate bite that chomps back if you nibble too many, these beans are perfect for pairing up with your Ceaser instead of a stick of celery. Hard to find in the area of California i reside in, i was excited to find a supplier that was able to ship so quickly and serve my cravings for an item so readily available back home in canada

My dog LOVES this chew bone, is highly disappointed if I run out. She generally chews one each evening, and has been doing so for at least 1 1/2 years without ill effects. It is sort of expensive, and occasionally I try to substitute, but she gives me this guilt-inducing stare, may grudgingly take the substitute which she then may not finish. My vet recently commented that my dog's teeth looked great for a dog of her age - 9yrs.

Warning to dog owners! This product has caused many dogs, including mine, diarrhea, vomiting, and seizures.

~~~~~~~~~

My history with this product:

My dog was very ill for 3 days: violent diarrhea and vomiting. Called vet after first day, they instructed me to keep him on a bland diet, and to bring him in if this persisted more than 3 days. Luckily, he got better and I didn't have to take him in. I thought, maybe it's just my dog and he has a sensitive stomach?

I went to the web to research the product and found others had experienced the same thing. So I wondered...why is this product still on the market? I contacted Purina, and after no luck with them (who claimed they never heard of any complaints), I contacted the FDA, which currently has this product under surveillance.

By the way, my dog is not a toy breed, he's a 20 lb. mutt. So say what you want to say about the latest 'not meant for toy breed' disclaimer on the package, he doesn't fall into that category.

Sure, some dogs can tolerate this treat, but why take a chance on your pet's health and life?

This treat has given my 120 pound doberman seizures and diarrhea badly. He is shaking all over and can barely walk as his hind legs are not wanting to stand. The muscles keep contracting. He finally vomited a lot of the bone.
I fed him one small busy bone. How can a company allow this to be sold?????????????

The chemicals and colors in this treat are off the chart. PLEASE DO NOT FEED THIS TO YOUR DOG. I HAVE REPORTED IT TO PURINA AND THE FDA

Everyone's tastes are different. But this is my absolute favorite olive oil. It has complexity, and has this incredible long smooth finish. I pour it over heirloom tomatos, or grilled asparagus, or just dip good bread into it!
Antara Olive Oil is wonderfully smooth.....like silk in your mouth.  The taste is pure olive oil.  I've tried many others, including in Italy,  and this is one of the best for the value.
This oil has got to be the best tasting oil I've ever tasted! Very addictive as a dip with good bread! Five stars! Love it!
This is by far my favorite olive and and it is excellent for dips and dressings!!!

My enthusiasm for this product is mainly that I'm a Vegan and have used it as a supplement. I believe it's only 2 tbs. for the serving and you get 45% of Iron for your recommended daily allowance which is phenomenal. I haven't seen any other cocoa product in my experience with such a high percentage of iron except for chocolate bars coming close and of those, only the one's that really don't use filler or water down the product. Look for "cocoa mass" in the ingredients list if you want the higher iron there by the way as well as a higher percentage.
All these compliments being said for the current time I would advise one not to order the product here as the shipping cost kills the value.

Geewees, where do I start? First, I'd like to say that I have personally tried this Ojio brand, although I'm not a Verified Amazon Purchase and would recommend it over any other brand from all that I've tried, (The only one that comes close is Navitas Naturals). No, I do not work or represent the company but just wanted to share my opinion on a great product. The good thing is, the supplier sells direct through Amazon, so you don't have to worry about counterfeits or any funny business.

Anyone can tell you that the main component for real chocolate is cacao powder. If you didn't know that, I bet your grandma did. We have this big misconception about chocolate and many of us have been raised to think that it is bad for you. This is mainly because of the high content of white sugars, synthetic sugars and dairy products that are in most chocolate candy. Whether dairy is beneficial for you is another subject all within itself and based on your personal research, understanding and belief system. The subject here is CACAO POWDER and although I am not vegan or on a 100% raw food diet, for many years now, I have been eating 50 to 70% raw food and cacao powder has been an invaluable ingredient to most of my homemade protein bars, carb bars and desserts. It is a fat burner, aphrodisiac, an energy booster (with low grade-slow caffeine release) and a great nutrient for the blood. This explains why women crave chocolate during their cycle. Check the internet, do your own research, it is remarkable. The most important thing is-- to consume it in combination with the right ingredients/foods that are healthy for you.

Lastly, cacao powder contains a high volume of the amino-acid Arginine also known as L-Arginine (no other vegan source carries it in such high amounts next to rolled oats), which reduces healing time of injuries (particularly bone), quickens repair time of damaged tissue, and helps decrease blood pressure. Most importantly, it is the precursor for the synthesis of "Nitric Oxide", a vessel dilator present in a lot of sex pill formulas and bodybuilder supplements. This is what helps men get that extra pump in every sense of the word! A scoop of this raw cacao powder should go into your daily protein drink and you can't go wrong. See all my reviews for more tips on male supplements.

I was hesitant on buying this organic cacao because of the 0 reviews but after seeing the nice packaging photo and visiting the company's website and finding out more info on the product I decided to purchase it. Initially I bought this organic cacao to prepare a facial mask from an online beauty recipe I found along with some other natural ingredients but was so impressed by the packaging (I'm a graphic designer hehe) and the little history on the back that I thought I'd give it a taste. It's definitely very rich tasting and very high quality. I'm not a cocoa drinking type person so I sprinkle a teaspoon of it to either my coffee or chai tea and I can immediately taste the richness of it.

I've tried a lot of coconut oils and this is the best I've ever had! Why? It tastes amazing, for some reason it has a lighter taste, and it's cold pressed and extra virgin. I cook with it, eat it straight out of the jar, put it on my lips and face, and make yummy desserts with it. AND it's healthy!!!

This is a great cereal bar, and I'm suprised that it's not widely sold at grocery stores. I think it tastes far better than the Lucky Charms treats and much better than the Cinnamon Toast Crunch bars that are sold both which I think taste good as well. The Golden Grahams Treats though have a very distinct flavor, and the marshmallows and chocolate chips throughout it make it one of the richest tasting cereal bars I've ever had, and as a result does satisfy your hunger. I highly recommend this product to anyone that likes Golden Grahams, you will not be disappointed.
For some reason I woke up craving these and couldn't find any near my house so ordered a whole box. The price was great. And as soon as I ate one it brought me back to my child hood yummy!!!

This product is very good and Quaker is one of my favorite brands.  The single serving bars are wrapped in a light aluminum foil and shipped well in package plus carton. The flavors are yummy and at least two months on date when I received.

This was a great find in the Warehouse Deals!  I was concerned I'd receive them and have a week til they expired, but they were a full 2 months ahead of the exp date and in my household they will be devoured by then!!

I have an office in an extremely remote and often frigid location and sometimes have co-workers visiting.  I try to make the workspace welcoming and hospitable.  I set out a box of other assorted teas and a box of this Numi assortment and visitors ALWAYS go straight for the Numi.  This also serves me well because I can pick out a tea to suit my mood, whatever the occasion.  All of the teas have great, deep flavor.
I ordered this collection in error but it was a nice error.  I have enjoyed the variety as it allowed me to try some different flavors.  I am still most fond of the Chocolate Pu-erh Tea.

This is some of the best tea I have ever tasted! Love the variety as well, every tea bag is like a little surprise, and always delicious! A great purchase, immediately ordered a second after trying several of the tea bags.

I love Numi's organic loose leaf jasmine green tea and drink it every day, so I figured I'd try this sampler to see if there were any other Numi teas that appealed to me.

Honestly, I was disappointed. Out of 18 different teas, the only one besides my favorite jasmine green that really appealed to me was the breakfast blend. Maybe it was the fact that they were bags instead of loose tea, I don't know. I just didn't like the flavors that much.

However, the quality of the tea was decent for bagged tea. It didn't seem like it had been sitting forever and getting stale. Especially the floral teas, like the rose infused white tea, tasted fresh and the floral scent was vivid, but not overpowering.

Also, it's a mix of herbal (no caffeine) and black/green/white (with caffeine) teas, if that's important to you.

I was pleasantly surprised by the selection of this tea. Another review said there were 9 teas with two of each flavor but mine is just as described in the product description with 18 DIFFERENT TEAS!! Im thrilled to try so many of this brand of tea. Great selection! My only concern is that the scent of the teas mixes in the box, perhaps the individual wrapping should be another material? Overall, very satisfied!

I really liked this collection which I purchased it the first time about two years ago.  Given that I am already familiar with these teas, I made this purchase because the product description included two teas that I had not tried.  I thought this was a new collection with a combination of new and old products.  Turns out that it was the same 'old' collection and despite what was in the product description, this collection did not include the two teas that I had not tried.  I thought it may have been a shipping problem because the two teas are also listed amongst the ingredients on the box.  Sale or no sale, I am making my tea purchases in a store so that I will know what is in the box.

I bought this teas as an alternative to plain iced tea. Drop a single bag into a gallon jug of warm water and in about 30 minutes you have a oitcher of very flavorful and refreshing tea. Add a little sweetener and some ice and sit back and enjoy.

Let me start by saying that I'm a lifelong tea drinker and I love tea, and I've tried all sorts.

I started out years ago with Lipton's before all these different designer brands and flavors came along. Black Ceylon tea was what they called it. Then when all these designer brands and flavors came out I tried all the exotic flavors I could get my hands on, mango, vanilla, raspberry, chocoloate, peach, whatever. I tried different brands, I tried expensive teas, cheap teas, organic teas, the standards such as Earl Grey, Darjeeling, Assam, etc.

Finally, I came back to this tea. It was like travelling around the world in a circle and coming back to the start. I love this tea because I've found all that other stuff, apple, peach, raspberry, just detracts from the true flavor of tea. This tea is just pure tea, without any other distracting flavors and that's what I love about it. A stong tea, a robust tea with full strong flavor, for a man (or a manly woman).

When I make it just right, the right temperature, the right strength, this is what I imagine Homer's nectar of the gods to be like. It's like Zeus brews me a cup, hands it over and says "here, drink this".

So far I have not been able to find another unadulterated tea with such a full and strong flavor. A 10/10.

When I could no longer drink coffee ( I loved it but it stopped loving me at age 50, making my nerves too jangly and insomniac for comfort) my favorite advisor about coffee and tea suggested I try Taylor of Harrogate"s Kwazulu Tea from South Africa. Enough caffeine to keep a busy evening nurse clear and running at San Francisco General Hospital, but no frazzled nerves, and deep sleep like a baby restorative rest once off duty. i love the clean, slightly bitter taste it gives to my palate; other black teas taste insipid by comparison. If you like English or Irish Breakfast Teas, you'll find Kwazulu Tea a magnificent improvement and frankly, never want to settle for anything less. It's sometimes a little difficult to find, but like the search for the Holy Grail, worth the pursuit. Shop around on the internet for the best price since there can be overpricing.
A sante, as Julia Child always signed off.

I drink this tea everyday, you can say I am addicted to tea. This tea is what I call Real high quality tea from South Africa, not that Lipton stuff. It is rich and dark without being bitter. Best paired with sugar and milk, just like the English.

This is a strong but not bitter tea, as others have mentioned. The thing that really distinguishes it is a rich tone like fresh-cut cherry wood in the middle of the flavor. Keeps very well, smooth on the throat. I can put a gram in a full cup, let settle, and have a tasty dilute lunch tea that's more woody, or 3 grams per in a pot for something really rich, with sugar. Takes less than other teas. I've been raiding an office-mate's box, so the 6-pack of boxes will let me replenish that store and load up my own tins.

9/24/2009 update: An office mate had this and I loved it. I ordered this 6 x 4.4 oz. set, and at first taste, it was very different. A lot more bitter, much less fresh woody flavor, more like a Ceylon. I was surprised and disappointed. The office mate noticed too. She says it isn't even close. We made some, compared again. The bits and the tea color look similar, but the flavor is way off, with a flat bitter note instead of the wood note. Not sure what to do with this. Many people like this, but it isn't the Taylor's/Kwazulu charm I got to like before. Maybe I can add some wood chips from a wild fruit branch...I dunno. Woe.

The editing will NOT let me alter the rating stars. I would give it: 2 stars now. This is not what I was raving about before.

This is an excellent black tea. My preference in black teas runs toward those that are smooth and not at all bitter. This means I often end up with  somewhat blander brews with little to distinguish them. This Ntingwe Kwazulu is a great exception to that experience. It's quite brisk, has robust flavor and yet is very smooth with no bitterness. My only complaint is the powder residue in the bottom of the cup, but it's well worth it. Now my favorite black tea!

This is a very smooth loose leaf tea which tastes great in the morning. It's really good with 1/2 & 1/2! You need to brew it just right preferably in a bone china teapot! The best thing about it is that it is really well blended. I've been drinking it for years and highly recommend it!!!
Perfect cup of tea. The best tea I have had since leaving the UK to live in the US. Worth the effort to use leaves instead of a bag. It's become our daily drinker.

Taylor's of Harrowgate South African Kwazulu Tea is the perfect tea for anyone trying to give up coffee. I switched 22 years ago. Rarely, I still enjoy a really good cup clean interestingly blended, freshly ground coffee or
very occasionally, an expresso with lemon zest, but for the day to day morning dose of wake-me-up caffeine that doesn't jangle my Irish nerves or upset my tummy, it's Kwazulu Tea the is perfect for me. Try it and see what you think. M. Tealeaf, R.N. 65y.o. female

Drank this tea almost exclusively for about two years. It brews up with a full body and thick liquor and an equally robust albeit smooth flavor. This tea has a look peculiar to itself in that the leaves appear almost ball-like. I don't know if this is the type of tea bush used in this variety or if it is a characteristic of the picking and curing process.
Anyway, I ceased drinking this tea about three years ago when the formula appears to have been changed with a consequent flavor change. The tea now has a strong, and to me, unpleasant aftertaste that puts me in mind of something chemical. Anyway, I don't like it and ceased buying this blend. Before then, however, its robustness made me feel exactly how a Zulu Warrior must have felt as he went off to battle.
I believe that a reviewer below states he began drinking this as the next best thing to coffee and I wholeheartedly agree. I too kicked around for a tea that came close to the strength of coffee before settling on this one. Highly recommended to those who have to wean themselves off Java.
If you are looking for flavor, the loose leaf tea with I find the one with the most refined and complex flavor that is both robust and inexpensive is Ahmad Tea's English Breakfast tea. I see it sold only in bags here on Amazon but it is definitely a superior everyday drinker.
What can I say, I love these. Not too heavy, but filling at the same time. I used to get them straight from Poland, but that's no longer necessary.

Arrived shortly after ordering. They were good but they were stuck together and weren't as fresh as the ones at a grocery store. One of the few places to be able to get 5 pounds of gummy worms and for a fair price.
Well, I didn't really think this tasted much like pumpkin.....But the chocolate around it was delicious!  I think I may just buy the plain chocolates next time!

You have got to try this! So nice to have freshly ground spices. I put this on everything hashbrowns, eggs, chicken breasts, taco meat just about anything. has a nice smokey flavor with minimal heat! Worth a try!
Being a person with Type 2 diabetes, I have to eat whole grains. Finding a flavorful whole wheat couscous is a boon.  This couscous does not taste like cardboard.
Was looking forward to lovely whole wheat looking and tasting couscous, and got the same white bland tasting stuff I can buy at the local store for a whole lot less money.

After much deliberation about wedding favors, I ended up going the edible route and bought the Leonidas chocolate favors from Amazon.  I highly recommend these for many reasons - one, they are yummy and go well with champagne; two, they are shipped fast and no hassles; three, it's super easy - you get a box of nicely wrapped favors and you can just take it to your reception and be done with it.  All in all, I was very happy with this choice!
The product came well packaged in a Styrofoam box and each box had a nice orange bow on it. The price can't be beat. Much cheaper than Godiva and much better chocolate as well.

We gave these as a gift, they are great you can't go wrong w/ Amazon. Just make sure you don't leave them out in the warmth of the day or the chocolate might melt.
You should be home when deliver is made.

My small dog loves his new food! Due to allergies, he only eats raw food.  This is by far the best and easiest food, preparation wise, that I've purchased thus far.  He devours every morsel, however, I do recommend mixing it with another food in order to prevent weight loss or increasing portion sizes.  At first, Ewee (he looks like an Ewok) lost a considerable amount of weight on this food, so I had to increase his portions to compensate.  Other than that I think it's a great, healthy product!  Oh yeah, and it lasts for at least a month.

I wrote an extensive review of this brand for the Sojos Complete Turkey Dog Food Mix, 8 Pounds and how it has improved my dog's life and helped her allergies. It is exactly the same for this product.

However, my dogs MUCH prefer the beef flavor to the turkey. We try to switch between the two to give variety, but they eat the beef immediately and are much more excited when they are on the beef bag. The beef also looks different and has more distinguishable vegetables. However, as puppies we fed them vegetables as snack and they really like them, whereas my sister's dogs do not.

My dogs love this dog food and I love how healthy and shiny it makes them and their coats. We will continue to purchase and love the convenience of Amazon.

This is Knorr's Hunter Sauce that you use to be able to buy in your local supermarket. It is good and just what is needed to add that extra little something to your meal.

It was shipped right away and arrived before the suggested delivery date.

It doesn't matter who sells the Hunter Sauce (Jaeger Sosse), or what language is written on the package.  This sauce is perfect with mashed taters and pork chops.  According to the directions, one can use this sauce with steak and chicken; I don't doubt it.  I wish I could buy it here in Korea, but I can't.  Amazon makes buying stuff like this very convenient for me.

I'm always on the lookout for something I can use as a quick breakfast or a relatively healthy dessert, so when I saw these on the shelf I figured that I had to give it a whirl.

The good about this product is that it is only 160 calories, is pretty filling, has 40% of your daily vitamin C, & is awesome when heated. I decided to try mine heated as was recommended & I found that it didn't burn or taste funny, which is a huge bonus.

The bad is that this isn't nearly as easy to open as the manufacturers would have you believe. The plastic wrap covering the apple portion didn't peel off cleanly & I ended up getting apple goop all over me. The other bad is that this has about as much sugar in it as a 3 Musketeers bar. I'll probably end up buying this again, but only sporadically as a treat. That's just a little too much sugar for my current diet.

This does make for a filling meal, but if you're watching your sugar, looking for something to put in a bagged lunch, or wanting something a little more diet-friendly, I'd avoid this.

This is absolutely awesome! OK, so it may have sugar, but with oatmeal and apples, you still can't go wrong. The flavor is oh, so fine. One caution: it's a little wait for it to cool down enough to eat, so please be careful. And one problem: the price is simply outrageous. It's awesome, but too doggone pricey. Bought mine at Sam's Club at an excellent price only to never see it on the shelves again which is downright sad. All the same, try it and enjoy!

I'm a life long vanilla lover and was thrilled to discover this product in my local market while I was living in Southern California. Now that I'm on the East coast, I've been unable to find it. As you might imagine, I was delighted to find it on Amazon. This product is sweet (without any sweetening additives) and the lovely vanilla flavor is rich and long-lasting.  It permeates and enriches whatever I have used it in. I recommend it most highly!

I discovered Orlando Vanilla a few years ago while spending a week in Puerto Vallarta. I am a chef and specialize in pastries so a good vanilla is important. I've tried Nielsen Massey vanillas and they are excellent but they still have a bit of a chemical/alcohol scent to them. McCormick extract (the most commonly found at your local supermarket) is so strong alcohol-wise that once you've had good vanilla you'll never go back to cheap chemical tasting junk.

Orlando vanilla (and their other brand La Reyna) is strong, smells sweet with no chemical notes. The aroma of vanilla permeates the kitchen when you use it. It is very reasonably priced and since most recipes call for about a teaspoon of vanilla you will find that an eight ounce bottle like this gives you enough for 48 typical recipes. Depending on your taste or the strength you are looking for you might get fewer or more portions.

I buy mine from Puerto Vallarta when I go. I usually buy two liters (a liter is a bit more than a quart) and this year I have a tour of the factory scheduled. Kept in a cool, dark place vanilla extract has an extremely long shelf life so no need to worry about spoilage. I don't think you can go wrong using this extract. The only other way to get better flavor is to use good quality vanilla pods (see my review on those if you are interested)

I actually really liked this vanilla!  I truly didn't think I would, but it's quite fragrant with a bit of a sweet vanilla smell.  It's nice.  The only thing that would be great, is if it didn't come in a plastic bottle.

Though I like all things potato, for the most part I enjoy potato chips sparingly because of their calories and fat content. In this case, however, I made an exception, intrigued by the "Dirty" name on the bag and the low price in the local warehouse store. A third reason I avoid potato chips is a lack of will power on my part, and I soon found out that controlling one's eating with an open bag of these chips nearby requires a will of steel. Mine is a will of mashed potatoes.

Dirty chips are a taste bonanza and a sensory delight. They are thick and crispy with an intense flavor one can't get enough of. If you think about it, salt and pepper complement potatoes perfectly, even in chip form. Want a different potato chip experience, try these tasty tater treats.
These are the most awsome chips if you like black pepper as I  do you will love these you can tell the pepper is fresh ground it has a nice bite I will order again

For fun, I went to the nutrition store tonight and bought about 2 dozen different protein/nutritio bars. My daughter and I decided we would do a taste test of each one so that we could buy the ones we liked in bulk off Amazon. It was a rather expensive endeavour, especially since we threw out over half of them after the first bite.

Well, as you might imagine, there were quite a few BLECH! bars - virtually inedible. There were maybe a handful of bars that we deemed 'edible if really hungry and there were no other healthy options', and then there were about 3 that were really really tasty.

NuGo Dark Chocolate Chocolate chip was pretty good. Good chocolate flavor, texture crispy, not pasty. 190 calories seems high, but you do get 10g of protein with it. I wouldn't call it delish, but how many protein/nutrition bars are really all that good? I prefer the Luna bars by far, but that's just me.

I would not wretch to eat these, but I wouldn't be running out to buy a case of them either. If I was hungry and there were no healthier options available, I would eat it, probably with a glass of milk, and it would tide me over until dinner.

It tastes better than a balance bar, and its vegan. It tastes more like normal chocolate than dark chocolate, I think. It has enough sugar to almost put it in the candy bar category, but the protein is high enough to make it not too bad for you. It works in a pinch when I need a small energy boost and cant eat a meal or healthy snack.

If they could put some vegan sources of the common difficult vegan vitamins (B12, D, Iron, Zinc and Calcium) in this, I would consider it as a daily snack. Until then, I consider it a nice indulgence.

I had the pleasure of sampling this product earlier this week, and I have to say, of all the [anything other than pure chocolate] bars I've tried, this one had by far the best-tasting chocolate.

Not a hint of the fake-chocolate taste that's so prevalent in other bars! In fact, these nugo dark bars are so downright delicious that I'd likely pick them over most any packaged dessert choice.

And indeed, these fall squarely into the dessert category, not health-food category. In fact the only thing costing this a star is my wish that they had a bit less sugar and a bit more fiber (10g of protein is reasonable, IMHO, for a bar this size and of this deliciousness).

We bought these for my child who has anaphylaxis to nuts and dairy.  We get the product home to find out there is a shared equipment warning.  It says all preventative measures taken, etc. But if you're not comfortable giving your child shared equipment food you may want to know that up front. It would have been nice if they posted that part of the ingredient label on Amazon.

Yes, it's packaged ramen, not a health food. However, for those who want a fast and inexpensive snack or meal, Maruchan ramen is a classic. This Chili flavor can be hard to come by in some markets; I haven't found a reliable source locally for the past year or so.

Some may mistakenly think that "chili" means Mexican-style, like the dish with tomatoes, beans, and beef. Here, "chili" means chili pepper, as in spicy broth. Don't pay extra for those bowl noodles with the additional spicy seasoning packet. Maruchan chili-flavored ramen gives you the same flavor and heat for less money and less wasteful packaging.

This Chili flavor makes a great, spicy ramen with flavor and a little kick. You can enjoy it as a simple ramen soup or add meat and vegetables for a more nutritious and tasty meal. Give it a try!

Grocery stores are usually around 20 cents per package; however, the selection is less than stellar for Nissin and Maruchan. Amazon's price is sometimes a little higher, but considering there's a better selection of Maruchan than I can find elsewhere, it is definitely well worth it. I can't even find the Maruchan Chili [Pepper] in grocery stores (though I can sometimes find the Nissin of the chili pepper flavor in stores). I got these Chili Pepper noodles on Amazon for around 25 cents each.

The Maruchan chili is a bit more spicy and tastes different than the Nissin chili noodles. I'd say I like both equally well. No matter which flavor, they're a bit too salty. I sometimes will use one seasoning packet with one noodle package, because it tastes so good, but once in awhile I'll use half of the seasoning packet for one noodle package. I usually eat two noodle packages, so I just put in one seasoning packet. I put in about half of the suggested water in the frying pan to cook the noodles and all the water simmers away with no water leftover. I add the seasoning packet at the very end of cooking, so the flavor of the seasoning is still prominent, even with half the suggested seasoning.

I like the noodles in various ways. I sometimes will add one or two eggs while cooking the noodles. Other times, I'll mix in a half cup of mixed frozen vegetables while it cooks.

I am life long ramen noodle fan and I put red pepper in mine before cooking.  I have never seen these in the store.  They are awesome!  Nice and spicy too, don't need to add the red pepper.  They are not chili flavored, more chili pepper flavored.

Hate the way manufacturers hide BEEF Extract in-between all the other garbage ingredients.
They need to be more forthcoming with the advent of so many people going vegan

BTW, I'm eating the Chili flavored Ramen as I'm typing this, lol :)

Creamy Chicken used to be my favorite until I came across this Chili flavored.

I am not a big lover on spicy foods but boy, these are amazing :D

Just enough hotness to make my face a little hot but that doesn't stop me from digging into a bowl of these yummy ramen noodles!

Flavor is perfect!

But they are spicy enough that you do need a drink next to your bowl, lol

Try these! Soooo good!

I always get the chicken flavored Ramen noodles, which I loove. This week I got a pack of these to try and they are great! True, they do not taste like chili, but I knew not to expect that after I read the reviews. These are red pepper kind of spicy and they really have a kick to them. The seasoning package seems to be bigger than in the regular chicken ones and unless you want your mouth to be on fire, you can easily use only about half of the packet and it still tastes great but not overwhelming.
I love picante sauce in ramen, these are very similar to that.  Be careful though and slowly add the seasoning pack and taste as go.  Its very spicy and delicious.

24 pack for $6 is simply amazing
i stopped buying nong shim after the price went up from $16 to $20 before SS
this brand doesn't taste very well in most cases, but the chili one, is very nice, comparable to the spicy nong shim.
It's ok-but almost too spicy for my taste. It's really spicy with a touch of lime flavor. It's very different than the chicken flavor,and for the cost,worth it.

These noodles are great really spicy but not overpowering for me. I usually add some vegetable like peas and carrot. I would definitely buy again .I was not able to find it in any of the local grocery stores.

These noodles are very good, but for me there not hot enough.
Other than that there good !! Don't taste very much like chilly?

About time someone made something that hot means Hot and has some heat! I eat chicken wings all the time and I would say the heat is equal to my favorite level of chicken wing heat "HOT". The flavor is spot on with what it is called "Chili" like the bottle you have in your cabinet to make homemade red chili, but has the heat of cayenne peppers. It has good robust flavor that lingers after your done eating.

I wish they would put this seasoning in a bottle so I could sprinkle it on everything I eat. They should do this with all their flavors!!!

The price of ramen on this site is ridiculous. I found this one for $5.28 so I bought it but other wise I would definitely go back to buying from another online site that has better prices than the grocery stores. I remember when ramen was cheap. Other than that it's exactly the same quality as in the grocery stores.

I tried the plain mix and it left an empty feeling for the flavor. I mixed the product with other soups and noodles and this was a very good way to add a little spice to other things. Amazon has the best varity of these products.

These are my favorite flavor of Maruchan ramen noodles. Keep in mind that these are not at all intended to taste like American chili. These are chili flavored, as in chili peppers--a spicy flavor. They are reat for lunches at work, though low in nutritional content, they are super-cheap. Eat one package with half the seasoning packet and a daily multi-vitamin and you're set! So many people at my work order fast food every day for lunch. You'll save hundreds of dollars by trying these noodles instead. Rotate them with other tasty, inexpensive meals and you have a great, economical solution to daily lunches.

The ramen noodles that were sent to me were awesome. My fiance loves them just as much as I do. And none of the packages were damaged in any sort of way. Im definitely buying them this way. We couldn't find them ANYWHERE in the stores... so I checked on Amazon. Thankfully they had them. Thanks Amazon...

When it says chili, it means tastes hot and has some chili-ish flavor. But mostly just some spice. This is what I expected but just clarifying. It's an interesting ramen compared to the others, which tend to be meat flavored. I love it, and I'm sure anyone who likes hot stuff will. Even if you don't, its not very hot at all. I might try the picante chicken though (chicken + hot) to see how that tastes.

By the way, this tastes amazing if you add some sriracha sauce!

Chili-flavored Ramen? I was hesitant to order, let alone even try this flavor of Ramen noodles. But I figured for the low price, why not?

The noodles itself are noodles but it's the flavor packet that makes all the difference. The chili flavor isn't too bad at all. I now prefer it over the several other Ramen flavors I've tried. The level of spiciness is perfect and I am (actually) happy with this purchase. So much so that I ordered another 24 packs of it.

I am a big ramen fan and seeing this pack on sale, I picked it up as a low cost gamble. But the chili flavor is pretty horrible. The broth basically tastes [and smells] like taco seasoning. I would not buy this again.

I was pleasantly surprised at the spice in this flavor of ramen. All I had tried up to this point was chicken and beef, so the chili flavor was a nice change. I recommend ... so long as you like spicy dishes!
I highly recommend to have business with this company. I like their job. Nice price, quick shipping, tasty product.
This spinach fettucini is the best we've tasted.  There is also a recipe on the back of the bag that's fantastic.

This is the same pasta which sells for considerably more at Whole Foods, Smiths and some Albertson's. This tastes like the pasta you would be served in an upscale Italian restaurant. Since it is made from spinach (but sure doesn't test like an spinach I've had)it is very healthy and simple to make. Add your favorite sauce, or some fresh tomatoes, and a glass of wine and you will be sitting down to a very nice meal with a minimum of effort. For a change try adding some chicken, soy , meatballs or fresh vegetables.

Here in SW Florida, I find it difficult to locate spinach pastas.  I've now ordered this pasta at least several times and I'm always more than satisfied...with the quality, the taste, the cost.  What I especially like is the cooking time.  This pasta seems to be ready for serving in about two-thirds the time other pasta takes.  Ordering in quantities of six allows me to also share a bag or two or three with friends.
The Al Dente Spinach Fettuccine is the best ever - in fact have subscribed to monthly Amazon deliveries
Great product.  so good in my casseroles.. the family also loves them , they are yummy and will order more soon.
Well worth the money, especially on auto-ship. Absolutely a great value, not to mention tasty and delicious! Would definitely purchase again.

Excellent product.  My family loves it and I am providing them with the nutrients they need.  I did not realize I was getting 6 bags in one shipment, but they are easy to store and I usually cook one bag for my family of four.  I then have leftovers for work the next day.

The price is certainly right! I purchased because it came up in a search for "vegan" products. This pasta is NOT vegan -- it contains egg white. If that is not a problem for you, by all means purchase. It is fine in every other respect.
This pasta is easy to make; fast cooking; and tastes great. The packaging is terrible if you don't use all of the pasta and need to reseal.

The pasta is fine, tastes very good and the package is plenty for 5-6 people.  The problems I have are A) one of the bags arrived with a tear and some of the pasta was spilled inside the box and B) package says cooks in 3 minutes but that is NOT true. It takes about 10 minutes unless you like your pasta REALLY firm. The quick cooking was a major part of the reason I made this purchase so that, combined with the torn bag are the reasons I won't purchase again.

I did not purchase this juice here at Amazon.Com as it is 51.00 and Walmart had the identical product for 15.00. (NOTE:) Right after I wrote this review I contacted Walmart with my review- they chose not to print any part of my review;however, Walmart did change their price to 50.00 the following day.

Continuing with product review: Please read for your own health:

The juice tastes good (does not taste natural) and is thicker than normal for Pineapple and Coconut juice. Now, as any juice drinker will tell you both pineapple and coconut juice have a very thin water-like consistency. So what gives this all "natural and pure juice" its thick creamy texture, and for you who care about sugar-why does this juice have an unusually sweet taste? And those who only eat Kosher: Please read on for warnings and your health:

L & A Pineapple Coconut Juice claims to be KOSHER. It also claims the product is PURE 100% JUICE. This is stamped on the front of the glass bottle right beside the word "Natural."

After my son drank it for two days -one bottle of 32 ozs he developed severe stomach cramps. He was doubled over in pain. Upon examining him I found him to have a large lower colon fecal blockage. After treating and removal of the blockage his tummy pain is gone. (Please pay attention to ingredients below)

Upon reading the bottle more carefully I found in small white letters.

INGREDIENTS: FILTERED WATER, PINEAPPLE JUICE CONCENTRATE, COCONUT JUICE, ACACIA GUM, XANTHAN GUM AND CITRIC ACID. (I ask you- Is this "PURE 100% KOSHER JUICE"?

Acacia Gum and Xanthan Gum ( broken down into sugar-bacteria is then added to create a thickening and sweetening agent) These ingredients are used in food to sweeten and thicken. These two ingredients are also prescribed medically for patients with gastrointesional illnesses. Their purpose in the gastro gut is to cause a stool to form bulk, as in the case of a patient with very loose bowels. What if your bowels are normal? Do you want your bowels to form such bulk that you have a bowel blockage or severe constipation? If you research you will find both ingredients can have excruiating side effects for some patients and consumers- to include bowel blockage and or severe constipation.

A. Crowell National Health Care and Patient Advocate

If you love sweet relish with some heat (not mustard relish), then this is the relish to relish.  But I guess it was not a good seller for Heinz, because my local grocery store tells me that it is no longer available from their supplier.  Luckily I bought a case from Amazon about six months ago.  I took a bottle to a local sporting event for their concession stand and it was an instant hit, both on burgers and hot dogs.  It has just enough cayenne pepper to make you appreciate the heat, but it is nowhere near overpowering or even painful.  This was a very nicely executed condiment from a great condiment maker.  I hope they bring it back (I only have ten bottles left...that might last me four months).

This is hard to find at my local supermarkets so getting a case at a cheap price was an awesome find for me.  I love the combination of sweet and spicy and put it on everything. (Has a good kick so beware.) It's thick, good and convenient in these bottles.  The price  I paid was a little over ten bucks so definitely a good deal!

I don't use any other sweet pickle relish since trying this. I store it upside down in the fridge so it's always ready to go. I mainly use it in egg salad and tuna salad. It adds a zip but it's really not too hot. Maybe I don't use enough of it to get a bite from it. Good on any sandwiches, hot dogs, burgers, thousand island dressing, and my favorites - tuna and egg salads.

This isn't sold in stores around here and I've never found it in stores - I saw it on Amazon and took a chance and so glad I did. It's a mainstay for us. Please keep carrying this, Amazon. It's a nice, sweet pickle relish...good flavor, colors are bright, not a lot of liquid, squeezes out of the over-sized top easily...just a slight hotness to it. I really don't understand why this isn't on grocery shelves.
Great tasting relish , got my local food store manager looking to stock it , the meat cutters loved it also everyone is hooked on it. Great taste with that extra zing.

Imagine crunchy little almond pieces enrobed in silk made of Nutella and you have the wonderfulness of a Giamanda chocolate. These are so amazing, if/when I have a kid, I plan to name them "Giamanda"...
A friend brought these when he came to visit from Belgium they are so delicious that I'm ordering more.  Literally the best chocolate i have ever ate.

I have been ordering these chocolates as gifts for my Mother and my Mother-in-law for a couple years. I tried them myself first. These are so good and decadent I have had nothing but thanks and praise from all who have received them. These are not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Smooth, delicious, the only problem they disappear too fast unless you hide them.

You might as well save your money on this product. I had been looking forward to receiving this so much, but wound up so disappointed. First of all, the product looks nothing like the picture shown on the packaging. It is not a croissant as we know it; it looks more like an ordinary roll and VERY small at that! What made it worse, is that as I was eating it, I kept wondering WHERE the creamy custard filling was. It wasn't until I reached almost the end, that I got it! Yes, the filling is delicious, but if they put in more than HALF a tsp. of it, I'd be surprised.
Another point to consider...why do they charge over $8.00 to ship this product, when it's as light as a feather? Please consider the product itself only costs $4.49!!!! I've never written a review before, but am feeling so outraged by this, that I felt I had to warn others.

I just tried this 10 minutes ago and it smells and tastes like medicine.  Strawberry from faerie's finest is fairly good and blueberry is kind of hard to taste, but right now I can't get rid of this medicine grape smell in my room! Buy grape somewhere else.
I recommended this product to my daughter, she ordered this caviar and was very pleased. She recommends it to everyone out there.

Not very happy with the quality of this product, was really watery,the flavor was not really pleasant, "I purchase same product in two different date and was the same running eggs". Maybe in the future the seller should suggest something different,more close to CAVIAR, " just because is black and taste like fish do sent justify....."

I bought these b/c I felt a sinus infection creeping up on me...spring allergies are wreaking havoc once again. I love drinking anise tea so I saw these "Jakemans Throat and Chest" lozenges, anise flavored, and wanted to give them a try. They are deliciously smooth and have helped soothe my sore throat and another great side effect, they have really helped clear my sinus passages too. Great little lozenges, I will keep these in my medicine cabinet for sure.
Your basic tin of mints.  I don't like them as well as Altoids, but they are great for my Chicago-themed party.  I would definitely order again.

How stupid can we be, buying water, when it come free right out of your tap. That is, until you research the origin of Fluoride and realize, what on earth is it doing in our drinking water.  Until you research what it means to try and shift your body into a more stabalized alkalized state, until you research what all this nonesense concerning alkalinity and acidity and what it means to us. This water is 9.5 alkalized and that's pretty awsome, it's also revearsed osmosis which is the only way to remove fluoride and it is infused with "proper" electrolytes that we desperately need.  Water is supposed to be 7.0 completley neutral, and it's generally understood that below 7.0 resides acidity.  I used to drink Smart Water, which is also reverse osmosis, but upon research I found that the Smart water was a staggering 4.5, NOT EVEN NEUTRAL.  Obviously they did something wrong, so when you consider buying water, please do some research so you will never think that your getting ripped off buying something that you think you can get for free!

I was very dehydrated and drinking the other bottle water was not helping. I read a book title Seven Pillars of Health which mentioned that water with PH 8 and above would help. I purchased this water which taste is excellent and it doesn't leave you feeling bloated or full.
Due to my dehydration my body was very acidic causing my silver jewelry to turn black. After two weeks of drinking this water my body was no longer acidic or dehydrated.

Just a quick note to say this gets me through hot yoga class.  I actually breathe better if I drink this.  While in hot yoga, I can sometimes panic thinking I need water, but then when I have a sip of this i notice a calming feeling.  It is remarkable.  I also drink it during a day when i have a lot to do.  It calms me then.  I think it quenches thirst...thanks very much..

I love this water and have been carting it home in cases from Whole Foods until I found it on Amazon. It is about $3.00 cheaper than the price at WF (including the case discount). So far I have gotten 3 cases. The first 2 were intact but in the third, the inner box had busted open. Fortunately, the bottles were all intact..

I like this water, in part because the ph is 8.5 which is supposed to be better for you. In addition, it tastes good, and I often won't drink enough water because I don't like the way other sources of water taste. However, the price noted here ($66.00+) for 12 1.5 liter bottles is ABSOLUTELY INSANE! I just got home from Mother's Market where one bottle is $1.39! Whole Foods also carries it for $1.69/bottle. Save your money, or, if you have money to burn, do something productive with it, donate to an animal shelter or something and buy your water elsewhere!
It is a gimmick. Do not waste your money. Water is not regulated so a company can claim it does any thing

My dog went through a lot of different food in her short 3 years of life. I tried Nutro, Blue Buffalo, All organic fancy stuff that's sold only at this small ID organic pet food place, and I have to say this is her favorite. It's bit pricey, and apparently according to my friend Eukanuba should be boycotted because they do experiment on animals (I don't know if its true or not), but this seem to make her the happiest. Also, for some odd reason, my cats (they're very finicky when it comes to food) starts to eat my dogs food for some reason. The cats eat the The Blue Buffalo Co. BLUE Wilderness, but most of the time they're at the dogs bowl, eating this stuff, so go figure.

Thought I'd share, since I've never seen this with my dog and cats. Weird thing is that Dog use to steal Nutro cat food from the cats, but wouldn't touch the Blue Buffalo stuff.

p.s. my dog looks like the Border Collie on this bag.

This is a great product! I give my service dog two or three tablespoons in her food twice a day. This keeps her regular. She has not had diarrhea since I started doing this. Unfortunately it is hard to find it available during late spring and summer months. She seems to be getting a bit constipated since we ran out of pumpkin. BTW, she is 60 lbs. so if your dog is smaller you don't need to feed as much. Pumpkin is wonderful for dogs to eat if they are constipated or have diarrhea.

This product is out of this world delicious! I have no clue why people need pumpkin PIE because this pureed pumpkin simply mixed with stevia is out of this world good! I will definitely buy this product in bulk again as I love pumpkin... out of the can with a spoon!

Libby's Pumpkin is definitely the best out of all the canned pumpkins out there! I got out of my way to buy it... which is why I resorted to the internet when I realize that there was a shortage!

This is what to use if you want to make the most consistent, most delicious pumpkin pie! Libby's 100% Pure Pumpkin in the can. Libby's also makes a Pumpkin Pie Filling in a can, but stay away from it, the results will not be as good.
