Usually, supermarkets stock Libby's 100% Pure Pumpkin in the smaller 15 oz can. This extra-large (double sized) 29 oz can is often difficult to find....even during Thanksgiving and Christmas season.

A single 15 oz can makes one deep dish 9" pie (4 cup volume) or two shallow 9" pies (2 cup volume). If you are making two deep dish pies buy the 29 oz can which is far more economical. I made three pies for Thanksgiving, so I bought one 29 oz and one 15 oz cans.

This is what comes in the can: 100% pure pumpkin....which can also be called pumpkin puree or solid pack pumpkin. Nothing else, so salt, no preservatives. The pumpkin is cooked during the canning process so you could eat it straight from the can, should you so desire.

The pumpkin pie recipe is on the back of the can. I've tried other, fancier, more complicated recipes over the years but have always come back to the tried and true because, to me, this is what pumpkin pie is supposed to taste like. You get a fragrant and flavorful traditional pie with an excellent texture. The recipe calls for sugar, evaporated milk, eggs, cinnamon, ground cloves, ground ginger, and salt. I also add 1/4 tsp. ground nutmeg and a dash of white pepper. Also, I like to slightly froth the eggs because it gives the filling a smoother and more delicate almost custard-like texture.

The recipe calls for baking the pie 15 minutes at 425 and then 40-50 minutes at 350. I cover the crust with foil for the first 25 minutes to keep it from getting too brown. Also, I find that 40 minutes at 350 is more than enough. Don't over-bake! If a knife comes out clean from the center of the pie, its done.

For comparison, this 29 oz.can would normally go for about three ninety nine in your average supermarket.

One last thing, if you remove the label from the can, you will find other recipes and helpful tips printed on the other side. Its a total win-win!

There are tons of great pumpkin pie recipes that work wonderfully with this product.  But my favorite way to use this one is in a smoothie...it's incredible!!  There are so many ways to make it: I've used plain yogurt, cinnamon, nutmeg, almond milk, sometimes ginger, crushed ice and even a banana.  Any way you make it, it will be a delicious pumpkin smoothie/shake. You can even add a little vanilla protein powder.  I LOVE this product!!

The price of this product was outlandish. One half of the cans arrived with major dents, even though the package appeared to be in perfect condition. However the shipment arrived quickly. The contents of the one can we have used (the one most seriously dented) were fine.
No complaints about the case of pumpkin.  My family enjoys pumpkin pie all year round and this saves carrying them home every other week or so.

To be honest, I didn't think mixed greens in a can would taste this good! Used it for a recipe that called for frozen spinach and tasted even better with the spices and seasonings. Highly recommend for a recipe and on its own as a side dish, too!

Just bought a 12 pack of this and Orange Crush; the Orange Crush is good, not as good as I remembered but drinkable.  The Sunkist has a strange bitter taste to it---makes me feel like I gulped a chemical experiment not a refreshing beverage.  It's not as bad as the generic Big K, which is quite awful, but I don't think I can finish the rest.

This soda rocks. A welcome change from Pepsi colas and Coke Colas of the world. It taste sweet and great. They got the orange color right on the nose. Don't drink too much of this stuff or it will turn your lips and your teeth orange. Overall a great change from Pepsi and Coke Cola with a great taste. I give this soda a 10 out of 10.
Thanks for taking the time to make sure you had exactly what I needed.  The product is great and I look forward to working with you in the future!  Take care.

LOVE the S & B Curry pastes. The Hot is the best flavor of all, but they are all good. This is the easiest way to make a really good curry at home. Little fuss and little mess and this stuff served with lamb, potatoes, carrots over rice the next day is even better!
I first discovered this product in Kmart in Oahu, Hawaii.  I'm so glad Amazon had this to make my curry dishes premium!!!
This is the best Curry I have ever found, but the price was double what I would pay in the store.  Look for another source.

I've been using these "mixes" for several years and they are so great. Couldn't be an easier meal to prepare. Nice with added veggies-- green or red peppers, carrots, onions, a little potato- but not necessary to make a very tasty and unique meal.
I used to put raisins and slivered almonds on top as a garnish but lately have just been throwing some raisins in to the mix while cooking and it's great that way. My brother adds some pineapple chunks when he makes it. I've given up finding these locally so I have my California people send me some -- but I think Amazon is cheaper.

This is an awesome curry paste to use with coconut milk. For what ever reason the combination of the two work reaaly well. I have used this paste with chicken, shrimp and minced lamb and each time it has worked out really well. I also simmer coconut milk with this paste and the protein and the two work very well together.

I love this curry but all the stores around here in Beaumont have stopped selling it. Only place I could find was here on amazon. But turns out amazon free shipping is not a good deal. They wait one week before they ship. One of amazon partners on here jvc or something like that you can order this for $29 bucks and pay $6 dollars for shipping and get it shipped out right away with out having to wait and get it for a total $1 cheaper than from amazon.

I'm still waiting on my shipment. But I love curry alot so I guess it's worth the hassle. But next time I'm ordering on jvc instead of Amazon. !

I ordered the hot mix by mistake because I didn't read carefully enough. It didn't matter this mix is great and not burn your face off hot, which I hate.  Super easy and quick to make and very tasty.  Highly recommended.

The first time I ordered this product, I only got a small amount. This time I went big! It has a wonderful smell. Great for cooking.. adds a great flavor (the smell goes away when cooking). It smells NOTHING like coco-butter--which I hate. It really does smell like a fresh cracked coconut.

It also feels great on the skin after shaving or exfoliating. A small bit on hair after washing keeps it smelling wonderful and shining.

It does come frozen and is a solid at room temp. Just place it outside or on a heater vent for a few moments to make it fluid.
I love this oil. It has completely changed the way my hair feels and looks. It used to be dry and brittle but now it's soooooooo soft and manageable within less than a month of use. It's great.
Great packaging and amazing flavor make this a perfect product. There isn't a more flavorful ketchup on the market, and I have tried dozens of them.

Look, we all know that HEINZ TOMATO KETCHUP is a fantastic flavor enhancer for a wide variety of foods (especially French fries). But this, ladies and gentlmen, THIS is what HEINZ TOMATO KETCHUP was made for:

*1.5 lbs. lean ground beef
*half an onion, sliced and diced
*2 eggs
*dash of milk (2% fat recommended)
*4 table spoons Heinz Worcestershire Sauce
*2 table spoons Tony Roma's Barbeque Sauce
*1/2 table spoon Heinz Distilled White Vinegar
*pinch of McCormick Garlic Salt
*season with McCormick Black Pepper
*add sprinkling of Quaker Oats

*stir/mix thoroughly; place in cooking pan

*cover top of meatloaf with a layer of HEINZ TOMATO KETCHUP
*sprinkle liberally with Lawry's Seasoned Salt

*bake at 385 degrees F for 50-55 minutes

*Enjoy

It's the best meatloaf on the planet, hands down, and its ultimate flavor is made possible, in part, by zesty HEINZ TOMATO KETCHUP. Wow. I'm hungry!
--D. Mikels, Esq.

I had braces and doctor recommends me using straw for all the drinks.  I can use those plastic ones for the cold drink but not for the hot drink. Especially, I like drinking hot tea.  Thus, I bought this straw for that purpose.  No metal taste at all.  I just need to be careful not to break it.  So far, it works well.

My wife loves this straw.  It is well made, there is a slight rounding over at the ends like a table top, and it is much thicker than we'd anticipated.  The product exceeds our expectations.  We'd buy another.  It was also well packaged and the packaging was easily removed (Amazon box with a box with bubble wrap around it inside).

I thought it was so cool that there could be a reusable straw that you could see through so you know if it's dirty or if whatever you're drinking is getting through. Unfortunately, the glass material makes it bulky and hard to not dribble when you're drinking. Also, it's hard to store since I can't put it with my other utensils since it might roll around and break. So yes, I probably wouldn't buy another one but it's fun to use once in a while.
I'm very pleased with this purchase.  Heavy duty glass straw.  The little brush cleaner works well. I like it. I would recommend this item.

My husband always begs me for a quarter whenever we pass a gumball machine, so for his birthday I wanted to get him a private stash of gumballs.  These are perfect because they are packaged five to a sleeve, will stay fresh longer than an unwrapped bulk purchase and he can take them with him when he commutes between Seattle and Los Angeles.  The flavors are very intense and long lasting.  He was very surprised and happy with the gumballs.

I have drunk "english-blends" of tea in various forms and guises. But being a wee bit Scottish, I tend to like everything in life, "maxed-out". Almost all tea blends from various companies have FAILED to meet my criterion of "Maximum Tea Experience". Now, along comes Yorkshire Gold tea. Yorkshire Gold tea is carefully blended in North Yorkshire England by Taylors of Harrogate, and part of the real secret to this tea is the company's attention to DETAILS. Now undoubtedly, such teas like ASSAM (from North-East India) will give you some strength, but not always enough brightness. "Strength" works well at the Middle and FINISH of the flavour gamut, but initially, it is Brightness which catches your palate's attention and then the Stength simply Underscores it. It's sort of like playing a huge C chord on a concert piano in double octaves and then you gently add a LOW Contra C. The deep low note brings out the richness of the chord. The case is the same here with Yorkshire Gold. So why Yorkshire Gold and not another brand? The parent company in Harrogate is a superlative corporation who takes great pains at CONSISTENCY. The magic is in the Details. I am actually drinking a cup of Yorkshire Gold RIGHT NOW as I type this, and I can tell you, I have never found a company more consistent, attentive to details, and maddeningly insistent upon excellence. Through myriads of experiments and counter-experiments, Taylors has discovered what GRABS the tea-drinker's "Gustatory" attention, if you will. But there's more: this blend both refreshes and relaxes you like none other.
Additionally, there is something here to which coffee drinkers may relate: AROMA. When I make the loose or bag tea variants, both exude an almost beefy richness in bouquet. The process of mixing furiously boiling fresh water with the tea invaribly and consistently produces a fine aroma akin to the scent of a British Sunday Lunch where a delectable roast beef is the order of the day. Rich, piquant, and satisfying. If your brand of tea does not do ALL that I have noted ... consider a change.

If you like your tea strong and black, similiar to fine, mild coffee, then this is the tea for you. This tea is not delicate or light in any way. It is bold and robust while at the same time having a pleasant, smooth taste. Yorkshire Tea is unique and wonderful. My day is not complete until I have had a cup or two. Needless to say, I buy it in bulk quantities. I find this GOLD version to be a "touch" more refined than the regular one.

I was hooked on this company's tea twenty years ago on a semester abroad in York, England.
Good, strong, lovely- colored, rich-tasting, incomparable brew.
I am an unashamed tea snob.
If you like it weak, go find something else.

I'm an American, born and bred, but also an admitted British tea snob. And this is my absolute favorite bagged tea. I love TofA Gold as a loose leaf, but sometimes I just want to grab a quick mug. These bags are an excellent bagged cuppa!

Great rich flavored blend of black teas, without the funk of some Chinese varieties or the perfume-y taste of other blends. Good balance all around.

If you appreciate a really good cup of tea, with the convenience of a tea bag, this is the tea for you.

I love my tea, and my favorite is Yorkshire Gold tea.  It has a rich, full-bodied flavor that is not diminished by adding a little milk and sugar!  The color, after adding milk, is a beautiful, golden tan.  Each bag will make 2-3 good, large cups of tea, depending upon how strong you prefer your tea; therefore, the cost is comparable to "lesser" teas.  It is also my wife's favorite, and we have tried many different brands over the years.

My wife and myself have been tea drinkers for over 40 years, and when i found this tea in a store in Portland OR, it was love at first sip. every time we find a store that carried it, soon it was not available. So now i watch for a good price at Amazon and we buy it by the case. Make sure it is the GOLD ...
Pete C
If you are a black tea drinker you will be spoiled by the taste of this tea. I find it really difficult to drink anything else. the flavor is rich but not bitter. A nice cuppa!

Many years ago a friend in Eugene, Oregon, told me that if I ever drank Yorkshire Gold, I would never want anything else, and she was right. Today,when a shipment comes into a store, word of mouth makes the boxes disappear fast.  Once, when I asked a cashier where I could find Yorkshire Gold, he went to a back room in the store and came back out, holding the boxes of tea as if it were contraband, looking both ways before he took it to the check stand.  When Yorkshire Gold comes in to a store, there is a run on it, and you can look down the shelf where it was stacked and see a blank spot.  I have heard it is going to be difficult to get this tea in the US, although the tea drinkers in the US are responsible for its great success.
This is strong Breakfast Tea. You can get a second cup from one bag.  The flavor is very satisfying.  True English taste.

Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire Gold Tea is such a perfect tea that once you have tasted it, no other tea will do.  Each bag is strong enough for two good, very rich cups of tea, so it is actually a very reasonably priced tea. It is a strong tea, and not for fans of America's typical kind of tea.

This is a nice well rounded black breakfast tea. It steeps nicely and can carry a little milk in it. I like my tea and I have been drinking the Yorshire Gold for several years and have not been swayed by any other teas.

A Scottish friend introduced me to hot tea with milk 20 years ago.  She started me on PG Tips, which I can take or leave.  I then ordered a lot of different types while trying to find one that suited me.  YG is it - and has been for many years.  It is strong, but one bag will make 2-3 cups depending upon how strong you take it.  While strong, it has a clean, clear flavor - not woody or fruity - just good, ole tea.  I've also tried the red label - not nearly as good as Gold.  I sip others on occasion, but my "every morning" brew will always be YG!!
Comes closest to my memories of "builders tea" when I lived in England.  Better flavour than other bagged teas I've tried.  Reasonable price if purchased in the 6-pack Amazon offers.
Really good, kind of strong, but not bitter. Has more of a mouthfeel than other teas - might make it a good substitute for coffee.

As an avid drinker of Taylors of Harrogate, when I discovered that there was a "Gold" tea of the same brand, I hurriedly purchased it, anticipating being shot into hitherto unknown heights of tea-drinking bliss. I knew when the package arrived, as it descended into my home in a brilliant shaft of light. The package unwrapped and opened itself and a teabag jumped into my waiting cup.

My palate revealed that there is a difference in the quality and smoothness of this tea. The tea also presents an exquisite gold colour while steeping in the glass. The question is whether this warrants a purchase at a higher price? The regular brand, in the red box, is an outstanding tea already and likely the best one can get in the States.

There would be no need to feel that life was less lived having only sampled the regular Yorkshire. Truly, if needing to save money, one could consider themselves a lucky man with buying regular Yorkshire. If your purse contains a little more, then let fortune bestow the privilege of adding this to your daily repertoire.
I'm from england originally and love this tea so I ordered from Amazon.com. The tea is excellent and the delivery time, etc. was fast. I recommend highly. Thanks

This tea, teabag or loose tea, tastes the way tea should.
I have used both for several years. End of review.

After 10 years in Yorkshire there are so many things I will miss:  the rolling countryside, the Yorkshire dales, lambing trips in April, blustery winters, Yorkshire in bloom, and countless other things.  Being able to continue the tea tradition I picked up while there makes leaving there more bearable.  Yorkshire Gold is my favorite, but all Taylors of Harrogate and Yorkshire blend teas are spectacular.  And if you get a chance, why not enjoy your cuppa in a Betty's Tea Room:  the guilty pleasure I will miss the most!
This is very good tea.  We were introduced to F&M Royal Blend tea on a trip to London, but it is not available in the U.S.  After that brand, this is the next best thing.

there is nothing like a fine cup of warm Yorkshire tea in the morning.  When I found that I could purchase this online, I did so quickly and was rewarded with a prompt delivery.  Just in time for the holidays, and a couple snowstorms that confined us to our home to enjoy many cups of tea.

I usually need two tea bags to make a cup of tea that satisfies me, but his tea is so full-bodied and fragrant that one bag makes a really intense, delicious cup. I'm normally a coffee person, but I've been enjoying this as my morning beverage for months with no temptation to switch back.

Yorkshire Gold is a very robust tea.  I do need to watch the steeping time or it is super strong!  Two bags will make a nice pot of tea (with Red Rose I need four).  I may prefer Yorkshire Gold brewed for iced tea with sugar and lemon rather than with milk and sugar as a breakfast tea.  Either way, I do not like it with honey.  Overall, Yorkshire Gold is a very nice tea, but I prefer PG Tips.
This is an excellent tea. It is robust and tastes great with milk and/or sugar. It is good anytime of the day.

The very best black tea there is! I agree that there are a few good black teas, but if consistency and a deep, rich, delicious quality in a tea are attributes you desire, then you must consume Yorkshire Gold. I have enjoyed this tea for many, many years, and recommend it highly.  Brian
This is a robust, rich English style tea worthy of the "gold" rating.  The price in the six-pack configuration is very good.  I have been drinking this tea for several years.

This tea is a true English luxury, but once you taste it, it is difficult to be satisfied with less than the finest tea this company makes. Yorkshire Gold tea has more flavor and character than most teas.

The secret seems to be in the high quality of the teas selected for Yorkshire Gold and in the shape of the tea bag which allows for the tea leaves to spread out more and I think this enhances the ability for a full tea flavor to develop.

This tea blend is perfect to steep along with a cinnamon stick. It is strong enough to serve with whipped cream and a dash of nutmeg.

The art on the box was painted by Lizzie Sanders and it sets a nice English mood for your tea drinking experience.

~The Rebecca Review

After tea, Watson and I did not stay for any afters since we were in a rush to catch a train with a friend of ours that we will just call, "Agatha." "Agatha" was always such a great story teller! Murder, conspiracy, "who-dunnits" and the like. I for one, was very fond of Agatha, considering she was one of the few women in our
town that had all of her original teeth and one of three that had both of her thumbs. (That is another story for another day.)

Getting back to the tea. Soothing, lovely with a scone....missing the days of being pushed on the swing as a
child.

For tea lovers it doesn't get any better than Taylor's of Harrowgate Yorkshire Gold.
We found this tea in a supermarket in Gainesville, Florida while visiting my wife's sister a couple of years ago.
Back home, in Virginia we checked several upscale stores and couldn't find it.
Searched Amazon and there it was. Now have a standing order with Amazon and have been very pleased.

I am a bit of a coffee snob, but have not studied teas much yet. I have a variety but not a great deal of knowledge. So from a "layman's" perspective I can say, this is very, very nice black tea. Compared to some other loose-leaf black teas I've usually purchased from the Indian markets, this is relatively very rich, fragrant, and not at all bitter. I'm enjoying it immensely and have shared it with coworkers, who also thought it was great. So, take that for what it is: a tea layperson's endorsement. :)

Yorkshire Gold Tea is a consistently high quality product that provides outstanding flavour with each & every cup. It provides satisfaction that meets our expectations of what a "good cup of tea" should be - pleasingly robust but, without a bitter aftertaste. It is the best tea available!
I treated my friends and I to a bunch of these dry aged steaks.  Amazing.  My NY Strip was as tender as a ribeye.

We have 2 dogs; one is a Aussie Shepard mix and the other is a Blue Healer mix. They just love to go after these treats in their bongs. They last for at least a half hour, and believe me, this is very benificail to my wife and me.
My Boston Terrier loves her kong toy and these peanut butter snaps.  It took her about a year to finally break the large kong rubber toy (She's a very aggressive chewer)

I gave this product two stars because it did seem to keep unpleasant odors at bay. However, the actual scent of this deodorant was unpleasant itself. It was just an odd smell on the skin. In the applicator, it was fine, but on a few different people ( who rubbed it on their forearms to test), the scent was not a good one. I did not like the way it reacted with me. It also gave me an itchy rash so I had to give up on it. One person said it smelled like urine,not good at all! But I didn't give it one star only because it seemed to do its job by keeping away the BO, I think.

For about a year I've been trying to find a nontoxic deodorant that actually works.  I'm a sweaty person, so this is not an easy task. However yesterday, I picked this stuff up and it works very well, I wore it for about 15 hours without any BO, and woke up this morning still smelling fresh.  This one actually works!

We all love the Tree Hugger K-Cups. It's one of the best ones we've had. I read this flavor was in danger of being discontinued so I will have to stock up just in case. That would be a huge bummer if they actually did discontinue them.
I am not a huge coffee drinker but we got a sample packet of these at work.  Great flavor and great taste.  The entire office agrees that this is one of their favorite.

Since acquiring a Keurig-type brewer several months ago, I've been sampling, one or two at a time, all of the bold varieties I've been able to find in a K-cup. I'm in no way a connoisseur of coffee; just like a straightforward, strong, not bitter, cup or two to start my day. Although not my absolute favorite among the brews I've tried, Tree Hugger ranks near enough to the top of my list for me to say that I'll definitely purchase it again. Try it and enjoy!

Also, because my income is truly "fixed," it's an added bonus that I can purchase this in the 50-pack quantity--much easier to fit into a monthly budget!

This is my second time ordering this product and ive been totally happy with both. I love the full bodied coffee and the title doesnt hurt. After all I am a "Tree Hugger" and I love the idea behind this coffee. The seller is very prompt and my order comes fast. On this last order I was almost out, had one more cup left and went to my mailbox...there it was and I was so thrilled. I will continue to order this as I run low. Thank all responsible for this product and its delivery.
Coffee People, Tree Hugger, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers (Pack of 50)
This coffee is for coffee lovers. My husband thought it was too strong. I thought it was just what the name implies.  Great taste and great coffee! This is one of my favorites.

This is by far the favorite in our house. We have ordered all sorts of different brands, variety packs, and flavors. This is even better than the Starbucks machine I have at work. I like the Donut shot also, but this my favorite. Rest assured, the 50-pack is a good choice.

I've tried a lot of K-Cups and this is by far my favorite. I like a very strong, but not burnt/bitter coffee. It is hard to find extra bold k-cups that are medium, they are usually dark roast. This one has been consistently strong (even on the 10oz setting of my Keurig mini). I am really don't understand the other reviewers who say it is weak. I know that I am very picky about weak coffee, I can't drink any of the non-bold k-cups as they all taste watery to me, but I've never had a problem with this. I am wondering if it may be because I have the mini and it brews this k-cup differently than the regular or alternately if some people confuse dark roast with coffee being strong.
Anyways this has a very nice strong non-bitter taste, I would say there are hints of chocolate in it. Very tasty. I am also a big fan of the Coffee People Donut Shop coffee.
I really like Coffee People brand K-Cups and Tree Hugger does not disappoint! This coffee is strong enough without being bitter like some coffees.

I order K-Cups in the 50 packs all the time and look for the good discounts.  However, the Tree Hugger was too weak, actually tasted "watery".  I normally order the organic coffees, Columbian and sometimes donut shop, so my preference is not for 'robust' coffees.  but, this was too weak even for my taste.

I purchased the "Organic" variety of this brand last time and I was very happy with the flavor and strength for a 10 oz cup. The "Organic" variety was not available this time so I ordered this other organic "Tree Hugger" variety. It seems that the flavor is much weaker for this variety versus the "Organic". On a side note, the taste is good if you brew a small cup (i.e. 6 oz).
Because we were having guests for a visit, I ordered extra coffee.  We found tree hugger to be a real good bold coffee, it was full bodied with out any bitterness.  I will order this coffee again.

Coffee People's Tree Hugger Coffee is the favorite at my office. We have cycled through many different Keurigs. Most of them end up not tasting strong enough or flavorful enough, since we are accustomed to awesome local coffees from Blue Bottle and Four Barrel.  But Tree Hugger is an exception. It makes a well-rounded, solid-tasting cup of coffee and continues to be our favorite after every new K-Cup we try.
Great coffee, and I feel good knowing it's fair trade as well as organic.  For an organic product, it is priced reasonably.  Shipping is fast.
So happy to have found one of my favorite Keurig Kcups at a cheaper price. Full, dark, robust, organic, yum.

I am not taking to the taste of this coffee. For me, it had a medium roast flavor, (meaning not too strong), and a slight burnt-bitter aftertaste. There is an ever-so slight hint of cocoa in the flavor, not to it's detriment. I did not want a super-strong coffee, and I was  hoping that this would not harbor the burnt/bitter aftertaste that some of the stronger coffees seem to have. In any case, I am trying to find a medium roast, good smooth coffee to replace the Van Houtte Kenyan k-cups, since they are not being sold now, and Tree Hugger is not the one to fill those shoes for my taste.
Not as bold as Tree Hugger and a little bitter. All in all there are better choices...Jet Fuel and Tree Hugger in the bolds.

Its OK...Tad weak for me...Love CP kcups but this one was a tad disappointing...Only CP Kcup i've tried so far and didnt care for too much......Dont get me wrong..its not bad...just 'fair' to me but others may love it.

I can make it a tad better using 2 kcups for 1 cup, but even then it still is not up to par, in my opinion anyway, to other CP blends. Just a tad too weakish and mild on the flavor for my individual tastes.

I believe this is supposed to be a 'bold' Kcup. Which doesnt mean a super dark roast..bold refers to them adding I think 20% more coffee per kcup. However, when I shake a kcup compared to all other 'bolds' this doesnt seem to have as much coffee.

Plus, it must be a light roast, as well.....

Saw some reviews saying this is as bold as it gets...

Man.,..if anybody things this is bold/dark/strong/rich.....then dont even try organic, jet fuel, black tiger, wake up etc....cause those are far bolder/stronger/richer/darker with a whole lot more flavor...each very unique as all CP blends are, including tree hugger...I just think tree huggers uniqueness is far to bland all around for me.....
A good balance, very tasty, the only k-cup we buy on a regular basis. The other coffee people flavors are usually pretty good as well, but the tree hugger is our favorite by far.

The title really says it all.  I have tried so many different types of K-cups and Tree Hugger is full flavored and smooth, and not at all bitter.  This is my absolute favorite and it is the only one I will buy now.

Tree hugger is the best coffee I've ever had.  It is mellow, full bodied, but doesn't have the bitter  edge that other rich blends have.  I certainly hope this is not discontinued because it is really the best!
it is comperable to gj's not quite but it will do still good coffee i have a sensitivity to cafine seems to be in how the deans are roasted this seems to be fine in that way

You really can't go wrong with Coffee People K-cups. I like their bolder stronger flavors but decided to give this organic one a try this time. Definitely not as strong as some of their others but it has a good taste to it and no bitter acidic aftertaste. If you like really strong coffee I'd try something of theirs more along the lines of Jet Fuel but this is a nice change of pace.
I have been looking for a good dark roast coffee for awhile and this one is really good.  It comes the closest I have found to a brewed in the pot cup of coffee and I am always sad when I run out!
The past two years this has been my go to Bold.  The 50 pk is a great value and the coffee reminds me of Rain forest Espresso or Santa's Buzz.
I think this is better than Starbucks coffee. The best part is the freshness that you get from each cup that you make. Love it and have it at least twice a day. So lets have a cup!

Coffee People has always been my favorite brand of coffee. This is probably because I prefer bold and full bodied coffees. I was told by one of their employees their secret is they use 30% - 40% more coffee than the competition. Since they were acquired by Green Mountain Coffee, who is buying up all the K-cup makers, this brand is going downhill quickly. It is probably because the profit margin is less because of the extra coffee needed to make their brand special. They used to have at least 10 different blends, now they are down to four. They have done away with three of the best flavors, Organic, French Roast, and Santa's Buzz (seasonal).

This Tree Hugger seems to be representative of the "new" Coffee People brand, it is weak, bland, and boring.

would purchase again if it goes on sale. not worth the regular price though.  as with all k-cups now, the price has inhibited my purchases. no reason for the price increase other than pure greed. coffee prices are cheaper now than they were in the past.

I'm a big fan of Coffee People bold and dark roasts, and this one is no exception. Tree Hugger has an almost chocolaty taste and well balanced. The fact that it is organic and fair trade is an excellent bonus. Note that I like a splash of milk in my coffee and seldom drink it black (only when I'm out of milk), so I cannot speak for those who take their coffee straight. Nonetheless, for those who like it bold, I recommend Tree Hugger, as well as the other Coffee People bolds: Wake Up Call, Organic, Jet Fuel, and (especially) Black Tiger. I drink them all because they are each subtly different from the others.

As much as I like Coffee People bolds, my favorite remains Green Mountain Coffee Revv. And, like many others, I'll be glad to see the return of Coffee People Kona Blend. Let's all pray for a good crop in Kona, Hawaii, this year.

If you are one of those who prefer juice which taste like 'fresh squeezed', you will love this grapefruit juice!  It has NOTHING added to the basic juice except water, and very little of that!  The juice does not have a 'canned' taste, rather it is most like fresh.  In other words, I love this stuff!
The problem with this seasoning is that it is totally overpowered by the mesquite flavor. There isn't much to the flavor profile except mesquite and more mesquite. I would take a pass on this one.
Perhaps I'm not grill master, but I and my family absolutely love this stuff.  We can't get enough of it when we bbq chicken.  I haven't had it with beef, but for the chicken its superb imo.

I LOVE PONS organic olive oil! PONS has graced pasta, salads, seafood, rice, farmer's market veggie dishes and dips for fresh bread (with a little Celtic Sea Salt) for several years. Exceptional taste, wonderful quality (organic, extra virgin) - it is SO delicious! I've sampled dozens of olive oils (there is such a great variety of taste and flavors available). PONS is my personal favorite by far. I moved away and couldn't find it in any of the local stores, so I placed an order with pastacheese via Amazon (great experience/packed well/timely arrival - thank you pastacheese!) Very happy to have my favorite olive oil again :)

I bought these eyes to put on faces for my daughter's lunch sandwiches & fun things I do for her. I had no idea they were the size of nickels since there are no measurements!  Will use, but I'm also going to buy some smaller ones for more practical uses.  Product arrived exactly as described and promptly.

I got these to make owl cupcakes, size is a nickel. I love how they were packaged, its guaranteed to not break - tightly packaged and padded. The back of the eye's are flat, so its not completely round, its like a button, but edable, and it tastes sugary good. I'm satisfied.

These worms taste great.  I share these with my two nephews and they love eating them too.  I asked one of my nephews which was better, these worms or a typical gummy bear from an ordinary company, and he said that these were better because of taste and that it wasn't too hard to chew on.  I chooose getting these because of it's soft chew and taste, which can be found similarly on Black Forest gummy products.  These can melt in the mouth if you keep it in there long enough and with mininal chewing to it.  You get two five pound bags that are sure to last a while.  I would recommend to anyone to try these for themselves.
The worms are really good. There are 3 different colors and each worm has 2 colors on it sorted in different ways. Kind of like the pokemon Spinda.

I am a gummy connoiseur of sorts and have to say that these worms taste fantastic.  The price is amazing.  Aside from Haribo brand, I think Black Forest is the next best gummy.  Proceed with reckless abandon!
Flavor makes everything tastes sooo good!! I am always looking for products to make my cooking taste good, because flavor is the key!! Price and shipping was great, as well!!

I have used this seasoning for many years as do many chefs.  Top notch seasoning!  It used to be called "Praise Allah" until the PC crowd complained. Seafood, soups, vegetables (Great with soup beans), pork & beef. Just discovered it available from Amazon.  Have usually purchased it through a restaurant food supply. I have never seen it in grocery stores.
This is my family's favorite flavor of the Hansen Diet Sodas.  It has a clean and crisp taste and is enjoyable on its own or with meals.  It even calms down an upset tummy.
If you like the taste of artificial strawberry flavoring then this drink is for you. Be sure that you use a blender because there is no way that you can dissolve this product in milk using a spoon.

I used to love Perugina's Baci, so I decided to try this since I've never had their milk chocolate.  Somehow I was just not impressed with this bar.  It wasn't overly sweet, which is always good in my opinion, but there was something missing.  Ritter Sport has a milk chocolate cappucino bar which is better, but is a little sweet for my taste.  Before trying this one, you may want to try the one by Ritter Sport.
Hard to find...this particular chocolate is an essential in creating a marvelous flourless second-to-none chocolate cake.

I love that I can order Carnation Vanilla packets on line for a dollar less then the stores (if you can find vanilla).  Also get it in 2 days.  Now these guys were $2.50 off per 10 packets and I saved over $40 on the order.  Can't do much better than that.

We're seniors now & have had Carnation Instant breakfast
in our home for at least fourty yers. We enjoy it as much
today as we always have. We're ordinarily not real big on
a sit down breakfast & so we appreciate having the nourishment
of a sit down morning meal sort of "on the go". It's a great
benifit to find it at such a good price on Amazon AND have
it delivered to our home on a regular basis.
Years ago Carnation used to make a coffee flavored Instant
Breakfast srink & it was killer good! Seems like as many
varied coffee products selling so well these days they would
bring it back. We'd love that, & so might you. :)

My nutrionist "prescribed" Carnation Instant Breakfast (CIB) to me many years ago when I was a child. Though I think I have "outgrown" it but I continue to drink it, mostly for breakfast because I like the various vitamins, minerals, and protein it provides along with the convenience. Most morning it is my only form of sustenance as I rush to work. Tastes great, can't go wrong with Vanilla. Sometimes I switch things up a bit and get the variety pack which has Strawberry, Vanilla, and Chocolate. Back in the "good old days" a box of 10 packs cost only 3.50. Now it ranges from 4.99-6.99 hence I have decided to go online and get the bulk pack which is a good deal relatively speaking.  If only they have vanilla flavor canisters available, like they do for chocolate. Definitely recommend CIB. In fact, I have recommended it to a handful of friends.

i purchase these very regularly, locally they range from 4.65 to 5.25 at the grocery stores, etc. per box.  this has been the best deal i have found plus its eligible for free shipping.  the carnation boxes are nicely packaged in a hefty cardboard box and arrive quickly.  you get 6 individual boxes of 10 count packs as the description states.  i usually blend one up with my handheld blender into a cup of milk for my boys, the taste is nice and they do enjoy it.  It is exactly what it states it is and i prefer taking the hassle out of trying to find these locally (have been sold out locally especially once school started).

Great price, fast delivery. Thank you.
These instant breakfasts have been a perfect extra snack for my boys on the go. While some may use it as a meal replacement, we use it for inbetween meals when a piece of fruit isnt enough. It seems better to me than chips/pastries/cookies. My boys love the vanilla flavor as it is mild and doesnt leave any after taste.

My husband depends on a stomach feeding tube for all nourishment.  He cannot take in anything by mouth.  Carnation  Breakfast Essentials have been a real blessing in helping to get some caloric value back into his body.  We have used as many as five packets a day.  Thank you for such a great product.  The convience of use also are of the utmost importance.
We need to buy these for one of our children who has special needs and the price on Amazon can't be beat.
Really great stuff, each packets contains the same mount of protein of 2 eggs.  easy to make milk shake with these.

I've been eating carnation instant breakfast for a few years now and this is about as a good a price as I've found (I've found it cheaper when on sale at a local store but those sales are rare). I use two cups of milk instead of the instructed one, so the flavor is diluted a bit, but still good.

I have purchased this product several times.
Prompt shipment. Good packaging.
Item as expected. Priced fair. Satisfied.
Will purchase again.

This product was recommended to us by the pediatrician.  My daughter doesn't like to eat and so we have to supplement her milk to give her more protein and calories.  We dilute it more now that she's older.  For every packet of powder, we mix it with 20 ounces of milk so it's not overly sweet.  I've heard that pediasure is a lot sweeter.  I also use the carnation packets to make smoothies and they taste so much better with the packets.  Highly recommend.
We buy this item all the time for a quick breakfast on the go. This is not the first time I have purchased this item. I get it all the time and it is a good deal on Amazon

Regular milk, even lactose free milk is hard on my stomach. I love the taste of the vanilla CIB and have found it mixes great with Almond milk (found in the dairy section next to the real milk). Almond milk also has more calcium and more protein than regular milk. I've tried mixing it with coconut milk but could still taste the coconut.

I have vanilla CIB every morning for my breakfast, then eat a light lunch around 11, and a regular dinner at 5. There have been times when I wake during the night and find my stomach growling. I don't feel like eating but it's hard to go back to sleep with a hungry tummy. I just get up and mix one of these drinks and go back to sleep.

To mix, I pour my tall glass about 3/4 full with almond milk. Dump in a CIB packet and stir with a spoon. Insert straw and drink. It feels odd to me to drink it by sipping on the side of the glass. The mix is a little on the thicker side and I prefer a straw EVERY time.

My kids enjoy the chocolate CIB and they like their milk warmed first. They actually call it "hot chocolate". They too, have some every morning and then a light breakfast of toast or cereal.

"I like vanilla, it's the finest of the flavors."

The song is correct. Vanilla is the finest of the flavors. These get old if you have them everyday, and occasionaly benefit from the addition of some fruit, but you can't go wrong. Also, the carnation brand tastes much better than the generic store brands. This is one time where you benefit from going with the name brand.

I first had Carnation Instant Breakfast as a snack when I was a kid, and now my kids love it too. We usually get Chocolate, because it is cheaper (about $10 for a 30-pack at Costco), but we prefer Vanilla (we like vanilla milkshakes better than chocolate too). $30 for this pack of 60 is not a bad price considering how much it is at the store--you might be able to find it cheaper sometimes on sale and/or with a coupon, but Amazon is so convenient that I decided to stock up.

I love this, because it is great as breakfast on the run (my teen has it almost every day) or a yummy but healthy snack for the kids--or ME! The kids feel like they're getting a treat and I feel like they're getting vitamins!!! Sometimes I drink this instead of grabbing something from the candy bowl--tastes great and I don't feel guilty! It's a great alternative to pre-mixed chocolate milk too.

Now if only Amazon would put this on subscribe and save... :)

The taste is alright. I'm one of those weird people that really doesn't really get a kick out of eating (I eat to live not live to eat) it takes away the hunger pangs while keeping me nourished when I don't feel like eating real food.

We tried this oatmeal about 2 years ago. My sister recommended it to us. It has such a wonderful flavor and texture. It's not the flakes like we're used to. It's little nuggets, steel cut, that take a little while to cook but it's well worth the extra time. It's creamy and nutty and tastes wonderful with bananas and raisins and brown sugar. I highly recommend giving this product a try!

(If you put the oatmeal in with the water to start and let it come to a boil and then turn it down to simmer it doesn't take quite as long.)

McCann's is a new experience in oatmeal. It takes longer to cook, but boy oh boy, is it worth it. It's best to cook the full recipe that they speak of: one cup McCann's, four cups water. Not real tough to remember!

Unless you use the shortcut method, it takes over 30 minutes to make one batch. So if you're going 'green' (energywise), try the overnight method. And warming it up the next morning with the microwave is great; I put milk on it before nuking it. So good when it comes out!

Note: if you undercook McCann's, it'll be like eating pearl barley (or birdshot) that's not cooked long enough--- not a great treat. Remember, it is full grains of oats that have been cut maybe once each, but many at a time of course. The water must be given time to permeate the oats grains.

Great for comfort food on those cold mornings when you want something that'll stick to your ribs, plus be good for ya.

A friend that I and one Mr. S.G. "Long Lense" Johnson call "Oatmeal Beard", a.k.a. "Prof. Braddock" (don't ask)--- because he used to eat oatmeal, out of the pot, every morning for years driving to work (but it was the 'quick' stuff), well we put him on to McCann's............. a real officianado of oatmeal. I eagerly await his review of this fine product. I give it a huge thumbs up!
The steel-cut oats from McCanns is truly a wonderful product.  And the service was excellent.  I received the product in just a few days after placing the order.
Product arrived quickly and wrapped properly. Quality of the oil was far beyond my expectations. Would recommend this product to anyone interested in culinary bliss.

I got this for a friend for his 50th birthday.  It really took you back in time.  It was a lot of fun going through all of the different candies and letting them take you back to your childhood.  Pop rocks, burlap bag of gum nuggets, candy necklace, bit o honey, candy cigarettes, even the Hersheys candy bar had the old wrapper on it.  It was fun.
Lots of goodies.  She loved it.  Was fun exploring and remembering the younger candy days :)
The picture makes the package look a lot bigger. The candies were very nostalgic, but way over priced for the value.

I received this as a gift.  Company enclosed a receipt in box so I know how much the sender spent - had to hunt to see who it was from....plus once I saw the receipt, I realized they had paid $34 for less than $10 worth of candy.... all these candies can still be found in local stores.... gum was hard as a rock - taffy just about took my fillings out.  Really poorly done.  I will be passing this info on to the person that sent this to me.  Loved the idea of the gift -- just really bad quality.

I purchased this item for my wife's 50th birthday party. A little expensive but good quality and lots of fun.  We played pin the tail on the donkey and gave out pieces of 60's era candy to each player.  They loved it.  Amazing how candy from the 60's brought back good memories to everyone.

This was a bit pricey for what you actually get in terms of candy, but consider it more a discussion starter and a vehicle for going down memory lane.  It is well packaged and a lot of fun. I bought it for a gift mostly because I wanted one myself and I thought the idea was very good. It is well packaged and delivery was quick. I would have given 5 stars but for the price and they tossed in several items that definitely were from the 70s, not the 60's. Good gift!
This "gift" was for a woman that just turned 50 years old. A great idea for decorations and stuff needed for the perfect party!

The picture made it look much better and bigger. Definitely not worth the money. I should have gone and bought my own and could have made a similar box. Although my sister liked it I was very disappointed and wish I could at least get a partial refund. Advice to others: make your own they will never know!
Gave this to my Dad for his 50th birthday..He really liked it..It was alot of fun eating and enjoying the candy my parents grew up with...REALLY COOL GIFT..

A good selection of candy from the past. I had this selection sent to my daughter for a party she was giving just before Christmas. She did not open it until everyone was there so they could all enjoy the walk down memory lane together as they sampled candies from her childhood as well and their childhood of things gone by.

i've brought all of the decades of candy, except for the 90's...they make wonderful gifts,and people loved them ...everyone was reliving their childhood...the only thing is, everyone is asking for squerrel nuts...
Cute idea for a 50th gift, but the soft candy was hard, perhaps indicating somewhat not fresh. Would buy again if this issue was solved.

I have bought this product for the last 18 months because it had no sugar and it was great for my toddler.  Well what a shock I had when the latest box I purchased said it now contains SUGAR too!!  The only organic cereal now out on the market with no added sugar or evaporated cane juice is Barbara's Organic Cereal o's.  Make a statement and do not buy this again!!  Very disappointed with Cascadian Farm...why ruin a perfectly good no-sugar cereal???

In the past few weeks this General Mills product was reformulated with 3 time the sugar.  This change was made without ANY changes to the packaging outside of the nutritional label.  This product went from a mainstay for us and our toddler to something we will no longer be buying.

I assume market forces dictated that Cascadian Farms add sugar and a more "refined" appearance to their cereal, but now it's just another box of sweetened junk--albeit organic junk. Too bad. Me and my two-year-old son were very happy customers--but now we'll have to look elsewhere. And I'll have to start reading the ingredients of everything I buy from Cascadian Farms with a skeptical eye, now that I know what their business plan is.

My family used this product for over 4 years, but last year the recipe was changed, sugar was added. That decision was probably driven by Cascadian Farm's desire to increase profits (cheaper production, more appealing to mainstream sugar junkies). Unfortunately, there aren't many choices right now for nutrition-conscious individuals. Even the so called organic/health cereals are loaded with sweets (all sorts of syrups, juice concentrates). Starting a morning on that note sets you up for a roller-coaster ride of high-low blood sugar. I had nothing else to do but to start cooking whole grain cereals (oatmeal, millet, buckwheat). It takes a bit of planning - you have to allocate time for cooking in the morning or cook the nigh before, but in the process you can save a ton of money. For instance, a pound of organic millet costs from $0.99 to $1.79 depending on the retailer (or $0.06 to $0.11 per oz). In the process of cooking grain absorbs water and increases it mass at least 3 fold. That makes the price of cooked cereal go down as much ($0.02 to $0.04).  Compare that to $0.48/oz price for Purely'Os! Then maybe the recipe change introduced by Cascadian Farms is truly a blessing for your wallet, if you are willing to wait 20 minutes, while you cereal is boiling on the stove. This time is not lost, but gained - you can use it to practice sun salutation to make your morning even more glorious!

I'm looking for an oat cereal to feed a young child and was excited to see that General Mills offered an organic alternative to its well-known conventionally-made Cheerios. Imagine my dismay to see that they've recently adulterated the product both with sugar and with cheap corn fillers. When General Mills acquired Cascadian Farms, they made a big show out of keeping on founder and CEO Gene Kahn to run the new subsidiary. Now, Kahn holds the title of Vice President of Sustainable Development at General Mills. It seems he's either lost touch with the company he founded, or has sold out to the interests of his new mega-corporation paymasters.

Shame, Gene! Is this sugared corn-stuffed junk really what you founded Cascadian Farms to produce?

We received an email back from Cascadian farms. "People" in the US like sugar.
I've enjoyed Purely O's for quite a few years until I noticed something different. I thought it was the milk, but no, I eat them from the box of the evening if I need to take medicine with food. They were a 5 star and we bought them in quantities on sale until we noticed the taste and started checking around. Sugar? If I wanted a sugary taste and sugary cereal, I'd chose a a regular branded sugary cereal, there are plenty of them.

3 years ago we looked long and hard for a sugar free, whole grain finger food for our then 6 month old.  Our son enjoyed this cereal as a snack and until recently, as a cereal, but then I bought my most recent box and noticed right away they didn't look the same.  When I tasted one I immediately knew they were sweetened and sure enough, when I checked the nutrition label it showed 3g of sugar per serving.  The label is completely unchanged except for the ingredients and this is dangerously misleading.  We live in a country where diabetes is rampant and sugar can be very dangerous.  How frightening that they Cascadian Farms/General Mills would sneak sugar into their cereal without changing any of the main labelling.  I will never buy anything from them again!

These used to be our and our 9 mo. old daughter's favorite snack. Unfortunately the company changed the formula altering the flavor and the nutritional value - not for the better. We plan to throw out the current box and stop buying this product and possibly others from the organization. The reason: Cascadian Farms, and their owner General Mills, dramatically altered the product without changing the packaging. It might seem like good business; however, it comes across as deceptive. Now, to find other cereals that meet the nutritional and flavor needs we used to get in the real Purely Os.

I've lost all respect for Cascadian Farm in recent weeks for taking our favorite cereal bar none and turning it into junk overnight - this cereal had been our staple for half a decade since our son was a baby (now he's almost 5), because it tasted great and had no added sugar.  I found it when specifically looking for a cereal without the sugar, and it fit the bill for years.  Then suddenly a week ago our son said it didn't taste right and refused to eat it and I looked at the box and while nothing else on the box had changed the ingredients certainly had - I had one leftover old box and the old ingredients were whole grain oat flour, whole grain barley flour, wheat starch and sea salt, and the new ingredients are whole grain oat flour, corn meal, sugar, oat fiber, wheat starch, sea salt, tapioca syrup, molasses (i.e., they have now added corn meal, sugar, oat fiber, tapioca syrup and molasses and removed whole grain barley flour).  It's completely misleading - the new box has a picture of the old Purely O's, but the new cereal looks completely different from the old one, even though the picture hasn't changed. Now we're stuck with cereal we won't eat and can't return because it's opened.  I contacted the company to complain and asked where I could get the old formula and their response was not helpful - they didn't answer the question of where to get the no-sugar version and the response was pat - i.e., they were sorry to hear of my disappointment regarding this reform and would share my thoughts with the appropriate individuals.  This is so misguided and a perfect example of large companies getting into the organic business and managing to end up serving us junk by another name; the old product was quality, the new one is one to avoid.  While boycotting an entire company's product line is not typical for me, I am leaning toward refusing to buy ANY of their products any longer due to this change and the company's response to my inquiry; I can't in good faith buy from them when other companies are acting more responsibly.

My family has loved this cereal for around 7 years or so before they ruined it. Also, the taste of the new sugar version is very poor. We have tried O's cereals without sugar from our local Whole Foods Market as well as Barbara's, but we don't really like them. For some reason, nothing stands up to the old version of Purely O's. We have now substituted Amaranth Flakes by Arrowhead Mills, which is a superior yet delicious cereal in my opinion (as well as my 2 little girls' and husband's opinions). We have abandoned O's cereals for now, not being able to really like Barbara's or WF's versions, but we will buy them if the original Purely O's cereal ever comes back. Certainly, if Cascadian Farms won't listen to its customers, then some other company should hopefully seize a great opportunity here. Especially since O's are so beloved by and wonderful for (developmentally) toddlers, who may grow to love them young, and keep them as a staple in their diet for years, perhaps for a lifetime. The opportunity for a company here is strengthened further by the huge market of devoted parents of young children who will seek out the healthiest version of O shaped cereal that their children will eat and enjoy... and will even pay a bit more for the higher quality. How we do care what we feed our precious growing tender dependent sweet little bundles of joy!

Who takes a sugarless product and suddenly adds sugar to it - without changing one speck of packaging (except the ingredients list and calorie content)?  Manipulative? Fraudulent? Stupid? Whatever the rationale, Cascadian Farm messed up big time on this one.  I'm going to avoid the cereal and the whole brand from now on unless they make a change (Remember Tropicana's rollback of their ugly new packaging?  Consumers CAN impact these corporate choices by switching allegiances).

This cereal used to be good AND have almost no sugar at all. Now the formula has changed and it looks and tastes horrible. For anyone trying to limit sugar for themselves or their kids, this is not the cereal for you. Not what it used to be. Try Barbara's O's.

I *loved* that Cascadian Farms used to sell an organic version of that perfect baby finger food - Cheerios. We bought it often, but were surprised and saddened to see the latest version sneaks in added sugar. Even my 2-year-old saw the change; after eating a few he looked and me and said, "they are sweet!" Of course, he's still a fan, but I will not be buying these again unless CF reverts to the old (perfect!) formula.

I used to like Cascadian Farms Organic Purely O'S Cereal because it had no sugar or sweetener and had been buying the cereal for my daughter for 20 months since she was 6 months old. However, the new box I just bought on Feb.13,2010 tasted different,very very sweet! I looked at the ingredients and found that the cereal now has sugar in it. I will not buy this product again. I'm very dissapointed with the new recipe!

I have been buying Purely O's for the past few years.  Yes, I was paying a premium, however it was worth it.  The ingredients were organic, these was a decent fiber content, and most importantly, there was no corn or sugar.  Recently General Mills (company that owns Cascadian Farms)decided to covertly change the formula, add a bunch of sugar and corn, and pass it off as the same cereal.  I opened the box and thought that that there was a packaging mix-up.  I thought they put the Honey O's in the Purely O's box.  I called the customer service number (which I have never done before) to let them know.  To my surprise I was told that it was not a mixup, and that they had changed the formula.  I was stunned.  I had finally found a fortified cereal without all of the junk in it that I liked.  Now it is just another overpriced mainstream sugar cereal.  Obviously General Mills is trying to maximize profits by cheapening the ingredients in their line of foods.  Poor form in my opinion.  I agree with the other reviews.  At the very least, inform people.  They have lost me as a Purely O's customer, and I question whether or not I can trust the brand in general.  Don't bother with this cereal.  It's no longer worth the premium you need to pay.

I am so disappointed in Cascadian Farms or, as I've heard, now General Mills
I have emailed them to voice my own concern and got a response that ended with this:
"In keeping with our satisfaction guarantee, we would like to send you an adjustment for your purchase and it will be mailed to the address you have provided. Please allow 10-14 business days to arrive.
We appreciate your loyalty to General Mills and hope you continue to choose our products.
Sincerely,
Imee B. Roberts
Consumer Services"
Guess what I got? Coupons for Cascadian Farms products! ARE YOU KIDDING ME???? Why would I waste my time????
BTW, here are the replacements I've found and my daughter LOVES them: 1) Natures Path Kamut Puffs (Kamut is the ONLY ingredient) 2) Natures Path Rice Puffs (Rice is The ONLY ingredient) and 3) Barbara's Bakery Breakfast O's (contain corn)
ALL OF THESE ARE ORGANIC!!!!! The Breakfast O's are the only actual "O's" but my daughter has not seemed to mind as long as they are crunchy and yummy!

I'm so glad I've found a healthier alternative to Cheerios. My 18 month loves Cheerios but I wanted to find a healthier version.

The new recipe is great. It only has 1 gram of sugar per serving and it no longer contains corn. Last year when I first tried it, it contained 3 grams of sugar per serving. I didn't like how sweet it tasted so I stopped buying it. Then I came across a review about the new recipe so I decided to research it. Seeing the new nutritional label here on Amazon, I decided to give it another try. Glad I did. Now my only complaint is it contains more sodium than Cheerios, hence the 4 stars rating. Cheerios has 160 grams while Cascadian Farms has 190 grams per servings.

Ingredients: *Whole Grain Oats, *Whole Grain Barley, *Wheat Starch, *Malted Barley Extract, Sea Salt, *Oats, * Malted Barley, Vitamin E (mixed tocopherols)

Vitamins and Minerals: Calcium Carbonate, Zinc and Iron (mineral nutrients), A B Vitamin (niacinamide), Vitamin B6 (pyridoxine hydrochloride) A B Vitamin (folic acid)

I just ordered the 4-pack of this cereal and on the front of the box they advertised a new formulation and 1 gram of sugar. Ditto on the nutritional panel. I suppose the backlash resulted in them dropping the sugar content.

1 gram of sugar is just fine for my family and me. If that's too much for you, you should consider making your own cereal out of your own home-grown and home-milled grain.

I have never cared for sweetened cereal as I was not raised on it. When I found Purely O's a few years ago I was happy to have found a cereal that did not contain sugar or corn products which I need to avoid because of a corn allergy.  I had intended to buy another box today. I took the time to read the label to make sure that nothing had changed. I could not believe that the ingredient list now lists CORN!  I am so angry!  Purely O's were my go-to breakfast when I needed a something quick or was in the mood for cereal.  There is nothing that this  company makes that I can now eat.  When will these people learn humans aren't pigs! Everything in a supermarket should not contain corn!  If I had wanted corny oat cereal I would have bought Cheerios.
Totally false advertising.  The advertisement says PACKAGE OF FOUR!!! But you will receive 3 boxes!  What a ripoff.  Paid for 4 pack and receive 3.  Do not trust them and order elsewhere!

It used to be great. My older son went through a truckload of these before they changed the formulation, added sugar and basically made it to be junk food. Whole foods has recently introduced a product that reminds me of old purely o's. Not quite the same but close.

This used to be a great cereal, the only organic "O"s cereal with the same taste, texture and mouth-feel as Cheerios.  The latest box I bought had a sweet coating that ruins the taste and feel.  Won't buy this again.

I AM SO PISSED OFF!!  this used to be "purely o's", as in NO SUGAR and only wholesome ingredients.  now?  sugar and molasses and fillers!  the VERY LEAST they could have done was written, "lightly sweetened" or some other sort of pseudo-honest marketing to let us know that they had changed their formula/recipe.  instead, i order a carton of 4 boxes only to find that these are "purely crap"!!!  no thanks Cascadian Farms!  you can keep your new cereal that is no better than every other box of sweetened crap out there!

The texture is bad: light as if there is no substance and the cereal gets soggy in milk very fast.  there is not much taste(at least there is no good taste that i can notice).  compared to the health valley cereals, this cereal would deserve only one star if it weren't for the ok nutrition facts.

What is WRONG with America!???
Why add all the sugar.
Spoon it on top if you want but
kids are eating too much sugar already,dont
put it in!!!

These lemon drops are OK.
First, they don't have a very strong lemon flavor, and you may like that. I like lemon and i want to pucker up.
Second, these babies are rough in your mouth. Lots of sugar to get through before you hit lemon.
Third, they are all beat up in a bulk bag, which doesn't make them very nice to put in a candy dish.
yummy! great price in bulk! They are a bit tart, the shape is similar to football, texture is good -absolutely delicious!
My favorite nuts and they are also healthy. By time the recall list on these came out they were already digested by me.

We bought a 4-pack of these when Amazon was having a special of saving $25 when buying $59 or more.  After the savings, these ended up being something like $4 a pound -- which is a great price for Pistachios!  After receiving the first bunch, we ate the first bag in no time and gave away a couple for holiday gifts.  When we were down to the last bag, my wife wanted more -- so we ordered 2 more 4-pack sets and hopefully this time they'll last a little longer.  These are fresh, taste very good and at the price we paid, a real bargain.
I have purchased these nuts a couple times. They are not the best money can buy but they are the best you can buy for the money.
THE PACKAGE ARRIVED ON TIME. THE PISTACHIOS ARE THE SAME AS I BY IN-STORE BUT THE CHEAPER PRICE MADE THEM EVEN MORE DELICIOUS!!!
These pistachios are a ton better than you can get at Trader Joe's. High quality and great taste.
These were the best, and somehow fresher-tasting, that we have enjoyed, yet!  A good buy!

My dogs love these and the smaller pieces are more appropriate for my little terrier than a whole pig's ear. I also like to avoid raw hide since one of my previous dogs had stomach problems with raw hide. I haven't noticed any issues with the ear pieces.
After looking at grocery and the pet store chains, this is a good price in comparison. I paid about $12 for the pound of Grillerz.

This keeps my dog (a dedicated chewer) happy for at least 2 hours each, and he's always going back for more.  There is a decent amount of meat left on it, that breaks down easily.  It's well cured, and clean.  Smells a little smokey, but much better than other products I've found.  It's my border collie/shepherd mix's favorite treat!

Wonderful flavor(s). Perfect for electrolyte replacement in heat and post-workouts. I heartily recommend it.  Try the citrus flavor.  Grapefruit...very unusual, different and oddly fantastic.  Unexpected, unique and as I said Yummy!
The power citrus berry is the best flavor of all.  It is so hard to find.  I just want to be able to find enough to keep me supplied at all times for 2 bottles a day.

I brought this up to Ohio from Texas (haven't found it in the stores up here yet).  I used it as a dip (2c sour cream + 2-3T seasoning, mix and let it sit for at least an hour), and my neighbors couldn't get enough of it.  It has just a kick of heat to it, just enough to make it addictive, and not too salty.  So glad to find it here on Amazon!  I'll be trying it as a general seasoning, too, once I get a new supply.

I was very excited to find this seasoning on Amazon considering that it is not sold where I currently live. When I lived in New Mexico, I used this seasoning in everything! I kept it right next to the salt and pepper because it is so versatile. I am very excited to use it again!

I use them to make fillers for dumplings and ravioli, I mix a can with a little wasabi mayo for a shrimp salad sandwich, I sprinkle the little guys on a salad (there is no chemical taste that you can sometimes get with canned seafood) ... there are a hundred great uses for these canned shrimp, and that makes me especially glad that they are responsibly harvested.  I am very pleased to be able to order 12 packs of this item at a bulk price.

Whoa nelly I love this stuff! WOW.

I made myself some shrimp cocktail and devoured an entire can the first day... drank the remaining yummy juice...mmmmm!

Now I'm addicted to a shrimp cocktail appetizer and then I dump the rest of these guys into a rice/cream-of-shroom/lemonjuice concoction that's out of this world. The remaining shrimp broth is perfect for drinking but I like to spice up my cat's meals with it since she seems to like it too :p

I did not expect to love this that much... not sure what I expected but I thought it would be difficult, at a minimum, to make it through a can per meal. Nope... there's plenty per can but I can't stop myself. I think it will refrigerate well (not sure for how long) especially when prepared in other dishes.

But I've already caught myself doing the math on how I'll afford to eat this every day or every other day -- at least for as long as my obsession lasts. O' Wild Planet wild shrimp: I CAN'T QUIT YOU.

I am so very happy with this product!

THANK YOU!

To be completely honest, at my house we did not like this shrimp at all ... nope, not at all (shudder). So I tried to send it over to my sister, but after she sampled it she said even her cat wouldn't eat it.  We thought about sending it to a food bank for homeless people but decided against that so as not to disappoint anyone there.  Never again, I swear, never again ... :(
I must say these are as good a canned shrimp as I have had.  Some others seem to have an after taste.  These do not.  The texture also seems to be firmer.  I will continue to regularly order these.

I love Wild Planet and what they stand for.  The shrimp are good, but I've had better salad shrimp.  However, the tuna is fantastic.  In an age where everything is farm raised, Wild Planet is offering an excellent product at a good value.
This is the only canned shrimp I have ever tasted that did not have that funny metal aftertaste from being canned. I will be buying this over and over.

Terrific taste-far superior to most canned brands.  In a salad, or what ever- your preference,this brand is a winner...No chemicals to cause allergic problems (my predicament),or other trauma!....Adapt to reality and please,please thrive!....I don't care if you are a right or left wing nut job,just do well with these products,and get well enough to tell me that I'm a maniac right-wing crazie...All I care about (at my age 63) is that gals feel good(and look good) without the creepy chemicals...the hell with the chemicals-and the hell with the political aspersions...get well,baby!....

This is a serious shipment of Swedish Fish. Hefting these bags out of the box is a lot like standing on the slippery desk of a schooner in the Baltic sea.. except.. well, like with sugar water instead of salt water.

Anyway these are nice soft (as in fresh-ish) Swedish Fish. There's even some stray piece of other candy from a factory, it looks like maybe a Sour Patch Kid or something, in the bag I haven't opened yet. Which totally lends to the illusion of a big net-full just reined in from the bottom of that sugary, sugary Baltic.

This will keep my visitor cup running-eth over of Swedish Fish at the office for the winter.. and hopefully will not promote my pants size. If you were going to eat this many Swedish Fish, you'd need to order like some kind of Kama Sutra of ways to eat Swedish Fish to go with it. This is a massive haul of the good old chewy fellas, of the large variety. My only complaint is that it isn't like 100 pounds instead of 10 pounds. Ahoy.

We bought two orders of these -- twenty pounds of red Swedish Fish!!!!  It was a little stunning to see the little guys in such quantity!  We're bagging them up in little sparkly tulle bags with silver ribbons for my daughter's upcoming wedding to a Swedish man, hence the massive purchase.  Anyway, they arrived promptly, they were packaged securely, they're delicious and chewy (we had to sample them!), and this was the cheapest place that we found.  Thanks!

Ten pounds is a lot of candy, but $3 a pound is a good price for these. The bags are not re-sealable, so be prepared to re-package them, if not intended for use all at once.

They are soft and fresh.

Please note that they are the standard, large-size fish, not small ones as it appears in the photograph.

I bought this back when it was $26 and free shipping.  What a great deal!  I'm still not through the second bag!  A little less chewy then normal, but that doesn't diminish the flavor.  A great value!

I have a sister who is crazy about Swedish fish, so I decided to get her a 1 gallon candy jar and fill it with fish for her birthday.  I wasn't sure how many fish it would take to fill a gallon jar, so I went with this package, thinking that it should at least fill most of it.  I was pleasantly surprised when the fish arrived and just one of the two included bags was enough to fill the jar almost entirely!  I was able to give my sister the full jar with a nicely packaged refill.  I'll most likely be buying this package again in the future, great bang for the buck.

These were a gift to my daughter in Texas. She loves them and they are hard to find (Red)!!! They came in perfect condition, fresh and chewy.

Thank you

I bought this package of Swedish Fish as a Christmas gift. The person I had gotten this for LOVES Swedish Fish. I bought him a 1 lb bag last year and he finished it in a few hours. His kids helped of course.

Well....this year there will be noooo way they'll finish 10 lbs in one night (I hope). There will be PLENTY to take home.

They arrived a little frozen due to the weather but they're GREAT and the price ($30) was right! FREE shipping on this heavy item was an A+++ and the reason I made my purchase.

I can't wait to give it to him!!!
Go Big or Go home.  This is 10lbs of Swedish Fish.  My daughters friend is addicted to them, so as a pleasant joke for Christmas I ordered this 10lb deal.  It is going to be fabulous.

There selling 2 5lb bags for 50 dollars, get a sams club mebership where they sell 3.5 lb bags for 4.00 flat. so it will only cost you 12 dollars for 10.5 lbs, and then for shipping ya right they want to charge you up the ass when they could easily fit it into a flat rate box. this deal is obsered, they dont have ak prices online but heres the price of sweedish fish in idaho
This is a very thick, richly flavored honey. Probably the best I have ever tried. In my opinion, it's good enough to give as a gift.
I kind of liked these and my granddaughter loved because they were also cute. My 32 yr old boys who love gummis did not like the foam on these.
We needed a themed snack for a book club meeting, and these were a big hit. Shipment came fast, product as pictured.
The trick is to make the box last awhile.  I save these for special treats.

I am a Heath bar freak and unable to find my favorite candy bar in my small town the luxury of ordering it through Amazon was fantastic. There is nothing like an entire box of Heath Bars showing up at my door to make me one happy camper.
These are a favorite candy treat but, for some reason, unavailable in local stores.  Delivery was in good time.
I was a bad girl.  Love a Heath Bar I do.  Amazon service is always great.

So I love Heath bars. Probably my favorite candy bar. I stick one in my otherwise healthy lunch almost every day, which also makes these 24 count boxes amazing. The thing is... the price here ($24.87 at the time of this review, and I've always seen it around this price) is absolutely ridiculous! Save your money and go to Sams or Costco and get two of these boxes for the same price plus a little left over for gas money. I'm kinda disappointed that Amazon even lets this happen.

These peanuts are OK.  They are obviously far better than most "store-bought" brands (such as Planter's).  However, they are nowhere NEAR as tasty as the peanuts I've ordered from Amazon which are produced by the Peanut Shop of Williamsburg.  Plus, the "blisters" in the Virginia Diner brand seem to be mostly broken in half (i.e., not intact), and they are actually somewhat hard to bite into.  For a few extra dollars, the additional investment in the Willamsburg variety is well worth it.
We have ate at the Virginia Diner and the food is great. We wanted more nuts but not the drive and this product was great as well. Price was reasonable and delivery right on time. Such good quality.
These peanuts are delicious but the price really went up!  I just ordered them in March and the price went up by about 7 or $8.00!  Very disappointed!

I would never buy these peanuts again.  The're as crunchy in as almost tasting stale.  No peanut taste at all!  If you like VERY crunchy peanuts, maybe you might like them....not me. If you're ever in Jupiter Florida come by my house and I will give you both 32 oz. cans!

First discovered these peanuts over 20 years ago in a small shop in Oxford Maryland, and I have been enjoying them ever since.

[...]

[...]

[...]

There may be better peanuts out there, but it can't be too many.

Enjoy!

PS If you own a boat, you may already know Oxford.

These are great peanuts, big, crisp, fresh and yummy.  The only thing I could possibly say in the negative is that the packaging is a bit inconvenient.  The lid is difficult to remove unless you use like a knife or something and then you can't really put the lid back on unless you always have the instrument with you.  Other than the lid issue this is a delicious product at a good price.
