There is substantially less hull than regular popcorn. The flavor is great. I suggest using peanut oil for popping popcorn. It gives popcorn a great nutty taste - really delicious. You can buy peanut oil at any oriental (Asian) store. It's better than olive oil (olive oil and popcorn is too weird for me). But peanut oil is perfect. You won't need butter flavor or anything like that again (artificial butter flavorings are full of chemicals). Now, we pop around three times a day and always crave this for a snack instead of junkfood. Try it and you'll be popping like us.

the baby white popcorn has lots of hulls when popped, very small kernels and scorched the bottom of my new whirley popper. I've had several poppers and this is the first time one has scorched and the first time I've used the Wabash corn. shipping charges were very high for a relatively inexpensive corn.
This popcorn has alot of hulls I order 4 bags and can't stand to eat it it's so hully - terrible

I ordered this because Amazon recommended it to go along with the Redenbacker popcorn popper I got from them. Hey, only a few of these actually pop! Most of these small, unpopped kernels get thrown out of the popper. What an absolute waste of money!
worst popcorn ive ever bought.  chewy not fluffy.  gave it to the birds for bird food.  postage was outrageous!  just not a good experience all around.  wont be buying from them ever again.

This is delicious popcorn -- lost a star because I use a hot air popper and many of them "jump" out before popping. Great flavor, great texture - tender. I do not add anything even though I have purchased three different flavored toppings.

Thanks,

This "Baby White" popcorn pops small and somewhat hard.  I have tried several batches with various adjustments of heat, using a "whirlypop" popcorn popper.  Unsatisfactory results!  I won't purchase this again.
wE LOVED THIS POPCORN  BUT COME ON  SHIPPING IS WAY OVER THE TOP  WE WOULD SETTLE NEXT TIME FOR SOMETHING WE CAN BUY BUT NOT SPEND 3 TIMES ON SHIPPING

I can only go as low as 1 star on the review, though I'd like to rate it a "0"- this item still shows in stock, but clearly isn't, which is why my order was canceled from Amazon today. Amazon suggested I search out the item again, and in doing so I see that this same vendor states the item is available. Not so.

Technically this review does not relate to the quality of the product, just the ability to be able to ship it. Good luck!

I'm a Bigelow & Twinnings tea fan, the green tea assortment is great specially the mango and peach flavors are really intense and delicious plus you have the added bonus of getting Decaff on each box.Last but not least you get a better deal at Amazon that the online tea store.

Not sure if you should bother reading about what other people think of the flavor, since we all have different tastes.  But for me, this is the first and only box of Green Tea I've ever enjoyed (out of many brands).  The fruit flavors are delicious (at least to my taste buds).  I especially like the peach.

I was so disappointed with this tea. i bought a box during lunchtime looking forward to a nice cup of tea in the afternoon. I made the cup and took a sip - YUCK. It tasted fishy to me but couldn't figure out why tea would taste fishy so I read the ingredients. I wish I had read them before - the second listed ingredient is an oil blend of tuna oil, soy oil, and soy lecithin. Just the thought of tuna oil in my tea is enough to make me gag - the actual taste is just as bad.

I like a large variety of herbal teas but not this one. Here, the flavor of  Omega 3 strongly overwhelms the tastes of pomegranate and blubbery. Probably, this tea is good for you but it has a distinct "fishy" taste.

I am always looking for ways to get in Omega-3's and find a lot of pills to incur those "fishy" burps hours after taking them plus the routine of remembering to take the pills daily.  I love tea both hot and iced so I was quite excited to try this one...tea + Omega 3's...perfect.  I smelled the fishy smell before I even tasted the tea.  I did force myself to tast it and took about two sips then had to pour out the whole pitcher I had brewed.  It is quite fishy tasting.  Ridiculously so.  Glad I bought the box on sale so I don't feel bad about tossing it but it is so bad I can't even fathom making someone else go through the smell and tasting I just did.

I do not taste a fishy taste at all. It is awesome hot or cold. Maybe the other drinkers are not using right amount of H2O. It has reduced blood pressure in patients of mine, and actually recommended.

I picked this up at my local store and after brewing poured it out right away. The first thing you taste is bad fish, then a berry taste. It was so gross. I read the label and tuna oil is how they get the Omega 3. I should have picked up a pomegranate flavor with out the omega 3. I wrote an email to Bigelow since my satisfaction was not met. I will see if I get a response. Disgusting, I had to brew something else to get the taste out. Learned my lesson- fish oil does not go in tea!

I have been a bigelow loyal for years, especially the super fruit kind of teas, and then saw this product. Pomegranate with omega3 sounded very good. But the first sip brought all to an end. I was having FISH tea!!! Fishy taste and smell! And then I read the contents- of course the Omega 3 was from tuna oil! Disgusting! I have burned once and now I will read Bigelow labels very carefully.

Let me throw some confusion into the mix. I have a different take than the other two reviewers. I am not a tea drinker but I thought I'd give this a try when my husband brought it home. Honestly, I never even noticed the Omega 3 on the package and I especially didn't taste anything fishy in the tea (I don't like fish either).  Anyway, I loved this tea. I even made it into a cold drink for guests and they liked it too.
Not a strong fruity flavor. You can tell there's fruit in it but not really what kind. Better than some low carb muffin mixes.

With 190 calories for a six cracker packet with pepper jack is a great snacking cracker sandwich with just a little bit of a kick.  I will definately be staying on subcribe & save for these Austin Pepper Jack cracker packets.  Luv em! I do wish I could find someting like this in a whole grain cracker, but until then these are great.
Love these Austin Pepper Jack Crackers. They have great freshness and a great taste plus the price you just cant hardly beat. Thank You Amazon!
If you like spicy...then these are the snack crackers for you. So hard to find ANYWHERE ELSE...a really good price on here!
This product arrived in about three days.  Never use the entire packet for one recipe unless you like hot seasonings!  It is extremely hot.
Don't waste your money and order directly from Nespresso!  Any Nespresso capsules sold on amazon (by various vendors) are marked WAY up, some by as much as 50%!  Don't be fooled.

The variety, not the brand, was recommended by a friend. Five stars is given with the caveat that other brands were not tried for comparison. The Choice Organic Russian Caravan blend seems to be the only such blend easily available in tea bags. The unit cost of the product is an excellent value here on amazon, compared to other sellers' offers.

The tea is a bit more delicate than one might expect, based on description. Steeping five minutes is recommended, for a full-flavored experience. The flavor is delightful -- a good black tea, but with a distinctive smoky quality.

Choice Organic Russian Caravan is my morning tea of choice since a few years back. This is a very high quality tea, no doubt about it. Never had a bad batch, box or single tea bag. I've tried many other teas from Choice Organic and the high quality shines through throughout the product line.

Choice "Russian Caravan" tea is excellent! It's got an unusually smoky flavor, and it is stronger than most black teas. Black teas are for the most part caffeinated, but they don't usually have a distinctive roasted flavor. Tea is an essential part of Russian fare;traditional Russian hospitality meant bringing out the samovar with sugar cubes (along with bread and salt) This tea would taste great while looking out onto the Pacific Ocean from Fort Ross, the southernmost Russian outpost in Sonoma County, California, settled in 1812. It's good for a rainy day, while curled up reading War and Peace (Vintage Classics), Anna Karenina (Oxford World's Classics), Plays by Anton Chekhov- Second Series and Complete Works of Fyodor Dostoyevsky (Illustrated), or even Russia Against Napoleon: The True Story of the Campaigns of War and Peace. Leo Tolstoy was from Tula, famous for its samovars, and its saying was "taking a samovar to Tula" an equivalent to "carrying coals to Newcastle."

Russian Caravan has a delicious, spicy, roasted, exotic flavor.

This tea is tasty, refreshing, and mysterious. It has a smokey aroma and robust "outdoor" flavor.  In the past I purchased it from a local health food store by I recently relocated and couldn't find it in even the large chain health food store! I introduce this tea to all my tea drinking friends who aren't afraid to try something new. It is worth every penny.
If there was a Johnny Walker Black of teas, this one would be it. Nice and smoky, try it with a cigar.

I bought several boxes of these cookies for Christmas gifts and had one box left over.  I decided to try them with my coffee one morning and got the surprise of my life.  THESE ARE THE BEST COOKIES, THIS SIDE OF HEAVEN!  I've never tasted anything quite as good.  They're simple little bite size cookies, but surprisingly they do take you back...back to a time when things were simpler, and happier. As cookies go, these are quite a healthy choice.  I tend to look for products using wheat flour.  They made me remember my grandmother's kitchen, as she baked special treats for the family.  All I can say is they are simply amazing, and you'll do yourself a great disservice if you don't try them.  It'll take care of that need for "something sweet", without all the calories. I promise, you won't be disappointed.
So far this is my fav. HOWEVER. if i were to buy direct from Nespresso the 50 capsules would only be $32.50

Nespresso does NOT officially distribute their product through Amazon - what you are purchasing here is a re-sold product from third-party seller who has purchased it directly from Nespresso (exactly what YOU should be doing) and is now re-selling this product to get a nice profit from simple-minded customers. Buy it directly from Nespresso, people - you WILL get a cheaper price and you WILL get a more fresh coffee (you can't know how long this coffee was stored at third-party reseller's location).

After trying about 15 different varieties of the short Nespressos, Rosabaya De Columbia is the one I've settled on. It's potent without being bitter and is closest to the traditional espresso you would get in a French or Italian restaurant. For the long one, I prefer Fortissio Lungo.

Nespresso makes GREAT coffee and GREAT machines. I switched over to a Nespresso machine 7 years ago and have never looked back. I save a small fortune every year by making my lattes at home.

That being said, the Nespresso capsule offers posted here are from a third party who is putting a large additional margin on their price.

You can order the same products online from Nespresso for approx $0.55 each (half the price here).
This is one of the best ! No aftertaste or bitterness. Capriccio is normally my fave but this may have surpassed it! Delicious!!!

My "picky" Morkie loves her new IAMS dog food.  She was eating IAMS before...but not the Healthy Natural one.  It's a tiny bit more expensive....but her delight with the new dog food is worth every penny!  She actually reacted to this dog food when I first offered it to her like she acts when she is given a dog treat!  I am very pleased with this purchase...and so is Katie!

I have bought these almonds for Christmas for the last two years. They were shipped shrink wrapped together with a cardboard base and never taped together.

I always buy these specific almonds because they make a nice presentation, especially for the holidays. They are not your typical almond with the brown outer coating and salty texture. They are actually round, not oval, and I didn't find them to be too salty at all - they were just right. Also important to note that they are halved.

MARCONA Almonds are the Best Tasting Almonds on earth that are grown in SPAIN ... Shipped fresh & timely

Stywu

I had this type of nut while visiting California.  When I returned to New York, I ordered the same brand of nuts on Amazon.  When they arrived they were stale and rancid.  I would never order from this company again.

Just pure and wonderful, no added flavors interfering like orange peel, lemon, allspice etc. The packaging was great, no staples, no plastic wrappers and Fair Trade Certified to boot...  I used no sweetener, just let it steep and do its thing.  Find a good book and curl up, before you know it you'll be having sweet zzzzz's.
brews well even stands up to sweetner and a little milk if you like it that way

This tea is absolutely delicious! It has become my new favorite tea, the flavor is fantastic. Very delicate and mild with a beautiful floral scent perfect paired with honey. I highly recommend this tea! I bought a pack of six and it went fast, everyone in my family loves it!

I first purchased this at grocery store. Much better price on Amazon. Some chamomiles taste really 'weedy' to me, seems strange to describe a chamomile as rich tasting, but does not need sweetener or anything else. And would only us an herbal tea that is organic--think about it! Definitely notice that it helps me relax in the evening to get to sleep more quickly. Choice is one of our favorite brands.

It helps me to calm and feel relax after a long day from work.  Also it helped me to get through the stomach flu a few days ago. Well when you has gastroenteritis and drink this tea, you'll know what I'm talking.

This is a great tea, clean and simple (and decaf).  The product is organic and fair trade.  The package is made from recycled content and the design of the tea bag and its individual package is perfect and so easy to use, no tearing of paper or tangling of tag/string.  I will buy more from Choice organic tea.

When my local Asian grocer stopped carrying the small tin of Japanese matcha green tea powder I'd been purchasing, I searched for a comparable (price/quality) alternative. Amazon, as always, was my first stop, but to no avail. Instead, I found this identical green tea powder from The Republic of Tea at Whole Foods Market, for $17.99. Wondering to myself, "How did I miss this on Amazon?" I came back here to look it up, planning to make all subsequent purchases here. Imagine my shock to find it listed for twice the price (almost $40) as what is arguably the planet's highest end grocery chain.

This is a great, high quality green tea powder, especially for smoothies. That said, don't fall for this price gouging. Please visit your local Whole Foods or other health food store first, where you'll find it at half the price. If they don't stock it on the shelves, go to customer service and I'm sure they'll order it for you, at no extra cost. Shame on You, [It's A Treasure]!!! (seller) When they cease their price gouging and bring the price back in line to a reasonable retail price point, I'll change my rating to reflect the actual product, but as it stands there's no way I'm going to award 5 stars and assist this seller in continuing to gouge the public.

I am a regular matcha drinker, and have been buying matcha from Mitsuwa or Sunrise Mart NYC for years, but bought this Republic of Tea matcha at the local Whole Foods. The colour of the tea is nothing like in the image on the package, it is a dull green (which means more oxidation and stems). There are usually three qualities of matcha: ceremonial, universal, and culinary. I am giving this tea 1 star because it is culinary quality at best. Don't waste your money.

If you want good matcha, is best to try the universal quality Maeda-En (gold package). Or if you want to splurge, try the ceremonial (black package) quality, both for sale here on amazon or straight from the Maeda-en Website.
Reminds me of the green tea I enjoy at my favorite Japanese restaurant. I really like that I am able to use the powder as strong or as weak as I want. I am very please with my purchase.

I wanted to note that these are the best-tasting, raw lemon cookies I have ever tried. I will not use banal frases such as "they are good for you" or anything like that. I will just mention that they leave me satisfied and with a joyful feeling inside. I can feel that these raw cookis are made with love, and I will definitely purchase them again.

When I saw Weetabix in my local grocery a few months ago, I just had to try it! How many breakfast foods do you know of, that get mentioned frequently in British novels and on BBC television programs?

Not surprisingly, the whole grain "biscuits" are delicious. They're nutritious, too: two biscuits with skim milk (no sugar required) provide 170 calories (10 from fat), 130mg sodium, 150mg potassium, 29g carbohydrates (including 4g dietary fiber and 2g sugar), 4g protein, no cholesterol, and a few vitamins and minerals. The biscuits themselves (12 to a package, or 6 servings) are light, crisp, and flaky.

According to the package, "Weetabix is great on its own or with milk". However the biscuits are very dry, so I can't imagine eating them plain. When you add low-fat milk (1% or 2%), the biscuits soak the milk up quickly. If you don't eat your Weetabix right away, the biscuits will break apart and your morning cereal will be a little soggy.

But I like Weetabix, even when it's soggy, because of the delicate flavor and pleasant texture. Weetabix has now replaced my previous favorite adult fiber cereal, Post Shredded Wheat Original Cereal, Spoon Size, and has become an almost daily habit. The pack of 12 boxes seems like a lot of Weetabix--72 servings--but it's actually about a 2-1/2 month supply for one person.

I have eaten Weetabix cereal for over 30 years, since I first found it in England while shopping with family.  It is wholesome and nutritious, great with cold milk in the summer and warm milk in the wintertime. I highly recommend it if you like a cereal that is tasty and versatile.

Gluten-Free Flour Tortillas
MAKES 6-8 TORTILLAS

1 cup white rice flour
1/3 cup potato starch
1/3 cup tapioca flour
1/3 cup fava bean flour
2 tsps xanthan gum
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp sugar
1 1/4 tsp salt
2 TBs vegetable or other shortening
3/4 to 1 cup warm water

Combine all of the dry ingredients, then cut in or work in the shortening using a pastry blender or two knives or your hand.
Add the warm water, starting with 3/4 cup and mix well.
Continue to add water until a soft, cohesive dough is formed.
Heat a comal, tapa or griddle to medium heat. Then, form a ball of dough into a flattened disk, cupping the outside edges a bit to form a round.
Using a bollilo or rolling pin, roll into a round disk about 1/8 inch thick and about 8 inches in diameter or to your preference.
Bake one at a time on a hot griddle until the surface bubbles. Turn only once, the first side should have brown flecks.
Bake until the second side has slightly browned - should brown in a very short time.
Keep warm in a tortilla keeper or wrapped in a cloth until served.
Note: Will freeze in a sealed plastic bag for up to three months.

Reprinted courtesy of The Jane Boutel Cooking School, Alberquerque, New Mexico.
This stuff was so good.  The only bad thing about that was that I couldn't stop eating it.  Next time I will have to have a better control.

The first time I heard of peppermint tea it didn't sound very good to me.  But I'm so glad I tried it because it is delicious and very soothing on the stomach.  I like that it's organic, it smells heavenly and I enjoy a cup every evening.  I would highly recommend it, even to "tea purists".  Give it a try!

I've been drinking Choice Peppermint Tea for about 4 years and have found it to always be very consistent and flavourful. I started drinking it when I had a case of Colitis and that caused frequent upset stomachs. The tea helped then to a great extent, and now I drink it just because it's so nice.

Evenings are best, with a bit of dark chocolate - purely medicinal you understand ;)
I had a hard time trying to find a peppermint tea that was organic till I found this. Way better than non-organic.
This wonderful organic tea is a delight. Perfect peppermint taste and oh so yummy especially near bedtime (no caffeine!). Very tasteful as well as soothing. Enjoy!
Lovely aroma, good for sore throat or calming stomach as well as pure enjoyment.  My favorite brand of peppermint tea!

I love this organic peppermint tea. It is the best that I have found anywhere. The aroma is really nice and the flavor is great! I combine it with green tea when I need a little energy, and drink it by itself after a meal.
This is my favorite peppermint tea!  Every cup has just the right amount of peppermint flavor.  Not too light and not too strong.
this is the best peppermint tea i have found and at 1/2 the price of whole foods.
Herb Tea, Bengal Spice, 20 ct ( Value Bulk Multi-pack).It was fine.I really enjoyed the tea it was so good. I don't like being forced into 20 words for a review

Everybody in the family really loved the Izze Sparkling Pomegranate juice. Between the four of us the case only lasted two days. The flavor is crisp and dry with a hint of club soda flavor. I think these could be used as an ingredient for a great wine cooler.

If the can wasn't labeled "pomegranate," I wouldn't have known what flavor it was. This drink is very fizzy and tastes tangy and vaguely citrusy like Sprite or the old Fresca, but I definitely didn't taste pomegranate. The ingredients list a blend of six fruit juices, and it's pretty much a muddle, in my opinion.

There is no added sugar and each 8 ounce can has 80 calories. This drink might be a good substitute for an alcoholic drink served in a pretty glass, or as a base for punch, but I wouldn't choose it as a thirst-quencher or when I want a true juice flavor.

I had never tried Pomegranate before so I just gave this a shot and it's nasty stuff.
If you don't like the tartness of a grapefruit (I don't), then this isn't for you. About as tart as I can go is an orange and this is about 100000% worse.

This is also entirely natural and has no sugars added which in my opinion contribute to why I can't stand it... Just entirely too tart!

Izze's pomegranate juice is almost perfect--good can size, not too sparkling, and a great flavor. I like this much more than Pom Wonderful (maybe because of the carbonated nature of Izze).

Important note: While pomegranate juice may offer some health benefits, it can also interact with some medications, including ACE inhibitors and antihypertensive drugs, so check with your doctor before drinking pomegranate juice if you're taking prescription drugs.

Two suggestions: (1) More pomegranate flavor; and (2) market a sweetened version as well.

I was drinking a bottle or two of these per day to help me lose weight (these got me off Pepsi).  I began to have very bad skin pain and muscle pain in my side and arms, wrists after about 2 weeks of drinking these.  I was going to the doctor for the pain and was about to be diagnosed with Fibromyalgia.  I started an elimination diet as a last resort because I had not always had this pain (only recently).  After stopping the Izze drinks just by chance because I ran out and the store I was getting them at did not have the flavors I liked, the pain went away.  This pain was very bad.  I was becoming a person who could not have my children or spouse hug or touch me.  My clothes hurt where they touched my sides.  It hurt to sleep and lay on the mattress with my side.  I may be the only person to experience this and realize it may be some kind of allergy to some product in this drink.

I must admit that, being the ripe old age of 31 and part-time middle-school teacher, I didn't quite understand the kids' fascination with Izze drinks. They bright juice color and brighter, young-looking packaging caused me to theorize that these drinks were just the same-old stuff with a clever marketing angle.

Then I tried one.

The quality of the product is certainly outstanding. Pomegranate is a trendy flavor these days, yet many of the pomegranate-flavored products on the market don't adequately reflect the fruit's unique flavor. Izze, as it says on the can, "stays true to the fruit" and it is evident in the fact that their pomegranate drink actually tastes like pomegranate. The flavor is full, yet not overpowering, and the flavor tends to stay in your mouth for some time. Although the product is made with carbonated water, there is certainly no "coca-cola" quality to it. There is not excessive carbonation, but rather the light carbonation of the water tends to enhance the flavor of the juice itself--yet another way in which Izze stays true to the fruit.

It appears as if the middle-schoolers have a more refined taste than I gave them credit for. Izze Pomegranate drink is excellent. I highly recommend this product and will be sure to keep it around the house, myself.

Despite the fact that Izze Sparkling Pomegranate juice beverage has 19g of sugar, it is not too sweet. In fact, it has a very refreshing fruity taste, which is enhanced by the light carbonation.

It's made from concentrates of juices, including apple, white grape, pineapple, lemon, cranberry and pomegranate. The rest of the mix is comprised of sparkling water, fruit & vegetable coloring, and added vitamins like C & B6 (very small amounts).
Even though it contains lemon and cranberrry juice concentrates, it isn't too tart.

All in all, it's a nice alternative to soda. And here's a little extra something I experimented with: mixed with a little wine (I used Sangria) it made a great wine cooler! ;)

It's also low sodium and has just 80 calories per 8.4 fl. oz. All this and the fact that the Izze company does philanthropic/educational work for needy kids, and you've got a winning product.

This is a fizzy, refreshing fruit soda with natural sweetening limited to whatever the 70% juice content can provide. So this is a slightly sweet-sour soda with no cloying taste and it tastes exactly like what it is--pomegranate juice. This is more in the tradition of the European "lemonades"--fizzy water and fruit juice with little or no sugar.

The can is the size of one of those energy drinks. (8oz.) If you like a fizzy drink now and then, I can't think of anything better. I don't drink soda, diet or regular (no point to either.) Izze, however, is quite nice. Try it.

This review focuses on the pomegranate and grapefruit flavors of Izze.

Izze's all natural sparkling juice is a nice alternative to soda. There is no caffeine, no processed sugar, and no unnatural ingredients. It is refreshing to read the ingredients and find that I recognize every ingredient! And they are all safe!

The pomegranate juice is mixed in with a bit of grape and apple juice, to mitigate a mild (but not unpleasant) bitter citrus aftertaste, somewhat like grapefruit juice. The sparkle has a feel closer to sparkling water than to carbonated soda -- and I like that. It is a distinctive flavor -- and I like that too. I wasn't sure what to think after just one can, but after trying it a couple of times I have found that it is quite nice.

I liked the ruby red grapefruit flavor all at once -- it has the perfect grapefruit flavor, the sweet tangy delicious zing, without the bitter aftertaste of grapefruit. It is not too sweet, but just right for that grapefruit flavor fix that I like now and again. This is the perfect size container, especially for my kids who also love the grapefruit flavor. Good stuff.

What I also like is that Izze appears to be a company with a conscience. Started by a couple of friends in 2003 who liked the idea of an all natural and distinctive beverage as an alternative to soda, Izze uses their product as a platform from which to promote awareness of the Global Education Fund (and other good causes, both environmental and global) that they support.

Pomegranate: My first sip of Izze's Sparkling Pomegranate was not appreciated by my palate very much; I thought it tasted like someone had mixed a wine cooler with beer. I actually did a double take to look at the can and search for alcohol content. By the end of the can I liked it, and by the 3rd can I really liked it. It's tangy, fresh, with no sweet aftertaste and has a cool looking container design (aesthetics always matter!).

With a total of 80 calories per cute little can, this isn't exactly what you'd call a "diet drink," but I find it to be surprisingly filling, so it makes a great in-between liquid snack, and can stave away the hunger pangs until your next meal without doing damage to your diet.

Overall a nifty drink in a most attractive can. Don't let the first taste fool you. Izze's Pomegranate Fizzy is quite yummy...a very pleasurable acquired taste.
.......................................
Grapefruit: Izze's Sparkling grapefruit is absolutely the best drink in a can I have ever tasted. Nothing is even a close 2nd. Tangy and refreshing, its lemony grapefruit flavor is quite strong and tantalizing. It also contains white grape, apple and orange juice from concentrates, but what my taste buds remember most is the lemon and grapefruit. The Grapefruit flavor has 90 calories per can, for those counting calories, but like the Pomegranate, it's very filling, and does well as an "in-between" snack for dieters.

This wonderful Izze fizzy is addictive. On a hot day cold Sparkling Grapefruit is a total delight, and since it does not have refined sugars it truly takes away your thirst, not like those soda pop drinks that actually seem to make one thirstier. Thank you Izze, your Sparkling Grapefruit gets the gold award for canned beverage in my house.
If you're into "hard likker," Izze's Grapefruit would make the perfect mixer, for vodka or tequila.

I've enjoyed Izze drinks in the past and for the past year and a half have been drinking pomegranate juice whenever I get the chance.  When I learned about Izze's FORTIFIED ALL NATURAL SPARKLING POMEGRANATE JUICE, I was rather excited at the prospect of tasting some. I was rather disappointed.  To begin with, even though this product is labeled as pomegranate juice, it's a misnomer because this is not real pomegranate juice.  Instead it's a hybrid containing juices from concentrates of apples, white grapes, pineapples, lemons, cranberries, pomegranates, and a few other added vitamins.  The other vitamins don't bother me so much, but when a product is labeled and marketed as pomegranate juice, that's what a person should expect to get, not a mixture of a bunch of juices only one of which is pomegranate.  Besides the false labeling, the drink is quite bitter and hard to drink.  Drinking the beverage straight from the cans doesn't quite cut it (it tastes a bit metallic) and I've had to pour the stuff in a glass with ice.  Perhaps the absorption of the ice takes away part of the bitterness, but I've found the drink tastes much better this way.  But, overall, you'd best just avoid buying the stuff altogether.

First impressions of IZZE Pomegranate (that's a funny word if you say it too many times):

Attractive packaging and accurate descriptions on the labels with one exception. On the logo side of the can it says "Pure Fruit Juice", and I know this is childish, but then it says "& sparkling water fortified with vitamins." Well, that's hardly pure fruit juice. It has other stuff in it too. However, IZZE Beverages redeem themselves by actually not adding refined sugars or caffeine to the drink. This is something I can give to my children and not worry about Child Protective Services hunting me down. I was surprised to see that pomegranate (funny word!) is not the main ingredient. It's sixth on the list. Apple, white grape, clarified pineapple, lemon, cranberry and then pomegranate (teehee). I guess "Sparkling Pomegranate" sounded better to the marketing department than "Bubbly Clarified Pineapple Juice" (not funny sounding at all, which is also a definite negative in my personal selection of a thirst-quenching beverage).

Taste. This is the good part. It's clean with a little sweet-tartness. Very nice balance and engages quite a few taste buds. It's fizzy and crisp. It kind of reminds me of the grape juice that I used to sneakily drink during church as a child, but with vitamin C, Niacin and B6. It has a nice, easy after taste that is not offensive like a few other drinks in this category.

The profits. The company claims to be in partnership with the Global Education Fund "to help provide educational opportunities and resources to needy children around the world." And there's a kicker.

The kicker: A lot of companies tout their philanthropic ventures. But with IZZE it appears that they actually do benefit humankind through a compassionate capitalism. The put their money to work! Employees, if the report is true, actually donate personal time for fund raisers and collect books in an IZZE vehicle. Those books are sent internationally to orphans and other needy children for their educational benefit. If you are involved with a school, you can partner with the Global Education Fund and do the same thing as IZZE. They are also involved in improving the "quality of life for children with chronic and life-threatening medical conditions" and programs promoting environmental responsibility and there's even more. Wow.

And my two-year old loves it. She found a new treat. And now I have a new reward for positive behavior! bwahahahaha [pirate laugh]

Great drink. Great company. I'm sold.

At the time of reviewing, I liked the idea of a healthful juice product that isn't "100% juice" (read: acidic or overly sweet). On the other hand, I didn't like overly diluted juices with added sugar - natural or artificial - either. IZZE seemed to be the juice product that I was looking for. It contains no refined sugars or artificial sweeteners. It's 70% juice, so it tasted sufficiently fruity to me. Because it's not 100% juice (with sparkling water added, which gives it a mild "kick"), to my palate it had just enough sweetness (from the juices themselves) and acidity. In addition, pomegranate juice seems to be renowned for its cancer-fighting properties. I considered this a healthful and tasteful juice product.

*****
This Izze Pomegranate Sparkling Juice isn't a soda and isn't a juice---it's a healthy alternative drink that's a bit of a combination of the two. It comes in a small can (8.4 oz) that I enjoy in a wine glass (it's about the amount of liquid in a very large glass of wine).

Some pomegranate juices are sour, but this one is tasty and sweeter than most...actually it tastes like real pomegranate pieces (arils) do---perfect! It is a sparkling juice, and sweetened just with real fruit. Technically, pomegranates are considered a "superfood", so this is a healthy way of improving your diet via beverage choice. It's also fortified with vitamins C and B6 and niacin as well.

Highly recommended.
*****

Izze is one of my favorite drinks. When I cut sodas out of my diet, I looked for something to replace them. Ultimately, I ended up drinking a lot of sparkling water. But when I need something a little sweeter, I found these and I adore them. It's real fruit juice and sparking water so it still has sugars in it - just not added/refined sugar. So it's a lot better for you and a lot fewer calories than downing a coke.

I do have a couple of very minor complaints (but they're so minor, the product still gets 5 stars from me). I feel like the drink could actually have a little less juice and a little more sparkling water. Sometimes it's just a little too sweet for me. Also, these cans are a little small (smaller than a normal can of soda). However, I've found a really easy way around both of these. I pour the can into a glass and top it off with some plain sparking water. Perfect!

All the flavors are good, but pomegranate is my favorite (however, I'm a huge fan of just about anything pomegranate).

Izze is like a freshly made italian soda, but with the convenience of being in a can. It's not super-sugary like a normal fruit-flavored pop and it has a lighter fizz (just the right amount, if you ask me). I tried the Pomegranate flavor, which I would describe more as a tart cherry/pomegranate blend. It has quickly become my beverage of choice when I open up the fridge. It's definitely more of a sparkling fruit juice than what you would think of as "pop". I highly recommend it!

It's often the simplest ideas that work the best. These Izze beverages aren't complicated at all - they're 70% fruit juice and 30% sparkling water - but they sure taste great. I enjoy pomegranate juice, but I never go through enough to make buying the jugs they sell at the supermarket worthwhile. That's where these Izze single-serving cans come in handy.

The good: The 8 ounce can is a reasonable serving size, it only has 80 calories, there isn't any caffeine or added sugar, and it tastes great.

The bad: I was expecting a bit more carbonation. Still, that's a minor complaint.

The best: This juice makes a great mixer for your favorite adult beverage. I prefer it with vodka, but I imagine it would work fairly well with gin too.

The verdict: Order a case! So far I've only tried the pomegranate juice, but I'll definitely be ordering more in the future.

So far, I've tried the Pomegranate and the Blackberry. Both are good, but I like the Pomegranate the best.

This stuff is best served chilled or over ice. Straight out of the can at room temperature, it has a sort of bitter/metallic after-taste but chilling seems to eliminate it. I like the fact that it has no added sugar, preservatives, or caffeine. It's a refreshing change from the usual carbonated stuff.

Finally, a soda for grown up, discerning tastes! Great as a mixer too.
If you are looking for syrupy sweet, it ain't for you!

I remember when Izze was first introduced a few years back. I had it in Chicago and I immediately fell in love with it. The great packaging and the great taste made me consider it the gourmet version of sparkling water. Now they have done it again ?! it is hard to believe that anyone can make something great even better, but they did it!

The new fortified version is so refreshing that you can drink can after can and not get tired of it. My kids loved it, my girlfriend loved it, my mom loved it. This was a hit at our house. I wish that I had a chance to try the other flavors this was so good. Izze undeniably has a winner on their hands.

Izze's Pomegranate Sparkling Juice tastes great.  The cans are a bit smaller(8.4 oz)than your usual soda can(12 oz).  The pomegranate flavor is there, but there's another fruity flavor in there somewhere that I just can't really identify.  The drinks are good but from the can it looks as if it would some sort of "health drink".  I got the impression that this would be a low-to-no calorie beverage but each little can packs a pretty decent 80 calories.  So, if you are counting calories, Izze's might not be for you.  Otherwise, they are pretty good.

Want a little sparkle in your glass? Izze Sparkling Juice is the answer to a splash of fun in your summer cocktails and mocktails.

I tried this straight, with twists of lemon and lime, and with vodka. It is refreshing as an iced beverage all on its own.

Which made me curious...if this is a distinctive sparkling pomegranate juice, how will it combine with Tanqueray, an aromatic gin? (This is all in the name of research...) It was a no contest win for Izze, as the flavors mixed well together, and my guests enjoyed a refreshing cocktail.

I also like the size...slender enough to be stacked in our fridge or thrown into a picnic basket. This is a versatile drink that is refreshing and fun. It is sure to be a regular in our fridge.

Pomegranate and Grapefruit

Izze sodas are refreshing and not overly sweet. There calorie content is almost identical to regular soda but because they have a natural tartness, they don't taste as sweet. So this is not a way to reduce your caloric intake except that the cans are smaller than regular soda cans. With 70% fruit juice you might expect that Izze sodas would have more Vitamin C but the fruit juices used in Izze are mostly grape and apple. For the pomegranate flavor, pomegranate is the 6th fruit juice listed.

So why drink Izze? The main reason is that it a tasty change from colas. There are many flavors and you are sure to find one that you like.

I received a case of this sparkling pomegranate juice and suggested that several members of my family (pre-teens, teens, and adults) try it. Depending on the particular tastes of each individual, ratings went from 3 to 5 stars.

This is a satisfying and nutritious alternative to soda, especially during the warmer months of the year. Members of my family agree: this is a product we would buy.

This is a really nice product for those who want to consume healthful things. Refreshing, tasty and guiltless beverages are too few and far between these days, but this qualifies.

Far too many "vitamin drinks" on the shelf are packed with empty calories, high-fructose corn syrup, and no actual fruit juice (or anything else good for you, for that matter). This is a refreshing exception.

The pros: 70% juice, not overly calorie-ridden, the Izze drinks DO contain a bit of Vitamins C, B6 and Niacin, but do NOT contain any dreaded (and seemingly ubiquitous) high-fructose corn syrup (about which I have heard nothing good. Not one thing), and it tastes really good.

The cons: Okay, not so much a con perhaps, but one should be aware that the product contains no more than 10% of the RDA of any of the aforementioned vitamins and minerals.

So as long as you don't think of it as a magic health elixir, but rather as a great-tasting, refreshing drink that appears to contain nothing bad for you, I think you will enjoy this drink as much as I have.

Izze is a great concept, especially as this is one soda that is actually a little healthier than the usual carbonated beverages. I ordered the Pomegranate and Grapefruit and preferred the latter much more.

Pomegranate: I love Pomegranate juices like Pom and other organic alternatives available [...] as it is a very heart healthy drink. However, despite my liking for the tart taste, the Izze pomegranate juice in cans has a slightly bitter after taste and does not taste as good as real pomegranate juice. It may be due to the dilution or just because this pomegranate juice is "adulterated" with more cranberry juice than pomegranate! It does state on the can that it is a mixture of several juices like grape, pineapple, cranberry. However, since the can said pomegranate I was expecting the juice to be primarily pomegranate and I feel slightly cheated if I taste more cranberry. It would be nice to see more information on the can about the proportion of pomegranate juice in this juice mix.

Since I found this juice to be a little too bitter, I tried making a "Pom-cosmo-tini", essentially a Cosmopolitan using Izze Pom and it turned out quite delicious. Now I know where the rest of the case is going, time to throw a party!

Grapefruit: This one tasted a whole lot better and has none of the bitter after taste of the Pomegranate. It tastes more like real grapefruit although this is also a mix of several juices.

In a taste test, I asked my friends to try the Pom and the Grapefruit. Everyone was excited to see the stylishly slim can but no one liked the Pom flavor. In fact one person said it tasted like cough syrup and poured it down the sink. My daughter also rejected the Pomegranate after one sip and finished half the grapefruit can. I was hoping she'd like Izze a bit more so I could give her some to drink at school, I believe the Apple and the Blackberry flavors are sweeter so I'll try those next.

Wow. That was the first thing that came to mind when I opened one of these and tried it. Not only was it delicious and thirst-quenching, but it was also good for me and didn't come loaded down with sugars. I was very impressed at both the flavor and the content.

So many beverages nowadays are just loaded with sugar and other artificial flavorings. Then we wonder why we are getting so overweight in this country. Izze has turned the tables on all that and uses only the natural sweetness of the fruits to sweeten up the drinks. At 80 calories a pop, those 80 calories are actually something good for your body and not just junk calories!

I noticed after I drink one that my thirst quickly goes away. Again, this comes back to the fact they aren't loading the drink down with sugar. It is a great after-workout drink because it really does help quench that deep-down thirst.

At first I was concerned about the small size, but you soon find out that they are just perfect for one serving. Instead of tempting you to overindulge like most soft drinks, this one actually gives you ONE serving and ONE serving only.

A great product and one that is good for you -- how can you go wrong?

This product reminds me of cranberry juice and tonic water. If that sounds good to you then you'll love this drink. This flavor makes a good mixer too. Personally I love this mixed with dark rum.

This drink is not artificially sweetened, so it tastes a bit tart compared with sodas and traditional fruit juice. Personally I find this refreshing; there's WAY too much sugar and artificial sweeteners in most of our drinks and food.

I refrigerated the cans as soon as they arrived as I prefer chilled juice beverages. Upon opening the can, I noticed a release of gas. The details on the can indicate there is sparkling water, aka carbonated water much like soda. Rather than being a pure pomegranate juice drink, there is a mix of other juices: apple, white grape, pineapple, lemon, cranberry, and pomegranate. I could easily detect the cranberry and apple, followed by grape and lemon. The pineapple and pomegranate was extremely subtle. The drink is far from being sweet and tastes much like apple/cranberry juice. My only complaint is that the cans are rather small. If they were 12 ounce cans or of larger volume, I would have enjoyed it for a longer period of time. The Izze Pomegranate juice is advertised to not contain any refined sugars, caffeine, or preservatives. Overall, this is the perfect chilled beverage for relaxing outside during the summer.

We rarely have soda in our house. We've got three teenagers at home and although they'd like to have it around, it doesn't fit in with our ongoing attempt to eat healthy. :-)

Izze's sparkling pomegranate is a great alternative and all the kids loved it. My husband and I did too. It's a mixture of 70% fruit juice with sparkling water and vitamins added. It has no refined sugar and most importantly no high fructose corn syrup.

The can is an 8.4 oz. size, smaller then your normal soda but really a perfect size in my opinion. It got a thumbs up all around.

The pomegranate flavor was tangy, not too sweet and delicious. I'm looking forward to trying some of the other Izze flavors too for a non-soda soft drink treat for the family. Highly recommended!

The Pomegranate flavor of Izze sparkling juice is a great choice for refreshment. It contains 70% real juice, including a variety of juices one of which is pomegranate. They remind me a bit of an italian soda. It's nice to have a cold beverage option that is so natural and high on taste while being very refreshing. The absence of any artificial additives or anything really unhealthy make this an all around great choice. I really like them.

The Blackberry flavor is even better, it has a really nice sweetness to it.

I haven't tried any other flavors yet.

I like soda. I definitely drink too much of it, but it's one of the last I-know-how-bad-it-is-for-me things I allow myself in a time when most of the foods and drinks you see in the supermarket can best be described as "mild poison." Books and documentaries keep popping up telling us just how bad the foods are that we consume (Supersize Me, Fast Food Nation, The Omnivore's Dilemma, etc.), and one of the big offenders is the insidious high fructose corn syrup. They put it in everything, it seems, especially beverages. (Its worst aspect is that it blocks the receptors in your brain that tell you you're full and should stop eating or drinking, so you continue feeling hungry and eating and drinking more and more.) So it's refreshing to have a drink that's got a nice sweet flavor without this awful sweetener. Tastes will vary, but I found this pretty nice, and pomegranate's a flavor you don't normally see as a soda - or, "sparkling juice" - so I'd say this is worth a try. At the very least, it's more interesting than another boring ol' cola or lemon-lime soft drink.

A note on the Clementine variety:
These Izze drinks are really quite nice. In addition to the lack of high fructose corn syrup, which is a major plus, they use really interesting flavors. This clementine flavored sparkling juice is cool variation. I thought it might taste more like a Sunkist-style orange soda, but it really doesn't. The clementine flavor is very distinctive. I don't think I've ever had a soda quite like it. Tastes great, very tangy, not nearly as sweet as I would have expected. A nice, cool drink for the spring.

A note on the Grapefruit variety:
Much the same as the others, this is a nice change of pace for a fizzy drink. This is my wife's favorite flavor, though for me it's got a little less zest than I would have expected. Still, it fits nicely with the other flavors.

This is a very refreshing, slightly tart carbonated drink. It tastes exactly as one would expect. Albeit a bit pricey, the quality of ingredients makes up for it. Whenever I get a craving for a soda pop type drink this definitely takes care of that craving. I plan to order the Black Cherry flavor next.

My husband fell in love with the IZZE brand when he decided to give up soda last year.  I teased him at first that giving up soda for another kind of soda was pointless, but after trying these myself I am sold.  IZZE contains all natural ingredients and no artificial sweeteners--its only fruit juice and sparkling water!  It gives you the satisfaction of a bubbly drink without all of the bad things.  Low calorie and great flavor.  Our local stores only have a few of the flavors available, so we have not tried all of the different kinds, but so far pomegranate is our favorite.  We prefer the glass bottle drinks to the cans, but again they are hard to find locally.  I purchased this 24 pack on Amazon when I couldn't find any at Walmart.  I will buy more cases from Amazon in the future.

Love the drink.  Been drinking diet soda ever since, well, since diet soda came out.  Have not had a soda or artificial sweeteners for a week now.  Thought this would be a good alternative since I'm mostly addicted to the carbonation.  The flavor is mild but I think you can basically make your own by buying your favorite fruit juice and sparkling water.  I was also shocked by Amazon's price.  I bought the 24 pack at Costco for $13. I gave it 5 stars because it is really good if you want to spend the money on it.

I not only enjoyed every can of this flavored sparkling water, I also enjoyed every zip of it! I recommend it. It is a reasonable price, perhaps not the cheapest but it is definitely worth it! There's no doubt that I will recommend it....

This is easily my favorite fruit flavored soda. There is a perfect blend of citrus and sweetness in every single can. The only thing I would change is to increase the amount of soda in each can. Or make it cheaper... This is so refreshing to drink after a long day at work.

Absolutely love the Izze sparkling pomegranate drink.  It is much healthier for you than regular sodas.  Taste is great.  This is the only drink compatible to soda but none of the unhealthy issues.  This goes great in the pomegranite margaritas....LOVE IT...Was only available from Target and used to buy it by the case.  They no longer sell it.  Price is much better on Amazon plus no tax and free shipping.  Has a sharp fruity taste...If you get the chance to try one you will be hooked.  By the way I grew up not drinking sodas...

These cans are a notch below the flavor of the Izze in the bottles, but buying the cans by the case is much more economical.  And drinking 8oz rather than 12oz is the lower calorie choice. Glad to find these cases at amazon.com

I first bought this beverage a couple of years ago on a whim, since I was getting bored of drinking just water and Dr Pepper all the time. Needless to say, it certainly did the trick: it's much healthier for you than pop, yet still tasty enough to not miss Dr Pepper.
I bought the whole pack because I liked the IZZE grapefruit sparkling juice. Great disappointment after the first taste. It doesn't taste like natural pomegranate.

I buy IZZE when it's on sale on Amazon. This Pomegranate flavor is pretty good. If you're looking for pure Pomegranate juice this is not it - go buy that Pom Wonderful stuff. This is a pomegranate flavored sparkling juice - with different juices mixed together. It's not too sweet, kinda tart, and very refreshing. To me the taste is a cross between pomegranate and cranberry. It's 70% fruit juice and 30% water - that's it. No added ingredients that you can't pronounce, none of that corn syrup stuff that everyone is scared about and no added sugar. I really like it.

IZZE has seemed to find the balance between healthy fruit taste and the sensation of carbonated soft drinks with their sparkling juice line.  I haven't had a soft drink in over a year since discovering these wonderfully refreshing, healthy alternatives to carbonated soft drinks.  Since it's pure fruit juice, it's also naturally weet (but not too sweet) so it also satisfies that "sweet tooth" as well.  Although not a substitute for plain ol' H2O, this beverage definitely satisfies and quenches my thirst.  Can't get enough of these beverages.......
This is the best alternative to soda ever.  It is light and fresh.  It is smaller so you consume less and it perks you up when you drink it because it is so refreshing.

Upon first trying this drink, I was somewhat put off. I've never had pomegranate anything, but based on other reviews I decided to give it a try. It tasted different, for sure, but after the first one, I realized I was having to limit myself to 2 cans a day. I guess it's an acquired taste, but once acquired, you'll never have enough! I love these things, and can't wait to try the other flavors.
My son loves this drink and it is much better than soda. It's a little pricey but very good.
My son and I each start our mornings off with a can of this delicious, low-cal fizzy drink.  It has a great fruity flavor and is better than a glass of juice or soda!

Izzes are relatively low in calories, no added sugar, and are natural.  They are basically sparkling natural fruit juice.  Pomegranate is a great flavor, harder to find than some of the others.  I also really like grapefruit, blackberry and clementine orange Izzes.  Pear is great but I haven't been able to find it for quite some time.

I tried two flavors of these Izze cans - Clementine and Pomegranate.

What I like: Real juice - no artificial sweeteners or high fructose corn syrup. Better for you than a soda. The smaller serving size is just right and the can is a comfortable shape to hold. I liked both of these flavors, with the Pomegranate coming out slightly ahead. Both were a nice mix of tart and sweet. They also make great vodka mixers.

What could be better: These really need to be cold to be at their best in flavor and fizz. I often prefer drinks to be room-temp because my teeth can be cold-sensitive. If you're looking for a fizz fix, then there are flavored, unsweetened sparkling waters out there that would satisfy without any calories at all.

Miscellaneous notes: As others have said before, be aware that the flavor juice is not necessarily the main juice (pomegranate), or even present at all (clementine). They're not a complete source of the fortified vitamins, but I don't think that's necessarily a bad thing.

It all comes down to what you're looking for. Looking for a sparkling juice that's relatively good for you? This is an excellent and recommended answer.

My husband and I tried the pomegranate, which is tart and refreshing, but as I don't drink soda at all, I tasted a bit too much sugar for my taste. But something in the flavor put us in a creative frame of mind, and we decided to have a little fun. So we tried Izze pomegranate and vodka, Izze pomegranate and gin, and then both of these with some OJ. The OJ adds a definite sweet/citrus taste and is quite refreshing with or without the alcohol. This is how we named and rated them:

1. Pomegranate/OJ/gin--a Bloody Orange
2. Pomegranate/gin--a Gin Izze
3. Pomegranate/OJ/vodka--an Izze Navel
4. Pomegranate/vodka--a Dizzy Izze

Try them this summer!

Soft drinks and sparkling water drinks rarely meet over due to their nature. Increasingly, like San Pellegrino, companies have decided to use a simple sparkling water and fruit juice blend to keep sugar contents down and your palatte refreshed.

I've been a fan of Izze drinks for a while, but I really really like this Pomegranated Flavored Sparkling Juice. I have always been a fan of mixing almost anything with club soda or mineral water (tonic water has too much sugar... have you read the calories?) to cut down the bite of some of the stronger juices and alcohols. Izze has done a nice job here. The pomegranate juice still retains it's acidic bite while the bubbly mineral water smoothens it out at the end. At 8.4 ounces, it's a nice little glass of juice and a perfect mid afternoon refresher with cheese or fruits. I'll be buying a few more packs of these!

Izze makes some very good juices, and advertises that their juice contains nothing other than fruit juice and sparkling water. These are undoubtedly far, far better for you than, say, a Coke or a Pepsi. They taste better and are more refreshing, and they certainly have a more natural feel to them.

My only complaint is that, like many juices that claim to be all fruit juice, the vast majority of the juice in this particular blend appears to be apple and grape, which are much sweeter fruits in comparison with the tarter flavors. Everyone knows pomegranate is good for you, but my guess is that the percent of this juice that is actual pomegranate is quite small--perhaps as low as 2 or 3 percent--and so contrary to what other reviewers have said, any health advantages are quite minimal.

All that being said, these are certainly a superior option to other soft drinks. Just don't think these are as good as water.

I think the warnings about drug interactions should have no bearing on the product review. Obviously, if you're on a certain medication with known food interactions, you need to be cautious of certain foods. That shouldn't effect how we rate those products for the rest of the world. Medication concerns aside, the drink is very fruity, and refreshing. It is a very nice alternative to plain fruit juice or soda, and far healthier since soda contains no nutrition whatsoever.  This does taste very much like a fresh fruit juice spritzer with authentic flavor, not artificial in any way.  It doesn't have a "canned" taste as some fruit drinks in cans do.  I would have liked it to be a tad sweeter, but accomplished that by adding a splash of fresh fruit juice or a flavored syrup such as Torani. The flavor of the product itself is akin to an Italian soda.  I withheld one star because I thought the product straight from the can was a little overly "fuzzy" but fares well when poured over ice.  For those trying the pomegranate flavor, be forewarned that this is a "blend" including other fruit juices, not straight pom.  The flavor of pomegranate is still plentiful, but not like drinking it straight.  Overall, I think this would make a wonderful addition to the summer picnic cooler or to serve guests at a dinner party. Served in glasses, rather than a can, it would make an impressive dinner beverage to accompany an elegant meal for guests. I would recommend it.

Although a little bitter, I do like the IZZE sparkling pomegranate carbonated fruit drink. With a case of 24, I was able to share and get the opinions of friends and co-workers as well. They noted the bitter taste but one friend mentioned how that could lend itself to be excellent in a mixed drink...come up with your own cool creation.

Carbonated fruit drinks are always my favorite. I always mix ginger ale or club soda with my fruit juices. It's especially great cold. For me, the 8.4 oz size is perfect. I tend to waste when I have 10 oz or more.

This is something I would definitely buy and I would love to try the other flavors. In addition, I love that IZZE has partnered w/Global Education Fund to help children around the world. A good drink, great cause...wonderful combination.

In a nutshell this is a refreshing drink. It is sparkling and has pomegranate juice in it. It is a bit tart in a good, thirst quenching kind of way.

Not only do I like it, but my seven year old child loves it too.

I prefer to chill it and to pour it into a glass before serving.

I wish this product wasn't made from concentrate, but this type of drink is so new, eventually someone will do it.  Having said that, this IS refreshing and delicious drink.  The small size is perfect.  Mine even arrived cold!

In the Beginning there was Fruit Juice, and there was Soda Pop, and never the twain should meet... unless you mixed them yourself. But then somebody got the Great Idea -- when reconstituting fruit juice after Pasteurization, why not reconstitute it with carbonated water? Thus was born...

Soda Juice!

And I tasted it, and it was Good! Apple and Blackberry were both rather mild tasting; Clementine and Grapefruit a little stronger and more tart; and Pomegranate had the strongest taste. I'd say Pomegranate and Grapefruit were my favorites, but I enjoyed all of them.

In the cans you have 5 flavor choices: Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Apple, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Blackberry, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Clementine, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Grapefruit, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), and Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice, Pomegranate, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24). The only difference between Izze in the cans and Izze in the bottles, other than the obvious of size and container, is that only Izze in the cans is fortified with vitamins: C, B6, and Niacin, plus the fact that currently Izze Sparkling Blueberry Soda (12 ounce) and Izze Sparkling Peach Soda (12 ounce) are only available in bottles.

Since virtually nothing is added, the slight nutritional differences must be due to the characteristics of the different juices being used. Apple, Blackberry, and Grapefruit have the highest calories, 90, Clementine and Pomegranate the lowest, 80. Apple, Blackberry, and Clementine have the highest sodium, 15mg; Grapefruit and Pomegranate the lowest, 10mg. Apple and Blackberry have the highest total carbohydrates, 21; Clementine, Grapefruit, and Pomegranate the lowest, 20. Finally Apple has the highest sugars, 21g; Blackberry and Grapefruit are next, 20g; and Clementine and Pomegranate the lowest, 19g.

Note: as other reviewers have already mentioned, all of these are fruit juice blends so those with fruit juice health concerns need to be aware of more than just the title juice. All contain white grape, apple, and lemon juice. In addition to their title juices Blackberry contains raspberry; Grapefruit contains orange; and Pomegranate contains clarified pineapple and cranberry juice.

Compare and Contrast: a similar product is worth considering: essn Sparkling Blood Orange & Cranberry Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), essn Sparkling Fuji Apple Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), essn Sparkling Mango & Passion Fruit, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), essn Sparkling Meyer Lemon Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), essn Sparkling Minneola Tangerine Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24), and essn Sparkling Pomegranate & Montmorency Cherry Juice, 8.4-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24). The difference? The essn products lack the vitamin fortification, have a higher carbonated water to juice ratio, and have roughly twice the calories, total carbohydrates, and sugars of the Izze products, probably because they contain the fruit pulp, which the Izze products do not.

I've been a fan of IZZE drinks for some time. The taste is sophisticated, the ingredients are natural, and the stuff is pretty to look at in a clear glass. It's casual enough to drink with your lunchtime sandwich but it wouldn't be out of place served with H'ors deurves or in a nicer setting in place of sparkling water or wine.

For this flavor, pomegranate juice is several entries into the ingredient list. That means the pomegranate flavor is not very pronounced (though it's there), which may be a good thing since the juice normally packs a major flavor punch.

I'd describe the carbonation as light-to-medium, pleasant like sparkling water rather than burn-y like Coke.

This drink is now labeled "Fortified" but tastes the same to me as the previous non-fortified version; some additional vitamins have been added according to the label.

Other thoughts: It's nice to see a reasonably sized portion (both in quantity and calories, only 80) in this era of supersized food, and supersized people. The lightweight aluminum can is an enviro-friendly way to package drinks. Recycle it!

If you're like me, you try to steer clear of colas and especially anything with high fructose corn syrup, yet you're a bit nervous of the calorie count from, say, orange juice, and you like a bit of sparkle to your drinks, as well. When I saw IZZE, it looked like the ideal solution. It's got a bit of fizz, real fruit juices, and a few vitamins. At 80 calories per 8.4 oz can, it won't break your diet, and it doesn't have any high fructose corn syrup.

So, how does it taste?

Actually, it's pretty good. The pomegranate flavor gives it a nice tang without being overwhelming. The carbonation is light, just enough to give the drink a bit of extra zip without being threatening to overwhelm your stomach. And IZZE is sweet enough that I can enjoy it as a sort of reward for a workout, without being sticky or overly-sweet the way some traditional soft drinks can be.

As a test, I tried one can at room temperature--it's a test I won't repeat. But served nicely chilled and straight out of the refrigerator or over ice, IZZE is an enjoyable treat--without completely busting the calorie count.

We first started buying Izze drinks when my wife was pregnant and she was looking for alternatives to soda and coffee. The Izze products were among her favorites -- especially the Black Cherry flavor. The Pomegranate variety is tasty as well, consisting of 70% fruit juice and 30% sparkling water. They make for a refreshing drink, although not a very large one (just over 8 ounces). One thing to note is that these drinks have 80 calories each, so that is something to be aware of. They're better than soda, but are far from calorie-free.

Wow!  Izze is a bright taste indeed.  Major Plus Factors: It is neither too sweet, too heavy, or loaded with any kind of additives. It is a healthful drink and this factor alone makes it ideal for people who search for alternatives to those ghastly flavored, carbonated sugar water soft drinks like coke or pepsi, etc, or other type of fruit drinks loaded with high fructose corn syrup which create false hunger and are so toxic to the liver.  AND, Izze is FREE of the dangerous caffeine junk that fries your nervous system like some of those such as red bull, etc. guzzled by silly "celebrities".  Izze is carbonated which works for my husband, albeit it is not my personal preference.  That said, Izze is great in fruit smoothies adding a lift with the fizz. I experimented by adding it to regular, unsweetened Dole orange/pineapple fruit juice and it really punched up that concoction. My taste buds were twangin'! I also see this used to add zip to homemade fresh fruit sauces,(think all kinds of berries, peaches, apricots, etc) for use over ice cream or frozen yoghurt sundaes, or in fruit shakes, custards, and yummy syrups over pancakes and waffles. The fact that is has zero sugar is a major plus for diabetics as well as those who seek alternatives to sugar overload. For those who do want a sweeter taste, I suggest adding a mere eighth teaspoon of Xylitol which I use in place of sugar because it is healthful and tastes just like sugar. AND, Xylitol doesn't adds a single calorie. Nor will it skew blood sugar values or promote sugar high and low crashes. This small addition of Xylitol really punches up the overall taste.  Bottom Line: This family really likes Izze for it's clean, sparkling and light taste plus the health benefits of the pomegranate fruit in this specific drink.

I'm not big on sodas, but I do like pomegranate juice, so thought I'd give this tasty beverage a try. It is indeed tasty, a mix of several juices and sparkling water. The more expensive pomegranate comes in fifth out of five juices in terms of content, but the pomegranate taste predominates. There are 80 calories in the 8.4 oz. can, so it's not like diet soda, but it's a refreshing alternative when you feel that you can stand a few calories.

My family loves this product.

My wife likes the small compactness, it's easy not only easy to carry but satisfying in flavor and the handy 8 oz amount. Even our teenage son finds it refreshing and just sweet enough.

The mix of pure fruit juice and sparkling water is nicely balanced and the fact that it is "vitamin fortified" is a plus factor. At the very least it helps rationalize drinking this tasty canned juice. And who know, it might even be good for you!

Personally, I am especially fond of the sparkling pomegranate and like to dilute it with an equal amount of club soda or just cool water. It also makes a great mixer for all kinds of drinks, alcoholic or not.

I hope this drink catches on and that other exotic flavors are added to the product line.

Definitely recommended for those who like fruit flavored drinks in nice packaging and handy sized containers.

My husband and I both tried Izze All Natural Sparkling Pomegranate Juice and here's what we think:

First Impressions...
We are not sure we can taste the Pomegranate in it, but my husband definitely tastes apple juice which is really not surprising because that's at the top of the ingredient list, followed by grape juice and others. I like that it is not super-sweet and only sparkles moderately, quite pleasant and refreshing actually.

Second Sips...
We both come to the conclusion that it almost has a wine-y taste, as if one were drinking an alcoholic beverage - maybe due to the grape juice? My husband also remarks that it would probably be great as a mix with alcohol, but let's not go there for the purpose of this review :-)

Conclusions...
We like it better than we thought we would, especially my husband who at first was very skeptical of the idea of having to drink sparkling pomegranate juice. It is quite refreshing and a great thirst quencher on hot days although I am not sure that it is something other than a regular, not-so-sweet soda. I don't have much to say about the added vitamins - I, for one, don't need them but they likely won't hurt either.
We will probably buy this again from time to time, just for a change from the same-old sodas in our fridge...

I often take some juice and add a bit of seltzer to make my own more natural soda.  Now with Izze, I have a company that has taken that idea and created a line of sparkling beverages.  I just drank my first can of Sparkling Pomegranate.  I found the taste to be enjoyable, with just the right amount of fizz.  These are rather small cans, being tall and skinny and holding 8.4 oz.  There is very little sodium and no refined sugars, though natural sugar does amount to 19g for a can.  I liked the fact that it was all natural fruit juice.  The only thing to note is that this is not 100% Pomegranate, it is a mix of apple, white grape, pineapple and cranberry with pomegranate.  Very nice smooth taste and something I would purchase.

I love pomemgranates and found that I really, really liked this flavour of the Izze sparkling juice. It's not too sweet or too fizzy, but just a good mix of that juice and sparkling water. I don't usually drink carbonated drinks, but this was a nice treat. Everyone else in my family really liked them, too.

Izze All Natural Sparkling Juice is a refreshing drink with a tangy Pomegranate flavor that is not overly sweet. With fortification of vitamins, 70% fruit juice and only 80 calories per can, I will use this as a non-caffeine alternative to energy drinks for a quick, but healthier energy jolt. It was my first time tasting Izze, but now I intend to try other flavors too.

I like that the soda is made from fruit juice but it is misleading in that it is not all pomegranate, it also has apple, white grape, pineapple, lemon, cranberry and the last on the list is pomegranate. If you like a sweet soda you probably won't like this since it is very tart, I was surprised at how tart this was. It has a good fizz to it and is 80 calories per can, the cans are only 8.4 oz so it is smaller than other types but is refreshing. I would recommend this soda since it is a healthy alternative to other types of soda.

Izze's All-Natural Sparkling Pomegranate Juice is a good, tart juice. It tastes great on its own, and would probably also work well as a mixer (with a small scoop of natural vanilla ice cream?) -- the possibilities are limitless.

I just got this juice today, and decided to give it the most extreme test I have -- drinking some right after finishing a little bit of exercise. I was very pleasantly surprised; after drinking this juice, I felt more refreshed and even a bit more filled than other juices of this type. (And for a dieter, this is a big-time plus.)

Note that this isn't a sweet juice; if you're seeking that, look elsewhere.

However, as a natural juice (unsweetened by anything save the fructose of the fruit itself), it has a fine, full-bodied taste that is worth savoring over a tall glass of crushed ice. It's a bit similar to natural cranberry juices; if you like those, you will like this.

Four stars, recommended.

Barb Caffrey

It's hard to go wrong with Izze. It's just like soda, except it's made with actual fruit juice. No sugar or artificial sweeteners.

This particular blend is described as pomegranate, but it's a mix of apple, grape, pineapple, lemon, cranberry and pomegranate. Overall it's tart and refreshing, not too sweet. However, the taste of grape and cranberry rather overpowers the pomegranate. Also, with the recent focus on pomegranate as a particularly healthy juice, it would be nice if the pomegranate-to-everything-else ratio was higher, so I'm only going to give it 4 out of 5.

As to the fortification, as with most fortified foods it's more of a selling point than something of real value. You're better off getting your vitamins from a healthy diet, or (if you must) a multivitamin tablet.

However, I'll keep drinking Izze when I feel an urge to drink soda. It may not be the healthiest drink, but it's a lot healthier than the high fructose corn syrup and chemical flavorings sold by the two big name soda makers.

So, I havent even seen this product in a store near where I live, but do like to try new foodstuffs- so I was happy to order it as part of the vine program. I was a little trepidatious about drinking it at first, but decided to pop the top of seven or eight cans (not all at once!) and drink quite a few before I reviewed it. Now that I have that out of the way I can write a quick review.

This soda is different. Different good. Its got a taste that reminds me of Red Bull without the caffeine buzz. On first sip, its got a funky aftertaste like beer, but then delves into a more tart, bitter taste before the natural sugars of the fruit juice come into play. It tastes more like cranberry than pomegranate to me, and the others that I have shared this soda with with agree with me on that point.

True, its not full of artifical sugars and so this soda isnt a sweet taste like we are all used to with carbonated beverages. Its more "dry" in flavor and tastes like fruit juice mixed with seltzer water. Not a bad taste, mind you, but one that takes two or three cans before it grows on you. I like this soda, and if the stores in my area ever decide to stock it, I will happily pick up a case and even adventure out into other flavors to try. Heck, I might have to shop on Amazon so I can pick some up every now a then :)

I dont give this soda to my kids, because to me, it has a more "grown-up" flavor to it. Its not sugary and sweet and syrupy like modern soda, but it does have a refreshing, fresh, tart flavor that is surprisingly good. At 8.4 ounces per can, it is a bit smaller than the 12oz. sodas we usually see, but this wasnt even a issue to me. I like this stuff and cant wait to try the other flavors. Trust me on this, do not jude this stuff by the first can alone. Drink a couple and then form your opinion. Good stuff, a refreshing change from Coke and Pepsi products.

This is by far the best of the Izze flavors.  It's light and delicious, and compared to the others I've tried (all but Apple) it easily tops the list.  The beverage is surprisingly thirst-quenching for such a slim, tiny bottle, and the best thing is that it's also quite versatile.  Too tired after work to break out multiple bottles and shake up a cocktail?  Just add two shots of your favorite brand of Vodka or Gin to one of these babies, cold out of the fridge, and drink up.  It's a light, fantastic way to relax.  The beauty of Izze drinks is that they aren't heavily carbonated like soda, so they don't really go flat, and they aren't heavily sugared like most juices, so they don't overwhelm your palette.  I couldn't recommend this product more highly.  Enjoy!

The Izze Pomegranate sparkling juice is a bit tart, but very tasty. Along with pomegranate, there are the definite flavors of apple and cranberry juices, which make for a refreshing cocktail. The can is small, but 8.4 ounces is just enough juice, and at only 80 calories per can, this is a better choice for dieters than many of the other sparkling juices on the market.

I'm really looking forward to enjoying a cold, refreshing Izze on a hot Texas summer day, and I plan to check out all the juices in the Izze line. Clementine is next!

Izze Sparkling Pomegranate is not too sweet, but it is just as refreshing and fun as sugary soft drinks. The cans are small and stylish, perfect for carrying in your purse or backpack. Kids like it, and the smaller size makes it a more sensible serving.
The company is ecologically and socially responsible, too.
What's more, this flavor is very nice with a touch of Cointreau for a sophisticated and festive cocktail.
